name: WalletHub
review: Little difference exists between the Sears MasterCard and the Sears Store Credit Card, save for the latter’s limitation to Sears-family purchases and the fact that it requires only fair/limited credit for approval. But that’s not necessarily a good thing, considering neither card offers much.  The Sears Store Card gives you an initial choice between a $10 gift certificate and deferred-interest promotional financing (http://wallethub.com/edu/deferred-interest-study/25707/ ). Beyond that, you get access to discounts in specific spending categories and a well-above-average regular APR.   The best thing about the Sears Store Card is its lack of an annual fee. This enables you to invest in your credit standing without putting any money on the table. But the Sears Card is far from the only vehicle for low-cost credit improvement. With that in mind, it’s probably best to take a pass.  Nevertheless, if you’d like to learn more, you can find a full breakdown of this offer in our complete Sears Credit Card Review: https://wallethub.com/edu/sears-credit-card-review/25964/.

name: WalletHub
review: Citibank Personal Loan ReviewCitibank personal loans are a good option for people with good or excellent credit. They offer competitive APRs, at 7.99% to 23.99%, and up to $50,000 in funding. These loans are only available to people with an existing Citibank account (checking, savings, money market or CD). In addition, personal loans from Citi are a bit harder to get than average, as the minimum credit score required is reportedly 680, compared to 660 for many competing lenders. Citibank has a bit of a stained reputation, with an F rating from the BBB and over 500 complaints about their personal loans with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. You should take time to look through some user reviews and weigh them against Citi’s good personal loan terms before applying.Citibank Personal Loan Review Highlights: •	Citibank personal loan rates: 7.99% to 23.99%•	Origination fee: $0•	Late fee: $25 •	Loan sizes: $2,000 to $50,000. •	Repayment periods: 12 to 60 months. •	Credit score requirement: 680, reportedly•	Minimum income requirement: $10,500 •	Other requirements: Have a SSN, ITIN or passport and be at least 18 years old. Be either a U.S. citizen or permanent resident, and have an open Citi bank account for at least 3 months.•	Reputation: Citibank has an F rating from the BBB, over 500 complaints filed against their loans with the CFPB, and a 3.7/5 user rating. •	Funding timeline: Up to 12 business days•	Joint applications: Not allowedBelow, you can see how WalletHub rates Citibank in our three major personal loan review categories: Terms, Requirements & Application, and Reviews & Transparency. Citibank Ratings by Category:Terms 4.6 / 5Requirements & Application 3.3 / 5Reviews & Transparency 1.5 / 5Overall Score 3.7 / 5

review: If I could give a zero, I would.  We opened the card with 0% APR for 15 months to pay for a specific party.  The week prior to the party, we had used the card a handful of times -- all in the same neighborhood.  The day of the party, we used it twice in the neighborhood to pick up food.  When the time came to pay for the party at a venue in the same neighborhood as the other two charges, they declined it.  We were NOWHERE near our credit limit.  It's humiliating enough to be declined.  Then to make matters worse, they don't authorize immediately by text or e-mail.  They use snail mail.  In addition, their Reps are very difficult to understand.  The venue agreed to wait until after the weekend to try again.  In the meantime, we actually had a call with Citi, another credit card company and us to verify the activity.  After 45 minutes on this conference call, Citi REFUSED to verify bc the name on the other card was Steven, not Steve, despite having our address and social.  Needless to say, we had to put it on a credit card with a much higher interest rate.  In addition, our credit rating was impacted.  We tried to get Citi to make a balance transfer with no fees bc of all the problems they caused and they again REFUSED.  It's unacceptable and unethical business practice. They should be shut down.  We have had credit cards for over 40 years and NEVER had problems like this.  I later found out two friends had major issues with Citi as well.   I do NOT recommend them at all!!!

review: I don't particularly like Mastercard or Visa cards for the simple reason that they don't care about the consumer. Someone stole my Walmart account access information and bought an electronic $100 google gift card and a rug. As soon as the order was placed Walmart sent me an email confirmation, Immediately I called walmart to void the order, I was told that the rug can be canceled but the Electronic gift card can not. I would have to deal with my credit card fraud department to get credit for the $100 fraudulent charge. Walmart provided Sears Mastercard with proof indicating that the purchase was made from a cell phone app that was initiated from California while I live in New Jersey. After three months of numerous calls and arguments with Sears Mastercard support, they tell me on the phone that I am not responsible for the $100 charge then they send me a letter saying that after they investigated they found that I am responsible. Finally I decided to pay the $100 and cancel all my Mastercards and Visa cards and replace with American Express. One more advice to everyone, don't leave any credit card info saved on any online account. Most will force you to save your credit card to make the purchase, after you complete your purchase go back and remove the credit card from their system.

All of this while you have been told publicly that your card was declined, and you have to either stand there and make everyone else wait for you while telling the world your security information on the phone, OR simply use a different card, IF you were wise enough to have a back up handy. No matter what I do, this continues to happen. Last night was the LAST TIME as it happened in a high-end restaurant with business associates. I have informed CITI that I will now pay off my balance and will no longer use this card or CITI until they provide the same means of confirming suspicious purchases quickly and discreetly as Discover, Capital One and every other credit card company does. name: Rachel
review: The application process was straightforward, pretty simple, however with that being said My first purchase was a refrigerator. I ordered it online and was given a one-week delivery date. I received confirmation from the Home Depot and multiple updates concerning my order which was scheduled for August 6. I have been using an ice chest for the week and was definitely excited about receiving my new fridge. Well the day prior to my delivery, I receive a notification that my order will arrive tomorrow, Friday Aug 6. At this point, we’ve moved everything out of the way to make a clear path for the delivery driver/installer only to receive an email on Friday saying there may be a problem with your delivery please call this number. So I called the number, was placed on hold multiple times only to find out they cannot locate my refrigerator. I’m then told, sorry about that, we can order you a replacement BUT It won’t arrive until August 14. WTH? I was furious but stayed professional with the representative and simply asked her to please Cancel my order and that I couldn’t wait that long especially with an 8yr old and a Toddler in my home. I was assured by the rep that I would receive an immediate credit within 3 business days. WELL after a week and NO credit back to my account, I called and asked why my credit hadn’t posted to my account, I was then placed on hold for exactly 20 minutes….it felt like an eternity, and then I was transferred without knowing why and they disconnected my call…I called back and another rep looked up my account, placed me on hold twice and then proceeded to tell me it takes 14 business days to receive credit. I was stunned…I couldn’t believe what she was saying to me. I asked to speak with a supervisor/manager and she told me it may take up to 72 hours to receive a call back. I continued to remain professional on the call and I told her how upset I was and I needed a better response than what she was providing and the ENTIRE time I was speaking the representative was talking over me trying to get her point across, it was extremely rude and poor customer service. I know everyone’s experience will not be the same, so don’t let this stop you from applying…just proceed with caution and make sure you follow up on any notifications you receive. I was going to also order a dishwasher from them but now I’m rethinking it and will most likely order from Lowe’s. Yes I have a credit card with them and I’ve haven’t experienced any issues yet. Hopefully never. Good luck with your decision.

name: Anthony C Buehler-Werline
review: I switched from a regular Shell credit card to the Shell/FuelRewards black card a year ago. Prior to that I had to swipe both my Shell card and Fuel Rewards card separately. So, in addition to offering a larger rebate, this was also a much simpler process. Boy, was I wrong. I immediately noticed I wasn't getting a lower price when I pumped my gas. So, I called Shell (I think) and was told the credits on that card would appear on my billing statement, which is handled by Citibank. Wrong. No billing credit. I called Shell and they bounced me to Citibank, saying it was their problem. Citi bounced me back to Shell, etc. After nine months of follow the bouncing ball, I finally spoke with a Citi rep who said it was indeed Citi that needed to activate (link) the Fuel Rewards to the card and he would take care of it immediately. On my next bill, I finally received a bill credit, but as it turns out, it was only for the prior months. It still was not linked to my card. Fast forward to last Friday, when I again received my bill with no credits. Spent a total of 3 hours on one phone call, getting transferred back and forth between Citi and Shell. Finally got a supervisor at Citi who said he understood the problem and would definitely be able to take care of it for me. Before I could say BOO, a lady answered with, Hi, I'm Monica. How may I help you?" After questioning, turns out she was with FuelRewards, which is a third corporation, completely separate from either Citi or Shell. They are Excentus Corporation out of Texas. She tried to bounce me back to Citi, saying it was all their fault. I protested and informed her to coordinate between Excentus Corporation, Citi and Shell to get the problem solved between them, as I had already spent tens and tens of hours to no avail. She agreed and said I would get either an email or phone call in the coming days to let me know it had been fixed. I supplied her with ALL my account info. Two hours later, I began receiving emails from Excentus Corporation (apparently via Salesforce???) wanting me to supply the info that I had already given, Each time I did, I would receive another automated email from Excentus Corporation with a new trouble ticket number. With each new ticket number, I would then, a couple of hours later, get an email from another rep requesting the same info I had provided to all the previous reps. When I reply, I get another automated email with a new case number and a new rep. Yes, that was exhausting! After a year, I am canceling my accounts with all 3 corps and will be filing Federal and State complaints for deceptive billing practices and buying my gas at Chevron. Unless you want to waste a year and end up with nothing but aggravation, don't bother with this SCAM.

name: Joshua Carr
review: I think it's important for future customers to be aware of the unreliability of Citi Bank and wanted to share a major concern. Here is the message that I sent to CitiBank, I'll update my review with their response. I honestly don't know where else to reach out. I opened a secured credit card with CitiBank earlier this year with the maximum deposit. I pay my balance whenever there is a balance. Now almost every time I use my card, citi flags it as fraud and blocks my card. Every time I call in, which has been more times than is reasonably acceptable, the agent verifies my identity and unlocks the card. Each time, they have to use a different method for verifying my identity, so anyone with any sense would realize that eventually we would run out of different verification options. Well yesterday I attempted to use my card, which of course was declined and blocked. Upon calling Citi, they told me they would be MAILING me a letter that I would need to confirm and that there was no option to unlock the card over the phone. As you can imagine, this is insane and concerning. What if I was traveling or had an emergency? It's so obvious that these transactions are mine, because I'm paying the bill multiple times per month. If these were fraudulent charges, why would I pay the bill? ON TOP of all this, my payments have ALWAYS processed and cleared with no problems. I made a $1500 payment a few weeks ago and that payment was held for almost 2 weeks, even AFTER the funds had come out of my checking account. None of this makes any sense. I'm seriously considering closing my account and posting some negative reviews of Citi, but I'm rebuilding my credit and don't want to close the account within this first year. My major concern is, what will we do next time, after verifying the item sent to me by mail? Every time I speak to an agent, they tell me the fraud verification should clear up and prevent any future fraud flags, but it keeps happening. Surely someone can do something about this... there is absolutely no reason to continue to block my charges, I've verified my identity in every way possible, Im making full and on time payments out of the checking account in my name. I've waited weeks for payment credits that were already deducted from my checking account on top of the fact that I put a $2500 security deposit down to open my account. Why am I being treated this way? I hope someone can help get this craziness to stop. I do think it's important that potential future customers are aware of these practices BEFORE they do business with Citi Bank and ill be posting this complaint on public review boards, hopefully you'll have a response that is satisfactory to show future customers that you care about treating them well. Thank You!

review: The offer itself for the Citi Premier card is pretty good, it is dealing with Citibank that has been a horror.First, they declined my application.   Which is insane.   Why?   My FICO scores range from 835-850.   Yearly earnings vary from $230,000 - $260,000 per year.     We have NO DEBT.   I have a number of credit cards but they are paid off every month.  No loans,  just paid off our million dollar home.    Assets in the range of millions.Then, after I complained, they opened the credit card with a limit of $2000.   LOL!   Really????!!!      The same day I applied to Chase Sapphire and got a very large limit and a few months later with Fidelity Signature Visa and got an even larger limit.    (Just sayin'.)But it gets better!     Even though I have had a Citi Double Cash card for OVER A DECADE and have a flawless record with that, they refused to apply my payments to the Premier card for WEEKS.   That's right - they take the money from my bank and refuse to allow me to use the credit line even though they have the money for weeks.    It is the same payment account being used to pay the Citi Double Cash card, by the way.This is a form of theft, is it not?    Think about it.   They take the money from my bank account and, in effect, create a forced loan from me to them because they don't make the money available to me to use, but they HAVE IT.   Somewhere, right?    Free interest for them using my funds in a forced loan every time I make a payment and wait for weeks for it to be applied to my credit line.They are treating me like a brand new customer they have never met before - after over 10 years with them as a customer they act like this 5 month old account is suspect and I am engaging in criminal activity that needs close monitoring.   And the credit limit of $2000 makes the card virtually UNUSABLE.    I despise Citibank and me and my family members are closing all accounts with them ASAP.

If it is not due to glitches as a consumer if Citibank has a minimum income requirement, I need to be informed of that minimum number before I apply so I can make an informed decision whether to apply or not since it comes with a consequence of Inquiries on my Credit. name: gway1518
review: Back in 2019 my wife and I opened up a secured credit card account with Citibank.  The agreement was for us to keep the account in good standing and at the end of the two year period, we would be issued a regular credit card account and our initial deposit would be returned to us (Keep in mind we didn't earn ANY interest on the deposit)  The deposit amount was for $2000.  WE kept up our end of the agreement.  Not only did we pay on time but we paid WELL over the minimum amount due.  We called in on April 9th and requested our deposit to be returned and was told by the CSR that we would have our money back within 30 days.  We waited the 30 days and when we didn't receive our funds, again called Citibank and was NOW being told that they needed to keep our money for ANOTHER 12 months for review.  On top of that, they tried to say they sent us a letter out in March detailing this.  If that was the case, why did the CSR tell us we were going to get our money back within 30 days in APRIL?  Long story short, WE chose Citibank because we BELIEVED that they were a company of INTEGRITY.  You're only as good as your word you put on paper.  I wouldn't have a problem with them holding on to the deposit if we had missed some payments or even if we paid the bare minimum each month but that's not the case.  I routinely spin at least $500 per month on the card and make a monthly payment of at least $500 per month.  Please tell me how you would need to review an account that has more than a 12 month history of these type of payments?  I'm beyond disappointed  and saddened by this.  The days of integrity are gone with doing business.  I thought I chose a reputable company to establish credit with and they reigned on their end of things.

review: I hate to post a negative review but this is a horrible credit card. We've mostly used the card over the years on large purchases to get the no interest promo. Recently we've made an additional smaller purchase, so now the card carries a promo balance and a regular balance. Every single credit card I've ever owned (that's alot) has always applied payments to the oldest promo balance before any others. review: I was looking for a credit card only for gas, I've been digging aroung for quite a few weeks and was not able to come to a conclusion. Most of the standard credit cards with no annual fee will give you a maximum of 3% for gas purchases. Shell is the only one giving actual discount on the price per gallon at the pump. So I decided to do some quick maths to see what was the best... #Savings with 3% back: S(1) = (Volume pumped) x (price per gallon) x 0.03 #Savings Shell with 10cts per gallon: S(2) = (Volume pumped) x 0.10 Now it is just a matter of comparing both. For example, if we pump 1 gal of gas, then we have: #S(1) = (price per gallon) x 0.03 or plot (y=0.03x) #S(2) = 0.10 or plot (y=0.1) #intersection of both slopes give the price per gallon for which, if located under then the Shell card is better, if located above then the 3% Credit Card is better So basically S(2) > S(1) if the price per gallon = 3.33 $/gal. In other words, if the price per gallon is lower than 3.33 $/gal, then you will save more with the Shell credit card than a 3% credit card. However, if the gas price is way above 3.33 $/gal, then a 3% credit card will make you save more... Note that a 3% cash back on gas is very rare for a free credit card, usually it is 1% or 2%. Also note that Shell has a few partnerships such as Tmobile, Dunkin, Giant and others big brands that give you extra cents to save per gallon pumped... So let's think you have 20cts/gal off with Shell when pumping. Then a 3% cash back credit card would generate more savings if gas price is 6.67$/gal or higher! And a 2% cash back credit card would generate more savings if gas price is 10$/gal or higher. ;)

review: I've had a Best Buy credit card since 2011 - so longtime user here.  Overall, it is a great way to pay off larger purchases without interest over time, and typically if you plan ahead you can get what you want for a good sale price.  HOWEVER, read ALL of the fine print if you sign up!  Apparently, there was some included "debt protection" service tacked on, which I never noticed until fairly recently (along with a lot of other people according to consumer reviews, so I think they changed something in their billing statements.)  This debt protection cost is based on your balance - 99 cents for every $100 on your card.  You can absolutely cancel this service, but they won't even entertain the idea that you didn't actually sign up for this.  I asked for a copy of my original agreement saying that I accepted this service, and they just shut down the line of conversation.  Incredibly sketchy, incredibly rude, and I'm really tempted to never purchase anything from them again.  BEWARE!

review: Citi Costco Visa card needs to improve its technology to keep closing date fixed instead of floating. It causes the issue to those users who are trying to make additional payments ( the users who control the percentage of credit usage in order to keep the good credit score) before the next closing date but after the last payment due date. Because in order to make additional payments before next closing date, the users have to wait for the last payment is settled otherwise it will automatically reduce the new payment amount from the last payment amount. Then there are only a few hours for users to make an additional payment and the users have to know exactly when those hours are, otherwise the new statement still will have the extra balance that the user wants to pay off before the new statement is generated.

name: jessesilguero
review: I would give negative infinity if it was an option. As a finance & banking professional working in the industries for over 17 years I cannot understand how HD is allowed to legally operate as a credit card company. I understand Citi bank is the underlying creditor however its home depot credit card services that manages and is responsible for overseeing it's accounts.  Please do yourself a favor and do NOT by any circumstances get this card. If you have good credit there are numerous other reputable credit card companies offering 0% interest, choose anyone one of those major credit cards. Store credit cards are not managed at the same quality of service as major credit card companies. Plus, in event of fraud (as in our case) it's nearly impossible to stop internal fraud from retail employees using your information. We had fraudulent charges exceeding $2K that we identified right away, contacted them and filed disputes on. Going on 4 months still not resolved. We provided police report, and have called numerous times a week only to be given run around and transferred from one department to another. During our 4 month ordeal I've discovered  numerous operational errors in routed incoming calls which are automatically transferring to incorrect departments. Errors in statement processing, specifically posting credits, purchases, and adjustments. I've had to use my expertise in accounting to speak to the appropriate departments to manually correct statements. This has become a part time job and I should be billing them for having to do this work for them.  Please, if your reading this.. Don't get this card, if you have it close it, its honestly not worth the aggravation.

name: Feddy Ups
review: I hold both a checking & business account with Citibank for many years so please read. Time to jump ship to new online banks. There are many online banks now that will handle your money much better. These physical banking locations are staying alive with fees and good gesture gimmicks to keep you. Two things, no way to access PPP loan information as a business account holder and a promise to waive service fees across all accounts was also false.Citibank has plummeted with genuine customer care since COVID-19. Many companies sent a COVID-19 customer concern letter when the pandemic started. Citibank did as well, a veiled COVID-19 email was sent regarding waiving monthly service fees. They didn’t automatically wave it, guess what, you had to call them EVERY month to get it waived.As a small business account holder, they also made it extremely difficult to get a PPP loan during a pandemic. Their physical banks turned me away as a business account holder and mentioned everyone has to call for that loan. And when you call, they mentioned only certain people were emailed for the PPP loan. Like many other people, they went to other banking institutions for that loan and NOT their own personal bank.Their customer service has turned into the Comcast of banking- loops, hoops and gimmicks.

I asked the representative what Sears is willing to do to keep my business since their interest rate isn't competitive and their business practices make zero sense. The rep hung up on me! I received a letter from Citibank saying I was pre-approved; went to the website filled in all requested information, entered the pre-approval code they sent me, and was immediately approved. I received my card about a week later. It's been great ever since. I pay off any purchase immediately. As soon as it posts, and allows me to pay it, it's paid. I do the same with all my cards. I am normally a calm and collective person. I have worked many years in customer service and I am a Nurse who loves to work with people. However, I have lost my patience with Citibank and I forewarn you BEFORE ever opening an account with them that they are near to impossible to work with or communicate with.

name: Clarence
review: Excellent card, excellent customer service, credit repair, excellent APR, excellent user interface, very good app service’s. Thank you very much.

name: Dita V
review: Long story short I had a joint account with an ex, to protect myself I shredded the card back in 2019 and only allowed him access to the account to make payments. Today I'm looking to do a balance transfer and if you don't have a physical card you're SOL to figure out your account number, even though you provide your SSN and everything else in a public store location, that has cameras and exposed to people everywhere. Also if you put a block on the account to restrict any other authorized users from making changes or using the card, you can't just request a card to have the account number, you actually have to reactivate it, therefore making yourself actually vulnerable in a messy divorce situation. Who's Best Buy looking out for?  I don't understand that their "safeguarded way" is to put a physical card out there with the account number on it if it's so vulnerable and not able to be discussed over the phone with the account holder. Seems rather antiquated...and to top it off now I have to wait 7-10 business days, no option to expedite the card in order to even begin the balance transfer process. Customer service has a HUGE opportunity to be trained better. Wouldn't recommend the Best Buy card to my worst enemy.

review: We've had this card a least 6yrs, use it for most household expenses.  We always pay full balance every month.  Couple times realized payment was, or would be late, so called Citi to make immediate electronic payment over the phone.  They were not concerned, and have dropped one or both the late fee and interest.  I get immediate response concerning suspicious charges, and if we don't get it figured out, they readily offer to void existing card and send replacement.  This is always fast, once in less than 24hrs.  The only other time I pay attention to card is when the cashback rewards build up.  We take it back in $500 chunks, 2-3 times a year.

Citibank plays dirty by LOWERING YOUR LIMIT to the balance owed if they don't like your credit score, which is 65% based on age of accounts and debt/income ratio anyway. review: Opened up an online account because they were offering good interest rates on the account (Citibank does not have physical banks in the state the I live in), the interest rates have of course fallen with the Pandemic which is to be expected.  I am Widower with a minor child and therefore need to set up a beneficiary on my account in case something happens to me, I submitted the beneficiary information which lists the Trustee to my estate which would be established upon my death.  Citibank won't accept / process this as they state it needs to be an individual (which it does not have to be, my bank, Ally Bank accepted the Trustee), I spent hours on the phone trying to get help on how to establish the Trustee as the Beneficiary on the account with no luck or help in being to do so.  So, I need to close out the account, turns out you can't transfer more than $15,000 per month out of the account, they'll gladly take much larger deposits into the account, but you can't get your money out!!!  If you want to wire the funds, they'll only allow you to take $50,000 out at a time and charge a $25 fee each time to do so.  They will offer to close the account and send you a certified check in the mail, but during times of Covid, the USPS losing mail and mail fraud / theft at all time high; that's a terrible idea to mail a large check!  So, it's going to take me months to get the money out of the account, customer service is absolutely useless; just a bad bank, DON'T DO BUSINESS WITH THEM, BECAUSE ITS A ONE SIDED BENEFIT AND ITS NOT YOU THE CUSTOMER!!!!!!!

name: Rose Budd
review: Citi Card is a legal scam. Skip this card if you're trying to build up your credit.When I first opened this card I got $7,000 credit with a score of around 750, no outstanding debt or marks on my credit. After using the card and making my payments on time for 3 months, they increased my limit to $10,000. Wonderful feeling to know you have a plan if something goes wrong. I continued to pay my card on time and they increased my limit to $17,000. Then life happened and I needed legal fees covered for a divorce. (Not mine) I paid the lawyer retainer and their fees which came to a little over $13,000. Still never missing a payment, I sent in a $4,000 payment. They dropped my limit down to $10,000 and increased my interest rate because when they dropped my credit limit, it dropped my credit score, severely. It made it look like I maxed out a card, which I didn't when it was $17,000.  Now I have just paid off the remaining $10,000 because I was paying $300 a month and $200 of that was going to interest. I checked this morning to make sure the payment went through and they AGAIN dropped my limit to $400 something and charged me $150 for purchases I haven't made. So, I am being punished for paying off my card and previously punished for making a big payment. Since Citi dropped my card credit limit the first time I have been struggling to get this card paid down. My credit score is now poor with a mere 620 score. I am so disappointed with the Citi card. I was proud to carry this card until I was able to make good payments and they just abused their privileges and power. Never again!

review: I have had the Goodyear CC for years to be able to use the promotions and bought multiple sets of tires. But although my last purchase of 4 GY tires qualified for 6mo. 0% financing, I was surprised to see being charged interest at the first billing cycle. Goodyear told me the the Goodyear tire dealer had not filled out correctly that I was making use of the 0% financing (like I would opt to pay interest). The tire dealer stated they could only correct this by starting the entire billing process over and billing the full amount again. No thank you, because I had already made a payment of $500. No assistance from Goodyear. Paid the tires off right away. Hope they are happy with their 20 bucks interest. Bye Goodyear. Never again.

name: ideasbydesign
review: On Friday late afternoon, October 23, 2020 Citibank blocked our two business accounts and refused to allow us to withdraw our funds. (More than $130,000). They said we have to wait at least two months (60 days) and if there are funds remaining they will send us a check. Their terms and conditions does not specify 60 days. Imagine the problems we have not having access to the funds. Calls from Police Dept., attorneys and upset clients whose money is tied up on deposits for merchandise. Citibank's response is that they don't care. They are following their guidelines. I gave the direct phone number of the Branch Manager who never answers the phone or responds to verification to our clients. It's a total mess. We filed complaints to the OCC and another enforcement agency. Well what a waste of time that is. There is no oversight to the ridiculous policies at the bank. The banks have a green light to make your life a living hell. And they do just that. It's December 15 and we have no better information as to when our money will be released and the so-called agent in South Dakota who was assigned to us after the OCC complaint has not responded with any information. You may think the bank will tell you to take your funds elsewhere and close your account, but in our case they froze the funds for no reason and made them unavailable. We do have two bank statements from them with the balances as they should be. But you can see the bank gets a loan from us at 0% interest for at least two months. Beware of these crooks.

name: Marc Strand
review: I would give Citibank and in particular Citicard even higher than 5 stars if I could. They are that good.I purchased an large, inflatable swimming pool for the backyard in May 2020, hoping , as many people did, that we could use it as an anitdote to the general restrictions of the Covid-19 pandemic. The seller turned out to be in China (although that's not always a bad thing), and this wasn't apparent from their website. When I finally received their product (which I suspect took so long because they didn't manufacture it or buy it from the manufacturer until I bought it), it was the wrong size (smaller).A few months later, after wrangling with the seller online (to no avail) and with PayPal (lots of promises of help, but ultimately no help in getting a refund), I contacted Citicard ... and received lots of help, good, professional help. I submitted the requested documentation online (easy with their online systems), was issued a provisional refund after review, and waited for the seller to respond to them. The seller essentially refused the return shipment, then lied and said they hadn't received it. Citicard told me my claim was denied and the refund cancelled, but offered me a chance to submit additional supporting documentation regarding the return shipment, which I did. After a review of the additional documentation, they reinstated the provisional refund, contacted the seller and must have said, essentially, "How do you explain this?" One month later, the provisional refund became permanent.When no one else will help you and you're about to see over $600 go down the drain, having Citicard on your side is a lifesaver. When their webpages say, "How can we help?" it's not just an advertising slogan. They helped when no one else would.

name: Stephan Manucharian
review: One strong warning: stay away from CitiBank, especially as a business customer. I had a business line of credit for a while, linked to a checking account. The only purpose of that LOC was to transfer funds to the checking account when I was short of money there, and conversely, transfer the funds back into LOC from the checking account. Therefore, note that the LOC account number was never exposed to anyone, I never wrote checks on that account or did any kinds of transfers except to my own, linked checking account. Recently I noticed a large ACH debit, almost $5,000 on that LOC account. I started calling the Citibank phone number. They kept transferring me farther and farther; in the process the call was dropped twice; I kept redialing and repeating the merry-go-round. Eventually someone from the correct department answered, apparently outsourced to India; The quality of call was so low, I could barely understand what they were saying, but, of course, I did not dare hang up after the calling ordeal. Anyway, the fraud information was collected, and the investigation started its course. I did not trust them fully, thus I went to my local branch to speak to the representative, to make certain the investigation indeed commenced. After waiting for an hour, I was seen by a rep, He did confirm that the investigation has been opened, but could not address my concerns regarding the fear that something like that may be repeated, after all, someone has the requisites of the account. I also expressed an opinion that this fraud must have been an inside job by a bank employee, as nobody had access to the account number. He promised to email me the results of his search. He never did. I followed up with him – no response. Third email: he responded that the investigation is in progress, that’s all. I reminded him that the purpose of my visit to him was to find a solution to prevent further fraud and either change the account number or place a block for ACH or other withdrawals. No response. In 2-3 weeks, I receive a letter that that they refuse to refund the fraudulent charge and suggest I contact the recipient bank. Absolutely ridiculous! If fact, we did. It was Citizens bank. They were quick to respond and very polite, were eager to investigate, but needed the name of the person, who initiated the ACH withdrawal. Citibank had the name; they did not share it with me. This is my story. Citibank does not stand behind their business customers; they do not have fraud protection tools, like Chase, when you are able to setup what kind of transactions you elect to allow or disallow and the amount; they do not offer even alert system (or at least, I was not offered that). And again, I an convinced, this was an inside job. I will keep trying and hope will get to the bottom of it. In case a Citibank employee reads this, they are welcome to contact me at image64@gmail.com, but I would very much doubt it. In the meantime, I am posting reviews wherever I can. Stephan.

They would do everything in their power not to pay in case of an accident.Their customer service/dispute department is a mess, very unhelpful. They will not be on your side, but rather on the merchant’s side. Very unclear, confusing process!They don’t send messages directly to your inbox, or in some cases don’t even tell you there is a message, like all other cards do, you have to log in into their website and go through layers of menus to find an important message you have been waiting for. Their reps speak with heavy accent. They charge foreign transactions fees. Enough, Citibank, I am closing all my accounts with you,  after 20 + years of being a customer, go find fools elsewhere to join - not me

name: Suzanne Murdoch
review: Our least favorite card in over 30 years of credit card use. Customer service is not responsive or helpful. Wrote a detailed feedback letter and received a non-responsive form letter over a month later — so disappointing.

name: Anthony
review: Citi customer service was great. Anytime I had an issue or question, I was able to call and get on the phone with a real person immediately who would quickly and happily resolve the situation. Very low hassle. Can't ask for much more than that. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that it took about 4 months and several phone calls to get my deposit back on my secured card. This could have been some confusion caused by my change of address though. However everytime I called and spoke with a different agent, I always got a different story or they would tell me the check had been delivered when it hadn't. Other than that fiasco, they were great for the two years that I used the card.

name: Paul Salva
review: I paid it full every month they charged interest because charge would pend pass pay date and they do a two month running total also had a charge that I had disputed and won but they left the charge on card as a balance every month

name: Jared
review: Great credit card. Worth every penny as far as I’m concerned. I will be a customer with this bank for the foreseeable future. Simply amazing.

name: Daniel Miller
review: I obtained a Wayfair credit card. I make sure that ALL my bills are paid through auto pay. Neither the bank that Wayfair uses, nor Wayfair let's you know that only "certain" cards are available for auto pay. They also make auto pay available, take you through the entire process of setting it up, take your checking acct number. Three times I thought that I was setting this up, the site confirmed that I had done so, and three times I received late fee's and now Wayfair has chosen to close the account because their website is misleading. And that is okay, because that will be the absolute last purchase through this company. If a company cannot be organized up front and thier website is misleading, and it is, DON'T trust this company.

name: Patsy
review: The agent’s that I spoke to were very professional. I was able to get the mistakes that I had  made on my application and was approved the very same day.

name: robingillman69
review: I bought a kitchen suite from Best Buy I told the sales person I wanted to put so much on my Best Buy VISA Platinum and something on another Visa. Since I’m a sales person an we use Citi as well I told the sales person to call Citi and see if they’d give me an increase, now I told him this a few times before he went on and swiped my card. Let me back up a second he said they probably gave you an increase (which I responded with NO THEY HAVEN’T) since I work for a place that deals with Citi I know what you have to do and I told this guy many times to call and he didn’t listen. Now my card is now $500 and some dollars over it’s limit. He said we don’t charge for over the limit, I told him that wasn’t the point. A couple weeks later I noticed my Discover, AMEX, and Sam’s card lowered my credit limit due to what this guy did to where all three of them were almost maxed out. Now I have one over the limit and 3 almost maxed out. My credit was in the high 700’s and now it’s not good all do to some idiot that doesn’t know what he’s doing and him not listening. I’ve called Citi, went into Best Buy 3-4 times and called Best Buy Corporate and not one person will fix his mistake and he’s messed my credit up, so he’s messed my life up because you can’t do shit without good to excellent credit. Does anyone know what else I can do, I’ve already disputed it and I’m not sure if that’s going to work!I’ll never shop there again EVER!

name: BRYON ANDERSEN
review: will decrease your credit with no reason why something about credit bureau blah blah horrible company took my available credit from $1,100 to 310 when talking to customer service they hung up on me like I didn't matter to nobody

name: donald
review: always happy. ty citibank. when ever I have an emergency it I need to spend over my my limit I never have a problem. and with my alerts I see everything in my account.

name: Frederic
review: Have had this card for years.  Since March of 2020, I've paid off the balance.  They then decided to close my account due to no activity for several months.

name: Christopher Brooks
review: Ordered a card back in August. It's mid October and I still have not recieved my card. Contacted them 3 times. the 1st csr said they would expedite it. the 2nd one said they don;t expedite and it would take 5 to 7 business days. the 3rd csr said 5 to 7 and he had to restart an app because the closed the account.  Closing the account dinked my credit score.  Horrendous.

name: claythelen
review: Don't waste your time or effort applying to this credit card. Shell Fuel Rewards is more like Shell Fool Rewards. You make your fuel purchases at Shell gas stations and no credits given.  Should have received over $1000 in rewards on my first statement, nothing... Called customer services and they offered me $5.00. Stay away from this credit card

name: Xavier
review: Love this card because it's just straight cashback, no need to memorize quarterly schedules. If I didn't have other premium credit cards with big sign up bonuses this would normally be my everyday spending card. Why not get 2% of everything you spend on everyday? As long as you pay off your balance before the statement close date you should be earning this without interest and get the full benefits of cashback. I will still keep this in my wallet considering Citi has added the Thank You points feature and additional partners which is nice because now it's a little more than just a cashback card.

name: Dennis
review: The WORST. Found out my card was cancelled via a three-sentence notification at the end of page 6 of my billing statement. It is now run through Citi (formerly Comenity) which, had I not read the very small print at the end of my statement, would have never known. Called to obtain my credit card number (which they won't reveal when you receive the card) and despite having to prove my identity to the rep via strenuous process, was informed she could not give me, the card owner, the cc number. You cannot set up account access without the cc number, rendering your ability to access anything other than paying your bill impossible. No balance info, no payment info, statement info. Nothing. The entire thing is utterly ridiculous and absurd. Boycotting Wayfair and will NEVER purchase anything from them again.

name: Randy
review: Great customer service great card to establish credit again love the benefits that come with it. Always fadt to pick up on calls to company

name: Rodney Wheeler
review: Where is the 0 star rating when you need one?  Customer service was very rude!  Refused to allow me to speak with a manager.  I had to call back and insist on speaking with a manager!  Manager is from a foreign country and could not understand  the conversation well.  He started yelling at me and was very rude as well.  I'm done with Citi Bank!

name: Marc Paolo
review: It’s ok for Costco fanatics . No FX fee is great and good starting credit line . It is ok for food and hotels and stuff just not airlines

name: cristin scruggs
review: This card is good for credit repair and literally nothing else. I purchased this credit card almost a year and a half ago with a $200 deposit. Within the first month my credit score jumped over 100 points. My balance is $14 every month and paid in full before the due date always. My overall credit card usgae is well below 10 percent ALWAYS. Since purchasing the card I've been approved for 5 other cards my last with a $6000 credit line and have been able to purchase a home. I've yet to recieve a credit increase,or my deposit back from citi,and the card is still secured. When I purchased the card it was clearly advertised they would look at you for an increase with 6 months of good standing and your deposit would be returned with a year of good standing. Without the card my credit would still suck and I would still be throwing money away renting. This does not negate the fact citi is very dishonest in their advertising and will hold on to your money gaining interest in their pockets.

name: Ines
review: This card has helped me to get my credit back on track and has allowed me the chance to put my finances in order. My credit score jumped 15 points this month!

name: Jeffrey S
review: Good morning - requesting a credit increase- This is one of the best credit cards on the planet - very supportive, always on time when calling.

name: Jackie
review: They say after 1 year they will drop the 200 refundable deposit secured but its been almost 2y and they keep saying no even though I use my card and pay off what I use weekly. Also sometimes when I make a payment they hold my funds for a week even though I pay with the same card every week it's a joke

name: Bruce
review: Card is no frills and does what its supposed to. I have nothing else to say other than this credit card does exactly what I want it to do.

name: Heather
review: Citibank is awesome they have so many options to help you budget money and NO ATM fees!! You can withdrawal at any ATM and its 100% FREE!!

name: Barbara
review: Only got this card to save on checked luggage fees and to add to my Aadvantage miles account.  The annual fee more than is paid for by the checked luggage savings.

name: Dale Gerstel
review: Citi handles credit card charge disputes absolutely horrible. I have had to handle disputes with other credit card companies and it always has been a easy pleasant experience. In 3 disputes on two different city credit card accounts, two were not resolved, even though it was clear that the charging company was at fault. In all three their communications were horrible, they required an extreme amount of work on my end, they took forever and only one was resolved properly. I have closed my double cash card, the half a point savings is not worth the trouble. On my Costco card, I have change to just using it for Costco.

name: musha34us
review: I don't know about if you are a business. But as a card-holder, I say no-no-no.Most important is the customer service. They merely do anything. and They are in the shoes of merchant rather than card holder when it comes to dispute.And I say this with evidence.1. I once dispute a restaurant charge for fresh seafood but served dead lobster. I kept box of the food for a week as proof. Uploaded pictures. etc. Citi dispute department just ignored all these and simply honored merchant's charge without any explanation to me reason why.2. I recently had an order at "Other World Computer" (Warning: another No-No!). The charge stays at "Pending". I wanted Citi to cancel the charge because the merchant sent me many marketing emails but no order confirmation. Citi said they can do nothing about it.

name: musha34us
review: I wonder why Costco change AmX for Citi.

name: Robert H Moore III
review: CITI card has habit of splitting larger single purchases showing a different total and a different interest rate excluding it from the rest of the total debt and I'm just not into that. I only use this MasterCard if I need an emergency.

name: John P
review: Worst experience ever! Applying and approval was quick and easy. Everything after that was awful.Activation - Download the app, scan the card. Seems quick and easy. Doesn't actually activate the card though, you have to log in an click activate. Offers to let you log in with Biometrics. Cool. You have to call a number into an automated system set up for Bank Account customers (NOT CC). Failed enough times to get transfered to a person in the CC section. Ended up talking to 4 different people, each one going through a lengthy process of multiple methods to verify my identity. Eventually I get the authorization number I need to enable biometric login. Invalid number. Oh well ... I'll just punch in my password each time. 20 minutes of my life wasted for nothing.Time to start using my new card & earning cash back!Purchases = Fraud!Day one - Before I leave work, I paid for a tire I bought. Then I stopped for dinner. Both paid for with me new Citi card, now problem. Next, I stopped for cigarettes. Declined. Paid with a different card. I get a text to call the fraud department immediately. 15 minutes on the phone, multiple verifications of who I am, I confirm each use of the card was ME. I'm told it's fixed and I can use my card normally.Day two - I stop at the store on my way home to purchase necessities. Try to pay with my new Citi card. Declined. Paid with a different card, get an alert to contact the fraud department immediately. 25 minutes on the phone with a very lengthy and detailed process of verifying who I am, including us ending that call and them calling me back at the number they have (the same number I just called them from). During the second call, another lengthy process of verifying who I am. The end result? The are mailing me something. Once I receive that mail (7-10 business days), it will have a phone number I need to call to verify my identity and then they will reactivate my card.So... this in an excellent card to use for scraping frost or ice off your windshield and apparently not much else as it seems attempting to use it to pay for purchases is considered fraud.

name: Jacqueline
review: This is an excellent credit card to have saving you lots of money at Costco or any other Merchant. 0% for the first year and 2% money back at the end of the year.

name: Scott
review: Great card and outstanding benefits. Yearly cash back is really the best benefit you could ask for given that you get 4 percent back on gas .

name: Richard
review: I'm super happy with customer support with this card and their app is really user friendly only real complaint is that I could not add more to the card to increase limit

name: whuser66836318
review: Balance paid in full, excellent reward card.This card has great benefits for back up when paying other cards. I would recommend this card to anyone. I injoy 1% + 1%=2.?

name: Brandi
review: They’re late in posting payments, they do not turn over secured cards to unsecured, even with stellar payment history and their customer service reps are often rude and most times there’s a language barrier so it’s difficult to handle business matters about your card.

name: jascporter57
review: 18 months no interest on both transfers and purchases. An excellent deal in this time of economic uncertainty.  Approval was quick and easy.

name: no no
review: I opened a Citi High Yield Savings Account and linked it with my local bank account so I could transfer money into my new High Yield Saving account - it was a large amount - 6 figure amount.  Citi took the money out of my local bank account, but then flagged it as fraud, and now they will not give the money back to me (even though now they say there are no current fraud alerts). The email they sent me telling me my deposit was being rejected said the money would be put back in my local bank account where it came from in 3-4 business days.  I have been on the phone MANY times for MANY hours with Citibank -- they keep telling me they will send the money back in 3-4 business days.  It is 10 DAYS LATER and my 6 figure amount of money is still missing. AS OF NOW, CITIBANK HAS TAKEN $100,000 FROM ME AND HAS NOT GIVEN IT BACK.  If I were to take $100,000 from Citibank, I would have federal charges against me and would end up in federal prison.  But there seem to be no consequences, to Citibank not giving me my money back.

name: apeters1125
review: This has been the absolute WORST customer service experience I've ever had. Our account was flagged for fraud and we contacted CS on 8/15/20 and were told they couldn't verify our account; we couldn't login to the account either because they actually deleted the account - our phone number, DOB, etc. couldn't be matched to any account in their system. We were told to wait for a letter in the mail that would take "up to 2 weeks" to arrive. It's now been 7 weeks and we still haven't received this letter. We've now missed two payments because we can't access the account, and nobody there has been able to offer any help whatsoever. Complete BS.

name: Johanna
review: Easy to use, payments post same day. Taken out of account next business day. Super easy to use with the app. I love the convenience of this card, and how easy it is to use and make multiple payments.As a struggling single mom, I can sometimes make five payments over a month. $10 here, $20 there, but I do what I can.

name: Allen R Williams
review: Used to be a really good bank o have credit cards with. Now like many businesses they use Covid as an excuse for trash customer service. I’ve called 4 times over the past 3 days to get this issue resolved and I’ve been hung up on 3 times and now I’m still waiting on hold the 4th time. They decided to put a 2 week hold on my payment even though it cleared my bank 4 days ago and now they are refusing to call Capital one to verify the payment like they used to do. They can’t be trusted anymore unfortunately.

name: wendyu2bad3
review: On August 14th I paid 9300.00 towards a 12k balance on a 15k limit.   I also paid off another card 3500.00 and paid one down from 7200 to 1077. 8/15 Citibank ran my credit and reduced my limit to 3500.00 after paying 9300 in a pandemic

name: jkpatience
review: After reading other reviews, I feel extremely validated. I have experienced almost every problem with the Home Depot / Citibank credit card as have been expressed below. 1) I signed up for the 24 month interest-free promotion  and was charged interest at the 6 month mark. I called customer service and was told i needed to go into the store to resolve this issue. Went into the store (during COVID19 when I was trying to avoid going in stores altogether) and was told I needed to call customer service. Have been getting the run around ever since and still has not been resolved. 2) Their online billing/payment system is the worst I've ever encountered. It always tells me my password is incorrect and when I change it, the new password is also incorrect. Customer service directs you to open the window in a private browser stating it is a 'cookie issue' but a multimillion dollar company shouldn't be having such basic website issues. In any case, I have been charged countless late fees for not being able to access my online account. I have been charged interest for a huge purchase of which i was under the impression I had 24 months to pay. I rue the day I signed up for this worthless account and now see why people dislike Home Depot so much.

name: Jason Palomba
review: My wife had a store credit card that wasn't used for years. We recieved text and email alerts in February stating that it had been used twice in one day. She contacted the bank that issued the card and confirmed that the charges were fraudulent. The customer service representative claimed the charges would be removed. The card was canceled and a new one was issued.The following month Citibank bought the accounts for that particular store card. One month after that we received a statement claiming the payment was late and fees were assessed. We then contacted Citibank customer service and explained this to them. We were transferred countless times and a few long holds, we were told that department was now closed for the day. Three days later, when that department was open we called and again explained the situation. We were then told we had to contact the prior issuing bank. We contacted that bank and were told since they no longer controlled the account we had to contact Citibank. Yet another call to Citibank, more hold times, and transfers,  we got the Citibank representative to confirm with the former bank that the charges were fraudulent. That person assured us that everything was taken care of. The following month we received another bill, with additional late fees. This was infuriating beyond belief. The process was repeated again. The following month, it was the same story. At this point there are now three late payments on my wife's credit report without merit. We have continued to spend countless hours on the phone attempting to get Citibank to rectify this situation since April. It's now September and my wife's credit has now prevented us from getting the full amount of a home improvement loan that we applied for, as well as prevented us from being able to refinance our home loan. Had we known that less than $100 would have cost us this much time, and frustration we would have just paid for the fraud and closed the account. Now it's costing us 2 percentage points in interest more every month which equates to far more than the original fraud amount.

name: Jorge
review: The mail service Was delayed de to the pandemic and me payment was 4 day late and  they penalized me by lowering me credit score ,for something that I hay no control ,all mail deliveries were late

name: Kim G
review: Their customer service is terrible. I would never recommend this credit card company. I was on hold for an hour and 9 minutes trying to speak with customer service and never did get through to them. I think they just don't have anyone real who answers the phone. Their customer bot on their website is similarly heinous. Avoid.

name: prototek
review: Went into the Citibank branch at Tyson’s Corner Virginia on Thursday the 17th of September. A teller ask if she could help and I said I wanted to open an account. Actually I was going to open 4 accounts. After about 15 minutes she came back and said it would be sometime before anyone could help me. Other than the teller I could see three others moving about the office. No problem, I went down the block to a competitor and opened accounts with no delays. I own a small business and new clients are very difficult to come by and are a priority!Guess not at Citibank

name: foster_five
review: I have had my card for three months- I have paid it off everyday after I use it.  I noticed my recent payment didn’t reflect my credit available - calling about it- I was told that sometimes they hold the payment for review- so not only do they have my deposit, they hold money (that cleared my bank the next day) for ten days.  NEVER has any other card done this.  I am using it wisely and paying right after using it-  Do Not  Use This!  I have done the same with Capital One- never had an issue and get cash back on top of it. Pay it the same way and they have increased my limit which helps build credit.

name: davidfore
review: We have had problems with this account for 2 years. On a regular basis, we would have to call Customer Service while we were at checkout station in store because our card was denied. Every time. We closed the account in April 2020, paying the balance given us by phone. In September 2020 we received a late notice, first one, by email, saying we were overdue, pay immediately. After talking to two reps and one supervisor, we paid $62 to once again clear the account, and closed it. Maybe. Will there be another bill in 4 months? Did damage to credit rating, but they were not willing to correct that, based on their not acknowledging our original closure.

name: Michael
review: Cut my credit limit in half for no apparent reason. I make more money now than ever and I just get cut like that? Not cool. I want my money back!

name: Bob Hervey
review: RUN RUN RUN. This bank is aweful. They had my money held up and my only option was to get a check because none of the online services were available. They held my money up for 2 weeks. I have no locations in my area so it was just online. I would run run run away from this bank!

name: jimwduffy
review: Citi does NOT stand behind its cardholders but instead favors merchants in disputes. I returned an item to a merchant, using the return label provided by the merchant. The merchant reported that they did not receive the item and so I opened a dispute with Citi. I was able to send Citi the return receipt from UPS as well as proof of delivery from UPS. The merchant still refused to acknowledge receipt of the item and Citi placed the charge back on my card.

name: pseanallen
review: Horrible, untrustworthy (despite their Mission’s claim), and unethical bank. Hurt people financially on a whim with no warning. Customer service doesn’t care to explain how their company’s practices are fair or moral.

name: Dana
review: Excellent card with great benefits to all users. Citi takes care of its consumers and offer great coverages for rental cars also. $0 Annual Fee.

name: Abduselam
review: Good customer service however credit limit is low and even though my credit score improving they are not willing to increase my limit.

name: Dl
review: It's an OK card for the 2%.  Originally received this card for promo 0% but since then barely use except for groceries.  Also do not like you have to wait to get rewards until you build up to $25.00.

name: Alvin
review: Great cash back and simple to figure out but there are still things I don’t know. They should do a better job with informing people with this card.

name: John Doe
review: Miles/rewards keeps getting worse.  Also contact customer service 4 times for online issue and was hung up on 3 times.  App performance is terrible (very buggy).  While I do apperciate security I find the security measures often times very intrusive/overkill feels like just to sign on I need to submit a blood sample.  I travel a lot and thought this would be a great card for me but when using miles it just does not work great.  Go for a cashback card and lower interest rate you will be much happier.

name: kaisernc
review: Deceptive and "trapping" practices in credit cards.  I did a small balance transfer for % fee. Annual card fee of $50 got charged next month and then I find there is no way to pay off the fee while the balance transfer is in place, so it continues to get minimum interest charges each month ($.50).That means I paid over 12% annual interest on the card fee.Nice trap.  Customer service just said "yes, that is the way it works and there is no way to pay it off; and no we will not credit back the interest."Enlightened way to make and keep customers....NOT.

name: Mary K
review: I took this card on an offer for a balance transfer.  I've not charged a single thing on it; yet they cut my credit line down to what I owed at the present time; this dropped my score down to the area of bad credit because it looks like I utilized all the line of credit I had on this card.  I won't do business with a bank that treats its customers this way.  When I finish paying the small amount I have on it; I will not use it at all; I don't need to.  I won't cancel because that will ding my score down even further. I always pay my bills on time, I never miss! There was no notice of them planning to do this.

name: Fabrizio
review: Since 2016 Citibank is been reporting my info to the credit bureau with a completely different SSN than mine.  Because of this issue the bureaus did not had a credit score under my name so I couldn't apply for any cc, mortgage, rent.. I've been trying to fix this issue with the bank for years. In 2020 I'm looking to put my business to another bank.

name: juleskcell
review: After being a customer for 12 years, they decided a year ago to lose my account without so much as a reason or notification. Prior to that, Back in September of 2019, they notified me I was 4 months delinquent when I had never even received a bill in the mail. I was informed my bills were “paperless” & going to an email address I never heard of or even signed up for the card under. I requested an actual bill in the mail from that point on, paid my $289.00 delinquent account via phone with another credit card was told everything was good. My house sitter tried to use my card, with my permission, to handle a home emergency today, September 10, 2020, & it was declined. In contacting the company, it was only today I learned they closed my account a YEAR ago. I never received any notification, although the Supervisor said it was mailed to me. Turns out, they never updated my new address when I moved despite giving it to them via phone in September 2019. So I’m sure my “closed account” notice was returned to sender given the post office only forwards mail for 6 months. I was told I could “reapply” & I told Citibank I have 37 credit cards in good standing & I wouldn’t do business with them again if they were the only credit card company available. Supervisor said, Thanks for calling” & hung up. Really?!  Obviously Citibank doesn’t do business on the up & up, the mistakes made in my case were their fault & they reported this to my credit report. It’s THE ONLY THING on my report DESPITE the fact I paid the delinquent balance in full. Shame on Costco for using Citibank for their credit card provider. They should find a reputable company & dump Citibank. DO NOT APPLY FOR A CITIBANK CARD!  YOU WILL BE SORRY. There are way better credit card companies, with better interest rates you can get. Fidelity is one of them & our go-to credit card.

name: John
review: They are a very good credit card with a lot of good features the only thing I don’t like is there credit score is off by 20 to 30 points other than that I recommend them to all my friends and family

name: Maximo
review: Despite having this card for about 3 years and always paid on time or earlier than due....no credit limit increase despite having requested it!!

name: 2janeplitt
review: Worst customer responsiveness; beware if they don't process your payment.  They will shut down your account and claim, "It is the system."  Unlike American Express representatives, their staff has no independent power.

name: Joshua
review: I’ve had this card for over 30 years great and responsive customer service. Fraud protection gives me peace of mind anytime I use it.

name: Towanda
review: Awesome review assist a allot nice program.

name: tyal1977
review: I'm trying to update my phone number with citibank. I've tried in the app, I've called multiple times, and finally am transferred to fraud/security. I verify every question, I give them my old number, but for some reason their antiquated system forces them to send a paper letter. How ridiculous and cumbersome.

name: Marguerite
review: This account is appearing twice on your credit report.  Please adjust your records accordingly.  I just have one Citi credit card with a $700 credit limit.  Please contact me if you need further clarification.  Thank you

name: Terrance
review: Awesome card rewards are great and it actually helps with additional benefits with purchasing items that I wouldn't typically buy.

name: Debra
review: I never have a problem using my Citi card! No matter where I go; restaurant, boutique shopping, thrift stores, automobile servicing.

name: Jeannine A Fitzmorris
review: haven't used his card n over 3 years & it still shows up on my credit, can you please get it removed. It was a great card & I have a different CITI card now.

name: lindac_301
review: I had a problem with customer service when I first started using this card ,however once that issue was resolved I haven't had a problem since. I highly recommend this card.

name: John
review: Pays varying rewards for different purchases. It can be used for numbers purchases and merchants but gives maximum rewards for purchases at Costco and several other classes of purchase.

name: sihamboutachali
review: I have been dealing with nasty costumer service for 2 years now. My card information was stolen and when I called for help I was waiting to speak to somebody overseas for over an hour than call dropped 3 times. When I ask to talk to someone in US I spoke to supervisor his name is JOHN who was really really rude and unprofessional. He was asking me every second if I want to cancel then he was pretending he can't hear me then he hung up on me. I called again, I spoke to a nice person who told me that my account was not closed even though I spoke to them the day before to close my account because of some transactions that I never made. Citi Mastercard is the worst bank I have ever seen in my life.

name: Dustin
review: I use Sears MasterCard for regular usage as well as purchasing tools at Sears store where I get points then use those points for purchasing  more tools for free.

name: Ryan Morales
review: Thinking about getting a best buy credit card. Read this first because from my experience their credit card policies are cut throat and offensive. Put simply I had a 700 credit score when I applied for their card and after 11 months of repeatedly maxing out my 3000 dollar limit and paying it off within the same month, they cancelled my card without warning and caused my credit score to drop almost 50 points. I never made a late payment and used my card for several large purchases. Well I had some fraud on a different credit card that caused my credit score to drop just below 600. I disputed the fraud and got that situation resolved as fast as the appeals process allows. But within that time Best buy decided to cancel my card without warning or consideration using the credit reporting bureaus inaccurate information during the time that i was correcting the fraud and credit score drop caused by that fraud. Thus causing my score to drop another 50 points. I called their customer service and they responded with the typical, "we are sorry sir its an automated system and there is nothing we can do. But you can reapply for a new card". This was absolutely ridiculous because due to them dropping my card i was now under the required minimum credit score to qualify. I explained that the information they had received was incorrect and didn`t reflect my true credit reputation and score. I explained that the fraud of another card caused the initial drop in my credit score and that it had been recently appealed and corrected. I explained everything and they did nothing to help or rectify the error. They simply said ," awe that`s too bad, try again". This was very offensive and frustrating and i would not recommend this card or company to anyone.

name: Cat Bach
review: Many hidden charges even for good customers that consistently pay their bill in full and on time each month. Interest charged even when you pay your balance off every month. Excessive wait times on the phone. Unhelpful representatives in the chat feature. Terrible customer service, especially during the pandemic. It took well over 2 months for the refund from a cancelled flight to be applied to my account and in the mean time I had 3 fees (two interest charges and one late fee) even though I had paid my balance in full each month. After waiting on the phone for 2 hours and being transferred around like crazy they finally fixed their mistake and refunded the interest and fees. I finally thought I was done with the mess and logged on a few weeks later only to notice that I had a "standard interest charge" applied to my account. When I asked about it they told me that if you ever have a month where you carry a balance you are then charged interest on all purchases from the date they are made, not from the end of the statement date like usual. **Basically, the clock starts ticking on your interest the second you make a purchase even if you intend to pay your balance in full at the end of the month.** They said that this type of charging does not go away until you have not carried a balance for over 60 days. Of course I never actually had carried a balance so this charge was arbitrary. It took another hour for me to get this charge refunded and I suspect I will have to deal with the same problem next month even though they swear they fixed it for good this time. I am so disappointed I ever got this card. The mileage rewards are not worth the hassle.
