name: veronicak5678
review: I’m writing about the experience of my 97-year-old grandmother. She needed a checking account so I opened one with Citibank for her online. I provided her land line, my cell phone, and my email address. She’s never used a computer and wanted me to take care of all the online banking. We would have opened a joint account but that requires you to go into a branch in person, something neither of us was willing to do during the massive Coronavirus outbreak here in LA since I’m a Type I diabetic and she’s old as dirt. 	We never got a card or pin in the mail but didn’t think we really needed it since we had an account number and she got a checkbook. She transferred every penny she has into this account. A few days after this she went to stay with her sister in another town because of her failing health. Immediately we started running into problems with them wanting to call her house and give a pin every time we tried to do anything. They wouldn’t use my cell phone or my email or verify us any other way and didn’t care that she wasn’t home. We had to resort to arranging a time her neighbor could go into her apartment and answer the phone to text me a code whenever we wanted to send $20. 	I spent many hours with Customer Service during this time explaining why this was a problem, but everyone told me a different thing. One person told me this verification business would go on for two weeks, another told me two months, another told me it was indefinite. One told me that it would stop once I activated the card and, when I said I already had, told me I had to get a new card and activate it again. We ordered a new card, waited for it to arrive activated it, but nothing changed. Another CSR told me we needed a pin and then this would stop, but we requested a pin be sent out three separate times and for some reason never got a single one. I finally got one to set up a pin with me on the phone, but again nothing changed. At one point a CSR told me she had opened a case for me and that the “higher ups” would be in touch to help, but the next guy told me that’s not even something they do. My grandmother and I were hung up on more times than I can recall, and not just when we were being nasty. It’s like they’re all trained to just hang up on you when they get tired of talking to you.	At their suggestion, I also went through a massive amount of hassle to get external accounts verified with trial deposits so we could make online transfers, but they blocked every single one. Later they told me it’s because the external accounts were not hers, which of course was the point of having external accounts linked in the first place. They also suggested I added ‘payees” and then I would be able to make wire transfers for free, but after going through that whole maddening process I learned that there’s a $25 fee every time you want to do that. 	As bad as all this was, it got much worse last week when I got an email out of the blue saying that the User ID had been blocked and I had to call to unblock it. When I called they told me they couldn’t help us unless we had someone at her house answer the phone to get the stupid code, so we had to wait days until her neighbor could go back and await their call. That day we set up a time when I could take an hour off work and the neighbor could too and called them up, just to be told that they couldn’t call with a code after all. This time they told me we had to go back to the house and call from the land line. I explained that we were out of town and couldn’t go back just to use that phone, but every single employee I talked to just told me they wouldn’t do anything else. During this time, we couldn’t pay bills, couldn’t pay employees, and were racking up late charges and overdraft fees all over because Citibank wouldn’t let us use our money. 	We had no choice but to pack up and go back to grandma’s house just to use the phone. This is all very difficult for her since she can barely move and we don’t have a car, but they would give us no other options so we packed up all her things and her wheelchair and got a very expensive Uber ride. When we got back yesterday and tried calling I was told they had to verify by calling me back on that number. So I hung up and waited twenty minutes. I called again and explained that no one had called me back just to be told that since it was “in the works” with that guy no one else could help me. After an hour I really had to get back to work so I called yet again and went through all the rigmarole of the system and being on hold for twenty minutes and being transferred back and forth for the third time, finally to end up being told by one of the managers that they can’t verify us over the phone at all anymore and that grandma has to go into a bank with two forms of ID. 	She does not have two forms of ID. She does not have a car. She’s 97 and it’s painful for her to get to the bathroom, let alone into a bank. She’s in the group with the absolute highest risk of dying of Covid (I’m in the second) and we’re in the highest-risk cities in the US. I told this to so many CSR’s, explaining that they’re literally asking us to risk our lives before they’ll give us access to the account, and were repeatedly hung up on. Not to mention that many of their branches are closed because of the pandemic and we’ll have to go miles away. We don’t know what else to do, so tomorrow I have to take yet another day off of work, get another extremely expensive Uber ride, sit in LA traffic for an hour, go inside a bank and risk our lives, probably just to be told that she needs a passport or something before they’ll give her her money. 	I honestly feel like they’re putting her in an early grave. I’ve never seen her so stressed out and I’ve felt like I’m having a mild heart attack for about two weeks straight. She was actually crying on the phone with them yesterday and they hung up on her. I tried to make this as succinct as possible and, long though it is, it doesn’t even go into all the problems we’ve had just trying to use a simple checking account.

review: I was approved for this card because of my relatively good credit.  They gave me a very low 1k max credit limit. Citigroup twice said no, which hurt my credit. If someone who has good credit and pays it down over and over can't get a credit increase, then who can? Avoid this bleeping card. almost useless.

name: Edgar
review: They don't make money if you pay off. They need to allocate credit to people who do pay interest. So they keep your limit low since you pay your balance in full. Banks have limited resources and citi depends on interest. Go to Amex they make money on network fees and don't mind if you pay in full and not pay interest. Remember that banks have limited resources and 0 interest is a marketing gimmick that if you game well gets you on their no no list.

name: Derrick Harrigan
review: Citibank is difficult to deal with for NO reason. I became POA of my grandparents back in February 2020. I drafted a general Durable Power of Attorney document and submitted to the bank for review. I just needed to be added to their account for money management purposes and to be able to make decisions for them. It was never told to me that Citibank had their own POA document, so a process that shouldn't take long--took a while to set up for no reason other than that the rep didn't really have a firm grasp on the bank's processes. I understand that there are holes in communication sometimes, so I overlooked it. I've visited a Citibank physical location at least 5 times to get access to my grandparent's account in a single month. Why? Because they eventually determined that it was the Durable Power of Attorney document that I had submitted--wasn't THEIR document. Again, it was NOT explained to me that I needed to use their document. They took my document and told me that it would be fine. Eventually, I was added to my grandparent's account as a user, and Citibank explained to me that I could do everything that they [my grandparents] can do, but that I couldn't be both a user on the account AND POA. Okay, fine. I called today asking to place a daily limit on my grandmother's debit card because of spending concerns. I'd bet that you can guess what they told me... "We have to speak to your grandmother...". My grandmother has dementia--she cannot make such a decision--and THAT is the reason why I got access to their account! Citibank has demonstrated to me that they don't care about aged adults suffering with memory care issues. They certainly don't really care to help me to do the right thing for my grandparents. A terrible experience, for sure. I can never recommend this bank to anyone. If I could stop my grandparent's federal pensions and Social Security benefits from being directly deposited into Citibank...I would. The only difference is that I can't because OPM does not recognize POA documents. You're lucky, Citibank. You. Are. Lucky. Don't bank here. Waste of time. They do not care.

name: Loretta
review: Great card! I have had no problems with this card. Payments are made ahead of time just in case it takes the company more time to report on time.

First of all your new WHAT? Where's the next word? Second who's dumb enough to fall for the 'amazing rewards' part? Who uses these garbage words to describe a program that is far from anything 'amazing'? It sounds like they have children running this program so I'll go 'amazing' lengths to avoid it. Makes me question Citibank's standards just for being connected to such a lousy product.

review: I always pay my bills in full every month and hardly ever need to call the bank. I told them that it was their mistake and i was told not in so many word that they could not really help me or it may takes weeks for someone to reach out to me or fix the issue. WHAT? Citi has been good so long as i don't have any problems. If i do, i am on my own. I am going back to the reliable ones like Wells Fargo and Capital One where customer service has always been great.

name: Derrick Harrigan
review: Whatever you do, don't go to Wells Fargo, either. They are pit vipers. They foreclosed on my grandmother's home, even after I demonstrated that she has dementia.

review: I tried to sign up for a joint checking and savings account online. They advertise that it is simple and easy. review: I am someone with previously extraordinary credit who due to not working during the covi-19 pandemic has a 700-range credit score now sadly. Citi was able to help me out over the phone when I explained my situation. Yes, their 5% fee is higher by 2% than my other credit cards, but my experience with them during this time of uncertainty has just be incredible! Highly recommend reaching out to Citi. Also you have to go into it with a plan. The deadlines for those 0% APR balance transfers seem lightyears away at the start, but I look back and wish I would have made more payments.

review: Watch out for late fee!! There is NO GRACE PERIOD. name: brian m
review: The specs are enticing but the experience is exhausting. For whatever reason, this card gets compromised at least once a year (with no markedly different usage than any other) and getting a new card is at best slow (takes weeks in the mail) and twice I never received the new one so I had to get another sent. DO NOT rely on this being your main physical card as you may be without one for a month at a time or longer. I currently don't have an activated physical card because I never received the last one and just don't even bother using this account anymore.Citi's web and mobile experience is similarly frustrating. I can only log into the website if I disable a couple of privacy extensions, I'm on there now and privacy badger (EFF) blocks11 trackers and my ad-blocker blocks 43 (and counting). Trying to login with these enabled results in an endless circle of entering credentials and being brought back to the login form. For a reference point, the amex login page (which actually lets me login) has 2 trackers blocked and 4 ads blocked. The mobile app is constantly down, and despite giving repeated access to use Face ID, it simply does not work. Even when bringing up my password manager (1password), which works seamlessly with my other financial type apps, requires a search and inconsistent autofill behavior. It may have improved now, but the process to add to Apple Wallet required much more authentication than other accounts, ironic as this one is the least secure I've ever had.How they initially set credit limits make no sense, when I applied a couple years back I had a 16k Amex limit, Citi auto-approved 1k. I asked for an increase which got denied. A few months later they auto-increased my limit to 4500. Its been auto-increased to something like 6500 today.The 0% APR length at the time was the best out there (and appears like it still might be). This is the only thing the card has going for, subsequent APR is average to above average, so if you do go for this card be prepared and consider only using it for your 0% months and ignoring it / minimal use later. I would not at all recommend as your daily driver especially as there are so many options out there that simply work where this card doesn't.

name: Daniel callarman
review: Very rigid company when it comes to late fees.  Have perfect credit and never been late with a payment.  They couldn't process my statement one month and slapped me with a 28.00 late fee that they refused to overturn?  Checked my stored card information and checked with my bank (with plenty of funds) and still am in the dark as to why they could not process my card information?

If you have 300 dollars do yourself a favor and invest in yourself. You never know... It may just change your life.

review: I was forced to give one star, but it would be negative five if available.Due to unexpected circumstances I was 5 days late paying my bill which was originally due on 12/25/19. First time being late since I opened the account 7 years ago. Payment portal, which is the absolute worst of any card, advised me my payment amount would be double since I was late, but also that my next payment would not be due until 02/25/20. That made sense. On 01/26/20, I began being hounded by Home Depot that payment was past due and they were demanding another double payment! Four months worth of payments in less than one month!!!! I went through several escalations of my complaint up to Mr. G. Stevens, VP of Citibank. They absolutely refused to investigate their faulty billing system. I have filed complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the BBB. The CFPB is investigating. The response I received from Home Depot through the BBB was that my issue is with Citibank so they consider the "Case Closed" but they look forward to providing me with my home improvement needs! Good luck if you are unfortunate enough to open an account with either of these unscrupulous businesses. I now drive by Home Depot on my way to Lowe's. review: I love this card! Was given a generous credit limit, great low interest rate, plus cash back rewards, 4% on gas, 3% on restaurants and travel, 2% at Costco and 1% everywhere else.

name: Ana Walshe
review: Citibank’s customer service is the worst in the industry. It happened to me twice that a charge settled on the due date, after I had already gone into the app and paid the account balance in full, which resulted in interest charges. They expect you to check your account until midnight on the due date to ensure no other charge posts, which makes no sense and is a lot of work. I am tired of calling their customer service only to be told “no” every time and never reaching a solution for a problem at hand. Furthermore, their protection against fraudulent charges is “0”. They always take third party’s side when you are disputing a charge. This ended up costing me approximately $1300 over the course of the years. I have over $60,000 of revolving credit with Chase and now do business exclusively with them. Their customer service is responsive, prompt, effective and Chase team operates with a great sense of urgency and genuine care. Citi has always been a secondary card and it turned out to not have been worth the trouble and all the extra work. Cannot wait to see Citibank go out of business. The way they treat their customers will get them there fast.

name: Scott
review: Citibank closed our Costco account after my bank and I decided to close my personal checking account due to fraud that I experienced on my checking account (thieves stole thousands of dollars before I noticed). Hence, I had to open a new checking account, effectively just changing my checking account number in Citibank’s records. I had automatic payments for the total balance set up to pay Citibank monthly from my wife's checking account, so valid payments were being made monthly from her checking account, despite what was happening with my checking account, for an amount that we determined to be her portion, usually around half to two thirds of the bill. I usually made payment for my portion manually from my checking account before the due date of the Citibank account, so that the remaining balance of the bill (her portion) was paid in full from my wife’s account. However, the one payment that I had made just prior to experiencing the fraud on my checking account was returned because the account was closed before the payment went through. Even though I phoned Citibank to explain, they told me that they couldn't stop the payment because it was already “in process”. That one payment was presented to my bank three times and returned three times for “insufficient funds” because the account was actually “locked” rather than “closed” in order to continue receiving automatic deposits until they could be redirected to my new account. Meanwhile, I entered a new payment for the same amount from my new account number. Unfortunately, I erred because I apparently incorrectly entered my new account number (it WAS a new account number after all, it was 4 digits longer than my old one and I was trying to memorize it) and that payment also was returned but as "account unknown". Additionally, before there was time for this first payment I made from my new account to be returned “account unknown”, I made a second payment from my "unknown account" for my portion of the bill for the next month, which also was ultimately returned “account unknown”. Meanwhile, another payment for my wife’s portion was automatically and successfully taken from my wife's account. So, even though our Citibank account was NEVER late, NEVER underpaid (always WAY more than the “minimum amount due”), and usually was paid monthly in the thousands of dollars from my wife’s account, I received notices of LATE PAYMENT because of the issues with my account, and hence, Citibank closed our account. Realize that we usually paid somewhere close to three thousand dollars total each month for over a year before this happened, and still over twelve or thirteen hundred dollars each month for the two months that this went on, but Citibank still closed our account. AND, apparently they closed it in such a manner that it could not be re-opened. WOW! That happened, I believe, automatically by default because of the programming that detected returned payments and despite not being late or underpaid and without ever having a person review the account before closure. Shame on you, Citibank!!

review: Quality Control for the Online banking web site is a Joke.  They have a problem that I researched and resolved within a 1/2 hour that they can not fix even now. After several calls to support I finally found someone who told me it was a known problem.  No Estimated time to fix.  No assurance that they would e-mail me when it was fixed.  Without this downloaded information I can not balance my books.    OFX files have been around since the mid 1990's.  It is a well known and established file format.  It has strict rules about how the information is to be formatted.  But those rules have not changed in years.   Since Citibank has been successfully producing these files for years, you think they would know how to test and quality control changes to their web site.    I Google the phrase "OFX File Analyzer",   The first enter was for a program from Microsoft with such a file.  The latest version was released to the public in 2006.  That gives you an idea of how stable this file format is.    Downloaded and installed.  Ran it against the files from Citibank.   In under a half hour I found the TWO errors they had their files.   I can make manual changes to the files to get me back in business.      But if I can find a tool, install it, analyze Citibank files, find 2 errors, and correct them in about 1/2 hour,  why can't Citibank with  millions of dollars and thousands of IT staff why can't they get it right BEFORE it goes into production.

name: lc8509
review: Dec 2019. It was not this exact card but was a CitiCard for college students with no credit history. I helped my 18 year old granddaughter apply and receive the college student card so that she could start building her credit. She had a $2000 limit when it arrived. The day that she received her card, she set up an automatic payment with a checking account so that it would be paid monthly and she would not forget to send payment. She chose to have statements mailed to her address rather than sent electronically. It is a way for her to keep a paper trail on expenditures in college. Several weeks later, she received a phone call from citi bank that her payment was past due, eventhough she had not even received a statement and she had set up AutoPay through a checking account. She explained to them that the account was set up to AutoPay but they said that did not happen and they asked if she could make a payment over the phone. She made the payment with her debit card at that time. She asked if there would be a late charge and they said no because they failed to make the auto withdrawal that had been set up and that everything should be fine going forward. The following month, she received her statement and there was a $25 late fee added to the total due. She attempted to reach them by phone with the phone number provided on the statement and reached an automated system where she could not figure out how to talk to a real person.I then tried the same number with no success at talking to a real person so I got on line and accessed their website and went to a live chat. I explained the problem and that I would like to have the late fee refunded. I also told them about the problem of not being able to talk to a real person with the number provided on the statement. They finally got back to me with another number to try. My granddaughter called the number and was connected to an automated call again. I told her to press 0 several times. She did that and finally she was able to talk to someone, She once again explained what had happened and that she would like the $25 refunded. They said that they were not able to do that because the payment was late. She again told them that AutoPay had been set up the day that she received the card in the mail and that she had not even been sent a statement so there was no way she could have known it was past due. They again said that there was nothing they could do. I was with her when she made the call, so I told her if that was the case to have them send a final statement and cancel the card, They cancelled the card.I then got on line and helped her apply for a Capital One card for students. She was aproved immediately and will probably be a customer for a very long time, if not for life, cwhile helping build her credit which was the goal from the beginning. I would not recommend CitiBank to anyone. This was not anything that my granddaughter did wrong. Late payment was all due to CitiCard's lack of organization and accountability.

review: I’d say Good card and that it’s definitely  worth it If you have less than perfect credit. my credit score has went up drastically!!

review: Great experience with this card.  Any questions or concerns are addressed immediately and within an acceptable time frame.!!!!!!!!!

review: We paid 26 days early and was told we could. We paid 85 on a min balance of 34. But because the EARLY payment was  made 1 day before the statement close date it resulted in citi/Best Buy applying as the payment toward the prior month.  In short the 25 day early payment was seen as a 4 day late payment for the wrong month. Best Buy/citi agreed it was an abnormal and waived two of the fees out of the 12 late fees that exceeded 500. We paid early and was penalized over a 1 day technicality. Strongly do not recommend this card. If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Wicho  Dominguez
review: It’s not a technicality.  Pay after your statement closes otherwise it counts for that current month. If you want to pay early wait until the statement closes.  Sometimes being over eager is a bad thing.

name: Jose
review: I think it was a brilliant idea for Costco and Citi to combine forces and offer the benefits of this card. Great Card! Great benefits!

name: Gary Levinson
review: Awful beyond words! Opened a savings account and tried to link it with my other accounts all major financial institutions. Not only did it fail but not a single one of their customer service people cou figure our why. Finally went up to a VP of service and they admitted that any remote services are intentionally hampered by the system. So unless you live in a city with a branch, you can do nothing but leave your money with them. No flexibility. I have to go to an atm, pay a fee for every transaction and get my money out $200 at a time. They still have about $1800 of my money because they claim to have sent me checks for the balance which never came. Stay away.

name: Michael
review: They approved me with a FICO of 481. The process was quick and payments are instantly credited. I did not get an instant approval, but rather a 7-10 message.

name: Laura
review: Citi cash back is great overall. There are no hidden fees; It pretty straight forward. The only drawback to my particular card is the high interest rate of 24.9. It's my highest APR of my 3 main cards.

name: tatertot28031
review: Ive had this card for 5 years. Purchased appliances, air conditioner and furnace,  building supplies and more. I always pay it off and make payments every month. I missed one several months ago on accident. They are not willing to work with me to make it right. I will no longer be using this card or be doing business with home depot. Ill be going to lowes and ill use a different card not associated with homedepot or citi.

name: Andrew
review: The card is great and provides great cash back. It’s annoying  to have to wait until March to redeem but worth the inconvenience for the astounding cash back rate.

name: Burleigh Johnston
review: Citi has been a good source for my credit needs.  I have had and enjoyed this card since 2013.  It is one of my favorite choices for credit cards and I will continue using it.

name: iheartoz13
review: I am absolutely DISGUSTED with Citi Bank's dispute resolution center. In September I had booked a hotel online and received a confirmation that turned out to be fake. I brought it to the hotel who they laughed at me, said I wasn't the only one who had fallen for this company in India's SCAM, and informed me they were completely booked so I couldn't even book a room on the spot. SO, the night before my LSAT I'm running around looking for any room available and spent another $200. I immediately flagged the charge and told them to contact the hotel as they will confirm the scam. TWO MONTHS LATER. They sided with the website because the site sent them the same fake confirmation I had fallen for. By this time I had frozen my card and planned on closing the account but tried to reopen the dispute. ANOTHER MONTH went by and I was charged the annual fee only to have them side with the fake company AGAIN and clearly not investigate with the evidence and leads I presented. So now my one night in a flea bag motel in BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA has set me back almost $500.

name: Cynthia
review: This is the easiest card ever & I get tons of offers with this card. I have even gotten a high yield savings account. They treat their customers amazingly !

name: David

name: raptor4315
review: Great secured credit card for building your credit. It was simple to signup and it's easy to make payments online or with their app.

review: I would think it's with all citi credit cards. I made my payment on time, but it was posted to the account one day after the statement closing date. review: I would give them a zero if I could.  I had 3 heart operations and 7 hospitalizations in 12 months.  I have terminal heart disease and there is nothing more that they can do. When the August bill arrived, I was in the hospital.  I live in a condo complex, and somehow, the Sept. bill never made it.  I paid the bill in mid October.....$20, PLUS $63 in fines and penalties....ie over 300%.  When I called and explained, they simply stated that I already had 2 wiped out, but they would not do a 3rd.  Legal?  Yes.   However, I told them that the charges were unethical and immoral.  They don't care.

I had to call service, who then also didn't know how to take my money.  They said to wait 24 hours for the bank to verify me.  What?  All I wanted to do was pay off my credit card in full.  I can't do it online.  And I am now on hold 20+ minutes to talk to a human being to take my money.

name: Valarie
review: Fees causes balances to be higher than credit limit. Late fees kill too (no grace)! Even when you call to make payments instantly there is a fee. Charges for Costco membership try to post when least expected with more fees.

name: Robert

Transferred the remaining balances from two other accounts and will have the balance paid in full before the zero interest rate kicks in. Great cc with rewards and balance transfer availability.

review: This is a great app for helping stay on top of credit transactions. I get the latest score and great offers.  The first  Also it keeps track of all my balances when I pay things off. Also if I miss a payment which I never do I am alerted.

review: I opened the account to improve my credit score after I was denied a regular Citi card (I've been a Citibank customer with an excellent record for almost a decade, but it does not seem to have any bearing when you apply for their credit card). The application process took weeks, they offer very little flexibility in terms of card graduation, and they provide no reasons for extending the deposit period.Despite my on-time payments for the entire period of 18 months, I recently received a letter in the mail stating that my card was not graduated and my deposit would be renewed for 12 months. Customer service representatives were unable to provide any more information. I decided to close this account effective immediately and requested a refund of my deposit. Moreover, since the opening of my Citi Card account, the FICO score feature on Citi's website has consistently showed a lower score compared to information provided by CreditKarma and CapitalOne.

name: Anamarie Waite
review: No complaints with this card. The rewards rack up quickly and are easy to use in a variety of ways. Citi is always easy to communicate with if there are any questions or issues. Overall, it's a good card from a reliable lender.

name: Lynn
review: "What happens to my score if" is not working.  The rest seems to be OK.  I like the 2% business.  I use this card when my 3% cards and my 5% cards are not applicable.  This is my everything else card.

name: Danny Lightfoot
review: The best card I use (of 10). Payments are applied immediately, you get a Equifax FICO score each month, great website that's easy to use, and liberal credit increases as credit builds. Double cash back, 1% when used, 1% when paid. Never an issue and always works perfectly. Plenty of other options are offered periodically to card holders, like balance transfers at 0% even after the introductory period. A great experience and card.

name: Taylor
review: Bothered me way too many times about fraud. Then they couldn’t easily verify me after my attempt to add Apple Pay to my Apple Watch after I unpaired and then REpaired the card on the same Apple Watch 3.

review: Unfortunately they will not credit your account on an early payment. name: Austin
review: This is an outstanding service for beginners in the ol credit card game. Hopefully this will boost my already decent credit score.

name: Carletta
review: Fast shipping, got approved for $3000.  I used the shopping cart trick and got approved.  My score was 660eq, 670ex, 640tr,  this card is really good because they have everything you want.  The shopping cart trick works with other retailers too

review: I opened a bank account online and entered the wrong phone number by accident for my joint holder. Wow, what a mistake. name: Chris S R
review: Citi is a fantastic creditor. I love the rewards program and the benefits!  Be aware that the bank recently eliminated some key benefits that some people may miss.

name: Cynthia
review: I’ve been a member since 1991. This was my very first credit card. A very reliable card that will be there when you most need it. Highly recommended!

name: getwrite38
review: Thank you guys for giving me a chance to hey my credit back pon track.  Things are looking up for me now in life....... I will stay with you guys.

name: Ginger
review: I have a no interest for 15 months and a good offer on my balance transfer.  I’ve used this card almost exclusively.  I also pay a lot more than requir

name: LAUREN
review: It does get frustrating that you can't change your credit limit even though it's your money. They say 12 months but it's really 18 till your card matures.

name: Theresa
review: 1% when I buy.  1% when I pay.  I pay in full every month.  Easy to use website and immediate text notifications.  Excellent customer service.

name: Aldo
review: Nice sign up bonus was easy to earn just putting monthly expenses on the card and payments got the bonus right away.  Just remember to pay off the balance quickly due to no zero percent promo.   And the Citibank app is great.  Love how making the payments it post to the account right away.

name: David
review: Great card if you and one other fly at least once per year. I'll make a choice next year weather we keep my DW Delta gold, or this card. May even downgrade if not getting enough value. So far so good.

name: Antoine Anderson
review: Nothing to say thank you help helping hello helped her out with the car and she has to come home at the night and get her daycare to

review: Citicorp is very stingy about giving higher credit limits. They also have excessive fraud detection systems so they will flag and deny a lot of charges if you make any larger online purchase.  They can definitely wear you out.

name: jonathan_khan11
review: I just applied for the card based on this review! DONT DO IT!!! I wish I read the reviews first. My average credit limit is several cards at $8,000+ and they gave me an $1,800 limit. What a waste! You cannot undo a hard pull on your credit report but I wont even activate it when it comes it.  I hope this review saves others the hassle

name: michaelg_642
review: The right card at the right time, with the best balance transfer offer for my needs.Thank you Citi!!! I plan to let all my friends know!!!

name: Sal Sev
review: I feel this credit card with deferred interest is just a big scam. At the end of promo period, even there’s $1 left, they will charge you all the interest accumulated at 25%. I divided my balance to 18 months and paying exactly what’s needed to avoid the interest. Funny thing I get offers on credit card like 5%.  Assume my deferred balance is 2000 and i buy 100$ kettle. At the end of deferred period assume I leave $50 balance assuming its the kettle and paid $2050. That 50 dollar unpaid will be assumed to belonging to  $2000. All interest will be charged to you. That’s at least $750 accrues interest. The reason is the last 100 you paid applied to kettle balance since your payment applies to higher apr

name: Joe B
review: I just wanted to tell you how impressed I was with Citibank's process and how I was blown away when I called to discuss a late fee that was added to my new Goodyear account. I made a mistake in entering the routing and account number (bank provided me) for the first time when paying my account. I have never been late on any of my bills and I was devastated that I made a mistake that would ruin my 100% on time bill payments with all of my credit cards. When I called the customer service line, Option 1 was to discuss the late fee and the automated system immediately advised that the late fee would be removed. I just want to say how much I appreciate the quick and easy process to resolve this issue without me having to beg and plead my case to a human. Thank-you! You guys rock.

name: Everett Vinzant
review: This card is mediocre at best. I started with a three thousand dollar credit limit. I used a couple hundred to buy some tools and pay it off over a few months. To reward me for paying it off, they dropped the limit to something like $800. I’m not going to waste my time with such a pathetic limit (especially with the interest rate). I let them know I’d consider using the card when the limit returned to where it was. I waited a year, no change. I was going to buy a washer/dryer set, but couldn’t (not for $800). That forced me to get a Lowes card. Then Sears closed the account. I can see why Sears is going out of business. They don’t want paying customers that pay off their credit cards. Luckily, other businesses do.

name: Christopher
review: I started at $750. I made every payment on-time. I then paid it off a few weeks ago. They decreased the credit line to $300 for no apparent reason. Wow!!!

name: Michael Trimboli
review: Their service was very poor. They never reached out about a payment that was on my account that I disputed. Said nothing they can do. Hit my credit with 2 late fees and would not remove from the credit bureaus. Spoke with a manager who was raising their voice at me and kept cutting me off when I was trying to explain myself. I would not recommend this to anyone

name: Vicki Mace
review: Citi charged me $105 for one wire transfer. $35 fee is already highway robbery. My transaction was big, so they made me break it up into 3 and charged me $35 EACH. When I called, said there was nothing they could do despite my 30 year relationship!!!

name: Tony Briant
review: I've had a Citibank Simple Checking account for 15 years and have never once had an issue. When life fell apart during the recession and overdraft fees started hitting my account during a brief time of unemployment, they were extremely helpful and worked with me. Because of that, I have stayed with them all these years. Customer service is always top notch and I have nothing negative to say.

name: BJ McBride
review: I have never left a negative company review before, but please please PLEASE never bank with Citi.I opened a Citi savings account and deposited $400 in hopes of taking advantage of their high-interest rate. They sent me an email to submit forms verifying my address, which I submitted the next day. Two weeks later I still have not received access to my login and do not have access to my $400. I call them and they tell me that even though I sent everything the email requested, they needed more verification (though no one bothered to tell me this).I went back and forth for weeks with them, and they insisted on needing a form from me that I did not have, and they did not care that I had given everything they asked for in their email. Eventually, I just decided to close my account with them and they promised to send me a check in the mail within 7 days. 7 days pass and I still do not have my check. A couple of days later I call and they insist on the check having been sent out. I have them cancel the check and resend another check. They promise me this will take at most 10 days.Two weeks later I still do not have my check in the mail. I call back and tell me that they refused to process the check this time because they said they needed more documentation. For two weeks, my check was refused to be mailed and no one emailed or called me to tell me this. It was not until I called was I finally told of this. I explained to them that I had already submitted all the documentation they asked for, and the check had already "sent" once, so it had already been approved at one point. I had completed all of their documentation and had closed my account. I was only asking for the money I initially deposited to be sent back to me. They told me that there was nothing they could do for me. I asked to speak with multiple managers, but all managers were "busy." I asked to be connected to their voicemails, but "none of their voicemails worked."This is by FAR the worst customer service I have ever experienced, and it borders on fraud and thievery. I am now. It has been months and I still do not have my money. PLEASE spare yourself and never use this company.

name: Vicki Mace
review: My son had a similar experience. He's been trying to open a high interest rate account for over a month now and just gets the runaround.

account number...  if you do not have it with you ...it then asks  for  6 more security questions.... then you have to be on hold... this will last 15 to 40 minutes....  the person that answers  in in
