name: jafoxbody50
review: Never again. I got this store card in May 2017 1200 dollar limit. I dont use it much bought a laptop paid it off bought some other little things but rarely used it. Recently went to buy a security camera and they tell me my balance is only 100 bucks. Store staff told me i should have used it more. Customer service never said that when i signed up for it I just made all my payments on time. So hell with it 500 bucks left pay  and shut it down.

name: Dianne
review: Never got a card but friends and family have and been keeping up with the payment on time Great Service maybe when I get a Credit card I'll get Great Service too

name: Oleg Andelman
review: Citibank business checking account includes all the necessary ingredients to make the customer as frustrated as possible. - Archaic online interface, hopelessly behind any other bank portal. - Inability to retrieve simple information. For example, account history (for business accounts!) is only available for the past 6 months. The rest is unavailable. Not if you call phone support. Not in the branch. Not anywhere. Good luck if you want to run through your activity for the past year. - The most inefficient, bureaucratic process one can imagine. For example, just opening an account takes 3 weeks, multiple visits to the branch and then another 2 months to get it working because they messed up with paperwork on the way.- Customer support doesn't care anymore. They must be tired of the constant flow of frustrated customers being stuck unable to do simple things or address contant mistakes. Such as charges for transactions that were not supposed to be billed. Overall: ARCHAIC, BOUROCRATIC, SLOW and REDICULOSLY INEFFICIENT organization. Avoid Citibank unlesss there is a good enough reason to use them that you are willing to endure all of that.

name: eevriyt
review: One of the worst mileage programs I've seen. They did not give me the bonus miles they promised. I closed the card and will not sign up for this Citi American airlines Advantage mileup card again. Poor customer experience overall.

name: christopherh_89
review: I got this card because it didn't come with the temptation of AUs to use everywhere like a Visa or MasterCard, but turns out you can't reliably use it at Shells either. More than half the time it just says "see cashier" and if you call the 800 number and spend 5 minutes going through the account info just to be told call back during normal business hours but they don't say when that is. I got through to a person once who put me on hold for 10 minutes and hung up on me, I call back again and they put me to the department to dispute an existing charge. The card is completely useless if it cannot be relied upon to get gas when I'm out. Maybe others' luck is better, but this card is total trash.

name: Qusay Alani
review: I purchase unlock iPhone from Best Buy using my best buy credit card and 6 weeks later I found out that my iPhone is locked with At&t .. the store customer service were awful and the Best Buy Credit Card customer service they were the worse.. so if you try to protect your purchase don’t use Best Buy Credit Card.. now i am going to file a claim with Federal trade Commission .. also going to report a claim Best Buy Credit Card services to better business bureau

name: alicia_santos787
review: They did not even bother let me apply because they need more than EXCELLENT credit. Do not waste your time if you want a second chance in life... and THEY ARE EXTREMELY RUDE AND MANNERED !Will NOT RECOMMEND. Check other companies that are not money hungry like them!

name: Connie Sledge
review: So far everything has been great and hassle free.. I'm looking forward to a great relationship... I made that comment in the beginning of my account. I was thrilled to finally have a credit card! I sent a deposit to them as instructed and then NEVER received my card... Now I also NEVER got my deposit returned to me! I'm angry! I was trying all this time to not leave a bad review but I do not want this to happen to anyone else!!! And, by the way, if someone can please tell me how to get my $400 deposit back... That would be great!

name: sanfilippo1183
review: This is the absolute worst company to ever offer a credit card.  This company has absolutely no customer service skills at all.  These people couldn't even work at Walmart lol its that bad.  People want a company who cares about there customers not this place its horrible.

name: Manda Villa
review: Citi CashReturn Card customer service is the worst.  I called in today and they hung up on me .  Such rude agent, I spoke to July, yes that is the Agent name at 8:39pm pacific time, she refused to help because I want her to clarify her statement so I can be clear on her instruction.  I am closing this card for sure.   So much for being a loyal customer since 2009.

name: Rintu Babu
review: This is the worst card I have came across. They are fooling people with promotional options and then making the full statement payment with revolving due concepts. There customer care service is also not upto mark. Not recommending to anyone to fall trap from Best Buy sales representative.

name: Lindsey Blalock
review: This is so true. I opened a card to purchase a MacBook in 2014. I did not want the card, but they said it was a promotional purchase that would be cheaper on me if I opened the card. So I did. It is now almost 6 years later and I STILL OWE $350! Because after that promotional period, they added on interest out the wazoo! Then each time I pay a chunk on my balance, like $3-400, they lower my limit?! Now my limit is $350! Which means I’m now utilizing “100%” of the card instead of 25%. Such a scam, do not open an account with Best Buy!

name: tckwmn03
review: Citi bank is a predatory lender and will hurt your credit score!!! I was approved for the Sears Citibank MasterCard in Feb 2019. However, at 6 months, they reviewed my credit report and DECREASED my credit limit! Want to know why?!? They said my FICO score decreased and there were late payments "according to Experian". NOT TRUE!!! My credit has not changed, I've never been late on any of my cards. I HAVE Experian, Equifax, AND TransUnion credit monitoring and there is no such evidence to support their assertions. In fact, my FICO had increased during the time of their review. That increase prompted my other cards to RAISE my limit during that same period, not decrease it. I explained to the credit dept (the real one, not customer service), that by decreasing my limit, they've caused my usage percentage to increase, therefore negatively impacting my FICO score, the man on the phone has the audacity to say "we don't care about that, we only care about our assets, and based on your score, you're higher risk." I've never been late on a payment, have paid well above the minimum on AUTOPAY, and they still would rather do this to their loyal customers, then to take their actual payment histories into account. NOPE!! I tried to get them to send me to someone higher, but nope, they can "have someone call you back." So, since they've already impacted my credit, I've closed the account and paid off the balance. I have NEVER had this happen from any of my other credit agencies. This is UNACCEPTABLE and PREDATORY. DO NOT GET THIS CARD!

name: Wyatt
review: I have this card and absolutely love  having it in my wallet. Citibank is top of its class in cash back rewards. The is my go to card for all unexpected financial occasions. I’m very please with the customer service I have received when inquiring about card related questions.

name: r_jenssen1
review: Just another big bank with a Costco logo on their card. Not worth .the trouble. Rewards are not worth it unless you spend $$$$$ at Costco. Problems with billing, chat, benefits. I seem to gain more from my airline card.

name: Crystal
review: Not true, I have accumulated almost $215 in cash back rewards and most of my purchases are not at Costco.

name: Marietta
review: The APR on this card is horrible.  I have made payments on time for 3 years, and have paid enough to pay off my entire balance over this time.  yet, due to the APR, I still owe over a thousand dollars and my total balance has only gone down by $300.  Absolutely disgusting business practices.

name: Sabrina Ezell
review: I have had this card for 3 years now. They send me 2 to 3 times a month 0% interest for 9 months to 15 months when I use the checks they send me.  I can use the checks for cash, new purchases, or balance transfers with only a 5% fee. I have never purchased anything with the card itself, but I love the 0% checks they send. And I have never paid any interest to date. Favorite Card of mine to date!!

name: Alex Rosario
review: Great Card. However, I had to get approval from a different card company first (Bank of America). After a couple months with BA Citibank came crawling back with constant pre-approval letters sent to me. That was because my credit score & use was gradually rising. I applied 3 years ago making a little over 55k and they approved. The double-cash-back is real. I've made over $200 a year just making the monthly pay. My credit limit has jumped three 3 times since and customer service has always been extra nice to me. Its a great card if your looking for credit increases (don't expect a credit increase after 4 months .... c'mon and you have to use the card for everyday purchases....everything.) I recommend it.

name: susan kramer
review: Please take my name off my ex-husbands HD credit card.  I have a ZERO balance on my on own card.  He has a balance of over 2500.00+ on his but it is showing up on my credit.  Because of this, I have lost a mobile home that I wanted and now have to pay more for another one.  It seems neither one of us knew about this.  Please correct this mistake. I am sure not happy about this.  And I ask that you do this ASAP. Boy, it sure hurt me.   I would have given you a 5 if this had not happened.  We have been divorced for 4 years!

name: Tanya Rumford
review: Buyer Beware: If you are considering a Best Buy store card, I HIGHLY recommend looking elsewhere! They are ran by Citibank and will place "add ons" to your account without consent, such as their "Debt Protection" program. (If you'd like more info, Google "Best Buy Credit Card Debt Protection Scam," and you'll immediately be brought to several results detailing a class action lawsuit they were part of in 2015 for the very same thing). They have stolen over $2,000 from me over the years that they refuse to return. If you ALREADY HAVE a Best Buy card, PLEASE check your statement immediately to make sure a Debt Protection fee hasn't been taken out. It's a terrible shame that they are doing this to people, but I intend to warn as many customers/potential customers as I can. Stay away from Citibank owned cards!!!

name: dgarlon
review: It's up to you as card holder to always check your billing statements the Credit Card can't address any issues unless you notify them in a timely manner so they can investigate and fix the issue.

name: Lisa Lee
review: These people are scammers. I've been a customer for years and finally had to dispute a charge. These people have lied saying I didn't send them information that I had to send 3 times, every time I call them every representative tells me something different about the same situation, the have a new policy everyday, and they will lie, cheat, and do everything in their power to not give you your money back. I've never dealt with a credit card company that we can't speak with the person handling our claim, or that works against me instead of help me. Its really shady how the investigators hide behind the scenes and scam and lie to not approve our disputes. They ask for one thing and when u send it, they lie and deny your claim saying they didn't receive the information. Whoever is handling the claims needs to be fired because they are crooked and obviously don't know how to do the job. They act like it's going to kill them and cost them to return your money from a dispute. Do not get this card or do any business with this shady company. The shop your way rewards department is also retarded. I have a lot of points that are not showing on my account, I called shop your way, they said I have the points but they don’t know why their not in my account to shop, they transferred me to sears, (when they are supposed to be the ones handling the shop your way points), then sears transferred me back to them, and they transferred me back to sears. This went on all day and no one knows why my points aren’t in my account to shop online or in store, and they told me if I want to use my points I have to call and place an order over the phone to use my points. This whole company is retarded and now I understand why sears has been shutting down. They don’t know how to handle ANY business.

name: antonypham1990
review: For the first time i have experienced with not good customer service to solve my issue with bestbuy citi bank credit card. I purchased a wireless earpod online from a website. I used the credit card to purchase and i already paid my credit owed bestbuy citibank....but the seller had received my payment but did not ship me my item...and i asked citibank customer service to dispute my transaction...they said that they sry could retrieve my fund and i have to pay the amount that i owe from buying this product which i had paid in full before monthly cycle....very upset that the bank couldn’t do anything to take back my payment from the online webisite that took my money and didnt send my earpod....

name: Desmond McGlynn
review: No rating. A pure scam. Will charge you and not any help, unless you are purchasing hundreds of dollars every week. I was never informed the monthly fees when purchasing a product. Promised the cost of product (under 50.00 purchase) to be less if I signed up for a card (be wary of in-store salesmen who get you to sign), and not told verbally or in writing about monthly fees wether crd is used or not. Closed act, had credit agency squeeze for increased late fees.

name: John P
review: I ended up buying a more expensive PC than I had planned. I paid $1,000 of my purchase in cash, and applied for, and was approved for a Citibank Best Buy card to cover the balance. I received my first bill and sent in a payment of $100. About a week later, I received my monthly commission check, so I sent in a payment to cover my balance ($709) electronically via my bank. Citibank received and posted my payment. My bank cleared my payment.When I received my next statement from Citibank, it indicated my payment was received and posted, it indicated my balance due is $0 (zero), and it showed my available credit, less $709.I called and asked how this worked, as it would seem if my balance is zero and my payment is posted and cleared, I should have the entire amount of my credit limit available.I was told my account was flagged due to suspicious activity. The suspicious activity was that I made 2 payments and paid my bill in full! They basically put a hold on my payment, in spite of the fact it was cleared by my bank.That's ridiculous!

name: Lindsey Blalock
review: What they do is lower your credit limit every time you make a big payment, they’ve done it to me multiple times! This means that your credit report shows you’re utilizing 100% of the card, which is very bad for your credit! Closing my account ASAP!

name: sh2death
review: Card offers no rewards -1 Star. However, it offers one of the highest limits w/ some of the lowest interests for balance transfers. I don't recommend this card for normal purchases, this card is only good for balance transfers from purchases on the right card or for those high expense bills (medical emergencies). If you book a vacation (outside of your available financial means) on a rewards card, you would be able to transfer that balance over to this card for a 3% fee and no interest for 15 months. Though I don't recommend going on vacation on money you don't have, this is a good option to save yourself lots of money on interest w/ a balance transfer. Strongly suggest this card for unexpected medical expenses. Again, charge on a rewards card and balance transfer into this card at a 3% fee for 0% interest for 15 months. 4 stars for ease of use, high credit limits and BT offers. Do not use as your primary card.

name: Mark Casey
review: I have had 2 Citicards for years, and I recently opened a Citibank Accelerated Savings account.   I already had logins for the two Citicards, but Citibank required a completely new login that would cover the new savings account and the 2 credit cards, and the old logins would no longer work.  This was inconvenient at best.   I requested a replacement ATM card, and this resulted in my account being locked, and I was unable to sign in for several days until I received the new ATM card in the mail.  They didn't tell me that I could use the original PIN from the old card with the new card, so I waited in vain for a new PIN to arrive.  I also had to call in multiple times to try to get the various locks removed.   Once the locks were supposedly clear, I attempted a wire transfer from my new savings account.  About 30 minutes later, I tried to take a look at my savings account, and it was COMPLETELY GONE from both my on-line access and the mobile app.    Again, they locked my account, and blocked it from even showing on the web site.  This was extremely frustrating.  Haven't they ever heard of showing a certain amount as being on hold?    I had to go through the whole process of calling into the security department at least 3 times to get this resolved.  And even though you give the first person the answers to the security questions, every department they send you to asks the same questions.   Seriously:  If you answered the questions once, and you are still on the phone with them, can't they figure out that you're the same person?   Twice I was asked if I was responding to "the voice mail," but they never sent me a voice mail.  Then they have this overly-rigid process of calling you back on the same number you just called them with, and then if that call drops, you have to start the whole process all over again from scratch  with a completly new set of people.  (No one ever asks you, "In case I lose this call, what is the best number for me to call you back?")So, after all that, I was told that there is still ONE MORE LOCK on my account, and someone is reviewing that and will call me in 15 minutes.  I'm still waiting for that call....

name: izzakmartinez
review: Absolutely unsatisfied with the service I’ve had with Best Buy and their Citibank services. I never would recommend getting a credit card with them. They’ve been completely  unreasonable with Their payment and refunds. I will never send anyone to Best Buy again and i will never shop here again. They do not care they lose my loyalty, just like they don’t care they they took my money from me and wouldn’t I’ve me a refund on the same day. They’re not someone I trust with my credit at all. Never go through them if you  want a reasonable credit service I would do zero stars if I could.

name: fgg2001
review: Citibank advertise a savings account with 2.36%APY, but when I tried to apply I found that the offer was valid for many states, but not in California where the rate offered by Citibank is a fraction of the one advertised, no explanation why they don't want the business in this state.The advertising is done on the Citi Card login web page for Costco.What is wrong with Citibank and California customers ? Evidently Citibank hates the business of customers like me just because I live in California !This really sucks, I guess I'll have to shop for a different bank.

name: pupham
review: Citi is taking away all the great perks as of 9/22/2019. That stinks!Hope Costco is looking for a new bankcard. There are a lot of cards out there these days which offer nice cash back rewards. Please pay attention to your members' feelings about this huge change.

name: Sar Moultris
review: I spent time on multiple calls while I was attempting to open an account. They sent me DocuSign emails with invalid access codes each time. I called customer service regarding these emails and they stated that everything was resolved. If axed all my documents over and never received any confirmation. I called to check on the status of my account opening and they stated my account was closed due to the fact that all my documents were not in on time. I was never told that they had not received my documents and when I last called they stated they had everything. I was NEVER notified that my account was even closed. TERRIBLE communication and when I called I was told they had received everything. How is that possible?? Never would I recommend them.

name: dbrown8321
review: I have had a Meijer credit card for over 5 years. Never late on a payment, NEVER. This past year I was paying it off each month. They reduced my credit from 1500 to 150 said my Experian score dropped, when actually my Experian score had gone up. Unless you are making them money on interest, you get penalized. Stay away. I mostly used it for the 10 cent gas credit at the Meijer gas station. Not worth it. I cancelled my account

name: Ray
review: I got denied the first time I did the application. But after one week they sent me a letter asking for Residency proofs, so I sent it to them. Got approved two weeks after the first attempt. Can't wait to receive it!

name: blitz_kravmaga
review: 30% interest. Really? Disgusting and usurious. Terrible customer service. Incorrect late fees (I had to call and wait to speak to someone to have them removed.) How can any bank get away with charging 30% interest??

name: Ty Carney
review: So after a lot of research I opened a rewards+ cities credit card. Approved instantly no problem for a $4200 limit. Through the citi app it Has you log in to your bank account through your login credentials for you personal bank. No problems there. It populates your accounts you have through your bank, you then select which account you want to pay from.So I select said account, entered a fairly large payment, and it posts. Easy, or so I thought. From this, it rejected my payment because of a communication error through their payment system, which then populates a returned payment fee of $150. Odd. So I call, figure out it was an error where their app created which basically boiled down to they couldn’t draw the checking account number correctly so over the phone I gave them the checking account number and routing, made a payment over the phone, and corrected the issue and they were going to refund the fee because it was in fact a mistake.  Now for the meat and potatoes.I go to use my card for a $1.50 soda, declined. What?! I call, citi closed the account because of a returned payment, because the app doesn’t properly communicate with their payment systems, which then draw a return fee,( which never should’ve happened in the first place) and now my account has been closed because of an error the citi had already admitted to. They tell me I have to submit a request to re-open it, won’t be accepted because of that fee. Again, an issue that was already resolved on Citi’s end. Apparently not. My account got closed because of this ridiculous error, and they won’t re-open my card I’ve had for 3 weeks, and I already made 3 separate payments on because the payment system is flawed. So I will never have a citi card ever again, they are unwilling to resolve this issue, and left me with nowhere to go because of their error. I have a couple cards through capital one and I have NEVER had this issue. So Citi, buh bye. Enjoy your terrible reviews.

name: kathrynklein
review: I have been a Citibank customer for over 10 years and always pay on time. Unfortunately a card I never use had a charge due to its link to my Paypal that I wasn’t aware of and paid 4 days late. I called Citibank for a courtesy waive of my late fee and they refused. I couldn’t even send email correspondence of my complaint because their outdated system doesn’t allow it. The customer service supervisor told me to send a letter, yes snail mail, to a PO Box. Avoid this company they have the worst customer service and don’t value there customers.

name: Kelly Copeland
review: Tried to help someone out by giving a pay advance in the form of a deposit on a secure credit card (Sarurday june 1st was when application was done), by June 3rd it was obvious that I had made a mistake and did not want my bank account being used so I called Citibank credit card customer service... The representative said he could not give account information to anyone but the account holder/applicant, as I stated multiple times I was not asking for info I was asking for MY bank account to be removed from someone elses account! I was then told that Citibank would not allow a deposit payment to be made from an account that was not in the account holder/applicant's name so rest assured I would not have to worry about the payment being drafted from my bank account, so not to worry. The very next day I asked the account holder/applicant to cancel the application or remove my account. When they called they were told that the application was processing and to far along to be cancelled (3 days??? And only 1.5 business days at that), so I checked my bank account because I just had the feeling I had been lied to about it not being able to be drafted from my account and low and behold the Citibank deposit was pending in my bank account! So I have the account holder/application call again and explain how I was lied to and how they wanted my bank account removed somehow. They were told that Citibank does a 4 day hold on deposits so there shouldnt be any issue for my bank to stop the payment because again Citibank could do absolutely nothing (if its sitting on hold for 4 days how could that not be stopped?) So I called my bank to stop the payment, they said it would take 24 hours to be effective (4 day hold, no problems right?). Very next day I check my account and Citibank has lied AGAIN, because it was fully processed out of my account within 24 hours and although my bank will still refund it to me (takes 3 days), it completely screwed up my bank account because I had also paid another bill, thinking that the $200 wasnt going to be withdrawn, but of course because it was processed my other bill payment was rejected, I was charged an insufficient funds fee, on top of the stop payment fee, and now the account I tried to pay my bill to is going to get all messed up because they are showing it was paid but now the bank would be rejecting it... All because Citibank refused to remove my bank account from someone elses application, then lied saying it couldnt possibly be withdrawn from a different persons account and lied some more telling me it would be  a pending/hold for 4 days before it would be taken from my bank... So 4 days from when the application was filled out and my bank account is screwed up, my bills will likely continue to get me insufficient funds fees, and their deposit payment spent 1 whole day on my pending transactions..  CITIBANK HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!! There is absolutely no way I would get any sort of account with this awful, lying, terrible company. So glad I have Capital One and have never had to deal with such absolute crap!!

name: springlemons
review: Wow! I called Best Buy on the phone to pay off my credit card. I gave them them my new bank account number, but instead of drawing it out of that account they took it from the account number on file. So I was charged by my other bank for an overdraft fee. When I called them to ask them to reimburse me for it they agreed to do so, but after filing the complaint they said No, Sorry, It Wasn't Our Fault. I will NEVER do business with this company EVER AGAIN in my life. I won't be buying anything from them, or using their credit line EVER. Don't do business with this company. They don't do what they say their going to do.

name: conordrew
review: AbsolutelyTerrible good luck with the dispute process this company has horrible customer service that talks to you like you’re a piece of trash they do not defend the customer the process for a dispute is easily a full-time job I had a receipt from the merchant hand written and an email showing exactly how much money they owed and they still failed the dispute and gave it to the merchant which is more than enough evidence than any average person would have horrible company that forwards calls overseas to rude people in other countries I will never use them again American Express and Visa here I come all over again I would never deal with city and if that’s mastercards process I would never deal with them either Not worth the hassle for the 2% better off sticking with a 1.5% card and not having to deal with them

name: Robert Stong
review: I had same problem with Citi's worthless "dispute resolution."  Recommend that others do not do business with Citi.

name: OG Cypha
review: This is a stupid company, if you're not yet a customer, just read the reviews from actual customers. Managing your account or making payments is stupid, no app - you have to go to longheckingsubdomain.longheckingwebsite.com to login and then you're greeted with a clusterflik of ads. And if you dont go paperless, its even worse - you get what looks like a magazine for your monthly statements and its 90% ads - you ll have to struggle to find what actually pertains to you-This is on-top of the sub-par service, sub-par rewards, huge APR, ridiculous "late-fees-that-get-removed-even-though-you-pay-on-time" and all the other "we're going to treat you like we're doing you a favor" type of service you don't get from using actual credit cards from serious companies.But f**k it, i ll keep it for my regular "HP-ink catriges" and "USB cable" black Friday shopping i guess

name: chimaren
review: First of all, when you deal with Home Depot, particularly for large jobs, you are dealing with a subcontractor, although thtey will lie and tell you they "are" Home Depot.  In point of fact, they are transient, and the second the sale is made, with all the lies you would expect thereof, they are nowhere to be found.Meanwhile, the enticement of the Home Depot 24 month interest free credit card.  Only, by some "oversight", it is only 6 months, not 24 months when you receive it.  You will spend weeks getting this sorted out.However, they have your permission to bill the card, and therefore, will immediately bill you even when pricing isn't final, even if they don't have the total price, up or down.  Then they will tell you they will eat the price if higher, and credit you if lower.  Watch the hole, see the woodchuck.  They will tell you that the price will get sorted out in 3 days, but this took 6 weeks.  Meanwhile, the first credit card payment was due and the order hadn't even been placed yet.In short, they have you sign the contract on an ipad, conveniently failing to show you the 4-5 additional pages of fine print.Dealing with Home Depot, or their credit card, is not friendly, not accurate, not above board, and far from honest.My first online payment didn't "take", apparently, although it said it did.So, when I called to fix the 24 month interest free issue (stated on the contract), they refused to fix it after telling me they would because no payment had been made on the deposit for materials not yet purchased, let alone used.In short, I'm going to end up paying more, and getting less, and should have gone with a subcontractor, not affiliated with Home Depot.  They didn't follow through, cancelled multiple times, leaving weeks of lost time in between, and meanwhile, want me to pay for something that should have been installed weeks ago.  In short, I am now directing my sizable home improvement monies towards any other store that can accommodate.  Directing business at Home Depot just perpetuates a narrow field and allows disreputable companies power that they abuse.

name: Robert
review: If you travel internationally, this is the card to have! Just one of the 4th nights free and the card is paid for. Add in the travel allowance and pre-check program of choice and you’ve got it made. 5x miles for travel and dining (internationally as well unlike AMEX gold). Travel insurance programs (and cell phone insurance) makes this a no-brainer. If you spend a lot and travel internationally, the Citi Prestige wins.

name: Kevin Cromarty
review: Had the account open for about 18 months. Used it once to purchase $800 worth of tires from Tire Rack 12 months ago. Paid off within the promotional period. Today I find they just arbitrarily closed it. The hard enquiry on my credit reports last longer than the card.. Avoid.Update: Apparently if you don’t use it every 6-12 months, it will be cancelled. So I guess instead of replacing all 4 tires at once, stagger the replacement one tire every 6 months then start over with the oldest tire again after 2 years. And so on.. Crazy.

name: Renee Cisneros
review: I applied a few months back and got denied. I have a bankruptcy due to fall off august 2020.. i decided to apply again and got approved! Im soo excited to get this card. thank you citi bank for giving me a chance!

name: Diane Bernardo
review: Terrible customer service. My authorized user's Citibank credit card was stolen and swiped at a grocery store. When it first happened (while the charges were still pending), I immediately gave customer service a call to let them know that over $490 worth of charges were made. They took note and immediately sent me a new card and proceeded to tell me that it will be off my credit 7-10 business days later.2 weeks after the incident, the charges were still there. So I gave them a call again and it's like nobody knew I even placed the first call. "Are you sure this is fraud? The credit card was swiped" To which I replied "Yes, the actual physical credit card was stolen." "But ma'm you have shopped at this store before." "Yes, but that wasn't me and we have filed a police report already." Again, they said that it should be off my credit card in 7-10 business days.Another week goes by and it's still on there. I called them a 3rd time and when I asked the customer service representative more questions, they then transferred me to the fraud / investigation number. After the THIRD TIME???!! And this department asked the same exact questions... "But the card was swiped? Are you sure you didn't make this purchase? You have shopped at this store before.It was horrible! By far, one of the worst customer service experiences ever. I have Discover, American Express, and Capital One and have had fraudulent charges appear on them, granted those charges were never "swiped" but they still at least gave me credit while they conducted their investigations.

name: Vincent A Wagner
review: Rampant affirmative action hiring has consequences, unfortunately

name: Dick Syatt
review: The worst customer service. The worst telephone service. But still I last10 years. Just got charged $25 a month service fee. For what? I don’t even get a calendar. What in the world am I getting in service for this? I’m switching to a fee free bank that actually gives over 2% interest on regular savings account. They stink.

name: Linda Larsen
review: Failed to send me paperless statements so I did not know I had a $23 charge. After FOUR MONTHS they tell me I owe $230, or TEN TIMES the original charge. They are thieves. Do not get this card and do not trust them.

name: patty P
review: Horrible customer service.   I have a deferred int with payments and balance transfer, all up to date.   I sent a payment which should have gone to the deferred int account due 7/19, not the balance transfer due 2/20.   According to THEIR terms, they apply payments to the deferred account first.  However, they made a mistake and applied to the bal transfer due 2/20.   The supervisor tells me they apply the monthly balance due to the bal transfer, which should have been $39, not the full amount they applied which should have gone to the 7/19 balance.   Talk about people who cannot admit they made a mistake and reverse the charge and put towards the correct account.  Not to mention not abiding by their OWN terms.   HORRIBLE!    Get a Discover or Capitol One card - both have OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!    Never an issue!!

name: knguyen1
review: Got approved on sight and out of 2 other credit cards I own (Apple, BOA) this is far the best and only one I own. They approved me right away with a $5,000 increment raise which I was very shook that I got approved so fast in under what a minute .

name: Robin Milis
review: The worst customer service I have ever encountered. We are a business and have many employees that make purchases.  We depend on receiving statements which we reconcile and pay in full.  I did not receive a statement from Goodyear for several months. When I did they added on $189 in service fees.  I called and they stated it wasn't their fault the postal service didn't deliver our mail.  Very rude and refused to make an adjustment to the fees.  We no longer do business with them.

name: james l smith
review: I was in bestbuy 4-14-19. In search of a new laptop. Mine couldn't be repaired.I own 6 credit cards.fico scores from all 3 bureaus 790 793 769.foolishly i let one Rep talked me into applying for this shit card to pay for the laptop, and Denied.I'd never even heard of this card .I called the company once i got home to let them know what i thought and asked why i was Denied and after reading some reviews, and talking with their reps i want Nothing else to do with them Ever.Also taking A hard Hit on my Credit rating which is Considered excellent and could get Approval for Most Cards on the market. Total Waste,and Shit Company. They don't deserve 1 Star.

name: Nesh AL
review: The card service is very rigid. The customer support is rude. Please do not apply. Its not worth it. There are better cards out their. Please consider other options. The previous AMX option was much better. I would recommend COSTCO to please switch back to AMX , or explore another companies.

name: MOHAMMAD HOSSAIN
review: One of the worst banking service in the US possible, I do not recommend anyone to have accounts with them, not surprising they are closing their branches, I had opened my checking and saving accounts with them, all the accounts are 6 months old, anytime I make check deposits , the accounts are hold for 12 days , they block my accounts from any access and then even an hour before of 7 business days  they won't unblock  accounts. 3 times in a month. All the checks are paid.Their verification team is not efficient.  I am closing my accounts soon.

name: marks_dusty
review: I did not have a good experience with them. Yes I signed papers to agree to fees but when I matured and had a goal to pay it off to improve my credit score it was hard to make any progress because of the fees.Even though I was making payments on time and not using the card so I didn't rack up more debt they wouldn't help me. You either pay it off in full or you rack up fees like $50 worth each month on top of what you owe.I called them and was nice at first but I got no where. One of the many reasons they do not approve someone to have their interest lowered is if they are not actively using the card. I could have paid the thing off quickly without the fees. Please be smarter than I was. They are not a company that will work with you.

name: jennifer_yarde
review: Worst credit card ever!  They neglected to update my bank account for autopay and attempted to retrieve the payment from the incorrect bank account, resulting in a late payment.  Exxon made zero attempts to contact me via phone, email, or postal mail.  After numerous phone calls, they still refuse to accept responsibility and to remove the late payment.  Good customer for three years.  Beware.

name: Justin Eno
review: Closed the account without notifying me because it had been paid off, not to mention that they had also reduced my credit line.Only found out about it after I called customer service to ask about getting a new card number because the one in my wallet had expired, and was told that I no longer had an open account with them.Needless to say, won't be applying for another card with them.

name: Greg K
review: Idiotic approval process. Applied online for the card and was required to go to a physical store to identify myself. And after all that trouble they offered me a measly $4000 line of credit because I don’t have a landline phone (seriously?!). I should note that I make over $200,000 per year, own a $2 million house outright (no mortgage) and do not keep a revolving balance on *any* of my other credit cards. (And of course I have no red flags in my credit history.) Hard to imagine how I could be any more credit worthy. Ultimately I rejected the offer and now Best Buy can pay another credit card company when I use their card.

name: Wicho  Dominguez
review: Then you don’t need a Best Buy credit card.

name: Chris
review: Account opened in 10/2017 with initial credit limit of $12,500. Sign-up bonus was 60,000 miles after spending $3k in first 90 days. Used the miles to fly round trip to Europe for $150.00 in fees and taxes.The opening offer did not have a low APR, but that was okay, because I planned on PIF each month. After about 60 days of use, they sent me a 0% purchase offer to activate for about 9 months. Low balance transfer offers come almost once per month. I never use them, but it’s nice to know they are there just in case.Fast forward to now and the credit line is $22,500. Always pay in full before statement due date and cycle everything in your life through this card to earn miles. The more income you earn and more you spend, the higher the limit. They seem to be okay with a limit 5-10x your typical spend per month.Register for AAdvantage Shopping and earn more miles on your everyday purchases from MANY merchants (Bose, Apple, and so many others). Register for AAdvantage Dining Rewards and earn even more miles at restaurants. I’m sitting on 126,000 miles now.I am happy with the card and with the way they have treated me. If you spend responsibly, you will be rewarded with perks (such as the surprise 0% and constant low APR balance transfer checks). The only time I speak with customer service is if they think they detect fraud - they are very good now at understanding my purchase behavior and those encounters are few and far between. I’m a happy customer.

name: pss8169
review: I have enjoyed my Citibank for the past 3 years up until the last few months of 2019.  I cannot use my mobile card anymore because it will not access on line.  I have contacted costumer serve and tried all the scenarios they suggested and it worked one time and if I log out and try to access a second time it doesn’t work.  I am deleting the mobile app because it just will not work!  This really sucks because I used it everyday.  At least I can access from my desktop computer, but it defeats the purpose of having the mobile phone app, because I can’t access anytime no matter where I am.  Citi should seriously get this fixed.  I am so disappointed!

name: fmvolpone
review: Hello Everyone I applied for a citi bank card, the double cash back card to be exact.Credit sesame said I had a good chance of approval for $3500 limit. Wanted it for balance transfer 0% for 18 months.My score on CS was showing 674I make over $150k a year. Have less than $3k in debt. So was hoping for the $3500 limit. To my surprise 5 days later, I received an email showing I was approved. The kicker is it was for $14,600.00 BIG difference from the $3500 I needed. It’s now my biggest limit card, my other is $7750 from CapitalOne. I had over $40,000 in available credit. This puts me closer to $55,000 now. Thank you CIti Bank.

name: Sara Me
review: Do NOT apply for Dividend citicard , I requested for dispute charge from long time ago ad I called them I don't know more than 10 or 15 time and every time I was on the phone for half hour or 45 minutes, and very interesting they are so rude and impolite on the phone with customer . Associate name : Jordan and manager or supervisor name is Jeremy As I said I write review for dividend card every day and every day I put all associate and manager or supervisor name.

name: Brittany H
review: I would give 0 stars if i could. I called in and paid off the card in full with an extra $4. Then was notified my account was no longer active and they closed it. I never recieved a letter, phone call or email. Also never recieved my reward which was about $165. I will never deal with citi again

name: pat_handwerk
review: I tried to open a savings account to get the $600 bonus for depositing $50K. They drove me nuts asking for all kinds of documents and I am an existing (not anymore) customer. I called in to find out what was going on and was on hold for over 30 minutes and then got the rudest person. So over Citi!

name: Tejas Kumar
review: They offer the lowest interest rate out of any bank. Getting 0.04% while CIBC is offering 2.40% and CIT is giving 2.45%.This really adds up when one is reposting a few thousand dollars.Why would anyone use Citi?

name: David Yansen
review: It's probably a good card. I Applied because wallethub said I had a good chance. I figured I could use the bonus and use the card for gas. They said processing 7-10 days. To me that means denied.........

name: Tony Petkaitis
review: Home Depot credit card operations are run by thieves.  I made a $1180 payment on my Home Depot account on line but it inadvertently was sent to a closed account (not my account). Home Depot accepted the money to a closed account and now refuses to return the funds. And won't even transfer funds to the correct account. THIEVES. Do not open a credit card with Home Depot.

name: Zach Allen
review: HORRIBLE. I have been a good member for 8 years and I would like to say that I am a modeled citizen if that matters. I was randomly unauthorized to use my best buy credit card in the store in Dec. 2018 and called to find out why. I was told that my account was shut down and terminated due to not using the account in the past ten months and that I also had a late payment in the history of my billing. The two items gave them the idea to terminate my account which they had the right to do under the stipulations of the CC agreement whether I like it or not. Customer service told me that they sent a letter in the mail in regards to my account shutting down and that my letter was returned to sender due to address issues. I was never notified of this account shutting off. They did not take any other action and shut it down. I asked why they didn't try emailing me with the email they send my monthly card statements to, or even a phone call to my cell listed on my account. The representative told me that they weren’t even required to send a letter and they can at any time shut down an account without notification. This representative did not care. I maintained a zero balance and was ready to use it again and was recommended to never shut down an account to help avoid credit problems. Customer service said that if I wanted to, they would be happy to help me apply for a new credit card and go through the credit check process because there was nothing they could do about the terminated account. Im disgusted with Best Buy’s credit card services and their lack of care. I will be strongly spreading my horrible experience with everyone via internet and in person and will discourage all to avoid the Best Buy Credit Card at all costs.

name: rfs_1
review: won't recommend I have dispute about a charge, they said there was nothing they can do because I didn't send it back told them I couldn't send back because all the writing on package is in Chinese I believe the site I ordered them from was a scam but they don't care so I  turned it  over to attorney general's office

name: mwinger2512
review: The customer service sucks, Costco needs to go back to Am Ex. You can give me all kinds of perks but customer service is what matters. Citi is more concerned for the merchant than the consumer when you have a dispute.

name: kathryn_f_payne
review: Terrible customer service and constant mistakes on their part.  My card was compromised and told that my card was going to be overnighted...took over a week for my card to arrive.  When I called customer service and FINALLY got to a manager, told there was nothing they could do, and it happens... along with being SUPER rude and belittling.  Another time I was charged interest when I had paid off my balance in full, the list goes on.  The cash back is nice, but there are other cards that are more reliable!

name: Charles Tilley
review:
The interest you're speaking of you had to pay may have been the 'trailing interest' buried in fine print, although AMEX reminds customers of this on every bill. So yes there's the possibility one can still owe interest after paying in full. However, it depends on the starting balance for the billing period. If no balance was owed, then there should be no extra interest, on the other hand, no matter how slight of a balance owed, one can get hit with this charge. Actually this was the first time I've heard of it & only because it's published on AMEX's monthly statement. Am sure other credit card issuers has a similar policy, could be named different.

Hope this explains the matter.

name: hjdewan
review: Used Best Buy Credit card to make some big purchases and then immediately paid the whole balance of card off on time. Then was charged a late fee which they removed but are still charging me a finance fee. Which is like theft since the full balance was paid off on time. Seems like a scam that they are slow to process payments and then hit customers with fraudulent charges. Nice work Best Buy you managed to loose a customer with excellent credit and who loves electronics over $ 11.52.

name: doris wilcox
review: i love wayfair.the prices are fair and the things i have ordered came super fast.i will order from wayfair again.keep up the great work.oh and by the way i ordered an over the range microwave.it looks great.

name: anonymous_aol
review: We received a call from a Citibank representative requesting payment for a bill.  Following a series of haranguing, blatantly racially insensitive remarks about the pronunciation of our name and how we were not the "cultural types" of customers Citibank usually deals with based on our last name, we asked to be transferred to another representative so we could substantiate our bill and the deactivation of our cards.  The insensitive individual persistently refused to transfer us and finally pushed us off with a comment, "We will come after you and keep on you!!!"The next two representatives were no better than the first character, as they too continued the haranguing attitude, going so far as to refuse answering our billing questions with rogue responses such as "Why are you calling us?  What is your reason for calling us? We don't get it.  Why are you calling?"  Actually, we were the ones who received the call from citibank and we wanted answers to our bill and why citi suddenly deactivated our cards for no rational reason (We should have foreseen citibank's messy accounting and operations when we first encountered its horrid, shambled website: The website fails in both user-interface design and proper functionality when trying to view or pay bills).We were customers for close to five years if not more with overall good payment history.  This crudely operating company suddenly and without notice left us stranded when we tried to use our cards to pay for groceries and gas.  There is even graver concern that this company endorses, i.e. hires and retains, apparently hordes of associates who resort to threats and racially targeted attacks against consumers.We are staying with a more viable financial institution with whom we've had relations going on several decades; we have terminated any and all relations with citibank.  Unfortunately, citibank continues its haranguing calls to our number, resorting to ploys such as calling from a random rotation of telephone numbers at its disposal.  We have filed proper complaints with various agencies to address citi's thug behavior.

name: felizvinln
review: Application process was easy enough. But what a joke of a customer service. My card got lost and I ordered a new one, new one still didn’t arrive. I called customer service to make sure I didn’t have any amount due since it’s been a month, and I would need my account number to log in online and pay. Customer service informs me I didn’t have anything due until the next month since I haven’t received my replacement card. I receive a call a week later from billing informing me of a late fee and a past due payment. My suggestion is always get the customer service ID of the person you’re verifying all of your information to. It seems like they will set you up for failure.

name: elvisbarrios1990
review: I am going to start of with since when does a credit card provider not mail out a letter stating that if your account continues inactive for a given grace period your credit card will me immediately canceled. Now this happened to me and only reason I found out was I saw a notification from Credit Karma stating if I had closed an account. Most if not all credit cards and Loans I’ve had it in the past have always sent out a letter if not contacted me personally stating any changes towards my account/loan/promotions. The only communication I received from Best Buy was a suppose email that is no where to be found under my mail box and their type of communication was to say your credit card is now closed. Personally don’t care for the credit card now a days as it was a hassle when I was first starting to gather good credit but what I do care for now is that will show my credit report a closed account with only < 4 years of borrowers credit history. This is what gets me very unhappy to know that no type of communication was made prior and only solution is for the customer to apply again for a credit card. For this main reason I give bestbuy citi credit card a one star but would be more than happy to give it a ZERO Star rating, don’t care what your income/Dept ratio is, don’t communicate with any changes to credit card, had to call at times to clarify payments that were maid under my checking account yet Citi/BestBuy would be trying to charge penalty fees for a proper payment made before deadline and much more they’ve done me dirty for.

name: markgaviganstuff
review: I called today to detail that I did not receive my Costco Reward with Citibank. It was for the amount of $213.03. I called Citibank twice on this issue. Once before then the last time was November 6th, 2018 stating that I didn't receive my reward. They said they mailed it. I stated that we did not receive it. They said that because it was past the December 31st cut off date that they would not be able to reissue that to me. I spoke to 2 supervisors. The last one was McKenzie in Kentucky, as she said she could not give out her last name. I stated that I did not know that the 31st was the cut off date, otherwise I would have called earlier. After I receive my 2019 "reward" from Citibank, I will be no longer working with Citibank and will choose another Credit Card company to do business with. Very disappointed at the customer care and concern from this company.

name: leebeed
review: This card is terrible. A limit of five payments you can make in a billing cycle. Never heard of such a thing and this is a scam. Prevent you from paying off your card so that they can continue to rack up interest charges. When I inquired about it, I was told by customer service that it was to prevent fraud. As if there is a fairy going around paying off people’s credit card bills. I wish! I have also spent at least $2000 and have seen no Bean Bucks. The old system with the Barclays Visa was much faster and I could use my rewards quicker. As soon as they will let me pay off my credit card, I will be closing my account. This is a total scam. Bean will lose some loyal customers over this card debacle. Also it is very hard to reach their customer service people. Had to give my ssn twice and go through a long menu for an option to speak to someone. People don’t have time for this kind of BS.

name: thecountofmontecristo83
review: Surprise Credit Limit Reduction for the Holidays.Cardmember since 2015. I made a $1,000 payment three days ago. Today I received an email that my credit line has been reduced by $1,000. I called to see WTF? They told me to call back in a month to review my account. If I had planned any purchases, that could have ruined the holiday. The website is also pretty buggy. I tried raising the issue to customer service twice, once in March and once in April. 30 minute calls each. They made no effort to fix or escalate.They should spend less on bicycles and more on customer service.

name: jodis_17
review: If you were late, I could understand that.  Were you?

name: Sumitra Tyagi
review: I have CITI NRO account for a while. I transferred money to buy property in India in 2010. JP/JIL/JAL Builder did a fraud and did not deliver the property. So I transferred the rights to another buyer in India with the builder. Here is the nightmare started with citi bank. I want to transfer the money back to US on Nov 30th 2018. Citi asked me to provide a registry deed of the property where as the property is not even delivered by the builder (expected to be delivered in 3 months) . I have nothing to do with registry. It was a simple transfer of rights at the builder. I provided the following to prove the source of my funds to citi bank. Notarized sale agreement, Stamp duty was paid by the new buyer, NOC from builder for transfer with new assignee, my lower TDS deduction certificate from Income Tax department, 1% TDS deduction certificate from the buyer which clearly indicate in Citi account that money came from the buyer. I also provided citi bank issued FICR certificate that this money originally came from US in 2010-11. I want to transfer this money on 30th November 2018 when USD was 69.74 and now it is 72.43. And I am still waiting from citi bank. I asked Citi a written statement that the documents I provided are not sufficient to transfer the money so that I can sue them for harassment and loss on conversion rate.  I wrote to citi customer service head, its being 3 business day, they did not reply to the email forget about calling. I am very disappointing with the inefficiency of staff and lack of knowledge on repatriation process. I hope this feedback will help people in my situation. Be aware that citi can hold your money for few weeks/months and you will be stuck.

name: Teee Deee
review: The 2% on Citi's card is nice, but customer service is pretty weak. Well, insulting. When you have a question that the automaton can't find an answer to in the script binder, they suggest a manager call you back within 48 hours. I'm not joking. You see, all of the customer service managers are in meeting each time you call. Fancy that. So very busy. They'll perhaps ring you if available on their own timeline, say, in about two days.

name: jawrkasperski
review: I was about to apply for this card, but after reading these comments, I checked my records from 4 years ago...I used to have a Citi Bank Card, and will NEVER use them again.  Someone sent me something I did not order and they told me I had to PAY to send it back in order to dismiss the charge.  Customer Service is only for the Vendors. I would give it a zero if I could.  ended up challenging the charge, then cancelling the card. I also have an excellent credit rating and pay my bill in full every month, still no service.

name: Robert Stong
review: I agree, Citi's customer-no-service is the worst!

name: Ron DE'IA
review: Customer Service is the worst I've ever experienced in over 20 years. My MasterCard was compromised on Nov. 19, 2018 and I received a call from Citi's fraud dept. I informed them I did not make the changes and they cancelled the card and said a new card would be sent over night. Today is Nov. 27th and after 5 calls to Citi customer service and speaking to a supervisor/manager and each time promised the replacement card would be sent overnight, the card never came. Every time i ask for a tracking number the supervisor informs me once they receive the tracking number they will email me. Thant never happened. Each supervisor has lied to me and know I am forced to cancel the card. DON'T ever apply for a Citi credit card!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I would give them ZERO stars if that was an option.

name: jd willie
review: I have used Shell and Chevron gas credit cards for over 50 years. Last year. Chevron changed banks and doing business with them became a living nightmare. This year, Shell changed everything also. This week, we moved so we called Shell for an address change. The  customer service person's English was so bad we couldn't understand him. He wanted my password, which I have never been given one. He then wanted my SS#, so I gave it to him. He then wanted my banking # and information, which I refused to give. I'm done with Shall. A 50 Yr. customer means nothing to them.

name: Lisa R
review: I received a pre approval offer in the mail so I figured let me see if I get approved since they offer the 0% as the promo on the card.  I thought for sure i would get declined since I heard citi can be tough to get approved for. To my surprise I was instantly approved for $14,500.!!! My credit score is 745. I would say if you have God credit definitely apply!!!

name: Brittney Boyd
review: This company stole my deposit, never sent me a card and never refunded my deposit. I called customer service 7 times over the course of 2 and a half months and they couldn't resolve the issue. They are thieves and they are rude.

name: Genevieve Solace
review: I’ve spent $20k in 6 months on the Costco Citibank card. When a tint shop damaged my new 2018 BMW and who’s tint job was poorly done, full of bubbles, and didn’t cover the whole window, I opened a dispute with Citibank for the $700 charge. They ultimately, after giving up the runaround for over a month, denied the dispute and sided with the tint shop. Their reasoning? The did the job so they deserve to be paid. Unbelievable. I will take my business elsewhere.

name: Amy F
review: After applying for the card, I waited nearly a month to receive it. Never got it, called them up, said they would cancel the first card (that I never got) and issue me a new one. They said they couldn't expedite it, it had to be sent through regular US mail, and I would have to wait 7-10 business days. Well after 3 weeks of waiting again, I never got it. Called them up, said they could cancel the second card and issue me a third new one through regular mail. Couldn't expedite it or track it. I said forget it. Taking my business elsewhere where I can actually receive my credit card to use.

name: Devlin English
review: Paid it off .... Citi doesn't Report that to TRANSUNION... They don't Report Balances Under $125.00.... But be a DOLLAR OVER and See how fast they Report That BS.... It's a A$$ CLOWN GAME.... In The Dresser Until they "Get Right"....

name: Adam Young
review: What a waste of time......I was purchasing a fridge online and saw a banner for $100 off a purchase of $1000 or more if I open a Home Depot credit card. The banner disappeared but I proceeded to open a card. Note that I have a household income over $150,000 and 700+ credit, but the credit limit I was given was $500, only $2,000 short of the fridge transaction. So now I have a credit inquiry and new card with a limit insufficient to purchase the fridge or get the $100 off. To make matters worse the transaction went through on an insufficient credit card oddly and when I called they said that the website had accepted the order but it was rejected on their end, yet I received no email that it was cancelled, I only found out after calling the credit card company (CITI) whom told me to call the store, whom told me to call the credit card company back. Turns out CITI was able to raise my credit limit over the phone, but I had to re-order the fridge and set-up deliver again. Ordered it a second time, it was delivered, then I got my first statement, no $100 off......Called them and they said it was because I did not enter a promo code, funny because I was not given a promo code, on e was not present on the banner, and when I called to increase the credit limit to even be able to order it, they said it would be on the statement. Well they did push the $100 off through and it showed on my 2nd statement, so I can't call it a scam, but it was painful and time wasting to accomplish. Next time I will use my Capital One card with 1.5% cash back and take the $37 and save the hassle. Now I paid off the card and am trying to close the damn thing, nothing online on the home, customer service is closed, so I guess I get to call them yet again tomorrow.

review: We've liked having the Citi card through Costco, but would much prefer to have it go back to Costco AMEX partnership. So, due to inactivity for only 1 MONTH and a lowering of my credit score due to repayment in full of two other accounts, my Sears account was closed without inquiry or pre-notification. Citi Bank, especially with this Sears card, is a terrible company to work with as a customer, and as soon as you pay them back they will remove your account as fast as possible. DO NOT GET THIS CARD!! Get approved for a Discover or Chase card and put all Sears purchases on one of those if you purchase something. Don't waste your time with Citi Bank through Sears.

review: I am spending countless hours banging my head against a wall trying to get Citibank to resolve 3 disputes.  They continuously give me incorrect information, and are incapable of crediting back customer accounts after disputes are found in the customer’s favor.  I was told over the phone that one dispute was found in my favor, then Citibank sent me emails telling me it was still open.  Another dispute was found in my favor, I was told I would be credited in two days, and it’s been over two months and I still have not received the credit.  A third dispute I was promised I would receive a call from Citibank asking for my documentation, but I never received any phone calls since the promised date.  I have called Citibank’s President’s Office and spoke with Tessha Taylor, 605-731-3627, who told me she would help me resolve my dispute problems and call me back, which she never did.  I followed up with several voice mails to Ms. Taylor, none of which were answered back.  I then sent multiple emails to Citibank (executive.response.unit@citi.com), none of which have been returned.  I am now going to The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency - United States Department of the Treasury, and also to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, for help, since Citibank is apparently incapable of managing customer disputes, and whose President’s Office NEVER returns phone calls or emails.  As soon as these three disputes are resolved I am moving all my Citibank and Citicard accounts to Chase Bank.  Enough is enough already.

review: The credit card has great perks for LL Bean customers, which was why I got one in the first place. However, I am VERY GLAD that LL Bean is dropping Barclay's credit card. I used Barclay's website to pay the balance of my credit card every month. On my most recent bill, I had an overdue notice and a late fee! I couldn't understand why since everything looked good with the automatic payments. I called Barclay's customer service and was told that automatic payments automatically STOP after 12 months!! I never received a notice that this was going to happen! OK, I paid the $27 late fee, despite knowing that the late payment was not my fault. What really made me mad was when the customer representative told me that the late payment would be reported to the credit bureaus! It is their policy to report payments greater than 30 days to the credit bureaus! I made the payment as soon as I learned of the problem but still will have my credit score dinged! Moral of the story is -- do NOT use Barclays and if you have to use them, don't use their automatic payments! Thank you LL Bean for changing financial institutions for your credit card!

name: Brian Herzog
review: Do NOT use Citi they will let you get screwed over if you ever open a dispute with them. I lost almost $200 because of gift card fraud and the sided with the company selling the fake cards. I even talked to a manager and he basically so too bad oh well.

name: Mohaimenul Hoqe
review: If there is a negative rating available, they deserve a -10. After promising their promotional offer, which is 'if you purchase for $1000.00, you'll receive a $100.00 off on your 1st statement, which is a gimmick. Just used my credit to make it go down after opening account with them is really frustrating. They have never applied it to my balance and after several calls(each customer service rep assured me to give the credit on next statement) finally they say they  didn't see this kind of promotion on the day I opened the account. My message to everybody DON'T FALL FOR THEIR PROMOTIONAL OFFERS.

name: redagalal2002
review: The worst credit card and worst customer services that I ever seen in my entire life. I'm warning you, do not even try to have the Good Year credit card. I had a balance of $43, they never contacted me by mail, email or phone, to remind me to pay that balance, all what they did, they reported that to the credit bureau and destroyed my credit history. I field a dispute to the credit Bureau and I told them I never been contacted by Good Year credit card to remind me about that balance, but as you all know, the credit bureau all the time is in the side of the credit card company. They did not believe me. The credit card company did not show any proof that they contacted me regarding to the $43. I am warning you to open a credit card with them. I stopped any business with the Good Year.

name: flacplnj
review: Isn't it your responsibility to keep track of your debt?

name: Lori Zubrod
review: I was charged a late fee with my simplicity card, no no late fees ever that I have been hearing about is not true. They tell you when you call of course this is the best card ever and no late fees ever. They waived fees for me in the past and no longer will. They said I have an old simplicity card and my card does not have the no late fees ever attached to it like the new accounts. Even after being told this by many service reps that no late fee ever. So you learn the hard way sometime-it is in the fine print even if what you have been told verbally is off. They call it a \"glitch\" ....

name: crys to
review: This card is garbage for travelers. The reason isn't due to American Airlines, but rather their partner, Citi. Citi is incredibly inconvenient if you are planning to travel and actually use the card internationally. Even if you notify Citi that you are travelling, even though they e-mail you acknowledging this, they will freeze your card. And they won\'t give it back to you. Why? Because the only way those dummies know how to verify a card is via sending you a letter like we live in the 1800s. Then you have to call them and tell them the code you received in the mail. Well, what good does that do if you are abroad? None. Not to mention the fact you need to call them for this. This phone call will be incredibly expensive if you are overseas. I paid $20 for one 20 minute call. These guys don't allow the possibility of emails. This is a trash card because of its inconvenience due to Citi bank. My card has now been frozen a second time. For what? Logging in to my account using the correct password. I am certain of it. If you're travelling, I highly recommend finding a card that does not use Citi. If you plan to rely on a Citi card abroad, you will be screwed.

name: John
review: Terrible experience. Gave me an insultingly low credit limit of $3000, based on incorrect TransUnion data, when I was just approved for a Discover with a $15000 limit.Even when I had the issue corrected, they told me that I'd have to apply for an increase, which would involve taking another hit on my credit score. I was told I'd have a response in 24 hours. Four days later, I called them to find out what the problem was, only to be told that I would have a response in another 24 hours.Three days after that, I called to find out what the hell was going on. First, they couldn't find a record of my application, despite me having talked to someone there a whole two days before. After 10 minutes on the phone, I was told they'd launch some useless investigation and send me a letter. In the meantime, they already posted the useless account to TransUnion, which lowered my score by about 25 points, so even if they were to get their shit together and process the limit increase now, it'd likely get denied because their own damn card pushed my score into a lower bracket.So, now I took a hit to my credit report for a credit card I have no use for. Thanks a lot Citi, I will never do business with you ever again, and I will make sure to tell everyone I know that you're incompetent.Never ever had issues like this with BofA, Chase, and Amex - get one of their cards instead!

name: Samantha C
review: I wish there was an option for zero stars.I\'ve had this card since 2011, and service used to be top notch - then started the decline a couple years ago...This past January (2018) I authorized a phone prompt payment on January 7th, with the funds ($600) being removed from my account on January 10th. I then call in to make another payment a little later in the month (I\'ve been making payments via phone, from the same bank account for easily the past three years), with the call prompt customer service line telling me I have a late payment and returned check fee? I get a hold of a person, and they tell me they were unable to locate my account, and that is why my payment was returned. So I ask, why if it was returned, did Citi Cards take $600 from my bank account??? They then make some excuse about the difficulty coming from my account being a savings and not a checking account, and they don\'t allow payment authorizations from savings accounts. So I have to have them go back into my records to realize that I\'ve been paying by said authorizations, using the same savings account for the past three years. By my third time calling customer service, I get a supervisor that seems to know a bit more of what\'s going on. She tells me I\'m not the only person to be dealing with this situation, and they are trying to correct the same problem with people all over the country, due to a software system glitch that happened the day my payment was pulled from my account.Later phones calls have everyone else I talk to refusing to acknowledge this happened. Basically, they pulled money from my account, then proceeded to lose it somewhere in space (or issued it to the wrong account). It is now 4 months (almost 5 months) later, and they still refuse to return my money, or issue a credit to my account for what they have stolen. Over 17 calls later, 3 hours of my time on phone calls, 4 employee promises to call me back with updates (when not a soul has ever called me back), and my having to pay for priority shipping twice so far, to send on documents from my bank, showing the cashed check and transaction numbers for when the money was taken, etc.  They still do nothing. They had me in contact with a Payment Investigations Department for a while, that seemed to be getting some sort of headway. But the number they gave me has now been disconnected, and the department dissolved. You now have to explain your entire situation in full, every time you call and talk to yet another incompetent customer service \"specialist\" that makes empty promises just to get you off the line. One of the last times I called, they refused to even forward me to a supervisor. It\'s ridiculous that they have stolen from me, and refuse to correct it. If a Citi Reputation Manager reads this, I will be writing similar reviews on every platform I can find until my $600 is returned and this situation is over with. If you\'re curious, this is Samantha C. with card number ending in 8817. Look it up.If you\'ve read this far readers, the point is - don\'t get a card from these people. I\'ve had a Chase card for years and they\'re amazing.

name: Nem  L
review: Sorry that happened to u, but Citi could care less about a few 1-star reviews.. they have bigger problems to worry about...  Like finding your 600 dollars in space!!!! COME ON CITI!!!!

name: Nat Mo
review: You would think with a reputable name like Citi they would be on top of their game to assist their customers, but Citi likes to play the game of ‘Keep their Funds’. Had a rental car used my Citi card to secure it and place the deposit, mind you it was not an actual charge, just a hold! I returned the rental paid for the car with my debit card from a TOTALLY different banking institution and here it is 10 days later and the hold from the rental car is still pending on my Citi card! Citi is the worst when it comes to this! Called their customer service and they like to give you the run around, some people are willing to assist and some just say oh no , it take up to a month, A MONTH FOR WHAT, to release pending charges! That’s BS!!! Never had this problem with my Capital One card, unfortunately, I’m in the hole with them and not able to use at this time, but as soon as I’m able to bring them back up, I’ll be going back to Capital One! Get it together Citi, you are playing with people’s livelihood!!

name: 338spear
review: Card and benefits are good, but customer service is horrible. If you have an issue and need to call in, it’s game over. Can’t provide any answers, and no action taken to improve issues. Sad. Have been a Costco member for years and was hoping this would be better. Wasted time switching to this card.

name: jkmdaniel
review: Have had the  BBY credit card since 2012.  They closed my account due to inactivity and refused to reopen it.  I was never late on a payment and had made major purchases there in the past.  The last purchase was in 2016 when I purchased my iphone.  BBY has lost my business for major purchases in the future.  It caused my credit to drop 7 points.

name: William Hovis
review: Applied for credit 2 weeks ago (score is 728 and I have a Citi card that their credit card is based on). Not approved for (get this) \"Too Many Credit Inquiries\". How about ONE inquiry in a year. Went elsewhere and spent $3k on a tv that was cheaper too. Oh, and yes I used My Own Citi card! Can you say........ Amazon!!

name: Still Learning
review: Have had this card for nearly 10yrs. and used it sporadically. During first 2 yrs CL was 500 so not much use could I do with it. Then I requested a CLI which required a HP on credit report to 4.5k, granted so  I was able to use the card more but Lowes is easier to get increases (SP) and I have a generous CL with them so I don\'t use this one as much even though I had it b4 Lowes.
