This difference compared to Lowe\'s is why I took off a star..They could make it easier for customers who pay well to be able to have more shopping power. As far as the card and paying, charging,or anything I haven\'t had any problems with it.

name: Still Learning
review: Have had this card for 2 yrs and no problems arose yet ,,,Like the price rewind feature, Though obviously not perfect,,I agree with user that we shouldn't have to take another inquiry to get a higher limit why not just use same report you did to approve me..

name: Still Learning
review: Have had no problems w/ Citi DC card or the previous Simplicity I had...Like earning the 2% on DC. Anytime I had a question I've used the chat feature and that went nice and smooth....I also have a Macy account that uses the CitiRetail pages like MyBestBuy and I've seen some financial software have problems with syncing those accounts but as far as working with them myself I haven't had any yet...

name: R Meng
review: Our primary business account was closed without proper notification, which caused us delaying the payroll through this account.The worst case is that they held our funds for 3 weeks, nobody in the their branch or back office knows where our monty is.After our account was re-opened, they kept sending us the urgent notes request information which was NOT necessary per their representative.It's very frustrating and they are NOT helpful to the small business like us but stopping our routine work. DO NOT bank with Citibank!

name: williamsmelissa1994
review: Easy to apply- same day purchase, but I have had mainly frustration working with them. I got the card in order to purchase a laptop with 0% interest for 12 months. On track to pay it off in 12 months, no problem. 9 months in and I keep making telephone payments and their phone system keeps telling me they were unable to process payments- so I get charged late fees. Couldn't pay for 3 months without contacting an "account specialist". I finally get them to take some of the fees off. Then, a few months ago I paid off the rest of the amount- no problem, they say. My account is clear and fine! No bills for 2 months and then all of the sudden I get a bill for $5.00- $3.00 charge and $2.00 late fee, even though I haven't even used the card. I called them up and nobody seems to know why this charge is on here, because my card doesn't have service charges. They take them off and I close my account within 15 minutes. Customer service is really nice and competent but whatever billing system they use is absolutely not worth it. My credit score has taken more hits from this card than I care to admit, strictly for that reason.

name: kelding1
review: DO NOT HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH THIS COMPANY!! They do not honor what they say. I was told by 3 people I would get a call back And did not. I was told I would get 60k miles and guess what...they did not give them. Switch to another travel card with another company. You will be SO much more happy!!!

name: ToniAnn Drenckhahn
review: I went to go make an airline ticket purchase and was declined immediately due to them flagging it as frad. After clearing it up via a confirmation text i went to make the purchase again and the ticket price rose. In calling Citi to see if there was anything they can do (considering they do something similar for Price Rewind) I talked to a bunch of people who were uninterested in helping me, and instead more interested in sending me off to someone else who (shocker) couldnt help me either, and the cycle continues. Dont ever plan on using this card for anything over $1 now because who knows, it could get declined and Im stuck paying the price for it. How convenient. Their service sucks and its disappointing. Fraud protection can be done right. My Capital One card has flagged me before and rather than declining, they allow the charge to pend while the clear it up with me so I dont get stuck with a useless card, nor do i get stuck with a fraudulent charge.

name: Ayrn
review: When shopping for airline tickets always use a private browser! You’ll notice that the prices won’t change because that can’t track which IP address is visiting the site multiple times!

name: nhzgroup
review: Based on the law, no credit company can discriminate applicants based on the country of origin !They did that to me! they sent me pre-qualified mail and when I applied they reject based on my country of origin!

name: darryl_gale1
review: There are some good and bad things about Citi secured card... It will help you build your credit score. But it can take from 1 to 2 weeks to see your available change when you make a payment. I made a deposit of $600, used the card to rent a car, the cost was $220. I paid the amount in full, it took almost 10 days before I saw my available credit for purchase change from $380 to $600. I was told that my bank has to release the funds. This is not true because the money from my bank is always released the same or next day. If you need a card that will build your score and it doesn't take 2 weeks for your available credit for purchase to change, go with Capital One or USAA. USAA will put your money into a CD so that it will build interest (not much). You can start of with $200 and add money to it as often as you like. I started mine off at $300, it is now at $1000. The day I add the money, is the same day my available credit goes up. There is NO waiting

name: Lori Parker
review: Don't fall for Thank you points.  For every $2500.00 you spend you get back $25.00.  If that isn't paltry enough, try using them to book a hotel.  You "use" your points and then, on top of that, you pay more in dollars than you would if you just booked on line.  I know.

name: laguera_nyc
review: I closed my account years ago. I get a letter today saying they closed my account because they claim I have poor credit which I don’t. I haven’t used this card in years and I thought the account was closed. Not only did somebody not do their job by not closing my account, they then send me an insulting letter acting like they are the ones that don’t want me as a customer when I don’t want them as a credit card. The interest rates are way too high, it’s just a crap card.

name: Dark Water
review: What A Joke. Definitely LISTEN to the reviews posted here. Citi is a joke. My credit score is 720s, make over $125,000/year with no rent or house payment. And they approved me for a credit line of $3,000!!!! Don't waste your hard inquiry on your credit. Not only that but the card says "the variable APR will be 15.24% - 25.24%, based on your creditworthiness.1" Can you guess what my rate was?!?!?! Yep.. 25.24% What a crock of crooked dunny.

name: Travis McFarland
review: They might open an account for you, then not let you actually use it. I was ineligible for instant approval when a ~750 FICO, then after a few days I got my approval notice. I received my cards in the mail, then when I tried to activate them the web page said there was an internal error and that I should try back later. After sometime I called and found that they claim the fraud department noticed a discrepancy with my account and that I needed to send a form in. Nearing the 3rd statement (the account is opened and unusable this whole time)  they left a voicemail asking me to call them back. I was informed that they sent the wrong form (nearly 2 months after getting it back) and I would be getting something different.Also, no one on any of their teams speaks English as a first language and most can barely speak it at all. If you are one of the people who want to be able to understand people taking to you about your financials, this is not the company for you.TLDR: you will get a credit inquiry and an account you cannot use.Should be 0 stars.

name: becky_charlton2
review: The promotional purchases are never right.  Each requires contacting customer service.  The customer service reps make you agree AGAIN to the contract that you already signed before they will help you.  When you order online, home depot ships the items separately and charges the card with each shipment.  This means at least 20 minutes with a customer service rep getting the items transferred to the correct promotion.  This is EVERY online order with multiple items.

name: acollinsdal
review: The card is good, but you dealing with Citi.  I applied, was approved for a limit about 1/3 of what my discover and BofA are, half of Chase and just over half of another Citi card,,they said don't worry, get an increase when you get the card, but they wanted to do another hard pull on my credit report (less than a week after the hard pull for the application,,I am cancelling Costco membership and will not accept terms (the account will disappear since it was never activated)..CITI IS HORRIBLE TO DEAL WITH, credit supervisor even said "the credit system is really messed up"

name: Yeah Boy
review:
They do soft pulls when determining whether to increase your limit. You got it for less than a week and you already wanted to increase your limit? That is not how it works. You need to use the card and pay it off to increase your trustworthiness.

You are being unreasonable by expecting a brand new credit card that you just applied for to have the same credit limit as ones you have had for a long time.

The card is designed to make purchases at Costco, not for you to show off your credit limit with (which isn't actually a benefit and I don't understand why the likes of you are obsessed with that).

This is the best credit card available unless you travel multiple times a week, every week (in which case travel miles cards are better).

name: len_daws
review: I made a 12month interest free purchase back on June of 2014 and each month Best Buy continues to bill me interest on a 12month no interest purchase. I call the issue in each month. I speak to a representative who indicates that they fixed the issues, and a month later I am back paying interest again on my interest purchase. How many other people realize that they are being scammed?

name: Lindsey Blalock
review: These people should be sued!

name: ericaleigh81
review: I got a best buy store card thinking I could get a decent laptop and pay it off over time. I got socked with a $165 interest fee that they will not remove. The "deals" are a joke- the'll get more than the original price once they hit you with the interest payments. -- Don't bother, unless you want to just give them your money. I'm closing out my card ASAP!

name: dgarlon
review: If the item is on an interest free promotional the full balance must be paid before the time expires if not you get charged the full amount of the interest from the date of purchase.

name: lovecat_lucy
review: card was closed and lost all the point without notification to me, said from their rep bank decided to close my card and mailed me an letter which never received. (wonder why?) Card still open in online banking and showing active in account, just no points left. customer services will do nothing about it and I have to take all the loss of my points because they decided it and never let me know or showed in my account. don't use, there are cards much better than this

name: Kenneth Anderson
review: I enjoy cards with apps that show your account activity so you can be on top of any fraud. If this has one I haven't found it yet. Can I use it to shop Staples online?I really can't tell......I make payments timely so the finance is great.  The rewards are whatever really. If you shop Staples why not? But really....not a real incentive.

name: Kristina McCampbell
review: Unfortunately the great cash back rewards has not made up for Citibank's horrible service. They are constantly marking random charges as fraud (only been accurate one time) and talking to someone is like pulling teeth. I once had to call them while in the middle of an airport and when I specifically stated I was in a crowded place and was not comfortable answering my security question, the representative stated there was no other way to verify my account and demanded the answer. The most recent issue, the chip malfunctioned and stopped working. I contacted Citi who's only response was to issue a new card/same information. That new card came and to my surprise, I had a new Costco membership photo. That photo was of a completely different person! Their response, it has to be on Costco's end.... Really wishing Costco could have gone with a different financial institution with better service...

name: Yeah Boy
review:
LOL so it's their fault you are calling from a crowded place? Go to a quieter place. What if I had called and said I needed them to allow me to use YOUR credit card and I was not going to answer the security question. Are you saying they should let me do that?

Their only response to a broken chip is to give you another card, which they fedexed you overnight at their expense. How is that not a good response? What else did you want them to do? You are the one who broke the chip...

name: gopmitra
review: Worst card. Citi Card plays game to squeeze late payment and interest charges without sending statement on time and will not send you digital copy of the statement. Do not trust Citi Card marketed by NTB. I had real bad experience and they start chasing you money without sending the statement. Avoid going for this card.

name: Anonymous Anonymous
review: Long review but worth the read if you are considering this card:  I applied for this card after I had about $500 of work done on my car.  My Goodyear advocated it, stating that if I signed up, I'd have 6 months with 0% interest.  I chose the card because of this so I had plenty of time to pay it off.  I went to make my first payment (minimum of $27) and confirmed I only wanted to pay $27.  The agent mistakenly selected for me to pay the entire amount, causing my bank account to go into a negative balance.  (The company admitted this mistake).   The agent transferred me to her manager, who transferred me to an executive manager, who told me it can take 3-5 days (or sometimes up to 7 days) for an issue to be resolved.  This meant I now had negative money, will face fees from my bank, and had NO money in my account to pay my other bills, or buy essentials like food and gas.  I am on disability, so of course I manage my money very carefully, as it is limited.  And they had no other advice, other than "we are sorry for the inconvenience and will work to return your money as soon as possible."  I was on the phone with them for nearly an hour, hoping they can somehow reverse this massive error, and because of this, I also missed out on plans I had that day.  Not only that, but I had to embarrassingly borrow money to get my bank account out of the negative so I would not face penalties from my bank.  I thankfully received my money back 2 days later.  On the initial call, there was no offer from the company to compensate me in any way (aside from they will cover any bank fees, though that would involve MORE time to fax them info and prove that I incurred fees), so I asked for them to compensate my bill to make the situation right.  After waiting 2 days with no answer, I called back and was told I would receive a $50 credit, and the manager believed that was “fair” considering they returned my money in 2 days.  While I am glad for any support and appreciate that they worked to return my money quicker than the original quoted timeframe, I have to say I disagree.  Due to this MASSIVE error that they admitted that took up much of my personal time, I still was without money in my checking account for 2 days, had to borrow money or else would face a penalty from my bank, missed out on the opportunity I had that day, and could not pay any of my other bills nor could I use my checking account to buy essentials like food and gas.  The MAJOR predicament they put me in was only worth $25 a day to them.  While there were a couple of people who were helpful and concerned, I overall would NOT recommend this card, as unfortunately I do not feel they made up for their massive error.  It would have been a small price for this giant corporation to pay out of customer service, and because of their mistake, I was the one who paid the price.  I will certainly inform my Goodyear and anyone interested in this card of this extremely disappointing experience.

name: Brandon Hoover
review: Its an ideal card all around great for people on the move and in a hurry get what you need without spending to much time its very handy to have never have to worry about running out of gas or getting a snack if its going to be a late night

name: lynnkroupa
review: I was in complete shock that I got approved. I have been trying to work on my credit and now I am even more inspired. Thank you Meijer! I have not used my card yet but I plan to use it for items I would buy anyway, things that are needed. This will be a great cushion to fall on especially as we get closer to Christmas. I really appreciate this!

name: yaricortez0711
review: I am a student who's laptop broke down in the middle of finals and needed a new laptop asap. My credit is fair, 630. I was told what to put in my income and my rent expenses because it would increase my chances of receiving the card by the Best Buy representative. He told me to input 650.00 as my rent when in reality I only pay 300.00. Also, my income stayed the same. I get the dreaded "Need further review on application". I received a letter, of course, stating that I was denied because "Total credit obligations when compared to total annual income you provided". I tried to call the "customer service" for the Manager of credit review and all I got was an automated service system with no option to talk to a real person. So unprofessional and terrible service.

name: Laura Noto
review: Hard pull from Exp. Approved by phone appl with 707 Exp score, but had to call back for approval after verifying rent amt. CL $2,400...very HAPPY. Card arrived in 10-14 days, bal trans done pretty quick right after getting card and requesting bal trans. I had Citi Dbl Cash card prior and in excellent standing w 0 bal. VERY PLEASANT EXPERIENCE!!! UPDATE:CITIBANK HAS BEEN GOOD, EXTREMELY GOOD TO ME NOW FOR A YEAR ON THIS CARD.

name: paola Villanueva
review: WORST CARD EVER!!!! interest rates are extremely high, their customer service department will not help you what so ever! they will transfer your lines to different people and no one will help you. i always did the 12 month financing and they still charge interest 25%. i always gave more than my minimum payments and my balance never went down. i never saw those payments reflected on my balance. i tried to do a settlement on my account to get rid of the card and they denied to.  DO NOT apply for this card their are better cards out their.

name: alexkansas15
review: This is the worst CC to get. Don't! Their customer service is always busy and you can't ever chat or email them. They have not been helpful after the associate at the Best Buy didn't ask me whether I wanted the 5% back or the 12 month free financing. I have tried multiple times to find out what's going on and I get nothing.

name: s_mahon
review: I immediately was approved for $500 with a credit score in the high 500 or low 600. I called and was bumped to $2,500, increased again 3 months I believe $1000. After having it around a year I moved and in the process missed 1 payment, the balance about$50. BOOM, reduced to $350 and almost doubled APR to 23%. Since my balance was $50 I did not have to pay it down. I really only made a purchase each month and paid it off to keep my CS up. I liked that I had a crutch to fall back on if needed in emergency with a low APR. I called and was told I had a delenquent payment on my credit history.   I was unaware of this and in the end it was removed. Here I am 2 years later still at $350 without a late payment. Every now and then I will call and ask for a increase and always rejected. It's silly, but it offended me and hurt my feelings because it was a legitimate mistake. But hey, it is what it is. SO, it was a great card until I messed up.Thanks a lot. I'm human and the problem on my CS was not valid. Great customer service.

name: dommalapatti_smruti
review: Worst credit card ever. Charges interest on everything even for the first 6 month period. Customer service wont give you complete information at the time of applying for a credit card. End of day they charge interests irrespective of anything, DO NOT EVER APPLY to this card its such a waste.

name: Jeffery Turnbow
review: Very difficult to pay the balance often so there is no interest. Citi held my payment for ten days making my credit score go down so now I have to call them and make debit card payments so they will post immediately.  And it's great you can earn money back on international purchases but why would I use this card when Capital One does nt charge an international transaction fee.

name: Tom F
review: After being a customer with 2 credit cards for years and paying on time more than minimum payment every single year, we got royally screwed. We made a balance transfer to our card on July 7. We asked when the due date normally was, July 13. So, the first due date for the balance transfer would have been August 13. We made a $450 payment, WAY over the minimum on July 15, but they would not count that towards the August 13th due date and assessed a $35 late fee and flagged us as late. I'd be fine if that was automatic, but they saw what happened and revoked the late fee. Instead, I was transferred 8 times, and put on hold 11 times, to finally have a "manager" tell me I'm the one who screwed up and paid during this July 13-17 payment no-man's land. Well, goodbye Citi, I'm sorry you don't care one bit about your customers. Going with some smaller bank or a company like discover.

name: rs4spitfire
review: If you have a lower credit score then this card is probably ok.  Since I have a good credit score I am questioning why I chose to open this card.  It has no rewards (being able to return stuff longer than 90 days is not a reward), a high interest rate (my interest rate is 26% on this card even with a 750+ score), and the intro interest rate they promise is "deferred" meaning that if you don't pay it in the time period they back charge all interest that would've been owed.  I have two cards that offer between 1 and 4% cash back, that have intro rates that don't charge back and have 12.99% rate or lower.  This card is crap and I will be closing it.

name: Leslie H
review: This account is a nightmare. Customer service is a joke. I was dinged a late payment for a payment that was received by them on the due date. To avoid additional issues I made the next payment well before the due date. Their response? Great the payment was applied to the last billing cycle so I owe another payment near the due date but not a second earlier. Paying it off and cutting it up.

name: Frank Kuo
review: Please think twice before applying for Hilton HHonors Reserve credit card. I paid my $95 membership fee last year and have spent more than $10,000 till my anniversary date this February. I cancelled my card late April. Citi said I would not qualify for the free night certificate because I was not a card holder when Citi was ready to dispense the certificates. It is just not fair and not right!

name: faferreira1979
review: Terrible customer service. Will never use it again. Not recommended. It's a shame that Home Depot have a card like that. Citibank can do better than that. They ask me 10 days to provide a letter documentation. Never offer to fax and said that's was the only way. They I call again and they said they could fax... but will take 3 hours. After all none came thru

name: elaine troyer
review: This credit card recently changed it's credit terms and there is no longer a grace period on purchases before interest begins accruing at the rate of  20.74%.  So this past month for $843.83 with no carry over balance, this was all new purchases, I paid $ 21.15 in interest charges.  This is highway robbery and I have cut up this card and will never use it again.  I would recommend that everyone who has this card to the same and that no one apply for this card.  Let's send this company a message that this is unacceptable for those of us with good credit who pay off our balances monthly.

name: Kassie Laffrey
review: I've had fraud 2 times inthe last 14 months. Their fraud department is absolutely incompetent and lack empathy. Worst experience. The lack of accountability and care tainted my overall view of citi bank, I would never recommend them.

name: Dee Ray
review: Closed my card because of inactivity for one year.  I had been a faithful cardholder for seven years paying on time or early ALWAYS, never a missed or late payment.  These folks did not notify me of this, I found out when I tried to use the card and it was denied.  What a bunch of a..holes.

name: John Wick
review: My credit card information was stolen they said it already went through. They said that i have made similar purchases. The similar purchase was made in new york. However i dont live in new york. So why would i have to pay. Not to mention the customer service lines suck they bounce you around to other reps hoping you quit and just pay. Worst credit card!

name: K
review: I purchased a fridge from sears in July 2016 that was suppose to be a promotional purchase no interest if paid in full by 12 months. I have my account set up for auto pay so I do not regularly look at it. The set up the payment amounts equally so it would pay off the promotional balance by 12 months. In December 2016, I was going thru the account and noticed I was being charged interest so I contacted customer care and they applied the promotion and credited the interest.I thought ok fine this was all taken care of but little did I know this was only the beginning of their scam! The promotional purchase expires October 2017 and I checked my account today July 2017 only to find out none of the payments from the last few months was not applied to the promotional balance and everything was being applied to my regular purchases I had made a few months earlier.I called customer service and was told I need to set up a payment allocation plan and that the payment is applied to regular purchase balance first unless I called them to allocate or set up the allocation plan. I have auto pay so I do not have to deal with this kind of stuff! I was never made aware of this and have never had to do this with any other credit cards I've used! They were able to allocate some of the recent payment but said it takes a billing cycle to update and I only have 2 months left to pay a larger balance than what I was expecting.My phone call further escalated to a manager and she proceed to tell me I've only been making my minimum payments on my master card which was why nothing was applied to the promotional balance. So I asked her what My sears MasterCard promotional beginning balance was and she stated it was $324 and proceed to tell me what I paid and said it was my fault for only paying minimum payment. She then tells me in March 2017 I paid $325. I had to stop her and asked her to explain why that amount wasn't allocated and my promo balance should've been paid off. (After speaking to her I remembered that I made the March payment assuming it would go towards the promo balance and be paid it off). She realized their error and allocated that payment to pay in full the promo balance for the MasterCard.As for my sears store card they were able to allocate the payments but what I had to go through to get this fixed was disgusting! This is definitely not an honest company and if I had not looked at my statement I would've probably been charged all the back interest on those promo balances.Now that I think back I have bought tires from them a few years back with a promo as well and was charged the back interest because the same thing probably happened and I just didn't pay close enough attention!If anyone is planning to do any promo purchases with sears make sure that's the only purchase on the card and check your statement very closely!

name: No Thank You
review: This card is great if you love getting patronized by their phone reps with "don't worry I understand" canned speeches followed by holding for supervisors who will tell you things that blatantly contradict what another supervisor later says, after you tried to do the thing the first supervisor said to do.  And do you love spending a day or two out of every month dealing with a hair trigger fraud department that will block your automated payments over nothing?  Requiring even more phone calls, even AFTER you responded to their security alert email that everything was ok and got a response screen in the browser that said ok you're good to go?  Then you may have low enough blood pressure to deal with this infuriating clown show.

name: Julio Cavalho
review: This card another funny business ( buy tickets with miles) round trip Washington DC to Punta Cana need 65.000 miles for me and my wife 130.000 I was short 30.000 the AAdvantage representative said I can buy those for $900 that means one round trip cost $1950.00  If not use the the miles I can buy for $550 round trip " Monkey Business "

name: Anonymous
review: 1 star  rating is over rated!  terrible bank! I use to be citgold, but there was forgery on my check and ciitbank did nothing about it! They let  the forgery happen with all my signature specimen with them and they let the thief go. DONT TRUST CITIBANK! they are THUGS!

name: Anonymous
review: A little background - I have an 800+ score on all 3 credit reports. I have 2 other major credit cards: Chase Sapphire Preferred and Bank of America Cash Rewards. I have a $13,000 credit limit with Chase and a $12,000 credit limit with Bank of America. I do not carry any debt on my cards.I was immediately approved for a $4,100 credit limit with Citi which was really disappointing. I called immediately to request a credit line increase and was told that I would need to wait a couple business days when the status of the card was transferred from an "application" to a "cardholder."I called back 2 days later and was told by a customer service representative, and then a manager, that in order to request a credit line increase they would need to pull my credit report again, placing another hard inquiry on my report, even though they did so for the application 2 days prior. I asked to speak with another manager and was told they would not be able to help me. I kindly insisted and they told me a manager would contact me within 48-72 hours. I don't even have the card yet and i'm already disappointed in their customer service.I don't think it's fair that a bank need to pull a credit report twice within a 30 day window, never mind 48 hours to justify a credit line increase. They should be able to review the current report they initially pulled for the application.

name: Robert Stong
review: Our FICO scores are 847 and 850 respectively.  Agreed, horrible customer-no-service at Citi!  Choose ethical banks instead of Citi.

name: Anonymous
review: This card is garbage along with the customer service never again will I use their card and have actually moved most of my small business purchases to any and all of their competitors which was only 10k last month. Within 3 months of having this card they started placing 10 day holds on my cash payments made in store yes cash not check or. Debit or money order but cash which has also lead to 4 late payments over the last couple years.  Run don't walk away from this card

name: dilwilliams98
review: I cussed them out....Don’t play with people’s credit and lively-hood!

name: Anonymous
review: This credit card is only a good deal if you plan on paying off what you bought at least 3 months before your promotions get kicked off and you get charged back all the interest you thought you saved on. And only make your big purchases one at a time. Give yourself a 3 month period to call them at least once a day, get treated like you ain't nothing, and then get told 5 different things by 5 different people, just to make sure everything is settled and you owe NOTHING. I made the mistake of not doing that and boy. I'll be at a 0 balance Monday-Thursday and then suddenly owe $180 on Friday. PS. It's also best to pay on the card in person vs. online. Online is more convenient sure, but it'll save you so many headaches about your online payments being reversed and charged "insufficient check fees" even though you definitely have enough in your bank account ("I'm looking at my bank account right now" you'll say over and over and over again) and you saw the payment go through a few days ago and now it's just suddenly not there. My grand kids are gonna be stuck paying this lol. Shady as hell.

name: Anonymous
review: The Sears store card was my first credit card. Everything from furniture (when Sears use to sell furniture), appliances, sporting goods, paint, clothing, and always their laundry soap was purchased there. One time, on the day my payment was due, I walked into a K-Mart to pay my bill. The employee and the manager refused my payment unless I showed them my I.D. The check was a pre-printed check with my full name and address. I had my charge card with me and had written the account number on the check. I explained that if I mailed my check, there would be no need to show my I.D. I didn't pay, wrote to the executive office and they closed my account. That K-Mart location closed several years ago, Sears continues to bleed money and management must wonder why the stores are empty. It's a lack of good customer service! Now, I shop WalMart, Target, JCP, ...

name: Anonymous
review: I was late paying aa balance of $22.00 by 3 days.  Home depot charged me $22.50 late fee..  Be careful  they have no pity...,  don't get it    I paid the priceHOME DEPOT are thieves  One cashier told me to steel for $20.'s worth

name: anthonyb_248
review: So you blame them for your negligence?

name: Anonymous
review: After paying $3600 in a year I was charged $1795 interest because they did not apply my payments to the promotion. Seems your supposed to call EVERY month to request your payment go towards your promotion

name: Anonymous
review: Never do it. The biggest rip off ever!!!  They get you to buy something interest free..then with no notice of the interest free program ending they charge back all the interest. For a 48.00 balance it cost me an additional 409.00. I will tear up my card and never buy from Best Buy again!!!!!

name: Anonymous
review: 2500 credit limit. Easy and simple to use. Highly recommend good app. Great service and simple payment process etc.Cash rewards and good for good credit. Goal,is to get an AmexBetter then most cards I've used or seen on here

name: Anonymous
review: I am on the hold for the same problem as the review below. It is completely frustrating that I purchased over the phone and the card was declined 3 times. Then the Fraud detection department left a message and I have been calling multiple numbers, getting people that were impossible to understand, on hold, etc.  All for the representative to finally tell me the hold was lifted and to place the order again!

name: Anonymous
review: never got notice about our finace charge gone up it  then BOOM got hit for  a 100 plus on a bill, but don't tell us until the next statement, so homedepot you can keep your card and we will be going to Lowes

name: Anonymous
review: The worst experience I ever had with SEARS Credit Card, if you don't want to be rip off, never, ever use City Bank. Pay cash or other Credit Card, there is no 0 for Rating so I won't rated (rewords for opening this card is not worth it).

name: Anonymous
review: Do not get a credit card with this company. I got approved and was told to make payments online when I received my physical card. Months later I have yet to receive my card. I am currently on a one hour hold just to see if I can even pass a security check to get my card mailed to me after providing a ssn and address. I have been late on both of my payments because of the lack of communication with this company. Employees are rude and could careless. The fact that I am on hold for a hour at work just to request a cc card for the third time and set up a recurring payment is beyond ridiculous. Do Not sign up for this

name: Anonymous
review: Signed up for a promotion and had my money "locked" into an account with them for 3 months. After I didn't get the promotional money added to my account, they said I never met the terms of the promotion, so essentially I lost $200 due to their disorganization. Getting in touch with an actual person was almost impossible as well. I would never recommend this bank.

name: angela_ebaymilw
review: Bait & switch!! Meijer gives you the OPTION of the store card & MasterCard at signup.  I have a 750+ credit score; a Visa AND MasterCard all in good standing - never missed a single payment and Meijer gave me the crap store card!!  When I called and inquired why, they said "If you're not eligible for the MasterCard you'll be checked for the store card" -- I was never given advance notice of this and did NOT WANT THE STORE CARD.  It's not a real credit card, you can only use it at Meijer!  Be warned:  If you apply for the MASTERCARD you will end up with the crap store card!!

name: Rene Evans
review: I was issued a payoff in January. I paid it and closed my account. I just received a notice that I had a balance on the account. It was interest and fees charged on that interest. I called Citi and they would not take care of the charges. I was done, I paid my balance and was a great customer and they still treated me like I was trying to scam them. I will not bank with them again!

name: pamelacwitt
review: I just got off the phone with Sears Credit Card and they would not extend my promotional offer even though they sent me checks to transfer other balances.  I am now going to be subject to the 25.45 or whatever it is interest rate that it will be now.  I will close my card and never get another credit card from Sears even though I have been a Sears Credit Card holder for a long time. Buyer Beware.

name: Arvin Sanders
review: Worst customer service ever. They wanted my life story before I could use my card. Avoid at all cost. -5 stars!!!! Closed account before I even got to use it. Save yourself the headache

name: Richard Kleinsdiest
review: I received a promotional brochure in the mail heralding $75 off my first purchase of $150 or more. I ordered 5 ink cartridges for $170+ and jumped through all the hoops in applying. The online order showed -$75 and a balance under $100. When I got the bill, there was no indication of a $75 credit. I spent 30 min or so on the phone to Staples and the More account people. No one mentioned any way to reconcile the problem, so I returned all of the cartridges. As soon as I receive a balance zero statement, I am closing this account.

name: Ernesto Figueroa
review: very disappointe fico score EQ 740, EP 728, TU 730. no negative, 0% use, any late payment.. and my application was DENIED!!!

name: Daniel
review: Although getting denied is frustrating, this card does let you know that you need a 750+. I have a 765, and I’m still hesitant to apply because if the strict requirements. Good luck.

name: captnrandom
review: The card itself has decent rewards. That is where the good ends. Annual fees and very poor customer service. If you ever want a credit line increase, itll hit as a hard inquiry on your credit and they said they never increase automatically. Calls to customer care never give any kind of real answer. I was told to call other agencies to tell me what Best Buy credit will do. Made no sense and was no help on any call.

name: spritzker2
review: Incredibly bad service. They refused to issue a refund despite the fact that Priceline did not honor their price guarantee. The entire process was terrible -- they required a letter mailed to process the dispute and then lost it. Stay away from this Bank and this card for anything but Costco purchases.

name: Yeah Boy
review:
This is your bank, not your lawyer. If you think Priceline breached their contract with you, file a lawsuit against them. Your bank resolves your dispute by asking one question: Did you authorize the charge? Your answer is yes. Dispute resolved.

If you had a problem with the price, why pay? You want to pay, use the service, and then get a refund from your bank when you have already used the service?

name: willsaccount1
review: This is the worst card ever.. I would give zero stars if I could.  have spent 8 hours on the phone over the past month to get my travel points.. Always an excuse.. never got my points. 18,000.. gone

name: Loren Shell
review: Just applied and was approved for the card when I bought new tires and qualified for $100 rebate in the form of a Visa prepaid card that will be sent to me in 8-10 weeks. The current APR is 29.74% which is listed on this site and the 6 months no interest if paid in full is an introductory offer so be careful. I plan to pay off the $257.98 I paid for 4 tires (buy 2 get 2 free) and the $306.10 I paid for lifetime balance, 1 yr wheel alignment, road hazard warranty and installation (the Value Installation Package which is a required purchase to get the 2 free tires) within 6 mo. so I don't have to dip into savings or pay any interest. So the $100 rebate and the buy 2 get 2 combined with the 6 mo intro no interest credit card is a good deal. The card alone, APR way too high. If I ever use this card again I'll definitely make sure the balance is paid off monthly.

name: lin
review: Make sure you get it in writing as you place the order if they tell you there's a promotional rate if you pay it off in a certain amount of time.  I'd been paying an amount to pay it off in the year and not even looking at the statements and I find out they've been charging me 25% interest since the day I bought it.  Of course when I went back through my records I couldn't find anything that said that so basically they made 25% on my money.  I had the money to buy it outright and if not I have a card that had 3% interest - why would I even open an account unless there was a special deal.   I've cancelled the card but I'd never deal with them again.

name: Pauline Morgalo
review: we were paying on time more than the minimum amount every month my husband's credit score dropped they took it upon themselves to cancel the cards definitely would not recommend it especially if you're a customer who pays more than the minimum every month

name: nrdennis23
review: After they long process of taking my money, I was finally approved and weeks later received a card.  Used the card for a rental car deposit and paid with discover rcard for the rental fees. Discover card transaction has posted and been paid  for. But yet, I am still waiting 14 days later for citi bank to release my deposit.  The representative stated I could wait exactly a month from the date of the transactions to fall off because on their system, out didn't shows it was reversed.  It was a deposit  and was cancelled 3 days after swiping. They can take my money but I have to wait for it to be returned.  The rental car company stated I should have already had it back on my card. I told the rep to cancel my card since you're not doing your job to assist me with my lost money. She started, if thou close it you will never be able to reopen it. Well why would I want to? Very shady.

name: esther_miller
review: I didn't even want to leave any stars, the interest on this card is so high that even with me paying above my minimum payment I struggle to pay this card off. Every time I feel like I'm making a dent in it the interest hits and it's like I didn't even make a large payment. it is designed to keep you in debt if you don't pay it off within the promotional interest free time and if its not paid off by said date they will charge you a years worth of interest that same day. BE AWARE. I wouldn't recommend this for any students especially I know its tempting because they approve large amounts and we need some electronics for schooling, but youre better off with getting a credit card through your own bank.

name: Jessica Reeves
review: The representatives are useless. Every time I speak with someone there I get a different response. Maybe they should get their shit together so they stop costing me money. I have cancelled my card with Citi.

name: andrewgamble64
review: I received my card in early part of December 2016. they sent me my bill for 40.90, I paid it within four days from receiving the bill. 2 Days after sending in my payment, i received another bill with a late payment of 37.00. I thought it was a mistake. Month went by and they sent me another bill with a another 37.00 late free on top of it. So now the item i bought costed me 114.90. After talking to a representative of the card holder company I got one late fee removed.  I believe they do this on purpose to receive a late payment. I closed my account and I will be shopping at Lowe's from now on. Thanks home depot

name: James E
review: Just a warning. I have a 800+ credit score, a low debt to income ratio, no delinquencies and make in excess of $50k a year and was denied. They wouldn't say why over the phone but needless to say I'm more than surprised and would not recommend applying for this card unless you enjoy rejection.

name: Daniel
review: I have been reading so many horrible reviews. I would say that by you being denied, you dodged a bullet that would of destroyed all the good you have done with your credit! Stick to chase, Cap1, AE, or Wells Fargo.

name: oddswiz
review: Deferred Interest charges are buried, in their statements and fine print. 25% interest is HIGHWAY robbery. These tactics are predatory lending at it's best. Shopping at best buy should be avoided at all costs.

name: seljuki
review: Terrible Customer Service Lost my Citi Prestige credit card while vacationing. Ordered a card replacement but had to call them three times since they would not ship the new card. Each time they promised to send the new card via FedEx but that was found to be not true. Still waiting for the new card. Plan to switch to a new card, likely from a different issuer.

name: Mimi Ross
review: I was a little leery about applying because I had already been approved for 15 cards one month ago, had a ton of inquiries and because of this my score had fallen from 794 to 673. When I applied they asked me did I want the regular Best Buy card or the Citi one that could be used anywhere. I chose the Citi and when they found out that one of the cards I recently was approved for was Citi they took that into consideration. So they approved me for $1,500 initially. I recon and told them I wanted to buy a BIG screen TV and asked could they raise it up to $3,000? They asked me to verify annual income, address, phone number and then approved me for the $3,000!!! Purchased my TV under the promotional 18 months interest free financing.

name: Lindsey Blalock
review: Lol bet you’re regretting this review by now. I’m sure you see the promotional 18 months was a hoax.

name: Jessica Toth
review: This is the WORST card I have ever dealt with.  If you get one PRAY that you never have an issue with it- because it will NEVER get resolved. Neither Best Buy nor CIti care enough to do anything about it either. When Best Buy first switched to Citi they managed to somehow merge my card and my father's so my card had half of my information and half of my fathers on it. Besides being a pain, this also made it so i couldn't pay online. It took 6 months of them giving me the run around and i eventually had to get my SENIOR father to go to the local store with me and have an employee call them to verify we were each who we said we were for them to get my information correct. No sooner had that been resolved than i stated having an auto-payment that I NEVER authorized start coming out of the last account I had paid with. As I didn't know this was there (because it wasn't supposed to be) it over-drafted my account and double paid my bill for the month. I tried for 2 years to get this taken off. At one point I had almost a -$200 balance because it kept overpaying itself every month long after i stopped spending on it. I tried closing the card and they REFUSED to do so!! (even though I didnt owe them ANYTHING) I eventually had to start spending on the card again because i was just loosing my money every month.Calling the phone number got me rude people who gave me lines such as "just deal with it", "everyone uses auto-pay now, that's  how it's done now" and on more than one occasion just being hung up on.  i finally went through the chat option (because when you try to email them they tell you to go to your local Citi branch for your problem- even though its a store card and so the local branches send you to the store who also cant do anything with it because it all has to be done by citi) i finally got a girl who i believe was actually a bot program who finally managed to - not remove the auto-payment - but change it to pay $0 each month. At this point i will take anything to get away from this card.  And i really think it's anything powered by Citi that has this problem because my mother had a similar issue getting support for her costco card that is also through Citi. Businesses and customers alike should be aware of using anything with CIti on it. They are the WORST.

name: James Loughman
review: Great card and got a low rate!!! High credit line of $40000 too!!

name: Lawrence Ricketts
review: What was your fico score??

name: scjackson2
review: Terrible. Terrible Terrible!!! They issue reward certificates, email them to customers to get them to enter their stores or shop online, promise they're good and then refuse to redeem them once the time to return the item has expired. VERY UNETHICAL!!! I'm cancelling both our credit cards immediately and never shopping there again. I had other problems with their credit cards years ago but gave them another chance only to have this happen. Even their corporate office employee Adolfo #16910 refused to help and was very rude to boot.

name: Elliot R
review: TERRIBLE SERVICE.  I used the card to charge a computer.  When the computer was ready to ship, Apple put throw the charge. Citi turned down the charge, because they said it was too large and they considered me a "new customer".This is in sprite of an excellent credit rating, a large line of credit and several charges that were also large although not as large. I also had the Costco card since the time it was introduced with AMEX.  When I called I was told that they would remove the large charge block for 3 days.  When I asked what the amount is, so I could call in the future, I was told it was a secret. No where when they were advertising the card did they mention that they would tern down "large charges".  Perhaps they are trying to avoid the 2 year extension of the warranty.

name: Yeah Boy
review:
That is not a large charge limitation. It is protection from fraud. If you pay a huge amount at a store you don't usually shop at, they will block it for your protection and theirs. You can go to your settings and have them text you when that happens. You just reply with "1" to authorize the charge and you are good to go.

Your credit rating, line of credit, and anything else is irrelevant to their need to protect from fraud. If your card is stolen and someone makes large transactions and they allow them, the bank would have to eat those losses when you call them and tell them you never made those purchases.

name: maryanna_tm
review: I had this card and the customer service is terrible.The call center representative was rude and made major account changes without confirmation. I asked to speak with a supervisor (also rude) and the supervisor said they didn't need to confirm anything. And because of the change, they can no longer speak with me again. They said any credit reporting mistakes should be directed to the credit bureaus as they will not discuss it with the consumer.Also the supervisor said there is no grace period with this card. Reading this page made me realize how much she lied.

name: Michael Rood
review: Horrible company! Allows contractors to commit blatant fraud, drags the dispute on for 90 days, and then sides with the contractor who has OBVIOUSLY submitted fake "evidence". Doing all of this while continuously asking for more documentation, that has absolutely nothing to do with the case. How is a person suppose to get a "refund authorization" from someone who is a scam artist?!?!? That makes absolutely zero sense. Way to be incompetent. My dog has more common sense than your "investigators".

name: Dmitrii Borisov
review: The worst bank ever! Your money is unsafe with this bank, when you will have hard time and ask this bank help you they will make your situation even harder, and they will try to cheat you if they could. So don’t have any deals with this bank even if it close to your house but if you already a customer leave this bank as soon as possible before you get hard time and this bank will take advantage on you! I had account in this bank more than a year and what I’ve experienced. Someone took about $300 from my account in Japan without my card, so don’t be impressed that this bank says that we have secure cards with cheap, the account security is so weak that hackers don’t need not you, not your card for grub money from your account in this bank. And security system so stupid that it can’t figure out that if I pay with this card a few hours before in Miami I can’t be already in Japan. And after I report about this fraud in this bank they said that they will investigate this problem and if all OK I’ll get refund within 10 business day! It sounds like this is my problem that Citibank gave my money someone in Japan! And I guess I’m lucky that they didn’t took all my money because it would be hard be without money within 10 business days! And they try to cheat you if they can! For example I pay nothing for use my debit card if I make at least one registered transaction, other way I have to pay $10. So I created an auto payment for my phone so I didn’t worry about this. But in several month I saw that I was charged $10 as monthly payment. I contacted bank throw chat but they said this is because your money was sent later so it wasn’t in my cycle period and refused refund me my money! Like this is my problem that this bank sent it later though money was available on my account and it was the auto payment, so bank sent it itself! And only after I called in bank they refund me money. And the worst thing from this bank is that if you have a problem get your money and ask Citibank to help you with this they will make you time harder. For example, I won some expensive lot and was a little short in money for pay for it but I thought, not a big problem tomorrow I will have a pay day and I have $300 available right now and $200 on next day as usual. I was need $400. So I asked bank on chat if they can give me $400 immediately after deposit my check, he said I have to ask it in bank. So next day I went to Citibank bank deposit my check and saw that now available immediately not $300 but only $100! When I asked what happened they said the bank changed its policy. I asked why? They said bank can do it when it wants and how it wants without any notification of clients. I asked help me because other way I will have to pay late fee if I will not pay now but they help me nothing. You may think it is happened sometimes. When I again had the same problem and asked bunk again help me cash my check faster they said it is federal law and they can cash my check up to 7 days! So they gave me nothing on next day and said I have to wait till Wednesday for completely cash my check, though I said I need pay my rent and I need this money as soon as possible! So my recommendation never have any deals with Citibank and if you already customer of Citibank leave it as soon as possible for you and your money safety!

name: zerrahwind
review: First dispute in 3 years was handled unprofessionally, almost like they didn't take my complaint seriously. They heavily favor the merchant. I actually felt betrayed by how flippantly they treated the dispute process. In addition, American Airlines employees tend to be negative and sometimes rude because of all the crap they endured while the company went through bankruptcy. There are better credit card companies out there.

name: Kimberly Shinabery
review: I have had an ongoing dispute with this company since Apr. concerning a transfer of $300 I requested be sent from my card to my credit union to pay a bill (a service they offer). The money never made it to my checking acct. I have sent them two bank statements. The first was in June; I never received a response. I made several phone calls and sent several emails regarding the dispute. In Sept., I received a letter from the Citicorp Card Services Executive Response Unit requesting a second bank statement, which I sent. Today I received a letter stating the statement did not show they deducted $300 from my checking acct. I signed up for this card in January to receive a discount on a tv. In Sept., I paid my balance except for this $300, the $15 fee, plus some for the interest I have accrued because of this. I have also closed the account. Had I known what I know now, I never would have opened this account. Don't make the mistake I did. They're a terrible company.

name: Justin Hair
review: Everything people are complaining about is mostly things that were in the fine print on the contract. Read the damn contract and make sure you understand every line before you sign papers for anything! Especially a credit card!I have bought a Wii U, and Xbox one on my card. My minimum payment was 25 and I have been paying well over the minimum payment of 25 bucks a month. My balance was say 800. now it's 213 with 170 days to pay off before I am charged back interest. I will easily have this paid off ahead of schedule. In fact I will most likely have it paid off by December.At the end of every month I go online and pay it so I have had no issues.Know what you are signing, be responsible, and pay more then the minimum payment every month! Do the math with a calculator, if you get 12 months no interest then divide the total amount by 12 and pay no less than that PERIOD and you will never have a problem!

name: ct180002
review: Best Buy Fraudulently coerced my elderly parents to sign a paper, they thought were simply sales and delivery papers, on a big screen tv.  They paid cash up front and have been harassed by citibank ever since to pay a processing fee on paperwork.  Citibank is charging interest that is now several hundred dollars.  Threatening phone calls everyday.  They say they will get their $ one way or another even if it's at an estate sale...they'll be the first in line for their $.  A charge for absolutely no service from Citibank, no dealings with Citibank period.

name: meliklay
review: If you are getting this card to get the rewards from best buy, forget it, 95% of the time the rewards won´t be available cause of technical issues that they´ve been having for about a year. If you call to get help, they´ll tell you that the rewards that you don´t see will be available in a month, then after that month when you still can´t see them and you call again, they´ll say that next moth they´ll be available.The most annoying and ridiculous card I have ever had. Save yourself a headache and get a good card that gives you what they promise without having to wait 6 moths to buy what you wanted with those rewards.

name: Saied Karoo
review: Been a loyal Best Buy customer for years had a. Eat buy card for 4 years with no issues until recently. Due to an error on one of my last payments where Best Buy sent me back my payment I was charged over $700 dollars interest. I called customer service and I explained my situation and that how it was an error on there end and all they could say was sorry we can't help you that the charges were already on your account. Honestly I can't believe this sort injustice is practiced at Best Buy. Never again will I shop at Best Buy.

name: Dwayne Fluker
review: I have a pretty low credit score. EQ + TU both in the mid 500 range. I applied for the Citi Secure card on 9/27/2016 and after a few days 10/6/2016, I was approved. The funds were taken out of my account 9/29/2016. I received several letters saying I was approved in the mail and now I'm just waiting or the card to arrive. It's been kind of a long process thus far, I will update on my experience once I receive the card and its impact on my credit score.

name: Sharon Bach
review: They sent us the envelope, no cards attached. When I called, they said we returned them. What a screwy company.

name: Mike Carter
review: I can say that I'm very happy with the service I receive on the card.On my other cards, I would have to pay like and extra 7 dollars if there was a late fee, and it was very annoying. With other card holders, they would pay my bills for me if they were online, but this would cause me to be overdrawn and I would have to pay the extra fee. It made me very upset, but this card does not do that..i highly recommend this card.

name: Katherine Burrion
review: I think this card is great! I have done a few promotional purchases since I got the card about 6 months ago. I am never late on a payment, and I've not been charged any interest since I paid off the balance before the promotional end date. I do wish that they would be a little more giving with the credit limit. I got approved for $1500 (the Visa card) and have not been able to get an increase since then. I only use it for the interest free purchases so maybe that's why I can't get any love. LOL. Pay on time and you'll enjoy the benefits. :)

name: Sterling Beddoe
review: God help you if you need to speak to customer service. The waits are forever, they give no estimate of the hold time you can expect and then they disconnect you without warning. I thought they would have improved in the 18 days since the switch over but I was wrong.

name: Yeah Boy
review: It appears God heard your prayers -- I get to customer reps immediately with no wait time, and I rarely even have to call them because the website has every conceivable thing I might need.

name: Sian Bado
review: For the past 3 months I have had to call and discuss my bill with customer service. Here are the issues I have with CitiBank and Best Buy:1. They do not go off of a 30-day billing cycle like most credit cards. Their billing cycle is ONLY 27 days which has resulted in me paying a bill twice in one month.2. Their late fee is $37.00. If you are 1 DAY late they charge the late fee, HOWEVER, If they charged in error it takes 2 MONTHS for the late fee to come off.3. You have to keep accurate notes every time you call customer service because they will tell you they are but the notes are NEVER found when you call back and reference a conversation you had with a rep previously.4. I have requested to have my due date changed 3 months ago in order to make sure that payments are made on time (I only get paid once a month) and the rep told me it was changed. Turns out she never changed it and I had to end up paying an extra $60+ dollars on top of my minimum balance, to include a late fee.5. They have a high interest rate and when you pay your bill only 1% of your payment goes towards your balance.This credit card has been a thorn in my side since CitiBank took over. There have been too many times (in the past 3 months) that I had to speak to a manager/supervisor just to pay my bill. Its ridiculous! They are quick to thank you for being a loyal customer but then set you up to fail and pay more in the end. But I guess thats what credit card companies do I guess, well CitiBank at least.

name: Sandy M
review: The late fee applies even if you try and pay it the same day. I tried to pay it online at 9pm the day it was due and was still charged a $35 late fee

name: gilliam4
review: I like being a Citibank Citigold customer, but did you know that effective November 1, 2016 the minimum balance (includes linked accounts) of your savings, investments, and retirement accounts in total will be $200,000!  If you are a Citigold customer now but you don't qualify on Nov. 1st they'll convert you to another package!  Good luck with the $200K minimum.  Looks like I may be looking for a new bank!

name: Penny Shelton
review: I am in shock been with you guys for years and I haven't even asked for a increase and plus we are getting more money considering we got married and goes on salary and what i make. Very disappointed in citi diamond to refuse me. I even told them i would send document so now I have to wait for a letter. Not happy

name: ak_home
review: I signed up for the $500 bonus on 50k if you keep the balance for 90 days. I completed 90 days on 6/11 and am still waiting for the bonus amount. I called citigold customer service and talked to them 2 weeks ago, they said that i would receive an email in 2 days and it will be looked at. I did not receive any email, called themback, the rep tells me that the case is open will take a week. Today i celled them back and this lady tells me that it will be more than 30 days for investigation. I dont understand why it would take 30 days to verify that my account meets all requirements. On top of all, the customer service has no apology, i asked for the superviser and she was rude and cold. This is it and you ahve to wait. i should ahve just opened an account with Chase, you dont even have to follow up on bonus with Chase. They auto credit it and it is all hassle free. Here i am sitting calling them over and over with no clear answer onw hen it will be resolved. DONT GET FOOLED!! Just to chase. Never coming back to CITI and mind you it is not a small amount. 50k and you dont get an aplogy.

name: Raman Rajpal
review: The Citi Hilton HHonors Reservce Card is a scam. The certificates for 2 free weekend nights never show up even after months of eligibility. After numerous calls and many hours with customer support, who recognize the awards have been earned, and promises that I will receive it within a week, there is no sign of the award certificates.

name: Jose Lara
review: Horrible credit card, I had a fraudulent charge in my card and disputed since December 2015 (we are in June 2016 Now) Best buy Credit card asked me to send paper work and to personally go and argue with the merchant were this charge was done , I did all this and proved I never made that charge. In may they credit back my account, 8 days later they processed the same charge for the same amount and from the same merchant. BEST BUY CREDIT CARD told me they needed more info and were doing more info, that I wasn't going to be charged any interest on that amount; which was a LIE because I got charged interest on the disputed amount. I am so tired of loosing time and hours on the phone with this card company and they cant help me resolve this situation I just ended up paying the amount and closing this stupid credit card. DO NOT ACCEPT THIS CREDIT CARD, BENEFITS ARE HORRIBLE AND THEY DONT TAKE CARE OF THEIR CUSTOMERS.

name: Tae Oh
review: New best buy cc holder. $500 limit. I made multiple purchases almost maxing out the card. Then i made large payments of $317, $250, $235 & $437 everything was paid before a statement was even processed. The reason was i was trying to increase my limit to possibly make larger purchases later. After each payment my account was credited about 2 business days later (normal) but this last payment i made on june 13th, 2016 for roughly $437 was posted on june 13th, withdrawn from my bank account (same one i used on previous payments) on june 14th, 2016 and its june 22nd right now and still hasnt been credited to my account. Called customer service and they gave me some reason saying its due rules and regulations for making multiple payments. And i should see credit to my account by june 24th!!! 10 days after they take the money from my account. I am pissed. If the money wasnt taking out and just put as pending charge...i would understand. But take my money and not credit me for 10 days??? I am now rethinking if i want to keep this stupid Best Buy   card. Even my wife's card too which has limit of $!0,000.00. Someone asked me why if my wife has a card already is because I made a young mistake of messing up my credit and rebuilding it now also with my own business. This really makes me mad. sorry for rant!

name: David Pagel
review: Sears used to make all credit decisions in house at 3 or 4 credit centers spread out thru the U.S.That changed when they bought a bank and had to follow  FDIC guidelines.That was in 1992 or 93.Not sure when Citibank came into play...Google is your friend...Sears sold their credit portfolio to Citibank in 2003.

name: keyesmm
review: If I could do zero stars I would. I signed up for the account in connection with the 50,000 AA mile promotion. It has been the most incredible hassle to figure out--even after I was assured I met the requirements, I was then told nevermind, you didn't, and now it's too late. Don't waste your time.I have never had such a terrible experience with a bank. Don't trust them! You'll get a different story from each agent.

name: JoAnn Long
review: We have been a regular card holder for over 50 yrs. My husband the main card holder, myself also w/ one.  He passed away 2 yrs ago, I continued to use my card once a week, and make the monthly payments. During a discussion with a person regarding a charge, I mentioned that he was deceased and they might wish to record it.  Information was given with no comment.  About 10 days later, after I filled with $35 gas, my card was "denied". After 4 tries, I had to pay the attendant with my "debit card". Still not knowing why.  I phoned, was told that my husband was the main card holder, altho' I was also eligible w/ a card. When he passed away, the account was closed and I was no longer eligible, thus the "denial" ... with no notice to me of this action.      I can get another card, IF I wish to go to a station, get a form, fill it out with the info that they already have on file!!, mail it in, wait for credit search to see if I am eligible.  Meanwhile, I cannot use my old card, and was told my 50 yr record of use and on-time payment record did not count, "So sorry!!"  Guess I must use cash, or go somewhere else and apply for a card with another Oil Company.  I am so "leaning" in that direction!!!

name: Tomeeka Grizzell
review: That’s horrible.. sorry to hear that ..

name: Theresa Carboh
review: Took me 1,5 hr to book a trip with this card, spoke to about 8 different citi bank and expedia employees. I already regret the card. Not to mention the low line of credit. I don't own a card under $30,000 available, and citi gave me a ridiculous 6K

name: megazerodude
review: Terrible banking experience and a fraud. I signed up for their 30,000 AA Miles promotion back in September and made multiple calls along the entire process to ensure I qualified for the promotion and met all the completion requirements. After being assured by 3 different agents on separate occasions that I had completed all requirements, I was told that I should expect my miles by February at the latest. February came and the miles were nowhere to be found, made another call and was told that this time they'd hit my account by March. I called them around March and was told I was missing a W9 form on file with them, so they could "verify" my account. After submitting the form 4 different times to 2 different fax numbers, and mailing it to 2 separate mailing addresses, they finally "found" my form. I was told they had to conduct an investigation as to why I couldn't be awarded the miles and the "investigation" lasted 2 months, at which point they told me that I didn't qualify for the promotion. They wasted my time and money, telling me I qualified at first, and assuring me I had completed the requirements only to drag it on and tell me I didn't qualify half a year later. Worst banking experience I've had.

name: Bill McGovern
review: Great card as long as you never have any disputes.  Had a dispute and they kept closing it stating they never received my notification or details.  I had faxed and emails which confirmed delivery and they still refused to intervene.  After over six months, it was impossible to dispute this charge with the merchant.Bottom line - there are other cards that will support you so go with them!

name: tnoquendo1
review: These reps are disgraceful.

name: Tamara Yakel
review: Not even worth having because every time I have tried to use they have always asked if I had a different card because it's too much of a hassle to get an approval!!! Why even offer them if it too much of a hassle to use it!!!! If I would have know that it was going to be like this every time I wouldn't of even got it and had it put on my credit report!!! Waste of time!!

name: Carrie Hendricks
review: I got this card with the promotion and used it on everything.  I saved up to a total of 70,000 miles in a year and wanted to go on a trip to NYC.  The only flights that were available using the miles were ridiculous flights that nobody would want.  (I am flying from Raleigh to NYC which should be  a direct flight and they offered my a connection flight to DC with a 2 hour layover.)  I ended up using 60,000 miles for a round trip flight to NYC (which usually runs you around $250) and they then charged me $86 to use the skymiles.  I have a Barclaycard and a Capital One card and those are MUCH better.  They are upfront and you get what is advertised.  I called customer service at American Airlines and they were extremely rude and demeaning in the way they spoke to me as well.  I would rather pay full price than be lied to and scammed out of my time and money.  DO NOT GET THIS CARD!!!

name: Angela Barbosa Oceguera
review: The worst card that i have. Never i could use when i wanted pay something more than U$ 200.00. They declined the debit of flight tickets in a total of U$ 400.00 and my limit is U$ 8,600.00. I called the  customer service for that and they gave me millions of reasons for that, but no one helped me. They insisted that my card was expired, but that was  not true. I gave up... never more this $#//! Card.

name: Rick Abrams
review: I do not always get a bill so I try to paying more than I owe so that I won't go into negative when I do not get the bill. They won't credit it and instead return the over payment.  Their late charges are $29 and it is impossible to verify anything as I cannot log onto their on-line site and when I call, I get someone who doesn't speak or understand English.  Then, I finally understand that I have to call another place, but that place is CLOSED.  I think the problem is with Citibank, but I still have to cancel my Shell Card after 35 years as Citibank is more than I can tolerate.what I see someone get a 25 grace period.  I was one day late due to a holidy with no mail and i got no stinking grace period.

name: William Johnsonston
review: Brook Brothers Clothes are expensive, and they all made from China. Comparing with Saks Off 5th, I believed I can buy similar dress shirts for little less for brand names, and made in Italy. Last year, when I received Brook Brothers card whenever I spent money at the store, I paid the amount in full within 30 days. This year, toward the end of May, I ordered some shirts and the total amount over the card limit of 68cents, and the card didn't approve.  Instead of sending the email to let me know right away, they were let me hanging out there for 7 days.  Finally, I received the noticed from Brook Brothers that they couldn't approved(remember over limit for 68 cents!!!!!). I called them for additional card in the amount of 68cents, and yet I still haven't received any notification since yesterday. I was thinking if this table turn around, and if for some reasons I pay my bill late for one day they would charged me $35 late fee in new York minutes instead of delay and without notification.  This Brook Brothers card is partnering with Citibank retailer division.  Citibank is not very good of customer service and not very good bank to beginning with.  Therefore, I give this card and Brook Brothers no stars if I can. I highly recommended not applying for Brook Brothers card and shopping with Brook Brothers.  Their customer services at the stores are not that good anyway.

name: Talya Syvann
review: I was not discounted the $50 that I was promised for a $150 purchase. Citibank sells your social security number and income to all its marketing affiliates, even after you quit, and gives you no option to stop it. It's terrible. NEVER WORK WITH CITIBANK OR STAPLES.

name: Joshua Guzman
review: I opened the card a few months ago and the was charged interest right away even though they told me it was 0% for 6 months. I contacted them and they wanted to know what purchase I was talking about that didn't include interest. The store itself gave great service, the customer service told me they couldn't do anything and to go straight to the store for further assistance.

name: Jaime Queen-Roosevelt
review: Just don't do it to yourself.

name: Denis Ouellette
review: The rewards suck in that you get a very short time to redeem them, maybe only about six weeks, so if you don't use them they are gone forever and you can't save them up for a large purchase at Best Buy. Interest rate i extremely excessive and I have had more than one month were I got no statement in the mail.

name: Joseph W Bronson Jr.
review: Home Depot is our official go to home improvement store.  I app'd and got an instant approval for 600.00.  So I called to day and got a limit of 15k.  Since I have the Citi DC & DP, this was a good addition.  And not to mention, I can actually get a little more done around the house or just charge what I need for my project and pif.

name: Frank Perkins
review: I have a love and yet hate relationship with this card. I was pre approved for this card as I received a letter from citi about the pros of this card. I talked with my financial advisor and she stated to apply as citi is one of the top credit cards san chase for which to be approved. I called. I was promised awards. All of my other credit cards have points and cash back. I thought sure. I got the card, and there was concierge service. I already have that with my Amex delta card. It also has points and upgrades. My credit score is 813. I applied and was approved for a mere2000 dollars. All of my other cards have a high credit limit. I started using it in hopes that I would get a balance increase. After five months of consisting using and paying on time it has not increased. I do not like that.I felt lied to by citi bank. I will continue to use it so that the credit limit will increase. If I want an increase I have to call which will put a hard hit on my credit report. Never again will apply for another card with citi bank.

name: Bud Mellman
review: Had card for over 10 years and for no reason my interest rate was increased from 14.99 to 22.99.  Then it was increased to 25.49.  Never missed a payment. Never late on a payment.
