Very good credit rating.  Called customer service and received no valid reason for the increase.  Then they offered to close my account but I would have to pay off the balance of course.  Have two other similar credit cards who have never raised my rate.  Suggest you switch to Discover. Excellent customer service.  At least for me, the rate is very good and has never been raised after 10 years.

name: Livia Augustan
review: I have had an LLBean Credit Card since they first began issuing them (20 years ago? 25 years ago?) and have an excellent credit rating. I have always paid my bill every month in those 20/25 years. Since LLBean switched to Barclay's Bank, however, I have several times been put in the entirely humiliating position of having my transaction declined because of their over-zealous and harassing Fraud Detection program. This happened to me recently when I was unable to pay for (and thus pick up!) my car from the auto body shop. Only when I returned home (without my car of course since they had turned down the transaction) did I find a message from their Fraud Unit on my phone advising me to call them. The last time they did this to me was a weekend before Christmas when I was buying Christmas gifts online, and was forced to call them three times on one day! The reason that I have a credit card is for large payments and for online buying. This makes me want to cancel my card with LLBean just because, when you need it the most, Barclay's turns down your transaction. For totally bogus reasons.

name: Avi Kartz
review: Worse customer service. Came to the store to buy something but my card was declined even though I I have a line of credit of  $1000. I called them and they said that I'm past due even though I paid on time and I got a confirmation number. They are really unprofessional  and I am definitely not planning on buying from them ever again.

name: Brooke Nelson
review:
this literally just happened to me like an hour ago.. 
i paid three days ago (before it was due) and got a confirmation number, went to the store today to purchase something and my card was declined multiple times because i was 'past due'.

name: Jonathan Flyger
review: I bought a computer at a local Best Buy and they insisted I use  and sign up for this credit card.   And they messed up my name and my address and did not send me statements on time. Then a month down the road I get a call from my credit monitoring company that these guys are hurting my credit.  Luckily I got their credit information from my credit monitoring agency and paid their card off.  Never again will I buy anything from Best Buy or use their credit cards. What a headache and a big joke. And I will tell all my friends and relatives the same.

name: Dee Satchel
review: The same thing happened to me on a 12-months same as cash offer. They sent the statement to the wrong address, then charged me interest for missing my first payment. I wrote to them; no response. I paid what I owed and stopped paying. Unfortunately, I didn't have a credit monitoring service at the time, and they have placed my account in collections. Still fighting.

name: Kim Falk-Carr
review: Worst customer service ever.  Called to apply and transfer 2 balances from other cards once I was approved. The girl added $1000 to my balance transfer.  When I questioned her, she said it's done and she cannot change the amount.  On the phone for one hour and a half with multiple people.  No one would help me, change the amount of balance transfer, or even let me cancel the entire transaction due to my disgust.  My questions were left unanswered and they told me to call back another day or wait until I received my card.  Is there anyone I can report this Horrible customer service to?   I have good credit and don't need their card.

name: Rex Arbuckle
review: Did you get this problem resolved?

name: Mark Lajiness
review: I was pressured to get this card when I bought a new laptop ($1400) at Best Buy. I thought that perhaps it would be a good idea when combined with their rewards program. Imagine my surprise when, receiving my first bill a week after the purchase, I discovered the APR on the card is 25.49%. That's exceptionally high! I called to see about getting the APR decreased and learned that Best Buy credit, with whom the card is issued, is actually CitiBank. Now, I have a separate Citibank card, with a 12.49% APR. I said I'd like to transfer the balance to my Citibank card, but the phone representative said people cannot transfer Citibank to Citibank. I feel like I've been duped! I've received nothing in the mail about the "rewards program," whatever that is -- just this bill, at 25.49% APR.  AVOID THIS CARD. BE WARNED.

name: Clayton Atwell
review: Sounds good I would suggest it to other people

name: Nathan Berlin
review: Card was awesome and the rewards were unmatched for my purchases. I am a business owner and used this card for several thousands of dollars a month. THEN..... MY CARD WAS HACKED! It has been 14 months since the unauthorized activity was spotted on my account. I have not even received a call from their fraud department. There have been many excuses but the main frustration is that there is no way to get a hold of the fraud department. You can fax them papers and information, but there is no number or email in order to talk to anyone. Worse yet, they did not report the fraud case correctly on my credit report. Therefore, I have had to call all 3 credit bureaus in order to correct the problem because you can't talk to anyone at CITI Bank Fraud Department. I will never get a credit card or anything from this company.

name: pychang21
review: Same as the last reviewer.  A complete farce and scam.  I completed my promotion requirements back in january albeit without the $50k deposit and been waiting for my 50000 thank you points ever since.  Have to pay a $25 fee every month to keep the account active but apparantly the bank manager who opened my account opened a regular account package instead of the citigold package.  So in lieu of the 50000 thank you points I was suppose to receive I got 20000 after a little hassle.  I went back to the branch where I opened my account and the manager apologized and tried to credit me the remaining 30000 points.  Needless to say they gave me the run around after waiting patiently for over a month and and a half they collected another fee before telling me too bad and you're stuck with what you have.  Oh by the way you also never had $50k in your account so thats why we cant no longer work with you.   What account?  The one that was never opened since I was given the wrong one to begin with.  And where in the promo says that it was a requirement?  They couldnt give me a straight answer except to tell me move along before I get someone in trouble.Totally unprofessional and unacceptable.  Take my advice go to other banks for more honest and reliable promotions.  Because when it looks like it's too good to be true, it definitely is with these guys.

name: Andrea Alexander
review: I got my card last year after the associate said I wouldn't have to pay interest for 12 months. fast forward 10 months and I find out that I've been paying interest the whole time. The "best" a supervisor at the call center can do is credit two months interest. I call complete BS on the whole thing.

name: Joseph Messinger
review: DON'T GET FOOLED INTO SIGNING UP FOR THIS CARD!!!!  I got this card in order to get a deal on a stove I was buying.  I forget if it was a discounted price or long term payment option, but either way, I bought in.  Long after I payed off the stove, my wife made the misguided dicission to buy some cloths with the card.  However, I never got the bill because I somehow got signed up for paperless billing.  3 months of late fees and interest later, I get a letter threatening that they'll sick the collection agencies on me.  Figuring this was simply a misunderstanding, I confronted them on the situation and the fees and they only agreed to knock one month worth of late fees off.  I got stuck paying over $100 in fees and interest, which probably made up for the benefit of signing up for the card in the first place!

name: Donna Marie Vitale-Field
review: 0  ZERO RATING   Hello, As stated in my initial phone call and multiple letters in writing. The late reporting on my account was unfairly reported.  NO one from home depot or CITI BANK contacted me a bout balances due or any late payments being made until I found it on my CREDIT REPORT.  This is completely unfair and UNJUSTIFIED.Your response was that my account was changed to electronic notification.  However, there was NO Email address in the system to send notification to and there was no Phone number listed on the account.Why didn't you send a letter to my home mailing address at before anything was reported as being late?  I was NEVER notified of anything being late.I have spent in the range of $50,000 - $80,000 at Home depot over the past 20 years and to be treated like this is appalling. I feel due diligence was not done by you.  I had this account open for nearly 20 years until I closed it because of this UNFAIR REPORTING. Ive already communicated with credit reporting agencies and they state it can only be corrected by cittibank formally instructing them to formally change the rating. Can you kindly help?

name: Ed Abraham
review: The Brooks Brothers MasterCard is a decent credit card overall; however, the rewards program can be beat with other more lucrative cards on the market.  Brooks Brothers offers rewards that are equivalent to a $20 certificate for every 2,000 points accumulated on the card.  Points are accumulated at 4 for 1 for money spent at BB and at an even 1 to 1 for purchases outside of BB.  This is not really a great reward all things considered.  You would be better off getting an Amazon rewards card, which offers tiered rewards for restaurants and gasoline as well as Amazon purchases.  The best reason to hold the BB card is to get special pricing several times a year.  The latest program provided a 25% discount on all purchases--online or in the store.  This can be a significant savings.  I would suggest getting the BB card for this reason, but seek out another alternative for better overall rewards.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: This is the type of card that you do not want to have. It's the card that other cards warn against in there advertising. Your bonus miles are very difficult to use. I had miles disappear for select flights. Additionally, there are better cards with better rates, but since I needed something with miles, and was denied from other cards I had to settle for this one for about a year. If you can get a different card, do so. The bonuses are poor, the APR is high, and the customer service is unfriendly. The card is average.

name: Lesli Gordon
review: NO CUSTOMER BACK-UPI paid for a 3 hour private tour in Dubai with my platinum aadvantage MasterCard.  The company we booked with's website clearly says "tour includes a tour guide."  We were sent a courteous driver who barely spoke English but no tour guide. After an hour driving around not knowing where to even look, let alone have a tour we just left the car.  I put the charge under protest but in less than a month Citibank put the charge back. The tour company said they provided the service we paid for: But they did not.  Citi told me that whenever it's a he said/she said situation that they stand behind the merchant.  "I thought you reversed charges for services not provided."  I then said that this is unacceptable to me and I want to cancel the card.  I was not yelling or swearing but the customer service rep hung up on me anyway. They definitely do not deserve mine or anyone else's business.

name: Cole Miller
review: Like another reviewer, the store mis-entered address which resulted in my not receiving my first More account bill for 3 months.  When I finally received,my $100 calculator had another $74 in "late fees".  I paid through my bank bill pay system and thought I was done. But NOOO.  Apparently, Staples claims to have received the amount 5 days past the due date for that cycle.  So they charged me another $37 in late fees + interest.  I sent the bill back with the note that I had paid in full.  I was receiving automated vmails from Citi, but ignored as I don't have an account with Citi and they were not specific as to their nature & thought it was spam.  After receiving my latest bill with yet more charges, I called Staples/More customer service to figure out why I was still getting billed for what amounted to purely late fees & interest on interest (no real balance on the account) . The customer service rep was rude, told me I needed to pay all charges and that they would proactively notify credit bureaus of my default payments.  My $100 calculator has cost me over $350 due primarily to their error in entering my address.  Needless to say, I WILL NEVER SHOP AT STAPLES OR BANK WITH CITI AGAIN.

name: Dan Chisholm
review: If I could give this a zero I would.  Be extremely careful what the sales rep at the store tells you regarding this card.  They will tell you 0% interest for 24 months (or, whatever promotion is going on at the time), then a certain interest rate will be added after the promotion ends.  They WILL NOT tell you that back interest will be applied if it is not paid off in full within the promotion period.  At least my rep did not when I asked.  The rep just wanted to get the signature.

name: Yvonne Turner
review: I believe that's what they all do with promotional interest. If the debt is not paid when the promotional time ends you must pay whatever the interest was from the day of purchase, even if you only owe a very small balance at the end of the promotional period. I have several major credit cards with excellent credit lines but I make sure to pay the purchase off before that promotional period ends. I currently have a six thousand limit with Best Buy but the reason I don't like the card is because you have to either go for the rewards or the no interest period. In other words I recently purchased a major appliance for a little over 2000.00. If I wanted to earn the 10% rewards offered I would have to pay the entire bill in 30 days. If I wanted deferred interest I could not get any rewards, I prefer cards that give you both.

name: Ed-ita Pur
review: I have a credit card rating of 830 plus.I always pay my cards in full each month. CITI website is full of inconsistencies with misleading statements. I aplied for an autopay more than 2 weeks in advance to pay for a a bill that was due. The autopay ignored it thereby charging me a $40  interest on the due date. It again charged me an interest of $37 after the next billing cycle even when the autopay has kicked in and paid in full. The account manager said that it takes more than a month for the autopay to set in. Unsusual!!! Other credit card companies require a miimum of 2 weeks for the autopay to set in. THOU SHALL NOT USE THIS CARD.

name: Citi-DANALMSA
review: I have been a Citi Preferred Thank You card user for the last 2 years. I first got it because it had an offer for 20,000 points and I was interested in taking advantage. I also had a Bank Of America Amex card, but it seemed this one would earn points quicker. And so it has proved it does. With what I spend, I have earned a lot of points that I have changed for Gift Cards. My favorite thing is that I can do so with as little as 5,000 points. I don't loose value if I have less points. For example, my Amex card would only give me 20$ for 5000 points, and 350 for 35,000. Where as this card give me a 50$ gift card for 5,000. So that is my favorite thing about the card. I also just had fraud on the card (more than 1,000 of fraudulant charges). Citi's service quickly reversed the transactions, cancelled my previous card and FedEx'd me a new set of cards. It took me about 10 mins to have all of this done, with little hassle. So I am really impressed with their service. The other feature I like is that I get my FICO score, which is very useful. Android Pay also works very well with this card. The only things i would improve would be to have more points (some cards are now offering more cashback).

name: Vernon Webb
review: Worst card I have website locks up been a customer for 33 years worked fine till Citicrap took it over!!!!

name: Happy Bank
review: I chose this card because I wanted Cash Back. I do not fly much (I'd like to but...) so I can't really use a Miles card. I pay my card in full each month so I don't worry about the Interest Rate. So Cash Back works best for me. I would like to earn more than 2% back - years back I had a card that used to pay 5% back but this is the best I can find for right now. I have had great experience with Citibank for decades. Their customer service is always reliable. Security is excellent - I use Citibank's Virtual Numbers for all my Online purchases. I also like not having my Credit Card from my Personal Bank so there is no connection between my bank accounts & my credit cards for security.

name: Roy Seaberg III
review: If Citi would just fix their Easy Deals rewards program this is not a bad card and really a pretty decent starter card. I think they are competitive until you try to use their reward system. I signed up for the card in 2011 I think. Forgot the actual month but do remember it was 2011. If my memory serves me correctly they gave me zero percent interest rate for maybe a solid two years. It could have been 18 months but I think It was a solid two years(24 months). I have to applaud them for that one. It's hard to redeem points at their auction application at their citi easy deals rewards website. They have auctions for all kinds of items including gas gift cards. This is where I got a sour taste in my mouth from Citi. You can exchange your reward points for bids. I wanted do something with my points so I exchanged them for bids. The one positive is if you lose the auction your bids just switch back to reward points. I did several auctions and I am pretty sure I bid at the very last moment. I mean the timer was on zero when I bid and I still got outbid. This makes me think its a rigged bid system with an auto robot bidder so no one wins bids. I could be wrong but it's just the impression I get. I mean the timer said zero and it still counted a couple more bids. In certain categories they might have good deals but not really in dining gift cards. You might get 5 dollars off any amount gift card. Example $50 gift card will cost you $45. I wanted to win at auctions because it offered useful things like gas gift cards. You might get good deals on something like a sweater or maybe even travel but I have enough clothes and can't really afford to travel. Yea maybe you got a good deal on the room through Citi but there is bunch of other costs in traveling like dining and stuff.Also the auction favors long term card holders and/or big spenders who have tons of points and they squeeze the little guys out who don't have much points on even small items like 25 dollar gas gift cards. If you only have 2000 points ( I have 5000) and wanted a 50 dollar gas card some guy (and a few of his buddies) with 50 thousand points comes along and just outbids past your points or drive it up so you have to spend half your bids. I am not spending half my points on a 20 dollar gift card but the big spenders don't care they havd a lot of points to burn.Citi scrap the auction system and give a little bit better deals in other categories and I would give higher stars. I don't really consider a reward card until they do that. If they do that I might five star them but for now it's 3 stars because the reward system should be much easier to use

name: Roy Seaberg III
review: When I said you might get good deals on things like sweaters or travel those things were not part of the auctions. The way I wrote it above it looks like they might be part of the auctions but they were in a different section than the auctions. They might have good deals just not at the auctions and not in dining gift cards. I think the auctions just do physical items like gas gift cards or iPads and other items.

name: Sandra
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred is purely meant for balance transfers and the promo 0% APR, that much is clear. In that respect, if you're using it for that, it's a great card. However, one huge drawback to me for this card is the fact that there doesn't seem to be anything truly special or unique about this card. After your 0% APR promo rate expires, this card was average to me. During the times I needed to do a balance transfer, I did not have any offers was not able to perform one to this card. All in all, this card for me collects dust, but your results may vary.|Great for balance transfers or promo rate, average otherwise.

name: Gee Bee
review: All of you people who are complaining or writing 1-2 stars, are complaining about things that were made VERY CLEAR in the application, the packet, and if you just did your research and read the My Best Buy Citi Bank booklet. It's your fault for not doing your due diligence, and it outlines all of the policies and guidelines about compounded daily interest, APY, APR, and financing deferred interest. They aren't manipulative, you guys just are lazy typical Americans who don't read and just apply for stuff. Don't fault them for your mistakes. Every complaint I see here couldve been avoided if you read the terms and conditions before applying.

name: Sandooch
review: I decided to apply for the Citi Simplicity card because, at that time at least, I was give 0% interest for 16 months for balance transfers. Since transferred $4,500 from another card that was charging me over 25% interest at the time, so this was saving me a lot of money each month. The only thing I would improve is if they gave me even longer with the 0% interest, which I see is now at 21 months. But I would definitely recommend this card to others looking to pay off their high-interest credit cards faster. You just have to keep in mind that if you don't pay if off before that time period that they give you the 0% interest, than all of your accrued interest will be added onto your balance, so you want to avoid that. So far, no problems with customer service, too.

name: jkljh
review: I got this card when I needed to buy a new laptop, the financing options are great. Sometimes the current financing options can be unclear which can be pretty inconvenient. I've only had to contact customer service once and the experience was on par with what you would expect. Overall I like having this card as it makes purchasing more expensive items less of a burden.

name: Carlos Imm
review: A card that charges foreign transactions fees should never be aimed to be a travel card. I use it to pre-pay for travel expenses but I never use it abroad.

name: Tommy B.
review: I originally got this card back when i started my games resale business and needed and extra influx of buying power to secure some bulk deals  for resale. I ran into issues a few months after getting it  as it seems to dislike mobile phone card readers and some websites deney it outright as it's not seen as a valid card by them(no idea what that's about).

name: Alexa H
review: I got this card when I needed a new laptop. I liked they offered a card I can use anywhere and receive points for my purchases, rather than just the store card. The APR is high but it's no interest if paid within 6 months, so I keep paid up on it. Customer service has been great anytime I've had a question.

name: Shulkies Xiong
review: If i could give them zero stars I would!! Just like some of the other reviews I should have done my research before getting this card.  This is a credit card that you have to literally babysit if you don't you will be stuck paying for charges and interests that you aren't even aware of.

name: Jodi Perkins Smith
review: This card is horrible and has the worst customer service.  I wish I had done my research before we used them, now we are stuck overpaying on purchases due to all the fees.  We tried to work with customer service, their response was horrible and rude.  Don't waste you time and money on them.

name: Kristofor Durrschmidt
review: My 1st kid was born, I was in the hospital with my wife for a few days and I was so busy and tired that I missed paying by two days. Citibank for home depot relentlessly called until I could get to a computer and make a payment. I refuse to pay people over the phone that call me for safety reasons. Called several times a day including 7am in the morning. Insane behaviour over honest mistake.

name: Donna Marie Vitale-Field
review: citi bank is absolutely an unfair business.. Ive been fighting with them for over 6 months to remove an unjustified late credit reporting off my account. They refuse to do so when it was not my fault.

name: ChuckS.
review: I got this card because of the excellent rewards. I don't travel much, so I didn't want a card that gave hotel or airline points. Instead, I wanted to earn points that I could redeem for gift cards or cash, and this is an excellent card for that. You get more points for entertainment, so this is my go-to card for eating out, going to the movies, going bowling, etc. I pay it off each month, and there is no annual fee, so I wasn't worried about the interest rate. I use this card for about $250 a month worth of purchases and I get about $100 a year worth of rewards. Not bad, really. Plus I like having this card since my other card is a Discover and every once in a while I go somewhere that won't take a discover card. All in all, this is a nice little card for moderate use, especially if you use it strategically.

name: BuffaloBill
review: I first got this card simply because I had balances I wanted to transfer, and they offered a generous term length on a 0% APR transfer offer.  I wound up continuing to use it even after paying down the balance, as the Thank You points accumulated at a decent rate, and rewards could be used for anything (which is a big plus for me).

name: Sheila Yancey
review: I would not recommend this card. I had my account for years and wish I could close it but it would look negatively on my credit report. My bill is due on the 25th of each month. Since I get paid the last day of each month, I pay my bill 25 days early. During the month of December I get paid the 15th of the month because of Christmas. So in December I paid my home depot bill on December 28th of the month. My bill was not due until January 25th. Imagine my surprise when home depot bill collectors started contacting me. When I got my bill, they said I was late, that I had to pay $233 for my minimum payment and I also was charged a $25 late fee. Why? Because I paid my January payment 2 days before their billing cycle ended! When I tried to talk to the customer service rep, she acknowledged that this is what happened but blamed me for it and argued that all credit cards are this way. I am almost 50 years old and have several credit cards and they do not operate this way. I paid all of them early in December and I was not penalized. I even asked to speak to management, he refused to help and talked to me like I was an idiot for having a problem with how they do business. I will not do business with them ever again. I will pay my card off and give my business to Lowes.

name: Donna Marie Vitale-Field
review: I have the same complaint against home deport CITI BANK.  I closed my account after 20 years too!

name: Tina Hanson
review: I made a few purchases at different times that qualified for the 18 month no interest promotion. I forgot to make a payment one month, with usually means you have voided the promotional terms.  I called them up, and no problem they said, no interest still applied.  When the 18 months were up on one of the promotions, I didn't pay it off in full.  Completely my fault, as it's clearly written on the statement in more than one spot when the due date is for each purchase.  The next month I was charged the accumulated interest of $259.  Sickening, considering that I was only a few dollars short, but again, my own fault.  I paid the interest and made another payment on the balance of the last purchase.  On the next statement, they credited my payment, PLUS they credited back the $259 interest charge.  I am beyond impressed. We have recently purchased a 30 year old home, and it's great to be able to have an interest free option to pay off all the large renovation purchases we have been making.

name: Michael Beecher
review: Customer service is AWFUL !  It took 2 months just to receive my platinum card. Be prepared to give your life history to verify byour account!  Annoying. Avoid

name: Dzevada Hadziahmetovic-Kladusak
review: Can I used my Sears Platnium MasterCard if I traveling outside for vacations,,,Internacional or Europe

name: Ana Caragia
review: The worst  customer service ever and customer representative management is incompetent, they only can and are willing to say "no", "unfortunately I can not..." ... like somebody already wrote :".. When you call to talk to a representative the management are idiots." ... when I opened my credit card they asked for my email, my mail address and my phone number, and when for no reasons I payed late( I assume I forgot what date was my balance due date) they was unable to reach me at any of this to let me know, so why do they get all of this information from us when they sell credit cards???? I called them to fix this and I got all the "no", "I can not", " I'm not in charge of .." answers! There is no "customer service" that The Best Buy Credit Card representatives are aware of!  As theirs negative answers are always, my thoughts about best buy credit card are always going to be NEGATIVE! NO CREDIT FOR BEST BUY CREDIT CARD!

name: Julia Wallace
review: Spoke to a rep at Citibank today and was surprised to find out that my "6 moths same as cash" offer was NOT for 6 billing cycles, but rather 6 months from the date of the purchase. It took 2 months and multiple calls on my end to ever get the card sent to me in the first place and my first bill didn't arrive until 2 months after the purchase was made. I paid a huge chunk of the balance leaving myself $200/month to pay over the next 5 billing cycles. Boy was I surprised to learn that I actually had 2 billing cycles left to pay off my balance (the current one for which I was making a payment and next month's) meaning that I actually only had 3 billing cycles in which to pay off my card (not 6!) because my 4th cycle due date would occur AFTER the 6th month from my PURCHASE date. So, don't be fooled by their same as cash offers - it seems from reading other reviews that getting your card and beginning to receive statements has been a hassle for everyone. Any company that cannot issue their cards and set up monthly statements should not penalize their customers for their own lack of competence. Remember, whether you receive a statement or not, you are "on the clock" and need to start making payments right away (even if you don't have an account number!!) Really a rip-off!

name: Dave Mangan
review: The card itself is good enough, the customer service is horrid.  I know bad customer service I work for Comcast...  I had "Xena" refuse to help me because the 'website doesn't accept Google Chrome, and it would be pointless'.  Seriously screw these people.

name: Christal Barreto
review: I've had my card for almost 4yrs and have always paid on time and I ask for a credit line increase for the first time and I get denied! What gives!? I have worked hard to build my credit and now I have a hard inquiry on my credit!! Thanks for NOTHING!! Paying this ridiculous card off and closing my account!!

name: James Wheeler Jr.
review: I just applied for this card and the application process was very quick and easy online. I was approved for $7,000 dollars. The option to transfer my balance on one of my bank credit cards with 21 months of no interest is a blessing. I am currently paying $35.00 dollars in interests fees a month that could be going towards the balance. Very pleased indeed.

name: Marlo Abston
review: This is a great card for those individuals that are looking to do a balance transfer.   I've had the card for a few years and even AFTER their wonderful promotion ended (0% on bt's for 15months) they still offered balance transfers at a 3% rate with 0% interest for various times.  I use this when my promotions run up on other cards and only pay a one time 3% balance transfer fee.  Sometimes it gives you an additional 12 months at 0%.   Again, even after the promo ends, they will allow you to do balance transfers for a one time fee of 3%, and they will give you sometimes 6, 12, or 18 months with 0%.  A great tool to use to avoid paying high interest...

name: Mike Julie
review: The Best Buy store card is a fairly typical store card. You get 2.5 points for every dollar spent at Best Buy and redeem the points in the form of a $5 voucher for every 250 points spent. You can opt for special no interest financing and the term depends on the price. However you have to chose between special financing or points - you can't do both.

name: Mike Julie
review: Citi Double Cash is one of the best cash rewards cards on the market today. The reward structure is a little unique in that you get 1% cash back at the time of purchase and 1% when you pay the balance for an effective 2% cash back. There is no annual fee but there is a quite high (3%) foreign transaction fee, so I wouldn't recommend using this card when you're traveling internationally.

name: Stephen McPeak
review: I have had this credit card for years, back when it was still a MasterCard. The rewards for this card are subpar at best, since you only get points to use at Best Buy. if you do a lot of shopping at Best Buy that is great, if not, not so much. I have had trouble in the past with their customer service about not applying a payment properly. So be prepared to fight for what you need done and what should have been done in the first place.

name: Andrew Lopez
review: I got this card for one of my businesses.  We tend to buy quite a bit of office supplies and printing materials.  Having this card helped us streamline our purchases.  We also enjoyed no interest payments initially, which was great considering we were doing consignment work.  This card is backed by citibank and their customer service is very good.  Application process was smooth but we did have to provide additional information after the online application.  Overall I would recommend this card to business owners.

name: troy mcbrair
review: So this card is a double edge sword. On one end, it allows you to purchase something that may be a little out of your price range for 0% for 18-48mo, and on the other end, it allows you to do just that, often spending much more than you anticipated. Obtaining the card was exceptionally easy. I needed a new laptop and didn't want to charge it to my personal credit card. I told a store clerk what i needed and all of a sudden i was approved for an exceptionally high amount. I didn't complain. The one gripe i did have however, is you cant have your cake and eat it to. What i mean by that, is either you can choose their 0% financing like i did for my laptop, or you can get 5% cash back on your purchase. Honestly, I don't mind that much as I can make my money work harder for me during that 18mo time frame than what it would have gotten me had i done the cash back. Overall, as long as you don't miss a payment(read the T&C if you do), this card is an excellent payment plan.

name: Julianne Heninger
review: This is a total scam. They allow you to make large purchases as "18 mo interest free w/ payments" but then if you make any other purchases your payments will go towards them instead of your large purchase which makes you not pay off the large purchase in time then you will procure all of the backed interest. When you call to talk to a representative the management are idiots.

name: La-Taunya Booker
review: You simply have to subtract your more recent purchase from your balance and figure out your monthly payment for the 0% and add your new purchase amount to that amount.  This way you are paying for both purchases on a monthly basis.  I had to figure that out because my 0% promotion is ending soon.  I will have paid off my promotion in a timely fashion.  voila, no deferred interest:)

name: Joshua Rowlett
review: This card is pretty good for my big purchases or for when I want to go on a vacation with y kids and friends. It is really easy to use, and there is no late fee charge. On my other cards, I would have to pay like and extra 7 dollars if there was a late fee, and it was very annoying. With other card holders, they would pay my bills for me if they were online, but this would cause me to be overdrawn and I would have to pay the extra fee. It made me very upset, but this card does not do that.

name: Vinay Kedia
review: I am very happy with the service I receive on the card, right from application, to dispute resolutions to adhoc requests. There have times where the customer service have got out of the way to stop a payment I had already made by the card wehn I realised that the transaction was to be cancelled. Very professional and no hidden charges. I have been using this since 2 years, and have no issues at all. Highly reccommend for a hassle-free experience and convinient option.

name: Lily Yee
review: I like that with this card, one can choose 2 versions. 1 version is only good for best buy items or the other version you can use it as a regular credit card and good for anywhere. I like using it for best buy items since the store has constant promotions of interest free purchases for either 12 or 18 months. I bought a dyson vaccuum for 600ish and just pay like 50 a month. Ifind it super helpful to have when I want to buy things like fridges and washing machines. The online payment is through citi bank which is easy to use

name: Pa Mike
review: I travel frequently and every time I leave the state I have to call their rude customer service people and tell them I'm traveling, otherwise they put a stop on credit charged away from home. Total crap! stopped using it and went to Marathon. No problems. Goodbye Shell!

name: clutchclark
review:
Exactly. 
This card is blocked at the pump every time I attempt to fuel up away from my home area and requires much time to contact the Fraud Dept to get it unlocked. 
This card is a complete waste of time.

In fact, last time it was blocked at a gas station that I use regularly in the same town as my billing address.

CITI Bank Fraud Department is out-of-control.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: When it comes to tech gear, the blue and yellow is a great store. Better yet, it's difficult to walk out without having spent a $1000 on a new appliance (TV, game systems, games, etc.). That being said, the deferred payments option is great. I utilize this option to collect interest on the money that I would normally use on site. It's very nice, and as long as you remind yourself to pay on time, you won't be hit with the high APR. If you are a frequent Best Buy shopper, you should check out this card.

name: Jen Ctrus
review: AAdvantage Citi Platinium Select is a total scam. They promise you free bag on domestic trips as well as Group A priority boarding. Be warned that those promises are lies--you wil be chrged $25 for your luggage. Also when you contact them for any customer service related to those charges you will be sent from AA to Citi and back from Citi to AA--none of those scammers will help you. You can't even dispute travel related charges with Citi. That is right, they will tel you to contact AAdvantage and AA will send you back to Citi... STAY AWAY! You have been warned.

name: Narendra Paladugu
review: I am satisfied with this card because it is having rewards storing facility when I will buy in this store. This points I can use when they will become maximum so that I can get some electronics with those. Even customer service is good, always the workers will receive customers with smile and never they will be angry, having good helping nature. The worst thing is billing section, have to wait so much time near billing counter.

name: kena_galvan
review: AVOID Citibank Credit Cards! My friend and I were taken on an education scam. We charged part of the cost to Citibank and part to USAA, the majority, $30k, to Citibank. I have great credit and a 18 month 0% interest - so put the majority on that card. When we found out it was a scam, about a week after the charge, I contacted Citibank, and my friend contacted USAA. My friend wrote one letter to USAA - and they rejected the charge. I have written 6 letters over the course of 7 months, including the letter from USAA rejecting the charge, as Citibank went back and forth with the vendor. Now - Citibank has refused to protect me - their customer!!! They sided with the vendor with an "oh well" and demand payment with in 15 days. Since USAA did side with the customer - I have proof that this was fully their choice. They chose to pay the scam artist instead of protect me. I have never once paid late, carried a balance, or done anything other than be a model customer.Well Citibank - I am shouting your lack of customer service from every rooftop I can find! No amount of promos can offset this!

name: Yourhusbands Fling
review: Citi Diamond Preferred is my number one go to card. This card has the highest credit limit of all of my cards. This card also has promotions for balance transfers and first purchases at 0 percent financing. This is can really you alot of money. This card is excepted almost everywhere that I have tried.

name: Sanda Secic
review: I wish i never have gotten this card. My credit score is 810 and my interest rate on this card is 25.99%!!! Insane! What's the point of having a good score if they are going to give you interest rate that high?

name: Philip Chandler
review: I obtained this card about six months ago, and have nothing but good things to say about it!  I used it to purchase a high-end "smart" TV for about $600.00, and paid an extra $150.00 for a five-year guarantee, and slightly less than this  to have their "Geek Squad" deliver the TV, install it, connect it to the cable box, test it, etc. the next day.  After having the card in my possession for about four months, and after conducting it impeccably, I asked for and received a credit line increase from $4,000.00 to $6,000.00.  Given that I am a computer fanatic and love the latest gadgets, this card is ideally geared for my usage.  Furthermore, I recently used two $45.00 rebate certificates to pay for a 21.MHz pixel digital camera which cost about $99.99 when shipping and tax were added, so I got myself a really good digital camera for less than $10.00!The statements are clear and easy to read, and this card permits downloads into Quicken with reliability.  I use it for almost all of my purchases precisely because it brings in so much in terms of rebate certificates (I have already earned an extra $10.00 in rebate certificates since applying the two $45.00 certificates to the cost of the camera).For some time, I did not use the card other than for sporadic minor purchases.  I then decided to use it for an entire month's purchases, and received telephone calls asking me if I was indeed using the card at the various establishments where I had used it.  These calls were generated by the fraud detection specialists, and upon confirming my identity and that I was indeed the user of the card, they removed the "warm" card status which had apparently been applied to my account (I tried buying Quicken 2016 online and was initially declined using this card; I resubmitted my request using this card just minutes later, and received my Quicken upgrade).Furthermore, TWO fraud security analysts called me on my home and cell phones to confirm that I was the legitimate user of the card.I anticipate future travel to South Africa and to Germany, and will almost certainly use this card for all purchases, due to the cash back feature and due to the lack of a foreign exchange fee.I have always received courteous and professional help from the customer support personnel, and have never been treated rudely or disrespectfully, as so many people above state have been their experiences.This card also comes with "Chip and signature" technology (or perhaps "Chip and PIN" technology), which is coming to the United States (indeed, many stores already have the appropriate new readers).  This means that I am guaranteed that this card will work overseas when I travel to South Africa and to Germany, and I will not have to wait around while hotel concierges call Visa for authorizations due to their readers not being able to accept only magnetic stripe cards (in fact, some vendors in Europe and the UK will ONLY accept "Chip and Pin" technology).I do not know if I have simply been lucky, given the numerous negative references above, but I cannot overstate my satisfaction with this card.PHILIP CHANDLER

name: Ian Goodwin
review: The double cash card, as advertised, is one of the only cards to offer 2% cash back on all purchases. I love it because I do not need to shop at particular stores, buy groceries at particular grocery stores, or get gas at particular stations. It's great. I love the freedom! Customer service is also spectacular. I felt like a human because I interacted with a human! I felt like they knew me well and wanted me as a customer. Get this card.

name: Lauren Faust
review: Customer service could really care less about you. All they see is how to rip you off! They have supposed "catch up"/hardship plans to help you during hard times but what they neglect to tell you is that they will continue to charge you a $35 late fee every month until you are current, even though they are automatically withdrawing the agreed upon amount every month on time. Soulless people working there!!

name: John Villegas
review: Pretty bad Card and customer service. I WILL NOT RECOMMEND this card at all. Beware of Citi, I am planning to cancel this credit card and I will cancel my other card as soon as I am done paying off

name: Brandon Smith
review: This is a great rewards card. They also offer some great promotions depending on your credit score. I got free balance transfers and no APR for 18 months. The card itself has been wonderful. I simply put all my bills on it every month, pay them off, and enjoy the double cash rewards. You can redeem the rewards as a statement credit or in other ways. This is my main card and I would recommend it to everyone.

name: Julie Weil Brown
review: I liked this card when I first started using it about 8 years ago.  There were more flights available for which to use the mileage. However, it seems like during the last 2 years, there are fewer flights and less opportunities to use the mileage making the less desirable.  I opened another account that does not have the transaction fees and the points can be used on any airline.

name: Willaim Foster
review: I gotta admit, when I first got this card I ran out to best buy just to try out the "chip" that they've put inside of the card.  It's the first credit card that i've had that's got a chip inside of it.  After the novelty wears off, I realized that I still have a very decent credit card.  The 0% intro APR and No Late Fees Ever has been a true blessing.  Still waiting to see what will happen after the 21st month,  I will try and update on here to let you guys know.  But so far,   this card is my favorite to pull out of my wallet.  Thank you Citi Bank !!

name: Rich Marshall
review: I'm extremely mixed on the card. On every day spend, you'll actually earn more AA miles by using the SPG Amex and transferring to AA at 20:25 than you will by simply using the AA branded card itself. If you travel on AA often, however, this card has several things going for it: The sign up bonus is fantastic and the annual fee is waived. You get 10% of your redeemed miles back which can easily be worth the $95 annual fee if you're redeeming 70k+ miles a year on AA. You also get priority boarding access which is always a plus. I would never advocate for this card unless you often fly AA and will make use of the redeemed miles back & the priority boarding often enough to warrant the annual fee, but don't want to step it up to the Executive's $450 AF and get lounge access as well.

name: JoJo Giera
review: Horrible! I got approved for a 18 month no interest. I started getting charged interest after 6 months. READ THE FINE PRINT.

name: Shelley Berkman
review: This credit card company, like all credit card companies waits for you to be late on a payment and then punishes you severely by jacking up the rate.  I was late on ONE of my payments and I had a very good reason for it.

name: Daniel Garber
review: They claim there is no penalty APR..

name: Courtney Freihaut
review: The reason I applied for this card is that I wanted to transfer a large balance I had from another card to this Citi Diamond card since it offered a great balance transfer option.  I am very pleased that it had the offer of 0% interest through April 2017.  It will give me enough time to pay off the balance without a high fee being attached.  I have had a very good experience so far in the 3 months I have had this card and plan to stick with this company in the future.

name: Ray Jan
review: The worst card ever. Highway robbery. Save yourself a headache. Get different card then this trash

name: Edward Carpenter
review: I was drawn to this card by the incentive of DOUBLE cash back. this sounded very appealing to me. I applied and was approved and had my card in about 9 days. I have been using for about 3 months now and can say that you do get 2% cash back across the board as long as you pay in full every month. This is a great rewards card just because of this. Highly recommended

name: Stephen Quimby
review: The Citi Double Cash card pays me 2% back on purchases, has no annual fee, and offers other rewards and benefits. I am paid 1% upon making the purchase, and an additional 1% when I pay for the purchase. The annual percentage rate is reasonable, but since I pay back in full every month that's not an issue. Another benefit is Citi's excellent customer service.

name: pablo haller
review: I´ve been with Citibank since 8 years now and I find that compared to other mayor banks they really stand out by their professionalism and customer service . Other than easy to waive account fees and tailored cut services for your situation, ( my case a small businness ) the reason I stick with them is rather the customer relations. They really thrive out to make it easy for you on every level. Last month I traveled abroad, needed to open an account in country I was in and they practically took care of everything .

name: Justin Snowden
review: This card is great as long as you are not late on your payments. The introductory 0% APR on purchases for the 1st 21 months is awesome as long as you maintain it. However, what my APR becomes after the introductory period being anywhere from 12 to 23% APR means I may only be using this card for the first 21 months.

name: Niikholeezz Marsilia
review: I've paid three times for a $400 iPad Never use this card -crazy feed and interest ratesI will take them to court

name: Steve Negen
review: I have their travel card.  Priceline is $1,100 round trip.  Sears travel is $2,000 for the exact same flights.  Plus the $229 fee.  So my 200,000 miles I was saving for a trip were actually only 100,000 miles by Sears math.  Cancelled!

name: Aimee Scharff
review: I had been considering getting this gas card for several years. I like that it offers five cents per gallon off for all Shell gas purchases. I like that the card has no annual fee. It has a high interest rate, but I pay off my cards in full every month. Overall, I would recommend the Shell Gas Card.

name: Rachel Dwyer
review: Best Buy representative misrepresented the card and terms in the store.  Even though I paid the ENTIRE balance a week or so after the purchase.  I started get bills for added fees.  I called and got them adjusted or so I thought until I called the customer service line today.  Not only did they not take off the fee, they added a late fee on top of that fee.  Suddenly they want me to pay $84 so that I can have a $55 rewards card?  What sense does that make?  The only positive thing was that the representative I talked to the second time said that she'd take off the late fee.  She also said that the only way she could take off the original $55 fee (some annual fee that the Best Buy representative promised was a one time fee and taken care of in the store) was by closing the account.  DONE!  Don't bother with this card.  If you actually need the credit, you would be in rougher shape than me.  Caveat Emptor, even if the Best Buy store rep tells you what a great deal it is.

name: Lenny Seidel
review: I just applied for and received my CITI Thank you Premier. It took approximately a month due to the most incompetent people I've ever met. I'll give them the three thousand in purchases in the three months with not the slightest problem. I'll take my $500 gift card or $650 airline credit then go back to American Express. Maybe fewer points but far better service. I Had to wait 22 minutes to get through on the phone while they bombed me with ads for Sears and other companies. When a bull mates with a cow the bull is said to have "serviced the cow". That's about the same service CITI supplies. As soon I get My AMEX Gold Card back I'g going to cut my CITI card up into little pieces and send it to CITI's V.P. for this division. I will suggest that during his nex colonoscopy he ask the doctor to shove it as far up as it will go. By the way. I have an 810 credit score so I'm sure AMEX will be glad to have me back. This site forces you to give a minimum of one star which makes this site overrated.

name: Trish Wish
review: The Goodyear Credit Card provides peace of mind to it's consumers because you never know when you can get a flat tire or need auto repair.  This company has many international locations, which is great especially on road trips, knowing I can get my car fixed and tires replaced wherever I am in the United States. Although the interest rate is high,  the grace period allows 25 days for payments.  I also like there is a cap of$38 for a late fee. and no over the limit fee.  I like this card for repairs, tires emergencies, and especially road trips.

name: Matthew Taylor
review: I signed up for the card about 6 years ago when I was looking for a new TV.  Although the deferred payment plan is nice should you not have the cash on hand, I would avoid using it unless it's a necessity.  The interest really adds up and can catch you off guard if you aren't fully aware of when it needs to be paid off.  I mainly use the card for purchases that I can pay off immediately and store the reward certificates to use on future purchases.  My only real complaint is the exorbitantly high late fee.  Be sure to pay a few days early whenever possible!  Overall I have been very pleased with the card and would make the same choice again in a heartbeat.

name: Robert Trump
review: I have used this card over the years to pay for repairs or tires on my vehicles.  Had an automatic payment agreement for years.  Suddenly Citibank changed my payment without notification.  They applied hundreds of dollars of interest on the account.  Claimed details that I never agreed to.   They are awful and will not work with me after i never missed any payments.  i will not be using this card anymore.  It is frightening how much extra interest they are dumping on.  Makes it extremely difficult to pay off.

name: Robin Nyles
review: I love my Shell Gas Station MasterCard !! I earn gas discounts for every single dollar I spend! I can earn up to 20 cents off my first one hundred gallons per month!!  I can use my 25 grace period to pay off my entire balance each month and so I avoid interest charges. The Shell Gas Station MasterCard comes with no annual fee. I love this card, I use it frequently and love the gas savings!! They are incredible!!

name: Kelsey Turner
review: The Home Depot card is great for higher value purchases because of the deferred interest policy if paid in full within 6 months.  After that, the APR is a little higher, but if you can pay the item off in 6 months, this is a great card to have on hand.  The policy varies for specific items (some are 12 months deferred interest), but a deferred interest policy in general is great.  With no annual fee, this is a nice card if you can manage paying on time and in the time frame to receive deferred interest.

name: Marissa Cox
review: I recently joined Citibank and opened an Access Account to deposit my funds from my online business. In the week I've been a member their customer service has been fantastic and I am so pleased with my account. The monthly fee is low and it is easy enough to have it waived just by having a qualifying direct deposit or paying a bill. Citi's fantastic customer service is enough to make me a loyal customer! You don't see service like that often.

name: Justyn Bigam
review: I would only consider getting this Sears credit card if I had a very large purchase to make. I would use if for the free shipping and $20 off with a new card. The outrageous interest rate of over 25%, coupled with the foreign transaction fee, make this card a prime candidate to be used once and then immediately paid off and canceled. The only real long term plus I see to this card is the smart chip.

name: Marissa Barrow
review: The Sears Credit Card has the great intro APR of 0% which is great if you are going to do a balance transfer to pay it down but once outside of the introductory 0% APR window the regular 25.24% APR is quite high. The additional discounts you receive on Sears merchandise put this card well above my regular Chase credit card which does not give me any discounts or rewards.

name: William Brown
review: The best buy credit card was a decent card but the yearly fee and customer service sucks the little features is cool when buying things but thats about it maybe it's just me try it for yourself.

name: Yvette Rivas
review: Worst card my husband and I have ever had to deal with. We had to change our billing address and they blocked the entire account, because of "specialists" activity. They didn't let us know about this either they just let us decline at Walmart line while we were grocery shopping. So we called costumer service and they were absolutely no help they told us we could go to a Best Buy store and clear this all up.. That wasn't the case. We had to send a document with photo ID to identify that it really was us. So we did and they told us we had to send it again because we didn't say we wanted restrictions off all because the representative we spoke to before about this didn't tell us to do so. It's been three weeks without the card and we are still waiting for them to call and tell us we can us it. No doubt we are going to cancel this card when we get it paid. Too much fuckery to deal with.

name: diallo moss
review: So I read up on the Tire Kingdom Card and from what I gather the card is ok if you just want to use it to make a purchase that will be paid back quickly but with an APR of almost $30 following the introductory period I doubt that I would use it myself.If you don't have a real credit card and need tires badly this may work for you but for those of us with decent credit there are better options.

name: Chelsea Clark
review: While the 5% reward rate is appealing, the extremely high APR of 27.99% is exorbitant. It is not worth it, in my opinion. I have heard of other cards, such as the Walmart Business Store Card, with a much lower APR of about 14%. The maximum late fee of $38 is comparable to other cards, and the grace period of 25 days is also comparable. What I really like about this card is the online accessibility of the account, for faster payment and an easy way to keep track of everything. Overall, I would choose to find a different card.

name: Troy Johnson
review: Applying for a card these days should always come with some sort of bonus incentive. The Staples card doesn't have any incentive bonus, which is the first major strike. My Chase Freedom card came with a $150 bonus, so I'm slightly disappointed the Staples card receives nothing. The regular APR is just under 30% is the 2nd major strike, making this card an all around terrible deal. The only saving grace is no annual fee and the 5% back on rewards. The free shipping seems debatable, since there are two major exclusions. Overall, this card is not worth the meager 5% bonus.

name: B Darren Bulloch
review: I've used the Home Depot credit card several times when I have purchased large appliances.  I was able to get deferred interest on my purchases over $299 if I paid in full before six months time. I also used it for a carpet purchase with the same offer.  I really like Home Depot stores and I've always found that the employees are quite willing to negotiate prices on large appliances,  giving me even better prices than online deals.  I don't us the card often, but I keep the account open for the convenience when making larger purchases.

name: Matt Clark
review: The L.L. Bean card is a solid option if you like shopping at L.L. Bean, and is an especially good card if you like your clothing monogrammed - the card includes free, unlimited monogramming on purchases made at L.L. Bean. The terms are pretty standard for a card like this - there's a max late fee of $37, which seems reasonable, and again, the 3% bonus' cash' is nice if you shop at L.L. Bean that often (the rewards are issued in L.L. Bean store credit). Like any store card of this nature, you're going to get better use out of it the more you shop at the store.

name: Tara Laterza
review: Have you noticed the $50 off if you spend $150 or more add?? It is a total scam!!! All over the staples card center area it tells you to apply today by "clicking here" and you will get $50 off if you are approved. But then if you look closely, right by the APPLY NOW button it says "in-store applications only." Yet when you call on the phone and ask, they say it doesn't matter how you get approved, that as long as you spend $150 or more within 45 days and are a new card member, you will get this $50. Guess what....3 months and 5 phone calls later - this big company STAPLES said to me basically "well even though you had to go to the store and pick up your $850 worth of products and were approved, hitting apply now online did not qualify you!!! Unbelievable!!!! The amount of money my whole family spends in this store makes them a profit well over $50. That is just bad business and why buying from a huge company is so impersonal. This would never happen with a small business - it would be more personable without using a scam method of APPLY NOW button all over the place and uninformed sales reps telling you its okay to do it online.

name: Reem Khaldi
review: My rate may have been a little high at first, but they have EXCELLENT customer service which is so very important to me. Upon speaking to them a few times I was able to lower my rate here and there, and they sometimes have offers for you that you may not see online. They have always resolved any issues I've had quickly and efficiently. They truly try to please all their customers and I'm very happy with being a loyal customer.

name: Jen Buller
review: The smart chip is something I have and love in another card that I have, not all stores are using their smart chip devices but more are. However the APR seems rather high to me compared to other cards I have with Chase. I do like that the Expedia credit card gives you 3 points for every $1 that is spent, this is higher than what my other card currently offers. Overall the Expedia credit card seems to be a good deal.

name: Morgan White
review: I have had Home depot cards given to me before but the last card I bought from the store. It was easy and painless and was a good way to set aside saved money for a boat project I was planning. It made it easy to plan for a hardware budget knowing exactly how much I had to spend I recommend the card and the store.

name: Sandy Pray
review: Due to an error by the salesclerk in inputting my address, I never received my card or bill.  A month later I started receiving robocalls from Citi, only on weekends or after hours, asking me to call them about my credit card during business hours.  Having no cards from Citi, my husband and I ignored them for about two weeks as a scam.  When we finally did call back to ask them to take us off their calling list, they wouldn't unless we gave them our account number.  Another red flag!  When we finally were able to have someone explain that this was in regards to a Staples card, we realized what they were referring to.  We asked for a bill to be sent to the proper address but were told we were still responsible for the full amount immediately WITH INTEREST!  Reluctantly they agreed to forgo the interest and said they were mailing me a bill.  It is now a week later, still getting automated calls, and when I called back again they said the bill is still due on the 16th whether I receive a copy of it or not.  So they can take over a week to GET me the bill but I still have to, regardless, get them payment by the 16th.  OR I can blindly give them my bank information over the phone to take care of this immediately.  And again, it was the error of the salesclerk here, nothing I did at all.  Staples manager was very helpful in obtaining the account number for me at the store this evening (something Citi won't give me over the phone at the same time they'll take my bank information mind you...) but I can't even call to check my balance because my account is in collections.  An account I don't even have access to despite asking them to mail, fax, or email anything to me proving its existence or verifying the amount I owe.  Trust me, the benefits of the 5% aren't enough in the whole world to make me keep this card.  At 27.99% interest you can take your chances at missing one payment or having a bill lost- I won't.  Customer service is absolutely horrible- check Consumer Affairs complaints.

name: Joseph
review: So many people keep having this exact same problem... sounds like this "accidental" address mix up is a straight up scam in full operation. The are following the same pattern with everyone.., someone should consult a lawyer and consider a class action lawsuit...

name: Darlene Todd
review: Because I did not buy my items on same day they only gave me the 6 months deferred interest. When I called about see if I could combined my items and get the 12 months I was told they did not offer the 12 months during my purchase. As a good consumer of Home Depot you would think they would have been able to do something.

name: Nonya Busy
review: Since I work from home, I need a lot of things for my office, and Staples is the best and cheapest place to go to for that.  Normally, I am a tightwad, but Staples is one of those places where you can buy in bulk and save a whole bunch. I bought a new chair for my desk since the other one was hurting my back, and I also bought a printer, with a few other things like paper, pens, and a few huge stacks of sticky notes. This was when I actually got the $50 dollars off of my purchase. I was so happy because i saved a bunch and still had a bunch left over after that. It really does come in handy.

name: Stephen McPeak
review: The Brooks Bothers Credit Card is my primary go to card whenever I need to make a purchase. The rewards I receive this just can't be beat by anything else I have. Their website goes above and beyond to help you understand your spending habits and show you ways to improve. If you are eligible, you should definitely apply for this card.

name: Nonya Busy
review: There is a Sears right down the street from me, and it is one of the main places that I like to do business at. The best part about this card is that you can make purchases online, and they give you special discounts because of it. When Holiday time comes around, I usually do all of my shopping online, and Sears has this fast and efficient service all of the time.  I like to buy major appliances from there, and when I do that, I get 5% off of my transaction.  This might not seem like a lot, but in the end it actually does add up.

name: Rose Chase
review: Unless you shop at Radio Shack frequently, I would think having this store  credit card would be unnecessary, using any other credit card would do for making a random purchase at this store.  I saw it offer free shipping and 15% off of batteries, those are very good things to offer from Radio Shack.  The APR seems a little bit high, higher than my rate on my Discover card by almost 6%.  It doesn't seem like a card with the energy to apply for so that it would collect dust in a wallet when there are much better cards out there to use when shopping Radio Shack.

name: jenniferm2
review: I have been with Citibank for 10 years. They were my very first credit card. That said, while they have raised my credit limit several times, they have NEVER lowered my 29.99% interest rate. I have asked several times and they always have an excuse. It's very frustrating to be a loyal customer and not be rewarded. Their rewards points are a joke. You have to save a ton of them to get a paperback book. It's pretty pointless- pun intended. They have handled a couple of fraud cases for me and the customer service was pretty good. They send out a new credit card within a day. The only issue I had was that they I requested proof of fraud, such as a letter from them for a court case, and they never sent it. They required I request in online which I did more than once and they never mailed or emailed it to me and I got nowhere with customer service.The credit limit is good, the interest is terrible, the points system is mediocre, the customer service is fair.

name: Seonghoon Kim
review: it is not good at all. Citi card service is so slow not professional.

name: Ronald Zia
review: This card initially was great when my local Shell gas stations were accepting Shell Card as cash, because in L.A., Cash price is about 10 cent cheaper than Credit. So I was getting about 15 cent off per gallon, but this no longer the case. Gas station is now taking Shell card as credit card instead of cash, so I'm only getting 5 cent off per gallon.

name: Troy Bridges
review: The card has a decent rewards program, and the deferred billing options are nice. Be careful though, if you do not pay the balance off on time the interest rates can be painful. Be sure to read all of the fine print on the deferred billing options so you are not surprised when you get your statement. As with any credit card, be sure you know what the card parameters are and use credit wisely.

name: kayleighj1
review: Citibank is not the bank I chose originally, but when my girlfriend and I combined finances, this is the institution she used. Putting me on her account was easy, until I tried to use my card anywhere. The banker put my name and card info with a weird mix of an old address with her mothers zipcode that took forever to figure out. Once we got that figured out, we ran into new problems: the hours of the bank. If I need to do anything at the bank before or after work, I'm out of luck. Our local branch is only open 10am-5pm weekdays. Going in means either hoping for an odd weekday off or requesting time off of work. We still use this bank, but once we move out of Bakersfield we will probably be switching to something that has more customer service in mind.

name: Jordan Westphal
review: Great card. I receive 2.5 points for every dollar spent, which really adds up over time. You can get reward certificates quite fast if you shop at Best Buy a lot, which I do. There is also no annual fee which is fantastic. I don’t always use the financing over time feature, but it has been helpful when I have.

name: Dana Lee
review: The AT&T Access More Card from Citi has lots of benefits of using compared to other cards you could choose. You earn points on all purchases and are not just limited to certain things such as groceries or gas. It has a low transfer APR which is on average or lower than most cards. The only thing I did not like about it is that the introductory interest rate of 0% is only for 7 months. And after that jumps up pretty high. Im not sure the benefits of points and transfer fees outweigh the APR, but it is great for your AT&T purchases. I would recommend this card to anyone who is an AT&T customer and might want to transfer.

name: Jackie Agbay
review: This card was okay for what it is. I enjoyed the ability to get electronics when I needed them with an easy to pay online system, however during the course of my use with this card they switched over banks and I found it increasingly difficult to pay. All of my account information was changed and I decided that I would just pay in the store where I found out they would not accept cash payments either. only card or check. The interest rate, as with most store cards was somewhat high. Overall it was okay besides the payment issues.

name: Daniel Espinosa
review: I've had nothing but good experiences with Citibank. I had to set up an account since my other bank account started charging me an annual fee for not having a set minimum balance in my son's account. I found a Citibank account which was made for students and set one up with them for my son who's just starting college. He's had no problem accessing the account and the minimum required in the account is incredibly low compared to the one thousand I had to keep in checking in the previous. I haven't had to call their customer service because I haven't had any problems with them so far.

name: Michael Solgonick
review: $50 Statement Credit5% back in Rewards,6, 12 or 18 mo. deferred financing$50 voucher for copy and print annuallyFree computer diagnosticNo brainer!!!!

name: Kristina Millan Menendez
review: I am not a person to negatively rate or review companies or locations except for when I have a significantly bag experience. This is exactly what happened when having to deal with the bank managing the Best Buy credit card (Citigroup). I purposely took out the credit card to build my credit with best buy because we are looking to buy many items for our newly remolded home and so figure that since I needed a new computer this would be the perfect opportunity. When contacting customer service for a credit increase the representative was rude and not sensitive to my needs. She basically treated me as if I was a child and disrespected me as an individual. I went ahead and closed my account immediately and refuse to work with them in the future. I am sorry for the store location because they worked so hard to meet my needs. The staff was excellent. Too bad that they will loose my business secondary to the lack of professionalism with their bank.

name: Danny Kline
review: The HD card is serviced by Citibank and they are by far one of the worst customer service companies in business. I highly recommend NOT using the HD credit card because of the following: I received a fraudulent charge on my HD CC and never received a bill showing that I had a charge that month. After 60 days since that charge posted to my account I received a call from Citibank asking when I was going to pay the $8.00 bill. After investigations on both sides and being forwarded to a Citibank manager, they agreed to remove the charge from my account. The manager insured me that a late note would not be posted to my credit report. 30 days later a letter came in the mail that Citibank reviewed the mater and since it was not a bank error they would not remove the 30 day late note on my credit report. I have never had a negative note on my credit report my whole life. I went around and around with customer service managers but they claimed there was nothing they could do. I took this up with the credit agencies showing them the last payment to the account was in May and I received this 30 day late in August, yet Citi kept claiming they reported it correctly. This negative report dropped my credit score by over 75 points and put me into a lower class of acceptance, which made my refinance of my home cost more monthly. I stopped using my HD CC because of this and they sent me a letter a year later stating because of my lack of use they were canceling me. I have now stop using Home Depot and Citibank. Lowes now gets all my business. Please join me.

name: Johnny Moore L Moore
review: I chose this card because of its 21 month zero interest on transfers, Also because of no annual fee, no late fee or penalty rate. Approval was quick and easy. What I do not like is the variable interest rate after the 21 months but is is still more reasonable than many other cards.

name: Chris Cherry
review: The fee on this card is $95, not $125. The $500 initial member bonus, along with the first year waiver, gives you the equivalent of six years for free. It also pays 3 points per dollar on travel and entertainment (including gas), not 1.2 as stated elsewhere. Travel also includes airlines, hotels, car rental, taxis, subways and even road tolls. Entertainment includes theater, movie, concert and most sports tickets. You get a 25% bonus on travel redemptions, so you can earn up to 3.75 points per dollar depending on how you use the card. I don't know of any other card that offers bonus points in all these areas.For international travelers, most other cards have up to a 5% surcharge on foreign currency purchases, this card does not.  Added with the normally preferential exchange rates all cards offer you can save quite a bit if you travel overseas. Customer service has never been an issue, as their mobile apps do everything I've ever needed. Everyone is different, but if you travel on multiple airlines and eat out quite a bit, this may be a good option.  You have to consider how you normally use cards and what redemption options you want.

name: Jackie Dill
review: The service with this card is great. I got this card when my computer just up and died on me and I realized it would be just as much to buy a new one as it would be to fix the old one. Not long after we had been paying on it monthly our limit was extended by $500. They were very understanding about the situation when we had to make a payment late. I'm sure it will come in handy around Christmas time when the nephews start asking for all the new gadgets.

name: Muhammad Sher
review: WORST. I kept asking many best buy personal that how my payments are directed and i always got reply that either they don't know or it goes towards promotions first. I always wondered that i select financing yet my minimum payments stay the same, so i always paid more that twice or thrice of that the minimum payment because I didn't want to pay interest. Now that I look back at the statements there are hundreds of dollars of interest charges, one charge was 300$. when i called they said that if you don't pay the promotional deal off, they charge all the interest that would have applied as if i never financed in the first place.
