I can not believe how manipulative best buy credit card people are. I hate best buy now, promise never to buy anything after being a loyal customer for many years.

name: Sheila Sanders
review: The Citi Simplicity card is great if you are trying to pay down some debt. You can get over a year and half with zero percent interest.  That is amazing if you have debt sitting on 6% or more. I would just try not to transfer more than you can handle since it then goes up to 12.99% or higher. Otherwise, the card seems a little weak because of the lack of rewards for additional spending. Of course, if you are trying to get out of debt, you may not be purchasing anything on it anyway.

name: Jeff Veasy
review: What attracted me to this card is the almost two years of no interest. Combined with the lack of late fees and low transfer fee it makes a great option for paying off any accumulated debt while keeping it on one card.The lack of rewards program is too bad but it definitely makes up for it.

name: Savannah Hanson
review: I like the fact that there's no annual fee with the Shell card, but an interest rate of over 24% is much higher than any card I've ever been wiling to sign up for. $38 late fee isn't terrible, though. Seems like an OK choice for a very basic credit card, as long as you're lucky and pay off every month and don't experience any fraud (they offer zero fraud protection).

name: Scott Fado
review: Worst card and service I have! Beginning to hate Citicard accounts

name: Sky Beaver
review: Citibank Citigold is without question the worst banking experience I have ever had.  Nothing else remotely comes close.Citi offers a $400 bonus for opening an account with $50K and leaving it in the account.  Good luck ever collecting it, though.  The promotion is a total sham.I opened my account in February, it's now September, and no bonus.   They claimed it would be paid 90 days after meeting the account opening requirements, but that milestone came and went months ago.  I call them and I get bounced around the phone banks from one bumbling and useless account rep to another.There are tons of really good and competent banks out there.  TD is great, as is B of A.  Schwab offers a banking service that offers everything Citi does with much lower minimum required balances.Don't waste your time with Citi.  Band bank, bad people.

name: christina gilkey
review: Out of the 3 years that I have banked with Citibank, I have had very few issues, but, the issues that I HAVE had, were very problematic and I had a hard time getting them resolved. The main problem I had was direct deposit. I had set it up correctly, but my money was not getting deposited. After talking for hours on the phone, we determined that the numbers that were given to me on a sheet of paper from the bank that were needed for direct deposit, were the wrong numbers. Other then that though, it's been a great bank to bank with.

name: Peter Chavez
review: HORRIBLE. DONT GET IT!! My purchase was of $297, I'm enrolled in automatic payment (above minimum payment) and I called just to check on my balance cause I have about 8 months into it and its telling me that my ba;lance is $463!! WTF!! THATS ALMOST DOUBLE OF WHAT I PAID!! I called, I was polite, I was angry, I was sad- NOTHING. they didn't help me with NOTHING!! DONT GET IT!!

name: David Alexander
review: Almost every bank or financial institution today offers cards that give you rewards for every purchase, and where is Visa or Mastercard not accepted???  Rating a card based on the simple fact that they give you rewards or that it is accepted everywhere makes no sense!The Citi Thank You customer service is a joke, their people do the bare minimum, they simply handle your transaction.  They do NOT give you all the facts up front, they do NOT tell you about the fees associated with any changes, returns, cancellations, their stories and policies change depending on who you talk to, and they do NOT care about you as a customer.

name: Andrew Leonardo
review: The only thing I have to say bad about this card is the yearly fee. Other than that it's great! I used mine to buy a PS4 and got 0% financing for 12 months plus double points. The interest rate is pretty high though. So if you can get the 0% financing, plan on paying it off within the 12 month period so you don't get hit with the interest.

name: Chris Molina
review: Citibank really does a good job and cares a lot about their customers. Whenever I have a problem or there is a charge that I don't recognize, Citibank is always there to help. They offer low fee checking accounts which is great since we make every effort to avoid fees. In addition to this they have a great selection of credit cards to choose from with fantastic rewards programs. The only thing I wish that they would change is there online interface could be a little easier to use and the could integrate it more with the rewards program so you know exactly how many points you have in order to use. When it comes to which bank I will be using for the rest of my life, I think citibank is a safe bet.

name: Idalia Allred
review: I own a wedding stationery business and I use my Office Depot Business store card on a regular basis for the cost of printing and shipping from within the store. I've never had any billing issues or disputes that I've needed to make. I love that I can make payments online and I can easily keep track of my spending for accounting purposes. When you print and ship on a regular basis it is easy to lose track of your receipts and such, and with this card I can see all of my transactions via the website. As well as with Office Depot, I can pull up all of my past receipts online, as well as get my rewards.

name: Dave Smith
review: I love my best buy credit card.  It gives me the ability to finance bigger purchases over longer spans at 0% interest.  I have purchased an entire top of line entertainment system on this program.  I would not recommend going over the promotional period as you are then charge back interest from when you purchased the item.  However, if you can use this card responsibly and pay it of within the promotional time period, it really works for large purchases like home appliances or TV.s.

name: Asad Zafar
review: this is one of my favorite cards! the cashback rewards are great and so is the customer service experience.highly recommended!

name: Nathan Carper
review: I have had the Staples Business Card for almost a year now. I love the fact that there is no annual fee, I was upgraded to 5% back in Rewards and free shipping online. I have taken advantage of their Deferred Financing on several occasions for some Tech Services and some larger purchases over $299. I love that they offer financing for 6/12 or 18 months. Great Card and very flexible!

name: Nathan Carper
review: I love the Staples Card....I can take advantage of their Deferred Financing on all of my purchases over $299 and it helps me to manage all of my office spending. The 5% back in Rewards Plus free shipping is great too.

name: Carol DeMott
review: I have had a Brooks Brother credit card for many years.  Now all of the sudden the Brooks Brother card changed banks.  Today I tried to use my card with is no longer working.  I informed Citibank who now sponsors the card.  They said the new cards were sent out 10-15 days ago.  I don't have y card and have many automatic payments on the card.  Brooks Brothers was no help either!.  My rating NO stars but I am giving them a one.  Really poor customer service.  Just a real inconvenience as I am now moving on to a new credit card company because neither Citibank nor Brooks Brothers cares about their customers.

name: Marisol Contreras
review: Worst customer service ever! They blocked my online account for no reason and are asking me to fax a personal letter, a letter from best buy, and some other stuff.

name: Sandra Trojak
review: I don't understand the bad reviews for this card, as it has been a perfect first card for me and for my family. My parents helped me pick it out and since I'm a long ways from home, my mom especially feels better knowing that I have an emergency (as in what if the CAR breaks down?) go-to card. Don't get me wrong, I do use it! But I also pay off the balance each month, the same way my parents do with their card. The card has a low APR with no annual fee. I can use it at restaurants and when I buy my books (which I always have to do anyway) so therefore I get reward points. Then there's the plus of building my own credit. It's win-win!

name: Ken Ritola
review: Post office returned my February statement to Home Depot Credit I'd gotten all statements prior to that. They then BLOCKED my card and made NO attempt to notify me of the problem. 5 months later Credit Karma (which really is free) notified me that my account was delinquent. I called them and paid ALL of my balance and asked them if the delinquency could be removed now. They said absolutely not, the problem was not the banks fault, they said. So, the black mark stays on my otherwise perfect credit reports for 7 years. They are the most rude, inconsiderate boiler room jerks I've ever dealt with. If I could give them a ZERO I would.

name: Donna Marie Vitale-Field
review: I agree citti bank is the worst!

name: Gray Fang
review: This card policy lies , well in my case i do not got the six months no interest , i spend about six hundreds with them and they star charging interest since day one , i call customer service and i got no proper anwer to the offer they supposibly give ... soo i deside to pay it off and cancel this card . If they lie at first its not a trusty card.

name: Marie Lapicki
review: Citibank is THE WORST for customer service! The searscard website is often down, purchases get denied for no reason. When the customer finally gets through to customer service they can offer no reasons why the card is being denied!

name: Kenneth Green
review: I don't like that its not a secured best buy credit card. Do you have one

name: Roberto Garza
review: Citibank is big bank with many locations.  I have been a member for around 5 years after switching from a local credit union due to a move.  Citibank does not have the same kind of family feel that my old credit union had, but it gets the job done.  I am able to pay and keep up to date with all my accounts from my computer and even pay them off, which I have to admit is pretty convenient even for a dinosaur like me who barely understands technology.  The only thing I wish is that the checking or savings account would actually accrue money, however I understand this is more an issue with our time than the bank.  Overall nice bank, gets the job done, and always is there when I need to ask questions.

name: Barbie Whitten
review: I think the reward is beneficial to those who travel a lot and use the same gas station. While the idea of having 20 cents per gallon is appealing, you would need to use the same gas station each time you fill up. Now if you plan accordingly this can easily be solved and worth the savings. I personally would use the offer if I traveled more but I simply don't. Cheers to those who benefit from it.

name: Dave Smith
review: This is a great option for those that own a home and need some options on the financing. With the first year of 0% interest! It really gives you the ability to do big projects like redoing a bathroom or kitchen. It gives you the flexibility to spread the payments over a year and not pay any interest.  I would not recommend putting anything on this card that you can pay off over the year, as the interest rate is 18+% and is way to much to carry a balance with and pay it off.  But if you can use it responsibly and pay it off over the year, it is a great card.

name: Gracie Impano
review: I recently traveled overseas and my Citibank account was not being used for some time. After a while, I decided to check my balance using online banking and I was shocked to see my account was a few hundred dollars overdrawn. While my account was inactive, Citibank had kept charging me some fees and my account got overdrawn, then the fines for overdraft kept augmenting up to hundreds of dollars. I immediately contacted the bank's customer service via chat to get clarity and the lady was so understanding and friendly. She also was able to wave more than half of the fee, which reduced my negative balance. I was so happy with the way my problem was understood and taken care of that I recommend Citibank to most of my friends and relatives. Their customer support is excellent.

name: Laurent Tshisekedi
review: I've just recently been doing business with Citibank and I had a pretty good experience there. For someone like me who's never really had a credit card, they were able to answer many questions that I had and made me feel good about getting a credit card. One thing that really surprised me was how much information they gave me and how they wanted me to be responsible and careful with all my decisions. It's like I had a whole other set of parents haha.

name: Kim West
review: I use Citibank for my personal check account. I do a lot of ATM banking and their machines are state of the art and are very easy to use. Their deposit policies are great and they seem to go above and beyond overtime I have to call. The customer service staff are friendly and go out of their way to help. I have never had a problem with them. I feel they really do care about your security and relationship with them. I give Citibank a 5 of 5 for customer satisfaction.

name: Parismarie Weldon
review: I am absolutely addicted to using Home Depot, not only for Home Improvement projects but also to pick up bulk cleaning supplies, some back to school items or just for some helpful advice on a project. The Home Depot credit card makes using these services offered by Home Depot even easier! The online payment system is great and it made ordering items online for pick up or to be shipped to my home even easier!

name: Denise Mooney
review: This card is great, especially at Christmas where they always offer deferred payments and interest free purchases if paid in full within 6 months. I have had this card since 2008 and the rewards I have received are kinda slim compared to other cards I currently use but the interest rate is really competitive. They have switched lending banks several times, tho it hasn't caused me any problems. Overall a pretty good card. Very useful card!

name: Eric Rothman
review: I like this card because of the 5% off or no interest if pain in full within 12 months on select items over a certain price.  I also like the monthly sales events and special financing offers.  The free standard local delivery is also nice.  Finally, I like the 5% assorted clothing, accessories, etc.  I don't like the high interest rate of over 27%.  Compared to my chase card, which I have a much lower interest rate on, it's not so good.  I also know of a few other cards like Amazon's Visa Card which offer similar if not better benifits!

name: Kamariza Natosha
review: I like that there is no foreign transaction fee, as I travel alot and rack up foreign fees on other cards that I use. I don't like that it doesn't have a smart chip feature because I am limited as far as using it while I am abroad especially in Europe, where the smart chip is used in many places. I'm weary of the free shipping aspect, does that include overseas shipping? If so sign me up!!

name: Chad Hanson
review: I like the fact that you get 0% interest for 6-12 months.  I also like that there is no overlimit fee.  I don't like that there's no online response.  I have a montgomery wards card and there is no 0% interest deal but they do have online help.

name: Perry Wheeler
review: There are certain features to this card that are great for the right person.  If you own a small business, and constantly find yourself ordering a large amount of products from Staples, the 5% discount is huge.  Be careful of the 27% APR though. If you you don't plan on paying your bills diligently each month, you will easily eat any costs you may have saved using this card.  Compared to the Office Depot personal credit card, this card offers a greater opportunity to save money, but at a higher risk with a higher APR and more stringent bill payment stipulations.

name: christina hollis
review: I've had this card for 4 year now. The terms have pretty much stayed the same, however the issuing bank has changed 3 times since I've had the card. Which is kind of annoying. I really like the fact that based on how much you spend you can get deferred interest for 3, 6, or even 12 months. What I don't like is the reward system. 1 point per dollar. You have to spend 250 dollars before you even get a redeemable reward. And once you do, it's only $5. I just don't feel like that's a ton of incentive to even use it, especially if you're not going to use the card frequently. Another downfall is the interest rate. The interest rate on my best buy card is 25%. That's just outrageous. So I don't think this card is ideal for anyone planning to carry over a balance. Overall it's an OK card, but I really only recommend it if you shop with Best Buy very frequently.

name: Caitlyn Ryan
review: I had this card for two years in the past and I liked it.  I got deferred interest for 12 months when I signed up, but that it not difficult to get for any CC these days.  I never had to use customer service and always paid my bill on time and in full to avoid paying interest.  Low intro rate on purchases but very high regular rate IMHO - that's why I got rid of it.

name: Max Fedotov
review: This is awful card.They are thieves.You'll never get cash back. They have some c.appy "points" and "deals" with 2x prices. Their auctions are nonsense. Discounts are useless. Literally, they just steal your money from your cash back, lying in ads.Be aware.

name: Ella Lee
review: The Citi Double Cash Card is my favorite credit card, not only because it has no annual fee, but also because of the rewards. It is the highest paying reward card out there. I chose this card because of the cash back I can receive, and that there is no fee to use it. You get 2% back on every purchase you make. Can't beat that!

name: Tara Urang
review: I have had this card for almost 3 years now and it is by far my favorite credit card. I had some billing issues in the past, and the customer service was amazing! They took great care of me and my billing issues, where as some other cards I have had in the past were rude and did not care. I had accidentally missed one payment (lack of remembering on my part) and they credited all the late fees for me. I was just taken back at how nice they were when I called to make a payment thinking I was to pay the late fees as well. I also do a lot of shopping at best buy, so whenever I do I use my card to get extra points. I think it is awesome that not only do you get to have a good card, in my case with a good interest rate, but you earn points too on purchases you normally would make. I highly recommend this card!

name: Stephen Mackenzie
review: I received my Citi Perfered card back in Jan, With a offer of 20,000 points after sending 1,500 in the 1st 3 months. I have spent well over that and didn't get my signing bonus. So I contact them online chat twice now, and they say that can't find that offer, which is still being offered now but they say my account doesn't have that offer attached to it, so the gave me 2,000 and a courtesy. Needless to say once I pay off the balance they can take their card and shove it.

name: Andi Paige Griffith
review: We buy all of our macs and game consoles here. I have had a credit card through them for years. I made a payment in February and then came back to make a payment in March and the online system kept reading error no balance to pay. Since my balance had been super low I believed I had paid off my card. Months later, in June, I checked online to see my available credit limit for a new purchase and was shocked to see a balance of $200 dollars. There was an error with their online system and I owed $58.25 then over the course of 4 months they charged me late payments of 35 dollars. They never gave me a call or sent me a letter in the mail. I wanted some of those late payments removed considering the conditions of the online error and they refused. I canceled my service and cut the card off completely. A horrible company to have a card through.

name: Monica Antes
review: I cancelled my card because they were trying to charge me a huge fee for the next year. They showed the account as closed and still charged me anyway. Then they charged me late fees for months. When I called to get it cleared up they gave me the run around. Worst experience with a credit card. Worst customer service. And they "don't remove fees unless you write and fax them a letter"

name: Chuck Foy
review: The L.L Bean credit card has some excellent features that offer a lot of options to me and other cardholders. The ability to get rewards on 3% of your L.L Bean purchase is a huge advantage as those rewards can give you a great value with future purchases. This is different from other cards because of the rate that you can accumulate rewards. Many other cards from stores let you earn good rewards but at a much slower rate. The added benefit of getting 1% on all other purchases makes the accumulation of rewards even faster and this card that much better. The only negative is a higher interest rate but the rewards outweigh that negative.

name: Alyssa Thayer
review: The Expedia credit card has many perks compared to other credit cards I've used. For every $1 spent, you earn 3 points, which is one of the better deals I've seen for the point system. The smart chip is also a really nice thing to have, just as an added measure of security. The grace period is an acceptable length of time, and the late fee is also agreeable. I can't say I enjoy the high APR, though. In the end, I believe the Expedia credit card is one of the better credit cards you can find.

name: Bob Smith
review: Here's the catch...  The Thankyou points used for flights on the Citi Premier Credit card aren't worth much.  You will pay up to 3 times the flight price you can find at the airline's website.  Moreover, Citi will not match the significantly lower price you can find online.  This mark-up in flight charges results in the Thankyou points being worth possibly 1/3 of the stated value.

name: Carol Starr
review: I don't know what you are talking about.  The travel service they use will match the discounted airfare or more.  I have used my rewards points for airline tickets below most published discounted prices.

name: Ramayan Tiwari
review: This is a wasteful card, and the customer support is super rude and arrogant. They card service does not issue any alert on when your promotional balance is expiring and then post huge interest charges on it. And if you explain the reasons, there is no ways they are going to adjust the charges. I had to close the account immediately. I literally ended up paying 20% more of the cost of item that I bought. NEVER OPT FOR THIS CARD

name: Billie Salas
review: The card is a good card, and the deferred interest for 12 months was nice. However they got my existing points account linked, so I never got $600 worth of bonus points. They create a new bonus points account for you, and you do not get your points. The card was good though.

name: Scott Davis
review: Citibank has a lot of products, but they clearly think of their customers as numbers, rather than their clients.  Recently, they began charging me a $25 per month fee because I don't have enough money.  Apparently they feel like those who are rich are more important than those who are not.  They will not offer any exceptions to that rule.  Personally, I believe they looked at their balance sheets and saw how much extra money they could make, and made the appropriate move.  Their products are good, and their online banking website works very well, but I certainly feel like I am staying with them because it is difficult to move to another bank, not because I like them.

name: Penny Noland
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card has the rewards that make customers stick to it unlike many major store credit cards. When you buy the card you are offered an uncommon discount that is enough to boost the morale of shoppers. It offers competitive royalties in points and this gives it the most competitive edge. I recommend it wherever I go as it carries advantage over other major stores in the likes of Walmart.

name: Robert Neal
review: In terms of large banks, I'd say that Citi Bank is one of the best. Up until March of this year, I maintained a CitiGold Checking account package. Citi's customer service was always helpful whenever I had an issue or questions concerning my accounts. The one caveat I did have with my Citi banking package were the minimums required to avoid fees; my checking account required that I maintain a minimum of $10,000. Seeing as I don't usually keep any sizable amount of money in a single account, especially one with such a low interest rate, I ultimately switched over to DCU (Digital Federal Credit Union).

name: Liptin Griffen
review: A few months after opening my credit card account I experienced a large volume of fraudulent purchases on two of my cards. I was not using my card at questionable places online and I shop in the same places for the past 5 years. Reporting the fraud was easy enough but it took an extended amount to time to receive my statement credits. Every time I would call and ask about the status of my refunds they would tell me it is under investigation and someone from the fraud department would take care of it. After the third fraud occurrence and having to wait over a month to receive credits I have a very low opinion of this bank. Funny enough after closing my credit card with them I have not had any issues with fraudulent purchases since although I continue the same exact shopping habits.

name: Dave McArthur
review: This card is nothing to write home about. It's your basic gas card.  There is really nothing to be gained by it that you can't get from other cards. The customer service is disappointing.

name: John Nagy
review: The Radio Shack Credit Card would be good for someone who would actually shop at radio shack, but only if they had an excessive need for batteries or were to be ordering things off of radioshack.com in excess of $25 for the free shipping. It does not give any rewards (points for dollars spent to use towards gift cards or bill credits) so it is essentially a credit line to the store. You'd be better off using a card with rewards for purchases and finding a promo code for free shipping.

name: Michael Whitney
review: Radioshack has a credit card? I prefer to go to Best Buy or shop online because they seem to have a larger selection. But the card looks ok...not interest for 65 months is good, but a year is better. There doesn't seem to be much for rewards, or theft protection, which is a big negative for me.  I mean, why use a credit card if there is no incentive? It also says it may not be available to new applicants...that makes it pretty difficult.

name: Brian Talyor
review: Citibank has been around since I was a kid. Unlike most banks it hasn't had a name and policy change nor has it been bought out by another bank. It's customer service has always been pretty good overall and if you have a problem that needs to be addressed they do it immediately.One of my favorite things about citi is the fact they don't have any annoying hidden fees that so many of the new banks have. The sign up process is easy, you sign up, get your account, and that's it. Citibank still remains to be one of my favorite banks after 20 years.

name: Andrew Mahabir
review: This is an awesome card. I've had it for almost 2 years and have absolutely zero complaints about it. I purchase items that I was normally purchase anyway, then I receive the rewards as a bonus. After buying a new refrigerator recently, i had enough to purchase a xbox one. Not bad considering I had to purchase the fridge regardless. I missed a payment once because I honestly forgot. I called them and they refunded the fee right away. Overall, great card with great customer service, and on top of all of that, great benefits and rewards.

name: Tony Hicks
review: I love my Staples card. As a creative hobbyist (I do graphic design and printing for events for my friends at cost), this card and its specific purpose allows me to go to staples and get more ink, specific stock, colored paper, invitations, whatever.It's nice to have a specific card for this purpose because I always know it's clear and it allows me to easily track costs related to my hobby.Features-wise, the APR is fine and although I've never had to use it (knock on wood), the grace period is generous. 20 days is plenty of time to account for paychecks falling weird or whatever. In truth, I may use this card more frequently than any other.

name: Ryan Wackerly
review: This is an awesome credit card. No annual fee is a wonderful treat to someone who takes care of his credit and financial needs.  It is among many of the other great benefits provided by Citi Simplicity. The low interest is a fantastic thing and allows me to use the credit card in a responsible manner.

name: Katy Fredrickson
review: AT&T Access More Card from Citi is a pretty average card. I has 0% APR for 7 months, not the best, but not terrible I suppose. It offers several ways to earn points through purchases. It has a pretty high annual rate of $95. Fees associated with this card seem to be slightly higher than some as well. I wouldn't necessarily recommend this card or not. Its pretty much your run-of-the-mill credit card.

name: Joshua Richardson
review: I like that this card offers a point system to reward you for using it. 0% APR for the first seven months is good, but i have seen better offers. All the other rates look similar to what you would be offered anywhere else. This is why i only gave it 3 starts. If they didn't offer points, it might have been lower.

name: Aisa Trevino
review: WHAT A NIGHTMARE!  If you ever lose your card, be aware that it will be like pulling teeth to not only get a rep on the phone but one that does their job efficiently.  It has been almost a month and I have not received my replacement card. Why? Because for some odd reason, the last customer serv. rep I spoke with (on the 17th of May--it's now the 11th of June) did not order me a replacement like they ensured they would.  This did not happen once but three times.  I have spoken with three different agents in the past month in reference to this teeny tiny operation and it seems as if there is no standard to the employee training or tasks.  I have never had such a stressful experience trying to reach a customer service agent and get such a simple task complete.  I cannot wait to receive my card so I can call and then pay the entire thing off and close the account.  I will NEVER recommend this card or business to anyone.

name: Cameron George
review: I was in my local Best Buy store and wanted to get a computer.  I applied for a Best Buy card and got approved in store with a $1200 CL and a score of 630.  It was enough for me to get what I needed and still have some open credit available.  I liked the fact that for the first six months there were no interest charges or fees associated with the card.  The Best Buy card is a typical store card with perks though.  Average interest rate.  The more you buy you accumulate points, at least when I got my card in 2011 thats how it was.  Not a bad card to have.

name: Shaun Mason
review: While it has been a couple years since I owned one, I had an overall good experience using my Sears card. At the time I was young and so their $500 credit limit they gave me was perfect, it gave me enough to spend on items I needed for the house I was renting at the time but not enough to get into crazy debt with them. From what I heard from other people it was slightly difficult to get approved for the card (I don't know if that's the same now), but I was military and got approved easily. In the end I decided to pay off the balance and cancel the card as I was trying to get rid of all my credit cards. It's a very useful card to have if you're a renter or home owner. Also, due to the varied selection of Sears it's got a wide range of uses.

name: Scott Davis
review: I have several savings accounts with Citibank.  One of the nice things about Citibank is that they have no problem with the fact that I have five distinct savings accounts - each of them with a specific purpose.  It really helps be to keep track of my savings for specific goals.  While I've never had any problems, I did once need to contact them for further information.  I went through two customer service representatives before I finally got one that was fluent in English.  While I understand that corporations use outsourcing to save money, I really prefer to discuss financial details with somebody that (a) I can understand easily and (b) that I feel confident understands me.

name: Dani Ling
review: I have this card and the Citi® Diamond Preferred® Card, which I have also written a review about.  I trust Citibank and they have always been good to me.  I needed two cards, one for personal and one for business.  I have had no problems with either card.  This card is especially good if you like to use the rewards program.  I don't so I can't really comment on that.  All in all, good card and good company.

name: Desmond Sessions
review: In my opinion, The Citi Simplicity credit card has the stability and usefulness of the best card I have used. The low interest rate is one of the most favorable aspects but no fees and penalties is just as awesome!  I have been a customer for the last 5 years and they have competent customer service which makes any card hard to compete with on this comparison.

name: Iris Daclan
review: HORRIBLE - Seems that you have to fight tooth and nail just to get the points that they advertised. I was supposed to received 50,000 points and it suddenly disappeared. Furthermore, they've failed to give me credits for my recent trips. Also, even if you purchased your tickets via this credit card, the system won't recognized that you are priority 1 boarding and will either give you priority 3 or 4 instead. Apparently, you will need to show your credit card to the American Airlines representative a the airport during check-in so they could give you that boarding 1 special treatment; otherwise, you snooze, you lose. My advice, drop this card after the initial 1 year when the annual fee kicks in. It's not worth the hassle and the $95 fee. There are better credit card programs out there.

name: Laura Tigra
review: I only applied as I was purchasing a dress and the offer brought the price of the dress to almost free. I did not shop at Sears much so I honestly forgotten I applied for the card. I had a nice limit however the interest rate was so high I chose to pay the card off and close the account. After using for Christmas one year, I realized the benefit was not worth the interest that was assessed. I had all the major credit cards and NONE of them charged me that much interest.

name: Marie Wilkerson
review: Husband ask me to apply for him a Home Depot credit card on my laptop....but received no response!

name: Thomas Busch
review: Best Buy's card offers the standard store deals for any appliance/electronics store.  You can get some time period for same as cash, blah blah blah.  They also do rewards but, at least when I had the card, you could get the same rewards through their loyalty program anyway so I'm not sure I'd consider that a benefit.  Their APRs are very high (it was around 25% when I had it) and they aren't super picky so you can get one of these cards when you're in college.  That's what I did, and of course this is the first card I got myself into trouble with.  Luckily the limit was low so I didn't destroy my future!  It's an OK card but like any credit card, you have to be careful!

name: Chris Gascon
review: There doesn't seem to be anything too overwhelming about The Shell Gas Card. The rewards on the card are marginally better then competitors, I had a Chevron card in the past where you didn't earn rewards quite as fast. What does worry me is that they don't list "zero fraud liability" like other similar cards, and in this era of mass credit card theft that’s scary. The cards biggest benefit is that it is for Shell gasoline, the only gas station I go out of my way to go to.

name: Ashlea Mull
review: I like that this offers No late fees, penalty rate, annual fee - EVER. Cash advance APR is a bit high compared to my capitol one card and the variable APR is also a bit high. This card however offers no rewards where as both my discover and capitol one do. These days they all have to offer rewards or very low APRs to be competitive.

name: Tyler Sharp
review: I work from home and honestly my supply needs aren't that demanding, but honestly, anything I need offise-wise is bought from Staples, and I love their store card as it has a ton of nice perks for moderate users like myself. Great 0% intro rate for me, my APR now is in the 17% range, but it's fine as I pay it quickly, and I love getting my bonus points. Also, the special CARD MEMBER ONLY specials they send to my email are pretty sweet as well. I love it.

name: Deb Gipson
review: I had a 13 dollar credit when I called and said that I didn't want my card anymore, the lady said they would send me the credit amount. No big deal right? I forgot about it, several months past and I found some old credit card papers and thought hey it's only a little bit of cash but why did they keep it?  Turns out they charged me $13.00 interest....... for nothing.  If your going to use a credit card don't use this one.

name: Michael Scott
review: The terms seem to be somewhat flexible (forgiving late fee policy and an extended grace period are standouts), and the discounts and promotional offers are quite beneficial as well. Seems like a good option for someone who needs tires or other vehicle items/services in a pinch (and is hopefully near a location that accepts this card). The interest rate is pretty poor, though, so carrying a balance on this card will cost you very quickly, and there are no rewards, so it's unlikely to be a regularly-used card for most consumers.

name: Elixir TheEnigma
review: The Shell Credit Card seems like it doesn't have much going for it, in my opinion.  The bonuses aren't very rewarding.  You have to purchase $500 in a billing cycle to get .10 cents a gallon.  If you spend $1000, you get .15 cents a gallon, and so forth.  I'd like to have to spend less in a billing cycle to get these discounts and rewards.

name: adam
review: The idea to save money off gas with the shell card is a really good one. I do like that u can save money with this card. The downside is that you have to spend a lot of money in order to save any. If u spend a lot of money on gas I would say this card might be worth using.

name: Brittany Tuscany
review: The Sears Credit Card is good if you need to make a large or unexpected  purchase like an appliance and can get it paid off within the 0% APR time window. Also, it's convenient that this card can be used at K-Mart and Land's End as well. The 25.24% interest rate is really high though and makes this card undesirable for other purchases.

name: Alison Berk
review: This is a great option for those of us addicted to home improvement, but need to finance our hobby. Especially with the first year of 0% interest! We redid our bathroom and kitchen over the past year and bought everything on the credit card up front. After we spread out the payments over the year, it didn't cost us anything extra, we built up our credit and ended up with a new bathroom and kitchen that we probably could not have afforded otherwise. We love it and couldn't be happier with this card.

name: Dave
review: I love my Home Depot Credit card. What I love the most about this card is the fact that purchases $299 and over are automatically 6 months same as cash. As long as you pay the balance off within six months there are no interest charges. Even better they frequently send me coupons where my purchases that are $299 or more have 12 months same as cash options. I have had this card for over 7 years and have never paid one penny of interest. It has enabled me to do all the home projects I wanted or needed to do over the years without costing me any extra money.

name: Alison Berk
review: While I can't deny that the staples credit card was convenient,  the apr was just too high. At a little over 27% it just isn't worth it,  especially if you're making larger office purchases. For some smaller office supplies it's not a bad deal, just make sure you pay it off right away or you'll be paying $50 for a package of pencils before you know it. I believe office max's credit card is a much better deal, the store themselves are just harder to find.

name: Aaron
review: I have been using Citi and their credit card services for approximately two years now. There was an instance where I had an issue that needed to be resolved, and Citi was able to resolve this problem after one phone call. The customer service representative was extremely friendly and wanted to make sure that I remained a loyal customer. On top of that, I have been able to use my card in several different countries with no issues what so ever. Their card has been a life saver and I'm very thankful that I have been working with Citi.

name: Dave
review: WOW. Did I read that right, 27.99% variable rate? That is highway robbery. There is no way Staples can get me to sign up for their Staples Store Card at that rate. Additionally there are no balance transfer options and their only reward incentive is that it automatically enrolls you in Staples Rewards that give you 5% back. I am already a Staple Rewards member without having to sign up for their store credit card. Since my current Disney Rewards Visa card gives me at least 1% back on all purchases and the APR is almost half of the Staples Store Credit Card I believe I will just continue using my Disney Visa Rewards Card for all my Staples purchases and still use my Staples Rewards account to get my 5% for being a Staples Rewards member. Thanks but no thanks Staples

name: Heather
review: This card is average in my opinion. However, it does have a few things going for it. The card provides a zero percentage introductory rate for the first 6-12 months; also it does not charge an annual fee so that can be big savings. In addition, the Tire Kingdom Credit card does not charge an over the limit fee and so that's kind of nice. The interest rate is average but it does offer some credit privileges at participating retailers. One caution though, the cash advance fees are high. Overall, I don't see anything to get excited about it has some advantage but it seems to be about average.

name: Brittany Anderson
review: My husband and I have used the Best Buy Credit card in the past. We longer have any credit cards on any kind. On the scale of credit cards this one is great if you don't ever pay interest on it. It is nice to have that buffer period where you can qualify for no interest, but if you have to pay interest the APR for this card is high! My Target card allows for free shipping just by using it rather than still having to have a minimum purchase of $25 for the Best Buy credit card.

name: Rimma Sheremet
review: I have this credit card and I didn't really like it any more or less than any other credit card I have. I read some of the other reviews here and they seem to be so positive ? Not one negative review ?? This credit card was offered to me via snail mail a few years ago and I've used it a few times for car rentals an a few trips to the Target down the street from my apt. As with all credit cards I don't use it very often. They have a way with of "nickel and diming" every cent from your account if you let them !

name: Denise Tutor
review: I like the L.L. Bean card for the rewards offered. Although it may seem like a small thing, the free monogramming is very neat and gives a special personalized touch to gifts. The interest rate is lower than my Capital One and the rewards and specials much better. Also, getting coupons in addition to the rewards is a great bonus. This card gives more than most that I have seen. No annual fees or any hidden charges. This is a good card to have and the grace period is also fantastic. I would recommend it for both L.L. Bean and everyday shopping in order to get more reward points and experience all of the benefits this card has to offer.

name: Julie Henderson
review: The Expedia credit card has no annual fee and great rewards associated with the card for people who travel a lot.  I am surprised that there is a 3% foreign transaction fee because it is a travel card.  So many cards are no longer charging these fees, so that's why I didn't give this card five stars.  Although I don't normally carry a balance on my cards, the APR is high, but not as high as others I have seen.  I would recommend this card.

name: Tanner MacLaren
review: I really have fallen in love with my Citi Simplicity card. This has been one of the best cards that iv'e found to use, with very low amounts of fees and charges. There is no annual fee, as well as no late fees. The customer service is also excellent, which also plays a huge factor for me determining on where I want to get a card from.

name: Elliot Kleinburd
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card has great benefits and offers a variety of different ways to get perks.  Between the $20 birthday reward, racking up rewards with every dollar spent whether it be within a Brooks Brothers or outside, special cardholder events throughout the year, and the discount given on the first purchase of the card, I don't know if there are many "store" cards that match this.  The only downfall would be the interest rate if you do not qualify for the lowest amount.  Also not offering a 0% interest deferment is something that, for instance, the Guitar Center Credit Card offers for 18 months, which can be seen as a negative. Overall, though, I would highly recommend this year for those that love shopping at Brooks Brothers or for those looking to start!

name: Elliot Kleinburd
review: The Radio Shack Credit Card, although having 0% interest rate for the first 6 months, has a very high interest rate after that at 28.99 %.  This high interest rate similar to many other "store" credit cards, but the difference for let's say the Gap credit card is that it has rewards.  The Radio Shack Credit Card has no rewards making it virtually useless to have. The only reason someone would get this is if they make a large purchase at Radio Shack and feel like they could pay it off in 6 months, giving them some more time to pay it off as opposed to having to pay it all once.

name: Elixir TheEnigma
review: I got my Citi Double Cash Card a few months ago.  Initially I was drawn to this card because of the 0% intro rate on purchases and on transfers.  There was only a $35 late fee, which seemed fair to me.  I have enjoyed having this card, but its nothing special either.

name: Brenda Thomas
review: I have previously had a Sears card.  It was probably one of the better store cards I have had.  I liked being able to make the payment in the store.  I’m not sure if they still offer this feature.  The interest rate was competitive and incentives were often offered in store.  I would recommend getting a Sears Card.

name: Heather
review: AT&T Access More Card from Citi offers its customers various ways to earn points. This card seems to be very generous in their awarding points. Another plus is that is offered a 0% introductory APR for the first 7 months. This are the pros that I have found with this card now for the cons. The annual rate of $95 is high for my budget. Also, I always look for benefits related to international travel and this card offers no advantage which is surprising to me since they award points based on purchased made at travel websites. The advantage of this card over the many others credit cards is that they seem to offer a generous benefit of awarding points so if you do the math and the points work out for good then this might be the card for you.

name: Blake Madson
review: I use the Office Depot Store Card on a regular basis and have gotten a lot of use out of it. It has a good intro rate, good interest after that, and has a lot of good features which help you manage your purchases and expenses. The ability to monitor your purchases and statements online makes it very convenient to use this card. While it doesn't offer any rewards, the customer service and other terms of this card make it worth it.

name: Anthony Thomas
review: Interesting the indignation from some people in this thread. "It doesn't reward me so I don't wanna use it". Well FYI getting rewards for card use is relatively new thing and it's just credit card companies giving back some of the largess they earn from credit card strikes (fees). IMHO having at least a Lowe's, Home Depot and a Sears Store card are a MUST if you rent or own a home. Major appliances do fail, many new cars come with low profile tires that are expensive to replace, etc. Great if you have credit cards with high enough credit limits to the things in "life" taking care off and reward points or cash back for it.  However that is not a reason to downgrade it. The card is super useful in other areas; you can use it to rent cars from Budget and buy everything for your new home; the amount of cynicism is amazing. Don't carry a balance! It seems to me people love carrying high balances on their high limit cards; of course a disaster waiting to happen; between jobs and you need brakes to get to an interview... Use your Capital One Venture or the Sears card no interest for 12 months? I think I rest my case.

name: Constantina Hauser
review: I enjoy the added benefits that come with this card such as upgrades and access to member activities.  This card does require a high credit score which was not a problem.  I am able to save a great on travel spending due to use of this card and really enjoy it.  This card also provides certain trip insurance coverage but is limited in that.  Overall I would rate this card pretty good.

name: George Green
review: I used this card when it was time to make some larger purchases for my office, and the 0% introductory rate for 12 months was very helpful. After this rate was over though, the permanent rate of 21% was simply too high. I was able to get my initial purchases paid off in under 12 months, but keep a balance on this card is just too expensive. And the card has no other benefits, so it is not very useful.

name: Mitch
review: As someone who runs a small business out of the home, the Staples Business Credit Card is an amazing way to not only keep up on my office supplies but save a lot of money in the process.Great interest rate, good intro rewards and continuing rewards (on top of their already existing rewards structure in store) and flexible payment options make for an all around great card for residential and business customers alike.If you do a lot of shopping at Staples or have a great need for office supplies, you can't beat these guys.

name: Elixir TheEnigma
review: My Staples card gets me all the office supplies I need!  There's a wonderful rewards program, and there is no fee to have the card each year.  Its easier than ever to use your card to purchase supplies online, and when you work from home that's a huge benefit.  I'm happy to have this card.

name: Myles Lindeburg
review: I have used the Best Buy store card several times for mainly Christmas type shopping. The points system would be ok for someone who shops there a lot, but for the occasional user it is best to use their 0% financing for 12 months. The major downfall I see in this card is the high interest rate, so I definitely would never carry a balance unless I could pay it off within the promotional time frame. Also, I think a good change would be the ability to build points and use the promotional rates at the same time. Basically I am keeping this card for credit building and emergency use, but only under a promotional purchase.

name: Sherese Santana-Rodriguez
review: Citi Simplicity® CardThe Citi Simplicity® Card is simplicity at its best.  For the first 21 months, Citi offers you 0% APR!  Some other incredible features of this truly simple card are 0 late fees, 0 penalty fees, and 0 Annual fees, and a small balance transfer fee!With your Citi Simplicity® Card, Citi gives you Citi Price Rewind within 60 days on purchases that go on sale after you make them.  Your card is made even more convenient with Citi's Apple Pay™ capability.You don't have to worry about unauthorized charges and identity theft.  Citi has you covered with zero liability for those fraudulent charges and will help you get your credit back.  And, with Citi's EMV chip technology, your Citi Simplicity® Card is even more secure.You can elect to have extended warranty coverage added of up to a year on your Citi Simplicity® Card, choose your payment due date, and get automatic account alerts.When you are traveling, you can rent cars wherever you go, worry-free, with your Citi Simplicity® Card Worldwide Rental Insurance, and feel protected with Citi's Traveling and Emergency Assistance.And, as always, you can call Citi® Customer Service 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.  Why not try to become a Citi® member today and apply at 1-800-492-2127?!

name: Lane Frontierville
review: The interest rate of 24.99% seems very high - it's much higher than the card I use now. With that high of a rate, it's not a problem that they don't allow balance transfers because I wouldn't want to transfer anything anyways. Other than that, I like that there is no foreign transaction fee. That's handy when traveling and would be helpful on the cruise our family has planned coming up in a few months. I also like that there is no annual fee - I would never have a card with an annual fee.

name: Lucine Kazaryan
review: Worse card... worse customer service!!! beware they will take your money.... after paying off over 8K they charged late fees and  to say that its previous balances which clearing when you pull the statements and our bank accounts we had paid off the balance.

name: Hannah Bealer
review: With the amount of car problems you can face at any given time, it is nice to have a credit card specifically connected to Goodyear as an option. The 25 day grace period is very acceptable, as is the $35 maximum late fee. The Goodyear credit card seems to be more flexible than most credit cards, although the interest rate is high at 28.99%. However, I believe if handled well, the Goodyear credit card would be an ideal option for anyone who might need help with their vehicle in a pinch, but would be able to pay off their balance in a timely fashion.

name: Patricia Garci
review: Citibank was always been a very reputable bank and because of this I have been a loyal customer for the past 5 or so years. I live in a fairly big city in south Florida and when I first opened my account with Citibank, there were plenty of branches nearby. In recent years, Citibank has closed many of their branches here. Right now there are only 2 Citibank branches left in my area and they are both about 15 miles or more from my house. This is extremely frustrating for me because I don't have the time to travel that far to go to a bank.

name: Rick Panko
review: Citi Bank is probably the most frustrating and insane bank I have ever dealt with. I originally signed up for them because my brokerage company was also a Citi property and I was promised an ease of transfer between the two. This was not true. In fact, it made no difference whatsoever. It was a flat out lie. Secondly, their fees are out of control! They charge high overdraft fees. AND! They charge you a high fee if your checking account dips below a certain dollar amount, which kept me in a constant state of paranoia. Third and finally, they make it impossible to close an account. I had two accounts with Citi and wanted to close one. What followed was two weeks of customer relations hell. This is big evil Wall Street at their worst.

name: Matt Hartman
review: The Shell card is a good card for those people that use the same gas station every time they fill up. The appeal of the card is that you can earn up to 20 cents off of every gallon which is actually fairly high compared to some other cards. However to earn this 20 cents off you have to make quite a few gas purchases which most daily commuters probably won't reach unless to have quite a bit of spontaneous driving. Overall it's not a bad card to get if you prefer Shell as your gas station of choice.

name: Matt Hartman
review: The Sears credit card, like many store cards is appealing in the facet that you can get no interest or a percentage off on purchases made at Sears. However this card, like many Department store owned cards has a rather unappealing interest rate. One thing about this card that makes it stand out is the ability to do balance transfers. However, for everyday use I wouldn't recommend it mainly due to the interest rate.

name: Colby Phillips
review: Not the best card. The only way I would consider this is if I did a LOT of shopping at Best Buy. Having to use your rewards for only things at Best Buy is inconvenient. The APR is really high and it takes awhile to build up points if you don't shop at Best Buy often. The only perk is the lower intro rate if you were planning on making a purchase with the card soon after getting it and not paying it off quickly.

name: Matt Hartman
review: This card is great for making purchases at Home Depot like many store cards, however there are no balance transfers allowed and it has a fairly high interest rate even if you have relatively good credit. I feel this card is well suited for making early purchases at a Home Depot store, however its terms make it less desirable to use as an everyday card.

name: Samantha Vale
review: I received this credit card when I was in college, and was given an extremely high credit limit! At the time I didn't fully understand interest rates, so I took out the credit card in my name knowing that I was able to buy what I wanted at the time, and I would just pay it back overtime.  After years of not using the card, I decided to purchase my appliances with the card in store, because they were pushing 18 months 0% financing with purchase on card.  I made the minimum monthly payments and then after 17 months, I noticed that I was going to have a large fiance fee that was over $1,000 dollars that would be added to my next statement if I did not pay off the appliance in full within the next 30 days.  Luckily, I had the money to pay off the remaining $900 on my card to avoid the finance fee. It made me despise this card. When you get a credit card, make sure you read the fine print and understand the terms and conditions. I do not recommend this card to anyone!

name: dgarlon
review: Unfortunately on the interest promotional offers you must pay them off before the time expires otherwise you get charged for all the interest during that period. You statement will not reflect how much to pay each month only the minimum due you have calculate how to pay each month based on the terms in your records and pay accordingly.

name: Amber Bell
review: It is a good card if you can pay it off fast. The interest gets really high. There are low monthly payments which are like most of my credit cards. All in all I think it is a good card.

name: Christie Buckner
review: The Tire Kingdom Credit Card is a good card if you plan on paying off the balance within the first 6 months. After 6 months the interest gets really high and can make paying it off harder. Unless it's over $600 then you have 12 months to pay it off with no interest. Since it is a Tire Credit Card you can only use it at places that take it.

name: Kelly Westphal
review: While the Expedia Credit Card doesn’t require an annual fee and offers lost baggage and damage & theft purchase protections, the high interest rates and no introductory offers leaves this card with much to be desired.  Offering a 15,000 reward point bonus is great, however requiring $1,000 in purchases within the first three months of having the Expedia Credit Card doesn’t promote responsible use.  The earn and use limits on rewards points will make it difficult to use the points earned, unlike other cards available these days.

name: Red M Raider
review: Overall I think this is a great card. The LL Bean Credit Card allows you to earn rewards quickly with everyday purchases, and even more quickly when shopping within the LL Bean brand. And as a Southerner, you better believe that by offering free monograms for cardholders, I'm monogramming all the things! I also like this card because unlike other store credit cards I've held in the past, you don't have to worry about overlimit fees - plus there's a 23 day grace period, which is fantastic. It just shows they really care about their customers. All in all this is a great card and I'm confident to recommend it here, as well as to my family and friends.

name: Frank West
review: Firstly, with the Radio Shack Store Card you have to be aware that Radio Shack has been bought out by Sprint and is having it's stores either closed down or turned into Sprint stores. So as a store card what utility it can have is limited in time and use. Even without that though, this card isn't the best. Interest is high and there's only a few benefits. No points, but you do get a discount on store-stocked batteries and free shipping on orders over 25.Given Radioshacks financial status, I would recommend staying away from this one and getting something like the Discover Student Card or any other bog standard card which will be around for the foreseeable future.

name: Justin Hite
review: This card seems decent, especially for Brooks Brothers shoppers. 1% cash back on purchases outside of Brooks Brothers seems decent, until you factor in that you have to spend at least $2,000 to receive the reward. I have other cards with cash back that I receive the reward sooner. It is easy to spend $500 at Brooks Brothers, but 4% cash back on in store purchases seems a little low. I would have expected at least 5% and maybe even 10% from a store card. The biggest sell would be the cardholder events, but that depends on the quality of the events. I would also give this card an additional half-star for the birthday reward, if that option were available.

name: Mike Bartholomew
review: I needed a card for an unexpected, big-ticket purchase, and came across this one. With its no annual fee, no late fees, and a 0% APR for 21 months on purchases, and after reading the reviews to see if this was legit, I knew this was the card I was looking for.

name: Raul Olivas
review: The AT&T Access More Card offers a 0% APR for the first 7 months.  My Chase Freedom credit card offers the same introduction fee with the percentage rate being good for 15 months.  I like that they have a new phone offer that makes it an easy process if you are just purchasing a phone.  They offer a points system based on the purchases made with the card. I'm a big fan of POINTS!

name: Kevin Rick
review: I believe this card is a typical credit card.  The rates are very similar to those I have seen on other cards I possess.  I do like the 0% APR for 7 months.  This can be very valuable if you purchase quite a bit of merchandise/services.  As long as this amount charged is paid back prior to the end of the 7-month period then you have nothing to worry about.  The $35 late fee seems pretty standard as well.  Now I can safely say I do not care for the Annual fee of $95.  This is ridiculous.  I fail to see what real benefits you receive from paying a $95 fee yearly.  I mean thank you points are great an all, but in the long run you are probably going to end up with something that’s worth not even 10% of what you paid to get those thank you points.  It mentions an “Exclusive New Phone Offer” but fails to mention any more details behind this.  I mean depending on which phone they offer you and at what price this could be worth paying the $95 fee a year, but it also depends wholly on the stipulations behind the offer.  I believe the balance transfer fee is fair at 3%.  This is pretty standard throughout every credit card I have ever possessed.  Although I have had one card that had 0% balance transfer fee for the first 60 days.  That was a pretty nice intro offer.  I do not know that I would either recommend or defer away from this card.  There really is not much special about the AT&T credit card that sets it apart from others out there on the market.  In the overall scheme of things there are cards out there that offer much better introductory offers and better rewards points programs.

name: Mitchell Hengesbach
review: I have used the Office Depot Credit Card on a few occasions when making a big purchase. I used it to buy furniture and a new laptop a little bit ago, and I was able to pay it all off in just a few months without being charged interest. That's the biggest perk of this card. No interest for 6 months if paid in full. Great benefit!

name: Edward Greene
review: I received a so called pre approved application in the mail and what a damn joke. I applied on line and got denied!!!!! But makes no sense to me because I just bought a truck from a dealership....I wish there were laws in place to stop this sort of mail.

name: Ashley Kieffer
review: You can choose to stop receiving "prescreened" offers of credit from companies by calling toll-free 1-888-567-8688. I haven't tried that number but I hope it helps you!

name: Frank Hamm
review: The Citi Simplicity credit card might not be an exciting card like some of the reward cards out there (Capital One Rewards card for example) but it has the most solid foundation I've seen for a credit card. Not only do you have a low interest rate but no kinds of fees ever, late/penalty or otherwise. That's amazing! Combined with excellent customer service and a long window for 0% intro APR and you have a card that is hard to compete with on the basic level.If you're looking for a solid, no-frills, low-interest card. This is the card for you.

name: Mitchell Hengesbach
review: I have been a member for several years. I like that it doesn't have a annual fee and a reasonable APR. It also offers extra security protection with a chip, provides an extra sense of security. The reward system could be a little better. I have the Chase Freedom Card that offers 5% cash back and I accumulate a lot more quickly. The website could also use a revamp, not the most user-friendly.

name: Frank Hamm
review: The Shell Gas Card is a pretty decent, if somewhat plain, choice for a credit card. The interest rate is in the middle of the spectrum, not high but not really low either. It's pretty easy to get one, and the rewards are limited but not bad. You can save 5 cents a gallon using this card at Shell Stations and those savings will add up over time. If you're a regular Shell customer, this card makes sense for you, but if not then you're better off searching for something else.Compare this to a more standard rewards type card which isn't limited to one location and you can see this is a niche card for niche use.

name: Tommy Cabral
review: What I really liked about my Best Buy Store Card was that for 48 months I had 0% APR as long as I made the payment before the 48 months were up. Meaning that as long as I payed off whatever was charged within the 48 months it was 0% APR but if I did not pay it in time, they gave me 25% APR for the entire time I had the item charged going back to the first month. Which is one thing I did not like because that would have ended up being a lot of compiled interest but it also made me want to pay it off in time.

name: Chris Bakker
review: I am responsible for keeping our office supplied with the necessary supplies. I am also responsible for accounts payable. Using the card and making payments each month makes my job easier than having to account for the petty cash drawer that we sometimes use. Also, the Office Depot Business Store Card has a lower APR than the regular Office Depot credit card, which can save a lot of money of the fiscal year. Trust me, this card is necessary to streamline your office duties and makes you a more efficient business in the long run. No complaints from me. All pro, no con.

name: Vince Gambill
review: Interest rates were a bit above market average, but it was decent.  Used it for some PC peripheral purchases and a car stereo.  Paid it off, never used it again.  Cancellation was relatively painless.

name: Tommy Cabral
review: There are two things that I liked very much about the Goodyear Credit Card. The first is that there is only a $35 max late fee meaning that whether I am 1 day or 100 days late, I will only be assesed a fee of $35. The other thing that i found good about this specific card, is the online services they offer. I do most of my account management for credit cards, banking, insurance, etc, online so they making that available makes my life easier.

name: Panache Sobe
review: The home depot card was easy enough to activate as opposed to a couple of other home store cards. I usually pay the amount due in full so the interest rates do not affect me. I believe the Max late fee is not bad at $35. The payments on the website are simple enough. The only drawback I feel is the card does not offer a cash back which could be beneficial for the company as well as the consumers.

name: Patty Garcia
review: The Shell Credit Card serves its purpose. It gives you rewards when you use it to pay for gas which is great. I like the bonuses that are offered and that is is backed by Citibank. The biggest disadvantage is that you cannot use this card anywhere else. In comparison to my current Discover card, the Shell Card lacks because you cannot use it anywhere else. My Discover card gives me 5% cash back for gas purchases.

name: Allyson Malik
review: It would be really great if Best Buy would also list the amount of rewards you could expect over the course of the year for certain purchases so that younger people wouldn't be as easily reeled into this kind of charge card. Since the rewards are based solely on Best Buy points, it would be nice to see a chart that showed how much you'd truly have to buy at Best Buy through the course of the year to make owning this card worthwhile. As far as I know, though, no other charge card offers this kind of service.

name: Amy Paul
review: This Tire Kingdom credit card is a decent card if you are in desperate need of new tires and cannot afford to pay them off right away. This card allows you to have 6 months interest free on your new tires before you get charged. If you cannot pay the amount, the credit card interest rate is pretty high and you should be careful in waiting to pay it off. Definitely take advantage of the 6 months because otherwise, you will find yourself paying way more for the card. Also, there are no rewards on this card which is another big downside.

name: Chris Bakker
review: Once you get past the 25% introductory rate, this card has some great benefits. With discounts offered on appliances and power tools. I've managed to pay off my first purchase and once the rate drops, I was able to purchase a few power tools that I desperately needed. The credit application was quick and easy. This card is not for everybody, as I wouldn't use it to purchase clothing.. but it's perfect for what Sears is best known for... tools and appliances.

name: Shawn Urang
review: My wife and I currently hold a credit card from best buy. We love that you can use it anyware and gain points towards best buy purchases.

name: Ritu Choudhary
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred card is one of my favorite credit card. i have this credit card from almost a year. it have 0% APR  on balance transfer for almost two years. it have a good customer service they are  very friendly and helpful. you earn points on purchase you make on this card and later you can redeem those points on great online deals, gift card and even local deals. so have fun while doing shopping with this card. i will recommend this card to friend and family as it is a good card to be used for daily purposes and there is no annual fee on this card.

name: Roy Seaberg III
review:
You sound like you work for the company maybe just here to write a good review to make Citi look good. I already have the card but I was halfway believing until you started talking about the reward system. I almost canceled over their reward system  but decided to keep it open since more available credit from the card looks good on credit report plus it's nice to have that emergency credit. Their point reward system is a joke however and I have even read other reviews to make sure it wasn't just me. Person after person hated it. On the gift cards you might get five dollars off any amount gift card like you pay 95 dollars for 100 dollar gift card. They also have an auction system in their reward website and it's a complete joke. I have bid at the very last second on several bids and I still got outbid. That makes they have a computer generated robo-bidder. I think one time I bid right when the timer said zero and still got outbid. Only a computer bids that fast. I bid just so I can do something with the points. Maybe you can find good deals at their Citi easy deals reward website but you have to search the site pretty good to find them. It just be easier than that to find good deals to make happy customers. Happy customers mean they will not only keep the card but more likely to use the card. I read on credit forums that people were thinking about canceling just because the reward system and I don't think I blame them. Citi needs to be reminded they have competition in the rewards category and need to clean up that system. My simplest card is the Capitol One Quicksilver. Their reward system is straightforward. It's 1 percent cash back and you can redeem anytime even a low amount like 2 dollars.i don't know if they will send you a refund (the 1 percent you earned back to you) check for that low but I have already used the 1 percent to help pay down balance. It wasn't a large amount before I redeemed either
I have not really had a negative experience with Citi besides their reward system and since I didn't talk with a person I don't even consider it a negative experience but just frustrating. I classify a negative experience when it's a person to person transaction. In fact I have never had a bad customer service experience with any cards. Some went more pleasant and smooth but no real negative experiences

name: Cornelius Vanderwerff
review: Being a college student the Citi Thank you card has helped me in tough spots when I needed a little help in buying basic necessities.  The card doesn't require no annual fee and is integrated with a smart chip for extra security.  The bonus points given after $500 dollars is also great to redeem for gift cards which is nice.  Plus, the 7 month 0% APR rate is a plus.  This is a decent credit card with someone with great credit.

name: William Lantz
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card is a cool card. You can earn rewards on everyday purchase, and you earn more rewards when you buy L.L. Bean merchandise. You also get coupons off L.L. Bean purchases as you shop. All your returns and monograms from L.L. Bean are free that's awesome. The APR varies, but it does stay pretty low. If you want to purchase Discovery School courses you get ten percent when you use this card. This card is a great card for anyone who loves the outdoor life. The only think I do not like is the cash advance rate being at twenty-five percent. Other than that this card is awesome!

name: Xar Kingship
review: The Expedia credit card offers attractive rewards benefits. The 15,000 point bonus is very enticing and the threshold to qualify for it is only $1,000 in charges. The card offers a 3 point bonus for every dollar spent. This bonus offer is better than average when compared with other credit cards.  The card also has an Apple Pay feature that provides additional convenience and helps to expedite purchases and payments. The smart chip addition is also very convenient, especially for international travel and purchases. The card offers a reasonable foreign transaction fee when compared to the fees charged by other cards. In general, the Expedia credit card is an attractive choice that provides excellent features for cardholders.

name: Jeff Fisher
review: The Radio Shack Store Card doesn't have a lot of bells or whistles. It doesn't offer any rewards points but does have some decent bonuses if you're a regular Radio Shack customer. If so you can get free shipping on Radioshack orders over 25, 15% off on store-stocked batteries, and a o% apr for the first 6 months. These bonuses are pretty decent but it's contingent on you shopping at Radio Shack regularly. Also bear in mind the financial state Radio Shack is in and perhaps a card with them might not be the best option. Still, if you're a regular shopper with them and their online store, this card is definitely the right one for you. Otherwise you would do best to look around at other alternatives which offer broader rewards or benefits such as the Capital One Rewards Card.

name: Cupin Cat
review: Wow! This looks like a great card for people who shop regularly at Brooks Brothers.  There are so many rewards; 4 points for every $1 spend on BB online is just fantastic! I used to have a chase card that offered 5% back on certain purchases, but they took that away a few years ago. The fact that you earn great rewards at BB and also can earn gift cards for others stores is great!  My concern with it is the regular APR rate – both my cards with Chase have lower percentages, one being 9% which could make a bigger difference than the higher rewards that the Brooks Brothers Credit Card offers. Another downside is that there is no smart chip. I like having that with my other credit cards.

name: Ramon Morales
review: The At&T Universal Savings Credit Card has a top notch points system.  The points system seems to be better than any other card on the market, despite what other posters are saying.  10,000 for spending $500 in three months makes it a top notch incentive program.  1 point for every dollar spent is also quite amazing, and it is usable on pretty much anything, as they state, from electronics, to music, to travel.  There's also no annual fee, and the rates, while high, are nothing higher than the norm.  The only thing I would really change about the card and its terms is give it a lower interest rate, but, all in all, it is a great card with really favorable terms.

name: George Acs
review: I had been a Citibank customer for more than 15 years when living in a city where there seemed to be a branch on every corner. It was easy to take their service and services for granted.But when I moved to a new state and began looking to open new accounts, there were very few Citibank branches nearby.
