After much delay, I finally decided to open an account at a branch that was about 15 minutes away. That as a lifetime my previous standards.But it's hard to match the range of services offered. Not only was Citibank one of the first to offer an extensive on-line presence, but they have really perfected it and complemented those services with a great smartphone app that was among the first to allow mobile deposits.Their on-line bill pay was and is still among the most extensive and easy to use.When I do need to go to the bank their customer service is excellent, whether at the teller window or with one of the officers. Further, when I have questions or issues their phone representatives are very courteous and helpful.Over the years I've had the full range of Citibank products, including credit cards, mortgages, home equity loans and even insurance (before they spun off their insurance arm). I've never had any regret or second thoughts about any of those decisions and look forward many more years with Citibank.

name: Todd
review: I have a best buy credit card that I love.  I have used to buy my computer and ipod in the past.  When I bought my I pod, it had a special of paying it off in 6 months without any interest.  Since the ipod was only $300.00, I was able to make a payment of $50.00 a month without any interest at all.  I was very happy with that, because I do not like to be behind on payments.  I will always use my best buy card in the future for more purchases.  I recommend this to everyone who does not have a best buy card.

name: Griselda Ortiz
review: Yes I would love to get a Best Buy credit card too but it's way to hard to get approved.  I wish I could have a family member or a friend that could get a Best Buy Credit Card and add me as an authorized user to make purchases and pay them off on time each month.

name: April Rider Meagher
review: This card comes with regular offers sent in the mail. This has been very helpful as we have been going through a large renovation on our home. For the most part, we have saved more money by using the offers like 0% interest than we would have saved shopping for discounts. I definitely appreciate the readily available offers. On the other, it is wise to definitely keep an eye out on due dates and when the reward period ends. If you miss this date, you will have to pay the interest. This can be a lot when making large purchases.

name: John Leverette
review: This Shell credit card is a decent card for anyone that spends a lot of money on gas and requires at least 120 gallons a month.  If you don't use that much gas I wouldn't bother as you won't get the 5 cents off until you use 45 gallons worth and if you live in the city you work you might not use that much in a month.  Also I would make sure I paid my balance every month because the 24.99 % is pretty high.  So all in all I would say if you plan on paying your balance down every month and use a lot of gas this would be a decent way to go, otherwise just stick to your Kroger or Walmart card for a discount of 3 cents every time!

name: Juan Henderson
review: I haven't received my card yet but it seems like a great deal. Basically there aren't any late fees or penalty rates, and the interest rate is particularly low. This sounds like the perfect card for a struggling college student like myself. What college student isn't struggling anyways? Citi Simplicity is the perfect name for this card because they make things simple which is the way they are supposed to be. I wish there were rewards but honestly they're rewarding you enough.

name: Ashley W.
review: The Goodyear Store Card is a great option for emergency purposes, specifically related to needing new tires. It doesnt appear to be a card backed with a major credit card company so it is not accepted everywhere. With the advertisted 4,500 locations that accept the card hopefully one of those is near the site of your tire blow out. The interest rate is on the high side, which is typically for credit lines of this type (specific to one store or brand). For someone who is not so much concerned with the cons mentioned above, the pros may be the exclusive discounts and promotional offers for card holders. With the anxiety that comes along with needing new tires, this card may offer peace of mind to someone about to head out for a road trip.

name: Amanda Hall
review: The Goodyear Credit Card has some pros, but I'm not sure it's the right card for me.  I prefer rewards cards.  I will say, as an emergency card for car trouble, this might be nice to have.  No annual fee, 25 day grace period and can be used almost anywhere.  Depends on your situation, but worth considering.

name: Colby Phillips
review: I like the perks this card comes with. This card is great if you are making a large purchase of $299 or more for your home and can utilize the zero interest. 6-12 months of no interest is a great perk and can save you a lot of money on projects.

name: Colby Phillips
review: There are a few perks to the card, but it does not make the top of the list. The perks are no annual fees and gas rewards. However, I don't drive enough to receive even the lowest reward at .10 cents off per gallon. I much prefer a card that rewards you for every dollar spent. Also, comparatively this card has a higher interest rate than other I have reviewed. This is not an attractive card to me at all.

name: Kim Dobbins
review: Descent card for making Sears purchases only. Normally Sears will have special financing available on certain categories of item, such as appliances. I purchased a freezer with mine and have an APR interest grace period of 12 months to repay. I would not use this card for any other reason. The APR in general is huge.

name: Patricia Schoff
review: This card would be very good to have if something happened to your tires and any other products you can get at these companies. But the interest rate is high so if you do have to get something it would be best to get something that you can pay off in a year if possible because not having any interest is nice for the first year. I like that if you happen to go over the limit for some reason they don't charge you for it. That is very nice because not many companies do it.

name: Darnel Jonson
review: My family switched over to citibank when my father's company got acquired; I have never been happier with a savings account. All the employees at my branch are always very friendly and very helpful. The ability to use online banking has saved such a large amount of my time that I can't imagine having a savings account that doesn't have online banking! I also have a few loans through citi, and my parents mortgage is through citi, so having all our accounts with one great provider is a huge benefit for us all. They have a great interest rate and it actually inspires me to save my money, which is a great practice to have!

name: Brandon Sharp
review: The Staples Credit Card sounds like a really great store card! 5% is a rather large amount for a reward, so I'm very pleased with that! I also like that there's a maximum late fee that they charge you, regardless of your balance. The 25 day grace period is also quite nice.

name: Alex Thomas
review: The L.L. Bean card is a must have for those outdoor enthusiasts. Earning 3% back on L.L. Bean purchases and 1% on all other purchases to use towards a future purchase there is great. Not to mention, you get free returns and free monogramming at L.L. Bean! Overall this is a great card.

name: Emily Gilson
review: The Expedia Card is great if you travel a lot. If not, this probably isn't a good card for you because it involves having to spend so much to reap the benefits (most of the travel cards do, though). The foreign transaction fees are reasonably low and the $5 minimum cash advance fee is actually lower than most - most other cards start at $10 or 5%, whichever is higher. So that's looking really good. Also some great security benefits here - new cards now, such as AMEX, are all starting to be made with the chip-and-pin in addition to the regular swipe stripe, which is securer and can be used more easily abroad, where they don't use the swipe cards. The fees are uncomfortably high for me, personally, but I don't travel often, so this might not be an issue for someone who'd get decent mileage out of this card. 29.99% penalty APR is freakishly high. Pay on time! Otherwise, the standard APR and the late fee itself are in line with other cards. This card is definitely not for everyone, but it's not a bad card as travel cards go.

name: Jamie Bruno
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit has really great awards such as a max of 4 points per dollar spent and a minimum of one point which is similar to most major credit cards. The $20 reward on your first purchase outside of Brooks Brothers alone is a reason to sign up. I have a J Crew Credit Card which has similar rewards such as 15% off your first purchase but has some slightly higher rewards such as $25 Rewards Card for every $500 you spend. You also get a surprise on your birthday and select sales and events only available for card members. I think the cards are similar but I prefer the Brooks Brothers because you get great rewards for shopping outside of Brooks Brothers such as $20 reward for every $2000 spent on outside purchases.

name: Jeff
review: My Best Buy credit card is one of my favorite ones for multiple reasons. One of those reasons is because they reward the customer for making multiple purchases and spend a lot of money on the store. I remember this one time I was purchasing a portable air conditioning system at my local store and I was also able to impress one of my girlfriends because of the amount of money that I spent that day. Compared to the other stores, the stuff you get at best buy is pretty decent when you compare the price but their credit card allows you to stack up some points. I love my Best Buy credit card.

name: Patricia Schoff
review: I love having a best buy card. It is great to go there and get stuff for yourself, friends and family. I have had one for a few years now and I love to go there and get new games, movies, computer accessories or any other house hold electronics. It is a great place to go if you want to build your own computer. The interest rate is not too bad either and depending on how much you spend the monthly payments are very good too.

name: Jackie Fillinger
review: I have been a card holder with Radio Shack  Store Card for awhile now. I wasn't too sure about it at first because I read so many negative reviews but I have to say, I am pleased. The best part about this card is I do alot of shopping in store and online.This was the ideal card for me. I run a small business and we are always in need of electronics. If you're looking for one of the best store cards, I would recommend this one.

name: Jon Groubert
review: This is an excellent card if you're like me and pay off your balances in full every month.  I never carry a balance, so I'm not concerned about the interest rates, but if I ever had to, the rates are low enough that they won't crush you.  More importantly, however, are the rewards.  They are terrific!  When I signed up for this card, I got a $150 Amazon gift card just for spending $1000 within the first three billing cycles.  Sweet!  And, on top of that, I also got points from my spending too, so I've got about $170 waiting for me at Amazon.  Yes!

name: Liz Morgan
review: The AT&T Universal Savings Credit Card is a points based rewards system, as opposed to cash back or airline miles. It is an excellent card for saving 5-10% on AT&T products and services. I use it to pay my cell phone bill, and my internet bill. This beats my normal credit card, AMEX Blue, of 1% cash back for the same purchase. On top of that, you also earn points towards rewards that can be redeemed at their store. For a bill, or service that I'd normally receive zero rewards for this card can't be beat!

name: Russell Gibson
review: I had a best buy card and bought many things with it I became disabled in 2010 and had been paying the insurance on the card. I told them that I needed to use the insurance since I had became disabled and couldn't afford to pay the bill , thinking this was why I had insurance RIGHT ? Well I was informed I needed to have received unemployment to b able to apply the insurance I didn't file for unemployment because I didn't quit or get fired or layer off I almost died and simply never returned to work. Who at 38 years of age expects to never be able to return to work ? My balance was $1300 roughly this we 2010. The debt has changed hands many times and I've tried to explain it and finally just said to hell with it. Now tonight I opend the mail and have. A balance of $2600 NOT HAPPENING it has been five years now ha think I'm going to pay you now  I will NEVER make another purchase from best buy

name: Kimberlea Rodriguez
review: I love Citibank. I think they have great customer service in person or via phone or internet.  My credit was not the best but Citibank has helped me through the years to greatly improve my credit score. I love the ease of use for checking and credit cards. They are honest dependable and just an overall great bank.  I would highly suggest people give them a shot. Whatever your banking needs are they will help you not just now but into the future as your banking needs grow.

name: Samantha Kass
review: This card was one of the better cards that I have used. First, they approved me even with my history. Never had any issues with the card or customer service or website. I liked having the Citi Card as well as it had access to their citi rewards and the ability to use your card number to get access to pre-sales on concerts. Earnings rewards was also a great aspect. Definitely recommend.

name: joseph owens
review: The best buy card is excellent. The charges are low and if you spend enough, you completely avoid them, (and let's be honest, it's best buy. It's not hard to spend a fortune there). The limits are high, and the card is easy to use. Also, the best part, even if you have not so good credit, you have a good chance of still being qualified for it. This is a card I'd recommend to anyone who shop at best buy.

name: Deloris Lewis
review: I do not currently use the Citi Simplicity Card but I am signing up for one.  At first I thought, "What no rewards", but when I take into consideration that the interest rate is well below many other cards I've viewed and that there are never any late fees, penalty rates or annual fees that is reward enough for me.  This card is a no brainer for anyone who wants to get the most value for their spending.  It almost seems unreal. Oh yeah, and after I receive my card and use it a few months I will come back to share my experience which I know will be great.

name: jose ortega
review: The overall process of signing up goes nice and smooth. You are in the door and in less than twenty minutes you have an active checking account. the have excellent fraud protection on my card. I can now authorize a transaction via text message or phone call, i am very happy i visited this branch to open my account , thanks citibank

name: Lakeisha Morrison
review: This card is really good. I love the fact that is has no over-limit fee. Most Credit card companies like to charge more than $30 for an over-limit fee. The grace period is very long as well which give you time to pay your credit card off. The only thing i don't like there is no online response and the cash advance is a little high. I do extremely appreciate the low payments they have and you can use the card in over 4,500 locations nationwide. So no matter where I am I can use it.

name: Jasmine C
review: I have now had this account open for a few years. It's been great! I don't have a branch near me, which is a bit of a draw back, but I do like how they have mobile banking and I can deposit my checks through their app on my phone. I've never had any issues with them, they haven't stolen money from me like a certain bank has, and they are very pleasant to deal with. I also love how there aren't any monthly fees. I see myself staying with them for many years to come!

name: Lexi Monroe
review: This card is awesome and i defineately recommend it. i have used my card on more than one account from the time i repaired the wall before the land lord came over or the time i built the shed at my new place. its great with no interest for six months and very low fees. A balanced card for average people with average credit. five stars. would never use any other credit card at home depot again.

name: Lexi Monroe
review: Although they offer alot of insentives i dont personally encourage anyone to get this card. The interest rate is crazy high and although i pay the bill before interested escalates the charges, theres also other fees associated with the card that require more than you put in. They offer members good point percentages for purchases but thats about it. From personal experience, i have had better cards and would stick to my others before i used this one.

name: Rhonda West
review: This is not a credit card for me. You have to spend $1000 dollars in one billing cycle to be rewarded a $.15/gallon gas credit. Even the rewards formula is confusing. $500 for $.10, $1000 for $.15 and $2499.99 for $.20 per gallon rewards. The 24% variable interest rate is very high. There is also no fraud protection offered.

name: Deborah Corn
review: This card has a very high APR.  It does give you the first 12 months interest free but after that the amount you pay is ridiculous.  They give rebates and coupon offers but no rewards.  You would be better off getting coupons another way.  There is no over the limit fee which is great.  However, I feel you are better off using a credit card with a lower APR.

name: Rhonda West
review: Although it is nice to combine a credit card with a rewards card, the fees associated with this card extremely high at 17.99% regular rate and a whopping 27.99% for cash advances. The rewards feature in this card are appealing with $5 for every $100 spent. Seeing that Best Buy is primarily a big purchase store, this helps.

name: Azzie Burns
review: If you travel a lot, this  Expedia credit card is a nice card to have in some ways. The smart chip will come in handy if you go to Europe, the lost baggage protection and travel accident insurance is good for peace of mind.  I will say the APR is way too high for someone who pays attention with excellent/ good credit score to settle for. Forget about making any cash advances on this card, they hit you with 3 percent up front and a 25.24 APR thereafter. In other words, you get hit while on your trip and afterwards when you come home. The foreign transaction fee of 3 percent just takes away a bit more from it's draw. It's nicest feature is the reward program but I personally do not think it is enough to make up for all the fees and high APR. I would opt for another card with a much lower APR.

name: Rebecca VanAcker
review: I love the rewards that Brooks Brothers offers; the max earn of 4 pts/$1 is a really good deal. I also have a Visa card (that I got through Kroger), which I thought had a pretty good rewards system, but even it doesn't offer quite as many as this card. I also like that there isn't a reward limit, which hasn't been the case with some of my other credit cards. I do wish that this card had a smart chip; Kroger just added that to their cards, and it's nice to have that extra security.

name: Robbie Boban
review: I am a Radio Shack credit card holder, and I have been very dissatisfied with my experience.  My main reason for getting the credit card was because you were supposed to get a discount on any battery purchase made using the card.  I purchase hearing aid batteries frequently and have found that almost NONE of the store associates know about the discount program, and they end up charging me full price for the batteries.  I have also had instances where I have made card payments on time, but Radio Shack still assesses a late fee.  Customer service is much harder to reach than with other cards I've had.  And now that Radio Shack has declared bankruptcy, I'm not sure what will happen to my account.

name: Jaron Castilleja
review: This card (AT&T Credit Card) has a rather large difference in rates, from 13.99 to 23.99 percent, and it makes me wonder if the rate itself fluctuates more according to the wishes of the credit card company than what I actually do with the card. The points system is a joke; spend $50,000 and get a $500 gift card for music and games? That seems outrageous, and I'd personally rather stick with a card that allows a person to get points toward travel, like the JetBlue card. All in all this seems like a decent card if you're a heavy AT&T user, but there doesn't seem to be much else going on here in the way of rewards.

name: Amy Kelly
review: When you go on their website and you've forgotten your password, they require you to put in your SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER!!! In 2015!!!!! Pretty funny how they offer free fraud text alerts but still, in this day and age, require you to put a SSN on a website for access!  Who even DOES that anymore - it's insane! Come into the 21st century, Barclay! If it wasn't for LL Bean, I'd cancel this card because Barclay evidently seems to be intractable on this SSN matter.

name: Cassandra Lind
review: The Citi Dividend Platinum Select Visa Card is an excellent credit card. I have been a customer of Citi's for 10 years and have always been satisfied with their products and their customer service. This credit card was my first credit card and I still use it to this day. They have the best rewards program and also the lowest interest. They are always very fair when you talk to them and are always looking for new deals for you. One of the best things they offer are specials on when you can increase your cash back percentage. Once every few months they offer certain stores or types of stores at high cash back percentage such as 3% to 5% which is great! They also have an awesome fraud team that alerts you immediately if a transaction seems out of place. For me, Citi has been a great company to have a credit card with and also has the best customer service I have dealt with. I highly recommend them to family and friends!

name: Jackie Fillinger
review: This is one of the best credit card I have used. The Citibank  Simplicity card  has lived up to what it stands for, just simply amazing.and the interest rate is lower than others. The customer service is one of the best. Always helpful and friendly. I would recommend anyone who isn't sure which credit cards is right for them, give this one a try., you'll glad you did! There are other great rewards with this card. Apply today and you'll agree. I am a very happy customer..Thank you

name: Anna Dukes
review: As a long time Shell customer I can say that this is honestly one of the best cards I've ever had. The interest is fairly low, and I love that I get rewards points from my Winn Dixie card that I can use in conjunction with my Shell card, which also offers incentive programs. If you are looking to add a gas card for any reason, I highly suggest that you consider this one. My only complaint is that sometime Shell is priced more than its competitors.

name: Emily Gilson
review: 29% APR? YIKES. that interest rate alone is enough to scare me away from this card, especially because there don't seem to be any benefits towards using it. The 25 day grace period for late fees is nice (I've never seen that on any other credit cards, and I have a few), but the late fee is ridiculously high. Pros: No annual fee, no overlimit fee, no foreign transaction fees other than cash advance, which is standard among most cards; 25-day grace period on late payments.Cons: unspeakably high APR and late fee- if you can't pay on time, that's really going to get you. Also it isn't chipped, so it could be less secure; no rewards.I see little reason to get this Goodyear Store Card unless you shop at goodyear a lot; otherwise there are much better general-use cards out there.

name: Azzie Burns
review: I have had this card come in handy more times than I can count. I use it for my garden supplies, my Christmas decor and I have even bought large appliances on it. I personally choose to handle all my payments and statements online. I love not having to deal with the mail for making a payment. I also love being able to send extra money anytime I want. They are also quite good about not filling my inbox with tons of unwanted spam. They send me my bills and important notifications and nothing else, and that is just perfect for me.

name: Anna Dukes
review: I use this card for all of my major electronic purchases! I absolutely love this account, I get 1 year interest free and that makes using this card and paying it off so incredibly simple! I've always had the best experience with the customer service they provide as well both in store and with the credit team. This is an account that I will be keeping for a very long time, as they make it a very friendly and personal experience!

name: Ian Goodwin
review: The Shell Credit Card is not the best credit card out there. Truthfully, you are better off staying away from gasoline bonus credit cards for other cards that provide you with cash back that you can simply put towards gasoline. Spending $1000 for .10 cents off per gallon is not worth it (in my mind), although this discount is higher than other gasoline credit cards. The APR for this credit card is lower than others, but it still quite lofty. Unless you are in a pinch, I would take your business elsewhere to find a better credit card.

name: Bruce Mcclendon
review: I too received the same "prequalified" numbered invitation, and when I formally applied online with the conformation # I was rejected....but what pisses me off the most is that checking my credit score Citi bank looked at my credit TWICE BACK TO BACK-looked once, then looked a second time on the same day! Credit Karma, shows the "hard inquiries" and my score dropped 4 points for each time they inquired. Again, I lost 8 points on my credit score in one day because of the two  "hard inquires" made BY Citi! Yes, I was "preapproved" but was rejected and all the while lost valuable points on my credit score because they looked! What kind of business is this that this organization can trick you into such a thing, then let you be punished for their mistakes? Beware Citi cards.........

name: Lee Von Preussen
review: Citibank who handles the Best Buy Credit Cards are the most dishonest Crooks there is.I would pay my Credit Card early always before the due date.  To my disbelief this Company applied the Payment for the Prior Month.  So I was getting major late Fees etc. I phoned several times and nothing is ever resolved. In fact I now believe I am paying for several Purchases more than once with this bunch of dishonest Crooks. So I have now decided not to send a Penny more and let them waste time trying to sue me.... Anyone in the USA on Social Security or Government Retirement can't have wages taken or any liens placed on Bank Accounts. So to Hell with these Crooks!

name: Kelsey Regan
review: I got this card about a year ago because they offered a $100 bonus for opening the account. I was planning on canceling the account once I received my bonus, but they offered me 3% cash back on all purchases for 6 months and then 1.5% cash back after that. For that reason, I decided to keep the card, since it has good rewards and most other cards don't offer more than 1% cash back.

name: Khan Khan
review: The card has a rather high APR for purchases and a extremely high ARP for cash advances. The rewards are terrible and appear wrong. 2.5 Points per dollar spent should be 2.5% cash back not 5%. Unlike other credit cards you only get rewards for shopping at Best Buy. Chase Freedom give you 1% everywhere and 5% at certain locations. It appears the rewards certificate will only be valid at Best Buy, unlike other reward cards where you can pick what reward you want.

name: Nathan Blackburn
review: Loved this card and had a great experience activating it!. There were some difficulties talking with customer service but nothing is perfect. Overall I am very impressed with the card and am eager to extend my account with this company. The max late fee is really low as well and there is a grace period to go with that so you are secure in knowing that if you are a few days late to pay you wont go into the red.

name: Nathan Blackburn
review: This car was simple to activate and simple to use allowing me to save on my project instantly. The interest is relatively low and making payments can be done by phone, online or in my Home Depot store locally. Customer service was easy to work with as well. I wasn't really interested in opening a line of credit until I started my project and my local Home Depot associate helped me save some money. I walked out with my building material an a wallet still full of cash because the card took care of it all!

name: Ramon Morales
review: As others have said...this card is an absolute must.  We did not think we would need it when we purchased our first home in June...however, this is so worth it.  Interest rates is higher than we would like it to be, but to be completely honest it doesn't matter...we pay everything off over the course of a few months instead of doing everything in a lump sum, we get what we need for the house, large or small, and it doesn't break the bank.  Could not have a better card in my wallet.

name: Franz Josef
review: Got a Best Buy card to finance a new laptop when my old one died and I was short on cash. Wasn't really something I was planning on doing but I took the plunge. I got a great offer on 0% financing and was really happy with the deal. There's no way I would have been able to afford the laptop without the card. Overall, very satisfied with Best Buy credit card. The only thing you have to watch out for is if you get any discount or deal on financing a big ticket item, make sure you understand the terms and pay off the item within the timeframe of the terms, Otherwise you are hit with back interest. Pay off your item within the timeframe though and your golden Definitely worth it.

name: Disturbing Beats
review: I have had the Staples Rewards card for a long time for our business purchases, so Staples recently offered me a Staples Credit Card.  The credit card automatically linked to my Rewards card so it started saving us money from the very first day.  The extended payment terms for purchases that I was going to pay cash for helped make all the purchases easier on the pocket, allowing me put money into other much needed bills to pay.  I would recommend this card to everyone that goes to Staples frequently.  It's helped us many times over for getting items that keep my business running smoothly.

name: Karl Michael
review: The Expedia Credit Card is absolutely great for travel! You can earn 15,000 bonus points after spending $1,000 within three months of opening the account. These points are redeemable for $200 in coupons at +vip access hotels or $100 at other hotels. My favorite perks for this card are lost baggage protection and the personal concierge service. I am not very happy about their cash advance rate of 25.24% on top of the 3% cash advance fee. The late fees are competitive at $35 but the grace period is slightly shorter than other companies at 23 days

name: Karl Michael
review: The L.L. Bean Card offers a great interest rate at 14% - 20%. If you are a regular L.L. Bean customer I would recommend this card because of the 3% rewards offered on their products rewarded in L.L. Bean coupons as you earn them. You receive the perk of free returns and monogramming of their products which is nice. The $37 late fee can be steep but thankfully they offer a 23 day grace period. There are no max overlimit fees or max penalty APR, though.

name: Timothy Steele
review: I love all the incentives that are stacked onto this card. The 15% off first day purchases is a big bonus. I also like the zero fraud liability. I had my wallet stolen in the past and some of my cards at the time didn't offer this, what a nightmare that was. The interest rate on this is also lower than my Chase Slate card. This seems to be a pretty great deal all in all.

name: Timothy Gavenda
review: The terms and conditions of this offer are very straight-forward and the fees are clear. I enjoy that there is not an annual fee. The grace period of 25 days is nice for people that get into a financial slump and could possible not make their payments on time. A couple of the things I dislike are that there are no rewards associated with this card for purchases like 1% cash back or 5% off. I compare this to Target that offers 5% off purchases when you use their card. On that same token, I would rather utilize my own credit card not tied to any store and earn rewards back. Personally, I do not think that this card would benefit me in any way as it does not offer any rewards and the APR is quite high at 28.99% in my opinion.

name: Jeff Jones
review: Very tricky qualifications - Not only do they not tell you what you are applying for, but they changed up on how to qualify.  They pulled Equifax (thought it was going to be TU) and then denied based on ratio of credit obligations to income being too high.  Apparently they consider student loans and auto leases as part of credit obligations.  Although my income is 90k I have 20k in student loans and 15k auto lease +5k that I pay off monthly on AMEX.   I guess it turns out OK as I don't have to pay 27% interest.  Just did not like having a hard pull for this.  And they (Best Buy/Citibank) outsourced the 'adverse' credit dispute department overseas as well.  I could barely understand the English that the CSR was saying...

name: David Webb
review: I've had the card for a few years now. I've only used it for large purchases (television, computer) when I can get deferred interest for an extended period. I've never had any problems with it and have always been able to pay off the purchase well before the deadline. The online payment system is simple enough. Overall, a pretty good card.

name: Sarah Bolton
review: I think this card has pretty great terms. The first thing that I like is no annual fee. I don't like feeling like even if I don't use my card, I still have to pay a fee to use it. This card has great rewards like 1 point for every dollar spent, and if you're already an AT&T customer, this money would probably already be spent, so why not earn points for it! I love that you get discounts on phones and AT&T services, I have not seen another card that offers that. The 0% introductory interest rate is awesome, and even after that, the rates are very reasonable.

name: Keith Cross
review: The Shell Gas Card is a quality card for be able to buy gas at all Shell gas stations nationwide. The short term rewards are pretty nice with the 25 cents a gallon savings for two months. However after that it becomes very limiting with the savings offered. 5 cents a gallon savings isn't much of a reward when you compare that to the 24.99% interest rate for the card. You also have to purchase a certain amount of gas per month to earn the rewards. Other cards like Chase Freedom are better overall credit cards long term that give you 5% cashback on gas during two quarterly periods a year.

name: Carl Hafer
review: The Citi Dividend card is a good card with a nice rewards system.  The interest rate is lower than Chase Freedom, but the rewards aren't as flexible as the Chase Freedom card.  I can only get cash from the Citi Card, whereas with the Chase Card I could use my reward points on Amazon purchases.  You're probably better off going with the Citi Double Cash card now, since you get 2% rewards with that card as opposed to 1%, but this is still a valuable card to have.  Customer Service is great, we had 1 wrong charge one time and it was handled immediately.  I was very impressed.

name: Andy H
review: 25.24% APR? Are they serious? So I have to pay in full every single month or face the wrath of the "Sears Interest Collecting Squad". I just have to say that one of the positive aspects was the 0% introductory APR for 12 months. I transferred some debt over to that card so I could pay it off without interest. Worked well for the time being but then the card lost its value. I personally enjoy shopping at Sears, but I don't spend with credit frequently. This card reminds me of a high interest credit card. So make sure to use it rarely.

name: Jason tripp
review: I have always had capital one and I've used it consistently for my travel and automobile needs.  Reviewing the Shell card, the limits on earning for amount paid is amazing.  The price per gallon is higher than what I have seen before and I'm guessing this is because it is a shell card which is known as a good gas price card.  The interest rate is better than I was used to getting and the cash advance fee is only 5 percent which is much lower than I am used to.  I have always thought that the interest rate I had paid in the past was normal but seeing the rate on a card that rewards the customer with shell gasoline is very worth it.  As much gas as I go through it is like cash money to me and my family so this is a card that is very worth it.

name: Anthony Helgens
review: Great card. Pay everything with this to get Sears Points

name: Burhan Khan
review: This is probably the best credit card here with no fee and less interest rate.

name: Casey DiMauro
review: 25% interest rate? That is crazy! 3% foreign transaction fee? That is crazy! All I see with the use of this credit card is the blood sucking credit company taking and taking. They don't offer any rewards. You have to pay $400 dollars for free shipping and with most credit cards you only have to pay around $50 for free shipping. I think the only reason someone should apply for this card is in a emergency and you need something right away and can not afford it on your own. I wouldn't never use this card to just build your credit you will be paying way way to much!

name: Casey DiMauro
review: This cards interest rate is very high compared to other cards I have in my wallet. The rewards are about the only reason i would get this card; but i am not into big ticket items. I don't buy video games or televisions often enough to make it worth it. On the positive side the grace period is rather long giving some cushion before the 35 dollar late fee charge. That fee is pretty standard and can be compared to most credit cards. Lastly, Citibank is the holder of the Walmart credit cards and I have contacted customer service with Citibank before and in my experience they tend to rude and very not understanding. I wouldn't open another credit card with them again it wasn't a pleasant experience. they always mailed my bill a week before it was due and I would receive it a day or two before it was due not giving me much time.

name: Louise Ganitis
review: Since last summer my husband had the best buy credit card. He was paying everything right. Suddenly he stopped receiving the bills. He thought he might had payed it off. Than the billings dpt started calling him. He told them he didnt have any bill posted to him anymore. Someone informed him they were sending it to the wrong apartment number. We lost count how many bills collectors started calling one after the other. For all of them He had to explain he wasnt receiving the bills and that He'd pay as soon as He receive a statement. When he finally received, he called to pay it all off. But they still charged him extra fees for the delay. So the mistake wasnt his and still he had to pay the extra fees. He terminated his card and we feel very Desrespected. Never applying for this card again. What a desorganized billing dept! And he just got of the phone after he terminated the card, another bill collector called right away. This is ridiculous!

name: Lee Von Preussen
review: How stupid to have paid them off for mistakes they made....

name: preet
review: I have been a citybank customer since 2010 and I must say that they have a great customer service. The checking account specifically is very easy to setup and provides a great interest rate (better than what I was getting from my previous bank). I love banking with citybank. The only reason why I gave 4 stars is because of the annual fees I have to pay to bank but citybank understands my banking needs so I guess it is totally worth it. I would highly recommend citybank to all my friends and family.

name: Debbie Meck
review: Although I am thrilled in my circumstances to have any card this is one of the best credit cards I have ever used.  My credit had been shot with the help of my now ex-husband.  After two long years of re-building I finally was eligible to receive an unsecured card and chose the Citi Simplicity Card.  I am always on time so I don't need to worry about a late fee but it is nice to know that if for some reason I was late there would be no outrageous fee to worry about.  I love that there is no annual fee.  The customer service is great and I have NEVER had that experience.  The fact that there are no rewards does not bother me.  It is not something that I look for in a card.

name: Jon Entledigen
review: Don't pay them with your bank's billpayer program. Even though it is an electronic transfer Shell said it can take up to five business days to process it and apply it to your account, for which you will be charged a late charge and interest. Quicker to send a check through snail mail!

name: Brian Russ
review: I have had the Best Buy card for several years. Since it offers deferred interest purchases I typically use it for larger purchases such as computers and electronics. The only problem is that sometimes I find myself making unplanned purchases to take advantage of this opportunity! I also like the reward zone program but I wish the rewards were a little higher.

name: Nathan Ryan
review: The goodyear card is great for when your car is broken down and you're in a bind. There is no annual late fee and there is a 25 day grace period. Nobody plans for their check engine light, so this is great. However, make sure you pay the card on time, $35 is a huge late fee. I love that Ican make my payments online and save a fortune on envelopes and postage. I won't be using it for cash advances, 29.95% is steep compared to my Sam's Club Card.

name: Jarett Crump
review: I've been a Best Buy card holder for 8 years and I have had a great experience using it so far.  I take advantage of a lot of their great financing offers for purchasing electronics including TVs, laptops, and other large purchase items.  The online account access makes it easy to set up automatic bill pay.  I will continue to use my Best Buy card to finance any large purchases I have in the future!!

name: Nathan Ryan
review: I have been using my Best Buy card for several years and I love how it keeps track of my Reward Zone purchases. In addition, I love being invited to the exclusive sales and getting 5% back on everything is a nice perk. In addition, I like having 18 months interest free financing on purchases over $299. The website for managing your account is easy to use and allows for both recurring and one-time payments from your bank account. I would recommend this card to a friend.

name: Saurabh Drakester
review: I have been using BestBuy Card for a few years now and I have saved so much money  with it over the time. I bought alot of gaming consoles, games, movies and got back 5% on everything. Also if sometimes I forget card to bring while purchasing, BestBuy online customer care auto adjusts and add points to my card when I call them later. I really recommend it if you buy alot of electronics. 5% on 400$ gaming console means almost 8$ saved which is quite alot considering how competitive prices are for gaming consoles.

name: Erin Tummons
review: At first I really was concerned about getting this card. I didn't like that there are no rewards and I also read many other reviews from previous customers, and saw mixed results. However, after I got this card I was surprised that I was so pleased. The customer service is great, and as some other customers have stated, they don't slap you with a large penalty as long as you pay within a reasonable amount of time. I also really liked the no interest  introduction and the no annual fee. Overall I have been pretty satisfied. Like I said though, I would love to get some rewards and that is why I am not giving the card a five star rating, but a four star. Add rewards and I will write a new review!

name: Ryan Walsh
review: Very Disappointed in this card. Ive had good creditfor a long time, and got a card from Citi for $3500 limit. So I figured why not, I shop at best buy a lot. Nope. $1000 Limit and 27.9% interest rate. I will never use this card, and will cancel it as soon as it comes in the mail.

name: Susanah Crowder
review: I got my Best Buy card a few years back to help purchase an X-Box for my husband as a present and I ended up applying for a card because they were having a promotion with 0% interest if you pay it off within 12 months.   We have ended up using the Best Buy card for bigger purchases because of the option of no APR/Interest for 12/24 months based on the purchase price.  Overall we have had no issues except for one time when we were charged interest after the time had lapsed.  We contacted the customer service and we were able to work everything out.  You just have to be careful that when you make multiple purchases that the final payment is enough to cover the minimum due and the remaining balance of that item.  At least it was this way when we had the problem 4 years ago!  I do like that they have the rewards program linked to card so we get $5.00 reward coupon every few months because we pay insurance we have through Best Buy for one of our smartphones.  As long as you plan on paying the card/purchase off before the time is up I think it is an excellent card.  Otherwise it ends up being just like every other credit card that you can only use at Best Buy.

name: Cobra Mustang
review: I like that this credit card helps me finance my large purchases which I can't pay all upfront. It allows for me to make my payments every month slowly and comfortable. The only problem is that I can't get this card from chase but overall this the best card I had!

name: Melody Luciano
review: I think this Home Depot  store Card is a must have for all homeowners. It's great for those unexpected emergency that pop up when you don't have the cash on hand. I love the fact that they give you 6 months to pay it off without incurring interest. The APR is a bit high on this card. All of my other credit cards are around 12.99%V but on this account it is 22.99% V. It doesn't bother me much because I normally pay my purchase off before the promotional time frame is up. The only negative thing is that this account doesn't come with a rewards program. I know that Lowe's has a similar card that offers cash back for your purchases.

name: Jack Raymond
review: I use this all the time for my business. I run a self made computer repair company and I have lost count of all the times this card has come in handy for me when needing stuff on the fly. With the amount of stuff I buy, the savings I accumulate are just insane! I prefer Office Depot over most big box stores for office and computing supplies. They have the widest range of photo paper which my company uses alot of as well. All in all, I would highly recommend this card to anyone who needs to get lots of office supplies and save lots of money!

name: Nikki Jones
review: I don't like that this credit card charges a foreign transaction fee. I also don't like that the interest rate after the introductory period is over 25%. That's crazy! However, it is nice that the card offers an introductory period with 0% interest. This card would be better if it offered rewards as well. With my Discover card, I am offered cash back for almost all of my purchases, and I can use the card virtually anywhere! With this Sears card, I am limited for where I can spend money, and I don't like that. All in all, I wouldn't apply for this card, because it's just too limiting and expensive, and doesn't appeal to me.

name: Valerie Sims-Harris
review: I became a member of the best buy reward card family in 2010. I have very faithfully paid the bill on time and even paid the bill off a few times but they have not raised my limit at all in the past 4 years. I am unhappy with this card. On top of the interest rate I have not been impressed with my interactions with customer service nor the reward program. I have read many reviews about this card and I think I am using it in the wrong way. I am going to take some of the suggestions listed to see if I can change my own opinion of the card. I don’t want to give the card up I just want it to earn its place in my wallet.

name: William A McBlain
review: I'm really surprised with this Citibank simplicity card. I've had Citibank before and dropped it because of the excessive fees, interest, and hard to get a hold of customer service. Well, Citibank must have noticed the drop in their customers and decided to do something about it. The card actually doesn't give you any penalty rate or late fee if you miss a payment (as long as you pay it within reason). It's not the best for balance transfers and the grace period is a little short at 23 days, BUT as far as their customer service and new stance on fees go, this is really a groundbreaking new idea for Citibank. With this new turn I'd recommend rolling the dice with them again if you were like me and dropped them before.

name: Zach Vandenberg
review: The Citi Simplicity Card lives up to its name.  I like that it has 0% interest rates ion purchase and transfers in the first 18 months.  After the first 18 months, there are still fairly low user fees.  I don’t like that the card has absolutely no rewards program because I feel like I am losing out on cash back if I were to use this card.  However, the 24-customer service, no annual fee, no late fees, and 23 day grace period really do make the Citi Simplicity Card a good option if you want a card that is easy to use.

name: Justin Snowden
review: The Shell Gas Card seems like a really good deal for the first two months, but due to the high interest rate, I don't think I would use this card for anything but two months worth of gas purchases. The convenience of being able to use this card for gas anywhere there's a Shell, nationwide would be worth it, but after two months would just be a rediculously high interest rate credit card. It would be nice if the gas discount after two months was higher than five cents a gallon, so I would only use this for two months.

name: Joyce Pryor
review: Ridiculous interest rate.  I only purchased high end items on my card which is the reason I applied for one, but my goodness the interest rate is unbelievable.  I would only use this card if you are able to pay off your balance every month.  Especially with high end merchandise, that interest free sounds great but life happens and many times things do not go as planned and if you can't pay off what you purchased by that date like you thought you were going to be able to, that is when having a Sears card is not a plus.  All the interest added back on plus the 25% that they add every month.  For example, minimum payment $72, interest rate $50.  Your card will never get paid off. Just be cautious when applying for this card.

name: Jordan Hopper
review: When I had my Best Buy card, it was used for a large purchase.  They offered 0% APR for 12 months on my purchase, which I was very happy with.  I ended up buying a Sony LCD TV with my card and paid it off over the allotted time period.  My only real issue with the card is it's only usable within Best Buy stores.  Other than that, if you can get in n a good intro offer, and have something you want from Best Buy, this is a great card to have!

name: ASLDF
review: I have been going to Meijer for years and the day I finally agreed to open up a store care was probably one of the best decisions. Signing up on the first day was met with a 10% discount which  came in handy because I had over 100 dollars in merchandise. The card was very quick to come in the mail as well, which I was informed would happen by the cashier. Good thing about this card also is you get money toward that goes towards Gas, which is awesome because there is a gas station nearby. Overall, including the lower interest rates,  high grace periods, customer service availability online and over the phone, getting this card was a no brainer! I would recommend all my friends and family to also get this card!

name: Valerie Sims-Harris
review: I am a fan of the GoodYear credit card! I have a GoodYear card and another automotive care credit card. Both cards come in handy when I need to have regular maintenance done on my car. GoodYear’s no over the limit, special discounts and other offers are something I take advantage of regularly. My other automotive care card has a lower interest rate and even no interest if I pay within 6 months but I still find that I enjoy the comfort of having both cards.

name: Tova Haines
review: The other major card that recently launched a points program is Orbitz.With that card, you earn a $50 cash statement credit when you spend $200, and you can earn up to 10% back on hotel bookings, 7% on air bookings, 6% on air/package bookings and 2% back on all other purchases. It has no annual fee.In terms of return on spending, Expedia points are worth about 0.7 cents apiece towards hotel bookings, so on your everyday spend, the Orbitz card gives you a higher rate of return at 2%. It also beats the no-fee Expedia card by not charging foreign transaction fees. However, the added perks of the Voyager card including elite status, the $100 annual statement, and 5,000-point anniversary bonus when you spend $10,000 might all make it a better value for folks who can really max out its benefits.

name: James Polk
review: This is a great Store Credit Card that really synergizes with their rewards program. Good benefits, easy to use, no fees. If you use Staples a lot, this is the card for you.

name: Richard Hicks
review: I got this card to use for some work projects for my business.  I used it for the project with the 6 months no interest offer.  I paid most but not all of the balance and got hit with the full interest of the whole balance after 6 months.  I think I only owed less than $100 when I got the interest charge.  It was a bad experience. Also, they cut my credit back for no apparent reason.  Shortly after that I closed the account.

name: Mike Foley
review: It seems like a good offer. I like the 25 day grace period and a max late fee of $35, as well as the zero percent rate up to six months you get with the Radio Shack store card.  I also like the five percent back and $25 dollar gift card with a purchase of $150,  compared to the Kroger 1-2-3 rewards card, where you have to spend up to $1,000 to get $5 in groceries.The only downside is the normal rate. The Kroger rate is a max of 23.99% where this card's normal rate is 28.99%.

name: Luiz Oliveira
review: I like the fact that i can have a good credit card with a low interest rate. 15% off your first days purchases is a really neat deal. I need a credit card for emergency uses because I never know what might come up in life so 15% off of a really expensive tire is quite nice. I suggest you apply for this credit card today. I also like the 15% off for additional 30 days giving you time to take advantage of this great offer. A reward card for making my first purchase how much better can it get! You can also earn another 40 dollars if you spend 500 then 200 dollars how sweet is that. they also have 4 events that you can take advantage of yearly. You can earn up to 5 points with each purchase using a your credit card. APR is not bad at all 2% foreign transactions what a sweet deal over all I think this is the best choice to go with it's a great emergency card in case of any needs arise in you daily harsh life. Credit is needed these days for everything and if not prepared like I was it can cost you more than you can ever Imagine. So come on get out there and earn your credit become responsible and apply today today!

name: Kirk Davis
review: The Citi Thank You Premier Card has become the first choice among my credit cards.  Its most attractive feature is the bonus points program.  After you spend $2500 in the first three months of membership, Citi offers $500 in bonus gift cards.  For every $1 spent on purchases for Airfare, hotels and travel agencies, Citi offers two Thankyou points.   In addition to this bonus, the Citi Thank You Premier Credit Card offers is one point two points per dollar spent at gas stations, supermarkets, drug stores, and commuter transportation and parking merchants and 1 point per dollar spent on everything else.  Finally you can gain three points for every dollar spent on purchases for Dining at restaurants and select Entertainment merchants while using the card.  I do a lot of travelling and get at least 3500 bonus points just from my gas expenditures.Bonus points can be redeemed for gift cards and travel rewards.  You can get free airline tickets once you accrue enough bonus points.  Thankyou points never expire so long, as you are still a cardmember and can be redeemed on-line.  You can shop at on-line retailers through the Citi Thankyou site.  This past Christmas I did a lot of shopping using my Thankyou points on Amazon.com.  It definitely took a bit of the sting out of the holidays.  Bonus points can be used for on-line bill payment through the Citi Thankyou site. On-line bill pay is another good option.  You can use your points to pay any of the bills that you normally pay by credit card.  You can also pay your credit card bill using these points which seems a lot like recycling to me.There are many travel benefits associated with the Citi Thank You Premier Card.  The card provides coverage of up to $3,000 per person, per trip if items are lost, stolen or damaged on a trip you paid for with your Citi card. If certain unforeseen events get in the way of your trip, there is travel insurance for non-refundable trip expenses, like change fees, for up to $5,000 per year provided you paid for the trip with your card.  There is Worldwide Travel Accident Insurance providing up to $500,000 in compensation. There is also travel and emergency assistance for last minute travel arrangements, travel issues, medical aid and legal issues.  Luckily I have never needed to use any of these services, but it is nice knowing that they are there if I need them.My interest rate is a manageable 13.99% and I pay $125 per year for the card.  The yearly fee does not apply to the first year and by the second year I had received benefits many times greater than the fee.  Membership also includes twenty four hour concierge service and private pass service which gives you access to tickets for special events and concerts.  I have used private pass on a few occasions and was able to get tickets to some sold-out musical events.  This alone, made this card worthwhile for me.

name: Nicholas Tart
review: I switched to Citibank from Chase bank primarily because I would need to be able to travel internationally with the account as well as link it to similar accounts at the same bank which I have in foreign countries. As an ESL teacher with a constant need to send back money to my US accoutn in order to pay student loans, the ability to easily and cheaply transfer money between Citibank accounts is a must, which is accomplished through the free-of-charge Global Transfers program. Also, on a (new product) Access account, the monthly fee of $10 for checking is waived either EITHER a qualifying payment or qualifying direct deposit. As I will only be making payments and will not be getting direct deposit in the United States, the access account is much more convenient for me (the ordinary checking account requires BOTH in order to waive the fee, or the minimum balance of $1500)Customer service was extremely prompt answering my questions and the website offers real-time chat (something not all banks do, but should). I'm very satisfied so far with my accounts and products

name: Robin Shearer
review: The AT&T Credit card offers some decent rewards! You can get 10,000 reward points just for spending $500 in the first 3 months! You also get one reward point for every dollar spent. You can cash your points in for great rewards including $100 in gift cards! Who doesn't like a free gift card!? The card also offers 10% off a lot of AT&T products for the first 12 months! All in all, this isn't a super fantastic rewards program, but is pretty decent!

name: Paul Hunter
review: The thing says no annual fee with an asterisk next to it. I have to be sure about that and the site doesn't list the conditions I would have to opt out of the city simplicity card.

name: Dave Brandt
review: I don't see this as being a terribly good card. Aside the $0.05/gallon savings, the benefits of the card are pretty average for a credit card. I'm really not a fan of the fact that you cannot manage the card online and have to use paper transactions. Even with the gas perks, you can only save a max of $5.00 per month while limiting your refueling locations. Look elsewhere for a card that can give you similar benefits.

name: Jemille Hardy
review: It has no benefits.  For someone who pays their card balance in full every month it is pretty worthless.  Lowes card offers 5% back on all card purchases.  What does HD offer on card purchases?  Zero.

name: Uzma Murrafaq
review: Simplicity is aptly named named, it's quite easy to use, no fees, and represents why people like to use MasterCard.  It's the best credit card I've used.

name: Georgina Gangluff
review: The Goodyear Store Card is an okay card. The regular rate of 28.99% is comparable to other cards that I have had, although slightly higher than some other offers that are around. The one good thing is that there is no fee for going over the limit. And it is accepted at over 4,500 locations nationwide. Unfortunately, it isn't available with smart chip technology, but many cards are still not offered with this. They do offer the usual online services available nowadays, such as account management, statements, and other features, which I find helpful.

name: Robert James
review: The Citi Hilton HHonors Visa Signature Card is for cardholders with an Excellent credit score (FICO score above 720). With this card, there is a 15.24% - 19.24% interest rate, depending on your past credit history. There is no introductory 0% interest rate. There is no annual fee with this card; however, the maximum late fee is a hefty $35, and the maximum penalty APR is 29.99%. The grace period is 23 days, which is more or less the median time frame for most cards. Additionally, there is Smart Chip technology in this card, which is a special kind of payment verification. Balance Transfers are not allowed with this card.With regard to rewards, this card gives 40,000 Hilton HHonors Bonus Points after spending $1,000 within four months of your account opening, 6 HHonors Bonus Points for each $1 spent at a participating hotel within the Hilton portfolio, 3 HHonors Bonus Points for each $1 spent on purchases at supermarkets, drugstores and gas stations, and 2 HHonors Bonus Points for each $1 spent on all other purchases. The 6 points you can earn at participating hotels is the maximum number of points you can earn per purchase. You also get Visa Signature Benefits, including concierge service. The 40,000 Hilton HHonors Bonus Points earned can be redeemed for nights at certain Hampton Inn & Suites, Embassy Suites Hotels and DoubleTree by Hilton and Hilton Hotels & Resorts. It is important to note that the Hilton HHonors Bonus Points offer is not available if you have had a Citi Hilton HHonors Visa Signature Card account that was opened or closed in the past 18 months. The points you earn will never expire as long as you have qualifying HHonors activity at least once every 12 months, so they essentially do expire if you're not using your card frequently. You get complimentary "HHonors Silver Status" as long as you're a Citi Hilton HHonors Visa Signature cardmember, which includes benefits like a 15% bonus on HHonors Base Points earned and complimentary access to the health club or fitness center at select hotel owned and operated facilities.There is Travel & Emergency Assistance, Worldwide Car Rental Insurance, Lost Baggage Protection, $0 Liability on Unauthorized Charges, Damage & Theft Purchase Protection, Worldwide Travel Accident Insurance, EMV Chip Technology, Citi Price Rewind (they search for a lower price after you buy something, and if the same item is found at retailers’ sites within 60 days, you can be refunded the price difference), and Citi with Apple Pay (you can pay in-app). With each of these services, it is necessary to read the complete details regarding who's covered, what's covered, what's not covered, and coverage amounts that will be provided upon cardmembership. Overall, this card is great if you travel frequently (more than once or twice a month). The most benefits can be earned if you stay at Hilton, however, as there are other credit cards that offer better points on things like restaurants and entertainment.

name: Bill Putz
review: So let me lay this out. I loved my best buy card. Used it often. Paying it off as regularly and as often as possible. I kept this card thru my divorce and my world changing. Out of all my credit options that could have done way more for me than buy electronics I keep this card. Because of the general happiness I had with best buy as a whole and the lack of problems I had with the carrier of this card before citi bank. I have had my best buy card for nearly 7 years now. And in that time yes I have made late payments but I have always paid including late fees in full. Now let's talk about the problem. I made a late payment on 9/10 and 11/7 in the amount of $980. Now on 12/19 I have been notified that my once $1800 credit limit has been cut to $500 based on my " consistant delinquent history" and that I am 38 days delinquent for December. If my payment was due December 4th and today is the 19th then how is that possible? Also if I had split my $980 November payment in half and made a second payment on or after 11/10 then I would have never been late for december. But because I made a lump payment 2 days before the cycle date cities bank has decided me a bad enough customer to loose me as a customer. Not only for them. But for their affiliates. Unfortunately even best buy. I will gladly pay the extra money at the local rent to own place in town (who is amazing) so that I do not have to deal with anyone who does business with citi bank.  Not to mention the type of service provided when I called in with my problem. I have worked in customer service for 16 years straight thru all venues and levels I know that there is a way to fix the problem. I also know from other interactions with citi bank that this is the norm for their company. So my opinion is anyone who values customer even a little bit will not do business with this company! I am appalled  at this. I am hurt. If it were possible to give negitive or no stars I would gladly! I will continue to reach out to the highest athority in citi bank and continue to fight this ridiculousness.

name: Keith Kwasigroch
review: The L.L. Bean proves to be a great card to have. The rewards this card offers are great and the fact that you can earn coupons as well is a great feature. Also, free returns and free monogramming are cool perks as well. Overall, I know I would be very happy with obtaining the L.L. Bean card.

name: Penny
review: We have had our Best Buy Credit Card for a couple of years now and it is a decent store card. The approval process was very simple and quick, and we were able to use the card for a purchase before we even received it in the mail. The APR is a bonus to this card with a 0% APR for 12 months when you make your first purchase. The online portal is very simple to navigate and customer service is very helpful when needed. About the only downside to this card is having to use it to purchase things from Best Buy. There are cheaper alternatives out there to purchase quality electronics.

name: Lisa McDonald
review: The Staples Store card is great initially, given the 0% APR for the first 6-18 months.  We used it when starting a small business and, the ability to pay those items off over time was helpful.  Add to that the 5% rewards on purchases, and this card is a winner!

name: Jake Peral
review: Low interest, good incentives, no fees, great card you can't do much better.

name: Shawn Gowen
review: My card has a good and easy rewards system. Even being someone with little to no credit, I was able to get a card with a reasonable interest rate and moderate credit limit. I have had no problems with transactions, processing payments, or paying on time. I do wish they sent notification prior to when the minimum payment is due.

name: Katie Crawford
review: 15% off the first purchase at Brooks Brothers is very similar to the other store cards that I have. I like that it is a MasterCard so can be used outside of the store. It also makes you feel special when they have cardholder events, my Victoria's Secret Credit Card has the same features, which is very nice. The interest rate is a bit lower than other store cards, which I like and it is a great feature. I like that there is a 23 day grace period, as well.

name: Tripp Gordon
review: Comparing this to my Wells Fargo Platinum credit card, I'd say the Expedia credit card is a better deal for frequent travelers. It offers a lot of great rewards, such as points redeemable for flights, vacation packages, and $100-$200 in hotel coupons. I would personally be a fan of Expedia's worldwide travel accident insurance, as it would be a great way to take the worry out of visiting other countries.The late fees, annual fees, and balance transfer fees are the same, and the grace period for both is generous. The biggest difference I can see offhand is the regular APR rate: Wells Fargo's minimum is lower at 10.15%, compared to Expedia's 14.99%, while their maximums are comparable at 24.99% and 22.99%, respectively. I'm no expert on credit cards, but obviously the lower the APR the better.

name: Caryl-Anne
review: I have been looking at getting the First Progress Secured Rewards MC for the past few months, on and off, but after seeing this information I think I am leaning more towards getting it. It looks like the approval credit rating for this and a lot of other cards has to be like astronomical to qualify,  which is a little frustrating if you've got good credit but not perfect credit. This card has no annual fee as opposed to the First Progress card's $39 annual fee BUT it all pales in comparison when it gets to the interest rates! This card charges SO MUCH interest! That's unbelievable. The First Progress card literally is half as much, plus you have a month grace period. It seems like if you're someone who buys a lot of gadgets and electronics, this card might be good in the way of saving money on purchases and money back, but beyond that I do not see why this card would be appealing considering its strict application limits, incredibly high interest, and lack of ability to transfer your balance. I loved the camera I got from Radio Shack, but I'll go elsewhere for a credit card.

name: Carissa Bowerman-Boyd
review: This card seems like a great idea, but there's too many disadvantages in comparison to other options out there. For example, the interest rate is 23.99%. In comparison, the Capital One Venture card has an interest rate ranging from 13.9% to 20.9%. If you have good credit, it would seem to be a no brainer to go with another option. Another thing worth mentioning is, with the Capital One Venture card, you can spend your rewards on things like hotels, flights, car rentals, cruises, and more. With this Shell Mastercard, you only get to spend your rewards on gas. For someone who does not own a car, this rewards system would be virtually useless.In conclusion, I'm much more attracted to a card with a lower interest rate that lets you spend your rewards in various ways! I wouldn't recommend the Shell Mastercard!

name: Aletha Roach
review: The Home Depot Card looks like a great credit card if you were going to make a major purchase in the near future. The fact that they are offering 0% interest for 6-12 months makes this a great option if I needed to purchase an appliance or spend $299 or more. I have been looking at refrigerators recently, and if I found one that I wanted at Home Depot, I would definitely apply for this card. Also Home Depot offers free delivery and set up in my area, and they will take away the old refrigerator for free which is a huge plus. The interest rate is a little high, but I pay off my credit cards or transfer the balance before the interest rate kicks in, so this really isn’t that much of a concern to me.  I also like the fact that it doesn’t have an annual fee.

name: Alan Martin
review: The Best Buy Credit Card is a great credit card that gives individuals an opportunity to gain credit while they make big ticket item purchases.  The rates and fees are comparable to most other major credit cards and this one even has a few perks that come with it.  I'm a Best Buy Rewards Zone member and its great that this card will allow me to gain Rewards Zone points just for using it.  Throw in exclusive discounts and free shipping for online purchases and this card is a winner!

name: Javier Orellano
review: This Sears credit card does come in handy for anyone like me who shops at Sears. I like the intro rate on purchases, but the normal interest rate is a bit high. I think when I compare it to other cards that I have such as The Chase Freedom card it lacks a bit as far as benefits, but it is still a good card to have, especially if you need to finance some kind of appliance and choose to get it at Sears.

name: Cheff Nobodee
review: I really love the rewards that come with the Best Buy store card!

name: Caryl-Anne
review: I like some of the offers with this card! I have the AT&T Access Citibank card and you have to spend TWICE the amount to get 10,000 points. The Access Citibank card gives you 2 points for each dollar spent, as opposed to this card's 1 point per dollar, but I think that only applies to like certain purchases (including anything from AT&T). And I've found that more than half of the purchases I make online do not earn points. I'm going to guess that applies to this card too. They're pretty similar in most ways but I really like that with my Access Citibank card there is no limit to how many points you can earn, and I guess there's a 50,000 per year cutoff. One other big 'pro' for this card is that there is a maximum APR penalty. That is definitely not the case with my card, it changes all the time. I wish I could combine the two cards!

name: maria michael
review: This has been a GREAT card for me.  This is a good way to continue to have good credit and encourages me to maintain a good credit score.  I do not like carrying cash on me and knowing that every dollar amount that I charge using this card earns me points, is a HUGE bonus.  You can then apply the earned points toward payments and other benefits.  That can be a life saver for a college student especially because books and school supplies are very costly.  Their customer service agents are always helpful and take their time when you call for any reason.  I have never had a bad experience.

name: Linda Parent
review: I've had the Citi Diamond Preferred Card for over a year now and I couldn't be happier with it!  I pay no interest on purchases paid off within 18 months and was able to do balance transfers at 0% interest, allowing me to easily pay off other high interest accounts.  I've used points accrued to get some great deals on gift cards and hotels.  The extended warranty benefit is a big plus too, especially on electronics.

name: Shem Han
review: I currently use Citi's savings account because all of my other accounts are connected to Citi. What I can say is that I've never once had a problem in my decade long relationship with CITI. No withdrawal fees and no minimum. Interest rate is decent but I give 5 stars just because it't that easy to have and maintain. I'd rather have no problems as opposed to great interest rates with loads of issues.

name: Christopher Agnew
review: Its amazing that Sears has one of the highest interest rates out there. It's not variable, just 25 percent. I stopped using it and just use my Visa. Also, they offer no rewards like Visa.

name: Charles Marlow
review: All I can say is ouch! I am not a fan of credit cards to start with, but I do have a couple that I use and make sure I pay off every month.  This is a card that I have had in the past and glad to be rid of. I got it only because of a rebate offer that came with opening of the card in conjunction with buying some tires. Once I received my offered rebate I paid off the card immediately as I was not going to pay any interest computed at a whopping 28.99% interest! That is highway robbery in my book and used to be illegal in most states. It still should be!  On the plus side, the card does carry some benefits for car owners who regularly shop at Goodyear stores or dealers who accept this card as you can get rebates not offered to cash buyers or those who use another credit card. If you do get a Goodyear card be sure that you pay if off immediately and do not let the 25 day grace period slip past without payment in full.

name: Chris Hahn
review: I currently have a global executive banking account, since I mostly do work abroad. The great thing about this account is that there is great customer service. We even get our own hotline to call in case of problems. Also, there are no foreign transaction fees when withdrawing from anywhere in the world.I also have a couple of Citibank's credit cards. I like their Thank You rewards program, as they seem to have good products on there, especially for travel. Overall, I'm happy with Citibank. Plus, they have an app, which is great, because most of the time, I'm very busy and don't have time to go to a physical branch. I can do most of what I need to do on there: transfers, check balance, deposit checks. It's great.

name: Tony
review: I am a small business owner, and I buy office supplies on a monthly basis.  I am a Staples Reward program member, which gives me a rebate for items I buy at Staples every quarter.  Now I have a Staples Store credit card, which automatically gives me 5% back on all Staples purchases.   So I am now basically getting a large discount on every Staples purchase.  The car also has great features.  No yearly fee, great online services,easy online application process, and great customer service.  All of those are so importation for a small business owner like myself.  It helps me manage costs, and it is easy to keep track of purchases made by others in the company.
