I keep all of my records online.so that makes it even easier to access and monitor! I  would highly recommend  the Staples Store credit card for small, medium and large business owners!

name: Yasmina Rivas
review: I had this card but I don't recommend it as it is very limited. Only good if you have a business vehicle where your tires are going to wear before two years and you need continued service on your business vehicle. The pros are that it doesn't charge annual fees. The cons of the Tire Kingdom card are that it doesn't offer any rewards and it's interest charges are high. I don't recommend the Tire Kingdom Card for anything unless you have one or more vehicle for business use with high commute.

name: Alex Borgstein
review: Citibank's Basic Banking Checking account is pretty good in some ways but there are a few downsides.On the upside, you can sign up online and there's no minimum balance required. That's pretty convenient, most banks you need to sign up for in person. They provide good services otherwise as well, this is a great checking account/bank for someone just starting out.There is a monthly fee though you need to be careful of. You can avoid it with a large enough balance in your account but this can be difficult if you're a student or have a lower income.Overall, it's a pretty good checking account with some unique convenience features, I'd recommend giving it a look.

name: Arianna Thomas Robinson
review: The late fee on this card is kind of high.  I do like the fact that there is no over the limit fee.  Sometimes this is hard to avoid.  The grace period is excellent.  Sometimes things happen and you need just that extra time.  This card does not have an annual fee so it does not charge to just hold the card.  I like that.

name: Cassie Pierce
review: The Staples Store Card is a great card to have for consistent Staples shopers. My husband loves going to Staples for our computer and office supply needs. The Staples  Store Card is similar to our Kohls Store Card. The Kohls Card offers more rewards. Staples offers no bonus rewards, while the Kohls Card offers up to a 35% discount. As far as APR is concerned, the Staples Card is at 27.99%, while the Kohls Card is at 23.99%.

name: Camille Patterson
review: The Expedia Credit Card offer is great for people who travel a lot! People can use the point system to their advantage and without giving it much thought they can earn points towards a hotel stays and traveling. The downside to this card is its fees, the late fees and cash advance fees are a burden. The Max penalty APR is too high as well. If they could lessen the fees, the card would be more appealing and more people would sign up.

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: This is my favorite card. I love it because I paid no interest rate for the first eighteen months and after that my rate was still relatively low. Also there are minimal fees and no annual fee!

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I think that this card is relatively good compared to other travel credit cards. However, I think that the whole points system is confusing to someone who doesn't know a lot about it. Also, the interest rate seems to be pretty high and the fees are also high.

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I like how this card has a rewards program that caters to people who shop a lot there. However, I do not like the rewards outside of the store because they seem to be minimal. I think that the fact that they offer 15% off your purchase and a $20 gift card is great and not many cards offer that in store.

name: Regan Williams
review: Recently I just opened a new checking account with CitiBank. I am very happy with it for a number of reasons. I was able to set it up online and the best part was I did not have to make an initial deposit. The customer support through the process was phenomenal and I would highly recommend Citi to anyone!

name: Alex Borgstein
review: The AT&T Credit card is a pretty good choice.The interest rate is variable but generally, if you're responsible, stays low. The rewards are really good, lots of points to be had if you use the card. It's the best part of this card.On the downside, the interest rate can swing higher but even then the rate is pretty competitive.All in all, if you're a fan of the company you'll like this card.

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I particularly like this card because of the really low interest rate. They gave me a great insurance rate starting out that did not raise over time. Also, I like that there is no annual fee or hidden fees. The only thing that I don't care for are the rewards programs because they do not apply to places that I like.

name: Robb Pope
review: the WORST CARD EVER......THANK GOODNESS I PAID IF OFF CUSTOMER SERVICE SUPERVISORS LIES TO YOU AND ARE VERY RUDE PERFECT EXAMPLE IS SARAH ID #5020 WHATEVER YOU DO STAY AWAY FROM THE CREDIT CARD IS JUST NOT WORTH IT! NOT WORTH ONE STAR BUT YOU DONT HAVE MUCH CHOICE WISH THERE WAS A 0 STAR TO CHOOSE

name: Ken Lin
review: The interest on the saving account is barely anything. However, the amount of money you have on your saving account can be consider as minimum balance that's required by the bank to maintain. There's a combined minimum balance, but that's a different story. I have this saving account just for the fact that the bank wants me to have it, so I just open one. There's really no advantage to it.

name: Ken Lin
review: The application process takes a long time. It takes nearly 2 to 3 hours to just set up a checking account. When I have problem, and I call customer service over the phone, they are not helpful at all. However, when you have a dispute about a charge, you will be able to get a temporary credit, and the bank will reverse it within 30 days if they found it to be invalid. A lot of promotion with digital product, and definitely not a bank that you expect to do things in person.

name: Sabina Hunt
review: I have had my Best Buy Credit Card for years and I have always found it to be one of the better store cards.  They frequently have good promotions like pay no interest if paid in full in 3/6/12 months and 0% APR for 12-24months. The holiday season is the time where they have great savings on big ticket electronic products and offer the interest-free deal.  Believe me, this is as good as paying in cash and it helps tremendously when you have a lot of big ticket items to buy.  Not to mention that they have a rewards zone where you can accumulate points to redeem for cash. They give out $5 or $10 rewards depending on the price of your purchase to use the next time.Customer service definitely great.  I forgot to pay on time one month and had incurred a late fee.  I called them up and got a hold of customer service fast and they were very understanding and waived the late fee!  One of the few cards that I definitely recommend!

name: Amanda Smith
review: I'm in charge of getting all the supplies that our small office needs. After much debate, I decided to go ahead and get this store card because it seemed like a great card to have. It's easy to use, the billing is easy to understand, and there is no annual fee which is always a HUGE plus in my book! I also get some discounts when I use this card which really helps when you're already spending so much money at the store. Of all the store credit cards I own, this one is definitely my favorite. Another thing that really helped me decide to get this card is that I just really love Office Depot in general. Every time I walk into my local one, the workers are always very friendly and always willing to help me find what I need.  Overall, I'd recommend this card to anyone who spends a lot of money at Office Depot for their office

name: Courtney Wilson
review: It's an ok card overall does the job, just not that great. The interest is bad. There is not really much you can do with it without having to pay tons of interest. It does the job when use it for small purchases, otherwise choose a different card. Not good for emergencies especially if it's a lot of money being used.

name: Ryan Hartline
review: The City Simplicity Card is an all around great card for anyone who is looking for an affordable why to spend money. You pay no interest for 18 months and the interest rate ranges for 12.99%-22.99%. Customer service is available 24 hours a day which helps when you have issues with purchases and card use at odd hours of the day. You also get a 23 day grace period, which is at the higher end of the spectrum when it comes to credit cards.

name: Tina Gallagher
review: On the whole, the Shell Gas Card is good for buying gas nationwide. For the first two months, I can save 25 cents off the price of each gallon of gas or diesel. Flexible payment options and no over-limit penalties that add to my balance is great. After the first two months, I will only save five cents a gallon, up to 100 gallons a month. The interest rate is also nearly 25 percent, which is higher than credit cards.

name: Donald Pinckney
review: I signed up for the Citi Simplicity card due to the promo they were running that offered eighteen months no interest financing on both my purchases and my balance transfers. Citi seemed to have some issues offering me a card with a decent limit but after some back and forth with them I was able to push it to a higher more useful level. This allowed me to consolidate my outstanding credit card debt onto one credit card, and pay it off quickly. Also it allowed my credit score to increase since my credit utilization went down after paying off the outstanding debt. The zero percent interest allowed to me to also buy a new TV that I need to replace an older one. This was the better card to use than a Best Buy credit card or any other store credit card, because of the warranty protection that Citi offered which allowed me to double the warranty that Samsung, offered on my TV at no extra cost. I save money do that as opposed to buying a protection plan or extended warranty from the store. Also it allowed me to get price protection at the same time which meant that if the TV went cheaper during the next sixty days I could get the difference. Best Buy only offers price protection for 14 days and that's with only certain retailers. Lastly Citi offered to cover the TV in the case of theft or damage for the first ninety days which my renters insurance would cover but at a deductible that might not make it worth it. The downsides to the Citi Simplicity card is that it does seem difficult to get someone the phone that can actually do something for me. When I first applied for the card they only offered me a two thousand dollar credit limit. This seemed pretty useless to me since the capital one card I already have, has a much higher limit and it wouldn't allow me to transfer my balance. After about a week of conversations with the their customer service and reaching out to higher level customer service members, I was finally able to reach someone that could assist in raising my credit limit. It does seem like most of their customer service operations are located in India which does make it difficult to understand the person, I am talking to. The other major downside to this card I would say is the lack of a rewards program like most other credit cards offer. Bank of America offers me 1 percent on all my purchases and 2 percent on my gas and groceries which makes it the card I generally use for day to day purchases. Citi seems to be trying to hedge against rewards with their VIP program which offers exclusive concert ticket, sports tickets, and some VIP parties. This doesn't seem nearly as useful especially when you consider that you have to spend more money to use these features. At the end of the day this seems like a good card to use for large purchases but not for day to day use.

name: Mario
review: Hello,This card is a Shell Mastercard, so it's accepted where Mastercard is accepted. Now right off the bat, reviewing terms and fees makes this card the worst performing card and even probably the worst performing Mastercard branded credit credit. There are no advantages to this card.No rewards, no bonuses and there's only a $0.20 rebate per gallon of case; the rebate is merely a discount. Since the cardholder would obviously be using the credit card, as the transaction comes through, $0.20 per gallon would be knocked-off (discounted.) Of course, this would only be for Shell locations because Shell wouldn't inventory every gasoline vender in the world, so it's only Shell.The regular rate is 23.99% which means for every dollar ($1.00) spent using the Shell card, Shell receives nearly $0.25. For example, spend $10.00 and Shell receives $2.50. Now $500 in qualifying purchases (means "gas") in 30 days and Shell rebates $0.10 per gallon. So on average, the cardholder will receive 1% for $500 spent on gas (translation: $5.00.) Careful because the billing cycle is 25 days and after the 25th day of the month, the cardholder is dinged a late fee (of course,) but here it's not clear, so assume it's tiered late fee called a max late fee.Good luck.

name: Luke Bauserman
review: This was the first credit card I got. I applied for it while I was in college and still have it. Citi is a good company, their online account and payment system is super easy to use. I frequently use the rewards points to shop on Amazon.

name: Collin Vickers
review: I own a small internet-based business providing literary critique and editing services to novelists and bloggers around the United States.  I routinely have to print out manuscripts numbering hundreds of pages so that I can provide written feedback in the margins.  The 10% discount from the Office Depot Business Store card saved me $50 right off the bat - my first purchase was largely paper, and I still have some stock from that initial purchase on hand.  When I need related goods, I only shop at Office Depot, and I highly recommend this card if you have a strong need for these types of supplies in your line of work.I also have to do all of my own accounting and tax filing, and the monthly statements I get from Office depot greatly simplify this process for me.  Almost all of my business supplies come from Office Depot, and being able to contain my business purchases on one account with a single, unified set of books, has been a big time saver for me.

name: Natalia Logotina
review: My husband and I got this credit card when we decided to buy a 50 inch TV. We got approved in no time and got 24 month 0% APR, which is amazing. We also had an opportunity to choose to get 5% back but 6 month 0% APR. Online portal is easy to navigate, which makes paying the bill online as easy as it can be. Also, you can call or even go into the store to pay, which is nice. BUT in order to pay as little interest as you can, you have to pay off card within the promotional period, and you will need to calculate how much to pay yourself.  Another thing that I really like about this credit card is that when the bill is ready, they send me an e-mail, so I never forget to pay it. Nonetheless, the card is very good, and I am planning on using it this holiday season.

name: Michael
review: Use it as lot for our office K-Cup purchases and for vital supplies.

name: Tommy Jones
review: I have been with the Citibank for about five years now, and it is perfect for me. There are no monthly fees, or hidden fees. I also love how i can use the online banking app, it is so easy to use and a great tool for a college student. There have also been many times where I lost my debit card, and i have canceled, and received a new debit card in less than a week. This is a great banking account for all college students.

name: Sam Ashley
review: I have used my citibank savings for 3 years  now and love it. The interest rate i receive each month is wonderful plus its so easy to use. I like that i can also have alerts sent to my phone to let me know the balance. If the balance ever drops below a certain amount they let me know. I couldn't ask for a better savings account.  If you want a good savings account go with this one. You won't be unhappy about it.

name: Sam Ashley
review: I love my citibank checking account. I have had no issues with it every. Plus whenever I need help I can call in and know I am going to get great service. I have had issues with my debit card information being taken and they cancelled then sent me a new one overnight. I have never had another bank do that before!!

name: Michelle Meadow
review: I have had this card for over 1 years now and it gives me so many options as far as payment. They offer 0% many times a year off of purchases higher than $500.00. They have great customer service as well. Most of it can be done online without ever having to call into the call center. I really have enjoyed my card and will continue to use it.

name: Jim
review: The Best Buy card is a great financing card for large purchases at best buy, and for people who frequently shop at best buy. I have had this card, in multiple iterations, for a few years and routinely get mailed $5 discount coupons and other invitations for in-store events. The card has a relatively high interest rate at 17.99% however again this is a REWARDS credit card, and should never have a balance carried on it outside special financing periods for new purchases. The deferred interest deals are pretty industry average, ("6-Month Financing On all storewide purchases totaling $149 or more, 18-Month Financing On all purchases totaling $429 or more, 24-Month Financing On all HDTV, home theater and Geek Squad® home theater installation purchases totaling $799 and up"). Other reviewers have complained about balance transfer fees, and cash advance fees (5% each) but these fees should be completely irrelevant to this card which you would not utilize for a balance transfer. Overall this is a good card to use, if you are a frequent shopper at Best Buy and want to accumulate some points for a new game or CD OR need to finance something at 0% interest for a varying period of time.

name: Jim
review: Calling the Sears Credit Card a Credit card is somewhat misleading, it is more accurately a financing tool offered on site when making a big purchase. With a regular interest rate of a shockingly high 25.24%, the only purchases that would make sense on this card are ones that are paid in full within the grace period at 0% interest ("within 24 months on Tool, Fitness, Lawn and Garden, Outdoor Living and Fine Jewelry purchases over $299... within 60 months on...select Furniture purchases"). The Sears Card would be a good card for someone with limited credit history, who doesn't utilize credit cards and needs to purchase an appliance, furniture, etc that they need and can afford.

name: Teresa Geib
review: BY FAR THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST CREDIT CARDS THAT I CARRY IN MY WALLET. THE PROMO WITH 0% APR FOR THE FIRST 18 MONTHS IS A GREAT HELP IN PAYING DOWN THE CREDIT CARD. WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANYONE

name: Patrice Williams
review: With an interest rate of 28.99% the Goodyear store card is one that could be used to handle emergency situations. I would definitely use it when I don’t want to tie up my cash but could pay my balance within the following 60 days. Being that they have over 4,500 locations I would feel safe just having it. You never know when you may get a flat tire or need automotive work.  The only down side is that they don’t offer a rewards program.

name: Sam Kirby
review: The Tire Kingdom Store card seems like an average card that someone with a lower credit  rating would get. Although there is an 0% introduction rate at first, that turns into a very high APR after that initial period. Along with that, there are no rewards that go along with the card. Everything else about the card seems similar to all of my other cards. I just really enjoy my rewards that I get with my other cards, like up to 3% cash back with my Bank of America card. This one seems to fail in comparison.

name: Joe Scott
review: I opened a checking account with Citibank a little over a month ago.  I received a debit card, and am very pleased with the service so far. There is no minimum balance required, and no fees. It's almost too good to be true thus far. They have ATM's in every 7-11 I've been in, which makes getting cash at any time very convenient. Customer service online is very efficient, and the associates in the bank are very polite. I give this bank 5 stars, and would recommend them to anyone who wants to open a checking account.

name: Lewis Garrol
review: The Citi Double Cash Card is chalk full of rewards and perks for those customers who use the card and make their minimum monthly payments on time.  Even if you aren’t always able to do that, the late fees with this card are just not that bad and the interest rate is pretty low, especially for a card that comes with so many bonuses.  Another perk of this card is that Citi’s staff is incredibly able and willing to help you understand all your options and also to help rectify any problem that may arise with your card, whether or not it was your fault.  Overall this is a very good card.

name: Erwin Zipfel
review: I'm really glad I got this card. I shop at Staples a lot so it comes in very handy every time I want to get some supplies for my house or even the office. Plus, the rates are very reasonable and much better than other cards that I have had. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

name: Yasmina Rivas
review: I have had this credit card for one year and since I am an LL bean fan I love it too. The $10 LL Bean coupons comes in handy to save even more. It is a great way to get some shopping money and is the main reason I will keep it. No annual fees or any hidden charges. I would highly recommend this card to anyone who enjoys shopping at LL Bean. It's a great way to earn rewards and is reliable. Their interest rate is very low. Only 13.99% and it is accepted in mostly every location.

name: Tr Gooding
review: I am very impressed with the Shell Gas card especially with the option to save per gallon with use of the card monthly. I like that its pay at the pump and no annual fee. We drive alot between neighboring states to visit family and it comes in handy and saves us per gallon with repeated use. Checking into the Hotel and travel perks too. There are a lot of stations here locally and neighboring states to stay to ensure frequent use and maintain a discount  per gallon. Their cashback/reward options seem great and we appreciate the fact that the Shell Gas Card does not put a cap on the amount that you are able to earn from your rewards.

name: Josh Tate
review: I pay my balance off every month so the APR is not such a big deal to me (though it is a nice feature to have just in case). What I really love about this card is the rewards program that is offered. With the amount of money I spend every month, I typically get back enough reward points to buy a $50 gift certificate to a number of online retailers. When I've had any issue with the card, the online chat has been able to solve it almost immediately. When I reach for my wallet, this is always the card I use!

name: Andrew Frisch
review: This card offers 2% everywhere which is stellar.  It also has a lot of new security features which protect you against fraud.

name: Jaclyn Cuorato
review: I wish instead of getting 5% back with the Radio Shack Store Card, they would just give us the 5% off immediately. When I use my target credit card it immediately takes 5% off my purchase right there, with no waiting fee. Aside from that I think this card is great!

name: Evelina Carrion
review: I bought some merchandise from Sears with a promotion deal, at the end of the promotion because, there was still a balance Sears charged the full finance interest of the merchandise I bought. no one explained to me that that would happened at the expiration period of the promotion, I was charged on my card 452.00 in one shot which brought my available balance over the credit limit, now I am stuck with 452.00 that I have to pay, sears customers beware!!!!!

name: Courtney Wilson
review: At the time when I had a credit card with them they weren't really great customer service. They didn't solve your problems very well. And the application process was very confusing at the time. I don't know about now but when I had a Credit Card with them it was awful. Customer service on a daily basis was rude and pushy. I didn't like how they would basically make you feel like it was your problem and not theirs to solve.

name: Justus Jackson
review: The best thing about this card is the fact that there is no fee each year. This is great if you only occasionally use the card rather than shopping there every week. The extras such as the cash back really work if you do all your office shopping at staples 5% on purchases can really add up. Although the APR is higher than some cards the payment options make it easy to pay the balance quickly while still gaining the benefits. Overall its worth having if you shop there a lot or tend to make 1 or 2 large purchases there per year. Thank you, Staples for giving me the ability to purchase office and school supplies on and offline. You have simplified my life with outstanding customer service, and prompt deliveries

name: Courtney Wilson
review: I've had my Best Buy card for a very long time It's an ok card for emergencies. The one I have is not just for Best Buy you can use it for anything. It has a good interest rate, not bad for a credit card. Customer service is good depending what day it is. I gave it 3 stars because I don't use it that much because of the interest. I've used many of times in the past, and that was a mistake, because I was paying so much to interest. Not at a bad card, but not really that worth it to be honest.

name: Ralph Wihlborg
review: I been using my Best Buy card for several years now and it is  a pleasure to have. It had allowed me to make many upgrades to my computer whenever I needed to do so. I also took advantage of the no interest for 12 months.

name: Joao Carlos
review: With the  AT&T Credit Card I get 10,000 bonus points for using 500.00, what a great deal. I remembering using my 500.00 on my Disney trip and I got the 10k points I was so happy. I remember using my points for a 100.00 gift card for my wife. The only thing I dislike about this card is the APR it is very High. The customer Service for  AT&T is really good they are very friendly and helpful with alot of information. When I went to my trip My card got blocked and when I called them, they were so helpful. I loved the experience I had with them.

name: Bridgett Grigg
review: The Citi Double Cash Card offers a lot of great rewards. Some of the best include Price Rewind and Citi Private Pass. There are no caps or category restrictions. Cost:There is no annual free and a 12.99 to 22.99 percent APR that is subject to your credit rating. Even on the high end of 22.99% this is still not bad considering some of the other cards on the market. There is no over the limit fee. The max late fee is $35 and the max penalty APR is 29.99%. You can get cash advances at a rate of 25.24% APR with a cash advance fee of 5%.Benefits:There is a 23 day grace period. You can enjoy a late fee pass on your first late fee too. This is the only card that offers double cash back. You get 1% when you make your purchase and another 1% as you pay for the item. Citi also offers the Citi Private Pass that allows you to purchase tickets to concerts, VIP passes, live shows, and other entertainment. You have access to presale tickets as well. One of the best features is the Price Rewind that will search for a lower price on your purchases for up to 60 days. If a lower price is found you are refunded the difference up to $300. If you've lost your card Citi will replace it, usually within 24 hours, via the Lost Wallet Service. In addition, they provide you with emergency cash subject to your available cash advance limit. The Trip Cancellation and Interruption Protection ensures that if things get in the way of your trip, you may be reimbursed for non–refundable trip expenses, like change fees, up to $1,500 per year. Other features include worldwide car rental insurance, concierge service, identity theft protection, and an extended warranty. If for some reason you need to call, you get to speak to a person instantly without having to wait. Other Pros and Cons:The card is lightweight and flexible. It is accepted nearly anywhere and uses a chip (which means you insert it rather than swipe it). On the con side, some of the online features may be a bit on the slow side or difficult to use. Also, the rewards will expire if you don't use your card for a year. You may redeem rewards once you have a minimum of $25. You can redeem cash back for checks, statement credits or gift cards.The competition:In comparison to the Capital One Quicksilver the extra .5% cash back rate is better than Capital One's 1.5% cash back rate. Capital One offers a $100 signing bonus that the Citi card does not offer. Which card is actually better would depend on how long the card is being used and how it is being used. When compared to the Fidelity Investment Rewards card the two cards are almost equal. Both offer 2% cash back and neither have a signing bonus. The Citi Double Cash card, however, has less restrictions when using the card. Also, the Fidelity cards rewards run on the American Express network, which may not always be accepted at some locations. The Citi Double Cash card is a Mastercard which is accepted nearly everywhere.

name: Jerry Luhr
review: While Citibank will usually keep your money safe, if something goes wrong, you're all but out of luck. There was a breach in my account once and the person who got my info used my balance to purchase a lot of things online. I contacted Citibank about this, and they didn't lock my account down until some time after I called them and took weeks to get me my money back. I'd use caution if you're planning on getting an account here.

name: Christopher Dixon
review: I liked this card and I enjoyed using it. I had NO problems, my bills came on time and I paid them. The terms were easy and the interest wasn't any problem. It was a great card! I enjoyed using the card, the store and some of the discounts it offered. There was no big interest if you make your payments in a timely manner, that is pretty hard to beat nowadays. The store was not packed, and Staples sold computers as well as software. This was very efficient compared to the big computer stores. I could get what I want and get in and out in a hurry. This is great when you are working a job and running a side business. I would say it was ideal.

name: Jessica N David Rader
review: I have been a Best Buy credit cardholder for around 8 years now.  I have made many big-ticket purchases over the years and have found this the easiest, most convenient way to pay for big ticket electronic items.  I have taken advantage of the 0% interest many times.  Every Christmas season I spend at least $500 on my Best Buy credit card and pay it back within six months and it is the same using cash in my mind.  The customer service for the Best Buy credit card is second to none.  I once forgot to pay my bill and tried to make a purchase.  I was able to call and pay over the phone so I could make my purchase.  They even waived my late fee.  I highly recommend this credit card.

name: Cory Cazes
review: I have been using the best buy card for about two years now. I love this card, the features are great such as no over the limit fee and a grace period of twenty five days. I use this card very often with no problems and if you pay off what you charge on it within the month you can also avoid paying interest on your purchase regardless of the amount charged. They also have the deferred interest for six, twelve and twenty four months depending on the amount spent over one hundred forty nine dollars. This is a great card and now you can use it for appliances to, because best buy has started selling stoves, refrigerators, washing machines and dryers. I would recommend this card to anyone, it's great.

name: John Barrowton
review: Always been a big fan of Meijer, it's like Michigan's personal version of Walmart/Target.This was the first card I ever got, not quite a credit card but still a big step for me. I did it back when I bought an Xbox 360 for the 10% off promotion and was approved pretty quickly despite not having much of a credit history.Since then I use it occasionally when I forgot my debit card or cash at home. It's easy to use, the terms are favorable, and it's a great backup option to have just in case.It's a good card to have overall, Meijer for all the complaints, is a good company filled with good people and this card will not let you down.

name: Andy L.
review: Citibank checking account is great! I had questions about how to accumulate points in their Thank You Points Reward Program and called Citibank customer service for answers. She explained clearly about how to accumulate points. The process was very easy and within the month I had accumulated points and very close to redeem a gift card. Customer service did not put me on hold and answered my questions almost immediately. She was very helpful! I enjoy being part of Citibank checking account! Setting up a checking account is very easy and I recommend others to call customer and asked questions about benefits of opening a checking account with them.

name: Steven Mixon
review: HD card is great for doing 12, 18 & 24 months no interest but the ONLY reason I gave it 3 stars is because they list on your credit report as a "Credit Card" when it is actually a department store card. Since I bought my washer & dryer and refridgerator, my credit score went to crap because they show this card as a credit card carrying a high balance.

name: Keith Cross
review: The Citi Simplicity Card is great for keeping these simple and easy. No need to worry about fees and penalties and the introductory APR is great for transferring a balance and paying it off easily. There other cards that offer late payment forgiveness, but you only get a few chances for forgiveness, not unlimited. This is great value even with the lack of rewards. For other cards you usually pay more in fees than you get back in rewards. With low interest rates and no late fees, this is a great card to have.

name: Amanda Jackson
review: I like that the Shell Gas Card offers a gas reward, but I think it should be a little more. I like that this card has no annual fee. The last credit card I had through Chase did. The APR rate is a little high, but they do offer a 25 day grace period in case the unexpected happens. Overall, it’s not the card for me.

name: Patrick Eagens
review: The Kingdom Store Card fails in comparison to the Capitol One Platinum card. The very high (about 29%) rate seems ridiculous compared to most cards, and if you don't need loan for tires I don't see why you would use this card at all. My experience was less than satisfactory for these reason.

name: Joe Scott
review: I just received my Citi Simplicity card a few weeks ago. This card is exactly as advertised, because it is very simple. I don't have to worry about a bunch of extra fees. I can use it anywhere, and I am a very happy customer. Out of all my credit cards this one is by far my favorite. Citibank has simply outdone itself with this credit card. I award the city simplicity card 5/5 stars overall. I would advise anyone to find a card that is more forgiving out there, and presents the user with lower fees. If you do find a better credit card, I would be extremely surprised. Having experienced getting a fee from being one day late, and knowing there is a forgiveness with this card is a huge relief. If you do not currently own one of these cards I would suggest you get the Citi Simplicity credit card now.

name: Jeff Lenz
review: The Citi ThankYou Preferred Credit Card is a pretty good card to use if you have really good credit and are looking at getting a brand new credit card.CostAs long as you are a responsible consumer, this card will be pretty good for you. Annual fee is always one of the first things that people look at when thinking about getting a new card and there's no annual fee here. For the first year there is no interest on balance transfers or purchases which is pretty common these days but still a relief to see. Once those twelve months are over, you will then pay 3% for balance transfers and a variable APR of between 13 and 23 percent. The actual rate you pay will be based on your credit score. Since this card is generally only offered to people with really good credit, chances are that your rate will be near the lower end of that range.RewardsThe way most cards are able to stand out from their competition these days is with the rewards they offer and this card is no different. You'll get a bonus of 20,000 points offered to you from the start. Those points are equal to $200 worth of rewards. However, you'll have to spend $1500 before this bonus kicks in. If you're someone who can afford to pay off your credit card right away then it's almost like you're getting $200 just handed to you.Most purchases will give you 1 point per dollar spent but using the card for entertainment or at restaurants will get you 2 points for dollar spent. If you get this card you'll probably want to use it most at restaurants to really get the most value out of this card. ConsThis card is alright, but there are a few problems I have with it. The reward program has a few flaws. Many other cards out there will offer you a better cash back rate than this one does. The fact that this card is also only truly useful at entertainment venues or restaurants is another drawback if you're someone who doesn't go out much.However, my main issue with this card is the fact that it advertises 20,000 reward points but it comes with the huge catch of how you have to spend $1,500 before that reward kicks in. $1,500 is a lot of money and many people won't be able to pay that off quickly enough. You may end up paying more in interest than the $200 you get out of the reward. It's a bit of a risky card to have but if you can afford then by all means go right ahead.VerdictIn conclusion, this is a good but not great credit card. The interest is alright (all cards have interest based on credit so your mileage may vary), you won't have to pay any yearly fee, and the rewards can add up. This might not be the best card you'll ever own but at the same time it will be far from the worst.

name: Kristi Shafer
review: I have to admit, I do love to spend money at BestBuy.  The credit card just makes it that much easier.  I buy what I want and pay over time and get 5% back in reward points. Come to think of it, it may make me spend more money in BestBuy...oh well. You earn 2.5 points for every $1 spent on purchases with the card. And get a $5 reward for each 250 points. Also, you get free shipping on items over $35 dollars, which can save you a lot of money when they don't have what you want in the store.  Shipping on most of these items would cost a lot of money because they are heavy items.  Customer service has always been helpful and friendly when I have contacted them.  They go out of their way to help out the customer.  I was late on my payment one time and they extended my due date and waived the late fee on my account, saving me $35.  They didn't have to, and I am sure it's not a policy for them to do that, they were just being kind in that situation.BestBuy offers a lot of sales and deals to their card holders.  They give extra percentages off and hold special ales and such just for card holders.  This can save you a lot of money, especially when they do this around Christmas time. I always enjoy seeing what special steals and deals they will bring out for us. If you are looking to get a department store type credit card, then I would recommend a BestBuy card to you, if you need to shop at BestBuy. They have lots of items worth spending money on and their customer service was very helpful to me in a time of need.  Just watch out for the interest rate and pay off your balances as quickly as possible.  Also, the cash advance fee is outrageous so beware.

name: Arlene Valladares Paz
review: My approval for the Sears Credit card was great as I was shopping for a new washer as mine had broken.  I had no choice but to buy a new one.  Annoyed at this unexpected expense, I went into Sears prepared to write a check for the purchase.  I was unexpectedly surprised by the salesperson who suggested that I apply for credit instead. I hesitated as lately I had been binge shopping and thought for sure I would not be approved.  He insisted, so I gave him my information for the application.   He input it into his computer and to my surprise I was instantly approved for a credit line of $1500. I accepted the new card and put away my checkbook, I was only slightly disappointed that there would be no reward points.What I do like about the Sears card so far is that I can pay off the purchase price of the washer without any interest rate being applied if I do so within 18 months of purchase.  The washer only cost me $599 plus tax and delivery, leaving me with some money left over to spend.  On my way home, happy with my new card and my new purchase, I thought about transferring my balance from my Citi Prestige Card and closing that account out as my Citi Prestige card has a really high $450 annual fee and carries a purchase rate of 15.24%.  I am still considering that but looking at the 5% transfer fee being charged by Sears.With the Sears card I can take advantage though of the 0% for 6-60 month intro rate on purchases to buy a matching dryer and I probably will do that once I pay off the washer.  The dryer still works well, but an upgrade might be nice.I am happy so far with the Sears credit card. I would recommend it to my friends and family.

name: Shane Hopt
review: The shell card is a new card offered by Citi bank and is accepted where all MasterCard’s are. Compared to other cards, like the Chase Amazon Rewards card, the Shell card offers much better rewards. Most cards only give 5 cents back, but the Shell card gives ten, 15 and 20 depending on the amount spent in a billing cycle. This makes it much easier to use and spend rewards. If you travel a ton and use a lot of gas, this is definitely the reward credit card for you. The rewards however can only be used on gas, which compared to the Chase Amazon reward card can be used on many more items. The major downside to the Shell card is that the interest rate is sky high. The Amazon chase card has a high APV at 22 percent but the shell card somehow comes in higher at 27.99 percent. This would not be a card to use for emergencies but is great for racking up rewards.

name: Jenny Barton
review: I do like that Home Depot offers no interest for 6 months, but if not paid off in that time frame, the interest is ridiculously high! In home improvement, most people will make a single fairly large purchase that can be paid off in about that 6 month time frame, especially when combined with other offers, such as big discounts that Home Depot offers during holidays and season changes. It’s a good card to have because more times that none it will have a zero balance, but on the occasional time you do use it, you have half a year to pay it off.  Perks they could start offering that would make it more lucrative are: include loyalty reward points, additional coupons for card members, or card member price on items. Overall, if you’re disciplined and can pay it off, I say it’s a great card to have. If you’re unsure you can swing paying off purchases, forego this card and stick to traditional major credit cards.

name: Christopher Paulsworth
review: I have been using the Citi Thank You Preferred card for the last year and so far it has been a fantastic card. The card started off with 0% APR for the first 12 months, so I was able to make big purchases with it, without having to worry about paying it off immediately. Even if you are unable to pay it off after the 12 month grace period, the APR after that really isn’t that bad. The rewards are fantastic as well! Great Card.

name: Nikkieta Kaylene
review: I was late on my payments a couple times and the customer service was always so nice and friendly, even though I was late in paying them. They took off late fees and were always cordial and willing to help. They never pushed sales on me, or reoccurring payments, I was very surprised!

name: Ashwin Iyengar
review: I have been using Citi Simplicity and Dividend credit cards for the last 10 years!! A few days back when I looked, I could get cashback above $20. And now I can't get anything below $50! I have $25 and $35 locked in 2 of my credit card accounts and can't get it. Pisses me off esp. because I thought I was smart to use Citi credit cards :(( I don't treat cashback as a reward but as money earned. There are several other credit cards I already have but don't use that offer equal or greater cashback without ___gimmicks___. I will switch to one of them and am writing about my bad experience to let others know about this dirty business practice of Citi. I contacted their customer service and was told that I may close my card anytime. And as for the $60 cashback I have earned, I'm not going to get it!

name: Justus Jackson
review: This L.L. Bean Credit Card offers great interest rates, no annual fee, and a pretty solid reward structure if you like shopping at L.L. Bean. Like the brand with which it is associated, this card seems reliable and effective. No annual fee is always nice, since you're already paying interest rates on your purchases anyway. The only thing to keep an eye out for with this card is that it does require Good to Excellent credit and that the rewards are mostly useless for those who do not shop at L.L. Bean

name: Ashley-Nickole Crist
review: As a college student this checking account is great for my needs. There is no monthly maintenance fee. I also don't have to keep a minimum balance. It does have a great app that is easy to utilize as well as online banking. It comes with a debit card too so it makes it very convenient for grocery shopping and the like. When I need  to pull cash out there are typically easy to find ATMs at their branches otherwise they charge me a surcharge fee.

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: I really love this card. I just applied for it when I applied for my Costco membership. The reasons I love this card:  It is accepted almost everywhere. It has a great rewards points system, even though people without the best credit are eligible to use it. There is no annual fee, which is always a bonus. Also, the online web payment system is very easy to use and I like it much more than the systems I have used for other cards. The final reason I love this card is that it is possible to get a very high credit limit even though I am just starting out building my credit.

name: Kristine Than
review: whats the credit limit on your card?

name: Blake Cooper
review: The Staples Store Card is a good card to have for use at Staples. It offers 5% rewards on all purchases as Staples, but no rewards on other purchases. It also offers no interest for a period of time which depends on the purchase amount, but the overall rate is quite high.

name: Rbl SmartAzz
review: The Goodyear Store Card has its pros and cons.Pros: The Goodyear Store Card is a good card to carry when you are in need of making a larger purchase like tires and cannot afford them at the moment. With this card there is a 28 day grace period. There is also no over limit fee. The Goodyear Store Cardholder also recieves special discounts, promotions, coupons and special offers.Cons: Like any other store card the APR is high coming in at 28.99 %. There are no balance transfers to this cards.Overall: I would only would recommend this card if you really need to carry for instore purchases.

name: Nicolette Bohannon
review: This card looks great for the no penalty fees ever! I'm always worried about missing my payment and receiving a penalty. No rewards is kind of a disappointment as lots of other cards out there offer some kind of reward, however minor. 0% APR for 18 months is nice, but other companies offer similar as well. It looks tricky about how much you interest you get charged after the 18 months but use it to pay off another card that has a higher APR and you're saving money!

name: Tracy Morrow
review: Like the other reviews pointed out, the APR on this card is really high. It’s too bad, really, because the card is pretty good otherwise. It’s got some nice benefits associated with it, and the online interface where can pay your bill online is really use to navigate. They also have great customer service. Over the eleven years we’ve had this card, we have accidentally paid our bill a few days late, and they have always been really good about waiving the late fee.

name: Chadd Lingle
review: Liars!! They say bad credit or no credit was ok so that you can build credit but that is a lie. All these cards are subject to credit check. I have never had credit cards or loans and I have absolutely 0 credit so how am I suppose to build credit as a student going to college??

name: sheba
review: I have been a member of citi bank since the start of my college days, I had my very first student credit card with them and eventually moved on to the Thank You preferred visa card I love earning my bonus points for entertainment and dining and earning 1 point for every dollar that I spend this definitely a card that I recommend for those who love earning points with the purchases that they make.

name: sheba
review: I have been a member of citi bank since the start of my college days, I had my very first student credit card with them and eventually moved on to the Thank You preferred visa card I love earning my bonus points for entertainment and dining and earning 1 point for every dollar that I spend this definitely a card that I recommend for those who love earning points with the purchases that they make.

name: Linda Kasem
review: I believe Citi is one of the best credit card companies out there. They have great customer service and their website is very easy to use. This card in particular has great rewards (things you actually want to get!) compared to most other credit cards. Getting a credit line increase is also fairly simple process too! I would definitely recommend this card for a student's first credit card or for someone's "main" card. I think the rewards and customer service are wonderful and make this card worth getting.

name: Blake Cooper
review: The Shell Credit Card is offered by Citi and has a pretty high interest rate of 23.99%. It is a rewards card and the rewards are earned in the form of savings on gas purchased at Shell stations. You earn 10, 15 or 20 cents off per gallon of gas based upon how much you spend in a cycle. The rewards aren't very flexible nor are they high enough to counteract the inflexibility. I would suggest a card that offers cash back like the Quicksilver or Amex Blue.

name: Blake Cooper
review: The Home Depot Store Card has a fairly high interest rate starting at 17.99% however they also offer no interest periods of 6 or 12 months based upon the purchase price. You should also take note of the grace period of 25 days which is shorter than the billing cycle. The main reason I rated this card a 2 is because it does not offer rewards. Unless you need to use the interest free periods you would be better off using a rewards card for your purchase.

name: Susan Reed
review: Even though Best Buy credit card has many advantages they do not offer a free transfer on balances which most all other cards offer.  They also chard 5% on the balance transfer.  They also have a high standard rate of 17.99% after the introduction offer is expired.  And if you do transfer they do not offer the introduction rate on that balance so you get charged the 17.99% right away. I love the fact that you can build points but I believe the interest is much higher than other offers I have seen.

name: Jennifer Touchton
review: The card can be used at reputable stores and the 6-month to 2-year introductory rate is nice.  However, the regular rate is excessive, even for a "store credit" type of card.  I would rather go with a standard, i.e. not tied to a specific store/brand, credit card, as those tend to have lower interest rate.  In addition, I don't see any type of rewards program tied to the card.  This type of program has become an industry standard, and I would no longer apply for a card that didn't offer one.

name: Brian Ackroyd
review: I have been very happy with this card.  I was really happy with the 0% interest rate for 18 months and then only 12.99% there after

name: Elias Carlon
review: While the Home Depot card has a very high interest rate of 26.9%, it also comes with six months of free interest. It is great if you are remodeling or making other major appliance purchases.  It is also good as a "back pocket" card. It's the kind of card that you keep at zero balance but on the off chance that your fridge or washing machine breaks you know you have the means to purchase a new one right away. Plus, you get an extra 10% off appliances when you use the card!

name: Leni Wong
review: I have had this card for over 20 years and have never made a late payment.  Due to a divorce and an upcoming kidney transplant, I called the company to request a payment modification.  I was initially offered a 0% interest rate to pay off the balance in 5 years.  I wanted to make sure that I could afford this payment so I told the representative that I had to look at my budget to make sure that I could do it.  I called back 6 days later and was told that the initial offer was no longer available.  When asked what changed in 6 days, I was told that the representative did not know and that she ran it through the computer.  I am extremely disappointed that they would treat a long time customer with an excellent payment history in this manner.  If that offer was something that was only good on that day, it should have been stated as such.

name: Juan Sarricolea Carrillo
review: I was shocked when I applied for this sears credit card....my credit is good!! 740 and they completely turned it down because I had three inquiries in the last 6 months. ..the guy I spoke to when I called to explain that decision to me was real short on his responses and stern, kind of rude, I asked him to reconsider such a ridiculous decision for this turndown...not a even a starter line of credit was offered....never shopping or applying with sears again...very unprofessional, rude and their credit decisions makes no sense!

name: Paul Hunter
review: I don't like the percentage rate. I've had better cards and my credit is terrible. I give it a huge thumbs down.

name: Angie
review: I don’t know about you, but saving money is not always easy for me. But I really wanted to surprise my husband with a huge vacation for his 50th birthday. I knew I was going to need help saving the money so I went into our bank, Citibank. The customer service person, help me setup a perfect way to save money. I was able to put my money into a savings account that actually got interest too.  I am so excited to spring the vacation on my husband because I know he deserves it.

name: Billy Spangler
review: I've had a Citibank savings account for just a little while now and have to say it's been pretty simple to get acquainted with.  I would have to say my favorite part of this account is the fact I can set up my external sources of income, such as Amazon Payments, to do instant transfers direction into my savings account.The whole push Citibank has done with making their business model revolve more around online banking has really gone far in my eyes.  It's ease of use, functionality and security all work well with my lifestyle.If I did have to change one thing it would be the limit to only being able to deposit a check over a mobile phone or tablet to just your checking account.  I wish it could just go into the savings account like all of my other external wire transfers.All in all, very happy with this account!

name: Kayla Cremus
review: I like that it doesn't have a foreign transaction fee, but it has a very high interest rate and you cannot transfer balances. The card really only seems beneficial if you were planning on shopping at Goodyear often.

name: Michael Kastner
review: What I do not like about the Kingdom Store Card is that it does not offer any type of rewards or cash back. I have a Discover credit card that gives me rewards and cash back so where is the incentive to switch cards or even get the Kingdom Store Card?

name: Aaron Lynch
review: I have two cards currently with Citi and they are my favorite Credit Card Company I have dealt with so far. I had a problem a few months ago with a stolen credit card number and it just so happened to occur when I was out of town. I frantically called Citi and explained the situation. They were more than helpful with this, they took care of the charges and had a new card out to me faster than I expected. Great company with great customer service!

name: Tyshon Joiner
review: I used the Staples business store card for my business mainly to purchase office supplies such as printer ink, printer paper, a few desktop systems from my staff to use while they worked in the office. What I loved about this card was the no interest if paid in full with 6 months, no fee for cash advances which I rarely used anyway, and the 25 days graces period which thankfully I have not had to try out.

name: Charlene Thomas
review: Thank you, Staples for giving me the ability to purchase office and school supplies on and offline. You have simplified my life with outstanding customer service, and prompt deliveries.

name: Janet Jongebloed
review: I originally got one to help with my home business, but I soon found out that there were so many other thing I could use it for! I totally recommend this card to anyone who has a home or business office!

name: Sere Chao
review: Because I work from home and thus responsible for all of my own supplies this card definitely does wonders for me. The next best thing besides actually busy in an office and mooching off their supply stock for free.

name: Chloe Sheffer
review: This card has a decent rewards system that is easy to understand. The interest rate is a bit high, so I try to keep my balance low. Every quarter there are offers for 5% cash back, on top of the 1% cash back made on every purchase. Sometimes the 5% offers don't excite me very much, but sometimes they are for very useful things like Best Buy or gas. Overall, this card is a good card to build credit and remain simple.

name: Timothy Proctor
review: I'm not a fan of all the fees that this credit card seems to have.  But then again this may be a regular things for credit cards.  I agree with one of the other reviewers that the THANKYOU points are not my kind of thing.  I would prefer cashback rewards. I have more options with cash back then I do with the gift card ideas that this card offers.  I do however like the idea that the card has a maximum late fee.  I understand that there has to be a deterent for being late, but if it's too high, it makes things really hard to handle

name: Darylin Bennett
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card has some of the similar features that I currently have on my Discover Credit Card. Rewards from credit cards can be extremely useful 3% rewards on L.L. Bean purchases and 1% rewards on all other purchases is a great deal. In addition, free returns and free monogramming at L.L. Bean! The interest rate for this card is also lower than my current interest rate on my Discover and Visa credit cards. The balance transfer fee is a little high, but I have never considered transferring my fee's from credit cards anyways.

name: Roberta Goodman
review: I've been using my Citi Diamond Preferred card for several years now, and I couldn't be happier with it. I initially signed up with this particular card to get 0% Intro APR on balance transfers and purchases, but the fact I can redeem my points to buy merchandise online has been a huge plus for me. Every time I've called customer service I've been pleased with the wait time and how my call was handled. I would highly recommend this credit card.

name: Erin Grupp
review: The Shell Gas Card is great if you drive a lot and you don't mind having another credit card. But what bothered me was their lack of online presence - you can't manage your card online, and in today's tech world this is a little shocking for me. I've also heard about the Exxon card, which seems like it has less perks. On the upside, the Shell card provides great hotel and travel perks!!

name: Dani Anderson
review: The Citi Simplicity Card, fittingly, made it simple for me to transfer over my balance from my Discover card. I wasn't happy with the APR on my Discover and the Citi Simplicity card didn't charge me any fees or APR for the first 18 months on my transferred balance. I was able to pay off another card easily and without ever worrying about late fees!

name: Keenan Harris
review: My experiance with shell oil has been terrible.  My boss has been riding my butt for the last week to get 4 accounts unlocked and shell will not email me a statement.  They said they would fax it and that it would take 2-12 hrs, it's been 2 days and I've called over ten times.  Every time they transefer me to who knows where in India with a terrible connection where I can't hear the person I'm trying to work with. We overnighted over 5 grand over a week ago to open up our fleet accounts and we know they have it and all they keep telling me is that it will take 7-10 business days to post.  Meanwhile we are stuck using the petty cash to write checks.  I know this sounds fake, but I wish that was the truth.  I will never recommend them to anyone, and have recommended other services to my direct managers in hopes to switch our business for the region elsewhere where they can actually work with us.

name: Bobbi Nodell
review: I financed a new computer for $1000 on a Best Buy card. After nine months and paying $900, I still owed $1000. Here's how it happened: On the 25th of each month, I sent  $100 through my bank's autopay. My payment was due on the 7th. Apparently, my autopay was not getting there until the 9th. I was getting late fees ($45),  debt protection (which I never ordered at $10.35), and then interest ($65.76) I called many many times. They reversed two late fees. After several more calls, they reversed one more. That is roughly $100. That means I paid $800 in fees. They were unflinchingly unsympathetic. No one should need to pay twice the amount of the item they purchased.

name: Lee Von Preussen
review: I wouldn't have paid a cent more. Citibank who now handles Best Buy Credit Cards are a bunch of Crooks.

name: Mitch Siegel
review: There is really no reason to use this card unless you are buying something expensive and they give you 6 months of free interest.  During major holidays like Labor Day and Thanksgiving they will give you 12 months of free interest on a minimum $299 purchase.  Home Depot has the lowest prices and good service on major appliances and does price match competitors as well.  I have used the card exactly twice in five years.  Once to buy a new stove and once to buy a new refrigerator.

name: Sandy N Bailey
review: So weird my card offers rewards but not liking interest rates

name: Nicole Gear
review: I'm giving the AT&T credit card a 2 star rating. The APR seem way too high for the credit rating that you have to to get the card. I do like the bonus points system, that could definitely be handy. Alot of credit cards, like the  Capital One card, or the Citi Bank Diamond card have 0% APR for at least the first year.  I would also boost the amount of savings on AT&T stuff, or what is the point of having an "AT&T" card instead of a regular one.

name: Matthew Flinders
review: Shell can be picky people

name: Rachel Dietrich
review: I once had my card number stolen. Citi alerted me right away, and once I contacted them took care of the problem in less than 15 minutes.

name: Stearns
review: I've banked with Citi for a number of years. If I go into a branch, they have been very nice and usually helpful. But, there customer service over the phone is terrible. I've never had a company give their customers more of the run around trying to resolve an issue. And I don't understand why the first real person you speak to on the phone can't help you and always needs to send you to a supervisor. They also tend to be a little crazy with bank fees - especially when you use a non-Citi ATM. I'd rate them a 21/2 overall - OK to use if you have a branch nearby, but forget about it if you don't.

name: Anna Borja
review: Look elsewhere! The terms of the Shell credit card make it a very disappointing credit card, unless perhaps you use this as your primary card, charge $500+ per month (and pay off your balance monthly, as the APR for this card is outrageous!) Also notable is that Shell gasoline is generally .10 more expensive than competitors! You would be better off going with another card. Amazon Rewards does not have a purchase floor you have to hit to begin earning or using the rewards (at Amazon), the APR is more reasonable, you can use your rewards in a number of ways (not just for Amazon rewards, you can use rewards for other types of gift cards and various). The Amazon payout is also nice if you shop at Amazon (3x points on purchases at Amazon, 2x for select other purchases, 1x for all other purchases) which is a little better than industry standard in my experience. Capitol One rewards is also worth looking into, though is a bit more difficult to qualify for.

name: Tatiana Munguia
review: Yup, I got this card. The Home Depot card is pretty good. I picked it up on the way to a remodel. The intro rate on purchases is  fair. I am seriously safer with this card than I am with paper money. First Home Depot card I have ever had. Its working out good so far.

name: Soror Viva
review: I like LL Bean and the credit card is good for free returns and monogramming.  I think the card is worth having primarily for free returns, and also to raise your credit score by having more credit that is mostly unused - at least that is how it works for me.  A valuable rewards card pays cashback, in my opinion.  Coupons are about spending, not gaining.

name: Pravina Fernandez
review: I have used Citi Visa in the past when I was a lowly graduate student. They made it so easy for me to fall into debt by giving me over $15000 in credit and tons of cash advance options.

name: victoria
review: I am not usually a fan of credit card terms, and often find them sneaky.. this Sears Credit Card seems to be no exception. They get you with the "no interest for a year" and then you look at the average rate. Once that year is done, you are swamped with it! This card also offers no rewards which is a big downside to me. It's nice to feel a connection to a company, and have them show that they appreciate your business. While this card might be useful in a pinch, in the long run, I would look elsewhere.

name: Andrea Cayton
review: The credit card for best buy seems okay. There are a few things I do NOT like about it one thing being that the late fee is kind of pricey. $35 just for a late fee?That's way to pricey for a late fee! you better never be late! I love the point system they have you get 2.5 points for every $1 spent and every 250 points you get $5 .There is NO earn or redeem limit which is super great. I like the fact that they have free shipping on orders over $25.One more thing I do not like is how high the interest rates are that's a bit to much for me.

name: Brandon La Fleur
review: I applied at the beginning of my first year of college. This is a good first credit card, especially for a student, and it is good for quick payments of anything from books to food. It's good to know that I earn points for every dollar spent, and since books cost a fortune it's nice to have some points to use towards more payments. If you take care, spend wisely and never overdraw, you'll have a safe and successful time using this card.

name: AL Diaz
review: lt ls funny to me the fact that l have a Bank 0f America Credit Card, a Chase Credit Card, a Capital 0ne Credit Card and a Discover Credit Card But l was REJECTED / DENIED for a Citibank Credit Card 2 Times already, They sure have NO love for me...

name: Vikki Knieriem
review: Actually having several accounts is not always benificial. The banks look at your "debt to income ratio" even if you dont use those other cards, the banks concern is you could max them out and wouldn't be able to pay on them.

name: AL Diaz
review: it is funny to me the fact that i have a Bank Of America Credit Card, a Chase Credit Card, a Capital One Credit Card and a Discover Credit Card But i was DENIED / REJECTED for a Citibank Credit Card 2 Times already, They have NO love for me...

name: Hari Kumar
review: I have got this card and I transferred money to it on 5th august. But money didnt get credited to my shell card till 18th aug. Whenever I call they will say that 'Will call back in 24hrs' which will never come. Once they said to verify with bank, I did that . Bank said 'Money credited to shell on 7th Aug itself' and they have sent the proof of successful transaction as well. I informed the same to shell services, but there was no action taken from their end.  THERE IS NO PROPER SERVICE FROM SHELL AND SERVICE SUCKS TO THE CORE. ITS BEEN 13 DAYS BUT NO ACTION TAKEN FROM THEIR END.my number-9886014712, hari kumar

name: Billy Hayes
review: The Citi Simplicity Card is definitely true to its name.  I got the Citi Simplicity card when I needed a card with no annual fees, which is just one of the wonderful features of this streamlined credit card.  The other main selling point for me was zero interest for 18 months.  This feature makes it an ideal card for transferring balances and paying them down over the course of 18 months.  The low-interest rates, mine is a 12.99%, are a really great deal as well.

name: Geisa Henry
review: I like the Home Depot card but I believe it needs improvement, no discounts or coupons are offered. At this day and age  home improvement is not just for men , we girls do things around the house and we  love coupons. I have the card and I used to get something my husband really wanted for fathers day and I could not pay for in one shot (nail gun ) .I am grateful to have it. He was happy.

name: Kat White
review: I'm giving A T & T credit card a  2 star rating. Its seems to be a basic rewards program. The APR is high and so are the fees listed. If your credit is less than perfect then most likely you won't be approved. Even if you do have excellent credit there are far more superior credit card offers out there. The Barclaycard credit card has basically the same rates or lower and a better rewards program. They are also more forgiving to someone who has less than perfect credit.

name: Billy Spangler
review: I've had this checking account for a while now and I have to say the customer service has been excellent.  Not only does the android App work perfectly for my checking account, I'm also able to quickly and easily see my totals.  Speaking specifically toward the checking account, it's been very painless to get set up and people have commented on the professionalism of the design.  Thanks Citibank!

name: Nurv Mattherson
review: The Tire Kingdom Store Card isn't a great credit card to get unless you really need a card tied to Tire Kingdom. While there isn't an annual fee, which is always a good thing, the fact that the regular rate is 28.99% makes this card a poor choice compared to others. The only reason I can see this being a good choice is if you wanted to have essentially a free loan to buy tires and then pay off over a 6 month period. There is no interest if you pay off the balance in full by the end of 6 months. If you don't need that, then I would look for a different card that has a lower rate and offers rewards on your purchases.

name: John Bif
review: It seems that Staples has a very high interest rate.  27.99%  meaning if I need to make a large purchase for my business of lets say $1000.00 I will be paying them almost $1,280.00  that does not seem to be worth it for 5% in rewards.  I think you would be better off using a regular credit card with a lower interest rate and getting the free staples rewards card anyway.

name: Derek Jenson
review: this card has a very high interest rate. There are no balance transfers available. With my Capital One rewards card I am able to transfer balances and my interest rate is much lower. I would not recommend this card to friends or family. The interest rate is too high and there is no flexibility with balance transfers. Do not get this card!

name: Keith Calico
review: i bought a4 brand new tires and my car was totaled by another car that hit me. I should not have to pay for the tires

name: Nicole Mannan
review: This card is pretty average, not much reward for using it. I only opened an account because I got a discount off my first purchase. The cashier who signed me up told me about some "secret" discounts for using the card, but it sounds like you have to ask for the discounts, which many users will forget to do. I paid it off right away, so didn't have to pay the high interest rate. The only reason I'm keeping the account open is in case we need to purchase appliances in the near future.

name: Madison Haliloglu
review: Through reading the information regarding this card, I know that I would not be inclined to attain the Shell Credit Card. Firstly, the "max earn" in regards to cents off per gallon is only twenty cents. While this sounds good on the surface, I think that achieving that max earn is not as easy as it looks. Users may be getting less than twenty cents on a regular basis. This would also take a long time to add up, in my opinion. In addition, the card requires the user spend 500 dollars at least in the first billing cycle. I personally know that I would not get near this amount in the billing cycle, which is not advantageous. This card does not seem like a good fit. I currently use a Capitol One Credit Card. This card does not offer rewards, unlike the Shell Credit Card, but I think the rules and terms with Capitol One are more realistic.

name: Andrei
review: The great thing about Citi Bank savings account is that it allows me to transfer funds internationally at a low cost. As someone who sends money frequently to my relatives overseas, City Bank allows me to transfer them with ease. If and when I do make a transfer, they send me a notification both through text and email, which is incredibly reassuring for someone who works hard just to send his family some money. I do not mind the transaction fees for international money transfers as long as it gets there and Citi Bank does just that. For every transfer in person, they always reassure me the time and date it would arrive and if any problems were to arise, that they would call me. There have not been any problems in the past two years so I am glad I made the right choice in picking Citi Bank.

name: Maria Ryan
review: I've had my best buy credit card for several years now.  It's one card I will never get rid of just because I'm such a huge tech geek.  I love having this card for getting all my electronics.  Considering most electronics are not cheap, I like using this card to take advantage of their 0% interest programs that they have  Since my regular visa card has an interest rate of 15%, this helps to save me tons of money!  Not to mention the Reward zone points.  I get $5 to $10 coupons all the time from this!

name: Albert Cano
review: This card is good for those times when an emergency strikes and you need to replace an appliance like a washer, dryer or stove.  The no interest on these appliances over a certain amount, although this is a promotional offer, I have seen this offer promoted more than once a year.  Another great offer is the into 0% interest for 12-18 months.  Cards that offer this service are usually good to have around.  The cash advance fee is a little high at 5%.  I also like the Purchase Assurance which is comparable to the program that American Express offers on items purchased.

name: Tina Molina
review: I think that this is a very good card for the simple fact that it has many rewards.  It also hass a great grace period.  Although I think that the interest rate is a bit high but some of the other perks are very good in my opinion I just hope there is no other hidden items or charges

name: Sylvia Garza Stone
review: I am very disappointed with the Citi Platinum Select/AAdvantage MasterCard Benefis.  My husband and I are very good standing customers..pay our balance off each month and have never had an issue with our card; however, the benefits that are given for this card--well, it's deceptive.  I booked on American Airlines (using our credit card) in February 2014 for our trip in July 2014.  With AA and US Air merging, in June, they changed our airlines to US Air--not at our request but I figured since it's merging, all was good.  Needless to say, we usually get 1 free baggage checked in but we had to pay the $25 on the outbound and $25 on the return.  Usually we would pay and then get credited back.  When we returned from vacation, I called Citi about this and they sent me over to the Aadvantage Benefits Center and they could not assist me..they said their hands were tied and they could not give me the refund because it was US Air.  Again, I originally booked AA and the airlines switched our flights to US Air.  They suggested I go back to Citi as a customer and see if they would work with me.  After numerous attempts, I was given miles on AA (again, which may not guarantee anything as AA may be gone next year when we want to travel again) so I chose to close our account.  Having this card and paying $95 a year for benefits that are not good for the consumer..it's NOT worth it.  There are other cards with excellent benefits and no annual fee and they are good for the benefits they state.  I would have expected being a loyal customer, that Citi could have made this right and have provided a $50 pre-paid credit card of some sort to keep their customers.  Not so and I wouldn't recommend anyone paying for this card with no guarantee of their benefits.

name: Chris
review: They might not be earning interest premium, but they are earning swipe fees. If you spend a few thousand a month, they are earning $100 per month, or more, on you (and compound that with other customers).

name: Christine Brown
review: The AT&T credit card is good but, the APR is way too high for someone who has to have excellent credit to even receive the card in the first place. The rewards program is OK, but it’s just like the other rewards programs for other cards out there, my Best Buy card was very similar.

name: Peter Baldes
review: Love the 0% APR introductory rate for 15 months. The Thank You points are ok, and you can use them on Amazon. Not a bad credit card for rebuilding your credit.

name: Angie Clark
review: This card has a great rewards program that really pampers its users, especially when purchases are made within the store.
