The special card-holder only events are a fantastic way to treat their high end customers, and the no annual fee is just icing on the cake.  With a higher interest rate, this is definitely a card that you want to pay off each month. The only downside to this card would have to be the points you earn outside of the store. It unfortunate that it couldn't be tiered like MC's other cards, 3pts per $ on gas, 2pts per $ on groceries, 1pt per $ on everything else.

name: Bill Ryan
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is a good card by my standards. I go to Radio Shack often for most of my electronic needs as I found the staff friendly and helpful and the products of good quality. As a result, this card was an easy decision for me. The deferred interest if you spend $150 for 6 months or $300 for 12 months was easily surpassed by me and I love having no interest. The discounts, especially on the batteries, are great too. Would highly recommend.

name: Bill Ryan
review: The Shell Gas Card is great for me because I have a Shell gas station right by my house. I always buy gas from there so this card is very convenient for me. The annual fee is hardly anything when you consider what perks it has and how much people actually spend on gas. The perks for half price hotels and 10% back on car rentals really works for me. I value those perks the most.

name: Thomas Hawkins
review: This was my very first credit card when I turned 18!  They gave me a decent limit for having 0 credit.  The interest rate was extremely high, otherwise it was a great card!  The bills came on time every month, there was no fee for paying online and everything went smoothly!  They almost always had offers and promotions for no interest on certain products for a year or 1.5 years!  I used those promotions more than once to purchase a flat screen and car stereo!  I would definitely recommend this card to others!

name: Andrew Deller
review: I love spending money on gas, rent, and other things and then being able to pay for my entire yearly trip to Gen Con with the points. It saves me a fortune each year. The points are easy to earn and you can stock pile forever. I really do think this card rocks.

name: Jo Ann Walls
review: The Tire Kingdom Store Card has some really good benefits, but the rate Is way to high. The zero percent until Jan 2016 is great if you can pay it off by then. If you can't pay off by then the 29% is very high. It does not have any rewards like Discover card.

name: Kaylee Trawinski
review: I love that this card doesn't have an annual fee and the interest rates are reasonable. I also always love when credit cards offer you rewards. If you shop at brooks brothers there's even better deals for you! You get 4 points for every $1 you spend either online or in stores at Brooks Brothers, but you also get a point for every $1 spent on ANYTHING, which is awesome!

name: Christina Jones
review: I used to be a customer of Citibank until recently they closed down all of their smaller, local branches and moved to one large branch that is several hours away. I had been with Citibank for  almost 10 years and for the most part it was a reliable bank. However, I have had several issues  with the bank throughout the years that I felt weren't handled the best way that they could be. The customer service from the tellers was excellent but because of some bank policies their hands were tied when it came to resolving issues quickly and efficiently. All in all I don't regret my experience with Citibank and I would cautiously recommend it to a friend.

name: Carrie Willis
review: I got a Citibank account because I was spending a lot of time and money abroad. My then-current account was charging me excessive foreign currency conversion and ATM fees for using my debit card out of the country. I found out that the Citigold account had a monthly fee, but did not charge fees AT ALL for ATM or POS transactions conducted outside the US, realized i could save a lot of money.  I eventually opened up a second Citigold account in another country. Not only did the US staff help arrange that for me, the system lets me send up to $2000 to my foreign account instantly. This is much better than trying to get that same amount of money out of an ATM. Overall I think it is great for international travelers, expats or business people.

name: Leo Kaphire
review: I started using this card about two years ago. I've always love buying small things like CDs, games, and flash drives. So I would get a few $5 rewards for getting the points. We also earned some cash back after buying a couple of HDTVs last year and a new refrigerator, because our old one broke down. I honestly couldn't be happier with this card. And I love the promotions that they have every now and then. This is a great card to have.

name: Devlin Idell
review: I used to work at Home Depot and would always recommend first time buyers to get the card. Of course this was my job. It wasn't until that I looked at the interest rate that I thought it was a bit high. The best feature about the card on the other hand is that it offers 0% for 6 months with a possible credit increase once you pay it off before the 6 months are up.  There are no rewards of course with this card and all purchases have to made strictly with any Home Depot. I would not recommend purchasing anything online with Home Depot though. Even if you return the item, you will not get your refund back and you will be offered a gift card through email, which of course you will not receive. Just a warning.

name: Devlin Idell
review: This card is actually not really worth trying to go for the .20 on gallon gas at the pumps. I will have to disagree with saving money though using this card. If your still wanting to save some money without all the hassle of remembering to pay your credit card off with Shell, I recommend "My Shell Bucks" You still save money with .03 on the gallon, and the quality of gas is better for the Cadillac converter. This was recommended by the Honda dealership that did an emissions test on my car.

name: Mohammed Ibrahim
review: I give the AT&T Credit Card 3 stars just because of it's reward system. Being rewarded 1 ThankYou point for every dollar spent is good, but not too good, because alot of other credit cards have the same, or even better, reward systems as my Citi credit card. I also think this card has a really high APR for someone who has an excellent credit rating. So my thought of this card is not too bad but not too good also.

name: Eddie Gonzalez
review: I like the design of the L.L.Bean Credit Card. It is simple, and very calming. Its with Visa so its accepted pretty much everywhere. I would be happy with this as my credit card

name: Alyssa Merrill
review: I like that there are rewards on this card, but that does not make up for the 27.99% interest rate. I have rewards cards from places like Amazon that offer more with a smaller APR.

name: Tracy Lynn
review: I've had this credit card for about 7 years now.  While the card itself is okay, I am not a fan of Citi.  I was somewhat scammed into getting this card when I was in college.  There were people on campus handing out "coupons" for a free pizza at Pizza Hut, if you filled out a survey.  Turns out the "survey" was a credit card application and the card arrived a few weeks later.  Yes, I could have simply cut up the card and thrown it away, but I was a stupid college student so I didn't.  Fast forward 7 years and now I have a balance of a couple thousand dollars on the credit card and a pretty high interest rate.  In addition, if you are even a day late with your payment Citi will call you multiple times per day.  I've also had problems with their website as far as being able to access my account information, make payments, etc.  I also haven't received any cash back rewards in about 2 years, despite the fact that I am still using the card to purchase the same things I've always purchased (namely gas and groceries).  Overall, the card itself isn't horrible compared to any other credit card, but having Citi as the lender is horrible.

name: Trina Rigsby
review: I was wanting to make a semi expensive purchase from bestbuy but needed the flexibility of a low interest rate. Best Buy was currently offering 18mo no interest on all purchases above $99 so I jumped on it. Best buy also offers excellent customer service to their car holders. I had an issue with a payment once and got charged a late fee which they immediately credited back upon me calling in, no questions asked. If you are looking to make a purchase and plan on being able to pay it off within the first year or so then I would recommend the Best Buy rewards store card.

name: Ed Vallee
review: I like that this card has no late fees. Other than that, it is a standard card.

name: AMANDA
review: We used this card to make a large purchase about a year ago.  We got the 12 month deferred interest which was really helpful to us.  We were able to make payments without having to pay any interest.  This card is great if you know you will pay off the balance before the deferment period ends.  If not you may have to end up paying high interest rates.  So my advice is to look for special financing promotions.  Other than that they are about the same as any other store card.  The reward feature is great if you shop at Best Buy constantly.  The special financing offer is great if you are making a one-time large purchase.  Just be aware of the interest rates.

name: Danielle O'Neill
review: The Goodyear credit card is good in that it does not have a max overlimit fee and has a grace period of 28 days. The rate on the card at 28.99% is abnormally high and therefore I would not recommend this card.

name: Derek Jenson
review: I signed up for this card,  just to save when I bought a fridge.  Worked out well,  saved close to a hundred bucks. Haven't really used the card overuse,  the rewards aren't great,  but good for sears purchases.  No annual fee,  so no reason to not have it if ever needed. Would recommend to others, especially if making a large sears purchase.

name: Ryan Mortensen
review: This is definitely a great retail to have if you are an electronics lover or just someone who needs a new T.V./computer. When I originally got the card back in 2010 they were starting to offer the 0% financing for 6 months and free "geek squad" support which was definitely worth it. While I had the cash on had to purchase what I wanted, the points from the card allowed me to purchase a free HDMI cable. I have never had any issues with this card until about approximately 8 months ago when Chase (who I got my card approved though) stopped backing Best Buy cards and I had to switch to CitiBank. While normally this wouldn't have been an issue, according to my credit report I lost 3 years of credit history, and it effectively treated the switch as applying for a new card. This simple change reduced my average credit history by almost 11 months, AKA a 25 point hit to my credit score. Something to be wary of, but other than that a great card.

name: Kate Mecary
review: There is nothing particularly outstanding about this card.  It doesn't offer perks to sign up and the APR is comparable to those other cards.

name: Christine Brown
review: I love my Best Buy Store card. I get lots of points for purchases that I have made, that convert into cash back for me. I earned enough points that Best Buy sent me a $50 voucher to use in store on anything. I bought a video game that my son wanted for his birthday with it! The payments are very reasonable as well! Their customer service is top notch, and that is very important to me!

name: Anastassia Gragg
review: With it being a gas credit card, I wouldn't expect to get cash back  on everyday expenses which is a major plus.  However, the interest rate and the fact that you have to spend $500 or more just to get fuel credit is a little steep for a credit of 010 on the first 100 gallons.  It doesn't seem worth it.  I do like that their is no annual fee which a lot of cards these days have an annual fee with their rewards cards.  For me, I don't think this card would benefit me in the long run.  Maybe if they lowered the interest rate and maybe changed the $500 to $250 and you earned on the first $125 I would consider it.

name: Christine Brown
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is a great card to have. I have had other store cards before like this one but the experience was very different. I had the best buy card before and they made you feel like just another customer. Using my Radio Shack store card is great, they are very personable, and I used the deferred interest payments around Christmas last year. It was nice to have a "same as cash" deal from a retail store during the Christmas rush!

name: Rob Padgett
review: I really love the 0% APR for the first 12 months and the rather lower end 13.99% - 23.99% regular APR.  My Capital One card only gave me a 6 month no interest, and the rewards program looks very appealing!  Earning up to 50,000 points  year (equal to $500 in rewards) is outstanding.  I do wish the rewards could be redeemed as cash value like my Chase and Capital One cards offer.  Getting discounts on AT&T products, 10% first year and 5% thereafter is a nice bonus.

name: Ashley Rohrer
review: The Tire Kingdom Store Card sounds like a winner!  The rate is high but I like that they're offering 0% until January 2016 on purchases above $899.  And for purchaes over $199, you get six months interest free.  There's also no annual fee and the card can be used at multiple tire stores:  Tire Kingdom, NTB, Merchant's Tire & Auto, etc.  I certainly don't advocate using credit but sometimes Murphy bites you at the worst times and this would definitely be something to look into!

name: Duane Schmidt
review: Staples does a good job promoting these cards and emailing information to you.  I like the fact that there is not annual fee and there is an opportunity to earn 5% rewards on items purchased.  But, the interest rate on the card seems excessive at 27.99%.  It is also possible to fall into the trap of having too many cards.  It seems it may be better to stay with credit cards that can be used at all stores.

name: Indira White
review: I love getting rewarded for shopping! This card offers quarterly categories to earn 5% back and that is wonderful! I always activate the categories when I receive the email alert and that is when pull it out and swipe. If I wont be spending for those categories I do not use the card. One thing I do not like, however, is that you can only use rewards in $50.00 increments. This past billing cycle I had $48.80 in rewards, I have to wait a month. On the upside, it is a nice little check for later! Also, the interest rates I have are pretty darn high, 29.99% I have never paid interest, but I went to take a peak at what it would be if I did pay interest and was shocked! Overall, I am grateful for the opportunities my citi card offers. Besides the quarterly categories, another thing that drew me in was the intro 0% interest and bonus.

name: Victor Diaz
review: Citi always has pretty solid credit cards and they did it again with this one The Citi Diamond Preferred card is a good credit card if you are look for the basics a good APR, no annual fees. although this is a good card when looking a the base line there is no rewards program for the credit card which might have you back off since most cards now a days have some sort of rewards program may it be point based or even cash back. overall though a decent card.

name: Lisa
review: I am only giving the AT&T credit card a 3 star rating.   In order to qualify for this card you need to have "Excellent, Good" credit rating, which is fine.  But their APR % is too high if you have excellent credit in my opinion.  Although I do like their rewards program, which is why I'm giving them 3 stars.  I especially like the 10,000 bonus points you can receive after making $500 in purchases within the first 3 months of opening the account.  Everyone likes to be rewarded for purchases!

name: Jimmy Lussier
review: It's a good card. nothing really makes it stick out but it will get the job done. I don't use it much but I have no stigmas against it.

name: Rob Padgett
review: The Best Card card is great for those large entertainment, computer or even appliance purchase where having the cash on hand can be difficult.  My card came with 0% financing for 12 months, which was a great perk when I had to buy a new computer for both home and work at the same time.  The interest rates are a little high overall, but its a give and take with the 0% financing options that are typically available.  I would recommend for large purchases, not games and movies, etc.

name: Nicholas
review: I have have had this card for years.  I have a bank account with Citibank, and this card works well with that.  I can pay online and also check my other accounts, every simple and well done on the website.  The card benefits are also very good the point system with a large variety of rewards.  They always have different promotions going on where they offer increases amount of points for a set period of time.  Nice card to have.

name: Karen
review: Like most credit cards of this type, the Goodyear store card has very high APR. It's best used for purchases you know you're going to pay off by the end of the month. As I rarely need to purchase many things from Goodyear, it works out great. When I do need something -- like tires -- that make a dent in my budget, I know I can use this card and take a little more time to pay it off, rather than coming up with the money upfront. The discounts also influence my shopping here -- of course I'll go there and use my card if I can get a deal. Much like the Macy's card I have, I only use it when I really need something and I have a promotion due to the interest rate.

name: nate
review: Worst mistake I ever made was getting the Staples credit card. After I got the card, the store closest to me closed. Now I have to go out of my way to go to staples. Besides that, the customer service is crappy as they never know what there talking about as you can get two different answers on services from two different agents. Their is not discount for shopping with the credit card like most stores which makes it useless having. However, if you regularly shop at staples, it is not a bad card to get as the max late fee is 35 dollars but that the only upside.

name: Lumen Stacy
review: The best part about using Best Buy credit card is the points value.  Once you have gained 250 points, you receive a $5 reward certificate that you can use on future purchases.  They have great financing rates, as well.  The only negative that I've had with this credit card is the late fee.  You can have your first late fee waived, but after that, it's $35.  With the hustle and bustle of daily life, it's sometimes easy to forget about a payment.  The best thing to do to avoid late fees is to have your payment automatically deducted every month.

name: Rob Padgett
review: This is a great low interest credit card!  As low as 13.99% for a credit card is rarely heard of these days.  The reward and coupon potential are also appealing.  My Lowes card gave me the option for 5% off purchases or 18 months no interest on special financing during a certain period with minimum purchase amounts.  The normal interest rate was set a 24.99% AND it's typically a higher purchase use card the the L.L. Bean card!  The late fee is on par with the industry standard, and the 23 days for a grace period is very Generous!

name: Tina Tucker
review: I've always like shopping at Staples, they seem to have everything I'm looking for, so I thought I'd get a credit card.  This card is good if you have good credit.  I love that it is a rewards card, but I think the interest rate is a bit high.  I like that it has unlimited earning and spending of the rewards that I earn.  The late fee is pretty much standard - all the better to pay on time.  Also, having a 25 day grace period is great!  Upon comparing this card to my Walmart credit card, I see that the Walmart card offers a lot more:  cash advance, balance transfer and a lower APR.  But, Walmart doesn't have the variety of supplies that I need, though you would think they would.  So, I'll do most of my office supplies shopping at Staples and just get some things at Walmart.

name: Dakota Wise
review: The Expedia Credit card is great for those who regularly shop on Expedia. Besides that, point rewards are not as high as comparable rewards cards. However the Expedia Credit Card does have a few initial benefits. 10,000 thank you points are added when you sign up, as well as a 50 dollar credit. However, once the joy of these rewards fades away, this becomes an average card with high interest rates, and low point rewards. It's best to look elsewhere for a rewards card, unless you purchase regularly on Expedia.

name: Guilherme Bentim
review: DON'T DO ITI applied for this credit card for a 300 dollars bill regarding tires, alignment and such. I had enough money to pay at the time and the only reason I applied it's because the salesperson told me I wouldn't have any interest unitl next january. I wouldn't have to pay anything until next january. The next months, I realized that I was having too many credit checks failing for basic sutff, like setting up internet. I finally asked someone to pull up the information and my credit was completely damaged by an outstanding debt of 300 dollars on the goodyear credit card. I called them and they said it was their fault to not apply the "promotion" that made sure I wouldn't have to pay anything for a year. I paid in full, to try and re-mediate the situation but they are still processing a request to see if my name has to be removed from the credit bureau (even though they already admitted that it was their fault) and they won't compensate me for any moral damage. Conclusion, even though I paid, my name is still dirty, because I "owed" money to goodyear for a month. I forgot to mention, they didn't even send my credit card when I first applied, I had to call in and ask them to send it to me, which they said, one more time "it was an error on our end"Their system is unorganized and their mess will screw you over. Not worth it, find whatever other means to pay, don't fall for this crap

name: Chris Samuels
review: If you shop a lot at Radio Shack this is the card for you. Please remember to get the maximum rewards out of this card it is best to pay off the balance before the interest fee kicks in. The twelve month no interest with a minimum of a $300 purchase is a great deal for the large purchases. This compares pretty favorable to the current best buy card that I am using. The no interest is much more favorable on this card than what I currently have.

name: Maureen Graessley
review: The trip interruption coverage is very limited.   The only coverage provided is for transportation you cannot take due to an accident.  If you get injured on a trip and need to return home before the end of the trip, there are no benefits because you are able to take transportation.  They list trip interruption and accident coverage as a benefits, it doesn't really seem to have much if any payout...

name: Dashaun McManus
review: There are so many credit card companies and each offers something alike or over the other AT&T Credit Card offers regular rate 13.99% - 23.99% (V)  and an intro rate on transfers 0% for 12 months and you can earn 10,000 bonus thank you points after $500 in purchases within 3 months. That is better than my bank card.  Bonuses are everything today if you are going to have a card it might as well earn you something useful.

name: Marianne William
review: It's very good for shopping.

name: Beth Grant
review: I have had this card for several years now, and have been very happy with it. The main reason I signed up for it in the first place was that the interest rate was much lower than other cards. Citicard has excellent customer service, and has quickly resolved the two disputes I had in a very satisfactory manner. I frequently receive 0% interest balance transfer offers, which have allowed me to pay down my other credit cards. I would definitely recommend it.

name: Britney Carmack
review: This credit card is a joke and I suggest no one fall into the trap of the "free 6 months no interest" it's total bogus. I have been a card user since 2009 and yet again they have changed their third party credit card company to yet another 3rd party credit card company. It's a total scam to take money from people. Also, watch your email they will send you emails saying you haven't paid - if you paid early or if you pay the day before- then charge you double.. SCAMMERS.

name: Alyssa
review: I have used my Sears card for many things. I love the shop your way rewards that you get for so many dollars spent. I love how you can use the Sears card at K-mart. I have done this many times. My most recent purchase with my Sears card was a 60 inch Smart TV. I absolutely LOVE my TV and would recommend anyone to go to Sears.

name: Anthony
review: The great thing about this checking account is that there are no fees and more to that no minimum balance requirements which gives you a financial break as a student.The account comes with luxury of online banking which can be accessed from the citi mobile app if you have a smart phone. On the other hand citibank ATM's are very accessible because they have some at the main branches and 7eleven's which makes it easy to access your money at any time

name: Michael Turner
review: The Best Buy store credit card is a no-brainer.  Not only do they have a nice rewards program for every purchase made, but it also comes with several no interest financing plans.  It's perfect for Christmas shopping in a pinch. They give you 6 months no interest on any purchase over $149, 18 months no interest on purchases over $429 and 24 months no interest on purchases over $799. Please do yourself a favor and go get one

name: Nandhu Vai
review: My bank is citibank. Once I had told my friend to purchase a mobile for me in a deal. So I had sent her money by net transfer. I transferred but the money didn't get deposited in her account on time. So I missed such a great deal. I never found such a good deal again. Apart from that customer service is good.

name: Israel Tour
review: I just got approved (6/20/14) of my first ever citi card (citi diamond preferred card) with almost $11k credit limit. With 18 months 0 balance tranfers and purchase fees. Approval took less than 60 seconds.

name: Happy Timez
review: Whats ur credit score

name: Matthew
review: I started out with a CitiBank paycard from my work and had a really good experience with it, good customer service and a well designed website for checking my balances, transactions etc. So I decided to apply for a CitiBank saving account. This is the first time I have ever held an account with CitiBank so far I am loving it. I like the website and I loved the fact this particular account had no monthly fees etc. that many banks try to stick to their customers now days. CitiBank gets 5 stars from me.

name: Rhianna Edwards
review: This is a great card overall if you stay with the basic card. I don't think the preferred card with the $125 annual fee is worth it. I got this card when it was offered to me with a 0% APR interest rate and used it to transfer some high interest balances. They usually offer low APR balance transfers with low fees at least every few months. The rewards are easy to use and they offer the ability to cash in for Amazon credit. They have been especially great about disputed transactions. I have had two times within the past year when I had to dispute something. Both times the response was prompt and they fixed my issue very quickly and to my satisfaction, Overall I would recommend this card.

name: Chris Falco
review: Good promotions and overall benefits. No hidden fees I've noticed so far but the rates aren't the best out there. Still, good for responsible buyers.

name: Aaron Gershon
review: The rewards are not as good as Citi makes them seem. My Amazon.com Visa from Chase has better rewards than this, and you need only fair credit to get that card. This card is significantly overrated. The APR is irrelevant to me because I NEVER carry a balance.

name: J T
review: I have been with Citibank for a few years now and have had an average to good experience. I currently have a credit card with Citi and can say I have not had a single bad instance of service or an error. Their online banking and electronic statement service is a great feature that I take advantage of. If you are looking for a decent credit card, Citibank is a good place to look.

name: Aaron Hinkle
review: Unfortunately I had a very negative experience with Citibank basic checking and I was forced to change banks and cancel my account briefly after opening it. Within the second month of owning an account I was charged 60 dollars in miscellaneous fees. I no longer trust Citibank and I would advise anybody looking into doing business with them to do their homework and check their statement.

name: Alyssa
review: I love having my Home Depot card. It has gotten many great uses already. I purchase a lot of non-traditional home improvement items here such as cleaning products, laundry detergent and paper towels. I have also used it this spring to help spruce up yard.

name: Jay Steve
review: The Staples card is a great deal. I have a need for a lot of business supplies and being able to get them all in one place at a discount is a major plus for my business!

name: Rebecca Pearre
review: The promotions that they run for card holders is awesome!! The one that runs everyday is 18 months, no interest financing for purchases over $499.99 They run a lot of other promotions too depending on what drive time they are in such as back to school, back to home, dads and grads, etc.

name: Jay Lowrey
review: This is a hard card for me to get excited about. It is really only good for getting the interest deferred on a tire purchase for a few months. Buried in the fine print, you can also see that all of the interest kicks in later if you miss even one payment. This should be made much more clear, and it seems like a way to trick customers. I think it would also be nice to offer some type of rewards program such as points towards new tires, etc. Overall, this card does not offer much value, and I would likely end up putting my purchase from this store on my standard credit card.

name: Phuong-Dung Tran
review: don't appy this card because I have it for a year but they tried to lie and take money from me. I tried to call them 10 times to talk with them about pay off but they asked me SS number I gave to them they said not right and told me to call back. And I called back and they said the same things. It is horrible company

name: Aldric Alfonso
review: I love the Best Buy Store Card. Not only do I like buying electronics, I love being able to test them out and get some additional info about them while I'm at the store. That is why the Best By Store Card is so useful for me since I tend to buy a lot of products at Best Buy. The fact that I can buy a product that is $600 for instance, and not pay any interest on it for 18 months is really useful for me. Even though I tend to pay off the balance way before the time limit on some items, I find it really useful for times when I have to stretch my spending a bit on some other items.

name: Kim Lemon Rabine
review: I'm impressed with the terms of this credit card.  The fact that it has a 0% interest rate for the first six months is a nice feature.  I have a similar card.  However if the balance on that one isn't paid within six months, the interest rate skyrockets.  It appears the Best Buy Card has a progressive introductory interest rate on purchases for the first four years.

name: Jesilyn Givens
review: I think this card would be ideal for when we decide to remodel, or are purchasing a new home that needs repairs. The fact that it is 0% interest within the first 6 months gives you the opportunity to make big purchases and pay them back within time especially for landlords. I have a rewards MasterCard and although the points would be nice there is a 2.5% rate for monthly purchases and you only get a 15 day grace period.

name: Lori Bennett
review: This card does not seem to be worth it. I do not like the fact that you have to spend $500 or more to earn a credit of 10 cent  on the first 100 gallons. I don't like that the max. earn is .20 cents. That will take a long time to really earn rewards. I think that $35 dollars is a lot for a late fee. It does offer cash back rewards but it seems like you have to spend a lot to get this benefit. I would not recommend this card.

name: Lori Bennett
review: The Sears card sounds like a pretty decent card. It is nice that it allows you to have no interest for at least 12 months on sears payments. It would be nice if people could transfer funds from other cards though. The one problem I see it seems to only be no interest on certain products. Looks like you might only be limited to places you can use the card too.

name: Susan Spurling
review: This looks like a great store card. If you shop at Brooks Brothers a lot it would really benefit you. I like that it doesn't have an annual fee. The interest rates are comparable to most store credit cards. That you get rewards for using it where ever you shop is an added bonus. The cash advance fee is lower than most store cards. Free shipping on all returns is really nice. The reward card of $20.00 on your first purchase outside of Brooks Brothers is a great incentive as is earning 4 points for every dollar you spend at their store. Although the 1 point per dollar at other stores is nice there are many other cards you can earn more with when you shop. Overall it is a great card if you shop at Brooks Brothers.

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: This is a store credit card that people with poor credit will not qualify for. Radio Shacks are almost non existent in some cities so obviously, don't apply for one unless there's one in your area. You receive 10% off all purchases which adds up if you do a lot of big purchases at this store. There's 0% interest for 6-12 months with minimum purchase requirement. If you buy batteries, the do give you 15% off, but again, this is a store card, so the benefit of having this card stops once you leave a Radio Shack store. There is no reward point or cash back system. I would not apply for this card unless I purchased large amounts of electronics from this store to take advantage of the 10% off.

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: This is a card with rewards aimed for people who use Expedia regularly. Double the "ThankYou points" for Expedia purchases and a $50 credit after your first $50+ purchase on Expedia.com. The interest rate is not horrible. There is a $35 late fee like almost all other credit cards but if you pay your bills on time, you won't have to worry about that. You can also Redeem points for cash, just like Amex and Capital One cards

name: Kali Breest
review: While the 0% intro APR on Balance Transfers is great for someone switching over from a high rate card, the fact that this card has no rewards is a major drawback.  As someone who travels a lot and puts high dollar purchases on my credit card, rewards of some kind is a must for me.  The $0 liability on fraudulent purchases is also a must and a feature of this card.

name: Orgalys Marte
review: This is not a reward card

name: richard dattilio
review: Just love this city card with its 0 annual fee and great rewards.I was pleasantly surprised to receive a larger than average credit limit. One great thing is Citi banks professional customer service team when you call in.Their on line account management web site  is second to none too.I did receive a lower than average APR and along with my  rewards this card works for me.

name: Ashlee Headley
review: I am not a current AT&T Credit Card holder, but am familiar with credit card usage.  The earning of 1 ThankYou® Point for every $1 spend is appealing.  People like being rewarded for the money they spend.  It's even more rewarding when points can be turned in for items such as gift cards.  The downfall is the amount of money they require to be spent within the first three months of activation of $500 in order to receive 10,00 ThankYou® Points.  It almost encourages debt for those who should not be racking up the debt.  Overall, this is a very appealing credit card offer and would be a good credit card to go with!

name: Shawna bancroft
review: I have had Citibank for 5 years now and I have loved it. The Citibank branches where I live are being bought out which is really upsetting. The main thing that I love most about my Citibank account is that you can get a hold of them 24 hrs a day  7 days a week. Every time I have a had a problem with an unknown fee or a hold on my account it was taken care of immediately. I have called and chatted online with customer service representatives and every person I have talked to has been very knowledgeable. Overall I would recommend Citibank to any one that were to ask me!

name: Aaron Boczkiewicz
review: The Best Buy Store Card is pretty nice, especially if you are first starting out on your credit.  It is especially great for purchases because of the deferred interest financing they offer for 18 months on purchases $429 and up.  I actually was lucky enough to get 2 years no interest financing when I purchased my TV.  There is no annual fee and it has very low interest rates.  My only complaints are that if you max out or get up close to your available credit limit it kills your credit score, and if you don't pay off an item in full by the end of your financing deal they rack on all the interest from the beginning.  AKA, pay well over the minimum payment!  Overall a good card to have.

name: Barb Eagan
review: I was initially pleased with my Sears card when I opened it 10 years ago. It had a decent interest rate that I could live with. Within a couple of years the APR jumped up to what it is now and coupled with my own desire to have less lines of credit, I choose to close the card. I paid it off and closed it….or I thought I did. A year later I received a bill for the annual fee. Through much complaining and phone calls I eventually resolved the matter. All they were doing was hoping I would give in and just pay it. Now I seldom shop there at all.

name: James Johnson
review: I signed up for my Citi Simplicity Card to take advantage of 0% APR on balance transfers.  It was great I was able to payoff another credit card and then pay no interest on my Citicard.  Now I use my Citicard for new purchases.  There are a lot of great benefits such as no late fees, great rewards, and a competitive APR after the initial 0% APR for 18 months.  Its a good card with pretty good customer service.  I pay all my bills online and get paperless billing in my email.

name: Nancy Lee
review: The Shell Gas Card is a great card for people who travel a lot. The discounts on hotels and the cash back is good.

name: Nancy Lee
review: I like how the Citi Simplicity Card has no late fees or penalty rates or annual fees. The way I would like to use this card is to transfer my higher interest rate balances to help pay off my credit debt.

name: Matt Wells
review: This Shell Credit Card is significantly better than most store-tied credit cards I've seen. You can obtain points from a variety of purchases and redeem them for gas credit. Of course, in order to redeem the points, you need to go to Shell gas stations which tend to be more expensive than their competitors, so the money saved may not actually matter if you're paying extra at the pump initially. I'd carefully compare various gas station prices before choosing to open this account.

name: Tim Lawrence
review: The AT&T Credit Card has a decent teaser bonus, but doesn't really compare to some of the cards I have used.  It doesn't have a intro percentage offer, so the points bonus is less attractive.

name: Samantha Griffen
review: The L.L. Bean card is great compared to the Capital One Platinum card I have been using until recently! I love that if I use it to shop at L.L. Bean I can get 3% back, that adds up quickly! (Especially since the APR is lower!) The generous grace period, while I hope I never have to use it, is appreciated as well.

name: Mike Myers
review: This card the Staples Store Card sounds like a good deal if you have good credit. I have had other cards & the late fees were much higher with very little grace period.

name: John Political
review: The positive aspects of this card are the $25 prepaid visa card offered after spending $199 or a $50 prepaid visa card on $499 with the card.  With the cost of tires these days, that might be worthwhile.  Additionally the zero interest if paid within six months or one year (depending on how much you charge to the card) is attractive.  If you're in desperate need for tires but don't have the available cash, this card could be the difference between no vehicle and getting to work. For those prone to making late payments, pay attention to the $35 late fee.  The 29.95% interest rate is also important to note, because that is variable and could even be higher.

name: Evan
review: I got a 1 year CD with Citibank about 7 months ago. I have really only experienced one problem. Their online banking service could use some improvement. There have been multiple calls back and forth between us trying to get my account verified so I can check my accounts online. It took about a month and a half for them to verify my online credentials so my username and login would lead me to my personal account. Other than that it has been a pleasant experience overall.

name: Yah Nah
review: I wanted a way to save money that was essentially risk free and would give me a way to get my money out quick if push came to shove, this citibank CD did all that and more: it gave me a nice little return on my money.  Add to it the level of service and professional that citibank provides and I have to say that I am totally won over.  I would definitely consider getting another CD, possibly a more long term one in the future.  Totally worth looking into for someone try to save a little more.

name: Jessie Ellington
review: There are several things that I like about the Radio Shack credit card. First, it seems to have a lot of discounts for customers who shop frequently at Radio Shack, especially if you need a lot of batteries (15% off). If you are a regular at Radio Shack, this is the card for you. I also like that it has no yearly fee and no interest for the first 6 months. With that said, there aren't really many benefits if you are not a regular shopper there. Cons include no balance transfers and no cash back rewards at any other institution than Radio Shack. I have an American Express card that offers much more cash back in my day-to-day life (6% on groceries, 3% gas), although it does have an annual fee attached to it.

name: Tony Schmitt
review: This is a great card for people with good credit. The initial reward of points and the $50 credit is very appealing. They also offer several useful features such as no pre-set limit and travel assistance. The interest rate could be a little lower, but is not atypical for cards of this type. If you use your card for travel-related expenses, especially through expedia, this card is an excellent choice and I would highly recommend it.

name: Kaylee Ganser
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card is a good option for those who shop at Brooks Brothers often.  There are numerous bonuses and other incentives when shopping there.  If you are planning to use this as a general purpose card, there are plenty of other cards that offer similar or better deals for shopping at other places (1%-5% back instead of the flat 1% back).  However, even if you just make one purchase at Brooks Brothers, this card can offer you enough bonuses to be highly competitive.  Overall, this card is a good card, particularly for those who shop at Brooks Brothers.

name: Aaron Vetovitz
review: I like how this card will allow cash transfers and there are no late fees. Sometimes we can run into monetary issues and Citi will work with you to make your life easier.

name: Bryant
review: This card is actually pretty good. I had a citi card that was similar to this. It gave decent rates, but I enjoy the fact that you earn 10% extra when staying at select hotels. My Citi Student card offered similar services, but not that good of an offer. The only problem I have is the $25 annual fee. But that is minor if you use the card right.

name: Patsy Holleman
review: I use to have a Best Buy Credit Card and enjoyed it so much. It offers so much and you can buy with confidence.  They have household items for your whole house knowing you are getting number one products you can trust and rely on .

name: oneida
review: Citibank seems to be good so far. Fast service. Opening an account was simple. I also had the option of getting a Student checking & savings account. I just had a problem with being over drafted when I thought overdraft protection was offered with my account. I was able to get the $35 fee removed being that it was my first time and it was a honest mistake. Debit/credit transaction do post to the account pretty quickly, so I know next time around I can avoid another over draft fee. Overall satisfied with the quality of customer service and transactions. The online banking is the a good feature as well.

name: Katie Amoureux
review: This is a limited-use credit card.  The Goodyear Store card is pointed toward customers who need automotive tires and parts the Goodyear store sells, but need to pay the price over time.  As is common with this kind of card, there is a "gotcha," which is if you make a late payment or don't pay off the total in time, you will have to pay interest on the full amount.  If you pay as required though, you can buy what you need now and pay no interest.  Watch out though!

name: jay see
review: Brooks Brothers Credit Card is a pretty good card. There is a large amount of bonus rewards you can get which makes it more appealing if you can benefit from them by being a regular Brooks Brothers customer. That is the main selling point and if you cant take advantage of that, then it might not be worth getting because there was better general reward cards out there.

name: Renee Niemann
review: The 10,000 Thank You points and $50 statement credit make the Expedia Credit Card worth it in the beginning, but other than that, the rewards offered are dismal at best when compared to other reward cards like Amex Blue or even the Capital One Venture card. Not too pleased about the rewards limit on this card either. For those that book their business travel with a rewards card, this most certainly would not be ideal.

name: Logan
review: Truthfully it is the only credit card I own, but I have definitely enjoyed many of the bonuses available on this card. As someone with tons of family in the airline industry, the flight miles are necessary to keep up with them and travel effectively. The mile per dollar does a great job of allowing that. The APR is a bit steep if you don't have much credit (Like me), however if you pay off your balance regularly it doesn't hurt too much. No fees for a year, but be prepared to pay $50+ after the first year if you're not a huge spender. Overall, good card though.

name: Cary Chitwood
review: If you shop a lot at Radio Shack this is the card for you. Please remember to get the maximum rewards out of this card it is best to pay off the balance before the interest fee kicks in. The twelve month no interest with a minimum of a $300 purchase is a great deal for the large purchases.

name: Logan
review: As someone who uses the card mostly for business purchases, it seems to give a very good amount of rewards if you use it enough. For personal use it may not rack up the rewards necessary to make up for the interest rate, but if you are diligent about paying it off and have lots of office expenses for your business/organization to use it on, it can be one of the most rewarding cards you can own.

name: Nancy Lee
review: This Sears Credit MasterCard is an easy card to apply for and get accepted for. We got ours when we were buying a treadmill and did not have the cash on hand. We thought it was a good decision. Unfortunately the interest rates on it are very high and we never were able to pay more than minimum payment for several months. I'm sad to say that we had the debt long after we still had the treadmill. This is a great credit card if you just use it as convenience and are able to pay it off quickly without accruing interest. Please take time and really read the fine print of the agreement before you get the card.

name: Emily Pfefer
review: This Home Depot credit card provides no rewards and as near as I can tell is only good for purchases at Home Depot. I prefer Lowe's personally, so I wouldn't get much from this card. Furthermore, I always pay my credit card off monthly, so the fact that this card's only "boon" is the 0% interest rate for 6-12 months would not help me any. I never pay credit card interest because, as I say, I pay off my card every month. What does help me is the 1.5 percent back I receive from my Visa Travel Rewards Card for money I would have spent anyway.

name: Emily Pfefer
review: This Shell Credit card would be of no use to me. I have no car so therefore only providing "rewards" in the form of fuel discounts would not save me any money. What does save me money is my Visa Travel Rewards Card, which provides me up to about 1.5 percent back by reducing my monthly bill.

name: Emily Pfefer
review: I am genuinely impressed by this Best Buy credit card. It doesn't have a foreign transaction fee. I have the same benefit from a Visa Travel Reward credit card.  However, the max rewards I can reap from that card is about 1.5 percent and that is only if I have made sufficient travel purchases first. Conversely, this card boast a minimum 2 percent reward rate (and that's if you never shop at Best Buy even) as well as free shipping when you do shop through the Best Buy website. Great deal!

name: Emily Pfefer
review: I would never choose this credit card because it offers no rewards and carries a 3% foreign transaction fee. Conversely, I am much happier with my Visa Travel Rewards Card, which carries no foreign transaction fee and through it's rewards program, allows me to reap 1.5% of my spending back each month!

name: Automm Lombardo
review: I like the 0% intro rate, but you have to already have good credit to have the card. Also the late fees are quite high.

name: Yah Nah
review: This is my third credit card and I have to say I am pleased with how easy they make it to stay on top of your payments without incurring late fees or ridiculous amounts of interest.  The statements are very easy to read, which was an issue for me with my previous two credit cards.  Also, I called in to customer service when I noticed an unauthorized charge and they fixed it immediately with no hassle.  I would definitely say this is one of the better credit cards out there right now.

name: Penny Trepp
review: The fact that there is no late fees, annual fees or a penalty fee, on top of the fact that is it a 0% intro APR on balance transfers and new purchases for 18 months, makes the CITI SIMPLICITY extremely appealing. I have also dealt with CITI for many years and they have always been a good company as far as I am concerned.  The only downside to this card is the fact that there are no reward incentives, but I think the pros outweigh the cons.

name: Theo Kaisa
review: The Shell gas  card is really not that appealing to me because I had the exxon gas card before which had nearly identical usage terms and did not satisfy me. The only difference is it did not give me rewards for staying in hotels and flying. I am not a frequent traveler yet but I think there are better ways to go about cutting down on traveling costs rather than getting a gas card like this one that doesn't give you much of a reward for using gas. I would not really recommend this card to anyone unless they are a very frequent traveler.

name: Lynn Rostie
review: I first got the Best Buy Store Credit Card to buy a computer, monitor, and printer and take advantage of their credit terms 12 months same as cash with payments. I purchased other items while I had the compute still on the card with 90 days and 6 months same as cash terms. I was careful to give the credit card company 15 days to receive and process my payment that paid off an item. They originally gave me a $2000 line of credit then raised it to $4000. I had heard horror stories about companies charging all the deferred interest because the last payment was late. I never had any problems with the card.

name: Eirelav Nosaer
review: Getting this card was one of the best choices I could have made. It helps me keep track of my purchases and I got a $5 certificate right off the bat. I can use it other places if I need to and the 25 day grace period is extremely helpful. I bought my computer on it and got an instant discount and interest free financing. Payment options are really flexible and the online management is excellent.

name: Larry Terrell
review: I love my Best Buy credit card. I tend to carry a balance from month to month and the 18 month financing is perfect for me. I can make payments at the store, with cash ONLY, which is easier for me personally. The  customer service is lacking just a bit, in store and the call center, but you can get your problem resolved quickly 95% of the time. The low monthly payment is easy to manage. I highly recommend this card.

name: Judy-Gene Duran
review: This shell card is way better than my previous gas card at a company I would not like to say on this forum.  I believe that the benefits of this card outweigh my current cart.  I will apply for this card in the near future.  I would recommend this card for anyone who constantly travels as the rewards for hotels and planes are great.

name: Wi Ci
review: This is Great!I love this card.  The shell gas card is a really good one with so many benefits. Compared to other cards$1000 dollars emergency cash.  The Shell Gas Card is a fantastic choice for travelers.Overall I think the Shell Gas Card is an excellent card for my needs.  Their cashback/reward options seem great, although not as good as I have seen.   like the fact that the Shell Gas Card does not put a cap on the amount that you are able to earn from your rewards.

name: Erin Tummons
review: The fact that the citi simplicity card has an intro rate of 0% APR makes me really love this card. There are many fewer fees than other similar cards and that is a huge plus. The only downside to this card is the lack of rewards.

name: Robert Canterson
review: I had heard some negative stuff about Citibank before. I chose them due to their proximity to my office as well as my home. About 3 months following the opening of my checking account, I fell victim to fraud. I believe it was attributed to the Target hack. Citibank responded swiftly and in a way that gave me supreme confidence in their customer support. Very pleased with their service and response time.  I had previously experienced this sort of incident with other banks (specifically Wells Fargo) and I had been left without a debit card for two weeks! This was not acceptable. CitiBank provided me instantly with a temporary debit card and I received my new permanent card in 3 days!

name: fantasia
review: I love citibank! They provide excellent customer service. I had an issue where I was no longer employed and went out of state to go to a new college and where I go to school has no citibanks so I never used the card. It turns out because I wasn't having direct deposits anymore fees would be applied. I wasn't aware of this so I called them and they reversed the fees for all the months I were charged and I went to a branch when I went back to my home state and had it converted to a student account.

name: Tom Verlane
review: In addition to my US bank account, I have an account with Citibank. I mainly opened this account so that when I'm abroad (I travel quite frequently for extended periods of time), I have a bank with a global presence as compared to my more national level primary bank. I haven't really had too many problems. Although their rates are pretty high on the credit card, I generally pay it off immediately so it's not really an issue. Other than that their customer service is pretty decent although I have to call more than I would like to for various annoyances.

name: Cole Mccoy
review: I like that there is a 25 day grace period and that there is a maximum late fee.  This to me shows that Radioshack is not out to get my money, but to help sell their product and satisfy loyal customers.  The only negative that I could think of is the interest rate.  On my discover card the interest is not nearly that high.  I think that they are a little unrealistic, but then again there is a 6 or 12 month same as cash option.

name: Summer Yandle
review: My Sears card is probably one of the best credit cards I've had. I use it primarily for Black Friday shopping. But I have occasionally indulged on some of the great sales I run across. The 2% cash back isn't something I have had the chance to take big advantage of but I will soon! I really love this card and I love the fact that I can go online and manage my account entirely. Saves me a lot of time as a business woman and a mother.

name: Josh Turner
review: I've had a CitiBank Savings account for about 2 years now. It is my primary account for my savings. It is easy to use and very simple. Interest could be better, but it is better than several others that I've researched about. I've had to ask a few questions and every answer was was professional and quick. Wouldn't choose anyone else.

name: Jacquelyn Scarborough
review: I love this card.  There have been plenty of times that I have found myself in a jam and it came to the rescue.  Compared to other cards, the offer of the hotel savings along with the cash back is just wonderful. I am happy with the grace period as well as I am guilty of forgetting to pay my bills on time.  This is Great!

name: Amanda Cole
review: The Citi Simplicity card feels like it was made just for me! Being only 22 and having a family of my own, times can be tough! With this card, and the lack of fees, it makes my life just that much simpler. It doesn't offer rewards, but so what! It surely makes up for it!

name: Dan Marchese
review: The City Diamond Preferred Card has a fantastic introductory interest rate. I use the Capital One Quicksilver cash rewards card regularly, and I have to say that 18 months at 0% interest sounds very appealing right now since the Quicksilver card only offers one year. Couple that with no annual fee and a 3% balance transfer fee, and this is the ideal card for someone looking to pay down their credit card debt. The fact that cardholders are not liable for unauthorized transactions is very comforting as well. Even though this card doesn't offer cash rewards like the Capital One Quicksilver card, I still think this card is highly preferred for daily purchases because of the friendly interest rates and reasonable fees.

name: Ken Bolcar
review: Great card.   The initial 6 month offer proved to be very attractive and we used immediately.  Upon paying our bill on time we were granted a credit limit increase that will be helpful for our next project. I like how the card is linked to the Home Depot web site.   After signing in you can go directly to the credit center to make a payment, download statements, see recent transactions etc.  I will continue to use this card for all my home improvement, building supplies, gardening needs and then some.

name: Matt Sinay
review: The Good Year Store card, well this isn't too much too say about this card really, No benefits at all which is already a pass for me on this card. There is no annual charge for this card so that's one good thing overall. If I were to weigh this card on a weight scale with another credit card with no annual fees but it at least had one benefit to it I would go with the other card. The way that I see it is that the whole point of having a credit card is the incentives! if there are none of those why have one? Might as well just use cash and save yourself from possibly getting in debt or having these high interest rates! Look somewhere else with more bang for your buck!

name: Dakota Doerr
review: i got this credit card to buy a power supply and an ipad along with those purchases i was given 6 months interest free financing by using this card which is great because now i dont have to pay it all at once and i dont get charged interest its fantastic!~

name: Andy Garcia
review: I think this card is too limiting and the terms and conditions are kind of cumbersome. I wouldn't have any interest in this card when there are many other cards with more comprehensive options.

name: Tomas Lekis
review: I'm a huge fan of the fact that I can use this at various shops like NTB. Between four cars, I'm purchasing tires multiple times throughout the year and this is a big plus!

name: Josephine Chu
review: Customer service for Citibank has generally been excellent, and all other services have also been great. My biggest complaint is that they don’t always live up to their advertised zero international transaction fees- be careful and read all the fine print before traveling abroad or making international transfers. Additionally, internal Citibank international transfer exchange rates are well below market exchange rates, which can significantly add on to international banking costs.

name: Mark Watson Jr.
review: It looks like Staples has a pretty good card available as long as you have good credit. Their late fee is only $35 and they have a grace period that is pretty nice. I had a premier bank card a while back and it was a nightmare. Late fees were high and there was no grace period. Not to mention that I had to pay an annual fee that the Staples Card does not have. Get it if you have decent credit.

name: Stephanie L. Weippert
review: When you need that last minute thing to finish up that job so you can send it to the client for payment, Staples is there for you. When you're already stressed over the deadline, when having their store card, there isn't more stress about if you have the money to buy what you need to turn the project in and get the money you earned. With no-annual fee or over the limit fee, all that makes this a card to have.

name: Ikechukwu Monye
review: this card is best and preferable for people who frequent staples. anyone else is best doing without this card. but then again the rewards are great and this can be tempting. but best be advised you have to pay up monthly unless you pay a high interest rate.

name: Cassie Miller
review: A few years back I realized that I wasn’t doing a very good job at saving money. So I wanted to get a CD where I knew that if I saved the money on the CD I would make a good investment. I shopped around for a while and saved money to put into the CD. I ran across Citi-bank because I have a credit card with them I decided to check into their savings account plans. I found that they had a really good interest rate and that there were no monthly or yearly fees, with that I was sold and opened my first CD. I now feel confident I can save money for the future with Citi-bank.

name: Andrew Shannon
review: the only reason that i am giving this card three stars is because of the 10,000 points and the $50 statement credit.  Aside from that, this card has an extremely average and almost high interest rate.  There is a 3% balance transfer fee.  You only earn double points when shopping at expedia and really, how often does one go on vacation?

name: Robert Michaudd
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card is really, really nice. It lets you earn 3% rewards on all purchases. 3%! Most cards offer only 1 percent, maybe 2 percent! The APR% is really, really good on it too in my opinion. And the maximum APR the card has is 27.24%, which is pretty good compared to a lot of cards that have over 30% maximum late APR% rates.

name: Chris Neal
review: I got the best buy card to make a few purchases a few years back and the point system does add up. After paying the principle,and the APR I got,really good deals on minor and major electronics.

name: John Jones
review: I feel as though the Radio Shack Store Card is a great feature that can definitely assist loyal customers in saving money.  I would be more enticed to shop at the store more often based on the rewards involved.  Additionally, I have gotten my last 3 cell-phones from radio shack and each time it was cheaper than getting the phone through Sprint directly.

name: Rajeeb M
review: The bank has an excellent customer service but I frequently have some problems with the credit cards. The interest they claim for delayed payments makes someone go mad. The online payment also faces some delays on the last day of the month. Besides these I love my bank and is my perfect partner.

name: Savin Jameson
review: I think this is a great card for those who are regular Brooks Brothers shoppers like myself.  Overall, the awards may seem minimal, but they really do help reduce the price of great quality suits and men's accessories at such a great store.  Because the store offers deep discounts during sale periods, plus the benefit of cardholder shopping events, I can see the value really stacking up.  The $20 birthday discount is another great feature that not many other stores would offer on a credit card that isn't solely a store card.  As a regular loyal Brooks Brothers customer, I'll take any opportunity to save some money on their products.Another great aspect is that there is no limit to the amount of benefits on the Brooks Brothers credit card  that you can redeem like other store cards have.  This has the advantage of allowing me to use this card as my primary card and save money on purchases that I'd already be making.The only potential negative that I'd associate with this card is the interest rate.  While not exorbitantly high, it still is slightly higher than other comparable cards.  While I pay down my balance each month, I would be hesitant to use this as my emergency card with such a high rate for large purchases that I may not be able to pay off immediately.Overall, great card!

name: Nichole Olson
review: I have always been a huge fan of Citibank. They have great customer service and I like their online banking system. However, I've been very disappointed by their savings account options. I got this CD before doing a lot of research on competitors.  After, I realized that the interest rate was much lower than I could have found elsewhere.

name: Andrew Flory
review: The AT&T credit card is one of the better cards I've used. I love their point system, because each point is basically equivalent to a cent back. This might not seem like a lot, but it really does build up. I've never come close to reaching the 50,000 point annual limit, but I can understand that some people might get frustrated by this. Overall it is really great, I haven't run into any problems with late fees, but a few of my friends who have the card say the late fees are a little over the top, which is why I am giving 4 stars. Overall I would definitely recommend though!

name: Anthony Van Duzer
review: The initial 0% interest rate on the Citi Simplicity card is really nice.  That along with no penalties or late/annual fees make this a really nice card to get if you can.  Just remember to watch for after 18 months because your APR will be going up.

name: Stephen Mcmadu
review: The shell gas card is a really good one with so many benefits. $1000 dollars emergency cash??? that's a really good offer. the grace period is long too. it's unlike what i am using now at walmart. if i have the opportunity i will go for this card.

name: Corey Baumgartner
review: The City Diamond Preferred Card has an excellent intro rate on purchases!  And the City Easy Deals program looks pretty sweet.  Also the City Identity Theft Solutions would give me peace of mind about carrying and using this card for my purchases.  The late fee and balance transfer fees are kind of high, but I can live with that to qualify for this card.

name: Mike Noel
review: This card is great if you need a high dollar item from Radioshack. The finance options are great and the discount on batteries voids the need to go to a Sam's Club or BJ's to purchase bulk packs of standard batteries (AA, AAA, C, D, 9V). Avoid the interest by taking advantage of the financing options.

name: Michele Carter
review: Yes the fee is high but I really like this card because they give us two free economy companion tickets per year (one for me + one for my husband), plus $200 in statement credits for airline charges.  No foreign transaction fees and chip technology.  Also, they added access to American Admirals club when flying on American. This card more than pays for itself if you travel with a spouse multiple times per year.

name: John Hoe
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred Card is a good card for a person just starting out.  It has no rewards so that kinda sucks but it does feature 0% interest for the first 18 months which is great for beginners.

name: Pi Reference
review: This card is great if you get the offer of no interest for the first year, and pay the balance in full after that.  They have the same deal for cash advance and they send you checks that you can write, but that has a flat 3% fee.  Not bad if you are going to buy something big and effectively get 3% interest for a year.  No annual fee for this one, 'thank you PREFERRED card" is great.  Be careful, their other 'thank you premier card' has a whopping $125 annual fee after the first year!  The website is very good, and the thank you points are easy to spend at Amazon or elsewhere.  Great card!

name: Sara VanIttersum
review: My husband and I just transferred our credit card debt to Citi Simplicity. We had been getting offers what seemed like everyday, and finally looked at one. We set up a payment plan to have it all paid off before we would have to pay any interest. Even with the balance transfer fee, the deal is saving us over $1500 from the card we had. I  think it is a great deal and has enabled us to take some major steps to cut down our debt and take control of our financial situation.

name: David Blank
review: This card is so convenient to use.  The customer service is top quality and that experience alone differentiates the Home Depot card from other store cards.  Not only are the values at the store great, but the convenience of using the Home Depot card makes the experience even better.  I highly recommend this card.

name: Michael Miller
review: This is just the kind of card I was searching for. The Citi Simplicity Card has a great 18 month interest free period compared to the usual 12 months or end of the calendar year offered by most cards. It's very helpful in managing my other credit card debt with the extended no interest or transfers period. No annual fee and only a 3% foreign transaction fee give me a lot of freedom in how I use and maintain it. Unfortunately it does not offer any rewards although I believe the terms more than make up for that down fall.

name: Julie Springate
review: As someone who travels regularly, I really appreciate the 5% cash back on airfare, 10% cash back on many hotels and no foreign transaction fee. The only down side is that there is no reward for buying gas. Since it is a gas card, I would think that there would be some sort of incentive to buy gas, but there isn't. The annual fee of $25 isn't too high, but I do typically prefer a card with no annual fee. However, the $35 maximum late fee is very nice.

name: John Hoe
review: I used the Best Buy store card to buy all my major electronic purchases.  Over the years I've bought multiple TV's, computers, and music players with my Best Buy card and it's never let me down.  I often rack up reward points because all my purchases are rather expensive so it's great if you spend a lot.  If you're a big Best Buy person, I'd highly recommend getting this card.

name: Jodi Wentz
review: I don't spend enough on gas to justify having the Shell credit card.  I would feel like I would have to always go to a shell station to earn the extra cash back, and this is not convenient for me.  I prefer my Chase Credit Card.  No annual fee and every quarter there is a special 5% rate for certain purchases.

name: Nathaniel Washup
review: The Shell Credit Card offer receives a 5 out of 10 scoring with me. On the surface the Shell Credit Card seems ideal for those persons who drive a lot and are looking to save a few pennies at the pump, however as I study the qualifications to receive any substantial savings at the pump, a consumer must first spend at least $500 dollars in a spending cycle; ergo a monthly billing cycle. I am not saying that it's a difficult task to spend $500 dollars a month but if you micro-analyzed the offer you would find that you are spending $500 and being charged their finance charge to reach the goal of saving a small amount at the pump. By the time you'll have spent the qualifying amount, you will have practically paid full price for the gasoline anyway. Again, if your profession is one that demands you do plenty of driving then this card would be perfect for you but for the average consumer such as myself, I would choose to use my Capital One card that gives me direct cash back every time I use it; plus unlike the Shell Credit Card, a new Capital One Credit Card comes with special introductory rate for up to a year, the Shell Credit Card does not offer an introductory rate.I like the fact that the Shell company wants to help everyday consumers save cash on purchases that they are probably going to make anyway but the biggest drawback to this offer is that it flat out tells potential applicants that if you do not have close to perfect credit; then you need not apply.

name: Robert Matye
review: I have had the Citi Diamond Preferred Card for about a year, and at best I can say that the card is okay.  I think that the customer service is good, but I expect that from a credit card. I also have a Chase Freedom card, and I am able to speak with a service representative at any time.  The single best benefit to this card is the very generous 18 month 0% interest rate. I had to pay for several months of health insurance premiums while I was between jobs and was able to take advantage of these 18 months, which was perfect for me. However, there is a big lack of rewards, even though I am given points. I still have not figured out what these points can go toward.  Compared to other credit cards, like Chase Freedom, cash back and rewards are easy to obtain and are pretty generous with say 5% cash back in quarterly categories.  Now that I am not as stuck financially as I was previously, I do not think I will use this card because the rewards offered by other cards are much better. If you are in a jam and need a 0% interest rate card for a very generous 18 months, go for it, otherwise, if you are able to pay off your card on a timely (see monthly) basis and avoid interest charges to begin with, find a card with better rewards.

name: Jared Boswell
review: The benefits of this are dangerous, especially for people who do not control spending well. The fees and cash advance rates are astronomically high, and the only true benefit to this would be to get the $160 visa prepaid card when you purchase 4 select tires. Overall this feels like a scam or a Capital One type credit card. I feel one would do better to just save up for tires than to rely on these kind of fees to finance a set of tires.

name: Ray Fath
review: I recently got the Citi Diamond preferred card and it my new favorite credit card for my business transactions. Although the card doesn't earn any rewards or bonuses the introductory rate of 0% for the first 18 months is just to good to pass up. All purchases and transfers made in the first 18 months will have a 0% APR, This is particularly useful for someone such as my self that has a business in which they purchase materials for projects often. The absorbent rates i was being charged on these purchases was really eating into my profits, this card eliminates these fees which means more profit for my business i couldn't recommend it more.

name: Nick Palatas
review: Curse those porous sponge cards and their high rates!

name: Carlton Powers
review: The rewards percentages are nice, but its not simple cash back.  I bought a mac laptop with this card, and it took some time indeed to get my rewards.  Finally, I had to print a "rewards certificate" and bring it in for a limited date.  Stick with simple cash back cards.  They're easier to manage, and some of them will actually get you 5% off at best buy.

name: Michael Reed Markham
review: My girlfriend and i are members of a local organization. We do a lot of printing and use a lot of ink. We love coming here  and using our Office Depot store card .  Nice grace period and rates.

name: Matt Kulp
review: When I signed up for the Home depot card, I was awarded a 10% off discount on my current purchase. I was making a large purchase at the time, and knew I wasn't going to be able to pay it off for a while. The 6 months no interest was a huge relief because it made it very easy to acquire the funds I needed. I love the home depot card and use it every time I shop there.

name: Riley Brewer
review: I really enjoy dealing with the staples card. Service is always friendly but also the discounts i get as a card member are great! As the son of a store owner i am often shopping at Staples for products and this card makes it quick and easy.

name: Alexandria Kinsey
review: I began banking with citibank a few years ago when I worked for a company that drew its payroll checks from a citibank account. It was easier to cash my checks if I had an account open with this bank. Overall I have been satisfied with this decision though the lack of branch locations makes it less than convenient at times. Fortunately my local branch has great customer service, everyone is super friendly and are willing to help whenever I have had concerns about my account. My one gripe is that they are completely inflexible when it comes to overdraft fees but that's true of most banks. I will continue with citibank but if I move out of my area I will probably have to change banks as aside from my local branch it's hard to find citibanks.

name: Alicia Schindler
review: Ι love this card for large purchases.  I bought two computers with it now and have been able to gradually pay them off with equal payments in 18 months, so I paid no interest!  Although my limit is relatively low compared to my other cards, it hasn't affected any purchase so far.  The rewards are great and I like that you do not have to use the credit card to get them. You get points for each dollar in purchases and receive vouchers to use in the store.

name: Dave Anderson
review: I cannot recommend this card highly enough for anyone who shops at best buy.
