The customer service is not the greatest, but the rewards are usually higher than other stores, with some products having incentive points that must be redeemed at best buy.  The 0% financing for most of their products is also a great deal for the big ticket items that one may buy at the store. I purchased a TV for $1500 and had 2 years to pay it off with 0% interest. The online account access is simple and easy to use as well.

name: Benjamin F Sullivan
review: I opened a Citibank account a while back and for the most part, I was happy with the products and services offered.  The cash back and frequent flyer miles on the debit card were neat too.  However, I had the one and only case of identity theft I've experienced so far (knock on wood) while banking with this company and when it came to resolving a fraudulent check that had passed through my account, I found them to be sadly lacking.  First of all, every person I talked to during the process sounded like they were outsourced employees in India.  Secondly, despite the fact that the check had clearly a bogus signature and had been cashed nearly 1,500 miles from where I was living.  I had to pay nearly $400 in overdraft and fees and getting reimbursed took almost half a year.  I closed out my account after paying off the negative balance and I am certain that I was not reimbursed the overdraft charges that were imposed on my account.

name: Scott Struzik
review: The Citi Diamond preferred card seems like a decent card to sign up for.  I have had some ridiculous deals from other companies in the past so this one is definitely one of the better options.  The Intro rate of 0 percent for 18 months is excellent, most companies i've dealt with only offer the 12 months.  So having an extra 6 months at 0 percent is great.  The grace period of 23 days is also a nice feature, my past cards have had slim to no grace periods.  The only thing I see an issue with might be the 3 percent balance transfer, I've had lower with most of my cards.

name: Justin Endsley
review: The Shell Credit Card is a great card for someone who purchases a lot of fuel. It offers great rewards in this area, and compared to my Discover rewards card the interest rate is not too bad. I like the discounts associated with both cards, but for the frequent traveler the gas rewards are good. However, you must use Shell affiliated gas stations in order to take advantage of their fuel rewards program. The cash advance rate is somewhat high, but that is expected from most credit cards. I have one of these cards, and would recommend it to others as well.

name: Jaye Gee
review: I wanted to make some home improvements so I applied for a Home Depot. card and was immediately approved! This card has 0% APR for the first 12 months, so it made it easier for me to do some extra home projects that I wouldn't have been able to do if I had to pay in cash. A year was enough for me to get my balance paid off and complete my projects. On the downside, there are no reward programs, but then again, I don't use this card often at all, but it was definitely worth it in the beginning for my do it yourself projects.

name: Devon Seager
review: Honestly, i've had many credit cards and this one is one of my very bottom favorites. This card offers NO rewards and compared to the Old Navy or Best Buy card i am unsatisfied. I wish i had more to say, but I just don't think this card is worth it. You could easily get a better card for another store and actually get some rewards you'll love. I should also add that I never shop at Home Depot, so the Home Depot Card would not benefit me much outside of being a normal card. i can see why some people would like this card though, but i feel it should offer some rewards.

name: Devon Seager
review: Awhile back i considered getting a Best Buy Credit card. One day i decided to do it. I was apprehensive at first because i didn't know why i needed one. After reading the Credit Card rewards, i was sold.. First of all the points you earn are extremely worth it.Every 250 points you get a free 5 dollars! How cool does that sound. I know it grabbed my attention. I really look forward to the discounts, i'm a sucker for discounts. The best thing in my opinion about this is the free shipping. I always order from home and i'm really excited to get the free shipping that comes with this card.The awesome grace period puts my mind at ease every month. The late fee is very minimal as well. Overall i am very happy i decided to get this card.

name: Shelley Barhart
review: This Sears credit card seems like a good deal overall.  The only drawback is you have to have excellent to good credit, and who really has that today?  They suck you in with special financing only in certain departments.  I don't like the high cash advance rate.  The 0% gives you incentive to pay your bill on time.  I highly doubt that if you had a high credit limit and maxed it out you would be able to pay it in full in 12 months, though!  Late fees are high if you don't pay your bill on time and they have a tier for accounts that are over the limit.  It pays to read the fine print.

name: Andrew Flory
review: I originally only signed onto this card to receive the 10% off coupon because I was going to be making a large purchase and figured the coupon would be useful. The coupon came instantly, just as promised, and saved me a lot of money on a new TV. I didn't really use the card for awhile, and really only used my other cards at meijer, and every now and then used it when they had promotions for using the meijer card. Recently I have been using it a lot more because of the large grace period and relatively low rates, and have noticed they are far superior to other store cards. A pretty good card, but no great.

name: Dawn Maupin
review: the Shell Credit Card is a nice card to have. It offers rewards like cash back on all types of purchases and fuel discounts. There is no annual fee, which is a plus. I would recommend it to just about anyone.

name: Rob Allan
review: I love the vouchers we collect with this card, we are big fans of the brand so the vouchers are always welcome.  It's great to go to the store and find you have $20 or $30 to use.

name: David Price
review: The Citi Forward card is a good first credit card for students because it is easy to get. This is especially important for college students who are focused on building credit. I recommend this card because I myself got this card a year ago as a junior in college. The ThankYou points are OK, but it isn't the best rewards program out there. Students should be responsible with credit (eg. always pay off in full) and should carry at least 2 credit cards to help build credit.

name: Kyle Bergholtz
review: I gave this card 5 stars because of the no annual fee and the zero APR for 6 months. Due to this i have been extremely pleased with this card and would recommend it to anyone in the future.

name: Takkea
review: Citibank is a really great bank. One thing that stands out is the availability of branches in convenient locations. I have been a customer for over 10 years and with the changes that they have made with their checking account, they always keep the customers up to date by sending information about it. I was a victim of credit card fraud and all of my money was withdrawn from my account. They were very helpful with it and treated me with a lot of empathy. They carried out investigations and sent out a new card for me right away. The issue was resolved in a matter of weeks and my account is in good health again.

name: Tania Goncalves
review: Although there are some pros, such as No annual fee, and no over limit fee, The Cons weigh heavily on a financially responsible adult. The Cash Advance APR rate is extremely high, at 29.95% and balance transfers are not accepted. My amazon credit card has several special financing offers where the APR is low. The Goodyear Store Card seems to be beneficial only if you are going to use it to buy Goodyear Tires, which then results in a $160 prepaid Visa Card.

name: Bryant
review: Overall, this card seems like more of a hassle than anything. The pros are good, with no annual fee, no over limit fee, and no max penalty APR. But other than that, the cons are bad. 29.95% APR on cash advance is ridiculous. Other cards I've owned had a max at 15%. Also the fact that they charge you at least $10 but up to 5% for taking out cash is outrageous. This card is only beneficial if you use it at Goodyear and pay the balance off. I'd suggest any other card unless you were at a Goodyear location and needed something to help finance a vehicle repair.

name: Cherise Bailey
review: For the citi simplicity card I like that there are no late fees or penalty fees or over limit fees. That makes it easier to use and less to worry about.

name: Allie Bentley
review: The Shell Gas Card is a fantastic choice for travelers.  It features a good percentage of cash back on some well-known and very easy-to-find hotels, as well as cash back on traveling needs like airlines and car rentals, PLUS discounts on many other hotels.  There are almost no drawbacks to this card, especially since, if you travel, you'll get enough cash back to easily cover the annual fee and more.

name: Allie Bentley
review: The 0% intro rate of this card is a huge plus if you're just starting out.  A lot of the features, like the regular rate and the grace period, are normal, but the late fee is a bit high, so this card would be best for someone with careful money handling.

name: Ryan Breland
review: I'm a college student and this is the only checking account I need. It is very useful and I have never had a single problem. I love the convenience and I can check my balance online any time using their app. There is the fact that you have to deal with ATM surcharges on occasion but that's really going to be a problem no matter where you store your money.

name: Ramy Eskander
review: I have been using Citibank Basic Checking for six months. The main reason to enroll was the capability to transfer money internationally, which means if a person has a Citibank account in another country, then he/she is able to transfer money between the US account and the other account outside the US. Citibank Basic Checking has a very good web interface that is organized and easy to use. Also the customer service is very responsive and professional. It is available any time during the day. The main disadvantage is the high ten-dollar monthly fees. Overall, I like Citibank Basic Checking and recommend it as long as a person is able to afford its monthly fees.

name: Kate Avansino
review: I have been with Citibank since 2008 and have had a decent experience with them.  I used to have a student checking account when i was in college with them but then it changed to a general checking account a few years back.  They started to charge me $10 a month to keep my checking account which I feel is excessive.  I have been considering changing banks.  Everything else is pretty decent about Citibank, they have good customer service and nice banks and lots of ATMS.  I just feel that I am being over charged for my checking account.  Thanks!Kate

name: Amy Eldridge
review: The Sears credit card seems like a good deal for regular Sears shoppers. I like that you don't pay ANY interest as long as you pay your bill within 12 months - that gives the card holder even more incentive to get the bill paid. But really it's only good if you buy certain things, and if you're a Sears shopper. Otherwise, there really isn't much use for it, as it doesn't offer any rewards, and to use it anywhere else and on anything besides what was specified above, would mean paying interest.

name: Katherine Hirose
review: The Best Buy card is a good option for people who plan on making a big electronics purchase there (or who tend to buy less expensive things more often).  It has a pretty decent intro rate APR for purchases so it's OK if you need a little extra time paying off that new computer.  I do wish they had an initial bonus for signing up for the card (like some other places) but overall it is a pretty good deal.  You also get first access to some good deals and discounts with the card.  Overall, I think this is a good choice for people who like electronics!

name: Gennadius Scholarios
review: As a college student, I signed up for Citibank's Student Checking Account. The ATM information listed here does not seem accurate to me, as I always struggled with finding Citibank ATMs and on more than one occasion had to pay hefty surcharges. Also, I'd like to point out that after 4 years, the student account automatically becomes a standard account with the monthly fees. After graduating, I went abroad for graduate school, and found that upon checking my account details, the monthly fees kicked in and started eating up what I had in the checking account.

name: Kelsey Fox
review: I have a variety of accounts with Citibank, and I have mixed reviews for a few reasons. It is easy to access every account and transfer between as they are all localized on the website and app. My student account is my favorite because there is no required minimum balance and no monthly fee. However, customer service is unhelpful in solving my problems with the account. It's hard to use my debit card when the zip code is required because Citi hasn't updated my zip code information despite my hour long calls with them. I also signed up for the account under the promotion for extra ThankYou points (their rewards system) and have yet to see any of the rewards after seven months.

name: Sam Wood
review: The Shell Gas Card gives a whopping 10 percent back on stays at some of the best hotels around. This is a much better offer than you can find on most cards and makes this card a great way to save money on accommodations.

name: Remy Lubbert
review: I've been with Citibank for a few years now and overall they have been an excellent bank. Their customer service is very good and always helped me deal with any problems I've had. The ability to take money at virtually any ATM is also a plus. And their online banking is good as well overly a very solid checking account.

name: Liz Runzo
review: The Goodyear Store Card's rate is not very good, My Sams Club card has a better rate. The cash advance rate is ridiculous, but I suppose if you needed tires or repairs on your car and were not going to use the cash advance option, then this card is not too bad. There is just many other store cards that offer better options.

name: M Hill
review: If you have any kind of business or do anything business related you are doing yourself a disservice to not have this card. The discounts make this card so worth it , you might be buying something like a printer or even something as small as a box of pencils or pencils. It's just this saves so much headache when it comes time to sit down and do that dreaded accounting chore. That and how could you not love the gifts and discounts.I love this card and it has just been a blessing since I started using it.

name: Donny Franko
review: I got approved for the BestBuy card as well. After paying it off several times in the first year, I applied for the BestBuy Rewards MasterCard and then got approved for that with a higher credit limit. I have a $0 balance on both now and just prefer to but everything there in cash like my MBP. I just use the Rewards card just for the rewards and they can scan it just as if it weren't a credit card. Oh my interest rate on the rewards card is now 10%, it takes a while to get that lowered down.

name: Jessica Hess
review: To maximize this card, you would really have to spend at Brooks Brothers often and enjoy small rewards. $20 for every $500 you spend is not likely to make a dent anywhere at a store like this.  That said, the special cardholders events 4 times a year could put this card in a new light and keep you looking great and saving every season. And they remember your birthday! So if you appreciate small concessions and shop at Brooks Brothers a lot, this could be the card for you.

name: Jessica Hess
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is very valuable to someone who spends a lot of money at Radio Shack. If you have a household with children, the money saved on batteries could be a handsome incentive. The interest rate is a bit high for a store card, so you would need to diligently pay it off as soon as possible. Essentially, the rewards and value are there, but it is up to you as a consumer to maximize them.

name: Shalaeha McClintock
review: This AT&T credit card is probably one of the most attractive credit cards I have seen to date. As someone who loves and lives for rewards for my spending purchases, this credit card really entices me to apply so that i can earn some rewards! I know that i am one to travel internationally as well, so seeing that the foreign transaction fees are 3% whereas others are at 5% I am shocked, and honestly, i think this is a great card for a frequent traveler like myself.

name: Dan Harrison
review: I love this credit card. I signed up on my senior year of high school (2009) and have had it since. In that time I've accumulated hundreds of dollars in giftcards via The Thank you points programs. I've also paid off my bill each month to avoid an interest charge, however the credit limit is low enough to prevent college students from spending way more than they can afford. Overall I really do like this card and would recommend it to any college student.

name: Tyler Watters
review: I went to Best Buy to buy the Microsoft tools disk. I did not plan on getting a credit card for best buy; however, the employee there tricked me into getting one. They gave me a small discount and after the transaction was done I had applied for a credit card. I didn't even know it was happening. So now I have a credit card from Best Buy with one purchase on it. I paid off the purchase and have not used the card since.

name: maria steranko
review: I've been using this card for a couple of years now and have nothing but good things to say about it! Best buy offers no interest payments for purchases exceeding a certain amount (the higher the amount the longer you have to pay it off). You can make your payments online and the website reminds you of how long you have to pay off your balance before you get charged interest.

name: Michael Meza
review: This is a great savings account! I have had other savings accounts and this is by far the best! Their fees are low and their rates are amazing.Their interest rate is amazing. I have had this account for over a year, and anytime I have a question about something regarding the account, I just call customer service and they help me out! I would recommend this savings account to anyone!

name: Oscar Laguna
review: The Citi ThankYou card is one of my preferred cards.  The interest rate they charge me is not too high (at least compared to other cards I have) and the thank you point are an interesting way to be rewarded.  Thankyou points are not too restrictive so you can use them even to pay part of your Citi bill.

name: Megan Triplett
review: There is no annual fee, which is great, but the cons far outweigh the pros. The cash advance rate is INSANE at 29.95%. Since this is a specialty card, you might as well just use a regular credit card. If you do choose to use the Goodyear Store Card, just make sure you can keep up with payments.

name: Ashley Marshel
review: I've been a customer of Citibank for 10 years. I've had a savings plus account for a few years now. It's a pretty basic savings account that gives you the opportunity to earn more interest, depending on how much money you have in your savings account. However, the interest rates are still pretty low, as they are with most banks these days. However, I have had a good experience with the account. The online and mobile banking are easy to use. It's fast and simple to transfer money between my accounts and to pay bills. I also get extra rewards by linking my savings account to my thank you rewards account. Overall, I'd recommend it.

name: Tim Riswold
review: So there are no explicit rewards.  Big deal.  The card is awesome.  With no annual, late, or penalty fees, this card provides a sense of insurance.  As a person who has missed paying his credit card bill a few times, I can say that it is very nice that there are no late fees.  More importantly, it has saved my credit rating.  Another nice feature is that the foreign transaction fee is quite low as well.  As a person who has family overseas and visits every year, having a low foreign transaction fee really adds up in savings.  What is more, like the card name implies, it is simple to use and think about.

name: Tim Riswold
review: Overall I think the Shell Gas Card is an excellent card for my needs.  As a college student I'm not a fan of the $25 annual fee, but as a person who frequently flies home from school and back, I have more than made up for it with the 5% cash back for airline fees.  With that said, I am curious as to why a gas card would not offer cash back when buying gas.  Nevertheless, the most important factor to me about this card is that it is stress free.  A max late fee of only $35 puts my mind at ease.  What is more, having had a different card stolen and being charged for liabilities, I am grateful that this card has no charge.

name: Erin Katsura
review: I was with citibank for about 5 years, and had few problems with my checking account I had through them. Their customer service is what really set them apart, always so accommodating and helpful and friendly. The only problem I ever had with them was when I wanted to open new accounts. Sometimes I was unaware of little monthly fees or charges made to my checking account or card, and the application process was always more than difficult. I just thought this was how banks were, until I switched to my current bank, which has much more clear disclosures, which are easy to read, and easier ways to apply for accounts. Overall good 5 years with them, however.

name: Matthew Maclatchie
review: We got a store card because of the no interest for 24 months on huge purchases. It worked out in our favor we got a huge bonus about 70 dollars back in best buy gift cards. We never missed a payment and have the card paid off before interest hits. Good card for best buy gift cards.

name: M Hill
review: This is a real good card especially compared to the Capital one Platinum card which offers no rewards. The 10 thousand thank you pts make this card worth it just for that. But the fact that you get one thank you pt for each dollar spent is just fantastic! I really love the fact that you can exchange those pts for gift cards , that is just awesome. How many cards let you do that?

name: Anna Cross
review: All my prayers were answered with this L.L. Bean credit card. I love to use it when I need something nice as a gift, or for a special occasion. My husband also loves this brand so I am always using it on gifts for him. I can always appreciate the low fees, which are way better than other cards I have had of this type.

name: Michael Concialdi
review: The AT&T Credit Card has some very attractive rewards available for select people. This card is geared to benefit those who purchase AT&T products and services or currently use them. The discounts are of a great value and the rewards for basic purchases are pretty typical. If you’re not a big time AT&T customer then I would not recommend this card for you. I have the Quick Silver Card which gives me 1.5% cash back on everything with no cap. Cash back cards with better APR’s are the way to go.

name: Michael Meza
review: The late fee is pretty high. Chase offers lower late fees, and also you can call Chase to have a refund on the late fee. Also, I can't believe there is no online response? That seems a bit odd in this day and age. The cash advance fee is also very high! Chase offers a much lower cash advance fee. It seems like this City card is not worth it. On the bright side, there is no max over limit fee.

name: Mark
review: I had a checking account here and I've had several issues. Within a month of opening the account I had some very strange charges, all from several states away, not such a big deal it happens to everyone these days. Then I noticed other weird charges from the same two companies, at least once a week, it took several trips to finally get them to stop withdrawing my money and still no luck in getting my money back. I have had some mysterious charges on my account from the bank that no one could explain or figure out what they were. I couldn't close this one fast enough, never again.

name: Cindy Badder
review: I work in a single employee office which means I do it all.  It is so simple to use my Office Depot Card to order all my supplies.  I go online, a couple clicks and the next day my supplies are delivered to my door.  Billing is simple to track and pay and it makes a monthly chore so easy and quick. A nice bonus are the gifts and discounts for ordering with Office Depot.

name: Donovan Hargrett IV
review: I think the Home Depot card is a great idea. I love the fact that I can order online or use the card in the store. No interest for 12 months gives me plenty of time to get all of my purchases paid off. I am constantly making purchases for a man cave/ shed that I've been working on. When home repairs need to be made, I use my Home Depot card to get the necessary items for whatever job needs to be done. I would definitely be in a bind without it. I would recommend this card to any new homeowner.

name: tomeka
review: Unfortunately the Sears credit card is representative of the direction its stores are going-down. The card offers no rewards. The deferred interest is only good on certain goods, unlike Von Maur which offers a interest free credit card. It is good that the card can be used at various stores that offer a different quality of goods.

name: Linda Protani
review: My husband and I have been using this credit card for many years.  I really like the feature that allows me to get a one time use number for shopping on the internet.  It also pays cash back.  I use it for just about everything.  I try to pay it off every month, so the  interest rate doesn't bother me.  I do watch the charges so I don't go over the amount I can pay.  This really takes some self control and careful budgeting, but pays off in the long run.

name: tomeka
review: The Best Buy credit card is a good card for those who have to have the latest technology. The APR is extremely low compared to other retailers like Walmart and H.H. Gregg which offer similar products. Its bonus points program offers consumers good savings on future purchases. Its balance transfer fee is considerably higher than say Walmart, whose transfer fee is 3%. The grace period of 25 days is good, offering more time to pay down the card without paying too much in interest.

name: Kyle Bergholtz
review: I like how this card earns money towards gas. My discover card only gives me cash back but not specifically towards gas which is what i want. I also think that the $35 max late fee is a positive due to the fact that the discover card late fee is upwards of $50.

name: William
review: The customer service of Citibank for their gold customers is really excellent. They are always courteous and even thank me for being a customer for the time I have had an account with the bank.  I travel a lot and I especially like the waiver of foreign transaction fees and non-Citibank ATM fees.  Also their online system allows me to send a bank wire from anywhere in the world, using a special physical digital key security device which really helps to identify that the transactions requested are legitimate.  I have tried all of the other banks and Citibank is my favorite.  Highly recommended, especially the branch on Paradise Rd. in Las Vegas, NV.

name: Lucas Jaeger
review: I love the Staples business store card. We have a family owned business and this card gets used quite a bit. The no annual fee and the zero APR for 6 months is what initially sold me on the card. However, the rewards are pretty good too. The 5% rewards for everything in store and online is better than most store cards. We have earned quite a few rewards in a short amount of time. If you're going to shop here anyways, you might as well get rewarded for it!

name: Dan
review: I love to break out my L. L. Bean credit card around the Christmas time every year. I've had the card for about 5 or 6 years now, and they will always run a special for current card members around the holiday. They have a nice rewards structure in place, unlike some other clothing outfitters, so your money goes farther with L. L. Bean.

name: Todd Poole
review: The Best Buy card has pretty good rewards especially on stuff purchased at the store or online. You get 5% back on any purchase at those places which is great. You also get points for everything bought at 1 point/dollar spent. I mostly got this card to use on best buy purchases but have used it on many other things since.

name: Lena Griffin
review: I guess if you need tires and you have no money, the Tire Kingdom store card would be okay. It has a zero percent introductory rate that looks good, but that's about the only thing it has going for it. The annual interest rate is a whopping 29.99%. That would be tough to pay off if you don't have much money every month. There are no rewards, but since it has no annual fee, and is relatively easy to get, you might want to get it and have it on hand just in case. When you compare this card to Visa, for example, it just doesn't stack up.

name: Jamar Faison
review: I like that it is a rewards card.  Reward cards tend to be very good and the five percent is higher than some of the regular credit cards you get.  Also it automatically links to the Staples Rewards.  One of the things I do not like is the fact you cannot get a cash advance.  There are times in life that a cash advance could be very helpful in allowing you to acquire items.  The max late fee seems to be on the higher side for a rewards card.

name: Jonathan Chapman
review: I like this card because it doesn't come with a load of hidden interest rates. I keep the balance on my card low so I don't have a ton of interest to pay off. I find that whenever I have to call customer service, the representative is always helpful. One of the only things i dislike about the card are it's high late fees.

name: Iam Notacola
review: As a car enthusiast, I recommend this card for people like myself. The benefits provided with this card are of a decent value, tires aren't cheap these days! There's no annual fee and if you're prompt with your payments, I see no reason to avoid this wonderful offer.

name: Steve Theman
review: This is a pretty good card for me as I work at home and need office supplies almost weekly from Staples. The card has attractive benefits such as the five percent earn back in rewards on everything purchased. The grace period is perfect for building my credit score as it's very generous, and allows me to pay when I am able to. The late fee for those times when I don't make enough profits from my business really isn't that bad either. The best aspect about this credit card is that there is no Annual Fee which is an added bonus.

name: Barbara Foster
review: The Staples card is a rewards card. Shopping here is easy because a new store opened in the neighborhood. There is an ink use program and the rewards add up as it is used. Offers come in the mail and email, as well. To take advantage of an offer, it was difficult to access and understand the eligibility for the reward. However it does work and the people are very good at making sure to explain clearly. The staff is very patient with questions. Rarely is there an occasion to use this reward system but it opens options for purchasing, especially on a larger item like a printer.

name: Brandon Hellman
review: The best store credit card I have ever used is the Best Buy Store Card. I signed up for it when purchasing an HDTV and I have not looked back since. Being able to pay it off without interest for 2 years let me be able to get some other cool things. Earning those rewards on those expensive home electronics is great and makes that purchase not sting.

name: Melissa Mcnerney
review: I personally would never use a card that had such a high cash advance percentage. The perks of this card are not even worth the monthly payment of four tires. I suppose if you needed something for your car or done to your car and didn't have the money to pay for it then this card would be of some help for you. I would rather have a store card with more perks, freebies, and lower interest rate. My sears card is a store card and the interest rate is not as high as this one.

name: Marc Lin
review: I have used the Citi Diamond Preferred card in the past and reading over this new offering I cannot honestly say it is significantly better or different than it was some years ago. For example: 0% for 18 months on purchases is pretty much the way most cards are these days. Most all card companies like doing mainly to entice consumers into using the card (hopefully excessively) and waiting to see if the customer forgets (or cannot pay back it all) later when the rate goes to the much higher rate (in this case between 12% and 22% APR). What rate you get will depend on what your credit scores are like. If you have never had a Citi card, most likely you will get the 22% rate since you have “little credit history with Citi.” At least that was my experience with all of them before. Citi Diamond Preferred is not a “bad card” to have. They did treat me decently when I did use it years ago. However I like other cards much better. For example the Discover IT Card offers a nice rebate system that pays me to shop. This has amounted to several hundreds of bucks paid to me over the years I have used that card. Citi in general is nothing like this generous.

name: Brianna Byrne
review: While I do appreciate the small ways that the Sears card attempts to save you in interest, this card is probably not right for a lot of consumers. One of my biggest problems with it is its over 25% interest rate, which makes forgetting to pay your bill in full a painful mistake. Other cards that I've had that were similar to this one charged a much lower rate--usually 20% interest or less. Still, if you're a consumer that does a lot of shopping at Sears and Kmart or who frequently buys fitness equipment, tools and jewelry, then I could see this card working out, and the reward rates can be beneficial. Just make sure you pay your bill in full every month, or see the balance owed grow...

name: Skye Harris
review: The Best Buy Credit Card is a wonderful thing to have if you're a frequent shopper of Best Buy. The rewards you get off things in the store really add up. The interest rate is pretty standard, but it quickly makes up for it in its potent rewards. Make sure you're checking the site often for deals using this card, because the options always change. With those benefits, it does require you to have good credit though, so that's about the only downside. Overall I recommend this card heavily to anyone who does a lot of shopping at the store.

name: Skye Harris
review: The Shell Credit Card is a pretty average gas card. If you go to Shell only for your gas, this would be a great card for you though. The discount you get off gas is a nice amount. The interest rate isn't good though, and the card doesn't offer very much. Even if you did shop at Shell a lot, I'm sure there are other cards as well that can provide more such rewards. Over-all, this is a pretty lackluster card compared to other cards on the market.

name: Skye Harris
review: The Home Depot Store Card is an okay card. I used this while I was re-doing my bedroom, and it was nice not having to pay interest while I was paying off those expenses. There really wasn't much else to this card other than that. There are no rewards, and there's no other reason to get it unless you're doing some heavy shopping at Home Depot. It doesn't offer anything compared to a normal credit card with rewards. If you use this for anything other than Home Depot you're going to get hit pretty hard with the interest rate even if you have good credit.

name: Mona Sala
review: I love this credit card as you get some great benefits with it. There is a reward card and every single purchase you make with BestBuy and their BestBuy Reward Card you get points added to your account. They accumulate cash back on your next orders. I have purchased high end electronic items and have always done well with the reward card. Also another great benefit is if you find the item cheaper in ANY other store they will refund the difference to your account. I really love this store and this card!

name: Skye Harris
review: The Staples Store Card is a great choice if you have a lot of office supplies to buy for your kids, home office, or your workplace. Regardless of credit, most people can get this card, but the biggest downside is the interest rate for this card is very unattractive. If you intend to pay your entire bill off the same month, it's a great card, but the interest rate will hit you like a bus. It's on par with other cards of this nature, but it's surely not the best, but extremely situational.

name: Garrett Black
review: This is the first credit card I have had. I initially got it when I got my own auto insurance policy. Since then I have spent over 2000 dollars and never missed a payment. I love their points system and have used mine on Amazon countless numbers of times. When I had an issue and lost my card I got a new one promptly. This is the first card to accept me and it has helped me build my credit. I would recommend this card to all of my friends. The only issue I have is whenever I log in it wants me to sign up for a new service.

name: Rob Taylor
review: This Expedia Credit Card is an excellent card and would be ideal for a frequent traveler. I am intrigued by the amount of perks they offer their users, not including the reward points that can be accumulated very quickly and used for almost anything. Users can take advantage of not having a pre-set spending limit, personal concierge service, auto-rental insurance, zero liability on unauthorized purchases, and many more. The card also offers some great offers right from the start. Users can earn a $50 statement credit and 10,000 bonus points right off the bat. This type of perks is becoming harder and harder to come by. Although, the interest rate is not the best. It can be decent if you have great credit, but it's not one of the lowest I've come by. The moderate interest rate is the only reason I gave the Expedia Card 4-stars, instead of 5. I would love to utilize a card like this.

name: Brandon Hellman
review: The L.L.Bean Credit Card gives you decent rewards, ranging from 1% coupon rewards up to 3% in coupon rewards. The interest rates are pretty good, and it does allow for cash advances. One downside is that there is a balance transfer fee, and the rates are high for transfers.

name: LUCAS
review: This Radio Shack store card is only worth it on two conditions.  One, you must be a person that intends to spend a lot of money at Radio Shack or you need a lot of batteries.  And second, you would need to know that you would pay off the balance before the interest kicks in.  The interest rate is high and you would not want to carry a balance unless it was a part of the deferred interest program.  If those two conditions do not describe you, you would be better off looking for a more versatile card.  I like my Fidelity Investments card that gives me 2% back on all purchases into an investment account.

name: LUCAS
review: This Brooks Brothers Credit card isn't terrible, but there are better options out there.  I like that it does not have an annual fee, that is always important to me.  But the rewards are not that special unless you are a heavy shopper at Brooks Brothers.  I don't buy all my clothes there.  If I did, this card would provide more value.  But as it is, it does not beat my Fidelity Investments AMEX that gives me 2% back on ALL purchases into my investment account.  The $1 return on the Brooks Brothers Credit card is fine, but nothing special.  I recommend staying away unless you plan to do a lot of shopping at Brooks Brothers.

name: Tad Hovet
review: I liked how I was easily able to apply in the store to get my Best Buy card and actually quite a good amount of credit to buy my new laptop computer. After about a month I got a bill in the mail from Best Buy and the instructions were pretty easy on how to pay it, either online or by check. If there was one thing I didn't like about the card was that I got such a big credit limit, that I felt as though I could buy a lot of cool stuff at the store! Luckily I have restraint on spending so that wasn't a problem but if I did, the APR wasn't very high anyways.

name: Lori McKirahan Burton
review: Go to Lowes, you'll get the same interest free offer in addition to 5% off your total.  I just cancelled my order with HD so I could recharge the same items to another card that gave me some type of additional incentive to use it.

name: chris lee
review: My first ever credit card was with Citibank. They approved me straight away with no credit history and gave me a decent limit. However, the APR is way too much (19.99% I believe). Everytime I paid off a purchase, my limits would drop and the percentage would sometimes increase. The customer service was decent and they were generally sympathetic to my complaints, but the hassle was way too much and eventually I cancelled my card. Perhaps a good credit card to build your credit history but I wouldn't necessarily recommend them.

name: Sean Pedigo
review: The AT&T Credit Card is not particularly a card you want to keep around. Although if you have the credit necessary to get the card I would suggest using it to get the bonus before you get rid of it. Since there are very few rewards aside from that I would suggest you get something else like a cashback card to make the most of your credit card purchases.

name: Jonathan Flemington
review: It seems to be a great card, this one. The balance transfer rate is awesome for those who want to get rid of other cards and switch to this one. What seems a little confusing for me, though, is that you have to have excellent credit--who is going to transfer their balance from another card to this one if they have excellent credit? There's probably an answer to this, but as far as I can see, this card has plenty of positive aspects, the only one perhaps being that Mastercard is not as frequently accepted as Visa (which I currently have), and I travel to some pretty remote locations a few times a year.

name: Shane Eye
review: I like the card; it should list the other places it works at more clearly on the card, and also mention that it can be used for store purchases. I would like custom images also. The insurance and the max late fee are nice. Over all I try to stay away from cards, but this one is nice. I would say this Shell gas card is much better for gas than my BP gas card.

name: Billy Maney
review: The Staples Store Card is a good card if you need to buy a lot of office supplies and are sometimes a bit short on cash.The major downside to this credit card is the fact that the interest rate is very high.The good thing is that if you pay your bill off each month you will not have to worry about interest charges at all.I would recommend this card to anyone who does a lot of office supply shopping but make sure you pay your bill on time because the late fee is pretty high.

name: Lucas Jaeger
review: I think the Home Depot Store Card is a great card for any homeowner to have. If there is one thing I have learned about owning a house, it is expect the unexpected. Things will break or go wrong at the most random, inopportune times and the Home Depot is a great place to go for your repair needs. No interest for 6 months is very attractive and can definitely make those large purchases less of a headache. Compared to your average credit card such as Chase Ultimate rewards, it may not appear as attractive because of the lack of rewards points, but when you are in a pinch, you can not go wrong. Recommended for homeowners.

name: Amy Eldridge
review: I like the fact that you can use the Shell Credit card on every day purchases and that these purchases count toward cents off on your fuel purchases, as well as future every day purchases! Every penny counts in this day and age and so rewards like these pay off!! If you can afford to pay off your credit card balance every month, this is a great card to have! The main thing I don't like about it is that the interest rate is so high. This is where credit cards will kill you, especially if you really don't have the money to pay it off each month, it'll just continue to creep up. BP is the only other card that I know of that offers anything even remotely similar, but it seems (at least where I live) that BP stations are being kind of phased out. Meanwhile, Shell is everywhere! So even out of state, this card would be plenty useful!

name: Lucas Jaeger
review: I love this card. I am a huge tech person - I always am buying something new for my house and this card helps me get the most out of it. The 24 month no interest on all HDTV's is particularly attractive and I have taken advantage of that. While Best Buy may not have the cheapest prices for high def televisions, the fact that you have two years to pay it off before interest charges kick in makes it completely worth it. It's also nice just being able to go into the store and buy the TV when you want, rather than wait for it to come in the mail. I definitely recommend this card to anyone who loves tech!

name: jessica sanchez
review: I have had the Citibank Savings Plus Account as my primary savings account for a few years now. Overall the savings account is great. I have not had any issues with it at all. The location is close to me which makes it very convenient for me. I use this account to accumulate savings each month for a safety net in the event of an emergency. Overall I do not earn very much on interest, but the account is great for me to just put money away and save. Overall the bank's staff has been very helpful and I have had no issues with them at all. This savings account is highly recommended by me.

name: Angie aluminua
review: The Staples store card can be very useful to someone that will pay back their balance on the card every month to avoid paying the high 27.9 percent interest rate after 6 months. There is an added bonus of receiving 5 percent cash back in rewards on all purchases. I personally have used the Best Buy rewards card and I find that it works very similarly although I never seem to use it enough to get very much cash back on purchases.

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Tire Kingdom store card is a subprime store card that doesn't stack up to similar cards.  Although the 0% intro rate is a nice feature, that's the only real feature of this card.  The interest rate is a hefty 29.99%.  There is no rewards system.  I would not personally be interested in this card, but I suppose if Tire Kingdom is a place you shop frequently, maybe it could be beneficial in some instances.  I guess with no annual fee, it wouldn't hurt to keep it in your wallet just in case.

name: Kyle Ervin
review: This is the best card for someone who is into technology. I consistently save 5-20% on purchases made at best buy. Through Best Buy's reward points program I also earn 5x the reward points on purchases at Best Buy which ends up being a lot gift cards.I can personally recommend this credit card, I mean most of the expensive things you would put on credit or otherwise are going to be electronics anyway. Best Buy doesn't have the best prices if you're not signed up for rewards, so the way I see it this is a win both ways.

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Expedia card's Thankyou points aren't my ideal type of rewards.  I prefer cash rewards like my Capital One and Amex offer.  The interest rate seems a little high for a prime card.  For some people this card may work, but it's not my ideal.

name: Rich Marshall
review: Excellent complementary card to have in your wallet if you shop often at L.L. Bean-- use it exclusively at L.L. Bean and use one of the higher, 1.5% base capital one cards for other general purchases and you'll be earning far more than using either card exclusively.

name: Nicole Bedard
review: I think that this is your run of the mill store credit card that you would find at just about any store offering a credit card. The card offers a nice rewards program which to me, seems a bit better than the Sallie Mae Upromise Rewards Master Card, which is a rewards card that I tend to use often. It offers $20 in bonus rewards upon your first purchase, which I really like, and I find that this is something that not a whole lot of cards have to offer. I do not like the rather high apr of this card. In my opinion, it would seem like one would have to shop a lot with this particular card at this store in order to justify the apr attached.

name: Pipk Sau
review: Part of running a small private business is getting your office supplies. By using the Staples Business Store Card, I am able to control the inflow of supplies that are needed for my business. One benefit that everyone should be happy about is earning the 5% back in rewards on everything in store. Also the card provides interest free if paid in full within 6 months on all purchases of $299 or more, which is a huge benefit when running a business. So all the small business people who need a large inflow of supplies should definitely consider the Staples Business Store Card and have a worry free life. Thanks Staples for all the help in running a small business.

name: John Richard
review: Here is my take on the Radio Shack store card: The 10% discount off your first order is appreciated. However a 28.99% APR is excessively high. (In contrast, my Target Redcard has a lower but still high 2%.) A 15% rebate on store-stocked batteries is not as appealing as the Shack might want you to believe.

name: Collin Sullivan
review: After an initial review of the AT&T credit card, I would give this card a 3 star, as it appears to be, OK.  I like that there is no annual fee, but I do not like that they cap the “Thank-you” points at 50,000 a year. Also, I would probably look into how many points it took to qualify for anything of significant value. If the points needed to “cash-in” were high I would probably not consider this card. However, there is a nice incentive of 10K “thank-you” points upon qualifying for this card if you make the appropriate  amount of purchases. For me, personally, for maximum value of return I would probably lean more towards a card that gives you cash back and does not cap your max yearly return. For people who may not qualify for a card of that type, this may be a good place to start.

name: SinDelle Morte
review: I have had my Sears card for over 10 years and I have used it probably more than any other credit card I own. For Christmas shopping, weddings and gifts, I have used this card to buy everything from lingerie to tires. Probably the best value I get out of it is in the electronics department. I have a family of men and they are all gadget nuts. This card has been a huge help in that area. I am so glad I have it. I've never regretted it.

name: Kyle McCullough
review: Every time I walk into Sears, I always get asked by a cashier if I would like to sign up for a card. I was always hesitant, but found out that they offer a discount on my first purchase of 15% off. So I took the plunge, and after a quick minute of filling out my information, I was immediately approved.  To this day, I still use the card because I find myself shopping at Sears (and sometimes KMart, since the card can work there too!) all the time for electronics and occasionally some clothes. I have never had an issue with the card nor any hidden fees. Every once in a while, the stores will also have exclusive discounts that benefit cardholders only, so it's nice to be appreciated like that every once in a while. Overall, I am very satisfied with my card and appreciate how easy and helpful the employees have been during each of my visits.

name: Jeff
review: I run a photography business.  I do a lot of commercial photography and because of this I have to have a lot of forms and paperwork.  I keep my office stocked with my Office Depot card because it is a great way to keep track of my office expenses.  I normally get everything paid off before the grace period runs out.  If I didn't handle it that way, I would wince at the APR.  When I first got the card it was nice to use the additional 10% off and I stocked up on quite a bit of things that I knew I would be needing.  It really does work nicely at tax time because I have most of my office expenses right in one place and I don't have to go scrambling looking for receipts from several different stores.  It also helps me because I have gotten to know where everything is in the local store.  I don't have to go traipsing all over a different store because I automatically know that I will go to the Office Depot for all of my office supplies.

name: Nelly Mendoza
review: As an owner of a small business this credit card does wonders for me.  I use it in everyday purchases needed for my business, from toners to a new desk chair, postage etc.  Plus the 5% in rewards on purchases make this card totally worth using.  Even though the APR rate is semi high at 23.99%  the convenience and quality make up for it.  This card is just well rounded and is practical for small businesses and others alike.

name: Doug MyVegas
review: I think at some point, everyone has been asked if they would like to apply for the store credit card in order to get an additional discount. I resisted for a long time, but when it was time to purchase a new lawnmower, I figured it would make sense. Just the extra % off for opening the account helped entice me, but I was lucky enough to get in on a 0% interest rate for 6 months. I had initially planned on using a rewards card I normally use for big purchases, but the savings was enough to convince me. I’ve used the card a few different times for bigger purchases, but always pay it off quickly because this interest rate is a bit higher than I like. If you can get in on a promo rate this is a very useful card.

name: Beatrice Renee
review: I chose the L.L. Bean credit card mostly because I found myself shopping on L.L. Bean more often for winter gear and jackets.  I've had to return things and pay return shipping, but now that I have the credit card they offer me free returns.  The extra 3% I receive on L.L. Bean purchases makes me look to them a little more often now.  Their prices can be higher sometimes and the 3% back and free shipping helps a little.  They have great quality.  My interest rate with this card is about the same as some cards that I have which don't offer cash back perks.  The L.L. Bean card is great because it offers me a percentage back on every purchase, even when I forget about it.  Seeing that amount waiting for you in rewards is really nice when you have forgotten how much you've earned.

name: Jeff Chen
review: Citi Diamond preferred card really is a good card for people that mainly use citibank like myself. There is no annual fee for this card which is a huge bonus for people like me. Also, it gives the owner access to presale tickets,VIP seating and much more. Overall, the card simply tops any other cards i have right now and the past. I will definitely recommend it to people.

name: Michael Concialdi
review: The Citi Simplicity Credit Card has excellent balance transfer offers of 0% for 18 months which is great if you're looking to pay off high interest credit card balances. I currently have the Citi Bank Dividend and they have similar balance transfer offers which I think are some of the best on the market right now. Furthermore, there are no late payment fees, over limit fees, or APR penalties with the Simplicity Card. There are no cash rewards with this card but that's okay because you're getting great APR's and balance transfers which will save more than any rewards program.

name: James Russell
review: The name of the card, the Shell Gas Card, may be a little misleading because you can use it for much more than gas. The best thing about the Shell Gas Card is that you are able to earn 10% cash back when staying at specified Hotels as well as earn 5% cash back on air lines and car rentals.  The cash advance rate is 29.95%, which I would personally look to avoid.  Overall, I think it is a great card if used on vacations.

name: Olivia Jordan
review: This is really a great card. I signed up for this when I was in college and didn't have enough money to pay off most of my bills. It really helped me through tough times. One of the greatest things is that you can earn Thank You points. I used these points to pay off my balance, and I love that they have this as an option. I continue to use this card, especially because of the 0.0% APR! Definitely satisfied :)

name: Jeff Chen
review: Getting a best buy store card is probably the best decision i made throughout my life. I am a gaming/electronic nerd therefore I enjoy shopping in Best Buy. Best Buy reward card allows me to earn points every time i shop in the store. And the points earned can be used as store credits which allows me to buy even more stuff. Also, best buy store card provides their consumer with discount and that can be very useful sometimes when you are short on money. I will definitely recommend this card to people like me.

name: Brandon Lion
review: So this is a decent store card, but by no means the best. I had it in the past when I used to work in an office and frequented the store. The best thing about this card is that you are enrolled in the Staples Rewards program when you sign up, which gives you 5% cash back on everything you purchase. The downside is that it yields a pretty high interest rate, so you'll be paying quite a bit if you don't pay this thing off before the balance carries over. And, as other reviews stated before me, they will defer interest at $299 and $399 tiers for 6 and 12 months, respectively. I'd recommend the card for anyone who is a frequent shopper, but don't let the cashier persuade you into getting it otherwise!

name: Michael Mezzasalma
review: This Citi rewards program is unlike any rewards program I've ever been a part of.  It seemed as if all these rewards programs turned out to be not what I thought, but Citi thank you rewards turned out to be a pleasant surprise.  I was earning points with every purchase and I quickly had a gift card which I could spend on anything.  Citi ThankYou Preferred Card is a great card!

name: Michael Staino
review: I'm not really sure how appealing this card really is. I think if you're into fixing up cars as projects, then maybe the card is useful. You could possibly take advantage of the discounts and promotional offers Goodyear has. However, I think I speak for the majority of people who would rather not be having to take in their car to the shop often enough to use this card. No annual is great, however, not so uncommon anymore. This credit card just offers the bare minimum. If you're looking for a no frills credit card, and like Goodyear tires enough, then maybe this card can work for you. But when other cards can offer rewards, and better interest rates, I'm not sure it is entirely necessary.

name: Ed Sal
review: The Chase Savings Plus Account has been my primary use savings account for over four years now. They offer not only the convenience of having a location near my home, great bankers who i can work with when i need to stop in, a very smooth online bank program that makes it easy for someone who is not computer savvy to navigate. They also offer pretty good interest rates that are better than a lot of competitors. This is my favorite savings account. I would recommend it to anyone looking to bank and save their hard earned money with ease. 5 Stars

name: Roger Bacon
review: I have been using the Home Depot card for a long time. I buy wood from Home Depot and it can get expensive so it is nice to have a card there. I highly recommend using this card!

name: Rafael Maldonado
review: Being a homeowner, having a store card for Home Depot is super helpful. Store cards typically do have a high interest rate, but if you are responsible and pay your credit card bills on time, it’s no big deal at all. I buy most of my yard and garage items at Home Depot and I simply love this card. I have not found another store card similar to the home depot one that provides me with what I need. I would recommend this card to everyone.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: The Best Buy Credit Card is a great credit card if you are a regular customer of Best Buy. They don't have the cheapest prices in town, but they reward their customers well with this credit card. First, the introductory APR is very good, and some purchases are eligible for up to 24 months of no interest financing, which is hard to find on general electronic purchases. And even after the introductory APR is over, the standard APR is just under 18% which is very good for a store credit card. The rewards program is also very good, and essentially equates to about 5% cash back. Also, there are different tiers of the credit card given out, so you'll most likely be approved regardless of your credit worthiness. All in all, the Best Buy credit card is a very good credit card if you're a regular customer of Best Buy and can take advantage of their long term financing and rewards plan.

name: Tina Marie
review: The Sears credit card has no rewards plan and a high rate (at 25%). I like that it has a 12 month intro period where no interest is applied. This card can be used at other stores, like Kmart and Lands End, but I really don't shop at any of these places (and neither does my family) so this isn't very appealing to me. I can get many of the items from Sears at Target and their card is much better (it has a great discount at the register). If I were shopping for home improvement items or tools, Home Depot's card is also a very nice one to consider. With the high rate and no rewards plan, I can't see very many reasons to consider this card.

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: I think that the Shell Credit Card is a great card to have, because everyone hasto get gas.  There is no annual fee on the card, and no hidden charges.  The interestrate is kind of high at 23.99%, but I like how they offer rewards on, not only gas, but alsoon other everyday purchases like groceries, cell phone bills, and dry cleaning.  Shellgas stations are very convenient to find, so it would be easy for me to getthere for my gas purchases.

name: Suzanne Cunningham
review: This is one of the few store cards that I truly was excited about being approved for in the 90s and I'm still happy to have today.  Their credit backing was somewhat discerning and many of my friends couldn't get this card but I could, and that was fabulous for getting me through some sticky situations in life.  Because Sears has everything, I have been able to charge costly repairs to my vehicle that I wouldn't have been able to afford on the spur of the moment.  My dad worked for Sears so I was biased to the company anyway, but their service has been outstanding and I have yet to experience a late or overlimit fee.  The interest rate leaves something to be desired, but it seems pretty standard for store credit.

name: Amy
review: I've had the Best Buy Store Card for a few years now, and it's come in really handy on more than one occasion. My main computer broke on me once, and without this card, I would've been out of work for a while. Even though the interest rate isn't great, hanging onto this card for emergencies is a good idea.

name: Doug Miller
review: I’ve used the Best Buy Store Credit Card for a few major purchases over the years. It has come in handy when something important breaks and you don’t have time to shop around. I like the promo interest rates that you get when spending over a certain amount. The standard rate isn’t very attractive and there are really no other benefits to keeping this card.

name: Tyler Sharp
review: Well, the good thing about store credit cards is that they do help build your credit, but the Staples Store Card has a pretty high interest rate, even for a store card. Office Depot's card has a similar rate, and I use that one regularly for business purchases, but still 27.99 makes me a bit leery. The deferred interest plan is a good option for purchases over $299, but it's only a good option if you REMEMBER you chose it. Don't make the mistake of using it then forgetting about it, as you'll be slapped with a nice payment + interest down the road.I do think this card is great for business owners or frequent Staples' purchasers as the points would add up quickly and would equal some nice savings. It just depends on what your purpose would be in getting the card!

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: The Citi Mastercard is a good option for someone who has a patchycredit history, or maybe someone who has never had a credit cardbefore.  The minimum deposit of $200 is reasonable.  I love thatthey raise your limit over time, so they are really teaching you howto use credit with low risk.  The apr is not fantastic at 18.24% although I havecertainly seen much worse so it's not terrible for a first timer.I would say all in all, this card would be a solid choice for people who eitherwant to repair, or build their credit.

name: Amy
review: The Tire Kingdom Store card is a pretty mediocre card in comparison to most other cards I've used. The best thing I saw was that it doesn't have an annual fee, which is something I look for in a card. It seems you can get approved without much of a hassle, which is good for people with not so great credit. The interest rate is pretty ridiculous though. I would never consider a card with a rate that high. There are also no rewards with this card. That's another thing I look for, and most good cards have them these days. It's an okay card for the purpose it serves, but there are much better cards with much lower interest rates.

name: Mike Powe
review: I have owned my Best Buy card for over four years now. Best Buy is the only big electronics store in my area so I use this card to make a lot of big electronic purchases. Best Buy is constantly offering financing options which give you points back (which are redeemable for gift certificates) or up to 18 months interest free. The good thing is that no matter what option you choose, you get a certain amount of points back regardless. Overall I am extremely happy with this card and would definitely recommend it if you make electronic purchases.

name: jason buonomo
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card looks like a good pick, but only if you shop at L.L. Bean a lot.  The 3% rewards at L.L. Bean are nice, but considering that you will be using this at a lot of other places where you will only be earning 1% everywhere else is my deciding factor.  Plus, the interest rates are not that great.  However, the free monogramming is kind of cool…If you’re a big L.L. Bean fan, go for it.  Everyone else though should keep looking.

name: John Richard
review: The Expedia credit card is a great card for frequent travelers because you earn a point for every dollar spent with a max of two points, which can be redeemed for shopping, dining, travel or even charitable giving. None of my other cards—for instance, my US Bank Ralphs card allows for such charitable donations. You also receive 10,000 points upfront. Another selling point is a 15 month zero percent APR for balance transfers.

name: Karen
review: I've only used my Best Buy card to purchase a computer. I did so because I wasn't charged any interest for the first year and a half, which was perfect as I intended to have it paid off by then (and did). The interest rate after that introductory period is high enough that I don't use the card very often to make purchases. The APR is comparable to other store cards I use, such as Macy's and Banana Republic, but I don't shop at Best Buy as much as I do at those places, so it doesn't make sense to incur interest on the occasional purchase.

name: James
review: I enjoy having this citi credit card because this credit card has 0% for 18 months and zero late fees which is really a great thing to have.  It is also easy to make monthly payments on this card and I never had any issues with their website.  Also their website is very easy to use which also helps a lot.  Overall, I am happy to be using this credit card and I would recommend to others.

name: Karen
review: I like using my Home Depot Store Card because I can buy anything for the home or yard when I need it, even if I don't have the cash. I tend to pay the balance off each month, so the high APR doesn't really add much to my bill as I rarely accumulate interest. I could use my American Express or my debit card, which if course have no interest rate, but I prefer to use the store card, particularly when added discounts are offered for doing so.

name: Rob Taylor
review: This Sears Credit Card has a lot of great features and benefits. The 0% introductory interest rate for twelve months, no annual fee, special monthly sales events and exclusive offers, the ability to use the card in associated retailers, and the 0% liability on unauthorized purchases is the total package. Although, it would be nice if after the twelve month introductory period the interest rate was lower than it is. Also, I usually look for cards that offer more rewards and incentives than this one does. Not a bad card all-in-all, but there are a few spots that could be buffed out to make it near-perfect.

name: David Marcillo
review: This Shell Credit Card is better than most other gas station cards you'll come across because it works on the Master Card network. This is useful since a lot of gas cards are store cards and can only be used at gas stations run by the specific brand. With this card, you can certainly use it at Shell, but you can also use it anywhere else you shop and rack up the points. Since we all need to purchase gas, having rewards that help make gas less expensive is always a bonus. The interest rate is a little high, but that's to be expected with a card like this. As long as you're not planning on carrying too much of a balance, and assuming you use or would like to use Shell gasoline, this is a great card to have.

name: Jennifer shunter
review: I have had a savings account with Citibank for two years. I primarily use this account to put away money from my paycheck for future emergencies when I need the money. The interest rate is reasonable and an added bonus, although I do not see my money grow much because I do not have a lot of money. I have never had any issues with my account here at all. in fact, if I had to open another savings account I would consider Citibank as my first choice again. I have also recommended a few friends to join Citibank as well for their banking and credit needs. Overall I am very happy with my account here.

name: Jacob Featherston
review: It's not as if you'll ever see enormous gains by leaving your money in a savings account, but the Citibank savings account does offer an interest rate better than a lot of others I looked at. I've banked with Citi for a long time anyway, so there would have had to be some very amazingly better option out there anyway. There's not really anything special about it; it's pretty bare bones actually, but there is no fee or minimum balance requirement. Basically, it's just a safe place to store money for a rainy day, and if it does accrue interest at a slightly less glacial pace, all to the good.

name: Gregory Stancil
review: I have a Citibank Regular Day to Day Savings and I can say that I'm satisfied.  I opened the account because I was looking for a safe place to put some of the extra money I was making as a freelance videographer and this service meets my needs.  It's a basic savings account but that worked for me because it only requires a low opening deposit (my initial deposit was just $100).  Like all big banks, it's FDIC insured and the thing I like best about the account is that I have access to my funds basically anytime, anywhere.  I am able to transfer funds from a non-Citibank account via their "Inter Institution Transfers" which is very convenient and since I've kept at least $500 in my account, I've avoided having to pay the monthly fee.  I'd definitely give the Citibank Regular Day to Day Savings a solid four stars.

name: Ashley Marshel
review: The Citi Dividend Platinum Select card was one of the first cards I ever signed up for. I like that it's a cash back card rather than a points card. I get 1% cash back on every purchase. Also, every quarter there are special cash back categories where I get 5% cash back . That really helps me get reward checks even faster. I don't have to worry about interest rates because I always pay on time and they gave me a very high credit limit since I have good credit. I've never had a problem with the card. I had some fraudulent charges on several occasions and they got rid of the charges right away and sent me a new card immediately.

name: Rob Taylor
review: This is a fairly decent card. Considering it has no annual fee, unlike many other cards, 0% interest for the first 6-12 months, and the ability to be approved for it without having a crazy-perfect credit score. Although, I dislike the regular interest rate of almost 29%. That's a bit high. Also, it does not offer any rewards. That is something I look for in a card these days. All-in-all, it's a decent card, but wish it had a few features that it doesn't.

name: Tyler Fessenden
review: The Citi Secured Credit Card is an affordable way to build or rehab your credit. Unlike other banks, such as Wells Fargo, the Citi Secured MasterCard only requires a $200 deposit. With no monthly or 1 time fee's you can have this card for only an annual fee of $29. Its perfectly acceptable interest rate makes it the ideal card to rehab your less than stellar credit.

name: Leah
review: The Expedia is a great card if you have fairly good credit.  They have tons of incentives at sign up, and i was so glad I got mine when i did, because I managed to get a good chunk of christmas gift shopping done, which let me get the most bang for my buck with the intro benefits.  I got a $50 rebate on my first purchase, free bonus points just for getting the card, and then double points on my first shopping trip. They  have no annual fee, which was primarily why I switched from using my Blue Cash Discovery, who charged me $79.00 a year just to have it.  I thought I'd keep this card as my back up, but once I saw how much more i got out of it, it took the number one spot as my go-to card.  Their points set up: you get 1 bonus point for every dollar spent, and there are always certain items that they'll give you double points on.  Also, my Discovery had this incredibly confusing tier with respect to my interest rates, so it was very hard to keep track of them all, but the Expedia is a flat 15-22% from the get go.  Customer service is great; they cut me a break last month when I couldn't make my entire payment,  and extended the due date for me so I didn’t have to pay the extra fees.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone who does serious shopping, even if you don't really need to buy things on credit, because the cash back program is like getting paid to buy things! Two thumbs up.

name: Brit
review: After getting asked at every checkout if I had a Sears card or would like to sign up for one I finally took the plunge to take advantage of the 15% discount on the item I was purchasing.  So glad that I finally signed up and added the Sears card to my purchasing arsenal!  The interest rate is actually quite good for a store card even though I always pay off the amount immediately to not apply any debt to my overall finances.  (Being a college student building credit history, this is a great way to build up my score!  Thanks for the opportunity to help my future Sears.  Love ya!!!)

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card is a great store card in my opinion. You earn 3% back on all purchases from the store so if you shop here a lot it will add up quickly. In comparison to other store cars this one offers a low interest rate although you do need excellent credit. I would recommend this card if you qualify.

name: Amy Hagerty-Kuehl
review: Like most store credit cards there are pros and cons that one should look at. The Staples store card is very high interest at 27.99, but that is about the same for all store credit cards like Office Depot or Office Max. So if you don't plan on paying off the balance each month look elsewhere. You will be paying way more than what you probably spent on the actual items. Getting a store credit card is an excellent way to build up credit and they are usually easy to get. There is a deferred interest plan with this card for 6 months for purchases over $299. That is a nice feature, but you have to remember to pay it off in that time frame. There are also rewards that come with this card which are pretty good. You receive 5% back on all items purchased.

name: Amy Hagerty-Kuehl
review: If you have excellent or good credit and you travel a lot, this Expedia credit card just may be the card you would want to get. There are tons of rewards attached to this card like the Marriott Rewards Premiere card. This interest rate wouldn't be too bad if you have great credit. I have seen better rates though. They also offer auto rental insurance and 0 liability on unauthorized charges which is great in this day and age with identity theft.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Tire Kingdom Store Card is not very well known. The interest rates are really high though they are lowered if you pay within 6 months and its comparable to a lot of store cards. This is a no frills card that doesn't offer any type of rewards program. But i must say this card could be useful in situations where you needed new tires quick on the spot or dealt in a business requiring you to buy tires frequently. 2 out of 5 stars for me.

name: Dennis Sanders
review: I have owned this card for 5 years now. What can I say about this great card. Making purchases on big items is great because you get a long time to pay off at a great monthly payment amount. Every time I make a purchase I use the card to gain points that are redeemable for credit in store. I also receive many great offers throughout the year. Sometime you can earn up to 3 times the bonus points on a purchase. Also most of times you can get free financing for 3 years on big purchases. I love this card and plan to own this card for years to come.

name: Sandra Brown
review: I like the Bonus and Thank you points of this credit card. My Capital one card does not offer this point system. I am a little nervous about the late fee, but I do realize that late fees can be avoided and that the $35.00 charge is the maximum late fee amount. My late fee is currently $29.00.
