Not having an annual fee is a big plus. However, I do not have an annual fee on my card. I do not like the regular rate which starts at 14.99%. That is quite high! Excellent credit scores should have single digit rates. This is a good card for someone who is planning to carry a second or third card around for emergencies. I am not sure I would consider transferring my current balance from my card to an Expedia Credit Card, as I am a satisfied customer with Capital one.

name: David Marcillo
review: The Staples Store Card has fairly high interest rates, but it also has an excellent system of rewards. Despite the high interest rates, deferred interest is offered on purchases of $299, which is more than reasonable. I feel like this card would be ideal for a business to use when purchasing necessary supplies. If the balance is paid in full each month, thereby avoiding the high interest, you could quickly rack up many points and earn significant cash back before too long. Overall, this card could be useful for individuals who make purchases at Staples frequently and should be a godsend to small businesses nationwide.

name: David Marcillo
review: This L.L. Bean Credit Card offers great interest rates, no annual fee, and a pretty solid reward structure if you like shopping at L.L. Bean. Like the brand with which it is associated, this card seems reliable and effective. No annual fee is always nice, since you're already paying interest rates on your purchases anyway. The only thing to keep an eye out for with this card is that it does require Good to Excellent credit and that the rewards are mostly useless for those who do not shop at L.L. Bean

name: Jason Leepid
review: The Citi Secured Credit Card is a decent card if you're rebuilding your credit or need your first card. It's very similar to the Bank of Americard Secured card in almost every way. The interest rate on the Citi MasterCard is a little lower at 18% and the cash advance rate is at the standard 25%. The Citi MasterCard does have a yearly fee of 29 dollars which isn't horrible but it also comes with the 0% liability with no fees that a lot of secured cards don't offer. Another good thing about this card is they automatically try to get you an unsecured credit card after a little while. Unlike most secure cards they don't wont to keep you tied in. Altogether this isn't a bad card if you're actively trying to rebuild your credit.

name: Melissa Johnson-Murray
review: If you are a regular Sunoco customer, then the Sunoco Credit Card may work well for you. For everyone else, it would probably be better to look for a different card. Most cards will offer introductory rates and give you cas back bonuses (BankAmerica has a rewards card with both). The regular rate is high - particularly since they require good and excellent credit to qualify for the card. You can also find cards that have a balance transfer fee for less than the 5% Sunoco has. Why you would want to transfer a balance to this card I don't know.

name: Frank Oz
review: This card seems okay, but not the best. Besides the fact that there are absolutely no rewards offered, the transfer fee and interest rate is quite high, as well as the standard interest rate. I want my card to be working for me and this one does not.

name: Frank Oz
review: I am a sucker for bonuses, so the 10,000 point signing bonus is a big draw here. Also the fact that you get a gift certificate $100 when you redeem these points, talk about bonuses! I also love that you can earn 5 points when you spend on things such as restaurant and movies. This is the perfect card for date nights.

name: Thomas Burke
review: I've had other store cards like this, it's good if you're planning a major purchase there anyway. For the 10 percent off your first purchase, and the discounted rate during the into period it's a great deal. They just give a break on larger buys, but a 28.99% APR on purchases isn't for anyone who can't pay their bills on time, it would be like a Mafia interest rate. I'd really check the numbers on other cards you can get, unless it's some item you really want from them specifically, then you could get it and pay it off with the discount and interest break on it. If you want a discount on batteries, go to a dollar store and buy them, you'll do so much better on something like a 4 pack of AA's.

name: Denis Vegas
review: This AT&T Credit Card probably has the best initial signup bonus there is. $500 dollars is not too hard to spend within 3 months to get the $100 dollar bonus. This is especially true since I am using this credit card to pay for my phone bill at AT&T. It feels good to earn money back on the bills I'm paying since It seems like AT&T is always expensive. But the only reason I have this card is to pay my phone bills with it and nothing else. There are better cards you can use daily.

name: Ian Keyes
review: This card seems to hold up well against its competition. Like most store credit cards, it offers discounts while shopping in store. Unlike most cards, however, it offers rewards even when not shopping in the store or online with The Brooks Brothers. The APR seems to be on par with others in the market, such as the Sears credit card, which offers 25% APR.  However, It seems to me that this card offers much more consistent rewards than most cards. Sears, along with other cards, will offer different rewards during the year, but it will vary greatly. With this cards program for points and rewards, it seems that you would be able to rack up the points a lot quicker than most! Overall, The Brooks Brothers credit card seems to be a good option for those who shop at least casually at the brooks brothers store. With the option to rack up points even on purchases outside the store, this card has benefits beyond store discounts!

name: LUCAS
review: I do like the Best Buy Store card.  I have had it for 8 years and have often found it to be useful.  The regular rate is not very good, but I have still found the card to be useful and a value based off of how often Best Buy offers special financing to card holders.  It is not uncommon for them to have a promotion offering 0% financing for 12 months.  It's a great way to make a purchase that you may not be able to immediately afford without having to pay interest on it.  That has been the primary way I have utilized this card.

name: Thomas Burke
review: This card was a lifesaver when my main computer broke and I needed a replacement in a hurry. I was able to qualify with just fair credit, and it got a nice computer since in the last years technology progressed so far and prices dropped a lot. The initial APR is great but it goes up after the introductory time, so I recommend paying it off as soon as you can if it's for an initial big purchase. There's a point reward thing but I really just needed something I could qualify for without too much hassle when the main PCIE slot on my motherboard died. They do have some good deals though, the prices weren't bad compared to other retailers. It's obvious they want to sign you up with the intro rate to get you to make a big purchase, but it really works in your favor if you can cover it before their regular rates kick in later.

name: Kyle Storm
review: i used to work at Staples and didn't really think much about these cards other than that I needed to sell them to customers, or get customers interested in them. It wasn't until I left retail and made my own business that I realized how much these things paid off. I needed a new computer and couldn't exactly afford the one I was looking for, but after applying and being approved in the store (the same day) for this card I was able to get what I needed. Better yet, the interest was so low I was able to only pay 40 a month to cover the charge! I use it all the time now when I'm in staples because it pays off greatly when you need to buy paper, toner, or services for your own business

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: I love that this card has terms that are so straight forward.  They accept all types of credit backgrounds (to a certain extent), and while the APR is high (27.99) they do offer a 0% interest rate for the first 6 months.  I have the same interest rate on my Capital One Visa, and I definitely didn't get a promotional rate in the first 6 months with them!  I love the deferred interest promotions for people who want to stretch out their purchases for a bit longer.  I have had this card for years, and absolutely love it!

name: David Marcillo
review: This Tire Kingdom Store Card is not too exciting, not too flashy, and honestly, likely not too useful for many people. However, for those for whom it is useful, it can be quite a boon to your finances. Anyone who has suddenly needed new tires can attest to the fact that it gets expensive, fast. If you happen to be a family with several cars, tires and tire related maintenance can take up a huge chunk of your budget. If that happens to be the case, applying for this card is certainly a great idea. Qualifying purchases can have no interest for six months, giving you the convenience of paying off the purchase without the hassle of that purchase becoming more expensive each month due to interest.

name: David Marcillo
review: If you're a frequent traveler, boy is this Expedia Credit Card the card for you! Plenty of point-earning opportunities for spending money on Expedia. You'll need Good to Excellent credit to be able to apply for the card, but once you've been granted the privilege, odds are you'll be thrilled. If you spend $1500 within the first four months of opening the account, you'll receive 10,000 bonus points. What an excellent deal! This is besides the points you'll earn at a rate of 2/$1 if spent on Expedia. My recommendation, if you are able to get this card would be to use it for all vacation and other travel expenses and quickly rack up those points to make your next vacation as close to free as possible. It's always more fun when it's free!

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: While in college, I really needed a new laptop.  I couldn't afford to pay cash for one (I was working 40 hours a week, but already paid my other bills).  I decided to see if I could qualify for a Best Buy card, and I was!  The interest rate was a bit steep for me (22%), but I was able to finance the laptop under the 6 months deferred interest promotion.  I ended up paying it off a little bit early with no problems!  The statements were easy to read, and I had no issues with the card.  10/10 would use again!

name: David Marcillo
review: The Citi Secured Master Card Credit Card could be the perfect card for one person and an exceptionally useless card for someone else. This card is meant for those who are trying to build their credit from nothing or for those who are trying to fix their credit and bring it back from the dumps. The card has an annual fee, which I despise, but otherwise the fees and rates are comparable to other credit cards. The huge difference, of course, is the fact that your credit limit on the card is equal to the amount of money deposited in a CD related to the card. This variable limit could be a negative to some, but I feel like it can help someone feel like they're building their credit as they go along. Again, if building credit is what you're looking for, this might be your card. Otherwise, you'd be better served looking elsewhere.

name: Michael Egan
review: I generally use the Home Depot card for larger purchases at the Home Depot so that I can take advantage of the zero interest rate for 6, 12 or 18 months, depending on the purchase size.  I think that this has worked out as a good deal.  For regular purchases, or if you don't pay the card off by the offer expiration date, the APR is quite high.  So, if you are planning some larger home improvements, or an appliance purchase and want to spread the payments out over time with no interest, it is a good deal.

name: jono
review: The 0% APR for the first 18 months and long-term interest rates are attractive compared to most other offers and the concierge service is a plus. However, the Citi Diamond Preferred lacks the lucrative rewards programs that most of today's cards boast. This card is especially attractive to recent graduates needing a credit line without the interest rates until steady pay comes in, though consumers looking for a card to use everyday to rack up points may want to look elsewhere.

name: Brown Nick
review: When I was in College I decided that I would need DSLR camera to complete my courses. Best Buy was one of the stores that I went to when checking for good deals on cameras. I found a camera there called the Sony A300. This camera was very nice, but the price was a bit steep for a college student. In order to spread out the cost over a longer period of time I decided to use their offer of a best buy credit card. It claimed that there would be no interest for the first 6 months at the time. This claim was false. I was charged interest for that entire 6 month period which increased the cost of my camera significantly. I ended up opting to pay the entire leftover cost left on the card and I will never use Best Buy credit again.

name: jason buonomo
review: The Sunoco Card is an average card as long as you happen to live near a Sunoco station.  The ThankYouPoints system for purchasing fuel is above average and pretty generous as long as you can purchase your gas from Sunoco.  If you purchase your gas anywhere else though, the benefits of carrying this card just aren’t there.   An above average interest rate along with a 5% balance transfer fee just don’t make this card a stand out.  Doesn’t surprise me this card is no longer offered.

name: Kyle Mcdonald
review: This card is simply awesome! The customer service is great, and the reward points that you get with the Citi Forward card are really good too. You can get 5 points per dollar if you buy things at places like restaurants and bookstores (even Amazon!), and for other transactions you get 1 point per dollar. The good thing is that you can redeem these points to pay for travel, entertainment, or even exchange the points for cash.  I have used other cards like Capital One and they don't offer a rewards program this good.

name: Jessica
review: The Sears card looks great, as long as you pay within the 0% APR period. Otherwise, the APR is really high! I think the best utilization for this card would be for major purchases, as long as it can be paid off within the 12 month period. Even my Macys card had a lower interest rate, and I felt that was way too high at 24%! The Sears card appears to be over 25% after any promotional periods, and I feel that is just too high. It traps people that may get themselves in a bind, feeling they can meet the 0% interest terms, and not get it paid off. This may be the consumers fault, but I feel companies should be held somewhat accountable to their customers as well.

name: Andrew Lopez
review: I used to be a hardcore Circuit City fan, but since the demise of their store I seem to be buying more at Best Buy.  So getting the Best Buy Credit Card card made quite rational sense initially.  This card has offered me introductory %0 APR but afterwards they increased the APR to %13 percent due to high number of credit card debt on my credit history.  It is still a decent number but this card does not get that much use anymore, instead I use my Blue American Express which offers far better rewards and APR.

name: Andrew Lopez
review: Home Depot Store Card is another card in my wallet that does not get too frequent uses nowadays, but back when I applied for it we were renovation our home and used this on a weekly basis.  I did have decent credit on those days but did not get offered a high spending limit initially.  Overtime I was able to raise my limit but my APR stayed quite high.  Nowadays this cards gets barely any use, but I still recommend it to people who shop at Home Depot frequently.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Shell Credit Card is an extremely wonderful card to have. There are at least five Shell gas stations near me and it is extremely convenient. This is one of the few gas stations that offer rewards that really make a difference off of what you pay. In comparison to the BP Credit Card, the Shell Credit Card offers better rewards for what you pay. Practically everywhere you go there will be a Shell gas station. I refuse to get gas from anywhere else because of how great the benefits are.

name: john soto
review: I have been using Citibank Savings Account for long time. I started with a free checking and saving account. No monthly or yearly fees. The customer service is always great. Whenever i have a problem they fix it in a heartbeat. Setting up an online account is very easy and quick. checking information using your smart phone is very fast even with a slow connection. You can check your account balance or even transfer money. ATM are widely available throughout the city. Using a 3rd party ATM can be a little pricey sometimes. All in all I'm very happy with Citibank Savings Account and recommend anyone giving them a chance.

name: Luan Roberts
review: I have had this card for several years and it is a good straightforward card with a simple rewards system. I use it for all of my purchases and it has never caused me any problems or had any issues.

name: eric
review: I got this credit card as my very first credit card during my last year of undergrad, mainly as a way to build a bit of credit before graduating. There's no annual fee, and the 7-month 0% APR period was perfect for my purposes. I used it several times per week, just as a way of building some credit, but even after the period ended, I found that it was worth using when I needed it, as long as I paid the bill promptly. I am looking forward to getting an even better card that I can qualify for with the good credit I built using this card.

name: Katie Christianson
review: The CITI Thank You Preferred credit card has one of the most amazing sign up bonuses I have found.  Regardless if you use it for gift cards or travel it is a great deal.  If you redeem the points for statement credit the amount gets cut in half – want a way around this? Search the rewards center for mortgage credit – they will cut a check to your bank and mail it to you.  All you need to do is go to the bank and cash it.

name: Jon Philips
review: The Office Depot Store Card is one of the best cards around. With a 6 month intro apr period with a great percentage, you simply can't beat a deal like this! This card is great for using instead of using your credit card, because at the same time you can potentially earn points and cash back to use at the store when you have enough points! I'm going to tell all my family and friends about it so they can get in on it too!

name: Ashley Fraiser
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred Card doesn't seem to have a high interest rate or an annual fee which is a good thing. If I were looking for another credit card I'd go with this card simply because there is no interest rate for the first 18 months.

name: Chris Christensen
review: The Citi forward card is fantastic.  You really can't be the rewards you receive with this card. The 0% on intro APR for balance transfers is great for moving any revolving debt away from any high interest cards that I had.  The rewards were similar to the CapitalOne Venture card except for the fact that this one gave me a bonus points which I was able to redeem for a gift card when I spent $650 in the first 3 months.  I would recommend this card to anyone who is looking for rewards credit card.

name: Ashley Fraiser
review: Although this card is discontinued, the Sunoco credit card would've been a good credit card for someone who drives a lot and always needs to fill up on gas. I would've loved this card since we have quite a bit of Sunoco gas stations in my area so I would've gotten a great deal of rewards just from filling up on gas.

name: Jason Budley
review: The Home Depot Store Card made sense for me, as a regular shopper at the local store around the corner. I had originally signed up for the card to take advantage of a deferred interest deal on a rather expensive home investment, but it turned out to be a solid all-around card as well. The interest rate varies with your credit, but with great support and a reliable card, it is a great choice if you frequent the Home Depot store.

name: Jason Budley
review: The Shell Credit Card makes it clear this company knows how to do rewards that work for ordinary people. The best part is the reward for buying gas at a Shell station (as far as I know, Shell has stations practically everywhere). You need to spend a bit first to qualify for it, but with a decent interest rate and minimal fees this is a card that will quickly become a favorite for regular use.

name: Danni Ro
review: I was holiday shopping at best buy when the cashier offers me the credit card application in exchange for twenty dollars of my purchase. I was approved instantly. The Apr is very high (21%), but they have a promotion which when you spend certain amounts you do not accrue interest for a few months. The only thing I have negative to say is while the cashier told me I would receive my credit card in the mail within ten to fourteen business days,it took an entire month to actually reach me.

name: Susan Clark
review: If you like Home Depot or have a large home improvement or appliance purchase coming up, the Home Depot Store Card may be the right pick for you.  Overall there is nothing "special" about the Home Depot Store Card, but it can be helpful tool in larger purchases or tracking spending.The card has no annual or monthly fee, so if you do not use it, there are no additional costs.  The late payment fee is somewhat standard at $35 and the average interest rates ranging from 17.99% to 26.99% are typical of most retailer cards.  If you're planning on keeping a balance on the card and paying interest, you may be better off looking elsewhere.The real winner for the Home Depot Store Card are their introductory offers.  The card offers a few different options depending on what is being purchased and as long as you can pay off the balance before the introductory period ends you can make improvements or buy appliances without paying any interest at all!

name: Cody DeLong
review: The Sears Card by Citi is a great deal for people who constantly go to Sears for all of the items they need.  It offers no fees and 0% APR for 12 months on tools, fitness equipment, and jewelry.   However there are no points on this which is a huge downside.  I have a card with Best Buy that offers points on my purchases plus 0% APR offers on electronic purchases all the time.  Because I can get that type of deal elsewhere it makes me not want to shop at Sears.  However if you're looking for a card just to use at the store and pay off monthly then it's a good card.

name: Tyler Regan
review: The company I've worked for for around 7 years has been using the Home Depot Business Store Card almost exclusively. The business is a small residential home building construction company and with all the changes that homeowners make without much warning, it is necessary to have an option that is convenient and fully stocked. They even have staff workers on hand that can cut lumber and even weld which makes getting back on the job a breeze! I would highly recommend the store, and the store card to anyone in the business of construction, or anyone who likes convenience when renovating someone else's home or your own.

name: sandy kelsh
review: I do not  care for the no rewards with the card.  I think that is essential now a days with all the companies available. I enjoy getting cash back on my purchases. As well as that rate is just ludicrous at 25.24% apr. That is just insane. I would rather save up to buy what i need rather than give you that much extra.The only thing that i do like is the no liability on fraud purchases. As someone who has had to deal with that it will be great if they actually follow through with that. But then again most companies fight to not refund anything. Ultimately i would pass and i recommend others do as well.

name: Cody DeLong
review: I used the Best Buy credit card first when I wanted to buy a TV on black friday a few years ago.  The sign up was super simple and I had no problems getting approved.  I opted to charge it because they were having a great 0% APR deal for over 12 months on the purchase so it was a no brainer.  However this is when we had a huge issue.  For some reason the first month we were charged interest on the purchase.  We called the Credit Card department and were shuffled around for a bit from manager to manager.  After about an hour on the phone we finally got it cleared up and interest charges dropped.  Since then I have had no issues with it or any other 0% deals we've gotten through them.  However that one experience always leaves a bad taste in my mouth.

name: Jon Philips
review: The best buy credit card is really a great find. Depending on if you have good credit or bad credit, you may be eligible for this card. It comes with a 6-48 month intro period which is great because the apr only goes up to 11%. I have been able to get a ton of things I've wanted because of this card so theres no looking back now! Im really happy with the card.

name: Jon Philips
review: The staples credit card is great! Not only do I get a great introductory period of 6 months of 0 % APR, but  there are no cash advance fees as well! I love staples and shop here often for school supplies as well as office supplies, and the staples card has extended my limit in times of need for school! Definitely a great card to get if you can while its out! I think everyone should take advantage of this great card!

name: Crystal Kenzy
review: I have just started using this card within the last few months. And I have got to say that so far I am really liking the rewards program. I stay at a Hilton at least 2 times a month if not more for work so I add up points pretty fast. I have already had 2 of my friends that travel a lot for work sign up and get the card also.

name: Scott Bryant
review: There are certainly pros and cons to the Citi Secured Credit Card.  It does help new users of credit have a safe and easy way of establishing a credit history and borrowing for future major purchases. The APR isn't outstanding and the card is more of a debit card in a way than a pure credit card, but it prevents new borrowers from overspending. Great card for first time borrowers. Bad for established customers

name: Jason Budley
review: The Kingdom Store Card gets overlooked by some because it plays a bit of a niche role. Yes, of course the interest rate is high, so look elsewhere if that is your only goal. However, if you qualify for the $50 Visa Prepaid Card and plan to make use of the Deferred Interest plan, then you can get some great use out of this card at the associated stores.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: I shop and make copies at staples on a weekly basis. The staples store card is a asset to my business. The apr is higher than on some cards i hold but is in line with comparable stores. And is also 0% for the first 6 months. I would recommend this card to everyone

name: Denis Vegas
review: I really enjoying using this credit card because I travel a lot and can earn a bunch of rewards this game. I easily spent the $1,500 within 4 months to get the 10,000 bonus points. These points can be used to redeem many types of rewards including cash.

name: Cameron Underwood
review: I don't quite like the LL Bean Visa card as much as my Discover. While the terms and rewards are mostly the same, this one cuts a bit back in favor of bonuses for purchases with LL Bean, which I do not use. I'd recommend this card if you're an LL Bean customer, otherwise stay away.

name: Mike Billings
review: The Best Buy credit card is a great choice if you frequently are purchasing tech items. They approved me for a generous amount of money and I have used the card for purchasing various items from gaming systems to a new iPad. The card carries a low APR and a generous rewards program that beats many of the other store cards. I have never had any troubles making payments online and their customer service both email and phone seemed to be very helpful and easy to access in the rare cases that I needed to contact them for. Overall I can say I am satisfied with my overall experience using the Best Buy credit card and have recommended my family and friends to apply for this card as well.

name: derrick dawkins
review: The Brooks Brothers credit card looks like a pretty typical store credit card.  The annual percentage rate looks to be similar to other store credit cards, a bit on the higher side of the scale but acceptable.  The rewards program does seem like a nice perk.  You would have to really like Brooks Brothers and purchase a lot of their products to see the benefits of the program, however if you do, it is a good incentive to get the card.  All of the fees associated with the card are just about like any other store card I've had.  The biggest perk of getting the card would have to be the twenty dollar annual birthday reward, which is a great bonus.  It would be nice if the card offered a lower introductory rate.  Several of the store cards I've had over the years offered this, and it's a nice incentive, especially if the initial purchases are larger.  Overall it would be a good card if you do a lot of shopping at Brooks Brothers.

name: Brandon Lion
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is really only beneficial if you are a big shopper at Radio Shack, and are looking to expand your line of credit. You get a 10% discount on your first purchase and then random rewards after that. There isn't much incentive to use it outside of your first purchase, and again, only if you shop at Radio Shack frequently. There is a flat 28.99% interest rate, and they offer no interest if paid-in-full within six months on purchases of $150 or more. To put this into comparison, the Best Buy store card offers the same pay-in-full incentive, but offers a lower interest rate (25.24% - 27.99%) and has a tiered no interest incentive. Not to mention, Best Buy offers one point for every one dollar you spend. This means there is a quantifiable reason to shop in Best Buy versus Radio Shack. Again, I have no doubt that it's a great card for people who frequently shop at Radio Shack, but I can't recommend it to someone who doesn't.

name: Matt
review: The AT&T Credit Card ranks up there with some of the other good reward cards.  The $500 that you have to spend to get your first reward is really quite low, should be easy to hit right now with the holidays right around the corner!  The fact that it also has no annual fee is nice as a lot of reward cards on the market right now are changing those.  I also like how the points earning rates are flat, most cards only give you decent point earnings on certain types of purchases so a flat rate is nice as you know what you are getting without having to guess or make calculations.I also like how they give you discounts on AT&T products for the first year, as well as 0% APR.  Overall a good rewards card for anyone looking to transfer your balance to if you are on a non-rewards card at the moment!

name: Casey Charvat
review: Today i am writing about Citibank Basic Checking to give my opinion of their service and what they offer.They are one of the earlier Checking accounts i had and i could easily say i was satisfied with the service they offered.The monthly fee while low was a bit to take in because the previous account i had before that was free and only charged me overdraft fees.But thankfully the fee is easily waived.Their customer service is up to standards but i have had better service.In conclusion i would give them a four their is no issues and they meet most standards.

name: Gregory Stancil
review: I'm definitely a big fan of Citibank.  I live in New York City and there are plenty of local branches which makes managing my account quite convenient.  I have the Basic Checking and I like it because my account has no monthly fee.  I had to setup direct deposit and bill pay in order to quality for this perk but I would have done that anyways so it's a good fit.  Also, I still use a lot of checks and Citibank offers unlimited check writing, which is very usual for me.  I think their phone customer service is a little slow which is why I gave them 4 stars but since I do most of my banking online, I've stayed with the bank.  I wish I could somehow avoid the overdraft fee but I guess that is normal for most regular checking accounts.  All in all, I'm very satisfied with my experience with Citibank.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: L L Bean has always been associated with authenticity. Myself along with a lot friends have been loyal customers of LL Bean right from college days and its always been a pleasure shopping with them. So when their credit card was up for the taking with an unbelievable zero sign up fee, i made sure that I made the most of it. The interest rates are just around 13% which is really really low. I bought lots of clothes and luggage from LL Bean and earned the rewards and cashback handsomely.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: Simply one of the best cards to have. I bought the Citi Secured two years ago for improving my credit history and after about 2 years now, I have been qualified for the Unsecured Citi card. I deposited about $2000 of my savings and my credit limit rose to that amount. I always look out for protection against theft and fraudulent charges and Citi has never disappointed me with that. The interest rates are about average - at 18% compared to others in the category that range about 25-29% . The only disappointing feature is the extremely low interest rates on my $2000 CD. Otherwise its a fantastic card to have!

name: Angela Pacelli
review: The Expedia Credit Card is attractive for those who have Good and Excellent credit scores. Despite that new members need to spend $1,500 within four months before receiving their 10,000 "Bonus ThankYou Points," I think that those stipulations are fairly reasonable. The points can be submitted for a variety of awards, including cash.  Of course, points are capped at a max value annually--100,000 points to be precise. Though, I'm impressed that cash advances and balance transfers are permitted.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: The Kingdom Store Card is just an OKAY card that doesn't add great value to your existing credit. Its neither a must have card also. Exorbitant interest rates would definitely be a deterrent for first time buyers who are looking out to start building their credit history. However, the interest rates are slashed if payments are made in full within 6 months. That might be possible for most without shelling out excess rates as interest. But if payments aren't made on time, the 29% interest rates would dent anyone's pocket. It would be wise to carefully evaluate the interest rates of the Kingdom store card for various purchases before one contemplates on applying!

name: Mark McKinney
review: I have been loyal to Staples for quite some time as they have always have what I need for my business. The Staples Store Credit Card has helped me to outfit and keep supplied my business. As another review mentioned, the APR for the card is rather high and I too have seen lower APRs at other stores, namely Office depot and Office Max, but the rewards I have received using my card have paid me back tenfold. The deferment on products $299 and up has helped me with initial office machine purchases so I wasn't completely front loaded or having to use one of my other credit cards. As long as buyers are fair paying back on time this is a great card to have to take advantage of any and all office needs.

name: Olga Allen
review: Well I buy a lot of office stuff with the hobbies I have so this card really works out well for me.  I buy all of my supplies as well as my son and daughters as well so it works out really easy.  I like to make sure my grand kids have the right tools for their classes and projects they have to do.  The Rewards work out good for me because I buy so much stuff that it works out well.  The 27.99% is high but I like the rewards I get because I buy so much.  The positive thing is the intro APR is 0% for 6 months which is great.  I would recommend this card to everyone.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: The Citi Dividend card is my first credit card and I have a strong sense of belonging to it! My father always asked me to get Citi credit cards, he had an affinity towards the Citi group for some strange reasons and so he insisted that I apply for the students card from Citi. And when I wanted the student card, I was very specific about Cash back instead of earning the reward points as I would have to redeem it each and every time and they would expire if I don do so on time. The Citi Dividend's cash back along with $0 annual fee made it perfect for me. I could choose my payment due date, which was vital to me as I had no regular income and there was every possibility that I go late on payments. Its a superb card to have!

name: Robert Gibbs
review: My mom was the exact same way as your father in regard to the citi card and recommended this to me as well. I really like the grace period. As a struggling student you need all of the help you can get and I am thankful for that.

name: Derek Langley
review: The positives: No annual fee, $100 in points for spending $500, and 1% point rewards on everything seem to make the AT&T credit card a pretty great deal. I wonder why AT&T will only give the 10% discount for the first year, if it was permanent this card would be a must-have for their customers!The negatives: Considering the good / great credit that you have to have in order to qualify for the AT&T credit card, the APR % is far too high, and the grace limit is not long enough (should be a full 30 days). This is definitely not a card that you'd want to keep a balance on.

name: Krystal Marie
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is really not one of the best compared to similar store cards. The 10% initial bonus upon signing up is pretty consistent across the board with other store cards.  They only offer periodic rewards with this card that are not very consistent. They have a great intro rate for the first 6 to 12 months,  but after that it jumps to almost 29%! That is a terrible interest rate and quite high compared to other store cards. The only thing I like about this card, is you don't need the best credit to qualify and there isn't an annual fee. If you're looking for a store credit card that offers electronics, I think you would be better off going with Best Buy or something similar.

name: JC Manalastas
review: Judging from the terms listed above, the Brooks Brothers card is a pretty decent card to own. I would place in on-par with other competing cards simply because their rewards program is pretty good. I do think their rates are a little higher than normal, but if you pay your card off in full every month, this should not be an issue. If you shop at the Brooks Brothers store, this would be an ideal card to get, but ask yourself this question: "How much will I really spend at Brooks Brothers?" I have used a competing card, the Bank of America Cash Rewards Credit Card. Compared to the Brooks Brothers card, the rates are a little bit lower, though as aforementioned, it shouldn't be an issue unless you pay your balance off slowly. The rewards program for the Bank of America Card is a little different in that you earn varying percentages in cash back depending on what item you are purchasing (gas, groceries etc.) thus it is a little more selective than the Brooks Brothers '1 point per dollar spent wherever MasterCard is accepted'. Overall I would recommend the Brooks Brothers card if you shop at their store frequently (they are an upscale store, so you will rack in the points!).

name: Sara Perry
review: I really like how the Best Buy Credit Card offers bonus points on purchases that you can redeem for gift certificates. I have a store card from Maurice’s, and Old Navy, and neither of those offer this reward system. I also particularly like how there are different financing options for bigger purchases such as T.V.s, laptops, etc.  The introductory interest rate is another bonus for this card. It’s a huge incentive for new customers to sign up for this card. The regular interest rate of 17.99% is the same as Maurice’s and Old Navy’s store card.  This card is a great choice for those who need to have the latest electronic technology.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: For those of us that have shopped for a store credit card before it comes as no surprise that these types of cards typically have very high rates. The Home Depot store card is no exception in this case with variable rates as high as 27%. To be fair they do also have a floor at just under 18% which is better than what most store cards offer. What makes this card stand out to me is the no interest offers on major purchases such as heating, air conditioning, appliances, and siding, etc.  This could save home owners a substantial amount and for some this could provide a better option than going to the bank and asking for a home improvement loan. Outside of these deferred interest offers there is nothing else that really makes this card stand out: no rewards program, no instant rebates, etc. Still, for those who are looking to make some upgrades or repairs to their home could do quite well taking advantage of this card's deferred interest offer and that alone makes it an attractive card.

name: Eric Tee
review: The Sears Credit Card is one that can be missed. The special bonuses that are included seem to be useful only on rare occasions: "No interest on if paid within 12 months for: Fitness Gear over $299, appliances over $499 and Heating/Cooling purchases over $1500". I feel like I could qualify for these once every few years, but a lot of credit cards have extremely useful bonuses like cash back. The rates are so so as well. If the card has worthless bonuses, it better make up for it with better rates, but the Sears Credit Card doesn't do that either.Overall it could be worthwhile if you meet the obscure bonuses, but I wouldn't recommend it otherwise.

name: Scott Bryant
review: The Shell Credit Card offers the ability to get rewards like 10 cents off per gallon if you spend $500 on one billing cycle. This reward seems a little outlandish. Alternatively, I can spend $100 at my local grocery store in a month without a credit card and get the same discount on gas.  With a max earn of 20 cents per gallon and a rather high APR, you're looking at, really, saving $20 per month, and that's only if you put $1000 on the card and use 100 gallons of gas a month. In my personal opinion, this doesn't seem worth it.

name: Rich Marshall
review: I never miss payments, so I can't speak for the late fees or interest rates-- but the rewards on this card are great if you use the card selectively. It's not the main card in my wallet, but I use it any time I'm in a restaurant or bar. As someone in their mid-20s, I eat out a bunch and go to bars which get classified as restaurants-- and those purchases earn a cool 5 points per $1 spent. The points are worth $0.007 when redeemed on Amazon, so you're effectively getting 3.5% cashback on your drinking habits. Perfect for someone who likes to go out a bunch. Just keep another card in your wallet for your every day purchases!

name: Rob Doe
review: Office Depot Business Store Card is a great card for anyone who owns a business that has multiple employees that need to make office supply purchases. I don't own a business but i have worked for a place that used this card and they would let me buy supply's with this and i thought it was amazing. I mean you have a lot of control over employee spending with accurate purchase history for each employee. And for your first purchase you get a 10% discount so be sure to take advantage of that. I remember my employer let me buy a laptop on this card once as a kind of Christmas present and i don't think he would have let me do that if he didn't have this awesome Office Depot card. So business owners, do yourself a favor and get this card.

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Sunoco Credit card has no annual fee and a points reward system.  I much prefer cash back rewards like the Capital One rewards card, but if you use a lot of fuel, the Sunoco Thankyou Points could be just as rewarding.  The interest rate is mediocre compared to other cards in this class, and it has a balance transfer fee of 5% while other cards have no transfer fee.  Personally, I don’t think this card would be great for me because of the rewards and the fact that other cards in the same class are a little more generous.

name: Jason Budley
review: Honestly the main reason I signed up for this card was Christmas shopping a while back, and of course it is that time of year again. When you're spending enough money at the store, the deals Best Buy give you are pretty nice! Overall it is a decent card too, I love the Reward Zone program and figure even if I have nothing special to buy at the store I can always blow them on printer ink or something like that. This is definitely one of the store cards that is worth keeping in your wallet, especially with the introductory deals they use to sweeten the pot.

name: Krystal Marie
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred Card is really a step above the rest.  The first 18 months you get a 0% interest rate and after your first 18 months, your interest rate will only be between 12% and 20%. This interest rate is great compared to other cards!  Their cash advance rate, along with their fees, are about average. The card also offers you access to online discounts, which could be as good as some companies reward programs. They even offer concierge services,  presale tickets, preferred seating, VIP packages, and entertainment experiences. The perks on this card really outweigh a lot of competitors! For someone who goes to sporting events, concerts and other events, this card is really a must have!

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Citi Forward card has a points rewards system which is more confusing than simple cash back.  I prefer cash back cards such as my Bank of America card.  The interest rate is average, but I do love the intro rate of 0% for 12 months.  That would be very beneficial, especially if you have a large purchase you need to make in the near future but don’t want to pay cash.  I would consider getting this card if the rewards system was up to par, but since that’s one of my biggest concerns with credit cards, I’ll have to stick to my cash back cards which work better for me.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: While store cards typically have a higher interest rate than regular credit cards, at 28% the Staples store card has a very high rate.  To back up the point, the OfficeMax card, offers an APR as low as 10% with a ceiling at 24% (depending on credit rating). Staples does offer a fair 5% cash back rewards plan. This could turn into substantial savings for those who must supply an office. Still, the rewards program is not very creative compared to some others out there that offer a variety of perks. They have a deferred interest plan on purchases made before the end of the year, which is a nice little bonus. Overall though, this Staples store card is really nothing extraordinary and would probably appeal mostly to people who run small businesses or run a home office. At that point though a person in that situation may want to consider a business credit card instead because they often offer much more creative rewards plans.

name: Andrew Hays
review: The Kingdom store card does not seem like a very practical card to get because it is only useful if your going to be buying lots of tires. Some things I do like about the card though is there seems to be no sign up charges and there is no interest on purchases over 199 dollars if paid in full in 6 months. Some things I don't like about the card is it offers no rewards so that gives me really no incentive to use this card. Also I don't like how it offers no online support and also has an extremely high interest rate of 28.99%. I think I will just keep using my amazon store card because at least they don't have insane interest rates and offers online support. So if you like high interest rates and no rewards and buy lots of tires then this is the card for you.

name: Gary shaffer
review: This is simply an offer to allow those who have bad credit, an opportunity to have a credit card to make purchases that are best paid by such a card[rather than cash etc.]. There is a negligible amount of interest on your deposit[necessary to obtain the card], and a $29 fee/month for this opportunity.  After 18 months you MAY be able to get an UNsecured credit card. For those that feel they MUST have a credit card and this is the only offer that can get them a card, go for it! Years ago I used Capital One [Silver]and their Master Card with a $50 deposit and NO monthly fee as long as I maintained a $100 balance. I received 6% interest on my deposit/balance. However, after 18 months they did NOT allow an unsecured credit card. My credit score had improved and I dropped Capital One and got an unsecured Visa Credit Card from my Bank[Wells Fargo at the time].Shop around-their must be a better offer for bad credit people wanting a reasonable way to obtain an actual CREDIT card.

name: Reggie Strange
review: The L.L. Bean card looks very appealing. I am enticed by its 23 day grace period and free returns and monogramming at L.L. Bean stores. However, I feel like I am not a frequent enough visitor of the store in order to merit the potential 19.99% interest rate and whopping 25.24% interest rate on cash advances. These two factors, to me, as someone kind of new to managing my finances, seem kind of alarming and off-putting. If you're a frequent shopper at L.L. Bean, with an established timeline of effective money management, I feel like this may be a credit card for you. For me, however, it has little practical appeal.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: You really can't go wrong with this card if you are a person that travels frequently. The "thank you" (reward) points you accumulate using this card are redeemable for a number of different things (gift cards, merchandise, travel, etc).  You can accumulate them through regular purchases and not just through credit card purchases from Expedia  (albeit at a lesser accumulation rate) so you have the opportunity to build up those points and earn some decent rewards with this card. Those with better credit can enjoy decent rates with this card as well. Considering it also has a number of other features, such as auto rental insurance, travel assistance services, and a personal concierge service, this is certainly a card that people that travel should consider.

name: Omar Alzayani
review: I don't usually apply for store credit cards but I have never regretted doing so with Best Buy.  I got approved for a fair amount and I use it quite a bit.  I'll sometimes use it to buy games, movies or accessories for my computers and game consoles, but I really appreciate it for the big purchases I have made.  Most recently I picked up a new Asus laptop with a touch screen and Windows 8.  I love it and the best part is it came with 6 months no interest thanks to my Best Buy card.  I would recommend anyone who does a lot of shopping at Best Buy apply for this card, it really is awesome.

name: Olga Allen
review: I have been with Citibank for about a year now and I am totally satisfied with everything overall.  I have always been treated great when I come into the bank to make a deposit or withdrawal.  One time I was trying to deposit $500 into the atm and everything got stuck and I had to leave the atm without the process finishing all the way.  The machine was just froze.  When I got home I called Citibank and explained my whole ordeal to them and they immediately credited my account until they found the problem which was a faulty atm machine.  Every time I have dealt with anyone from Citibank they always seem to help me out in one way or another.  I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Stela Gemes
review: The rate on the Home Depot Store Card is about average compared to that of other store cards. It’s easy to qualify for and quick to sign up at the register. However there are no other real benefits to this card, especially if you are a regular shopper. For example many store cards offer a discount on your purchase when you first sign up, and then a regular store discount on all purchases after that. With no such perks with this card, it’s really only good for large purchases that you made need to pay for over time, with 6-24 months deferred interest on purchases of at least $299.

name: Scott Bogle
review: The Sears Store Card is a MasterCard offered from Citi. They offer an introductory 0% interest rate for the first few months, which can be great if you're considering a big purchase or two in the next year from Sears, like home appliances or fitness equipment. You basically have a year to pay it off with no interest. However, like most store cards, after that initial year, it rate goes to 25.24%, so you'll want to keep an eye on your balance to avoid high interest racking up. But if you're planning on shopping at Sears (or their affiliates like KMart), it would be a good option for you.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: My wife and I have a Best Buy card and we like it very much. We frequently use it when we go shopping for phone and phone accessories, computers/monitors, and video games. The interest rates are very acceptable for a card like this at about 18%. For people that are frequent buyers of electronics and similar items sold at Best Buy, this is a great card for buying big ticket items with because they give you deals on financing with orders that are a high amount. There is also a very nice intro rate that was helpful for us when we needed a new computer in an emergency situation. The online bill pay service has been a breeze to use and very convenient as well. Considering the fair interest rate, the rewards program, and the financing offers they provide for larger purchases, the Best Buy credit card is one I am very happy to have.

name: Nick Davis
review: I have used this card since Staples for almost 4 years now. It is a great card to have. It was very easy to get approved online. I filled out the card application online, was approved, and they mailed the card to me within a week. I use the card often for work and house supplies. Setting up an online account is very easy and quick. Customer support is handy 24/7. No annual fees and decent APR makes this card a must have for anyone who needs a lot of office supplies. Staples awards it's also a nice plus for frequent buyers. I highly recommend this card.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: The reward on this card is 10 cents per gallon after you spend $500 in one billing cycle on qualified purchases. I personally can't imagine myself placing $500 on a credit card (for qualified purchases) in a month in order to save 10 cents on a gallon of gas when I only fill up 2 times a month and have a small gas tank in which I rarely buy more than 10 gallons. This would amount to about $2 dollars saved over the course of a month for me and hardly worth it. The interest rate is also extremely high at nearly 24%. We have a gas card from another company that has lower rates. I am not very impressed with this card. I recommend shopping around if you are considering a card such as this.

name: Wendy La Puma
review: Applying for the card was easy, I got quick approval, and 15% off my purchase.  I also was a member of their rewards program so I began accumulating points for discounts on future purchases.  The only information they needed to apply for the card was my social security number.   The card came in handy not only for retail shopping but also for auto repairs at selected stores.  Sears also has a strong internet presence, making the card a convenient way of paying for purchases.  The card can also be used at K-mart which is closer for me because I live over 50 miles away from the nearest Sears.

name: Jester O Court
review: Offered through Visa , the Citi  Forward Card looks very similar to the Citiv Preferred Card on the surface. One immediate difference is the rewards program, which albeit is standard in relation to most top rated reward programs – 1-point for each $1 spent, with a max limit of 5-points. The card offers one full year at a 0% introductory rate on all purchases, including balance transfers, which is 6 months less than the sister Preferred card. But one facet of the Forward Card is the availability to those applicants who have a credit score that falls only under the good criteria. Most rewards cards with appealing introductory interest offers, plus balance transfer options, only extend credit to those reaching the excellent tier. The Citi  Forward Card will allow those who have only attained a good ranking assistance in climbing the ladder to achieve the elusive excellent status category. There is no annual fee, plus some other appealing extras like a $100 store gift cards when 10,000 bonus points are attained. There are ThankYou  Points generated at $650 worth of purchases if the cardholder elects to go paperless with their monthly statements. Considering a good credit history is sufficient to attain the Citi  Forward Card, plus the enticing interest charges and rewards program, the card presents itself as an excellent source of credit.

name: Jester O Court
review: One might initially shy away from the Citi Diamond Preferred Card because it does not have a listed rewards program, but a shrewd financial planner will be able to use the other outstanding features of this card to potentially earn or gain more than any rewards card could offer. As budget appealing as just about any of the top rated credit cards available on the market. The card first of all offers a year and a half time frame of free interest on all purchases including balance transfers. Although the standard 3% fee is attached to transfers, allowing 18 months to erase these balances is truly enticing. After the introductory period the interest rate will establish at a rate between 11.99% and 21.99% depending on the cardholders established history to date, ranking it in the top tier for interest rates available. The Citi Diamond Preferred Card also offers a concierge service to assist in booking travel arrangements, so as a travel related credit option it stands above most. With an outstanding introductory interest free period, followed by an excellent interest rate, in spite of not having a rewards program, the Citi Diamond Preferred Card is an outstanding credit card choice from a long-term financial standpoint.

name: Allen Marshall
review: I used to have the Sunoco card and did appreciate the gas rewards I receive for spending on it but it is an average card that requires you to have excellent credit. Before deciding to go with this, make sure to research what other cards are out there because there are many that give better perks and will help you save more money. Also this card’s greatest rewards points have to be earned from purchases at Sunoco gas stations, other gas cards will give you the freedom to choose where to fill up so you don’t have to feel obligated to go to Sunoco even if it’s a little more expensive. There is nothing that stands out about this card and as soon as I realized this I stopped using it and upgraded.

name: eva mckinnon
review: The Brooks Brothers card is a pretty cool card too have if you are a fan of their stores. I can use it in their stores and wherever MasterCard is accepted.I like that you can earn points for every dollar you spend online or at Brooks Brothers locations.The late fee is a bit steep,although they do give you a 23 day grace period too make your payments. Customer service is always very helpful if I ever have any questions or concerns about the card. I never have too sit on the phone for hours to get someone on the line unlike my other credit card I have.Overall this card is a pretty good card too use for my shopping needs.

name: David Marcillo
review: Everyone has a cell phone and (almost) everyone has to pay a cell phone bill every month. Annoying, but it has become a part of modern life. The AT&T Credit Card can help ease that burden a bit, if you happen to be an AT&T customer. All AT&T products, and more importantly services, are discounted by 10% for the first year when paid for with the card. After the first year, the promotion drops to 5%, but that is still a solid savings amount when you remember that it's something you'll save each month on your bill and every time you need a phone or accessory. This can also be used for non-mobile phone products and services like home phone, cable TV, and internet. Aside from the discounts, however, there isn't much to this card. Reward structure is a basic $1 for 1 point, and rates are not eye opening one way or the other. A fairly small percentage of card users will benefit from this card, but those that do will likely enjoy it very much and swear by it. Does AT&T get a lot of your money? Then you may want to consider using this card to do it. Otherwise, you're likely better off looking for something that better fits your needs.

name: Michael Staino
review: The overall features of this card are decent.  Nice introductory bonus with the 10% off.  15% off batteries is an interesting, but still nice bonus.  However, with such a limited product selection, their rewards are definitely lacking.  I could find the majority of the items I would be looking for at Radio Shack elsewhere.  I could check out Target, and get 5% off every purchase I make there with their credit card.  Much better than what Radio Shack is offering.  If you do shop at Radio Shack often, taking advantage of their financing options make a lot of sense.  However, if you're just looking to make a few purchases here or there, look elsewhere.

name: Kay Bola
review: The Shell Credit Card offers cash back on products you would purchase in your everyday life like groceries, dry cleaning, cell phone and of course, gas. What I really like about this card is that it’s a MasterCard, which means it is accept at most retailers. There is no annual fee, which is a big plus, other cards have an annual fee ranging from $20-$100. One drawback I see with this card is the high interest rate. At 23.99% APR, customers will not have a hard time finding a card with a much lower rate. The card offers 10 cents credit per gallon if you spend more than $500 on qualifying purchases. 10 cents per gallon is a pretty good deal and every little bit saved helps. This card is decent as long as you spend at least $500 a month AND pay off your balance in full.

name: Krystal Marie
review: The Home Depot Store Card is a good one to apply for, especially if you're doing home repairs, a contractor or just purchasing a new home.  You don't need the best credit to qualify,  like a lot of store cards require.  They don't offer a rewards program, but I think their intro rate makes up for it.  They offer a 0% interest rate for the first 6 months and up to 24 months. After that,  their regular rate starting around 18% is very low compared to other store cards, unfortunately,  your interest rate could be as high as 27%.  They also offer online services, including account management, online only statements, account activity, and faster payments, which most store credit cards are lacking. I think if you would use this card regularly, it would be a decent one to have in your wallet.

name: Krystal Marie
review: I really like the Best Buy Credit Card! There is no annual fee for this card, which is akin to other store cards on average. If you have decent credit, not just excellent, you could qualify for this card. It seems like most store cards require perfect credit. They have a great rewards system, with no limit on how much you can earn. You end up averaging about 5% back with their rewards. If you're a frequent best buy shopper, the savings will add up very quickly. They also offer a great intro interest rate. After your intro period is over their interest rate, at 18%, is considerably lower than most store cards! Max late is $35, which is pretty average for a store card. If you purchase from Best Buy often, I would say this card is a must have!

name: Angela Pacelli
review: I initially applied for the Sears Mastercard due to the in-store offer which enticed me to accept it. (I think it was either $15.00 or $25.00 at the time of my purchase.) While the above information lists that balance transfers are not allowed, customers are occasionally mailed "checks" (usually three at a time) which essentially allow them to perform credit transfers. While some might be quick to point out that this card has no rewards program, in my opinion the atrociously high interest rates are the worst feature. As another reviewer points out, the rates can be well over 25%!

name: Krystal Marie
review: I'm not the biggest fan of the Sears Credit Card.  They do not offer any rewards and you need excellent credit to get the Sears Credit Card.  They do offer an intro rate for the first year if you meet their requirements on purchases. Their interest rate after the first year, at 25%, is on the high end, in comparison to other store cards.  Their cash advance fee is at 5%, which is around average, but nothing to brag about. They don't disclose a max late fee, which leads me to be quite nervous about this card. They say they offer monthly sales events and special financing offers every day, but with this company, I would be very hesitant on how great these specials really are.  I would only recommend this card to someone who can't afford to pay for an expensive appliance that is a necessity.

name: Shawn Pennick
review: The Brooks Brothers Card is very limiting. It  is their store-only version credit card. It can only be used for purchases at their store or orders through their website and catalog. Being a long-time customer of Brooks Brothers it alone would have worked  for me. However, with only one  Brooks Brothers credit card application, and because I had qualifying credit, I was given the MasterCard instead of the store-only version.  I can use it in their stores and wherever MasterCard is accepted. Neither has annual fees. With the card I get 4 points per dollar spent at Brooks Brothers (both cards give this),1 point per dollar at all other places MasterCard is accepted, and $20 Brooks Brothers reward certificates are given for every 2,000 points.  You have to read the fine print though because reward certificates cannot be used on catalog or internet orders. Certificates will expire after only 6 months from date of issue.  That is a bit limiting. But overall, the Brooks Brothers credit card isn’t bad.

name: Rbl SmartAzz
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is a nice card to own.  It offers a card with no annual fee, and 6 months no interest if paid in full with $150 minimum or 12 months no interest if paid in full $300 minimum purchase.  There are not a lot of bells and whistles but this could be a great way to finance a large ticket electronic item.  Radio Shack Store Card also offers 15% off on store batteries.  This can equal out to a great deal. If you have smaller children think Christmas and birthdays. This card also has a 25 day grace period which is great.

name: Remloc Ecnal
review: A few years ago I applied for and got the Best Buy credit card. I used it to purchase some items for my new home, such as a fridge and a dishwasher. The reason I used this card, as opposed to other cards is the low introductory interest rate. Most big box store card have interest rates in the 20%-26% range, which is outrageous. The Best Buy card started at 11.9%. This interest rate was good for the first 48 months. I was able to pay off the fridge and dishwasher before the 48-month period and saved a lot in necessary interest fees. I was and am happy with this card.

name: Jon Philips
review: I like the AT&T card because there is no annual fee. Sometimes you dont know how much you have in your bank account and then the bank slaps you with their ridiculous 100$ annual fee and not only does it make you overdraft, but you have to pay a ridiculous 40$ overdraft fee as well. So now you're down 140$ For this reason alone I think this is one of the better cards out there and I recommend it to everyone that I know and love, and tell them with this card they will not be disappointed ever again!

name: Angie aluminua
review: I have been extremely happy with my Citibank savings Plus Account. I have some of my monthly check deposited into this account and let it sit there until I need it for an emergency or major purchase. My deposits always go through in a timely manner and I have never had any negative encounter with my account at all. I am very please with Citibank and would easily recommend others to open accounts here if they were looking for a new bank. I will definitely continue to use my account and possibly open a new account in the future based on my very positive banking experience.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: My brother has the Citi Forward Credit Card and swears by it, he got it while in college. There is no annual fee, no sign up fee, no monthly fee, and a low APR of around 13%. My brother also uses his rewards all the time, and when getting 5 points per dollar at restaurants and movies, he earns them quickly. There is also 0% APR the first 12 months, how can you go wrong with that. If you pay on time and under the limit, you also get other rewards and bonuses. Lots of incentives for college students. If people are looking for other cards and do a lot of online shopping, the Amazon Credit Card has a lot of decent reward opportunities and also no annual fees. Otherwise,

name: David Seibert
review: My Best Buy store card is my most frequently used store card that I currently have. I used my Best Buy store care to purchase my 60" LED smart television, and the payment options really helped me put a good mark on my credit report! I was able to pay the full balance with zero interest within a 60 day time frame, and Best Buy reported my good account standing to all three credit reporting agencies rapidly. I highly recommend this store card.

name: Leslie
review: The best buy store card is really awesome. I use it to not only help my credit, but as a sort of layaway as well. See all you have to do is make sure that you pay within the time frame they allot for your purchase, and you won’t have to pay interest at all on that purchase. This is pretty cool if you need help with your credit score because it shows that you are making timely payments. As far as your layaway, you don’t get your item until you have fully paid for it. Well doing it this way means you get to bring your item home and make your payments later.

name: Braden Blaettler
review: First thing I always notice about credit cards, the annual fee. With the Citi Diamond Preferred card, there is no annual fee. Perfect! Also, the interest rate can be pretty good, with the lowest end being in the 12% range. That is good compared to some of the other cards, which normally have around 18%. This card does not have any rewards, which is why I took one star away from it. I do like how it gives your priority access to presale tickets to a number of different events. Very cool! I would say if you have the opportunity to get this card, I would not pass up on it.

name: Emma Frost
review: The Best Buy store card is a good choice if you are into technology. I got this card to finance a TV purchase. The interest rate is similar to other store cards. I was excited about the Reward Zone points. I used my card often over a period of fifteen months, but never received any of the bonuses that I was promised. Out of frustration, I paid the card off and closed it because I wasn't getting the rewards I thought I would. THREE YEARS after I closed the card, I got a Best Buy gift card for $75. Overall, I would recommend this card but advise that you pay close attention to the reward points you accumulate.

name: Braden Blaettler
review: It is a shame that this card is not available any more, as it would be the perfect card for someone trying to build credit. There was no annual fee and the interest rate was actually pretty mild at about 17%. I had cards that were well into the 20%'s, so this one is a bit better. The point system is pretty good as well, although I would have appreciated a cash back option better as opposed to "ThankYou Points". But rewards are rewards and we are lucky that we have any! Anyway, the Sunoco credit card was a pretty good low-end credit card, suited for those people who are just trying to get their credit going.

name: Connie Seale
review: The Citi Secured MasterCard Credit Card would be especially helpful for young people needing to build a credit history, or people who have a bad credit history and need to help their credit score. It's a good bonus to be earning interest in the money in the CD. I've not ever used a card like this, but would recommend it to someone starting out. The fees seem low compared to others that people with bad/no credit can get, but I am personally accustomed to no fees at all, so I guess it's middle-of-the-road.  I've had friends that got their first cards when I did and weren't responsible with them like I was and now are in a pile of debt. This type of card would have been good to have been around several years ago.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: If you love shopping at LL Bean like I do, then the L.L. Bean Credit Card is amazing. The no signup fee or annual fees is only the start. Everytime you shop with L.L. Bean you earn 3% bonuses that can be used in store or online. And if you are an avid shopper of L.L. Bean, then every dollar you spend not at store, you still get bonus rewards. There is a low interest rate compared to other store cards like the Express store card which is 25%, whereas LL Bean is  only 14%-20%. Besides this, there are no other perks or benefits of rewards like Kohl Cards, but if you need to build credit  (with decent credit already), or a credit card, and shop at LL Bean a lot, then you don't want to miss out on this card.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: The Tire Kingdom Store card is a card that most people can do without. This card is really only useful to those who often buy tires, and let's be honest, who buys multiple sets of tires each year? This card offers little incentive to use it's card in the first place. Yes, there are no annual fees, no interest for 12 months, and no sign up fee. But, this card has NO rewards! To take advantage of the no interest for 12 months, you must spend $700 dollars. If that were the case, I'd rather use my airline mileage card and get 700 mileage points. The $50 voucher they offer is not worth it to me, just to open up another store credit card. If you find yourself making multiple stops getting oil changes or tire changes, and don't necessarily have a great credit score, this card is probably more likely for you than it is for me.

name: Sandra Dragon
review: I applied for the Sears card when I found an air mattress there that was on sale.  When I went to the store to buy it, the clerk offered to open a Sears credit card for me and give me an immediate $15 credit on the air mattress.  I only had to give them my social security number and date of birth to qualify.  Within a week I had my new card.  I went back to Sears and bought two pairs of shoes (also on sale).  When I got the bill, I noticed that I had earned some points for discounts on future purchases.  With Christmas coming, I am sure I will be using those points.

name: Katie Christianson
review: I would recommend the Staples Store Card to any business owner that can pay off the balance every month. The 5% cash back is great as well as the $0 annual fee. Plus there is no limit on the rewards that you can earn and the rewards never expire.  But there are some downsides about this credit card to be aware of.  First, the annual percentage rate is astronomical at almost 30%! Second, there is no incentive to get you to sign up. Maybe 20% off your first purchase with the card would be appropriate like other store credit cards do. Overall, unless you are a Staples power shopper, I would not get this card.

name: John Morena
review: I thought that this was going to be a good credit card to be able to purchase items for my family in other states and ship to them.  Every thing was good until I was late with a pay with a payment and the late fee is not bad at only $35.00.  After paying off my balance on my account, I realized that the APR was 29.99% and had a hard time trying to get Expedia to cancel my account.  They would call all hours of the day and offer me other credit cards from there company to stay with them.  I finally got them to stop calling and have never used them since.

name: John Myer
review: I have only had a Citi checking account for about 3 months, but it has been a great 3 months.  I received 40,000 thank you points for signing up for a new account and doing direct deposit and bill pay a couple times.  I have had Citi credit cards for a couple years and they have never done me wrong.  Customer service is always available for you, you can email or chat with them or call them up.  They have always treated me really well.  I think its been a total pleasure to bank with them and I will continue to do so.

name: Scott Molly
review: The best buy Store card was a good choice when I wanted a new tv a few years ago. I got approved for 1000 dollars in credit and then I bought a brand new sony tv that I still have. I love it and then I got a bunch of rewards points also . I currently paid off the tv so now Im going to go buy something new.

name: Ric Rogers
review: The Radio Shack Store Card is a standard store-based credit card that doesn’t offer much in terms of benefits to the user.  Whereas other store cards give a multitude of rewards, this one is really only good if you purchase a lot of batteries from Radio Shack since it will give you a 15% discount.  The 10% off first purchase is nice, but hardly an incentive to continue usage.  Looking at the standard rate at 28.99%, it is certainly higher than most cards, as well as the 29.95% cash advance rate that will be a burden for most to deal with.  It’s nice that there’s no annual fee, but overall the high rates and minimal rewards don’t make this card very appealing.

name: Chris Bova
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card is a pretty good option if you like shopping at Brooks Brothers or need a professional wardrobe. The 4% cash back at Brooks Brothers is very nice, and you also get 1% back at other stores, which is just a bonus. The maximum you'll get back from a branded card is probably 5%, so this card is definitely one of the better ones. You also get some little extras like $20 on your birthday and 15% off your first purchase.  It would be nice the card had an introductory period with no interest so you could finance a big purchase without getting slammed by interest payments, like some retailers like Best Buy allow.
