So, while the card is not perfect, it's definitely one of the better branded credit cards because of the rewards.

name: Andrew H
review: I think the Best Buy card is pretty great for someone like myself that doesn't use that much credit. I buy electronics quite frequently and the free $5 gift cards I get from time to time are nice. Best Buy is the biggest electronics store in my town so I am pleased that their card works out quite well in my circumstance. It's nice to know that the rates that I get are decent for someone with my income and when I cant afford to buy something outright, I know that I will at least be able to pay things off in a timely manner without garnering too much interest with this card.

name: Jon Fuller
review: This is an interesting choice for a gas credit card. The bonus cash back option is somewhat rewarding, but the interest rate is very high on this card. If you plan to pay off your charges in full every month this might be the card for you, but otherwise I wouldn't bother. Unless you drive a lot, perhaps as part of your job, the 10 cents back on gallons of gas won't really be noticeable either. Overall, though, this is a solid card in comparison to some of the other gas station cards available on the market. Just don't let your payment go late!

name: Quinn Carter
review: For someone who doesn't really love electronics or video games, I feel like the Best Buy card would not be the best option for me. They do offer rewards at 1 point for every dollar spent, but the rewards are higher when you use the card at Best Buy, which wouldn't help me at all. Other store cards don't offer any rewards points for using the card outside of their shop, so I guess it has that going for it. I also am not digging the fact that there is not a 0% intro interest rate fee, but rather 11% for a few months. I think I'd be better off with a different card.

name: Quinn Carter
review: I am not sure, after looking into it, that I really like the sears credit card. It seems to be one of the less rewarding and less flexible cards on the market. There are no cash back bonuses, no initial bonuses, not to mention the absolutely high interest rate of 25%. I have seen store cards that offer many different perks, whether it be for using at their own store or using it elsewhere, and the sears credit card is not one of those cards! I think, with hardly anything to offer, one might benefit from choosing a different card that offers better incentives for usage.

name: Dan Diciaula
review: If you do a lot of home improvement or contractual work, the Home Depot Store Card might be the card for you.  It's only good in their store, but it offers attractive finance rates as low as 17.99%.  That is much better than the comparable Lowe's APR of 24.99%.  There are no frills with this card and unless you do heavy shopping at Home Depot then this card probably isn't for you.  It has the same no annual fee as the Lowe's card and an extra two days grace period.  It really is a card for someone who needs some credit to get projects done.  Their customer service is pretty good and they do have no interest if paid in full within 6 months.  The card does what it advertises to do.  It gives you credit at Home Depot along with good customer service and online access to your statements and bill pay.  It doesn't offer any frills other than being useful at Home Depot.  If you do plenty of shopping at Home Depot, then it never hurts to have their card as the APR is decent and their customer service is great.

name: Michael Rooney
review: The Citi Forward credit card has some very attractive features but also falls short of perfect in many ways. I personally like the 0% APR for the first 12 months. An offer that caught my eye was the 10,000 initial bonus points that will help you to begin accruing reward points quickly. However, you need to charge $650 dollars on the card, sign up for paperless statements, and redeem your 10,000 initial rewards points within the first three months in order to get your $100 gift card. You can also gain anywhere from 1 to 5 points per dollar charged to this card, but you only get 5 points per dollar when you purchase books, music, or movies. Another down side is that the cash advance rate on this card is a reasonably high rate at 25.24%. Although, my Capital One Quicksilver Cash Rewards Credit Card is only slightly lower at 24.9%. I have not had a positive experience with Capital One customer support in the past and I think that switching to this card will make my life simpler when dealing with Citi Bank's fantastic customer support.

name: Dan Diciaula
review: It would be hard to find a much better card for people who use their cars often than the Sunoco Credit Card.  With no annual fee you really have nothing to lose.  The 16.99% Rate is pretty decent as well.  Lots of other cards like the Capital One Ventures Card offer rates from 13-20%, but we all know most of the time you are getting closer to the 20%.  There's not millions of things and rewards to do with this card but you have to buy gas so you might as well collect your rewards.  There are lots of cards with better perks, but the one thing you have to do as a traveler is fill up your tank.  Why not take advantage of it with the Sunoco Credit Card.  Every gallon of gas gets you 3 thank you points as well as after the third fill up of the month you get 10 per gallon.  Other cards have more rewards, but if you fill up enough and use Sunoco you can get some use out of this card.

name: Sean Pedigo
review: I was sad to see this card discontinued. My girlfriend moved on to this card after she had her Matrix card. Great for the first year or so and then the interest rates went up. That's okay there's always something better in the future and without this card and the Matrix card we wouldn't have the outstanding credit that we have today. I'm really thankful that banks offer cards like this for people like me who are struggling to get new our credit score up. The customer service, as usual, has always been great with city bank and they've always answered my inquired promptly.

name: Sean Pedigo
review: The Citi DIamond preferred card which was offered through my bank wasn't bad. Although my fiance was the one who primarily used it she was able to build her credit with this card. I would call this a "beginner's card" and I wouldn't recommend you use it forever because of the steep interest rate. It was very comparable to the Matrix Card that I was using at the time. Thanks to Citi Bank we're on our way to both building our credits with this card so we can eventually buy a house.

name: Peter Walters
review: If you shop (or would like to shop) at Brooks Brothers, the Brooks Brothers Credit Card is worth investigating.  Those bonuses are sweet!  15% off your first Brooks Brothers purchase, a $20 annual birthday reward and a $20 rewards card when you make your first purchase outside of Brooks Brothers with your card are very tempting reasons to get this card.  The only thing not to like is high late fee and the short grace period (many grace periods I see are 25 days, but I believe only 21 days are required by law).  Hey, I need a couple of new suits anyway. My advice: get the card.

name: Krystal Marie
review: The AT&T Credit Card is decent, but average credit card. They do have a great rewards system in place! They put a limit on their rewards, but it does seem quite high, so I would definitely be willing to get this card. Their interest rates are pretty average compared to other cards, but I would like to see an intro rate offered on purchases. Their cash advance interest rate is fairly higher than other credit cards. Their max late fee and their grace period is pretty average, nothing to really brag about. I do like that they offer travel accident insurance and travel emergency assistance. This card is really not one I would consider getting, there is far better ones that can offer you much more for your money.

name: Dan Abrams
review: This was the first line of credit I ever received. I got it during college to purchase a sony PS3 which was slightly out of my price range at the time. I was approved with a decent credit limit and 0% financing which was pretty nice. Over the years Ive continued to use it for the 0% financing and havent really had any problems. Their online bill pay isnt great and their customer service isnt the best but any issues Ive had always seemed to get resolved somehow. If you are in the market for new appliances and want 0% this is a pretty decent card and I would recommend it.

name: Jason Leepid
review: I got a Radio Shack Store Card a few years ago to finance a big purchase and am still using it today. It's a great card to finance through with a fair no interest program as long as you pay it off in year. With a minimum purchase of 300 hundred dollars that's really simple. It has a high interest rate like every other store card. My Home Depo card is actually a little higher and you need to spend a lot more to qualify. The card is also really handy for Christmas. If you have kids you know you need to buy a million batteries and they give you 15 percent off on all batteries in store which is an awesome deal.

name: Steven Gimenez
review: I never had much money to invest in a savings account until one event happened, I came across a large sum of money from a lotto win. So when I first was in the market to deposit my recent lottery winnings into a savings account I first looked at Citibank and I haven't looked back since then! Citibank offers a fantastic interest rate for a shy deposit amount of what competitors offer. There sign up process was also a breeze, I signed up online and talked over the phone with a rep to get my account activated. For a person who is new in the market for a savings account, Citibank was one of the best choices I could have possibly made!

name: Mike
review: I’ve had a Citibank savings account since college.  I am really surprised at how easy it is to make deposits even though there isn’t a branch very close to me.  I haven’t seen any many other banks that allow remote deposits with a cell phone which is incredibly convenient.  Who likes standing in lines at the bank just to make a deposit?  I’ve never had to contact Citibank because of any problems, which is a good sign, but I also can’t comment much on their customer service.   Opening an account was slightly more difficult than some other banks and credit unions that I’ve used, but it was manageable and definitely worth it for the benefits.

name: Jacoby Greene
review: Like most store cards, the Tire Kingdom Store card is a no frills card that best for those just starting out with building credit; there are definitely much better options available for those who are more established. The Tire Kingdom Store card has a criminally high interest rate of 28.99 making this card look a lot like the ones from the First Premier Bank lineup. The card does offer a 12 month no interest period for the first year, which makes the idea of such a high interest rate more bearable. One of the best things about this card is that unlike a lot of other credit issuers, you're not charged an over the limit fee if you happen to spend a bit more than you have available. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this card for anyone who has any type of established credit.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: This a pretty good basic credit card, though you do have to have pretty good credit to qualify.  The nice thing is you will earn back $100 if you spend at least $500 in your first three months as a cardholder, which isn't difficult to accomplish.  The interest can be a little high if you don't pay off your balance every month, but it isn't unreasonable compared to other cards.  I really like the cash back feature, which works on any purchase, though there are always certain categories that will earn you extra.  Anyway, I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a basic, no frills card.

name: Jane NIPPER
review: I have The Citi Diamond Preferred Card.It does have Concierge service which Is its only perk.  It is what I call my emergency card.  It is the card I keep in my wallet for that unplanned purchase I need to make.  You never know what will come up with kids (especially boys).  I chose this card over another when opening it because of the lower rate I was offered. I was offered the lowest 12% rate, however I read the fine print and the rates can be quite high if your credit is a bit blemished or you want a cash advance.   But why not just charge the stuff you need to the card.  Plus the cash advance rate is less than a payday loan so that's a plus either way you look at it.  I have never needed to dispute an issue or anything like that but dealing with them initially was not a hassle nor what I felt to be a pushy process.  They also don't up my line of credit or change anything without asking me first.

name: Julianne Cordova
review: I have had a citi card since 2003. It started out as my emergency card. The next thing I knew I was always having emergencies. I have transferred my balances away and back over the years. I currently have it locked in a safe because I realized that on my everyday purchases with a balance my interest rate was pretty high.  But I have also loved my rewards from my card such as paying on student loans, blender, vacuum cleaner and other fun things that I typically didn't "need" but were always great quality perks. I think that if you just want rewards and can budget your money so you don't carry a balance it can be a great card if you aren't looking for cash back or mileage. All in all it is a good card. I will keep locked up for a rainy day. They do come out with balance transfer offers with 0% with minimal transfer fees. It is not my top choice in cards but its a good one to have on hand.

name: Kathleen Morris
review: I signed up for a staples card when I started my teaching job over ten years ago. I cannot count the ways in how handy this Staples card has been for me.I use this card a lot at the beginning of each school year to get the supplies I need for the year. I also use this card when I buy my daughters school supplies and to buy supplies and make copies for my small catering business as well.The absolute best feature about this card is the 5% back rewards on purchases. This bonus makes me feel like I truly am getting a deal whenever I use this card, which is a lot.I use this card both online and in the store and have never had any problem with it. I also get coupons throughout the year for being a card holder. My only issue with the card itself is that I have a high interest rate. I find for a store card, the interest rate is a little higher than others. Their late fee is also a little higher than others. Overall, this is a good card to have if you have a business or are in the education field. Staples offers such a variety of services that having a store card would be useful.

name: Krystal Marie
review: Credit cards like the Citi Secured Credit Card are necessary for building your credit back up. This is one of the better secured credit cards I have seen compared to others that are similar. A minimum deposit of $200 isn't too bad considering you're trying to build up your credit. I've seen much higher amounts on other cards like this. Annual fee is well below average and there isn't a monthly fee! Most secure credit cards charge a high monthly fee.  Also, you can earn interest on the money you've deposited on the card.  What I really like about this card, is after 18 months you can become eligible to receive an unsecured Citi Card. Their interest rate and penalties is quite low, compared to others, which is another perk of this card. They even cover you with identity theft solutions and car rental damage coverage.

name: Gregory Stancil
review: The L.L.Bean Credit Card is a good idea if you're doing online shopping for yourself or buying gifts for others.  I like the fact that the card offers 3% rewards on L.L.Bean purchases which you can use to buy a variety of clothes, footwear, outdoor gear, and luggage, just to name a few.  One thing that I don't like about the card is that it doesn't offer an Intro bonus; for instance, the Sony Card from Capital One allows its cardholders to earn 5,000 bonus points within the first 90 days.  Yet this card makes up for the Intro omission by offering 1% rewards on all purchases as well as free returns in case you do not like something you purchased at L.L.Bean.  All in all, I'd say this is a cool option for L.L.Bean customers as well as anyone else who does a lot of online shopping.

name: Krystal Marie
review: I really do like the Staples Store Card because of their great reward system! It comes in especially handy for small business owners who frequently need office supplies. The Staples rewards is well above average compared to other store credit cards. The biggest turnoff about this card is their 28% interest rate. Their interest rate is definitely on the high end when you compare to other store cards. I think it would be great if they offered some type of intro rate for the first 12 months, sadly, they don't give this option.  They do have great online services. Also, compared to other store cards, their customer service is always top notch! Their grace period and late fees are pretty average compared to other store cards.  Would only recommend this card to small business owners who could benefit greatly from the rewards.

name: Ventsislav Dimov
review: The Sunoco is a frills-free credit card. While it does not feature a zero or low introductory annual percentage rate, it does feature no annual fee and offers a rewards program enticing to those near Sunoco fueling stations. In an environment where most credit cards offer more broad-reaching rewards programs and lower interest rates, the Sunoco card may be a tough sell for those consumers shopping around for the right card for them. Personally, my American Express Gold card offers the rewards I am looking for coupled with an interest rate that makes sense for me. It does not, however, come with the zero annual fee that the Sunoco boasts. I would consider this card if I were near Sunoco stations and needed a card with these types of rewards.

name: Justin Scott
review: The Citi Forward Card offers decent terms, but you are likely to find other cards that will maximize your rewards points. There are some nice qualities though, such as no annual fee and 0% APR for the first 12 months. My gripe is with the rewards system. Unless you buy a lot of books, movies, or music, you might not rack up points that easily. 5 points for every dollar spent at restaurants is nice, but as a college graduate I still don't have a lot of money to throw around at restaurants. And then it's just one point for dollars spent on everything else. Personally, I believe my Amazon Rewards credit card has a more fruitful points system, especially for those who do a lot of Amazon shopping (triple points for Amazon purchases, and double points for restaurants and gas stations). Plus with the Amazon card, you can spend your points directly at checkout, as opposed to just getting $100 gift cards with the Citi card for every 10,000 points. Not a bad card overall though.

name: Richard Thompson
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred card is a solid but unremarkable credit card. At its lowest interest rate of 12% it's a good value, but that interest rate can scale up as high as 22% depending on credit rating. The introductory rate of 0% for 18 months and the lack of an annual fee make it a good, but not outstanding card. With no rewards program to really make it stand out and incentivize use , the only perks really seem to be the concierge service offered with the card and the opportunity to access pre-sales at certain events, which are not enough to make it stand out from the crowd.

name: David
review: I was offered the Citi ThankYou Preferred card in the mail and decided to apply for it when I saw the 15 months of 0 APR.  I was looking to spread some of my balances around and this worked great.  I got a ton of points out of it that I redeemed for gift cards, so it was a great bonus.  I have had no issues with this card and the APR I was offered was lower than some of the other cards I had.  It is a solid card with solid offers and I've definitely been pleased with this.

name: Krystal Marie
review: When I had my Shell Credit Card I had several complaints. The interest rate has always been extremely high and it's still close to 24%, which is a bit of a drawback. Although, it's still comparable to other gas credit cards. The cash advance fee is terrible and their reward points are abysmal. I would really only recommend this card to a company that has daily drivers that rack up a lot of miles. Their max late fee is average and so is their grace period but there isn't anything positive about the Shell Credit Card that stands out. The only thing I like about this card is their online services, but by 2013 I think every credit card company should be offering that to stay competitive.

name: derrick dawkins
review: The Citi Dividend credit card was one of the very first credit cards I ever had.  It has proved to be a very useful card.  I've always had very good experiences anytime I call customer support.  Being that it is part of the Citi brand, I don't think there has been any store that hasn't accept the card.  I've found my annual percentage rate to be acceptable, and is on par with other typical cards as long as you don't make any late payments.  I would tell people who are just starting to build credit to give this card a try.  The fact that it doesn't have an annual fee is a great perk for those in the early stages of building credit.  Overall a good option if you are in the market for a credit card.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: The Sears credit card is a mediocre credit card at best. There are no incentives for getting the card, and there is a high interest rate, over 25 percent! The best part about this card is you can use it for financing for a lot of stuff at Sears and some other stores. This is very useful if you are buying big ticket items such as a washer, dryer, TV, or some tools. There are also some special sales every month for card owners. Otherwise, this card isn't really worth owning. As I said before, the APR is very high compared to other credit cards, even store credit cards. Also, there are no rewards points or even any incentive for getting the card like many other store cards have, such as a discount or dollars off first purchases. All in all, you would be much better off with a rewards card with a 0% introductory APR instead of a card like this.

name: Richard Thompson
review: With a lower APR rate than most store cards and reward points being able to be accrued even when used outside Best Buy, the Best Buy credit card is a good value for a store card. The 2.5 points for every dollar spent at Best Buy makes it a valuable card to have if you plan to do any large purchase, or shop there frequently. The APR rate of 17.99% is low in comparison to other store cards which often have rates up to 28%. However, there's no indication whether the reward certificate you get at 250 points is a coupon only usable at Best Buy or whether it can be applied toward your bill.

name: Chris Bova
review: The Home Depot Store card is a niche card that won't be attractive or even useful to a lot of people. However, if you are planning a huge home improvement project and would like to finance the costs over a few months, then this card would be pretty valuable. The card's only feature is an interest-free introductory period for the first 6 months. While that is nice, other store cards like Best Buy's also have   some sort of rewards or cash back program to go along with the introductory period. The APR is pretty standard, ranging from around 18 to 27%. In short, it's a decent card if you shop at Home Depot and want to finance a big project. Everyone else should look elsewhere for a card with more benefits.

name: Johan Graham
review: CitiBank gave me an excellent checking account and with ease of deposit and payments, remotely transfer funds to my checking account with just a click away which is a major fact for me who is always on the go. and they always try to get what i need, customer service is very interesting they always give me new opportunity and update me with what i need meaning what payments should i do and when is my target date, i use this checking account for almost two years now and i have been very happy with the way things are going. they really are a wonderful bank to deal with. easy and convenient. always treat their clients as clients not just another policy for them. and that's a plus for any clients to be treated equally and fairly.

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: The Expedia credit card provides its customers with an excellent rewards program, giving 1 point per each $1 spent, and 2 points for eligible Expedia $1 purchases. The bonus for signing up and spending $1500 is a good deal as well. You get  $10,000 bonus points and a $50 statement credit after hitting the minimum requirement in the first four months.  Points can be used to “purchase” gift cards or towards travel perks. The bonus point to dollars spent ratio is much better on this card than the Disney Visa rewards card I have. The balance transfer fee is also relatively low, making this a good option if you only want to carry one credit card.

name: Richard Thompson
review: The Staples Store card offers a decent, but uninspired, rewards system of a straight 5% rebate on any item purchased at Staples. This is a higher rate than most cards offer, however it is through the Staples Rewards program which you might be able to sign up for without the credit card. The lack of an annual fee is good, but you'll need that money to afford the extremely high APR with no introductory rate to cushion the blow. Perhaps decent for people that spend extremely large amounts at Staples and can pay the bill in full to avoid the finance charges, I can't see recommending this card to anyone else who doesn't desperately need to build their credit.

name: Steven Arnold
review: As someone with little credit, the Citi Secured MasterCard is extremely helpful. It is a great way to build yourself up again and get back on your feet, or even establish some credit. Other cards aren't always understanding of people with bad or no credit and will charge you outrageous fees and interest rates. I would definitely recommend to teenagers and people with bad credit.

name: Richard Thompson
review: My initial impression of the L.L. Bean credit card was that is a good value. The interest rates are fairly low for a store card, there's no annual fee, and the 1% rewards on general purchases and 3% on purchases made at L.L Bean are on par with some of the better store reward cards, such as Amazon. However, where most other cards that generate points allow those points to be applied toward your balance or toward purchases at a variety of different places, the points rewarded by this card only apply towards coupons for L.L. Bean. It seems like a really good card if you shop frequently in their store, as points would accrue quickly and rewards could be easily spent.

name: Richard Thompson
review: At a glance, the Tire Kingdom store card doesn't seem like an incredibly good value. The interest rate is outrageously high, with minimum purchase levels required for the interest to be forgiven even if the card is paid off. It also promotes $0 liability on unauthorized purchases as though this wasn't a standard, base level of expectation from a credit card. There's no rewards offered beyond Visa prepaid cards for certain purchases made at their store. In the event of an emergency where you needed new tires quickly and could afford to pay them off before getting charged the interest, then perhaps this card would be useful, but I can't see using it for anything else.

name: Faryal
review: I signed up for my savings account right when I turned eighteen. Every month since then, I've added $100 and it's been amazing watching my account grow! The interest rate isn't that great when you're starting off, but if you just keep adding money in there, the interest will pay off! This account is also good because they don't have a lock on it so you can access your money whenever you want. I would recommend setting one up for your children so that by the time they're eighteen, they will already have a lot of money in there.

name: Angel Colon
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card has some good qualities but also its share of bad qualities.  The initial bonus of $35 is nice and combined with the $20 for an initial purchase outside of Brooks Brothers and we have a pretty competitive initial offer.  The cash advance fee of 3% is actually very low, I’d enjoy this card if I needed some fast cash.  I know with the Chase Freedom card I used to have, the rate was not close to that low.  The bad…  I was initially enthusiastic about the 4 to $1 point ratio but then realized it was only on Brooks Brother purchases.  It’s 1 to $1 otherwise and not very enticing.  The interest rate at its lowest, 14.24%, is pretty high, not something I would want.  The most important feature of a credit card in my eyes is the interest rate and its value for points to spending ratio and this doesn't meet my satisfaction for either.  Overall, just an average card, nothing spectacular.

name: Kareem Abdushakur
review: This is the best card I've reviewed by far. It starts off good and only gets better and better. There's no annual fee, you get an  introductory  ten percent discount just for being accepted. The only thing you have to worry about is the ridiculously high interest rate. The way you can negate that however is by paying it off in 6 months after the purchase or sooner.  I like the fact they give you a 25 day grace period. The only other thing I dislike about the card is that it can only be used in radio shack stores.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: The AT&T credit card can be a little difficult to be approved for if you don't have really good credit, but it has a few unique rewards that are rather nice.  You can earn up to 50,000 rewards points every year that can be redeemed for $100 gift cards.  Even better, you can save up to 10% on AT&T products/services in your first year as a cardholder, then 5% thereafter (up to $350).  The interest rate isn't bad either.  Overall, I'd recommend this card if you're an AT&T customer.  If not, it's still not a bad card but you might find better elsewhere.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: I was originally declined when I first applied for this card, but after having the store card for a while, I applied again at the urging of one of the store employees.  Also, the $15 off my purchase was very tempting.  I was approved!  The interest rate is higher than many other cards, but it's still a nice card to have, especially if you plan to pay off your balance every month.  It has all the advantages of the store card, which I really like, but the freedom to use anywhere, which I love.  I also appreciate the fact that there's no annual fee.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: I applied for the Sears store card after being declined for their Mastercard and the store clerk told me the store card might be easier to qualify for.  I was pessimistic at that point, but was happily approved.  I was given a $10 gift card for applying and received an additional 5% off my purchase for using the card.  It's since saved me quite a bit of money because Sears frequently gives you an additional percentage off when you pay with your Sears card.  Also, having the card allows you special deals when financing larger purchases which I've found useful when having to replace a few major appliances.  The interest is higher than I'd like, but I almost always pay my balance off every month so it hasn't really been an issue.  I'd recommend the store card.  It will expire after a year if you don't use it too, and then you can take advantage of the sign up promotion all over again!

name: Jeff
review: I purchased an older home recently, and decided to apply for a Home Depot Card.  The application was painless, and the approval was quick.  It was a real life saver to help me keep up with expenses as I remodeled the home.  The interest rate was not bad, and so far the little interaction I have had to have with customer service has been above average.  With the 6 months interest free feature, I have plenty of time to make sure everything gets paid off, but still track it all differently from my other expenses that I have using my regular debit card.  It also makes it nice if you lose a receipt….they can easily look your purchase up for a return if you pay with this card!

name: Angel Debrodt
review: I used the Best Buy reward card for about a year, it was alright, the interest rates were pretty high. I never actually used any of my rewards or anything, and then I lost my job, and it all went downhill from there, and Then all sorts of fees were tacked on. So now i choose to use no credit cards. But like I said the interest rates, and payments were pretty high, and I had a very low credit limit. All in all if you really want or need a credit card, and cant get another, this one may be for you, but I chose to do away with it.

name: Joseph Darpli
review: I became a customer of Citibank after I took a teller job at a branch for this bank. I have seen both sides of the equation, both customer and employee, and I have been and continue to be very impressed with the level of service that is delivered and demanded by all bank employees. I have numerous accounts and credit cards and have received nothing but the best in my interactions with those who work in these banks. One thing that really sets Citibank apart is their rewards program. If you really devote yourself to the "Thank You" program you can receive quite a lot in rewards for your banking with them. I Myself have received over $800 in gift cards in 9 months with them as my primary bank by doing things like direct deposit, actually using and paying off credit cards, and taking advantage of quarterly promotions. It is well worth your time to check them out! Happy Banking!

name: Dolores Severance
review: I like the Best Buy store credit card. There is no annual fee and they run 0% financing on certain purchases. You earn reward points too but I don't think you get them when you choose the special financing terms. I have only had the card for a couple of months so I am not that familiar with it yet. I think the interest rate is rather high as most store credit cards are but I do like the special financing offers. Also, by having this card you get notices of special sales. I think it will also come in handy if you wanted to order something online and pick it up in the store. I will only use this card if I can get no interest financing. The only con that I see right now is high interest rate. Everything else is great

name: Allen Marshall
review: Unless you are a Sears addict then I would suggest shopping elsewhere for a better credit card. It does not offer much in rewards that you cannot get with a regular sears rewards program. It only accepts perfect credit so obviously with credit like that you can be picky about the cars you get so why not be. The JcPenney card offers more I think and would be the better option. Better yet, skip store cards and get a great card that can be used generally. I had the sears card for years, had a $10,000 limit and always paid off my balance in full but decided to cancel and use a card that gave straight cash back instead of sears gift certificates that forced me to buy something from there. It is not a horrible card and lets you build good credit but there are a lot of better options.

name: Allen Marshall
review: The Home depot credit card is great to have if you are moving into a new home or remodeling. I liked the six months without interest because it let me budget my new kitchen over six months instead of paying it all at once. The interest can be brutal if not paid completely by six months so make sure you pay attention to that. I prefer shopping at Home Depot so I prefer their card but I have looked at Lowe’s card offers and was disappointed that the Home Depot Card did not offer more in terms of rewards. On bug purchases like home improvement projects five percent rewards can make a difference. It is a good card but unless you are loyal to home depot I would suggest shopping around other home improvement stores for the best card option.

name: Maggie Caraveo
review: After looking at the facts about the best buy credit card, I believe that this is only an alright card. The point system is pretty decent. I have seen cards offer more and some offer less but if you are buying electronics then this is a great way to accumulate points. You get 2.5 points for every $1 spent at best buy which will grow quickly if you make large purchases at BestBuy. The regular rate is kind of high but the intro rate of 11.9% is pretty good. I like the incentives to keep purchasing such as a $5 dollar reward certificate for every 250 points. Overall this card is going to be great for those big purchases at Best Buy but probably shouldn’t be used anywhere else.

name: Ava Doll
review: The Shell Credit Card would be decent if I purchased gasoline from Shell often.  However, I don't have a car, so I only buy gas if I'm renting a car.  I tend to rent cars only about once or twice a year, therefore the $0.20 back per gallon of gas would not add up to much for me.  The interest rate of 23.99% seems to be standard these days, unfortunately.  However, since the Shell Credit Card requires good to excellent credit- perhaps it would be easy to negotiate a lower rate after making payments on time for a while. I don't like that applicants cannot get an approval decision online.  I prefer to apply online for credit cards because of the swiftness of the process.  My Visa card allowed me to apply online, and even though I don't get cash back on gas, I do enjoy the benefits of no annual fee and no restrictions on where I may use the card.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: One among the best cards to have when you are not sure when you will be able to pay back the bills and yet maintain a decent credit rating. There is no reward points no cash back to augment the features of the card, but however, the card isn't designed for that and Citi has a lot of other cards which offer that. But however, its simply the best card to pay your bills and repay back as and when you get the money. You are not time bound. Now, isn't that great yet simple? Thats exactly what the Citi Simplicity is!

name: Carla Massa
review: I really enjoy that I am able to obtain bonus points for purchases made at Staples, but seeing as they are one of the biggest office supply stores I guess I expected more from them. Don't get me wrong the card comes in handy when I need something for school and I don't have the cash, and at Christmas time when I need to buy electronic presents!

name: Carla Massa
review: Because of bad credit I am unable to obtain an unsecured credit card, with the Citi bank secured card I am able to once again be able to use a credit card ! By depositing the $200 on the card along with the $29 fee I was good to go! Citi bank has allowed me to begin to rebuild my credit back once again, and having the emergency card around is always helpful when I need some gas or my morning coffee!

name: Laura
review: The L.L. Bean credit card is great if you are a regular shopper of theirs! They offer rewards at a rate of 3% on all in-store purchases, as well as a 1% reward rate on any regular purchases. The card is part of Visa's network, so you're sure to be able to use it wherever you need to. Cash advance rates and fees are fairly high, but this seems to be standard practice for most store credit cards. Just stay away from using the card for this purpose. If you shop L.L. Bean much at all, this card is smart to get - there's no cons as long as you're careful.

name: Amy Maney
review: This Tire Kingdom Store Card seems like an okay store credit card.If you needed a set of tires in an emergency situation and you were short on cash i guess this card would be great.Unlike with my Pep Boys Credit Card though you have an extremely high interest rate and have to make a minimum 199 dollar purchase before they will forgive interest charges with this card.This card may be okay but you can surely find a better credit card in this category.The card bonus they give may make this card well worth giving a shot and seeing how good it may be if you are interested.

name: Amber Jones
review: The Expedia credit card is great to have when traveling is regular.  It allows travelers to accumulate a lot of points that they can redeem for almost anything.  What’s also wonderful is the 10,000 points bonus after spending $1500 in the first four months of account opening.  There are also two points earned for every dollar spent on eligible Expedia purchases and one point earned for every dollar spent on non-Expedia purchases.  There is also a $50 statement credit and a no over the limit fee..  These are all wonderful benefits of owning an Expedia credit card.  The unfortunate thing, however, is that there is a 100,000 point limit per calendar year.  The Capital One Rewards Credit card, unlike the Expedia credit card, has no limit on rewards that can be earned.  There is an over-the-limit fee.  The Expedia credit card is a beneficial credit card to have access to.

name: Drew Barkoff
review: The Citi Forward Credit Card is a very good card to have.  There are no annual fees, there is a long grace period should you forget to make a payment,  Also, for the first year there is no interest on purchases which can be very useful if you plan of making a big purchase yet don't have the money to pay for it by the end of the month.  The initial 10,000 points can be redeemed for a 100$ gift card as well which is a great incentive to start with this card.  The requirements to redeem the 100$ gift card are easy to meet because all you need to do is sign up for paperless statements, and spend 650$ in three months which is not very challenging at all.  All in all, I recommend getting this card.

name: Chris No
review: I think the Sunoco Credit Card is an alright card for excellent credit users, you would think for people that value their credit this card would have a little more bells and whistles. For instance this has no introduction rate like some cards have such as 0 percent interest for the first 12 months that you own the card, that is a good perk to offer your clients. A good thing about this card is there is no annual fee, because who wants to pay to use a credit card. There is a grace period on late fees which is 25 days which is nice for the user because face it sometimes we forget. This cards probably best feature is the rewards it offers to it's users it has many different ones such as, Earn 10 ThankYou Points per gallon of fuel purchased at Sunoco on your third and subsequent purchases in a billing period then you can combine all your thank you points to get your rewards. Overall I think the Sunoco Credit Card is a 3 star card I've seen other gas cards that offer many more perks for it's users, such as Master card where you get 5 cents per gallon as a bonus.

name: Jason Leepid
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred credit card is an excellent card. It's a straight forward card with some simple benefits added in. Unlike a lot of cards the Citi card doesn't have a million little ways to earn extra pennies and then gouge you with high interest rates. It's just a credit card with a low interest rate of 12 percent and some convenient services. It does have the standard high interest rate of 25 percent for cash advance but that's the only bad thing about it. It's nearly identical to my Bank of America Premium card except the Citi card offers a few services to its members. The concierge service is great and easy to use and their presale tickets have something for everyone. Altogether I've been very happy with this card and it's been more useful than your average credit card.

name: Sarah
review: Overall I wouldn't necessarily say that the Sears Credit card is amazing. It doesn't offer any kind of rewards incentives for making purchases, which in this day and age, you expect a credit card to do. But if you shop at Sears frequently or are planning on buying bigger ticket items like tools or appliances, the card can be very useful. We've used it a few times when we were doing our Christmas shopping and it's been a real help. I appreciate the fact that your credit doesn't have to be perfect to get the card- decent credit is enough. Overall it's an acceptable card that's good for one or two things, but in general is kind of meh.

name: Rafael Maldonado
review: This card is a no-brainer if you are a shopper at Brooks Brothers. You can get up to 4 points per dollar when you shop online or at their stores.  The rewards on it are enough for anyone to get this card. The rates for balance transfer and purchases are fair. Cash Advance and Balance transfer are a bit high, but that’s expected from any card. The Brooks Brothers Credit Card has treated me well as someone who shops there at least once a month. I would recommend it for anyone who wants that classy and professional look. Great credit card.

name: Alexis Beth
review: I love my Citi Diamond Preferred Card. Personally, I am a die hard Citi fan and my loyalty to them runs deep so it would only be natural to gravitate toward this card. I was approved several years ago and have used this card for all sorts of purchases--travel, food, gas, shopping. There is no annual fee which was appealing to me, and not to be petty but the card looks pretty neat being black! They also have a 24/7 concierge service which really comes in handy. Their 18 month intro rate of 0% APR is what makes it stand apart from other cards, like the Capital One Venture Rewards Card. Highly recommended!

name: Carla Massa
review: I really like the idea of earning bonus points on this card, you can use them and potentially purchase your new AT&T phone along with a new tablet or ipad. Even if you are not looking to upgrade your phone, you can still utilize bonus points for other areas of interest! The apr is not as bad as I thought it would be either, and earning one point for every dollar spent is awesome too!

name: Lily Yee
review: After I turned 18 I got this card. I felt like it was a good way to build credit. After all everyone knows how important having good credit is. There is not much to lose since there is no annual fee. I like student cards since a lot of banks offer unsecured cards that require a deposit. This card does not need that. I feel that the introduction period was a little short. A lot of cards give free interest rates for as short as year to 18 months. Being that this is  a student card, the rates are a little higher. Just be careful and pay your bills and you will be fine. Compare to most student cards this one is better since the cash back benefit. Most student cards do not have that.

name: Krystal Marie
review: The L.L. Bean Credit Card is a Visa which is a trusted financial institution and it's accepted everywhere! Unlike Amex cards that are often declined at several merchants due to higher rates. They don't offer an intro rate which would lead me to stay away from this card. Their interest rates seem very high, but in comparison to most other retailer credit cards. Their cash advance fee is high, I would never consider using it for those purposes. I couldn't imagine having a credit card with a 27% max penalty APR. They have a decent reward rate, better than a lot of retailer cards, but also not the best I've seen either. I think their 1% reward for other purchases is a great addition.  Free returns and free monogramming is a big plus for this card! I think that would provide a lot of value to a large amount of customers.

name: Matt Menhennett
review: I love my citi card. The company is awesome and has an incredible website. It make all the transactions super easy and pain free. I also really like all the notification options they have to make sure I know exactly what is going on. The one time my bank messed up and did not credit the account. They were very understanding and credited the late fee back to me. I also like the paperless options, it is very annoying when I am constantly getting two or three things in the mail each week. I will highly recommend this simplicity card to anyone and will be glad to get my next card from Citi and look forward to continuing to do business with them in the future.

name: Alexis Beth
review: The Citi Secured Mastercard was my second credit card when I was a teenager and I highly recommend it (although I think it may be discontinued now) to people who want to build their credit. Perfect for high schoolers/college students. This card is somewhat similar to the Open Sky Visa Card in that your credit limit is whatever is deposited. After 18 months of using this card, you may be eligible for an unsecured Platinum Select Card! No monthly fee, no fee to open it; only an annual fee of $29 which I personally view as worth it. This card is a lifesaver and I highly recommend it!

name: Nichole Estep
review: I love this card more than any card ive ever used. I used to sign up for a different card every month but since I signed up for this card I've loved it so much I haven't signed up for any other. I love earning points. I shop online a lot so I can go back and watch my points add up then buy even more afterwards, If you're a student I highly recommend this card for sure!

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: Compared to other store cards I have, the Staples store card is about average. It’s great for small business owners or anyone who purchases office supplies with some regularity, because of the automatic enrollment in the Staples Rewards program, with which you get 5% back. It could also be a good card for a student looking to build their credit buying things they would need anyway, since it is available to anyone with Fair credit or higher.  The APR is pretty high so I would never carry a balance on this card. The late fee is also comparable to other store cards I have had, such as Kohls or Macys cards.

name: Alexis Beth
review: The Citibank Expedia MasterCard is a great tool for those of us who travel often. If you book a lot of trips, hotels and the like through Expedia.com, this will pay off! Because the card is through Citi, you automatically earn Thank You Points too which is awesome because those points can be redeemed for rewards (gift cards, household items, etc.). This card has the potential to save quite a bit of money for the frequent traveler, and I love that you can earn $50 statement credit following the first eligible purchase greater than $50 on Expedia two months of opening the card. Overall, great deals for the traveler always on the go!

name: Jason Leepid
review: The Tire Kingdom store card is a decent card if you need four new tires but not great if you only need one. The interest rate of 28 percent is in the high range for a store card but it's not too bad. I had a Discount Tire card a while ago with 25 percent interest and the economy wasn't what it is today. The Tire Kingdom card also comes with a 50 gift card that you can turn right around and spend on your payments. The no interest deal of 800 dollars is also pretty good. At first I didn't think I would qualify but you get to include labor charges if you don't want to pay for it right then and there. All and all this is a decent card if you make sure to pay it off and really helpful if you can't afford tires all at once.

name: Tawny Garrett
review: The Citi Forward card’s terms and conditions seems pretty standard. The interest rates during the initial period are great. Zero percent for the first year is really good. They allow balance transfers also for a good low rate. The interest rate after the initial first year is pretty standard as well. On the low end, 12.99% is quite low for a basic credit card. This card seems like a good pick as long as you take advantage of the rewards that come with it. The no annual fee is a great service. Overall, this card looks like a good one. The only down side is this website says the card may be discontinued or no longer available. That has me worried.

name: Jester O Court
review: With the reduction in the number of Sunoco service stations around the region of the United States in which I reside, the card itself has become essentially worthless except for trips where I travel by automobile. That drawback back plus the fact that Shell Stations are far more readily available, renders the Shell Gas Card far more useful to me, if for no other reason than availability of venues. The Sunoco Card will though, maintain a slot in my wallet due to the fact there is no annual fee. But, comparatively speaking, the rewards program for fuel purchases is weak compared to the Shell Gas Card, and even more so in relation to other fuel cards. There is also a somewhat appealing annual interest rate that is lower for the Sunoco Credit Card, so that percentage rate compared to the Shell Gas Card, plus the lack of fees helps it to keep a place in a credit card slot of my wallet. If Sunoco were to raise the interest rate, or add an annual fee, then it will soon be another card victim of the scissors treatment.

name: Alexis Rodriguez-Carlson
review: I've had my Citi Diamond Preferred Card for years.  I actually never use it, I used it for a 1% balance transfer ages ago and I've just been paying it off ever since.  In that time, a couple things have impressed me.  When my card was stolen, I forgot to change the account number with my bank where the bill was being paid automatically.  As a result, my payment was late.  Citi was within their rights to charge me a late fee and to raise my interest rate.  But when I called and explained the situation, they immediately refunded the late-payment penalty and assured me that my interest rate would remain unchanged.

name: Sherman Hutchison
review: This Radio Shack store card seems fairly run of the mill in many ways. There is no annual fee, The annual interest rate on this card is 28.99% for purchases however if you spend at least 150 dollars and then pay the card off within the 1st 6 months, there will be no interest on it, and the same goes for 300 dollars or more of purchases within the year if paid off within that 12 months. What is interesting about the card is not so much the 10% discount on first purchase, but the fact that you get 15% off of all store stocked batteries so if that is something you like to buy here this card is for you. The interest rate is similar to the HSBC credit card I have, only mine has a 29% interest rate and there is an annual fee on mine of 99 dollars per year. Not too shabby if you like Radio Shack, and I do!

name: Hannah
review: This is a very good card, especially if you shop, often on amazon. The points really add up when you use your credit card and the redemption value at amazon is fairly good. At first, when I was saving up a certain item, with points from the card, I found the credit card fairly frustrating. Now I very much enjoy it. I don't have a great credit rating and I still do not pay a lot in percentage wise. I also got a pretty high limit which was pretty nice when I was stuck between financial aid payments. The introductory 0% was also extremely helpful for me as this was my very first credit card. I would highly suggest this card to anyone just starting out.

name: Brittany Lickey
review: The at&t rewards card seems to be an unlikely choice because most people think of them for phone and internet. At&t is now offering this credit card to people with good or excellent credit. I like the points system and the things you can redeem for seem to be pretty limitless  and you can get giftcards. However I feel there should not be a limit on the points. If I am spending the money I should be compensated with the reward. I would not chose this card if you are a big spender and want all rewards. The interest rates seem to be higher than that of a card I would like to use. Another good thing would be the 0% liability on unauthorized purchases. If you feel that you're being ripped off call customer care immediately.

name: Rob Doe
review: The Brooks Brothers Credit Card is a wonderful credit card. Any card that doesn't have an annual fee is already better than ones I've had experience with in the past. I never even consider one of those anymore since there are good cards like this without it. Being able to earn 4 points per dollar spent at online or at Brooks Brothers stores is great. A lot of cards i see only do 3 points per dollar spent. This is the most I've seen for any card before. Also, you pretty much get a free $40 every year with the $20 Off Birthday Card and $20 Off Anniversary. Which can easily turn into $60 or more since you can receive a $20 Reward Card automatically for every 2,000 points earned and with the great 4 points per dollar i can easily see that happening. If you love Brooks Brothers you have to get this card because you'll be getting free stuff all year round from them.

name: sambit acharya
review: I have become a fan of citibank credit card. When I first contacted them to get a credit card they promptly sent a representative to my house to explain all terms and conditions. Although I was not very sure about it, I applied for Citibank Platinum Credit Card. I got it within 2 working days as promised by the representative. Since last 2 year I have been using it without any hassle. I once misplaced my card and thought that it is lost. Immediately when I contacted on toll free number my card was blocked and a representative delivered me a fresh card without any charges. I was so thrilled with the prompt action. I got the original card and the bank destroyed it. I have never been charged single penny more than what is promised. It had been a great help during all my travel as I travel by air very frequently. I have earned a lot of reward points also. I have not en cashed it yet. I also availed a lot of discount in amazon.com, Kaya clinic and shoppers stop. Today I can say proudly that I made the right decision to get the card.

name: Lily Yee
review: This sunoco card has become useless to me. I found that the gas stations are not close enough to me. I also moved so this card is quite obsolete. This card would be better if there were more locations. This card is like any credit card, in terms of fees. So there is nothing unreasonable about this card. However the $1 per point seems to translate to 1% cash back. So it feels a generic cash rewards card. I fill my gas tank at least once a week or every other week. I don't feel like i have earned much of a savings. So to really get the savings one has to use it a lot. I find their customer service to be less than stellar.

name: Anita Garcia
review: The Citi Forward Card is a good credit card to get on your feet if you are able to transfer over to it. If you know that you will be able to pay off the money you owe within the promotional period, the zero percent offer for balance transfers is good to take advantage of. The APR on the credit card is great as long as you keep your credit usage at a decent rate. However, I do not often spend money on books, movies, and music as I use the library a lot which, if I did, would earn me five points cash back. Therefore I prefer the Chase Freedom card, which gives me bonus cash back on things that I use instead such as gas and home improvement categories.

name: Bela Kalinova
review: I love the Citi Diamond preferred card. It has many great perks and offers. I have overall good credit and am not sure if it's right for someone who is just beginning to build their credit, but I love it so far. They have a long drawn out intro period, which is hard to come by these days and the rate for that intro period is ZERO! I was so happy to hear that. This counts towards purchases and balance transfers. The cons of this card are hard to come by. I would recommend this to anyone. Have fun shopping with Citi!

name: Aaron Garcia
review: I like having my best buy store credit card because it gave me zero percent financing for up to fifteen months on certain purchases. This allowed me to buy myself an Apple laptop and pay it off fast.  I was also able to purchase two Apple iPads for my wife and me. The one thing that really is not good and  I had to find out the hard way is to make sure you are able to pay off the items on time if not they do make you pay back the interest that they did not charge you before for the fifteen months. Other than that, if you adhere to payment dates, this is a really great store financing credit card.

name: Shawn Pennick
review: I would not rank the Shell Credit Card as one of the best to have.  It is fairly restrictive in the fact it can be used only for gas (Shell) purchases. There is no annual fee to carrying the card (which is pretty standard)  and  interest rate is lower than other credit cards you may find available but higher than some offering competitive rates. The biggest benefit I can see is that it pays you a credit of 10¢ per gallon .  Other than the convenience of using a credit card as opposed to cash (or another card) the 10 cent per gallon credit, there are no enticing benefits to signing up for and having the Shell Credit Card.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: I love my Home Depot Store Card!  It wasn't difficult to qualify for, even though I don't have perfect credit and the interest rate is lower than many cards out there.  If you have a lot of work to do around the house, it's a good card to have for the convenience.  My only complaint is that there is no rewards program offered in conjunction with the card and they don't have any special offers or discounts for when you apply.  But still, it has come in handy for when some unexpected repairs have been needed to the house or when there's been an improvement project.  I would recommend this to anyone who shops at Home Depot for their home repair needs.

name: Tracy Harvey-Bell
review: This Home Depot card is excellent if you are remodeling or adding on to the inside or outside of your home.  It is also a great card if you need to purchase a new appliance of some type and want to get six months with no interest.  The card has a pretty good interest rate compared to other cards and does not have a yearly fee.  The home depot card has a wonderful online account management system where you can pay from anywhere online and also see your statements and any account activity you have had.  Keeping up with projects and the price of things are so much easier when you can just look it up quickly.

name: Jessmcness
review: If you have an interest in keeping up with all the latest technology and you think Best-Buy is the place to do it, then this is a good credit card to have. There’s no annual fee and the rewards are always a plus, even if they are low compared to, say, the Amazon credit card which offers 3 points for every $1 spent on Amazon, 2 points for $1 spent on gas & food, and 1 point for every other dollar spent. I just think this card needs a little more versatility in its usage. Still, electronics are huge purchases and this is a card worth considering for that purpose.

name: Sidhu Ram
review: Citi is a fantastic bank for transactions. They have their services everywhere, good enough credit facilities, decent credit and cashback awards, but when it comes to savings, they are no where near the mark. Extremely low on interest rates, be it on Fixed or Recurring Deposits, Citi never stands a change against competitors. I do not know why, but they have never seemed to care about it. I guess they really care about rolling money and not much about money thats stagnating. That said, it drives away a good number of customers, but they take no steps to overcome it which is the most intriguing part. Not good enough for saving schemes!

name: Jennifer Foster
review: As far as store credit cards are concerned, the Staples Store card is an excellent choice. There is no annual fee, which is always excellent. Also, there is a chance to get reward points, which is 5%. The interest rate is high, but if you are an individual that may have a need to buy office supplies quite frequently, then this card may be for you, especially since the card does offer rewards that could redeemed later for different items. I feel that it would be great for small business owners who are looking to save money. but still run a business.

name: Lily Yee
review: I would like to say Thank you to citi bank for this awesome card. I was young and did not know how to manage money. This card saved me in the sense that I was able to not accumulate interest on purchases and balance transfers. In 15 months I was able to pay off my debt. If you have debt I suggest using this card. The only bad thing is that Citi is an east coast bank. I live in the west coast so there were no branches here. I had to remind myself to pay early so that I don't get a late fee. Sometimes out of sight means out of mind. I paid twice a month and I did automatic bill pay. By the time I got the statement I only had 3 days to mail my payments.

name: Francisco Delgado
review: The Tire Kingdom Store Card came in handy when I was looking to get some new tires for my car. The incentive of the $50 prepaid card helped with the price tag on getting 4 all new tires. I used the gift card when i got it to help pay off the balance on the card and repaid it in full within 6 months for no interest. It's also nice when you get rebate coupons in the mail every now and then that can be used to services. This is a card I use infrequently but it is a nice niche when I do use it.

name: Sidhu Ram
review: I had a horrible accident a couple of years ago and was at logger heads with the insurance agent that put my credibility at stake. I had to set things right soon and I happened to land on the Citi Secured Master Card. Piled most of my savings into my Citi account and stuck to my credit limit for more than a year and the bank saw to it that my credit worthiness was set right. Am indebted to Citi for that. A few more months and I would be eligible for a platinum card that would greatly improve my credit worthiness. A big Thank You To Citi Secured Master Card for the timely help that no other card could offer me!

name: Chris Bova
review: The Expedia Credit Card is a decent card for people who book a lot of trips or hotels. You get 1% back on all purchases and 2% back on eligible Expedia purchases. The 2% back maximum is not great compared to other branded cards, as other brands like Amazon's give 3% cash back on eligible purchases.  There is no introductory rate, but you do get a nice bonus if you spend $1,500 in the first four months and an easy $50 credit if you make an Expedia purchase within 60 days of opening. If you're planning on making a lot of Expedia purchases you could do a lot worse than this card, but as a general rewards card it is only average.

name: Sidhu Ram
review: The Citi Dividend was a life saver while at college. I cannot imagine a life without the platinum card as I was so hooked to its reward points and cash back options. Back then, there was also a cash back of 50% on movie tickets and it my personal favorite! Cash backs for utility bills, telephone bills and what not! I made sure that I used the card to the fullest when I were at college. The late fee rate of interest is extremely high, but for my short purchases and bills, luckily, I never had to be late to pay my bills and never encountered a late payment fee! Anyway, Its a fantastic card for college goers!

name: Adam
review: Until getting this card I hadn't had a store credit card in almost ten years, I almost always either pay for everything outright or put smaller purchases on a regular credit card.  However my laptop died and I needed a new one right away and I didn't have enough money to get the one I wanted.  I also didn't want to put it on my regular credit card because I knew I wouldn't be able to pay it off for a couple of months.  Getting the Best Buy card allowed me to get what I wanted while being able to pay it off over time.  As long as any purchase I make with the card is paid off within 15 months there's no finance charge, which is great.  Although if you don't pay it off the interest rate is pretty stiff, so make sure you pay off your purchase.  I had no trouble getting approved even though my credit isn't the best, and I haven't had any issues with it since.  I highly recommend this card if you are looking to purchase any electronics but don't want to pay for it all up front.

name: Alexis Beth
review: The Brooks Brothers credit card is definitely worthy of these four stars. Compared to my Saks card, where you do not earn any points per dollar spent, this is a godsend. That is, if you shop enough! The perks in-store are a-okay in my book, and I love the plus of having a 15% initial discount because, hey, Brooks Brothers isn't exactly a discount shop. They do send a $20 reward for anniversary, birthday, and every time 2,000 point are reached which is a great incentive to shop even more. The rate is a bit high, so this is for serious BB shoppers only!

name: Cory Grant
review: I usually hate store cards but my computer died and I needed some quick financing and best buy was offering a very attractive deal, a percentage off the computer and no finance charges if paid in the 15 months.  I had zero problems with the card, was able to talk to a real person and resolve an issue when I had it.  I had planned on canceling it after I paid off the computer but I was so happy I'll keep it.  The interest rates and financing fees are high but everything is transparent so just keep an eye on the details and it's a great option.  I've come across a few in store geek squad and troubleshooting deals as well so it's definitely worth it if you're often shopping for electronics.

name: Napster Henry
review: I run a small business out of my home and have found the Staples store card to be useful in building bonuses for extra supplies like paper or, unironically, staples. It takes many miscellaneous items to run your business day to day, and we go through a lot of it over here. The high interest rate isn't a plus for sure, and if I didn't shop at Staples so often I would never use this card, but if the pros outweigh the cons, I recommend that any small business try out the Staples store credit card and see if it works for you.

name: betheny smith
review: This card has been a hit right from the start. I am always looking for a bargain and I got 10% off my first purchase. Do not laugh but...you also get 15% off battery purchases. I stock up when they are on sale and save big! I pay whatever I owe off at the end off every month to avoid interest fees. If you shop at Radio Shack this is the card for you. It is very easy to make payments in the store or online, which ever you prefer. Also if you pay on time they offer bonuses and promotions.

name: Dan G
review: AT&T is a major cellphone service provider, who also ventured into the realm of Credit Cards, and this is a review of them. This card is known as a rewards card, one that as you spend you get points which you can use on other things like gifts, trips, and goods. Starting with the annual fee of 0$, you wont get charged which is great, and the rewards you get are mainly applied to AT&T item purchases but you also get a bit back from everyday purchases.  This is a great card for travelers and people who love using their phone. Compared to my favorite card, the Amazon CC its decent with some good reward rates but they can be acquired on more goods than AT&Ts. Overall this is a pretty good card, I would recommend.

name: Chris No
review: First off let me say how much I love the store Staples friendly staff and bargain prices makes me come to this store time in time again. A good thing about this Staples card is it's for people with good and not so good credit making it easy for all people in any situation to obtain the card. It has absolutely no annual fee which is a huge help to me. The interest rate is a little high being 23.99 and it doesn't offer a first year intro at 0 percent like some cards do, so that's a downside. One upside is that this card has perks when purchasing. You can earn up to 5% rewards on everything in the store. One other good thing about this card is it has flexible payment option for your charges not many cards I've seen offer this such option your payments are set when they want it, not when it's convenient for you. Overall the Staples Business Store Card I think is a must have card in your wallet or purse.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: A card that is solely used for the purchase of fuel and nothing else! I hold an account with Citi and applied for a card when I bought a car as I could easily acquire one without much hassle. Strictly for fuel purchase, expect nothing more! Interest rates are extremely high and defaulting could cause serious trouble. The reward ration works out to just 2% and thats nothing big to boast about. However, I could easily get this card due to my eligibility without much paper work and thats the only reason I went about buying this! I guess Bank of America's reward points are a bit higher, not sure though!!

name: abigail lee
review: The best buy credit card is just an alright credit card. This will get you 2.5 points for every $1 spent at the store. Once you accumulate $250 points, then you will receive a $5 gift certificate to the store. If you buy your appliances at best buy, then this will be a good credit card for you. I wish that the best buy store credit card will give you more than just a $5 gift certificate. If they bumped it up to $10, then you will be more inclined to buy your appliances at best buy and not at costco. Only get this credit if you really shop at best buy, other than that, you can skip this credit card.

name: Joseph Gordon
review: The card is good if one is moving to a new home or one needs constant fixes to decorate and make the home look trendy, but otherwise there are not much benefits one can draw out of it. There is a whooping 17.99% interest rate if defaulted and thats extremely high! I do agree that they are accepted in most places, but Home Depot Cards have done nothing about it to improve their customer base - there is no cash back rewards, no exclusive prices, nothing which any other card with such wide customer base would offer! I wouldn't recommend this one..!

name: Joseph Gordon
review: I have been a loyal customer of the Citi Dividend credit card for 2 years now. Accepted almost everywhere and recognized by one and all, thats the main advantage of this card. Bought it at a time when I had to buy a DSLR which was above $500 and bagged the $100 cash back instantly. A timely buy well rewarded with! The late fee is a bit high and eat up in to the credit worthiness but then the bill payment feature can be scheduled so that we do not miss on end dates. Overall, a pretty good card that serves most purposes!

name: abigail lee
review: The sears credit card is a bad credit card. There is no bonus for signing up for this credit card. They will charge you a foreign transaction fee of 3%, so make sure that you do not use this when you are buying from a foreign retailer. Only use this credit card if you are buying appliances at sears so you can get a good discount on their appliances. You have to watch their email so you can see what items are on sale. They also accept coupons, so you can combine all of the sears discount all together. Don't use this credit card for other purchases.

name: Alexis Beth
review: I have been banking with Citibank since I got my first job when I was 15 years old and have not looked back! 12 years later and they are still tops in my book; their customer service is wonderful, their accounts are easy to access, and no minimum account amount! Also, the fact that you can deposit a check through their iPhone app is truly amazing and convenient. I have opened accounts with other banks due to availability while out of state but Citibank completely blows them out of the water, and I am shocked that they have received 3/4 stars here!

name: John Clary
review: The Staples store credit card is one of many store cards that you can get from various stores around most towns.  You automatically get 5% back on all items which is a really nice plus if you shop at staples often.  This card, although it does not have any fees or cash advances, does in fact have a VERY STEEP interest rate of twenty-eight percent.  Overall, this card is above average in terms of other store cards around but isn't the best.  If you haven't ever used a store credit card or don't shop at staples very often then I suggest getting a different card similar to the Amazon credit card or something similar.  The reason I give it a 4 star rating and not a 5 star rating is because of the steep interest rate.  if the interest rate were closer to 22-25% then it would be a phenomenal card.

name: Constantina Hauser
review: L.L. Beans Credit is your regular old store card, but since I like this brand so much I applied for their store card a few years back.  I really like this brand and this card comes handy when I do not have the cash in hand to buy the items I would like to have.  They also do have a decent rewards program ranging from %1 to %3.  Of course that amount is determined by your purchases.  Overall, I am quite happy with this card but their interest rates are off the roof so I try to limit my use to as little as possible.  This card does provide 23 day grace period which I think is standard on most store cards.

name: ursula kafka
review: If it's time to buy new tires and you can't afford it, the Tire Kingdom store card might save your tail. That's about the only thing this card is useful for. If you spend $799, you get the benefit of no interest for a year. $199 for six months of interest free payments. You will also get coupons and rebates in-store for being a cardholder but it's not worth using this card for smaller purchases. The APR of 28.99 is so astronomically high that you wont want to get caught carrying a balance past the 6 or 12 months you qualify for with a big purchase.

name: ursula kafka
review: If you book a lot of travel through Expedia, you'd probably do well to consider the Expedia Credit Card. The 10,000 points for signing up and spending a certain amount in your first months are a great bonus and you can accumulate points toward further travel very quickly. Since you can book just about everything travel-related through Expedia, this card lets you earn double points on hotels, cars, flights, and more. The interest rate is comparable to other rewards cards, nothing special there, but there's no pre-set spending limit so you don't have to worry about maxing out your card. It also covers car rental insurance, which is a huge benefit to frequent car renters. The only downside is that they cap your points at 100k for the year.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: The Citi Secured Mastercard credit card is a good credit card if you are trying to rebuild your credit or have no credit.
