I can’t really justify increasing my annual fee for the moderate increase in rewards compared to what I am already getting.

name: David Bishop
review: The Citi® Platinum Select® / AAdvantage® World MasterCard® Credit Card is yet another great card for those wealthy individuals who are flying constantly. The only way to make up for the so-so interest rate, and the lack of any introductory rates at all is to use this card constantly and to have the need to fly constantly. Additionally, you get charged a "membership" fee annually of $95 after the first year. This is a good option for those it is aimed for, however, that would be a small segment of the population, for the rest of us, there are better, no-frills options like the Slate by Chase card.

name: Jordan Webb
review: The Citi Secured MasterCard credit card is a great stepping stone for improving your credit if you have bad credit or if you have limited credit history. Essentially, this card allows you to deposit a particular amount of money, which then becomes your credit limit for 18 months. If you perform well in those months, you can upgrade to another card with a higher credit limit! This is a great way to start building your credit with a card that has almost no interest rate. I would highly recommend this card to start improving your credit score so that you can move on to higher limits.

name: David Bishop
review: The AT&T Credit Card is really a solid card. I like that there is no annual fee, even though most cards I have had are the same. The full year at 0% as an introductory interest rate is nice, none of my cards have been for that long. The rewards system is a bit intricate for my tastes, I just like a bare-bones, functional credit card with a low rate, I'm not too interested in rewards programs. However, if you are, and you make large purchases on your card, then this program seems to be a good one, as far as rewards programs go.

name: stephen blackwell
review: I'm not a huge fan of the National Tire & Battery Store Card due to its regular interest rate of 28.99%. That seems a bit high, in my opinion. It also doesn't have any type of rewards program which is a downside for those who like to use their cards a lot. I do like the fact that with a minimum purchase of $799 you could potentially pay no interest if you pay it off within 12 months of the purchase. I feel like more cards should offer this option as there are things I'd love to buy and I know I could pay for within that time period but simply don't, because of the interest rates. I wouldn't recommend this card over my Capital One Visa Card to an of my friends or family because of the high APR and the lack of rewards.

name: Jessica Trivalia
review: I do not understand why anyone would use this card. Maybe they offer it at the Goodyear stores when customers are buying tires and have bad credit?  I cannot see any reason to have a card that offers you nothing except an extremely high interest rate and abusive interest fees on cash advances. A cash advance rate of 30% with a 5% initial fee is the worst I have ever seen. The offer states that there are low monthly payments yet with a $1000 cash advance just paying the interest every month would be around $25. It could take 10 years paying the monthly minimum along with the interest to pay off the debt. This card offers nothing of value to anyone, even people with bad credit. Get a pre-paid card and build your credit instead of getting a credit card like this.

name: Jalisa
review: While this card would be useful for some, it's not something I'd use. That's not to say that this card isn't worthwhile, it's just that I can't see myself using it for anything. I don't have a car so it'd be a waste of time for me to sign up for this. For everyone else, I'd highly suggest picking it up just in case they needed to get any work done or replace something in their vehicle. The discounts would help a lot seeing as how vehicle repairs cost a lot more these days. It'd be even better if they offered rewards on purchases made, but that's not something to worry about as most vehicle repair purchases don't happen too often.

name: Jalisa
review: This card was made for me. I love buying the latest tech and electronics from Best Buy so any discount I can get is great. Like a previous reviewer mentioned, the low intro rate is amazing compared to most other cards I've looked at. I'd prefer for the qualifying purchase to be a bit lower than $149 however seeing as how many of the products I'd purchase cost about that much, it wouldn't be a huge problem for me. The $35 late fee seems to be expected and is not much more than what other companies charge for their late fees.

name: Jalisa
review: Though I don't travel as much as I used to this is a card I could see myself using in the future. I plan to travel to Brazil in the near future and the cash back percentages seem to be very nice and exactly what I would need. The only problem is I have seen other cards with much better cash back rewards than this one, and for frequent travelers getting a higher percentage back would be great. I'd definitely pick up this card if I had the chance, though, simply because it's one of the better ones I have seen, though not the best by any means.

name: Max Holt
review: I can see how this card might appeal to a particular sort of user, but it just doesn't work for me. If I traveled frequently the 10% cash back and 5% cash back on airlines would be very attractive. Unfortunately I don't travel much so these positives don't out weigh the negatives. Those negatives being an annual fee of $25 and a rate of 24.99%. I use credit cards just for the ease of payment and for short-term loans. I don't want to have to pay to use a credit card and I want my interest payments to be manageable. But again if your are a frequent traveler the discounts of up to half off and the travel reservation services could make this the right card for you.

name: Pua Tamandua
review: I like this car because it has no over limit fee like my old one did. I also like the low intro rate. The rewards are specially nice as well. I have never had a card that gives rewards before, even though that is common. I just always went for regular cards. I have had no problems using this at any store I have been to yet. One great thing is that it has no late fee(within certain limits) though I try to never make my payments late it can happen on rare occasions since everyone runs into problems now and then.

name: GamingCX
review: I got my Sears Store Card a little over a year and a half ago and they have been pretty good, when I used it. A major appliance broke down and you cannot always plan for these things, so I looked around and saw a deal at Sears. At the time they were having a special financing deal, so I figured if I could get the Sears Store Card with the special financing, this would give me time to pay it off, with no interest. I qualified and got the Sears Store Card with the Stove I needed, I had a year to pay it off with no interest, plus it was on sale. I think the other choice was you get 5% off the item. The interest on this card is high, so beware on that! Sears commonly runs specials for Sears Store Card members, and I get them sent straight to my email. However outside of big ticket items, the deals don't seem that great. Overall it is a decent Store Card, but buyer beware on the interest rate. If you feel you cannot pay it off in the amount of time they give, I would not recommend this card, due to high interest rates.

name: Maren Beasly
review: The Office Depot Store card is a fantastic card if you go through office supplies like I do.  I seem to need reams of paper every month as well as all sorts of other office supplies.  This card offers a 6 month no interest grace period, which is fantastic when I was purchasing my laptop for school.  It gave me the time I needed to work off the debt that I had and let me purchase the laptop that was desperately needed for my schoolwork.  Your entire account history is online so you do not have to worry about going to your local Home Depot to pay off the balance.  I noticed that a lot of other store cards still use this archaic method, so I'm glad that Office Depot has learned from this.  All in all, I think this card is a valuable asset when buying things in Office Depot.

name: Irving Duley
review: I got my Sears Store Card a few years ago when I was in the process of repairing my credit.  Repairing credit is difficult, so I was very appreciative that they “took a chance” on me.  There are no annual or monthly fees like many high interest cards charge.  I’ve used my card over the last few years to purchase large items (washer/dryer, riding lawn mower, electric fireplace).  One of the benefits of using the Sears card is that they often run deals where you can purchase items interest free for six months and often times for a year.  That helps out tremendously since the interest rate on the card is really high.  All of the purchases I’ve made were under those terms, so I ended up paying no interest on any of the items.  Also, they usually run really good deals around major holidays.  I’m in the market for a refrigerator, and I’m holding out until the 4th of July because I’m sure they’ll run some really good specials.  I’m completely satisfied with my Sears Store Card.

name: Pat Matthews
review: I got a home depot card in 2009 shortly after buying my first house and need a need water heater. I figured it would be a good idea to have with new home improvement projects coming up. the interest rate reasonable as far as credit cards go. I wound up using the card quite a bit over the next two years. it was nice being able to afford to make upgrades to my house and have extra time to pay for it. there is no way I could have afforded all the stuff I wanted to make my house the way I wanted it.

name: Jack Nguyen
review: After carefully building up my credit, I decided to apply for the Sears card and as expected I barely got the card after a phone call in the store and various verification. I did it mostly because you got ten dollars off your offer in the store and the employees really push it. The APR on it is the highest allowed by the law, 25%, and I always make sure to pay off my bill every month. Getting the card has definitely made me shop more at KMart and Sears if only for the coupons that get sent every month. It is especially great for getting the cashiers off your back about selling credit! However, I still try to keep the amount I use on the Sears card to a minimum. I mostly buy apparel and some home items. I avoid the big ticket stuff like the lawnmowers and televisions though they've told me I get low interest loans for those if I want.

name: Nella Scsarpisnato
review: I got this card in 2006 when I was trying to improve my credit score so that I could eventually buy a home. It wasn't until 2008, that I bought my home and began using this card. Even with hardly any credit history, they approved me for quite a bit of money, but with a nasty percentage rate. It's perfect for items that you intend on paying off in under a year. Many times they offer promotions that allow you to go interest free for a full year. My first purchase with this card was my Trane central air conditioner, so it was a big ticket item. My intention was to pay it off in a year, but I fell short and got gouged with the huge interest. I should have used another credit card with lower interest. This card is good for those with discipline.

name: Phillip Kessler
review: My wife and I have had our Home depot Card since 2005.  We got the card just after we bought our first house.  The house needed a lot of TLC and the Home Depot Card allowed us access to the funds to make our house our home in a very short time.  Today we still take advantage of the 0% interest deals.  The last Item we bought was a new Front loading washer and we paid 0% interest if paid off within the year.  Since then we have paid off the card and keep it around just in case we are in need of emergency home repairs (like a new hot water heater) or if we have a project where we need extra funds to complete.  Overall the Home Depot card is a great tool to have for any home owner.

name: Will Crowley
review: I actually went into Staples one Black Friday (first off bad idea) but I did the early rush so I could be guaranteed some of the Black Friday sales mainly a 24 inch monitor and an MP3 Player. Everything was already pretty cheap since it was Black Friday, but when I get tot he register I'm asked if I want to sign up for a Staples Store card, and if approved I would get 10% off my purchase for today using the newly approved card. I said sure, was approved, and saved that 10%. Now the only time I use Staples is wen I need new printer supplies or if they have a great sale on certain electronics, but every time I do I use my card usually online, because my car is setup to be connected to my staples rewards, and because of that I get 5% off and free shipping from online orders. I may not use my card that often with them, but when I do it's always a pleasant experience.

name: Sara Osborne
review: I used this card for all my back to school shopping supplies for my daughters. They found everything they wanted, and all the current styles. There is no annual fee and billing is fair and timely. It was an easy approval service and a quick response. Customer service is quick to answer and there is little wait time. They are also very friendly. I pay online every month, but there are various options as with most cards. There is a good rewards program where you can earn points that add up relatively quickly. There are many locations of Office Depot in my city so I have no problems using the card, or I have ordered online before which is also convenient.

name: Senior Cheeks
review: I applied for this card in a local store back in 2005. I was advised to get it so I could take advantage of the 0% interest for the purchases I was looking to make. I was getting a lot of wood, bathroom fixtures, and also some lighting for a home renovation project I was working on at the time. Everything worked out with the project, but I decided not to cancel the card. I have used it on and off over the years whenever I need something from Home Depot, since it is convenient. The interest rate could be a bit lower, but I have no complaints about the card at all.

name: Thurman Gloe
review: I first got a Staples credit card on the recommendation of a colleague. He had been using it to take care of his home business supplies for a while, and I was looking for a card for similar use. I have not been disappointed yet, there is no annual fee associated with this card which is excellent. The interest rate is a bit high but I always pay my bill on time and in full so I never have a problem with it. I would highly recommend this card for anyone that routinely uses Staples for office supplies or any other type of purchase, it makes shopping there simple and quick.

name: Peter Gibson
review: I have had my Home Depot card for a while, and only recently decided to use it in the attempt to purchase a new washer/dryer. Now when I had initially signed up for it, I was approved for $750 and 24.99% APR. The promotional offer at the time was 10% off first purchase, which I did not receive since I didn’t purchase anything. Still, those were all decently good benefits.  When I was trying to purchase the washer/dryer, I tried my card but was told the account had been CLOSED.  Ok, no big deal. I was told to call the support number to speak to someone. When I did I was told I would be receiving a letter explaining why I was refused. Now, the apparent reason for refusal was a bill showing a balance of $250.54 that I never spent. Hell, I never even received a statement at all. Needless to say I was upset. I called back and had words, a lot of words, not all of them kind. The customer support rep though was really patient and really helpful. Out of that whole mess, that is the one good thing I can say about it.

name: Tiffany Johnson
review: I used this card to purchase a computer a couple years ago.  Although I feel that the interest rate was somewhat high, at the time, it gave me the option of purchasing a device that I very much needed for both professional and personal use.  The customer service on this card has been professional and courteous and I have never had difficulty reaching someone if I need to.  There are multiple ways to pay monthly bills, which I find convenient.  However, the one drawback is that, unlike many other cards, you must have the card physically present to use.  I do enjoy to points rewards that come with the card.

name: Tim Keyes
review: I used a Staples card, in the past, to make various purchases of office supplies used at my place of employment. We never had any issues with the card or its customer service; and appreciated very much that it doesn’t have an annual or quarterly fee, like some specialty credit cards often do. It was also nice to accumulate rewards for use of the card, although I sometimes wished they accrued faster! Payment was never a hassle. We didn’t carry a balance, so interest rates were never an issue (although their rate is fairly high, so be careful if you do carry a balance.)

name: Derek Cliett
review: The first store card I was able to apply for and be accepted for was a Sears card. I had wanted to start building my credit, using something I was familiar with. My parents have had a Sears card for as long as I can remember, and they've always had a positive experience, so I checked this card out. The application process and approval were done in-store and were pretty quick. I wouldn't recommend using it for revolving debt, since the interest rate can pretty much nail you to a wall, but if you are using it for the discount they offer (quite often you'll get offers for a percentage off your whole purchase if you use the card) and then paying it off, it's awesome. I went down the "make payments" road a couple of times, and as long as you pay off within the time period (for me, it's always been 12 months 0 interest so far), you don't get charged the interest. I can imagine that backfiring if you aren't careful, though. But Sears is a great store, and they're local to me, so that is helpful. I always feel confident when I use my Sears card, whether it is for small purchases or larger ones.

name: John Blatts
review: Sears approved me with my first credit card I ever had. I had just stepped foot into college and had no credit to speak of. I needed some basics and furniture to move into a sublet with a roommate. My friends suggested that I apply for a Sears card because it was one of the easiest department stores to get approved. I was approved! Sears started my credit worthiness!  Like someone else mentioned, this card is GREAT when emergencies happen (because they do). Sears, after all, is a jack of all trades department store. I highly recommend any homeowner or renter alike to all have a Sears card.

name: Elna Velaquez
review: The staples business store card is a great addition to any business's purchasing arsenal.  Sometimes you need the convenience of shopping online, and sometimes you need the immediacy of a brick and mortar purchase.  With the staples business  card, you can get both, all with a 5% cash back option on every purchase.  You also get a little extra money when you recycle your old ink and toner cartridges, which definitely adds up since most small businesses go through them frequently.  As mentioned, the APR isn't great, but that doesn't matter if you pay it off by the end of the month, and is easily trumped by the 5% back and the convenience of getting all your small business needs met in one place.

name: Rob Callahan
review: I used to work for a large law firm. They had a Staples credit card that they used to purchase office supplies. I was in charge of ordering the supplies, and would often go to the actual Staples store itself to use this card. After the company spent so much money, they got rewards in return for their purchases. Every time I went in there was never a problem with the card, and the company that I worked for never even considered switching to another provider. They were overall very satisfied with this card and I would recommend it for other businesses as well.

name: Penelope Strong
review: Wait, USED to work??

name: Donetta Vivino
review: The Staples store credit card is fantastic.  I have been shopping at Staples for a very long time and this is the perfect companion to that long relationship.  It automatically links to your staple rewards so whenever you buy something with the card, it automatically gets connected to your staples reward balance.  You can also use that same balance to help pay or pay completely for your items.  The rates are pretty fair even though I have paid off all of my debt consistently without having to use the rates here, but I can see where it might help others if they need something right away.  Overall, the Staples store credit card is a fantastic asset for people who consistently shop at Staples.  I couldn't be happier.

name: Mable Rodrigez
review: This is a great card. I have been a long time customer of staples. This card has been very useful for larger purchases at staples. Applying for this card was very simple and painless. The only complaint I have is how high the rate is, but other than that it is a perfect card for someone who shops at staples. I have found myself in situations in which this card has been very useful. It's a real life saver at times. I probably use this card less frequently than most because I tend to purchase larger items with it only.

name: Jason Dagger
review: Since I worked there, I invested in one of these and it paid off so much in the long haul. I could easily go to the Meijer gas station right after I got off work to get 5 cents off every gallon. Considering I would be going there daily, I've saved close to 20 bucks in gas solely off the 5 cents saved. There are always new savings, and, for me, it usually saves a good amount of money, close to 30 bucks at a time. The 10% discount works wonders when you're a college student living by yourself like me and with already cheap prices, it's all the more reason to go. The discount plus normal Meijer prices sometimes even beat Walmart prices.

name: Alicia Frisone
review: I love my Staples card.  I am a frequent shopper, because I do all of my shopping here when I work on projects and this card makes it so easy.  I applied in store about a year ago, got approved quickly, and received my card about a week later.  The interest rate is a little bit on the higher side, but it has never bothered me, since I always pay off my balance right away.  When I got this card, I only had one other credit card to establish my credit, and this card helped with that, as well.  I’d definitely recommend this card to any frequent Staples shoppers.

name: Don
review: I opened my Home Depot account the day I closed on my home.  The house I purchased was a bank owned foreclosure, needless to say it was in need of lots of TLC and minor repairs.  In addition there were no appliances in the house, so I needed a washer & dryer, refrigerator, stove, and microwave.  Home Depot being the nearest hardware store / lumberyard I headed there to get a start on my tasks.  Talking with the salesman in the appliance department I found out that if I opened Home Depot account I could take 10% off of my total purchases up to the limit of my account, the fact that this was on top of the 10% military discount I was receiving sold me!  I completed the application was approved for $2,500 on the spot.  Since my intended purchases totaled over $5,000 they sent me to the customer service desk to see if I could get a limit increase.  The assistance manger at customer service listen to my problem and asked if I had any other credit cards.  I said, “Yes American Express and Visa.”  He then called the credit desk and explained he had customer approved for $2500 on a $9500 sale.  The customer was going to pay the balance on AMEX.  Was possible to increase the card limit?  They raised to $10,000 on the spot!I've never carried a balance past the six-month interest free period, so I don't have an issue with the 18% APR.  I love the fact I can pay online by check and see my account status as well.  I the five years I had this account I've never had reason to call customer service.  I highly recommend the Home Depot card as a means of getting interest free finance for six-months on purchases for your home.

name: Mary Stouffer
review: My husband and I had a business home depot card or our small business company.  It was very convenient when we were out on a construction job and something would come up, and we needed a different tool, or the customer would change their mind about the project, so because they have so many locations, we normally would not have to drive too far and normally they would have it in stock.  Although my husband has passed away and we no longer have the company I still use it for many of my projects around the house. They always seem to have plenty of help on hand to help you find something or help you decide which is the best material for the job at hand. I would recommend home depot to my friends, family, and any business associates.

name: Tim Wagner
review: I mainly got this card several years ago to help build up my credit but found myself using it often after I bought a home. It comes in handy when I am out and about and think of something I need. I also go to Home Depot just to look around and always pick something up while I am there. It's a heck of a lot more convenient than carrying cash with me or writing a check. As with other credit cards I try to pay off the entire balance every month. Having this card makes me feel better just in case there is an emergency and I don't have the cash. I can always pick up what I need and make my monthly payments if necessary. This is a good card to have, especially if you are a homeowner.

name: Corey
review: I've always had positive experiences with using this card. Taking advantage of the 0% interest for 6 months deals has been extremely useful for certain repairs/remodeling that I do around the house. For example, when I decided to change the carpet in one of the bedrooms at home, I bought the carpet and had it installed by Home Depot professionals, and put all of the expenses on the card. Then I simply payed down the balance online at my own pace. I couldn't be happier with my decision to sign up for this card. Some people complain about the interest rates, but if you take advantage of the grace periods offered, and you are responsible about your payments, this really shouldn't be a problem. I'd definitely recommend this card to anybody who regularly shops at Home Depot.

name: Alonzo Corington
review: I applied for a Sears card because I needed a card and had worked there for a few years. The application process was fast and simple. It is something that can be done within minutes at the cash register which makes it convenient. I also got a discount for my purchases that day. I love my sears card because I can make a payment whenever I visit the store. There was a time I forgot the card that I needed and did not have my sears card with me. The cashier was able to identify me (using proper identification) and they were able to look-up my Sears Card. I was able to pay for my purchases without having the physical card. I would definitely recommend this card to anyone looking for a store card, especially if you are a frequent Sears shopper. The shopper rewards program definitely sets this card apart from others.

name: AJ Sklar
review: I have had the Home Depot card since I bought my home in 2007, when I first got the card it was twelve months zero interest. In addition, I receive ten percent off my first purchase. This really came in handy as we were replacing wall and ceiling lights, kitchen and bathroom cabinets, and all door hardware. We made sure to pay it off before the promo rate expired. As with most store credit cards, the normal interest rate is insanely high. I use it like my American Express card. I pay it off every month. It is easy to make an in store payment too. I would recommend it.

name: Mary Webber
review: I don't know where to start but maybe stating that Citibank has provided by far the worst customer service experience until this moment. I deposited a check that I wrote to myself from another financial institution, as I wanted to move money between accounts without incurring unneeded wire transfer fees. After I found out it would take 7 days to clear the check, I did ask for it to be cancelled and I was going to wire the money (so it would be available on the next business day). They were not able to do that. So I did call my other financial institution from which the check came, and they immediately stopped the payment. Fast forward one week - my Citibank account balance was now reflecting a negative balance, for twice the amount I had initially planned on depositing. I spent many hours on the phone trying to understand what happened - no resolution whatsoever. I am not able to get my funds, and no one explained why I have such a huge negative balance (which will result in more fees I am sure). I do not wish to do business with a partner that makes rules on their own and would not even explain the reasoning behind them. Not to mention I cannot get my funds when I need them.Terrible experience! Never again will I deal with Citibank!

name: Shaneeka Anderson
review: Being a home owner I spend quite a lot of time in home improvement stores, so it was only natural I ended up with a store card to one of them. I chose the home depot card due to it being my first choice for home improvement projects. At the time I was making a major pruchase, and Home Depot was offering 0% interest for a certain period of time if your total was over a certain amount. I was replacing my washer and dryer so I qualified and signed up immediately. The in store application process was quick and easy. Once approved it was a breeze checking out just as I would if I were using my normal method of payment. Since that time I have made other purchases, and also get coupons in the mail which I love. This card was one of the best decisions I ever made.

name: Codi Oravec
review: I ran a small business from home with my younger brother and having the staples business card has been tremendous. Even if prices are cheaper elsewhere, being able to buy all my supplies in one location and the reward points make up for it and the time saved is priceless.Their customer service has been great so far, always give very good feedback and answer all my questions thoroughly. The APR  could be better but looks like it is on par with most store cards and the rewards makes up for it. Will be upgrading some equipments in our office and I am looking forward to the savings and points.

name: Kumar Shah
review: I recently had to move to an apartment complex that didn't come with a washer and dryer, this was a big issue after having had them readily to my disposal for over five years. At first I thought I can manage with just using the community amenities and wash clothes there. It became clear after the first attempt that it will be time consuming and costly too. The community washers were small and took two dollars to work. Each trip cost me 12 dollars every week. I applied for a Sears Store Credit Card on a recommendation from a friend and got it approved. I went to the store and looked around for a nice washer and dryer that fit my needs. Because of the card I was able to get the items at 0% financing for 12 months. That is a great deal as it meant I didn’t spend 1,000$ up front and was able to get my items without paying some ridiculous interest rate. Great Card!

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: I actually just signed up for a Home Depot card because of an excellent deal they have going on.  We are getting new windows installed in our house, and the current promotion was that they had no interest for 24 months if we signed up for a Home Depot card.  I very rarely see them offer deals for that many months of 0% interest financing, plus they also were offering 10% off my purchase.  Usually it's one or the other, not both.  I figured might as well pay 2 years from now with future dollars that are probably going to be worth slightly more than what they are now with inflation.

name: Kassandra Raza
review: The company I work for uses Office Depot Business Card for all of our supply need purchases. The closest Office Depot store is about five minutes away from my place of employment so it makes it very convenient to shop. We use Office Depot Business card for everything from ink and laser printers, to pens and computer accessories. The APR percentage is not bad and accounts receivable pay off the balance each month, not to mention there is no annual fee which is great. This card is very flexible and the company I work for has been using it for years. I highly recommend this card for office supplies.

name: Vada Blasco
review: The Staples Business Store card has been the perfect thing for my growing business.  I found myself at the store almost everyday at the launch of my business, and then more and more often as we progressed through our product launch cycles.  I never realized how much I was actually spending at the store, until I was presented with the opportunity of applying for a Staples Credit Card.  After using the card for about 6 months, I was shocked to see how much money I was getting back in Staples rewards.  I won't go into specifics, but it significantly helped cut down on the cost of the purchase of a new tablet computer for our office.  I would recommend this card to anyone, especially business men & women.

name: Tamika Schwebke
review: I got my Home Depot credit card 6 years ago, when I decided to finish my basement.  I also got one for my Dad, because he  is the one who did the work for  me, and it was so easy for him to be able to drive over to Home Depot multiple times a week and pick up whatever he needed, without any problems.  We also received 10% off of our first purchase, so we tried to think of everything we could to make it a large purchase, that was a big savings.  I made sure to pay the balance off every month, so that no interest charges incurred, otherwise, all that savings would have been lost, plus much more, as the interest is quite high.  All in all, I have had a great experience with my Home Depot credit card.

name: Jacinta Labs
review: I initially got the Home Depot Store Card about 5 years ago when I was renovating my kitchen. Since I was making a big purchase of around $5,000, it saved me 10% on the purchase price, which was definitely worth it. The great part is that on large purchases, they offer 0% financing for the first six month. So, as long as you pay it off by then, you are ok. However, if you don’t you can run into some major financing charges and cost yourself a pretty penny. Overall a great card for large purchases, but make sure you watch the APR after the initial 0% financing period.

name: timothy bull
review: I've been using the Home Depot credit card for about 5 years now and it really comes in handy for the larger purchases and the 0% financing. Recently both our washer and dryer went up and when you get hit with a double wammy like that it can really drain your bank account but with the Home Depot card we were back in business in no time and we didn't have to worry about the interest on the purchase.The card really comes in handy when it comes to any home repair because you know you can get exactly what you need and you can pay for it monthly if need be or pay it off sooner if you can. Most credit cards are  just a hassle and usually charge a hefty 22-24% interest if not more. Even on the small purchases the interest rate is only 17.9% with the home depot card.When it comes down to it I think this is one credit card that every homeowner should have in their wallet. When it comes to home emergencies you know you will be covered without spending too much money.

name: Chris Hornbostel
review: This is pretty much our go-to card in office purchasing where I work, and it gets the job done but needs to be managed. You have to be able to coordinate your purchases with accounting and paying off within the grace period for us is important. That said, we simply handle this card as a "net-14" day invoice, and only shop for things like ink, paper, envelopes, and other stuff at certain points in the month to keep everything straight. If you don't pay in the grace period, that 23.9% APR will start to put a hurt on your bottom line. If you manage your expenses well and have the cash flow to stay within that grace period, this is a fantastic and effective card. (And we love never running out of ink in the middle of a big print job now!)

name: Jenette Morrow
review: My husband and I own a small construction outfit so having an excellent material supplier is a basic lifeline of ours. Having access to available credit for materials was especially important when we fist started out but is still an important staple needed for our continuing success. Home Depot was the first place we applied for the credit we needed to start our business. I definitely feel lucky that they accepted us because they have been wonderful. I have never had a problem or even a small issue with them. They have always tried to accommodate us.At one point we even needed an emergency increase in our credit with them and they gave it to us while making us feel good about it instead of the lecture that some companies might give you. When we first started out we had to make the minimum payment at times but now that we are on our feet we are able to pay the amount owing every month, most of the time, and are rewarded for doing this with not having to pay any interest that month. Which as you all know is a definite plus. However the interest rate we have to pay when we can't pay the amount in full is very low. I recommend to obtain this card to anyone who is starting out or even well established, this cad will be an asset to you.

name: John Dover
review: My wife and I just made a recent purchase at our local Home Depot. We were looking at washer dryer combos and some odds and ends for basic home repair. We found everything we needed and ordered a washer dryer combo. Our sales rep told us a little bit about the Home Depot card and how we could get 18 months no interest. We then decided to apply for the card. The application process was fast and easy. The Home Depot credit card is a GREAT way to make large purchases for your home and pay later with no interest. If you have decent credit and need to make a large purchase I suggest you apply for the card!

name: Kip Joyal
review: I've used this card in the past when working with friends who had a shed building company. It was always a great way to get building materials and keep the bill separated from normal expenses, making paperwork a breeze. Not to mention it was quite good for purpose of getting building materials at a discount. I would recommend this card for people who are not contractors but are DIY'ers and do a lot of work around the house. Just remember to pay it off monthly! All in all a great card to use, for the builder to the homeowner to the contractor!

name: Jenny Tope
review: I have had a home depot card for about ten years now.  This account has been a huge help in helping my family meet both our financial goals and our home remodeling goals.  We have used it on several occasions to budget and manage larger purchases when doing remodeling around our home.  We have used the "buy now, pay later" feature to purchase hardwood flooring, carpeting, bathroom cabinets and a kitchen sink and faucet.  This feature allows us to budget our larger expenses over several months, making it manageable.  We like Home Depot store and do use it alot.  Having the home depot card does make us more likely to go there for purchases.  It makes it more convenient when we don't have cash.  In addition, if we have a return, and we have purchased it on our home depot card, it is much easier to research if we have lost our receipt.  Overall, we have been very satisfied with our card and would recommend it to others.

name: John S Dunning
review: I have used this card since Staples opened a store in my city a few years ago. It is a great card to have. It was very easy to get. I simply filled out the card application online, was approved, and they mailed the card to me within a few days. I use the card at least once a week. It has low monthly payments. I like that you can manage your account online and even make your payments online. Anytime I have ever had to contact customer service I have gotten fast, friendly, and professional help. I highly recommend this card.

name: Sheila Jenkins
review: I like this card a great deal  I use it often, as I'm always having to buy printer paper, inks, pens and so on.  I have also used it in buying my laptops: almost every laptop I've had has come from Office Depot!  there's no annual fee, which is great, but I suspect that they more than make up for this with the tons of fees they charge for just about everything else.  Also, the the interest rate at 23.99 % is damn near murderous if you aren't careful.  A good card overall, but be very careful to never spend more than you can safely pay off in one month's pay period.  Also, unless you really enjoy getting hit with a huge fee, don't ever use this card for a cash advance.  Pay it quickly, don't use it for advances, and you'll be fine.

name: Hua Ding
review: Citi customer service representative was deceptive!I signed up for the 20000 bonus points for $3000 spent in the first 6 months, then another 20000 bonus points for the $3000 spent in the second 6 months, based on the term and conditions. I called the customer service to make sure my understanding is correct.Interestingly, the representative told me the second 20000 bonus points will be awarded as long as I spent the second $3000, which can be in the first 6 months. Not believing what I heard, I asked the question from different angles 3 times, all confirmed by the representative. So I set out on my spending journey.It turned out too good to be true. Citi didn't give the second 20000 bonus points after I reached $6000 spending line. Contacted the customer service, the only answers are the repetition of the terms and conditions, twice, no matter how I pointed out it was the Citi customer service representative said so.From a retrospect, I am having a feel that Citi representative intentionally told me such to get me spend more with the card! And now I have no way to prove it, despite the creditability with Citi I supposed earned by being a top-tier Citi banking customer for years. Going to cancel the ThankYou for sure. What a waste of my time and money!

name: Kraig Lasher
review: Oh the perks of climbing the hills of credit and reaching the peak!  I once had bad credit although not due to poor credit card management.  Then I used credit cards to help me build it all the way to very good.  I would not call it excellent but it's up there now and I was still approved for this card.  I really appreciate the card and it is really effective with making sure you don't hurt your credit as there are no late fees, annual fees, or penalty rates.  Yes, I could not believe it my self.  Especially the no late fees part.  I initially transferred my balances from other cards and then I just dropped those.  I would rather have it all in one now, and the Citi Simplicity card really does make things simpler and less worrisome.  I made use of the 18 months with no interest as well since I had recently climbed out of losing everything.  I had to buy everything all over again.  I really appreciate this card, but I understand why you must be doing well with credit to be eligible.

name: Cathrine Gerber
review: This card is great.  I have been with them since 2007 and they have provided me with such great service.  I've had my limit increased once when I didn't request it, but who can complain about that.  When dealing with exchanges or refunds from other companies, they are very helpful and quick to solve all issues.  They also send an e-mail immediately stating the changes that have occurred.  Sometimes when I call, I feel great when I am being recognized for being with them for so long.  Also their rewards program is great.  It offers so many different varieties that I wish I can just get them all.  They are great and I will continue with their service for a very long time.

name: Wilmer Gering
review: AT&T Universal has been my credit card since 1990.  In over 20 years, I’ve only had one issue. Other than that, it’s been great.  I travel globally and my platinum AT&T Universal card has been to 7 countries with me and has never been declined.  All transactions are a snap and I don’t have to worry about the exchange rate. AT&T handles that for me.  Once, they even called me out of the blue and asked me if I had done business with “so and so”.  I said no and they said we’ll take care of it for you and all before I’d even seen the activity on my card.  That kind of proactive security is why AT&T will be my card of choice for the next 20 years and beyond.

name: Beth SIim
review: I was excited to sign up for the Citi Hilton card because of the two complimentary night stays. I've used the card many times and have only had pleasant experiences. My husband and I travel throughout the year to see family so our points accumulate pretty quickly between rental cars and hotel stays. Although I've only had minimal contact with the service representatives, the woman who handled my change of address over the phone was cordial and prompt. Citi's website makes it really convenient to make payments and keep track of purchases. If you do a lot of traveling, I'd recommend the card.

name: Alex Ruegg
review: I have been banking with Citibank for a little over a year now. Honestly there isn't much I can complain about. They are pretty fair, and locations are everywhere so I never have a problem finding an ATM. I like the system that they use, and staff is always friendly. They even gave me 2 dollar bills upon request. The location and parking at the one nearest my house isn't the greatest, but other than that I have no other problems. It is a nice newer bank and I think it made a great addition to my city. May be applying for student loans with them soon if things keep going the way they have been.

name: Sean Forde
review: I've had this card for just about 2 years now and I use it all the time.  I use it on small and big purchases alike all with the intent to rack up mileage points.  It has done me well.  Currently there is  special where you can get 2 for 1 on allowed purchases and with this I have seen my mileage soar.  I again have enough to get a round trip ticket.  This would be three.  I live in California but I grew up in NY.  I try to take a trip back every year and with this I get a free one. I have never had a problem with American Airlines so I will keep flying with them until I do.  Not only is it good with flights you can also use it to replace your car insurance and it came in handy for me.  I had a problem with a rental where there was a very tiny chip in the front windshield.  They told me not to worry but then I got a bill for a few hundred dollars because they replaced the whole windshield.  I did not sign up for the insurance so they tried to stick me with the bill, however because I used this credit card they handled everything with no fuss and I never heard from the car company again, and nothing came out of my pocket.

name: Carroll Christaldi
review: I've been using the Citi® Hilton Honors Visa Signature® Card since I first started traveling for work.  I found out that they gave a start up sign on bonus of 40,000 miles. That was a good jump considering I can use it for my personal use with family hotel stays as well as work. The incentive with this card is that you get a lot more than double points if you use the card for your Hilton stays, I believe its 6pts per $1 so they make it very attractive.  They have other shopping points to. But you really get most benefits if you stay at the Hilton.  I recommend this card if you have a job that pays most of the upfront hotel cost because some Hiltons are expensive.  Otherwise this works as an ok rewards card. The interest can be a little high.

name: Kayce Bomer
review: I first got this credit card when I was a student in college in order to help build up my credit. The rates are pretty reasonable compared to other credit cards. However, they don't really matter as long as you pay on time and in-full (which is what I do).When I first got the card, they were offering 5% cashback on all purchases. Now, however, it's only 5% cashback on select purchases (like gas) and only 1% for the rest. The 5% cashback for gas isn't very useful given that gas stations where I live charge MORE for using a credit card compared to cash. Even worse is the fact that you need to earn at least $50 cashback in order to get a check. So, unless you charge a LOT of money on your card, you won't see a check.

name: Marie Malave
review: This credit card works like every typical credit card. It does has it advantages and disadvantages. One of the plus side is that it is accepted in almost any place you go or you want to use it. One of the disadvantages is the high rates and the late fees. You have to make sure that you pay on time and this goes to every credit card holder. The experience overall was good and I will recommend this credit card. Is an excellent way to start building up your credit and create a history of good credit. Customer service is average but you know that in most credit card or bank company customer service is not always the best.

name: Elena Auiles
review: I opened this account for work travel. I'm able to charge all of my travel expenses to my Citi Hilton Honors Visa and then get  reimbursed by my company. It's a great system because now I'm earning points that I can use for personal travel. I was originally offered the Reserve card but after a little research decided on the Visa Signature because there is no annual fee. This card is definitely better suited for cardholders that will likely travel a lot throughout the year (more than once or twice a month). For business travelers this card is a must. The point are really easy to accumulate and even easier to redeem.

name: Richard Schmitt
review: The Citi Simplicity card is the most aptly-named credit card around.  It simplifies everything that my family does.  It enabled us first to transfer our balances on other cards to this new Citi Simplicity card with a higher credit limit and lower rates. The 18 months at 0% interest helped my family buy the things we needed after getting our first house without worrying about serious interest charges and fees. After the first eighteen months, the interest rate was still reasonable as well.  I had an issue twice about charges on my card, and both times the customer service representatives were very cooperative and high-spirited.  If not for the Citi Simplicity card, my family would still be trying to prioritize our needs for the house instead of being able to accomplish all our goals at once. Citibank overall has done a wonderful job with credit cards, but Simplicity may just be the best!

name: Linda Diianni
review: We use our Citibank Platinum Select credit card for all of our purchases. We have good credit, and our Standard Purchase APR is 8.740% as of our last statement.By paying off our credit card and using it carefully, that is, we don't buy everything we want on credit but only buy our higher priced items and necessities on our card.I have not used the rewards features because I do not want to be tempted any more than I am about making purchases.Paying our bills on-line is a great feature and keeping up with our payments is easy. Citibank also sends out reminders if you would like them. We make it a habit to check our accounts at least twice monthly. The account is secure, and it's great to know that it's possible to freeze the credit card in case of financial hardship.We'll stay with Citibank. I did my research before obtaining the credit line and Citibank was the best credit card option for us.

name: Elizabeth Nack
review: Unfortunately, I have never found the rewards program to be useful. But I have had this card for five years, and I have never had a major problem. The interest rate is high, but every card out there had a criminal interest rate, so that doesn't really change my opinion of the card. Also, a few months ago, my laptop was stolen and fraudulent charges were made to my account. The customer service reps whom I spoke to were exceptionally helpful, the charges were reversed right away, and they did follow up with some outside agencies to make certain that the old card would not be used again and it would not impact my credit score. That situation alone makes me happy to remain a customer. They have also called me with a reminder to pay my balance on the rare occasion that I am late, and they have always cancelled the late fee for me.

name: Maryanne Sedman
review: This was a good card for me as a student to help build my credit. But the interest rates were very high, I guess just how they are for all student rate credit cards because of the liabilities. But They do offer 1% cash back which over the span of a year or so will build up if you spend enough. I would recommend this card to anyone student simply trying to boost their credit rating. However, if you actually plan on getting a credit card to use it often and not just to build your score, I would suggest finding another card due to the interest rates on this one. Their just not plausible, especially for most college students.

name: Gary Nelson
review: My experience with this bank is awful. As with most other banks it's nothing but fees, fees, and more fees! Unless you have reached minimum account balances you will get hosed with the monthly service fees...and I don't know too many working people who can easily maintain those minimums in today's job market. And besides, what is the so called service fee all about anyway? What service? It's just a number on a computer screen! Plus with the strained economy, banks, just like everyone else, are cutting hours and making things harder on both customers and employees. I go there during a weekday in the mid-morning and there is a line with 8 people in it and only one teller. Come on now! This wasn't even a Friday!Overall I find that this bank, along with every other bank I've had the displeasure of being involved with, are all crooks and ultimately will give you less for more.

name: Trish Johnson
review: I love my Citi Card!  This year will mark 6 years since I first signed up for my first credit card- which is this credit card, and I feel like I'll have this card forever.  I love that I am essentially buying things that I'd normally be buying with any other credit card, but I'm getting something back for it, in the form of points!  And let me tell you, those points add up fast!  Not to mention, the customer service really is great.  Although they are at times a little pushy in trying to get you to sign up for some of their 'add on' services, they are extremely helpful.  In the past 6 years I've only had one minor problem, and it was a problem caused by me!  This is truly a great company and credit card, and I would recommend this to absolutely anyone and everyone.  Thanks, Citi!

name: Connie Tat
review: The Citibank Shell credit card is very useful and handy. Whenever, I want to go pick up some gas, I feel comfortable paying the amount I do for gas and getting a bit back for it. You get %5 back when you pump gas at any Shell using this credit card. Though the amount is not an incredible amount, it is still something I get back, like a small discount. This credit card is great to use anywhere else as well and since it is a MasterCard, transaction using this card is very smooth and easy. There are no problems using this card from my part and I love the rewards I get for pumping gas. I recommend it to all who wants to have great rewards and those who love earning back on their gas cost today.

name: Bong Prisoc
review: This card turned out to be my solution.  I was like a lot of people, trying to furnish my apartment through the furniture store’s credit plan.  I was getting about 90 days to pay at no interest. After that the interest rate skyrocketed.  I finally took the time to shop around for one of these 18 mos 0% APR credit card offers I heard about. I found Citi Bank. The Citi Simplicity Card had what I was looking for-- a card with a long enough window at no interest, decent interest rates afterwards and a good reputation. I also transferred one of my high interest balances to this card and didn't have to pay interest on that for a while either.

name: May Crog
review: Credit card as a whole are dangers in themselves.But Best Buy allowed me to get my first credit card. I liked the fact that I could earn points, which I redeemed a few times for things that I needed like an external disk, kitchen appliances and so on. The interest was high though, and I saw the potential issue with keeping on using it. I was planning on reimbursing every time I did a purchase on it, but that was slower than I would have wanted. In other words, the interest rates are high, but the consumer is whom creates issues or not by being a good steward of that card. I managed to pay it off, and really never use it unless extremely needed.

name: Paul Rath
review: The Citi Simplicity card is a very good simple credit card.  There is a great introductory rate for the first 18 months with 0% interest.  The interest rate then goes to only 12.99% on purchases and about 22% on cash advances which isn't bad for a credit card  The card has given me a generous credit limit as well.  I've had an issue with a fraudlent charge on my account last month and went online to the dispute center and disputed the charge and they handled it very quickly with no issue, simply taking the charge off the bill after a few days. I hope this charge doesn't come back again but If It does I am confident that I will be able to resolve it and if needed change my credit card number with no issues.  I recommend it to anyone looking for a simple no-frills card.

name: Kathy Fitzgerald
review: I originally got the Citibank card several years ago during a promo for 1.99% interest on transferred balances until the card is paid off.  I initially consolidated two cards, and about 3 years ago, transferred the balances of notes on two motorcycles to this card at  an interest rate of 2.99% until paid off.  Essentially, I used the card as a loan, and the only interest I paid at the actual rate, which was something like 14-16%, was on the interest accrued on the balance.  I paid the last payment in January, and the total interest I paid was significantly less than I would have paid on a regular bank loan.  I don't see this type of offer any more, but have seen some that allow you to pay 0 - 1.99%  on transferred balances for up to 18  months.  I'm not sure if there's a fee for transfers, but from personal experience, if you can pay the balance off within the promo period, it's worth a relatively small fee, because you save more than enough in interest to make up for the fee.

name: Joey Jefferson
review: This is a great credit card and was my first ever credit card. I was worried at first that I would forget to make a payment on the credit card and end up having to pay heavily for it. After all all of my business class professors always stress the evils of credit cards! I decided to get one anyways so that I could start building up credit. Needless to say I was incredibly nervous. Everything went well for the first five or six months, but then come finals time last year it just slipped my mind to pay off the bill at the end of the month and I just wanted to say that I am just now getting all the back paying done since I live on a very small payment. To any students out there this is a great card, but use responsibly!

name: ANETA OBALEK
review: My wallet has been stolen twice and both times I had my Citibank debit and credit cards in it. I immediately contacted the bank when it happened, and they cancelled my cards as well as putting a freeze on my account. Unfortunately, the thieves still managed to make several withdrawals and write bad checks for a fairly high amount. When I reported that the cards were stolen, an investigation was initiated. I received all the instructions and forms in the mail a couple of days later. The paperwork was easy and self-explanatory. I was also granted provisional credit for the monies that were missing. The whole investigation took several weeks, and the bank eventually finalized my credit, and closed the investigation. All and all, they were very helpful given the circumstances.

name: Bo Darnell
review: I have since cancelled my card.  I had a pretty high limit and was never late with any payment on any of my statements.  For some reason, out of the blue, Citi dropped my credit limit to $200 below what it used to be.  I gave them a call and they said that unfortunately, new policies were in place that resulted in this and there was nothing they could do for me.  I was very upset with this and cancelled because they hadn't even notified me of any changes -- I had to find out for myself.  Very disappointed with this service and will not be using it again.  I've since moved to a different service.

name: Ja Christopher
review: Beyond my credit union credit card, this was the first credit card that I signed up for.  My experience with this card has been fairly ordinary and comparable to your typical rewards card, but the one noteworthy feature that I have loved is the virtual credit card number feature.  This feature allows you to generate temporary credit card numbers for use with web sites and/or merchants that you may not necessarily trust your permanent credit card number too.  This feature is easy to use, free and is very secure in comparison to the traditional payment methods.  I recommend this card for that feature alone.

name: Sean Forde
review: All I want to do is say thank you to the citibank thank you rewards card.  when I first bought this I didn't realize what I had.  I use it all the time for everyday purchases and have watched my points build up since.  I recently used this to rent a car.  I've never used a card to do this before.  I was able to upgrade to a really nice suv and didn't have to pay a cent.  Plus because I used the card I did not have to pay for the insurance from the car rental place another plus.  I want to save enough points to buy a tv one day... that may take a little while however it will totally be worth it.  I tend to pay off my card before the end of the month so I never incur any interest charges so its like I'm making money buy buying the things I buy anyway.  I love these kind of reward cards.

name: Sean Forde
review: What can I say about Citibank... I've had them for years and they haven't really disappointed me. They have great customer service and my checks are always deposited on time. Online banking is easily accessible from my phone, laptop or computer. I can always get access to my money day or night. I've always had a great experience. ATMs are even available at 711.  How great is that? The only bad thing I would say are the charges that occur when you use a non Citibank ATM. they charge you at the ATM and then Citibank charges you another fee. I don't think this is right but my solution is to always use a Citibank ATM. other than that they have everything I need.

name: Gordan Thienel
review: Previous to the Citi Thank You rewards card I had the Citi Drivers rewards program and it has been fantastic. The card is fee free and the rewards I get on everyday purchases are great. The few times I have lost the card I found it very simple to call and cancel, plus they sent me a replacement with no hassle and quickly. Although the interest rates are a little steep I still use the card frequently. I advise not being late on payments because they are not lenient on late payments and you will get charged. Other than that I would definitely recommend the card.

name: Kendall Tapp
review: About a year into my college career I saw various flyers around offering free subs, being a college student I went to check it out. Not realizing what was going on I ended up signing up for a credit card – what can I say I was young and didn’t really understand what I was doing. I choose to take the experience in stride and use it to build my credit. It was a negative experience to say the least! After overlooking my minimum payment one time my rate shot up to 29.99%. Now almost 6 years later of paying on time I still have not received a lower interest rate, and my credit was slashed by 75% in the wake of the 2008 crisis (I was told it was happening to everyone because it was “more expensive for the credit card companies”). Needless to say I rarely use this card and the only reason I still have it is because I don’t want to shatter my credit by closing this line.

name: Jimmy Jr.
review: At the time this might of sounded like a good idea, but now I learned I probably should of just paid cash.  I ended up applying for a Radio Shack Store Card because I wanted to buy some photography equipment.  I didn’t have enough cash at the time but I would of a few months later if I would of just waited.  I ended up buying $1500 in equipment including a camera and put it all on the store card.  With interest I paid about $500 over what I would of paid if I would of just had patience and waited.  I didn’t have any problems with the card and paid part of the balance every month, but it really wasn’t worth it since this was the only thing I was buying.  Buying photography equipment from Radio Shack probably wasn’t even the best idea anyways and using a credit card to get it was just stupid.

name: Ivonne Scheetz
review: I have had my Citi Thank You card for a little over a year now. After the first year the fees increased and others were added. While that is normal I regret getting this card now. Compared to several friends I have spoken about it with the fees are higher than many other cards. The costumer service personal are thankfully very helpful and are some of the nicest costumer service people I have ever worked with.  Once I pay off my outstanding debt on the card I plan on cutting it up and do not plan on getting another Citi Bank card anytime in the future.

name: Lloyd Witherell
review: I have had my Citi Hilton Honors Visa card for about a year now.  I have been thoroughly happy with it since receiving it.  I picked this card because I travel a lot and prefer to stay at Hilton Hotels.  Therefore, I have been able to acquire quite a few points for future stays at Hilton.  This card also has a zero yearly fee which is great compared to other points cards.  Also as soon as you spend $1,000 within 4 months of opening the account, you get 40,000 Hilton Honors points, which is awesome!  That’s reason alone to just get this card!  I highly recommend this card!

name: Mike Kaduce
review: This card was stolen from me and I needed to get in contact with Citi's customer service in order to resolve it. They had a very quick-responding fraud team that actually detected the fraud on their end and got in touch with me before I realized anything was wrong. That was impressive to me. Before that, I was happy with my card. The terms are fairly common for cards of this type, but any time I can extend my line of credit for no annual fee and help build up my credit score, I will take that opportunity! A great card that comes highly recommended, especially if you're not relying on it as your primary card. The points don't hurt, either!

name: Tim McLarney
review: I have had a Sears card for so long, I don't remember when I got it. It's not something I use all the time, because I don't do all my shopping at Sears, but for Craftsman tools, and the occasional appliance sale, or air conditioner sale; Sears is great, and the Sears card earns me a discount. The interest rates are reasonable, if you carry a balance at times, and it's nice to be "membership" fee free year-to-year. It's a fairly plain-vanilla card, but the customer service will take care of you if you have any issues, and it sure is nice to receive the extra discounts that come with the card use. Thank you, Sears!

name: Luke Thomas
review: The Citi Forward card is possibly one of the best cards to have for single living. You get 5X ThankYou points per dollar spent at restaurants, fast food, the cinema, theme parks, book stores, and more. Little did I know is that Amazon.com counts as a book store, so you can even get the bonus points there!The ThankYou rewards program is known for their extensive list of items they offer. Amazon has also recently accepted these points to pay for anything on their website. If you go out on dates, eat out, or shop online a lot, this versatile card is a must.Some of the other random perks:- Your APR goes down .25% every quarter you pay your bills on time and stay under your limit (max 2%)- A special "Price Rewind" program. If you pay for an electronic device using the card and the price goes down within 90 days, Citi will pay you the difference.- If you pay your cellular bill using the card, you get cell phone insurance for free.- 100 free points every month you pay your bill on time.

name: Kristin Hinson
review: This is by far my favorite credit card.  I’ve had this card since 2004.  I use it fairly regularly, not only at Best Buy, but anywhere credit cards are accepted.  Over this period of time, I have earned a very impress amount of “points”, which can be used for any purchase at Best Buy, including gift cards.  I would estimate, that I have gotten several hundred dollars in free merchandise from Best Buy, by redeeming my reward points for purchases.  I also receive member exclusive coupons in the mail every couple months.  These are high value, and very impressive coupons.  I’ve received some for $5 off ANY purchase, as well as $20 off ANY $50 coupon.  These are only for redemption at Best Buy, but because I shop there so frequently they come in very handy for me.  I would recommend this card for anyone looking for a credit card to use on a regular basis.  They offer impressive rewards, much better than any of my other credit cards!

name: Lenny Corman
review: Starting with the good stuff, Citibank is really good when you first take out your accounts with them. Upon being accepted you get your cards and welcome info VERY quickly so you can get started straight away. There are tons of ATMs you can use for free spread out around the country and their online services like their internet banking and phone app are great – really easy to use and I've never noticed any down time. With it being a big bank, however, you can expect to be treated like a statistic rather than a person - I've had to speak to customer service operatives a few times and while they do know what they're doing you are made to feel very much like you're asking a stupid question and they'd rather be doing something else. I have worked in a call center previously so I'm sure they're understaffed and under pressure to get through calls quickly but it's never good for the customer.

name: Morris Rieger
review: I applied for and received this card back in 2004, when I was 19 years old and looking to add a quality credit card to my wallet.  Back then, I chose the card because of its generous benefits: 5% cash back on gas, groceries, and if I remember correct, drugstores.  For everything else, they gave 1% cash back.  A few years ago, they changed the rewards program.  Now, 5% cash back is given on revolving categories that alternate on a quarterly basis.  The 1% has remained the same.  I have no complaints about the card: the customer service is great and there is no annual fee.  Once, I missed a payment by only one day.  After contacting customer service, they canceled the late fee and did not leave a negative report on my credit report.  The interest rate is rather high, but I recommend this credit card for anyone looking for a card with solid benefits.

name: Joey Bowen
review: I have had this card for four months, and received a $150 bonus in points. I’m impressed with the selection of available rewards and the reward rate is double other cards when you consider the annual bonus.  One point is roughly one cent for redemption purposes.  In addition to travel or cash rewards, the reward can be used at amazon, which is great for me.  I’m not impressed with the annual fee, and not sure if I’m going to be keeping the card past then.  But so far, it has been outstanding.  We have used this as our primary card.

name: Jacob Altermatt
review: This is a very good credit card overall and was my second credit card. I got it because I felt my other cards limit was not high enough to cover expenses. The bonus categories could be better but I have never had any major problems with Citi Card. The only issues that I felt I have had with them is when calling Customer Service I once or twice got a person with an accent too heavy to understand but lately I haven't had those issues and from what I recall Citi is going back to American call centers. Overall a good credit card for college students. Get it, you won't be disappointed. The rewards on the card are great and I expect will only get better with time.

name: Dionne Silloway
review: When my wife and I bought our new house, we needed to get some basic necessities.  We didn’t really want to take out a loan to get it all so we ended up at Sears and signed up for a Sear’s Store Credit Card.  We looked around and ended up purchasing a new refrigerator, mower, weed eater, and big screen TV.  The payments were set monthly and we just simply paid them every month with a set amount.  Now that I’m older, I most likely would not have signed up for the card to begin with.  The biggest problem I learned was there are no rewards.  What was the point of using a credit card on these items if I wasn’t getting rewarded for it.  I could of easily went the cheaper route and took out a signature loan at my local credit union.  Oh well, that was the last time I used the card and I don’t plan on using it again.

name: Yoshie Perre
review: The rewards on this card are phenomenal and I've never come across a better card in my life. Every month the rewards seem to be tailor-made for my spending, and it shows when I trade my points each time. The interest rate is awesome, the card is accepted everywhere and is never a problem, and there are many other special offers too. Whenever I've had to contact customer service, their personnel is professional and friendly every time. Their website is easy to use and tracking your spending is extremely simple. I highly recommend this card to everyone and especially those looking for great cash back.

name: Nick Lewis
review: About two and a half years ago before I entered college I applied for the Citi mtvU student credit card to start building my credit as early as possible.  That card eventually changed into the Citi Forward credit card which I still use as my primary credit card.  It has been everything I would want in a student credit card.  There have been no extra hidden fees and even when I couldn't make my full payment one month during the first year with this card I didn't have any extra fees to pay.  The rewards system has been great.  I've earned up to about $150 in rewards cards and amazon credit so far.  The only complaint I can think of with this card is the fact that my limit is only $800.  Otherwise I am completely satisfied with Citi.

name: Stephen Samuels
review: This is a great card to have when you travel.  The rewards add up very fast when you use the card at select hotels.  The redemption is also top notch for travel deals.  I don't use this card other than when traveling because I have credit cards that get better points on other things like restaurants and entertainment.  For travel though this is my number one card and I have become very acquainted with Hitlon as a result.  Never had any issues with the card and would recommend to anyone who travels a lot, or wishes they had more money to travel.

name: Jaylene H
review: This was my 2nd Credit Card and I've had it since I was 22. I absolutely love it. I've never had a problem with the billing or payments. It's super convenient and easy to use. I think I will probably have this card for many more years to come. The credit limit is perfect to my standards.  I love the Rewards that I have received and perks and benefits with using my card. I told myself I was going to only use it for emergencies but after I realized that it is super convenient to be able to pay the bill I am now using it for things to get rewards.  The customer service is great because they say your name as if they have known you or have spoken with you before. The one thing I didn't like was that I tried to change my credit limit but the process took a little long. But it was worth it. Thanks

name: Janet
review: In the beginning, I thought this bank was pretty great. I had no issues with my account, they provided great customer service, and seemed knowledgeable enough whenever I had to ask them multiple questions. I also love how I can just be in the city area and it isn't too hard for me to find a Citibank branch. However, I wanted to report some fraudulent charges on my account, which I was confident I'd be able to get them removed. However, it took me way longer than I had originally planned to even get them removed. Unlike another bank I also am a customer of, I had to actually make a call to make sure Citibank would remove them.

name: Akiko Marandi
review: I got this Citi card about a year and 1/2 ago in order to transfer my existing credit card balances and consolidate my credit card debt. I was surprised by a very nice credit limit when I applied and I haven't had any issues at all with the card. It's got a great time period for the introductory rates too which is what attracted me to it in the first place! I also love that it does not have an annual fee. I've also had good experiences dealing with their customer service, which I cannot say for some of my other cards. I highly recommend this card.

name: Vinita Nanes
review: This is a great card to use if you can make all your purchases each month on it and then pay them all off when the bill comes due. If you just use the card occasionally, the whole cash back angle is pretty insignificant. One of the good things that Citi seems to do in my experience is up the limit as long as you're using the card a lot.I got this card because I needed to buy a refrigerator and due to the price of the appliance, I got to take advantage of their introductory deal on the card where if you make a big purchase within a few months of opening the card, they give you a giant bonus.
