Even if you have the money on hand to make the large purchase anyway, it's worth it to use the card to buy the item because you get a hundred dollar bonus after the intro period is over.Outside of the cash-back angle, it's a pretty standard credit card. If you're looking for a backup card that might sit in your wallet, unused for years and is just for emergencies, this probably isn't the card to go for. But otherwise, seeing the cash back you get over time is fun.

name: Mindy Overlin
review: My experience with this credit card has been good over the years. I've enjoyed getting American Airlines miles for all of my purchases and hopefully soon will have enough for a free flight. They have a good website for viewing your statement and account and even paying your bill online. The times that I have needed to reach out to Customer Service for questions they have been very responsive in a timely manner. I think I have an annual fee though so that is the only negative thing that I can think of since I have other credit cards with no annual fee. So I guess it depends on how many purchases you make to make it worth while. Overall I recommend it.

name: Sam Uliano
review: I will be honest: I hate the thought of having a credit card. I don't know nearly enough about them or finances in general to be responsible for something, but this card makes it easy. I got laid off a couple of months ago, and not having to worry about fees is a huge bonus, plus the whole no interest for 18 months is especially sweet for someone in my position. I can keep track of my money responsibly. I was somewhat nervous at first, however, about switching to Mastercard as I have always had a Visa before. But I found that there is almost no difference between the two-- everyone says Visa is available in more places, but I haven't run into anywhere yet where Mastercard wasn't also accepted. I've lived all over the country and traveled all over as well and I still get service everywhere. If you are nervous about going with a credit card, this might be your best option. It was mine.

name: Sharon Tucci
review: Hi,  I've had a few major credit cards over the decades (Fidelity, Citibank), but decided last year to try a new one.  I applied for an LL Bean Visa Card, and though it seemed to me that such store-named credit cards seem a little hokey, the terms seemed good so I thought I'd give it a try.  I started using it around the holidays, and have to say that it saved me a bundle of money for the holidays.  Not only does it provide free shipping ALWAYS, I earned several coupons for anything I ordered.  Not only do they accept coupons toward future purchases, but they accept more than one coupon toward an individual purchase.  That practice is nearly unheard of these days.  Also, for the coupons I didn't use, they have a wide time frame before they expire.  Not only does LLBean offer quality products, but I find their card to be a quality card.  While it's not my first "go-to credit card for most household charges, it offers alot and can come in handy and save money in certain situations.

name: Buford Huckeby
review: The Citi Bank Simplicity card is just that; a simple card. No hassles, no complicated usage requirements for awards or miles or anything. There’s no annual fee, and fairly standard values for interest rate charges, balance transfers, and the other normal categories we consumers should be comparing. CitiBank is a good business, aside from their fee hungry banking services, and their great customer service carries over into their credit card operation. I have had quite a few cards thus far in my life, and most have been pretty good. I don’t apply for cards from companies which aren’t good. You shouldn’t either. Reward the card companies you feel are good by using their product, and get rid of the cards you don’t like. Get yourself a Citi card, and you will appreciate the difference. Citi Bank will make you feel wanted, and the Simplicity card will treat you right.

name: Shenika Konye
review: I have been very happy with this card. I have had it for at least 2.5 years and it has yet to fail me. My husband and I try not to use my credit cards very often, but when we do, this is the card we use. I used this card to transfer from another account because of the great balance transfer rate. The Citi protection/monitoring plans are a great plus, for, though I haven't had any issues to deal with, knowing that my information is being monitored gives me peace of mind. All in all, this is a great card, belonging to a GREAT company!

name: Adrienne Vanwyngaarden
review: I have the Sears credit card and it is not bad too have.  I don’t have a bunch of credit cards and this is very handy for emergencies.  I have a house so therefore if an emergency pops up unexpectedly and I need to purchase an appliance or repair something I can always go to sears for that purpose.  The APR is high but I did call and get it lowered.  They do allow this if you are consistent and on time with your payments.  Payments are not high but the more you pay the quicker it will get paid off.  Another good thing about the card is now they offer vacations.  You can get deals and put vacations on layaway.  So overall I think it is in okay card for emergency purposes anyway.

name: Zina Raike
review: I've had the Citi rewards card for many years now.  Because of the good amount of rewards you can accrue I use it for absolutely everything from grocery shopping, monthly bills, you name it. With every credit card the trick is to live within your means and only buy what you can afford to pay off. If carrying a balance the rewards will do you no good. In my situation I'm actually making money with this card because I spend a lot on it, get a lot of rewards from it but pay no annual fee or interest rate charges. Good card if you play it smart!

name: Mitzi Byam
review: My citi credit card is the only card I use. We're very good about paying off our balance monthly so we never have to worry about the interest rate. The rewards points aren't as good as they used to be but considering we don't pay  interest charges, they're a great bonus. You can get them in the form of gift cards to various places.  Recently we got one to Home Depot, other times we've gotten them as gas cards or for other retailers. I really don't see myself changing credit cards. It serves our purposes just fine. Our credit max is very generous and customer service has always been polite.

name: Matthew Beal
review: This isn't the first credit card I have had, but it was the first rewards card I applied for and boy is it a good one. I primarily shop through the internet, mainly Amazon.com. Why do I bring that up? Because part of the perks of this card is that this card is that you get 5 reward points per dollar spent on entertainment, restaurants, and book stores. And guess what Citi counts as a bookstore? That's right, Amazon. The rewards points stack up fairly quickly and they have an excellent amount of option to redeem them on. Customer service with the card is exceptionally fast, polite, and overall helpful. They are also very generous on the credit line. I would highly recommend applying for this card if you do a lot of purchasing from amazon and are looking for a good rewards card.

name: Todd Shanburn-Bryson
review: I have had this card in the past. I do travel a lot but there are cards out here that offer a lot more in terms of earning power. Also the customer service experience I had was terrible. I called them about a suspected identity theft, I was told that I would have to purchase a seperate product in order to be protected against identity theft. I was over $50.00 per month. They did however refund my money from the theft after much debate. I would not recommend this card due to the fact that their customer service seems to based in a foreign country and they are very hard to understand.

name: Aisha Menso
review: As someone who does their mortgage primarily through citi, this card is quite the godsend. My family and I frequent Los Angeles quite a bit, so the fact that the Hiltons are all listed makes it a great card to take trips to Disneyland with. The points rate is quite nice and I hardly find any issue trying to redeem points when I choose to do so, that is to say using the card is mostly headache free when redeeming the bonus points. Which in my book is a large boon. If you're looking for something to take family vacations on this is the card to do it with.

name: Afsal Ismail
review: Citibank has been the worst bank experience ever. I recently traveled to Brazil and had fraudulent transactions in my account. Citibank decided it was a good idea to authorize $800+ worth of ATM withdrawals within several minutes, whereas if I had tried to withdraw anything over $500 back in New York, a stop would be placed on my account. Dealing with customer service in an international country resulted to a continuous loop of service representatives. After 45 minutes it took to sort everything, my cellphone carrier dropped a $90 fee for international roaming even though it was a collect call in which Citi accepted all charges. I never got reimbursed for this situation.

name: Ed Ross
review: My Citi Thank you card has been my primary credit card for several years now. Citi's customer servcie has been good to me, and I appreciate the rewards. I usually pay my card off within the grace period to avoid interest charges. The website is easy to navigate and find what I need when I log on. I like the fact that rewards can be used for in-store purchases, through the Thank You website, and through Amazon.com directly at check out. My points don’t usually get a chance to add up to much, because I used them so often for small incidental purchases when I feel like I want a little something.

name: Dan
review: I’ve had my Citibank card for almost 1 year now.  We initially opened the account to take advantage of an 18 month interest free period.  We made some major purchases on the card in order to make improvements to our home.  The card is accepted everywhere, and the online account system is navigation friendly and easy to use.  All in all, I’ve been quite happy with this card.  Account representatives have been friendly and easy to deal with.  I anticipate keeping this card open, even after the balance transfer period expires.   We were given a very fair interest rate, and that is the primary reason that we will stay with this card.

name: Nichole Lakey
review: I have had a student checking account with Citibank for the past 3 years. The process for getting the account was very easy, and customer service was excellent in this area. In general, the terms of this account are very good. There is no monthly fee for the checking account, which I like. One area that I am less than pleased with is their customer service related to issues with the account. At one point, my debit card number had been phished from a website and several fraudulent charges were made to my account, which caused my account to overdraft. Citibank was willing to remove the charges made, but did not want to refund the overdraft charges (which amounted to over $200). It took several hours on the phone, moving up the ranks of customer service until someone was willing to help me with that issue. Overall, Citibank provides average customer service. They are great if you never have an issue with your account. If you do have an issue, be prepared to spend many hours on the phone sorting it out.

name: Alisha Bacon
review: Citibank was a very average bank for me. From the first time I went in, they were only so-so. The application process was very confusing and required a lot more time and paperwork than my previous bank, which I wasn't a fan of. I also had to wait quite awhile to be seen to get the account opened by a bank manager. The process went smoothly from there, but then once we actually started banking there, some of their policies surprised us. We had limits on withdrawals, which we weren't told about up-front. We had outrageous charges if we used an out of network ATM, and they liked to nitpick over every little thing. Overall, they weren't horrible, but not fantastic either, just very, very average.

name: Melissa Glenn
review: We are very happy with this card. We have had it for more than two year and it has become our primary card because of the excellent customer service and benefits. We originally chose this card because of the 18 months of no interest. We have transferred balances from our other cards because of the excellent promotional rates - 0%! That has saved us an enormous amount of money. The customer service department has called us several times to check on "unusual" charges which we greatly appreciate. One was actually a fraudulent charge being made from a foreign country. They immediately erased the charge and put a fraud notice on our account. I think we will definitely stick with this card for a long time to come!

name: Karen Dumaine
review: I use this card because of the points.  I travel with my daughter frequently for soccer tournaments and the using the points for hotel stays saves us quite a bit of money.  They areas that we travel to for tournaments have always had Hilton as an option for us to stay, that is why I went with this card.  I make 6 points for every dollar I spend at the hotel and 3 points on gas (we drive to the tournaments) and 2 points on all our other spending.  So over all having this card has been very worthwhile.  I would recommend this card if you want to save money on travel.

name: John Jameson
review: I have a few credit cards with Citibank and I have only had 1 issue in the past five years. The rewards incentives are great and the customer service goes above and beyond to straighten out any potential issues you have. The one incident I am referring to is an attempted identity theft incidence. The culprit was only able to charge a $100 or so to the card before the customer service at Citibank recognized it as credit card fraud. Apparently the guy had used my card to make several iTunes purchases and also bought something from Amazon. Thanks to a cooperation between Citibank, Amazon, and the local authorities they were able to track down this jerk to his house. Needless to say he was arrested. Citibank returned all my money. Proud to say I will remain a customer of theirs for a while.

name: Jason Hadley
review: Like many folks, I use this card primarily for the rewards, which are Hilton Honors points that are earned when making purchases.  My job requires some travel, which generates additional expenses that I am reimbursed for through the normal operations of my job.  That allows me to earn additional points.  Fortunately, Visa is accepted virtually everywhere and there are a number of scenarios where you can earn bonus points using this card.  I've never had any troubles with the card and the company has always abided by the terms of the credit card agreement.  I have found this to be a good card, with lots of earning potential, and unlimited usage opportunities.

name: Rachel R
review: I use my Citi Simplicity card for the balance transfer offers. When I originally signed up, I got 0% interest for 18 months with a 3% balance transfer fee. I saved hundreds by using the money to pay off my home improvement loan. Right now it seems they have less and less balance transfer offers. Luckily, they are still at 3% for the balance transfer fee, because one of my other Citi cards went to 4%. The offers are usually for about 12 months no interest, which they usually have offers for 15 months no interest. I also like the Citi Deals, it seems the “Daily Deal” is actually a really good deal and stuff I would want to buy. Overall, I am happy with my card and will continue to take advantage of their balance transfer offers for a cheap source of cash.

name: Marylin Blada
review: This is a really nice card. There are nice advantages for the first few months which allow you not to pay too much interest if you go in debt. I find it very easy to check my balance with the online website and very easy as well to pay my bills. The citi rewards go up pretty fast and they offer some nice rewards. Overall I am really satisfied with this card and would recommend it. It is my first credit card and given that I'm a beginner and yet manage to go through life without any credit card debt so far shows that this card is really good for students or young adults.

name: Jasmine C
review: I just recently applied for this checking account and was approved without any problems. They sent me my card and all the information on my account in three days! Three days! That's crazy fast. I like how they have a lot of security and how I can do all of my banking online without having to set foot in a bank. This is important to me as I don't have a Citibank branch close-by. There are many free ATMs that you can use to deposit and withdraw money. These ATMs can be found in any 7-11 or Publix, which, again, is very convenient to me since I can get money wherever I am. They also have a great app that allows me to check my account balance and activity, transfer money, and even make a check deposit through my mobile! I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great bank that is mostly online.

name: John Johnson
review: I am very happy that I decided to apply for the City Simplicity card.  It has been one of the best cards that I have used.  I really liked the 0% interest on purchases for the first 18 months.. Also, when I have other cards with higher rates, I love to transfer my balances to this card, where I can take advantage of the 0% interest for 18 months on balance transfers!  I forgot to make a payment one time and gave them a call, and they had no problem letting it slide that time.  They were very helpful and I am glad I decided to get this card!

name: Winterlich Feather
review: I've had my Citi Dividend Platinum Select Credit Card for 5 years now and I can say this is my favorite credit card that I own. I love the low interest, the excellent customer service and the generous cashback. I find myself earning cashback twice a year ($100), just for using my card. And my interest rate has dropped from 11.24% to 5.99%, which is very low. Customer service always wants to help in any situation possible. They have helped me win disputes, gave me extra time to pay and gave me courtesy credits for being a valued member. Now that's what I call customer service. The online interface is easy to use, as is the Citi app I downloaded. I pay all of my payments & check my balances via the app and online. Combine all of this with no annual fee and you have the perfect credit card.

name: Filipe Lebre
review: The Citi Thank you card is great for people with fair to good credit. Their rewards are comparable to other cards and over time you can redeem it for an item. You can also use the points to reduce your balance. When I had this card, I did not have to make a payment for over a year, which was a plus. This allowed me to catch up on other Bills, as most of us nowadays have to anyway. Their customer service department is attentive and friendly. I would recommend this card mainly because its associated with one of the biggest names and companies in the credit card world. Best of luck to any of you out there that decide to go with it!

name: Bill Ziola
review: I'm pretty happy with this Preferred Card. I just keep it for emergencies really, but the few times I had to call customer service they were always polite and helpful, which is a BIG plus for me. I was even a month late on my payment one time, due to a family emergency situation, and they were extremely helpful in working with me (of course, I caught up as quick as I could and now after that experience, I realize how important it is to have a back-up plan, which is why I use it now only when I must, I don't want to ruin my credit and that experience came close to that. I'm so thankful to Citi Diamond for working with me!)

name: Agatha Androde
review: Seriously the best card out there hands down. The rewards system is top notch so I tend to use this card with absolutely everything I purchase. Very low APR which doesn't have me worrying to pay off the balance every month. Best part of the card compared to the premier is the no annual fee while the Premier has $125 in yearly fees. And with their $5 points per dollar for the first 12 months you can really rack up the bonus points. Overall I would for sure highly recommend this card. While it may not be the best rewards card out there, overall combined with such a low APR it for sure is worth it compared to Discover and AmEx.

name: Rachel R
review: I used to use this card all the time because of the balance transfers. They used to have balance transfer offers one after another, with terms better than most in the industry. I would use the money to pay off higher interest debt. They would charge 3% fee plus 0% interest, generally for 12-18 months. Now within the last few months I have seen less offers from them (and my credit score is the same, I monitor my score) and for shorter amounts of time, usually 6-12 months. They even had one offer that was charging 4% for the fee. I am not sure if the market is changing, or what is going on, but I am not sure if I will be using them much anymore if they do start charging 4% for a balance transfer and for a shorter amount of time. They were my “go to” for an easy balance transfer, but not so sure anymore.

name: Peggie Weible
review: I have had this card for a couple of years now, and I have been very pleased with it so far.  I first got it because I was planning on buying an expensive television, and I knew I would reach 1000 dollars within three months so I would be eligible for 150 dollar gift card.  This was a great deal for me.  The rewards points really do add up and there are a surprising number of retailers that you get points for.  The application process was relatively painless and I received my new card promptly.  I have had instances where I was out of town and making multiple purchases and received a call to make sure that I had not been a victim of fraud.  This is good and I feel secure using this card.  I would recommend this card for anybody.

name: Bob Regin
review: When I lived in the Kansas City area I briefly had an account with Citibank. I say only briefly because they certainly did not live up to my expectations. The checking account I had seemed fine but then without notifying me they switched me to a different type of account that charged a monthly fee. When asked how this happened without my consent they said they sent me something in the mail (which I never received) that authorized the change. I immediately closed my account with them. I will never be using them again and I will be recommending that everyone else does the same.

name: Eleonor Wyche
review: Hello,I've had an LL Bean credit card for about seven years.  I have never mssed a payment, as a matter of fact, I pay off my balance each and every month.  My credit score rating is excellent.  The $10 bonus that can be applied to my LL Bean store orders has been very helpful and there have been times (many) that because of the bonus, I've received articles of clothing for free.  Nice gift!  However, because I pay my entire balance each month, I've never really paid attention to the interest rate applied to me.  I did check to see what interest rate I would be paying if I were to keep a balance and was shocked to find that my interest rate is set at 13.99%.   I feel this is ridiculously high given my credit rating is over 800 and that I've never missed a payment.  So, for anyone considering applying for an LL Bean credit card, please take this into conideration.

name: Bob Dean
review: I remember the first time I opened a Citibank account. I tried to get a bank account at other banks, but they wanted to charge so many extra fees. I tried Citibank and they were the right choice for me. They sat me down and took me through the entire process. If I had any questions they explained them to me. I'll never forget the look on the bank teller’s face when I said I wanted to open an account. She was so friendly and I couldn't be happier with my decision. The overdraft protection is a must for me, because sometimes I tend to go over my spending limit.

name: Nams
review: The CITI AA Visa card is a great addition to my wallet and ever since I got this card, I have been using it for making most of my purchases. When I applied I earned 50,000 bonus miles after making some initial purchases. This helped me pay off my Airline tickets for my family vacations and trust me this was great. Their website is very informative and it actually breaks down your spending in different categories and this helps me gauge where I spend more. The best part was that they waived off my annual fee for the second year. Their customer service is very professional and they really take up your queries and concerns promptly. I have never had any issues with them and overall it’s been a great experience.

name: Kyle McCullough
review: I got a Sears credit card about 7 years ago when I stopped in a store one time and was asked if I would like to open one. To my surprise, I got approved for a high limit, which enabled me to purchase more and quickly pay it off. While the interest rate was rather kind of high, it was still lower than other cards I currently have. Probably because of my high interest rate, I did have a security issue at one point in which I used the card multiple times in 1 day on high-value products. I then received a phone call from the security department of the credit card and was asked to verify the charges were really from me. After verifying the charges, my card was automatically set to go again. It was very convenient to know that they were watching out for me and making sure my card was not stolen. Other than that security incident, I have not had any other issues or troubles with this card at all. As long as you keep paying off the card, the interest rate isn't too much of a hassle to deal with.

name: Dave
review: I have had this card for years and I have never had a problem. I only use it for purchases of $300 *or* more so I can get 0% deferred financing. This card is great if you have some big purchases to make. But be sure to pay your balance off before the promo rate expires. Otherwise, they will hit you with ALL of the interest that built up during that time. People on this board are so upset that their payments only pay down 0% balances while any other balances accrue interest. But that is how ALL credit cards work and it is stated in the terms of use. Payments will always be applied to balances with lower interest. It is not a big secret. As for the people that opened accounts for their irresponsible children, who then maxed out the cards and defaulted... lesson learned. If your kid has terrible credit and can not open an account, then they probably should not have another credit account. Your children should be ashamed of themselves. That is why our economy is teh way it is, banks were willing to issue credit to people that could not handle it. I have never had a problem with the customer service. But I make all of my payments on time and I am in good standing with them. So why would they be rude to me? Bottom line... this card is great for people that are responsible enough to handle it. The deferred financing is very convenient, especially when it is for 18 months.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: The Citi thank you card is an okay card. Like all rewards cards they pretty much offer the same thing. 1 point per dollar spent. Notbpad.. but you need so many points in order to cash in on something worth a crap. As in any rewards card the interest is a little higher (because of the rewards) but not ridiculously high as to where you would not want to have this card. I have never had any trouble with billing or charges or anything along them lines. Like I said, decent card. It has the Citi name which in itself tells you a lot.

name: Luigi Primeau
review: Applying for the Citi Simplicity card was one of the easiest and most rewarding things I have done online. I can not count how many times I used this card in a pinch when I needed it, and Citi has always been very prompt on any service issues or complaints that I had. My Citi card has easily, by far, the most simple balance transfer system I have ever used, and it definitely saved me quite a bit of money before I ever even started using the card regularly. I recommend Citi Simplicity to anyone looking for a direct, easy to use card that you can really depend on the service of, and also to anyone looking for a balance transfer.

name: Jordhy Ledesma
review: I used this bank heavily in the Caribbean. Their international presence is notable and their agents are always well trained. You can trust that their cards will be some of the most expensive ones but they also give you huge expending limits so there's the trade off.Indeed, Citibank is a nice brand and having a checking account with them is very nice if you need to move money overseas like I did. I don't recommend the credit card though; probably one from Bank of America will be better or an American Express will have more loyalty prizes. I find that Citibank cards don’t reward loyalty as much. Well, a final comment: lines were huge at this bank! Even though they have a large international footprint, there were only a couple of branches per city, so those fill up pretty quickly. So make this decision mindfully.

name: Tyler Kmiechick
review: I've owned this card for about 2 years. I've actually really enjoyed it, the limit is high enough that I can buy big ticket items when I went but not so exorbitantly high that if it got stolen somebody could go buy a few cars and a limo out on the town. What I really like is the rewards points, as long as you pay off your credit each month you basically accrue free money just by using the card. You can redeem the points for either cash or an item (they have a huge selection to choose from). If you choose cash you obviously don't get as much as if you were to purchase an item, however you can use it to pay off some of your bill which is nice as well.

name: Freddie Obregón
review: The Citi® Dividend Platinum Select® Visa® Card is quite amazing.  I had to call to apply for this card, and when I was approved the helpful customer service agent rewarded me with a sincere “Congratulations!”.  The card holder receives a portion of cash back for each time the card is used, and the cash back amount needs to reach $50 at the statement time in order for a check to be issued.  However, the card owner must submit a request for the check to be sent.  Additionally, the minimum monthly payment can be as low as $20, so with both the cash back option and a cheap minimum monthly payment this card is an ideal option for consumers on tight budgets.

name: John Johnson
review: I've had this card for quite a few years now and it has been a very good card.  I basically use this card in case of emergencies.  The first time I used it, my truck broke down and I didn't have enough money to pay for the repairs.  So I used this card to pay for the repairs while it was still under the intro period, which was great because it let me pay it off with 0% interest!  The nice thing about this car, is there's no hidden fees or annual fees.  It is all straight forward, which is what I really like.  I have only had to call customer service once for an issue I had, and they were very friendly and took care of it so I wasn't charged extra.

name: John Connor
review: After getting my first job, I needed a bank where I could deposit my paychecks. I searched around online and read reviews of various banks and decided Citibank was the best option. Since then I have not looked back. My experience with Citibank has been absolutely fantastic. The bank has very low fees compared to other banks and has never mischarged me for anything. Also, the customer service has been great. My checking account had charges I didn’t remember making and I called Citibank customer service. It turns out the information was stolen and someone was withdrawing from my account. The representative helped me over the phone and reversed all the charges from my account. I highly recommend Citibank to anyone looking for a new bank.

name: Eliza Prescott
review: Out of all my cards, this one is the one I worry about the least. It came with 0% APR for the first year, which was great, and now the APR sits at a cool 12% and I've never had to deal with any huge fees either. Recently, I needed to rent a car for a vacation, and found out that through this card, not only am I offered a rental car insurance plan that's actually better than what the rental car office was offering, but they also give you a discount if you rent with Hurtz. It's not even a paltry discount--when I used this card combined with another coupon that Hurtz was offering, my car rental price dropped by almost HALF. I like cards with perks, and not many of them are offered to younger people. I'm sad that it seems like it's no longer being offered to new applicants!

name: mary faulkner
review: BE CAREFUL! That is my best advice on this card! I have had this card now for 6 years and it is so hard not to use it and once you do it takes forever to pay off. Best Buy often has promotions offering no interest for one year but the catch is your credit card has to be at a 0 balance and all that amount must be paid off in that year otherwise it will be compounded and added onto your bill. If you have a previous balance your payment goes to that first therefore you would have to essentially pay off your entire credit card within that time frame for it to truly be interest free for a year. I know I shouldn't spend on it but I was you and the amount I spent 6 years ago I am still paying off!

name: Debbi Brattain
review: I've had a Universal Card account for over 15 years.  However, I'm very surprised that with my good credit history and LONG standing good credit, that when I wanted to try a balance transfer their interest rate was a walloping 5%.  This is not the way to treat a long standing customer, in my opinion.  While my credit limit with them is very large (Over $30,000), I am stymied as to why they wouldn't offer me a lower rate.  I even called them, and though their customer service answered quickly, and was professional and nice, they were unable to change or alter the offer in any way.  I still plan on keeping the card, and I'm hoping my lodged complaint will get me a better offer in the future, but I don't think I'm going to give them too many more chances.

name: Denisse Millan
review: I applied for the best buy credit card, around 4 years ago. I tried to apply through the website, but for some reason I was denied. I decided to go in the store, and try my luck there. I went asked for an extended lunch break at work, and I drove myself to the local best buy. I filled everything out, and was immediately approved with a credit limit of $1500 dollars. So I immediately went and chose my dream computer. I was on a plan with 18 months no interest, it was absolutely fantastic. After, I paid off my computer I bought some other stuff around the house. After having it for a few years my credit with them is raised up to around a few thousand dollars. It is a great card to have around the holidays, and makes those expensive electronic purchases at your fingertips reach.

name: Gary Bridges
review: I applied for and received this card back in March of 2008. This is a very good credit card for the first time credit card holder, or college student. It is accepted anywhere Visa is, so you shouldn't have any issues using it whether you are going to school within the town you grew up, or if you are going to school across the country. Also, as long as you are responsible by making payments on time this card has no interest for the first 6 months. Very handy if you need time between paychecks to get essentials such as food and gas. Speaking of getting essentials, this card also has a pretty good reward program where you can earn anywhere from 1-5 points per dollar spent depending on what you purchase! This is really good if you need to purchase books for the semester because you earn 5 points per dollar spent at bookstores. And during finals week when you don't feel like cooking and you end up going out to a restaurant or ordering takeout from restaurants, then you can also get that 5 points per dollar spent. Overall this was a very good starter card for me who was only purchasing the essentials every month and buying my books from the bookstore. It was very manageable for the payments (as long as you don't go overboard) and was very good at making sure I understood everything within the disclosures and "fine print". I would recommend this card to anyone who was looking to open up their first credit card account.

name: jason buonomo
review: I got a sears card 10 years or so ago when I bought my first lawn mower.  Initially, I had a $1000 limit, but over time my limit has increased to $4,000 with minimal to below average usage.  Typically, I make a big purchase with it, pay it off over a year, and then buy something else.  The interest rate is actually lower than some of my other credit cards, so I actually prefer to use this for my appliances/ electronics, etc.  Administratively, I have never had any issues with them, billing or otherwise. To be actually honest, I don’t even think I have ever had to call them about anything.  Add in all the special perks and sales, and you have a winner.  Highly recommended.

name: Kristin Foss
review: I have had this card for years. Since 2006, I believe. I got it as a broke college student, and used it to cover expenses that my loans and part time job would not cover. This is not to say I spent entirely responsibly. As my balance grew, they kept extending my credit, until it was way up there. I finally reached the limit, and am paying it off. I got lucky, my APR is nice and low, making it much easier to pay off, but that is only because I opted out of the change in terms that would have kicked it up to 19%. But since I have been a card holder for so long, in the rare times that I am late on a payment, they return the service charge, and are very polite and helpful (albeit, they are almost always in India). I would recommend this card to you if you can get the APR low.

name: Mayank Sharan
review: Not recommended if you are not a citizen/gc holdder!

name: WalletHub
review: That's very interesting, usually credit card companies only ask for your Social Security Number.  Would love to hear more about your experience with this card.

name: Michelle Lynn
review: If you travel a lot and stay in hotels then this credit card is a good choice. You can earn free nights at Hilton hotels which can be a big money saver for spending money on things you already buy. Hilton hotels are not usually cheap and they are generally nicer hotels so it is worth it to earn the free nights to use if you need to travel, or just want to get away for the weekend. The interest rate isn't the best so I would recommend to pay more than your minimum balance each month so you're not paying a ton of interest.

name: Won Lee
review: always pay full for cards like this.   if you can't pay your CC full, pick up a bluebird debit and use it wisely.

name: Melody Hafenstein
review: My Citi Simplicity Card has been one of the better credit decisions I’ve made. One of the best attributes of this card is that it has 0% interest on items for an extended period of time. Another amazing attribute of this card is that they have no late fees, no annual fees, and no penalty fees. This is great because every so often I can get behind on my payments and not having a fee every time I’m late definitely saves me money. They also have terrific customer service. They were able to answer all my questions about using my credit card abroad and they ensured me it would work without a problem, and they were right! Simplicity Citi is a great credit card to have and I highly recommend it.

name: Cat Logan
review: The Citi Thank You Card was an excellent credit card. The reward points were great as they can be used in so many different ways with so many different companies. Personally I usually just cashed them in and applied the amount to my balance. The card had a 0% intro rate which was excellent. I did not transfer any balances using this card or take a cash advance so I can't comment on either of those features. Citi is an excellent company to use as they have great customer service. If you can get approved for this card I would highly recommend it.

name: Mike Kaduce
review: This is a credit card for which I applied when I opened my account at our local Citi Bank branch. As with all other cards I've had in the past, I applied for this card in order to build credit. I wanted also to have a backup plan in case I was in a situation without cash. Since I use it now, I'm within the first year and I have not had to pay an annual fee. In the case of annual fees, most credit cards I have and have used in the past do not have one, so for this reason I will not renew the card. It was an attractive offer at the time since there was no annual fee, otherwise late fees and other features of this card are pretty run of the mill. Since it's linked to my bank account at Citi, it makes it convenient to check my balance and this is a card that has gotten a lot of use from me as of late. I would recommend it, at the very least for the first year. After that I would cancel since the annual fee is relatively high.

name: Thomas Cogswell
review: I just spent 30 minutes trying to negotiate the phone tree, entering my number repeatedly, all in order to inform the MC folks of foreign travel.   But they have repeatedly erased the info -- so the account is frozen.I THINK I have finally gotten things straighten out but what a complete bunch of incompetents! Why would anyone work with them if you have an option.RUN SCREAM FROM THEM!

name: philip
review: Citibank was great when I needed a new credit card for travelling aboard. Since Europe mostly uses a chip and pin system as opposed to the bar codes seen in the United States I needed to get a new credit card. Citibank is one of the few US banks that have such cards and were extremely helpful in providing me with a new credit card. All calls I made to their customer service department were answered quickly and the vast majority of those in the service center were helpful, and if they did not know the answer to a question they quickly pushed me through to someone who did. They made everything incredibly easy for me and I would definitely get another credit card from them.

name: Chelsea Monroe
review: I quite enjoy this card.  I have no major qualms about it.  The online payment site is easy to use.  Setting up automatic payment through my bank was easy too.  I love how great their customer service is.  The rewards service is great too, especially for a first credit card.  Super easy to keep track of what points I have earned.  The fees are laid out from the beginning.  I've yet to have a hidden or new fee that wasn't given full and proper notice from day 1.  I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a good company that is easy to deal with.

name: Jinxy Bear
review: I am very happy with my Citi Forward Card.  The introductory period is a little longer than most cards and even without special offers, rewards add up very quickly!  I like that you can use rewards bucks to pay your bill.  This is something more companies should allow.  The interest rates are fair and I have never been charged any interest or fees I didn’t understand.  This would be a good card for those looking to establish or improve their credit because your interest rate can be lowered by simply paying on time month after month or even by paying your bill in full regularly.  Other card companies could really take a lesson from Citi Forward!

name: Doug Miller
review: I have had a Shell Credit Card for years. It is the one card that I don’t see myself getting rid of. There are a few expenses that you can’t avoid, so why not maximize your benefits and rewards while purchasing them? I used to struggle to know exactly how much I spent on gas every month because you don’t always fill up on the same day of the week and the prices constantly change, so I got this card to use just for gas purchases. The card can be used for all kinds of purchases but the biggest benefit from it was the bonus rewards for fuel purchases. I pay the card off every month and have a nice record of my fuel purchases. Their site is very easy to use and the one time I lost my card, they got me a replacement very quickly.

name: Diana Schara
review: I am fairly new to the Citi Diamond Preferred card, but thus far I am very very pleased with it.  I don't like to use a credit card if I don't have to but it is very nice to have a card with so many perks and a great interest rate and no annual fee!    No interest for 18 months and also zero interest on balance transfers for that 18 months, makes a great tool in consolidating and paying off other cards.  My Citi Diamond Preferred Card is accepted literally everywhere I shop and wonderful to have now for the holiday season. I am hoping to get down to just one credit card that I can use if I have an emergency or something else unexpected happening that was not budgeted for, and this card is helping me to do just that.

name: Jesse Will
review: I've had the Best Buy credit card for a little over a year now and so far I am happy with them. I had a small credit history when I applied with them. It was almost a year of history but they approved me with a $300 credit limit and $59 annual fee when I got the card. I did not activate the card and called them to get rid of it but they said they can waive half of the annual fee. I agreed to this since I’m building my credit. They also gave me a 6 months no interest promotion. After 6 months they increased my limit 100% to $600 which I never asked for. Overall I am very happy with this card and recommend it to all of my friends.

name: Jenn McCormick
review: I have used a Citi Diamond Preferred card for over a decade. Through the years, I have raised the spending limit to more than I'd ever need to spend in a lifetime. I have transferred balances to this card during excellent promotions offered at different times of the year. I have never utilized any types of rewards system with this card, as I just don't use it often enough for purchases to make it account for anything. Interests rates for this card are great, as long as you make your payments on time and take advantage of the promotional percentages for transfers and things. I feel confident using my Citi Diamond Preferred Card, and have even been contacted by them once when I was on vacation to confirm that I was, in fact, the one using the card.

name: Veronica Ruggiero
review: After having a lot of issues with a previous bank, I switched over to Citibank. It was honestly the best decision I've made in a long time. Citibank is very convenient for me, only 5 minutes away. I appreciate the drive up ATM, and the easy banking when you go to a teller. You can get your money from any ATM in a 7-11 store, which has been a life saver to me. Customer support is always available, and I feel good knowing that. When I've come close to overdrafting, they called me up to let me know. There are no fees since I have a student account, which works in my favor. I would highly recommend this bank.

name: Paul Witree
review: I love my Citi Thank You Card just mostly because of the fact that I don’t have to make payments for the first 15 months and that makes it perfect for a new card holder around Christmas! I know I shouldn’t spend so much on credit but you have to splurge a bit on the holidays. They make my life really easy and at least I can say that I’m earning points. They have a modest 1 point per one dollar reward system that isn’t anything to over look. Its always worth getting those free points when you are going to spend the money anyway. The freedom to by what I want when I need it (like gifts for the kids) is so valuable to me I feel like this card has really saved the day this year.

name: Kristen Gardiner
review: I applied for this card a little over a year ago.  I really wanted a card that offered the benefit of 0% interest on balance transfers.  Once I received this card, I transferred a $1,000 balance and was able to save a lot of money on interest payments.  It was a lifesaver.  I was able to have a better handle on my debt and now I have paid it off.  It was nice to have this credit card as a backup, too.  I thought the online site was very convenient and user friendly.  Anytime I had a question, I received a prompt answer.  That makes it a lot easier for me to manage my money and not waste my time.  I recommend this card.

name: Trey Redding
review: The Citi Forward Card was one of my first credit cards. The ability to quickly accumulate rewards is what initially drew me to the card. After reading all of the disclosures, the deal was sealed. The fact that I could accumulate rewards so fast, without hidden fees made the choice a no-brainer for me. I love the fact that I can spend money on things I need using the card, and receive rewards which I can use for the things I want but maybe would not spend money on if it ha to come out of my normal monthly budget. That is my main reasoning for using this card to pay for 80% of my monthly expenditures. I would recommend this card to anyone looking to do the same, and receive great rewards in the process.

name: Ila Hallerman
review: The Citi Forward card is an excellent credit card and I love the benefits that come with it. First, there really are no hidden fees or surprises at any times which is definitely a plus. Another excellent benefit of this card is the cash back. There are hundreds of purchases you can make each month that Citi offers greater returns on, such as books, dining, and movies, along with the already great rate at which cash back is earned. Going through Citi's Thankyou Network, there are thousands of options of what to do with your points earned on this card as well, if cash back is something you're not as interested in. The interest rate on this card is fair, but because of the no hidden fees, just avoid paying your bill late and this is the card for you!

name: Evia Mortis
review: We cancelled this card. We used to have a very high limit and were never late with any payment on any debt we've ever owed. Then Citi dropped our credit limit to $200 above our balance. They were always sending us low interest rate balance transfer offers and we used them. Dropping our limit increased our percentage of credit used after they dropped the credit limit for no reason, it hurt our FICA credit score. This became a viscous circle. When we paid the balance down they dropped our limit again. We called and talked to them and only got BS. We'll never do business with Citi again. They're unethical in their business practices and cannot be trusted.

name: WalletHub
review: That is a really tough situation they placed you in.  It's a place that many card holders found themselves in after the financial crisis, as most major credit card companies tried to clamp down and reduce their lending.  It might not be much of a comfort, but it probably was not because of something you did.

name: Alex Alexson
review: This Citi Dividend card was one of two cards I had when I was a college student. It was a good card for a student like me who had next to no credit whenever I got it. The rewards were pretty decent. Their standard rate was 1 point for every dollar spent, but there were some things I got 5 points for each dollar. My laptop that I bought got me 5 points for every dollar, which is a nice reward for a poor college student like I was in those days. Another good thing was is that I did not have to have a cosigner, which gave me a bit more independence and was a relief to my parents. The spending limit was fairly low, and that was my only complaint about the card. However, a low spending limit is probably good for a college student.

name: Margery Ledger
review: I've only had my Home Depot credit card for a few months now, but getting it is one of the best financial decisions I've made. The Home Depot is my go to store. I do a lot of work on my house and my friends houses and I always rely on the Depot to get me what I need. Now that I have a card to go along with all these purchases I couldn't be happier. If I need an appliance or something more costly to get the job done, I can always count on a 6 month no interest purchase to make a hard job that much easier. For everything else, smaller things that is, I just use the card and then pay it off with the money I would've used to buy the stuff originally. For any do-it-yourself kinds of people, or those who just love good tools and great prices, you can't go wrong with this card.

name: Bryan Thomas
review: I've had the Citi Diamond Preferred Card for over a year. The main perk of it is the no interest for 18 months when you sign up. It's accepted almost everywhere, and many places I've been to have specials for people who use a citicard to purchase something. As a more general statement about citi, when I pay a bill they have me cleared and the money withdrawn from my bank account in two days. Other credit groups I've dealt with can take up to a week to make withdraws. This isn't the case with Citi, so your credit limit will reflect this when you make a payment in only a couple of days. In terms of card benefits, the rewards system is ok. The points go towards discounts on things at citi's rewards website (like 10 dollars off a 50 dollar gift card), so it's not bad. With that respect they are great.

name: Sarah Garceau
review: I have had my Citi card for many years now.  I would highly recommend this card to anyone that would like to take care of their finances without being hit with huge interest rates.  My current interest rate is just under 11% WAY lower than any of my other cards!  Best of all, I am continuously offered 0% interest for up to 18 months on balance transfers or cash advances, which a low 1 time fee of 3%.  This card has been a great way for me to purchase products and take care of other high interest credit cards.  If you have other high interest credit cards – open this Citi Card so that you can start saving on interest rates today!

name: Hildred Balliew
review: This is a great card with good intro period and they give you lot of points on purchase which you can convert to dollars. I was really impressed with how quick they were in reviewing my application and approving it. I tried few other cards before this and they took too long to approve my application but this card got approved within a day. I don't pay any annual fee so that's another plus for me. If you are someone who makes lot of purchases then this card is for you since you'll be earning lot of points and converting them to dollars. You can also use those dollars to pay your credit card payment (I have done it few times and it went smoothly). Overall very nice card!

name: Joel Sprague
review: Like many people, I have an account with Citibank. My particular account is a credit card account, and Citibank has always been great for me. They offered 0% interest to begin with, which helped me refinance some high interest cards and transfer the balance over at 0%, which was great. They have also been very helpful and understanding any time I had any trouble and had to call their customer service. The Citi Cards website is also extremely well designed and easy to use. It even allows you to request credit line increases online, and it automatically approves or disapproves the request, so you don’t have to wait to find out whether it is approved.

name: Jess Poochitas
review: Citi Forward was the best choice for me when I really needed some extra cash flow. This card was geared towards students and it was a great choice for me especially being a no annual fee card with no interest charges for an introductory time period. It is also a rewards card which is a great added perk. I use this card more than my other cards because of this. It was also very easy to qualify for unlike other cards. I got an approval instantly! I would definitely refer anyone who is looking for a card with an overall great value to apply for this card.

name: Brian Palm
review: I applied and was approved for this credit card a few years ago.  It was one of my first credit cards and initially applied for it when I bought my first xbox.  They had a promotion going on with their "reward zone" program where I got a gift card in return for signing up.  I then applied the gift card towards the purchase of some games.  The whole process was hassle-free.  I don't use the card regularly, and honestly can't remember the last time I used it.  I don't shop at best buy very often and when I do I usually just use my debit card to make the purchase.  I would recommend this card to anyone who shops at best buy regularly due to their rewards program and the gift cards you receive toward future purchases at the store.

name: Donn Gersten
review: This was my frist credit card as a college student and an adult for which I paid my own bills etc..It was failry easy for me to get this credit card given that I had no credit history and just a part time job as a sales associate. My dealing with Citicards has been very positive and I have never had any problems with them. I like the cash back offers that they feature every month and they change from time to time allowing me to get cashback for purchases when I used my Citicard. I have also lost my card once or twice and the customer service representatives have been very helpful in replacing my card as well as helping me rule out if I needed to disupte any charges that were posted to my account during the time that my card was lost. The one thing I did not like is that the company is not very lienient or understanding of issues that customers might have. For example I was out of the country for one of my payments and missed the payment date and when I got back I called to see if the late fee could be waived because of my situation and they were not very helpful or understanding.

name: Cristin Krieser
review: When I first got this credit card I was in college and It was a great credit card for me because it provided a lot of reward points for me. The card allowed me to get points for good grades and allowed me to used my rewards points to pay off student loan debt. I also liked the fact that gave me a credit limit of 4,000 while I was in college without a job. Now that I have graduated college I find the thank you card a lot less useful. I still have a high interest rate of 27% that was given to me while I was in college without a job and I still have that credit limit of 4,000 although I feel my current salary would justify my credit limit being a lot higher. My recommendation would be if you a  young college student and you need a credit card you will be easily approved for with a decent credit limit then the thank you card is a good option, but if you are an adult then I think there are better option then the thank you card.

name: Jamal Biddix
review: I've been using this card for over 5 years now and I love the rewards it brings. I have redeemed the rewards of my card several times now and have never run into problems. Citibank provides excellent service as I have had my card stolen before. All charges were taken off and I was issues a new card immediately. This credit card is my card of choice with no annual fees and provides an easy way of keeping track of purchases and rewards. While most cards limit qualifying purchases towards rewards, this card offers a reward towards every dollar you spend. Overall it is a very great card and I will continue to stick with it.

name: Nicolas Billings
review: I used this card with minimal difficulty. The major benefit was the relative ease of communicating with customer service representatives; they were able to help me with virtually any problem I encountered. There was, for example, no issue with having the card replaced after I (somewhat embarrassingly) lost it. They were very helpful in ensuring that I ran into no problems while I used the card abroad, either. When I had fairly simple questions about PINs, the CitiBank staff was there to help. I was not crazy about where the interest rate ended up, but I have to admit that it was at least a competitive rate, and so I can't fault CitiBank for that.

name: Mitzi Boze
review: I recently got this card and I love it. The online tracking is phenomenal. Also this is one of the few cards that has a rewards program that you can accumulate money on pretty quickly. I also got a special cash back bonus for spending a certain amount within three months which was very nice. This is also one of the cards where the interest rates were not extraordinarily high so that was nice change from seeing all the high interest rates on comparable cards. Also the reward program is nice as the rewards are not restricted to any categories but is a flat rate of 1 percent. All in all I would recommend this card highly.

name: Virdette Otkins
review: I love my Citi Simplicity Card. I've had it for 6 months now and I have absolutely no complaints. I actually prefer this card over all the others I have had in the past.  I recently made a switch because I was not satisfied with my card or bank, and it seems like I made the right move. All of the associated fees and rates are more than reasonable and fit me perfectly. I would recommend this card to anyone. It is the absolute best. If you are looking for a new card, look no further. This is the number 1 choice.

name: Eu Hihi
review: Citi ThankYou® Card was exactly and even more than I needed for all my needs. I really appreciate the fact that I am able to pay every single thing on time and that they give me some opportunities that I really like!And, again, I’ve been using it for a long time – no problem, still. Everything is smooth and I am pretty sure that this was a very good choice for me. Reparations for my damaged car were paid easily with this card and the interest was low!The customer service is also nice, as the staff gives me explanations and guidelines every time I contact them. They’re really willing to answer my every question!I’ve never expected to find such a good deal for me, but I expected a further usage of this. It’s simply wonderful!

name: Pearline Tenamore
review: I have had my City Simplicity card for a number of years now. I got it back when I wanted to transfer balances from my higher interest rate credit cards to a card with a balance transfer offer that was better than others I had found. Since that time, I have gotten pretty good offers from Citi to transfer other balances and it would be for a low rate for the remainder of the balance and wouldn’t end after a certain time period. This worked great for me, and it was at an interest rate I would have been hard pressed to find with a bank even. I would highly recommend Citi for your credit card needs.

name: Christel Valen
review: This card is what I used to use frequently when I was, well, frequenting hotels. I don't have much use for it aside from that. I racked up a decent amount of points rather quickly, and it helped that I was able to use this card instead of the company card and just have my charges covered for later on. If you don't have that luxury, however, travel is still rather expensive, so unfortunately cards like this might be relegated to people who enjoy traveling or have to travel frequently and know they're going to use it for that specific purpose, because there are other cards that outclass it for other purchases. Another obvious drawback for those who don't like to travel is what the points can be redeemed for, generally more traveling expenses covered. Basically if you need to book hotel rooms left and right for you or friends and family this card might be for you. I've gotten a lot of use out of it, and if you will too then feel free to get it.

name: Nessa Selez
review: I love this card! First off, the sign-up bonus is great. Spending $500 in the first three months of having the card is no problem, and Citibank gave me $100 in rewards for doing so. I love the consistent rewards rates on purchases I make regularly. The card carries no annual fee, which is also nice. It's very easy to keep track of my rewards through the company's website. The high interest rate is to be expected with a card like this, but paying the balance every month keeps those interest charges away. All in all, this is a handy card to have on hand if you want an above-average, simple-to-use rewards for everyday purchases.

name: Colby Hric
review: This was a good credit card in the beginning and I loved low intro rate  etc. After I had it for few months I received a call from them saying that I haven't made payment and I need to make it or they'll cancel my card. I called them back after a day and told them that I already paid it. The lady at customer service was very rude to me and she acted like I was lying. I asked her that I wanted to talk to her manager but she refused to call her manager. I told her that I need my credit card statements and she said she will send it but I never got any statements. Good card but their customer service is horrible.

name: David Koutroulis
review: RUN!   STAY AWAY FROM THIS BANK IF YOU HAVE HAD A BANKRUPTCY WITH THEM IN THE PAST. THEY WILL NOT APPROVE YOU NO MATTER HOW LONG IT HAS BEEN.I had a Bankruptcy more than 22 years ago, the total CitiBank Card balance was less than $500 USD and they STILL REFUSE to even approve me for a Secured Card.   Here is the info pertaining to CitiBank's rules on the letter I just received: "."Banks are free to set standards for credit applicants which serve to evaluate the applicant's ability to repay loans, provided such standards are not based on discriminatory grounds. We are permitted to decline your application based on the prior loss to the bank regardless of the amount of time that has elapsed since the occurrence."They have not only lost a potential Credit Card Customer but a potential new Bank Customer as well.  More than 22 years ago, really?FORGET THE BIG BANKS, GO TO A LOCAL CREDIT UNION!

name: Brian Palm
review: I've had this credit card for a couple months now.  I originally applied for the card because over the past year I've been doing a lot of traveling.  I realized I could get more Hilton points to use on future stays by booking my stays through the credit card.  My wife and I really enjoy staying in Hampton Inns, and we pretty much exclusively stay in them when we travel.  By booking our hotel stays with the card, we get 6 points per dollar spent on the hotel, 3 points at gas stations, and 2 points on everything else.  My other cards give me only 1 point per dollar on most expenses.  I'm happy with the card because I know that I'm getting rewarded when I use it, especially on vacation.  It's now my primary card and my wife and I are saving up to use our points on a beach trip in the future.  I can't wait.

name: Sara Appino
review: I was able to qualify for this Citi card after maintaining a very good credit score for several years. I was really excited to finally have a card that offered me 0% on purchases for an extended period of time, which this one thankfully does. Because I am at a point in my life that I can pay off my full balance each month, this card is perfect for me. I am not paying anything extra in interest and fees, and just using my card as a convenience when I need to. I'm finding that it's also a good way to continue my good credit history by paying off my balance each month. A great card overall!

name: Michael Johnson
review: The Citi Simplicity Card is exactly what it says in the name... simple. With no late fees and no penalty rate, no annual fees, it makes this card the easiest credit card to have. They have amazing customer service representatives that work very hard to satisfy your needs. They truly give you a peace of mind. Citi Bank has always been a favorite of mine but this card tops it all. Decent interest rates make it easy to charge and then pay back what you have charged without spending years doing it. I recommend The Citi Simplicity Card in a heartbeat to anyone wanting an easy, reliable credit card.

name: Liz Bradshaw
review: I've had this credit card for something like eight years-- it was my first card.  It’s still the only card I use because I don’t spend enough to rack up points with other cards, and this one is fee-free.   I like that I get cash back from the purchases I do make, and all I have to do is call to get my check—very easy.  I  do wish I could have a check sent to me by accessing my account online, and I’ve tried that, but it doesn’t seem to work.  Still, I haven’t had any problems with my card, and they’ve notified me several times when a big purchase was made or I was out of the country.

name: WalletHub
review: Getting the 30,000 points is easy, but you do have to put at least $500 dollars in charges on the card in your first three months.

name: Michael McGurk
review: The home depot card is useful if you have to purchase high-priced items.  For normal purchases for diy projects or crafting, or home repairs, it is not super useful.  For big purchases you get 6 months to make payments, and you can get 10% off, which could save you lots of money.  For me, I rarely use it, and it just sits in my wallet.  I got it when I was making a large purchase and wanted the 10% off.  Overall, it's a good value, but not super useful.  I would recommend this card to my friends and family if they are making large purchases at home depot.

name: Brad Hayes
review: I have had this card for several years and have been very pleased with it. We use it for most of our daily purchases to accumulate rewards points which we redeem for gift cards. Usually once every couple weeks I will have enough points to redeem a restaurant gift card so that my wife and I can go out for a date. We also like to redeem gift cards for various retailers when the kids birthdays come along. I initially got the card for the 18 month Zero interest offer on balance transfers but ended up using it as my primary card for the Diamond Preferred Rewards program it offered.

name: Kaye Svoboda
review: I travel a lot for business and have found this card to be great.  I go out of my way to make sure I am always staying at a Hilton Hotel so I can use this card and receive all the great extra benefits.  I have redeemed my Hilton Points numerous times for free stays and the process is always very easy to do.  The points add up very quickly with this card when you travel a lot.  If you don't travel or don't stay with the Hilton chain when you do then don't waste your time with this card because you won't see any benefits.  If you like Hilton and travel a lot though this card is almost a must have for all the benefits it gives you.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: I think the Home Depot can be a great choice for homeowners.  Especially if you have many large purchases to make.  We waited until we needed appliances and got the card.  We received 10% off and had no interest for 6 months so we could pay it off before we accrued any.  We saved a couple hundred dollars.  The interest rate is rather high so if you use the card plan to pay it off right away or within the first 6 months if taking advantage of the introductory offer.  Customer service is helpful and if you are doing a project that exceeds your limit they may be willing to increase the limit if your account is in good standing.

name: Adam Jeppson
review: This Citibank card is pretty useful.  It is generic, but in a good way.  Most credit cards have some sort of rewards plan built into them, and they usually equate to about a cent earned per dollar spent.  The problem with most credit cards is that these earnings are restricted in that you can only spend some on certain goods, like airfare or certain vendors.  I was attracted to this Citibank card because it simply gives you cash at the same rate (1 cent per dollar spent).  They don’t subtract any fees from that amount, and it ends up being a pretty good deal.

name: Bob Hanson
review: I recently got this Citi Dividend card to transfer the very last of my debt from a high interest credit card. I was very quickly approved and the whole application process was easy and straightforward. Because I just got this card, I haven't yet had a chance to use their rewards. But I am excited that if I make $500 in purchases in the first 3 months, I get $100 dollars back. That's a pretty good excuse to spend with this card. I've heard a lot of good things about Citi over the years and am now very excited to have a card with them.

name: Renato Ganoza
review: I've had this card a few years now, and I've used the bonus miles it came with. It's accepted everywhere I've tried it, save smaller cities in China. I don't really have any problems with it - transaction are cleared quickly, and my statements are always accurate. When I have a question, Citi's customer support is helpful.I've thought about looking for other cards that offer cash-back bonuses, as it's a bit slow-going accumulating additional miles (where I could definitely use some cash-back immediately!). That said, for the moment I'm staying put. On the balance, I'm satisfied with the card. I wish it didn't have that annual fee, but what can you do?

name: Grover Cathey
review: I have had my Citi Simplicity card for years, and I have always been extremely happy with it.  This simple card just works for everything I need, whether it is regular credit card usage, or using the convenience checks when I need to pay for something that doesn’t take a credit card.  I was also able to transfer over several card balances when I opened the account and get 0% interest on them, which was a great way to help pay down my debt.  There is definitely something confidence inspiring, even in this recession about having a card backed by Citibank.  It is just comforting to see that name on a card in my pocket.

name: Adrienne Dowling
review: This card is great. I have always had a Citibank card, but I think I like this one the best because it was the first card I have had that offered a reward for spending money I was already going to spend. They actually gave me the $100 pretty quickly. I would assume that it would not come until after the 3 month period. I got it after a month. I also love the customer service I have with Citibank. They are always so polite and professional. I never have to ask a question more than once, which is nice. This is probably the best card and company out there. My mother even switched and she loves it too. Great company, great card, great service.

name: Shavon Yokoyama
review: I have had this credit card for a few years now, and I have no complaints about it whatsoever. I first got it when I was looking for balance transfer options. I found an initial term that was good for me. A year or two later, I received an offer to keep my balance at a steady rate for the life of the balance. Granted, I don’t like carrying this balance, but it seems that’s what a lot of us have to do these days, and I’m happy that Citi offered me this option. It was a great rate, too. Lower than I could have found elsewhere.

name: Alesha Edgemon
review: I was a loyal CitiBank customer for a long time. We had quite a few accounts with them (checking, savings, IRA, loans, you name it!). After an incident regarding our home equity loan, I got really upset and closed out everything we had through them and that included our Citi Simplicity Card (which was admittedly overdoing it a bit but I didn't even want to see their name on anything I owned). However, the card itself was perfectly fine. I only had it for a few years but it suited our needs well. I believe really good credit is required to qualify, but for people who do it doesn't charge cardholders a late fee or over-limit fee. That was useful for us (we're pretty busy and have multiple accounts so we aren't always able to keep great track of everything). As a matter of fact, the only fee I can ever remember paying were cash advance fees. They never raised our interest rate either. I can't say there are any stellar rewards opportunities or extravagant perks with this card, but it does have some good points like a long 0% intro offer and no annual fee. All in all, once I've cooled off I would reconsider reapplying for this credit card again in the future.

name: Spencer Knouff
review: This was my first credit card that I had ever applied for. I've had it for just over a year now, and would definitely recommend it to any college student looking to build credit. One of the many perks of this card include the reward system, in which you receive points with certain purchases redeemable for many things. Another huge draw for me to the card was that there was no annual fee, which seemed to be a huge downfall with the other credit cards I looked into. The APR is low, and overall, I have had nothing but wonderful things to say about this credit card.

name: Dima Ivanyuk
review: As a college student, I have been looking a card that can provide me with a source of money in emergencies and tough situations. The application process was pretty straightforward and I had no trouble getting approved. It's great that they give you a grace period on your bills, and it's come in handy the one time for me that I had to pay late. The reward system is a cool bonus, especially since you earn just by doing stuff right like paying your bill on time or staying under the credit limit. Overall, I would recommend this card to any college student.

name: Von Snoots
review: This was only the second credit card I ever received (first was one through my credit union) and the first one I got from a major bank.  I’ve had this card for at least 6 years now though, and continue to use it regularly.  There is definitely something confidence inspiring about a card backed by a name like Citi.  The interest rate is very reasonable, and of course there is no annual fee, which is pretty much a requirement for credit cards that I get.  Overall, I can’t say that I have any complaints.  There is nothing really fancy to this card, it is just a good low interest, no fee quality card that is accepted everywhere.  What more can you ask for?

name: Devon Tanequodle
review: This program has been ended - also be aware of the cash advance - this is not a regular cash advance. One merchant that I used somehow triggered the cash advance with this card - for $20 and I had already accrued charges of $10 on this one by the time I called. And of course they would not remove the charge so I cancelled the card. They were going to cancel the generous 3% cash back and provide a new card with 6 cents back per gallon. I almost applied for that one - but when I had a bad experience with the cash advance for $20.. I decided they are not worth a gamble.

name: Won Lee
review: Is Joe Weider and Maggie waiting for me to go first? haha.This card can be great, if you know how to use it right.  Spend 2.5k and you get 2 weekend nights free.
