Ok.. what does that mean?  no finite # of points or what? what can this card do for you? how do you value this card?Simple.  Go pick out a weekend trip to one of most expensive areas you can think of (think SF, NY, Boston, etc etc), and find yourself the MOST EXPENSIVE HILTON HOTEL!now think of spending 2 nights there for free. (some restriction apply, but minimal). I was looking at top tier hilton hotel in NY, and those were going for about 400 dollars a night. So this card will get you 800 dollars for free.+  gold membership, which I value (unless you stay at hilton often, and you get gold from stays) at about $250.  so this card will give you $1050 first year alone. Then each year, you get one weekend night free,  which, again, if used properly, is worth more than 95 bux. Even if you don't consider all the bonus points for using this card AT hilton (10 bonus pts per dollar),   not a bad deal. 95$ annual fee, again guys, is easily covered from annual free weekend night certificate.

name: Del Fenniman
review: I've had nothing but great experiences with this card and I would recommend it to any college student. It's been my first experience with a credit card and I have to say I enjoy getting points for things I do (gamer). It's a great starting point and I use it to develop good practices with credit cards. Keep up with payments, limit purchases etc. These practices earn you points. You get points for staying under your limit and for paying on time. The points can then be applied to 'almost' anything in the future. I haven't tried using my points yet however. It's a great deal and especially suitable for students just starting out on their credit card journey.

name: Tony Yu
review: I have had this credit card for about 2 months. It's very simple and easy to use. There is no annual fee for the card, and I believe there is a six thousand dollar credit limit for me. This is the first credit card I have ever used that belonged to myself only. The interest rate for this card are decently low, but I have never missed a payment, and do not plan to either. I use this credit card primarily to build my credit and to get experience paying off purchases. I have yet to use my reward points, but for now I have around twelve thousand, which can net me a nice watch. Overall I would say this is a great credit card to start out using.

name: Hugo Scorca
review: I've had nothing but great experiences with this card and I would recommend it to any college student. It's been my first experience with a credit card and I have to say I enjoy getting points for things I do (gamer). It's a great starting point and I use it to develop good practices with credit cards. Keep up with payments, limit purchases etc. These practices earn you points. You get points for staying under your limit and for paying on time. The points can then be applied to 'almost' anything in the future. I haven't tried using my points yet however. It's a great deal and especially suitable for students just starting out on their credit card journey.

name: Nessa Selez
review: I am a pretty big fan of Citibank and this card in particular. The rewards are very good -one point for every dollar you spend- and there is no limit on the amount of rewards you can earn. Citibank also gives an annual anniversary bonus, which is a nice perk! I like to use this card for shopping, and it really pays some great dividends! Citi's customer service has always been helpful and friendly, which is important to me. I do wish the card had a more reasonable interest rate, but all rewards cards seem to really spike their rates. Just be careful not to carry a balance and you should enjoy this card as much as I do!

name: Loredana Magie
review: Being honest, I’ve tried many credit cards before, but most of them made me unwanted surprises. I didn’t exactly know what should I do, especially because my job requested me to have such a credit card. One of my co-workers told me something about Citi Simplicity Card and I made me very curious about it.I called the customer service and they were very nice with me, very polite and respectful. They seemed prepared to fulfill all my wishes about this.So I decided to purchase Citi Simplicity Card and give it a try.I have to be honest and tell you that I was very satisfied with it, because I could pay all my bills and anything else on time, avoiding causing myself any kind of trouble. I would not use another credit card, because this one provides me many facilities and giving it up would automatically mean giving up the only credit card which satisfied all my needs.

name: Adrian Półtorzycki
review: The Citi Simplicity Card credit card is the card I had in terms of many things but it especially shines in the department of low interest rates on my purchases. I have bought many different things that I need for school with this card and they were all great purchases. The really low interest rate really helped out because I needed to get books at the time and couldn’t afford to pay for them with cash. Now that I am paying them off I am glad that I used this card because the interest is so low it doesn’t impact my income of money from the current job I have.

name: Renaldo Levalley
review: Used the card for occasional purchases for a couple of years.  Used the electronic statements but they do not notify you by email that there is a new statement so that unless one is careful it is possible to miss a payment date.  If you opt for paper statements there is no electronic statement available.  So it is as if they are making it simple to miss a payment date.  One of the poorer card sites I have used.  After missing a date by a few days and getting hit by the $35 fee I decided it was better to close it than be annoyed by GE and risk a credit ding.

name: Wade Puz
review: I needed to purchase new tires this summer.  I always buy Goodyear tires because they are very reliable and I like the way they look on my Jeep.  I went to the Goodyear website and looked for tires.  The tires I wanted had a $60 rebate.  If I got a Goodyear Store Card, that rebate would double to $120.  I got the card and purchased the tires.  I sent in the info for my rebate.  I got a card from Goodyear saying that I was not eligible for the rebate.  I called the Goodyear Company, talked to a representative who immediately got me my rebate.  The check was in the mail within 2 days.  The Goodyear Store Card is accepted in many places where Goodyear products are sold.  Although it can't be used for everyday purchases, it is a handy card to have if you need emergency car repairs.  Because of my experiences I will continue to use my Goodyear Store Card and continue to stay loyal to Goodyear products.

name: Chris Wilson
review: I've been a Citibank customer for about a year now. So far my experience with Platinum Select Visa has been pretty good. I got an extra cash back bonus for spending a certain amount within 3 months of having the card, which was nice, because I was going to make those purchases regardless, so getting some cash back was icing on the cake. There's no annual fee, which is an absolute necessity for me nowadays. The cash back rewards are pretty standard: 5% on rotating categories (changes quarterly) and 1% on all other purchases. There are several other cards that offer the same type of cash back bonus reward system, so between the Citibank Platinum and my other cash rewards cards, I'm usually able to get 5% back on whatever I need to buy.

name: Dani Ling
review: I have this credit card and it's really reliable.  Citibank is a really trustworthy company.  I haven't had any problems with this or any of the other cards I have with them.  Customer service is second to none.  Usually I hate calling companies because you never know when you are going to get the chance to hang up.  They are not pushy at all and listen.  I have had no problems with identity theft or anything like that.  I think this is a great choice for your first ever credit card.  The only thing I don't like about it is the Rewards Program, which is pretty useless.  Otherwise, I highly recommend the card.

name: Richard Johnson
review: Good card from a very great and respectable bank. The interest rate honestly could be better but you can't beat the 18 month intro rate. Besides, as for the interest rate, as long as you are smart with your money that wont matter right? Just make sure you pay it off every month and it won't matter.Also the people are very polite and helpful. I lost my card shortly after getting it and when I called they got it canceled in a matter of minutes, and had a new one to me within a few weeks. Really took a load off my mind when they got it canceled so fast.

name: Aranda Marie
review: I've been using Citi Hilton Honors Visa for over a year now. It's a great card for travel rewards, I tend to randomly travel and the points I've earned add up quickly and come in handy for spur of the moment trips. The first four months of using my card I received 40,000 bonus points which allowed me to stay 5 nights free in a standard room. I've obtained those points by spending $1,000 the first four months of having the card. The late fee charges and grace periods are extremely reasonable as well. If I ever come across any issues which is rare, customer service simply and kindly helps. I love my Hilton Honors Visa, I wouldn't change anything about it.

name: Mary Munoz
review: I really like my Citi Simplicity Card. In the past I used a Wells Fargo card and while their rate was good I found that their customer service was not. With the Citi card there is no annual fee and a competitive rate. There was one time that I unknowingly went over my card limit. This had never happened before so I called Citi to talk to them about it. I was so pleased with their great customer service. They refunded the fee for going over the limit and they even increased my limit so it wouldn't happen again. I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a great card from a great company.

name: Qing Lu
review: I have been using this card for about three years. My main purpose of using this card is for balance transfer. Since I have a good credit score, I got a pretty high credit limit on this card. I have several other credit cards with high credit lines and providing 0 APR balance transfer offers, but this card is my favorite due to two reasons: (1) This card has no annual fee. The BT transaction fee is standard (3%), no higher or lower than other cards; (2) it provides an 18-month 0 APR offer, about 6-8 months longer than the periods provided by other cards. I have been using the transferred money for other investments. Another good thing about this card is that after I paid off the balance, the 18-month 0 APR BT offer would come out again, so I could borrow the money again at a loan rate of 3% per 18 months. So far I haven't had any bad experience with this card and I plan to keep using it.

name: Amir Malik
review: Zero APR on Purchase, application fee, fraud liability, no delays in credit reporting and identity theft protection all sound like great advertisements right? But this is what you can get through this card. Application procedure is extremely simple with every detail explained by the customer service. I had no experience of the credit cards, but once I put all pros and cons of miscellaneous cards, this proved to be the suitable choice for people like me with low credit. One better thing about this card is that there is no annual fee. Many credit cards with rewards features have hidden fees and annual fees that they don't tell you about upfront; however, that is not the case with this card. Itâ€™s incredibly easy to access the account online. All in all, a recommended package.

name: Johnny Last
review: I really enjoy the Citi Simplicity Card. I have had a very good experience with it as of now. I have had the card for a couple months now and this might be the best card I have used. I received the offer of 0% interest for 18 months and I had to jump on board with the card. They even give you a no annual fee. I would definitely recommend this card to anyone with good credit who is in college the 0% interest for 18 moths could really help out someone like myself. All in all this is a good card and it definitely gets the seal of approval with me.

name: Patty Macho
review: This card is what my old college student "Car Rewards" credit card turned into when I guess they ended that card/program a few years ago. It's your standard credit card - I've never had to contact customer service for anything other than activating a new card or payed late or gone over my limit, so I can't comment on any of those situations personally. The rewards program is "Thank You Rewards." To earn points you can either buy thing on-line through the website, or buy items in stores at certain stores, so you don't get rewards on all purchases and how many points you get per dollar depends on the offer at the specific store. Rewards are your standard gift cards or items from a list for a certain amount of points. It's not a terrible rewards program, but there are better out there, so I don't use this card much, it's mainly one of my back ups.

name: Patty Macho
review: This was my first ever credit card, opened as a college student many years ago. It's always been good to me. Paperless statements, which I prefer, and an easy to use online banking system. No annual fee. It has a rewards program, Extra Cash, which is ok - you earn 10% of all eligible purchases, and later can purchase gift cards or other goods at full price and apply your extra cash rewards towards the price ($10 in rewards would get you a $50 gift card for $40). Not an amazing program, but it's something, and this is a decent card all around.

name: Chelee McKenna
review: The Citi Thank You Rewards Card is the best rewards credit card out there for rewards. When we signed up we got 25,000 bonus points for signing up. I have seen several offers that are offering the same bonus for signing up to new customers. We love the rewards that are offered for gas cards and gift cards and merchandise. There is so much to choose from and we haven’t even cashed in our reward points because we can’t decide! I have never had to call customers service for any issues because we haven’t had any issues so far. We love this card!

name: Tomi Mad
review: This card I got when I first started college.  It is a great thing to have for a newly on there own college students.  The APR is lower than most credit cards and it offers a slight grace period when it comes to payments.The citi forward offers a really cool website called thank you rewards.  Every time you buy something with the credit card you earn points on the thank  you reward site.  The monthly payments are keep rather lower for the college kids not to get over whelmed I suppose.  This card has been a major help to me and a few of my friends who also have this card.

name: Paul Prince
review: Having less than perfect credit, I decided to give this card a try.  The interest rate is a little higher than a normal credit card, but keeping this account in good standing will help you improve your credit store.  One of my favorite things is the points you get with EVERY purchase that you make!  You get up to 250 points (which doesn't take very long) and you get a 5 dollar reward gift certificate to Best Buy!  You also get more points for using the credit card for an actual purchase at Best Buy.  Quick and easy!  I definitely recommend this card to everyone.

name: WalletHub
review: If you paid your last bill in full, then you have a grace period, which means you will not be charged any interest as long as you pay this upcoming bill in full as well (so no need to pay your purchases right after you make it).  If you haven't paid your last bill in full then you get assessed interest on your average daily balance.  In which case you should try to pay off your purchase as soon as you make it, in order to minimize interest charges.

name: Fatima Blurg
review: I'm someone who flies a lot and uses various credit cards that offer airline miles. Unless I need to make an emergency flight, I always use my miles to buy my tickets. This saves me a tremendous amount of money. If you're someone who makes a lot of trips that you usually plan at least a month in advance, this card is really worth it. American Airlines is not my favorite company to fly with and theirs are the only tickets you can buy with the rewards from this card, but the money saved outweighs this minor negative. If you fly enough that the amount you'll save on tickets exceeds the fees significantly enough, this card is a must have.

name: Brian Bugle
review: My experience with Citibank in getting my first credit card has been great so far.  I wanted to try to find a credit card that had no annual fee and also had some sort of reward system.  The Citi Dividend Platinum Select card fit both of those specifications and seemed like the best option for me to boost my credit rating.I found the card on the Citibank website, applied online, and was approved immediately.  The whole process took less than 30 minutes!  I have had the card for about a month now and so far everything is going great.  I am required to do a lot of driving for my job and usually spend around $90 on gas every week.  The added Dividend bonus from gas purchases, coupled with the ~$1000 I spent on school books/parking has already earned me a very sizable cashback reward check.Overall I am very pleased with this card and would highly recommend it to any college student looking for their first credit card.

name: Sydney Stefanick
review: I have had this card for over 6 years now.  I was very disappointed when my APR was increased without having a late payment or defaulting in any other way.  I am someone that is currently working to pay off their debt and this is the first place I have to address as it is now the loan with the highest interest rate.  I also really dislike that half the time I've had to speak with customer service they are always trying to up-sell me something (eg. identity theft protection).  Usually when I call I am on a mission but I am friendly to a fault, so I usually end up on the phone forever.

name: Jereme Taylor
review: I applied for this card not too long after I graduated from college.  The application process was quick and painless, and the 0% APR for the first eighteen months was a godsend.   When I applied, I had no plans to actively use the card.  Although I somewhat regret it now, I practically lived off this card for a while after I moved across the country and spent six months looking for a job.  I never had any issues with this card or Citi, and the one time I had a fraudulent charge, Citi brought it to my attention and sent me a new card within the week.

name: Dima Ivanyuk
review: This was my first card I ever had as a college student. My parents helped find this card for me as a good way to establish my credit history, and it has definitely completed the job. I first had an issue with this card at school because I was using it in a different state than issued. Customer service was more than helpful very quickly; they verified my information and allowed me to finish the purchase right away. This card is helpful for college students because there is no intro rate for the first 7 months. Due to a high interest rate, I have avoided using the card except for rewards items such as gas  or emergencies, but it is definitely a decent first-time card that I would highly recommend to any first –year college student who has never had a card.

name: Golden Eschenbrenner
review: My parents signed me up for this card about a year ago: I needed to actually borrow some money, since my credit score was non-existent before, and things like not having a credit score come up as red flags on background checks for interviews and such. Well I've used it a bit, always paying it off in full each month, and my credit score is in the 800s! I would highly recommend this card, it has proven invaluable in emergencies like when I was overseas and needed money for a place to stay. It charged a little extra of course for being used outside the US, but that's to be expected! I also liked the extra $100 you get at the beginning. Just the icing on the cake!

name: Robert Hesselgrave
review: My Wife and I share our Citi Diamond card and it has been a blessing.  We rarely use credit but this card was such a great deal with zero interest for the first 18 months.  So when we had an emergency and needed the extra funds we had this card.  It was there when we needed to have repairs done to our truck and allowed us to pay for something when it was needed and not just when we could scrounge up the money.  The rates on this card are amazing and give us the means to actually pay off our debts without a ton of interest.

name: Deidre Rene
review: I've had my Citi Simplicity for about 3 months now. I was attracted to it at first because of the balance transfer offer. I had a huge balance on a different card, and transferring a portion of it to the Citi Simplicity card was quick and easy. It only took about a week for the money to come through. This card seems to have a better payment alert system than others, and as far as I can tell, you don't have to make a payment for the first month, which I appreciate. It's a simple card. My limit is $500 and there are no fancy rewards or other such perks. It is really just a basic credit card that is very good for people trying to establish or rebuild credit (like me).

name: Patty Macho
review: The Citi Platinum Select Visa card was my first ever credit card, opened as a college student card many years ago. It's always been good to me. Paperless statements, which I prefer, and an easy to use online banking system. It has a rewards program, Extra Cash, which is ok - you earn 10% of all eligible purchases, and later can purchase gift cards or other goods at full price and apply your extra cash rewards towards the price ($10 in rewards would get you a $50 gift card for $40). Not an amazing program, but it's something, and this is a decent card all around.I also have a Citi Thank You credit card. This card is what my old college student "Car Rewards" credit card turned into when I guess they ended that card/program a few years ago. It's your standard credit card - I've never had to contact customer service for anything other than activating a new card or payed late or gone over my limit, so I can't comment on any of those situations personally. The rewards program is "Thank You Rewards." To earn points you can either buy thing on-line through the website, or buy items in stores at certain stores, so you don't get rewards on all purchases and how many points you get per dollar depends on the offer at the specific store. Rewards are your standard gift cards or items from a list for a certain amount of points. It's not a terrible rewards program, but there are better out there, so I don't use this card much, it's mainly one of my back ups.

name: Mike Wooldridge
review: Cannot pay Big O credit card online or in a store.  Huge negative.

name: Garret Eustace
review: Horrible Card really.  No benefits and the interest rate is terribly high.  The only plus is a low monthly payment, even when you're balance is crazy high.

name: David Sanders
review: I've had this card for a long time and they have proven to have good customer service. They have much better customer service than my primary credit card company in fact, which is why I still have the card even though I don't use it very often. The primary drawback to me is the rewards, because I'm all about rewards I don't really like this card because you don't really earn a whole of rewards with it, and the rewards that you do earn don't have a lot of attractive offers for redemption. Additionally you have to accumulate quite a bit of rewards before you can use them which I am particularly not fond of.However, outside of the rewards issue this is a good card with a responsive issuer that does deal with your issues if you have them and does a good job of keeping you informed of things like changes in policy or rates or fees, which is definitely a good thing.

name: Catrice Franchette
review: I have had my Citi Diamond Preferred card for about nine months now. As a soon to be college graduate, I was initially drawn to the eighteen months interest free and the extra cash program Citi offers is a great perk as well, though a lot of the auctions tend to go higher than I would like. The customer service has been very helpful on the couple of instances I have had to call them as well. While I have yet to use the 24/7 concierge service, I have only heard positive things about it, and look forward to using it myself in the future. Overall, I would most definitely recommend this card to anyone who was interested.

name: Emile Coate
review: Previously I had a Chase card that I'd used in college on the initial 12 months of 0 APR. After missing one (small) payment while I was abroad, the APR doubled. It was fairly absurd, especially for someone with good credit. The Citi Simplicity card had an 18 month 0 % APR balance transfer offer a few months ago, and I moved the small remainder from my Chase card and I'm now saving money every month. Furthermore, I've found that Citi has better payment tools, more branches in my area, and better electronic notifications. Overall I've had a good experience with Citi and this card, with no annual fee and lots of beneficial options, and will continue to use it in the future. The only negative aspect would be a sub-par rewards program, but I simply don't use credit enough for that to be an important factor.

name: Garrett Lew
review: At first I had the Citi MTVU card, and then after college they upgraded me to this Forward Card.  Up until recently, this was my primary card, and I enjoyed (and still do) the many ways you can earn points.  I never held a balance on this card, so I have no experience with the APR or fees.  Being able to get 5x points per dollar on restaurants, fast food, and bookstores really accelerate point earning ability.  When going out to eat with friends, I tend to wait for everyone to pony up their cash, and then take all their cash and throw the balance on my card.  For a table of 10 at a restaurant, this could easily be a charge of $200 or more, which translates into 1,000 points for you to spend!  My only gripe is that some of the rewards are a bit "pricey" in the Thankyou rewards network, with the better gift cards at 6,000pts for a $50 card, or up to 14k points for a $100 prepaid visa.  Unfortunately, statement credits and checks are more costly than those.

name: Dani Ling
review: I have had my Citi Diamond Preferred card for almost four years now.  It was my first ever credit card and I honestly have no complaints.  I have only had to contact customer service once and the person on the other end of the phone was really nice and accommodating.  They didn't really bug me and try to get me to enroll in something I didn't need.  They took care of my issue and was pleasant.  As for the card, I have had no problems with it either.  They also offer a rewards program, but I don't have any experience with that.  I just thought it was neat.

name: Queen Palen
review: This was my first credit card to start with, I have used a few since but none have been as good as the Cit ThankYou cadr. 0% interest for the first 15 months is a great luxury most cards are 6-12 months, though I tend not to use it it's nice to know it's there for now. The rates after the first 15 months are reasonable, about on par with any other card so it's a neutral point. The nicest part is the rewards 1 point for every dollar really adds up and with most cards this is only a selling feature which disappears or drops after a while. I've used Citi for a lot other banking needs like loans and the service on them was great just like on this credit card. I would definitely recommend this card to a friend that's how good my experience with it has been.

name: Robert York
review: After purchasing our home, my wife and I applied for a Hope Depot credit card.  The application process was extremely easy.  I went to their website and applied online.  I was given a code and a telephone number to call and after speaking with them for a few minutes I was approved.  It only took 10 -15 minutes total.  We purchased some much needed supplies (lawn mower, string trimmer) and got 6 month no interest due to our purchase being over $299.  They also gave me 10% off my first purchase!  I am a fan of Home Deport and will likely use this card a lot in the future.

name: Sam Grand
review: I have had the City Aadvantage card for about 2 years. This is a great credit card to have if you spend a lot and want to save up for travel. It has a $75 yearly fee, which you can justify if you use it a lot. There aren't very many promotions to increase the amount of miles earned over 1 mile per dollar spent, which is too bad, but if you are comparing it to the 1% cashback cards the airline miles are worth more. Customer service for the card has been very good. Citi's grace period is a bit shorter than other cards, so it does seem to come up sooner. For now I will keep using this card, but with so many others good cards out there I'm not sure it is worth the yearly fee unless you spend a lot on it.

name: Delfina Saager
review: I was not really looking for a new card, but when I received the offer for 0% interest for 18 months, with no annual fee,  I couldn't pass it up.  I transferred the balance from another card, and will save hundreds, even with the 3% transfer fee. I have used it for some purchases too that I can pay off over several months without worrying about the interest racking up. The application process was very easy. The interest rate I'll have after the first 18 months is on average with my other cards and I received a generous limit.  Overall, this is probably my best experience with a credit card.

name: Frank Avalos
review: For a number of years, card holders have felt swindled by a number of companies due to a lack of clarification and really tiny fine print. But Citi has been instrumental in changing things for the better for card holders. The Simplicity card has definitely made my life a bit more stress free thanks to features like their price protection. I was surprised finding out that after an item I had purchased dropped in price, I was refunded the difference. What card company do you know does that? When I had called in, the representative that helped me was kind and explained things clearly for me. Though the feature doesn't apply to all purchases, just knowing that it’s applicable to certain purchases is enough to restore my faith in the credit card industry. If there is anything I can gripe about, it would be the lack of a rewards program. But that is such a minor thing. All in all, this is a fantastic card and worth having in your wallet.

name: Brent Larson
review: I've had this card for a few years now.  When I first applied online, the browser was acting up and apparently I ended up applying for 2 cards, so they sent me 2 identical cards.  When I called them and tried to cancel 1 of the cards, they offered me extra points to keep it and I ended up getting the introductory rewards for both cards.  So I ended up with a windfall of ThankYou points from my mistake.  Overall it's been a fine card, but they don't have the 5% point categories like some other cards do, so I don't use it as often anymore.  I did eventually cancel one of my duplicate cards, but I kept one and it has served me well when I've needed it.

name: Shacoria Robinson
review: This is a great card for students. The best part about the card is that it has no annual fee. Some cards charge you just for the privilege of owning them. Thankfully, this one is completely free. I also like that it's designed specifically for students. I was really scared to get a credit card originally and it made me much more comfortable to apply for a card that was specific to college students.  I didn't even need a cosigner to apply for it. This card has been great so far. It's Visa, so they accept it everywhere. I really like that this card offers me rewards for using it. I was late paying my bill a few times for this card, but thankfully it does have a grace period.

name: Frank Avalos
review: This card comes highly recommended from not only myself, but also friends and family who have similar cards. When I had applied for this card, I wasn't expecting to be instantly approved, so needless to say that was a very pleasant surprise. I got in contact with a customer service representative just to go over the particulars, and I was amazed at how friendly and knowledgeable the representative was. It definitely made the experience more memorable. After my first few purchases and my first payment, its safe to say that I am a very satisfied consumer. I look forward to my continued use of this card and my time with Citi.

name: Kristy Blake
review: Sounds good

name: Glynis Embry
review: The Citi Forward card is a great starter card for students that are looking to start to begin building credit.  After being denied by three other credit cards, I applied for the Citi Forward card and was immediately accepted.  Unlike the other cards, the Citi Forward card gives you a number to call to check if you get accepted or not.  So if you having trouble getting accepted for a card, then this card is one that accepts people pretty easily.  I haven't gotten the rewards yet because I haven't paid for the billing for my first month, but from what I have heard the rewards program is up there with the Chase card and Capitol One cards.

name: Ashley Davis
review: I applied for a Best Buy card when I needed to get a new laptop for college 5 years ago. I've had the card ever since, and I still use it when I shop at Best Buy. The starting credit lines are very low for an electronic store. The nice the thing about the card is that they run a lot of promotions of no interest for so many months when you buy a product. This is really nice when you absolutely need to get something on the credit card. Just like any store card though, comes very high interest rates. If you happen to not get a promotion or take too long to pay off the card you're looking at over 20% interest rates. This makes a small balance take a very long time to pay off. I would say if you need the card, to get it, but make sure you pay it off ASAP!

name: Ann-Thérèse Hendricks
review: I have had this card for a year and a half now. After doing a lot of research it seemed like the right card for me. So far I am very pleased with it. The card had an introductory period of 0% APR and after that the rate is fair. I got the card to start building my credit. I have had very good experiences with  costumer service. One month I was very busy and forgot to make a payment. I made it a day or two late and after speaking with a costumer service representative who was very courteous and friendly, she got rid of the late fee. I would give this card a 5/5.

name: Patty Macho
review: This was actually my first credit card. I opened it as a student card about 6-7 years ago. I've never had any issues with it or Citibank, although I've also never gone over the limit or missed making a payment on time. The rate isn't great, but I've seen much worse, and there's no annual fee. It has the ExtraCash program, but I've never used that either.This was a very decent 'starter' card. The times I have spoken to customer service they were polite and helpful after the required script the person had to read. They have an option for paperless statements, which I like. They often offer decent balance transfer offers. The only reason this isn't my 'main' card is that I have another with a lower APR, but overall I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a basic, no annual-fee credit card.

name: Jessica Dunn
review: My experiences with this card were nothing but positive...until I used my max credit limit. From that point on, I couldn't seem to do anything about my balance. I would pay the amount they would tell me, and a week later they would call me to tell me that my fees had put me over my limit, and demand another payment. So I would ask what amount I needed to pay so that fees wouldn't put me over my limit again, and they would quote an obnoxious amount of money. But when the next statement came, there would be more fees and a statement balance that I could barely afford, even though I was no longer putting charges on the card. Eventually, I just dumped the whole of a paycheck into paying the darn thing, and never used near the limit again.

name: Marie Picard
review: This credit card is a great option if you have good self-control as a young consumer. They give extremely high credit limits right out of the bat - mine was about two thousand dollars. That would have been great had my knowledge of credit cards been better. Their customer support and online interface are good, as were their locations, but honestly, I think they issued me an irresponsibly high amount of credit. It was almost impossible for me to pay back on a very limited student income. Definitely my fault, but I can't be the only one who got in this situation, and I hope they've gotten more conservative with their lending in light of the economy.In all, this is a great card to get if you are confident in your financial knowledge, and confident in your ability to spend like an adult. If you have any doubts about your self control, either hold off or find a card with a lower limit.

name: Meredith Crilly
review: I have had this credit card for about three years. The $10 bonus is a great way to get some shopping money and is the main reason why I chose this card. Since it is a Visa, I have no problems using the card both in and out of the United States. The terms and conditions that came with the credit card were very reasonable as well. I specifically wanted this card because it didn't have an annual fee or any hidden charges. I would highly recommend this card to anyone who enjoys shopping at LLBean regularly. It's a great way to earn rewards and is reliable.

name: Abel Lantagne
review: While I don't really use any credit card all that often, I have nothing but positive things to say about the Citi Simplicity. This was the second card I got (first one as a sophomore in college, this one about 6 years later). After switching careers and not having steady employment I was sick of paying an annual fee for my first card which I almost never used. The 0% rate for the first 18 months on simplicity was long enough to hold me over until I had a more steady flow of income, and I still don't miss paying that old fee! I don't use cards that much so rewards points/bonus miles/other rewards are not as important to me as good customer service and ease of use. I applied for the card based on the recommendation of a friend, and thus far it has totally satisfied everything I was looking for, on the rare occasion I need to use a credit card. I also don't seem to get too much frivolous mail from citibank after signing up, which is always nice. Simplicity really does sum up this card nicely.

name: Abhilash Ananthapally
review: Excellent card. I have been using this card since a the lat 4 months. The best thing about this card is the 0% interest for the first 18 months , which enables you to spend more with out worrying more about the interest.I moved to a new place and bought all my furniture and groceries with this card. Secondly they don't charge you any penalty and you still have a grace period of three weeks to clear out standing dues. They don't have any annual charge. I pay almost 50 dollars as annual charge for my other card.An excellent card and scheme designed for people with some financial issues and working class. Really love this card.

name: John Rea
review: I've had this card for awhile now, and I mostly use it as a secondary card. It's a great card, and the interest rates are fairly low, but the rewards require a lot of time and patience. With the amount of points required to redeem the $100 in gift cards and the rate at which you earn points, I often forget about the rewards completely. Because of that, I don't use the card as frequently as others. That being said, the few experiences with customer service I've had have gone smoothly. They were always nice and courteous, and often offered me extra reward points because of the issue I called about. I recommend the card, but don't go into it thinking you're going to be raking in the rewards.

name: Qing Lu
review: I had this credit card for a while (about two years). It applied for this card when I was booking a flight ticket on Expedia.com and saw a discount offered for that ticket if I applied for the card, so I went for it. In general, I have no bad experience with this card since I paid off the balance on time every time. However, I also do not feel great about this card. I have several other credit cards, such as American Express for Costco, and Chase Sapphire for groceries. For this card, it seems it's in my best interest only when I book flight tickets on Expedia. I am not frequent traveler, so I don't use this card very often. Over the time, several of my other credit cards frequently provide some 0 APR balance transfer offer for one year, some of which I took advantage of to get extra cash to make some other investments. For this card, however, it had never provided any other incentive offer to encourage me to use it except the initial sign-in bonus. Therefore, over the time, I used this card less and less. Eventually, I cancelled this card because I did not feel the need to keep it anymore.

name: Filipe Lebre
review: I am definitely a fan of the Best Buy store, as well as shopping there. So, it only makes sense that I would get this card to help me fund my electronic products and movie purchases. I go in about once every two weeks. Next to each major electronics, it shows you their financing options for example how much you would pay per month. They also run specials where its 0% financing for a certain amount og time. Their customer service is friendly, and opening the card was very easy. The fees are fair as well, even though I do pay off the card regularly. If you frequent the Best Buy store, then this card is perfect for you.

name: Jennifer Cobos
review: I've had my Citi Diamond Preferred card for a little over a year now. The first year and a half was interest-free, and now it's just a really good card with a very low interest rate and high credit limit.  We have a reward system where we get cash points for every dollar we spend. There are a few interesting items for auction, but they usually go way above what I would be willing to pay. I've never had a problem with the card or the customer service, although Citi continues to send me pre-approval letters for new cards. I would recommend this card to my friends.

name: Tammy Slate
review: I have had this card for four years now and really cannot complain.  I have primarily used it for balance transfers.  As other people have commented on it really has great rates for transfers.  Unfortunately I have not been able to utilize the Thank You rewards as I do not use the card very much.  What I do appreciate is that the interest rate is low and they do not hit you with annual fees. I have had other credit cards in the past and this is the only one I ended up being comfortable with.  I would definitely recommend this card to anyone who is interested in building their credit.

name: Frank Avalos
review: Getting this card was interesting to me. I don't even really know if I can properly convey my experience with the Citi Forward card, but I will do my best. I've had this card for a while now with a pretty good credit line, and the experience overall has been absolutely average. It is a good card with a lot of benefits, such as its reward program. You earn points on purchases that can range from books, restaurants, and movies. You can then redeem those points for things like gift cards. It’s really a nice feature, but it doesn't really wow me. In a market that seems awash in cash back and rewards programs it seems pretty standard, but it does come in handy. Customer service has been a pretty mixed bag. There have been a few instances where I have had to call in with an inquiry or an issue and have had times where I have been treated well and others where CS reps were rude and condescending. I can certainly say that it hasn't outright been a bad experience, but it hasn't stood out as a good one, its average, a happy medium.

name: Ashanti Donkervoet
review: The Citi Thankyou Card has worked very well for me. It has a relatively low APR, no annual fee, and they also offer you sign-up bonus reward points. One of the important aspects for me was how diverse the rewards selection was, and I can tell you that it's great! Citi offers a wide variety of rewards you can choose from, and it really isn't that hard to accumulate a sizable amount of points. Another note that is worth making is that I have had great customer service with Citi. I've encountered just a couple of issues while I've had this card, but both times their employees were very efficient and helpful in dealing with my problems. I would highly recommend this card!

name: Phyllis Binney
review: This card has been nothing but great for me. It's very easy to use and is accepted pretty much everywhere. I love the rewards program. I've been able to save up a good amount of money while using this card. The interest rate isn't bad at all. I make sure to pay my card off on time. However, if I was unable to do so, it wouldn't be too detrimental. The Thank You points are great. That's definitely a great feature if you are looking into getting this card. I would recommend it to others definitely. I'm very happy with it.

name: Juan Naman
review: I've used this card since 2004 when it was a mastercard but its pretty much the same. I have no trouble with it thus far (knock on wood). I have had to call customer service couple of times but it was all good experiences with them. They work hard to resolve your issues. If their are any charge-backs, all you have to do is file the claim and it is taken care of. Very simple and effective. I have used this card overseas and while there is a 3% fee, again it poses no problem. I just call customer service and tell them that I will be traveling and they denote that on my account. This is the only card that I've used and in effect I have a very high credit rating due to that. I highly recommend this card.

name: Meghann Bulman
review: My husband and I use the Citi Hilton Honors Visa card for travel, which we do frequently. I can highly recommend this card for the rewards and its ease of use. Of course, it's much better for your rewards accumulation if you stay with the Hilton brand of hotels, but that should be easy, given there are so many brands and locations. As with most rewards cards, this one looks for a high(er) credit score from its customers and the interest rates are pretty high- just something to remember before applying. All in all, this is a great card for travel rewards and everyday purchases!

name: Tarnima Andalib
review: I applied for this card as a sophomore in college, as I needed another form of payment for my textbooks other than my own meager income. I really appreciated the 0% rate for the first eighteen months. At the time I didn't have a problem paying the minimum balance every month on time anyway. However, the following year I was forced to withdraw from school due to illness, and no longer received financial aid. Suddenly unemployed and without an income, I struggled to make minimum payments, a crisis which was quickly resolved after talking to a very helpful customer service agent. She set up a minimum payment that I could actually pay, and thus gave me great relief.

name: Ronald Kooch
review: I've had my Best Buy Credit Card for about one year.  I purchased a washer and dryer with the card.  I was instantly approved at the store to purchase both items and received 0 percent interest for two years.  I highly recommend this card if you are going to make a large purchase that way you can receive the 0 percent interest.  Just make sure to pay off the balance before the promotion ends otherwise you will have to pay for back interest and your interest rate will jump too.  I have never had any issues with billing or payments with this card at all.  All in all this credit card is great for large purchases if you don't have the cash in hand.

name: Jon Smith
review: I've been using this credit card for the last 3 years and have never had any problems with it. I feel pretty satisfied with citibank and all they have done for me. I've been able to purchase a laptop and fridge for my mother's restaurant and get rewards to buy some other things that I needed. The card has been reliable and it's always great that I can log in and check my balance or pay my bills online. It's even better that the customer service was pretty amazing when it came to solving a problem I had about the card. All in all, this is a pretty great card and I've had no qualms about using it and would definitely recommend it to anyone that inquired about it.

name: Adam Hogan
review: I got my Best Buy Credit Card while in college to use for Christmas gifts. I was given a $900 limit which was more than I expected. Best Buy offers No interest if your balance is paid off in a certain time (time limit is set by the amount you spend...the more you spend the longer you have to pay off with no interest). I've used it almost every Christmas to buy a few big presents and I'm able to pay it off every year and face no interest charges which really helps. If you do not pay off in time or if you miss a payment you will be charged interest on the total amount though. Although I missed a payment once but only because of an extra number in my account info meant a payment I sent was not received. Best Buy did not charge me the interest and allowed me to make up the payment with no charge. This is a great card if you are  making large purchases at Best Buy and would like some extra time to pay them off with no interest.

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: This was the first credit card I ever had, and pretty much got it to start building up my credit history.  I drive, figured I need gas, so why not get a credit card for buying gas?  With no prior credit card history I was approved, although with a very low monthly limit, but that was fine for my first card!  You get 15 cents off per gallon, and the card even has the SpeedPass built into it, which makes it easy to pay.  I always see Mobile Gas Stations around me, so getting this card was an easy decision.  Even though you can use it elsewhere I pretty much stuck to using it primarily for gas.  If you have a teen that is now driving this is a great way to get them to start building up their credit history by getting them a credit card for gas in their car.

name: Tennille Labs
review: This Citi Dividend Platinum Select Visa Card was a great choice in deferring incurred interest for 12 months. I took out a credit line of 2500$, and the minimum payments were very reasonable! I would recommend this card to anyone who is looking for a quick line of credit without the interest for a year. This card is a great way to earn good credit as long as you use it correctly. I gave this card five stars because by credit went from 780 to 830 which is excellent credit. If you can manage your money wisely I highly recommend this credit card!

name: Robert
review: I have had a great experience with Citibank. The ability to deposit checks with my smart phone is something I use almost on a daily basis. The hours are great 8-6 at my local branch. Even when the banks are not open I can deposit checks through the ATM which has worked flawlessly since I started using them. ATMs are everywhere since I can use the ATM at any 7-11 convenient stores. I have had some issues with online purchasing, all a part of their customer protection program, these were easily and quickly resolved by Jeff, my account manager. The local branches themselves are some of the cleanest and modern looking banking facilities I have ever been in. The online banking with Citibank is very straight forward and easy to use. Transfers from checking to savings can be scheduled to happen automatically which is a great feature. The ThankYou reward points you get just from having a checking and savings account are tremendous. I have already acquired enough points to cash in $200 worth of gift cards from a huge assortment of retailers. Having moved from BoA when they announced they were going to start charging debit card fees I could not be happier with this bank.

name: Andrew Smith
review: I applied to get a Citi Dividend Platinum Select Visa Card to transfer a credit card balance. I was accepted and I was able to transfer a balance of $2000 for 0% for 12 months. That saved me a bunch of money at the time coming from a 14% interest credit card. Balance transfer fee was 3% but still worth it. The transaction was simple and convenient. Citi customer service was very helpful and handled this transaction very well.Purchase APR was also 0% for year, which then changed to 10.99%. Even though I feel that its a little high, I pay off my balance every month so it doesnât matter. The rewards program is only OK for me. I donât travel much so 5% back on airline and car rental purchases doesnât help me much. However, I do get 1% cash back on most other purchases so that adds up to a nice payout at the end of the year. I highly recommend this card and have had no problems with Citiâs customer service.

name: Anthony
review: I recently went to Citibank to take out a loan to buy a car after hearing of great things from a friend. The application process was super easy and the representative who helped me was also very nice. She helped me file all the necessary paperwork and made the entire process very pleasant. If there were ever any problems with my application, she would be the first person to call me. I was very surprised at the immediate attention I got and it made me feel like they really do value their customers. I was also given her direct phone number line just in case I had any problems or confusions. Overall, Citibank was very clear and made me feel like I was at home.

name: Danny
review: I took out a 5,000 dollar loan to help pay for my first three years of college and I have no negative things to say about their loan system. They approved my loan despite my lack of a cosigner. They also offered me a much lower interest rate than any of the other lenders at the time. Their repayment program is excellent - and now that I am out of school, I still haven't had to make a payment. The customer service rep that help me delay my payments was very helpful and understanding of my financial situation. If you are in need of financial assistance for college, I would highly recommend Citibank!

name: Shelly Chalace
review: I have owned a credit card with Citi for a number of years now. I got it when I first became a college student. It was my first credit card and I was pleased with it. The thing I hated the most about Citi is their high APR, but I think that’s what most expect from most banks-ridiculous interest rates. I like the points that I could earn by using the card. Then with the points I could buy something from their Reward Store. I  have never attained enough points to buy anything but it was pretty cool any ways. I never had any big problems with Citi, but I like I said before, their APR rate could be lower.

name: Nerissa Westmark
review: I have had the Citi® Dividend Platinum Select® Visa® Card for about six years.  I was very happy with their offers of 0% balance transfers and 1.99% balance transfer offers for many years.  I did use this for some business transactions here and there.  Once my balance got a bit high, they sent me a letter stating they were upping my interest rate to 29.99% from the current rate of 17.99% that I was paying.  I was not happy that I pay on time, all the time, and never missed a payment, but yet I was punished for being a good customer.  This is not the only Citi I have, and the others did the same as well within a few months.  They should not punish us because of others not paying their balances off or on time.

name: Vishwa Abhilash
review: I have been using this card since the last 10 months. The Best thing about this card is that there is 0% changes for the forst 18 months. Secondly they don't have any hidden charges. I have used this card for buying furniture for my homes and for all my recent purchases. The payment is also very simple. They don't have late fees even if you fail to pay on time , even though I clear all my dues in time. Theuy don't have any annual fees whicjh amost every card has.  This is a great card and I am very proud to have one. really this card is " Simple to use and Simple to pay".

name: Casey Spiller
review: I've been using this credit card as an introductory card to build some credit. The introductory rate was 0%, which was nice. The rates after the introductory period are pretty high, but not unmanageable. There is no annual fee, which is nice. There was no co-signer needed, which was a plus for me. The cash-back rewards program is pretty good- I've made a little over $100 from that so far. I pay off my card on time every month, so I've never had any real problems. I feel safe using this card. I recommend it to college students who need to build up some credit.

name: Marie Picard
review: This was the second credit card I got - the Reward Zone Mastercard version. The initial credit limit was quite low, and it takes them an absurdly long time to process payments. My first payment didn't post for almost two weeks - from a direct bank transfer! That was a bit frustrating, but customer service was at least polite when I called to ask about it. I'm pretty sure my next few payments posted more quickly than that. The card was also recently sold to Capital One. I was really hoping that might mean that the card would show up on my Capital One account page, but unfortunately not. It is nice to have a card that gives some rewards, even if it is only at Best Buy. The long introductory APR of 0% is also great, but the annual fee is extremely high at $59. I wish I'd noticed that before I activated the card. That will teach me to read carefully. I expect I'll be closing this one fairly soon.

name: Adrian Półtorzycki
review: This is a lovely Citi card. I love the fact that I get the first 18 months absolutely APR free. This is a must for me because I buy a lot of things and knowing that I can pay them off for exactly the same amount is a good feeling to have. This card also offers some good rewards when buying entertainment packages and I'm a big movie fanatic so I go to premieres about 5 times a month and I use this card everytime.The grace period time is really awesome too, 23 days is a blessing for someone who is sometimes out of schedule. This is a truly good card for a lot of people. Recommended.

name: Anonymous
review: I applied to get a Citi Dividend Platinum Select Visa Card to transfer a credit card balance. I was accepted and I was able to transfer a balance of $2000 for 0% for 12 months. That saved me a bunch of money at the time coming from a 14% interest credit card. Cash advance fee was 3% but still worth it. The transaction was simple and convenient.Purchase APR was also 0% for year, which then changed to 10.99%. Even though I feel that is a little high, I pay off my balance every month so it doesn’t matter. The rewards program is only ok for me. I don’t travel much so 5% back on airline and car rental purchases doesn’t help me much. However, I do get 1% cash back on most other purchases so that adds up to a nice payout at the end of the year. I highly recommend this card and have had no problems with Citi’s customer service.

name: Liz Bradshaw
review: I've had this card since 2006 and use it everywhere, even overseas occasionally.  I like that it's Visa so is accepted pretty much everywhere.  I like the rewards/cash back that I get when I use it and can rack up quite a few throughout the course of the year, enough to get some decent cash back to use for special occasions.  I use my credit card whenever possible to help me get more cash back.  I've never had a late fee and since there are no annual fees, it makes this card very affordable.  Being able to check in on my account online is very helpful as well.

name: Hermila Barbini
review: The Citi Forward card is for students looking to build credit while also having spending money in college. For me this was my first credit card as I would not have been approved for other cards having no credit history. This is a great card for all the features it holds. One of these features is for thank you reward points. With this you gain 1 point for every dollar you spend and more for different categories. Another feature is the low minimum payment. In case you cannot pay off your entire balance that month it comes with the low payment of twenty dollars. And the APR is not too high so you will not have an obscene amount of debt. So I would recommend this card to any college student looking to get their first credit card and to start building their credit history.

name: Kaitlyn
review: I have been a Citi credit card user for many years.  I have had good experiences working with them on the credit card side of things.  However I have not had the best experience when it comes to the savings account which I opened with them a few years ago.  Twice I have tried to close it -- since it is hard to get money out of and I don't like that there are no banks that I can walk into to get assistance.  I am frustrated with their lack of help when it comes to closing an account, or looking into other options.  They have been good about not charging fees, but I do not feel like there have been any other benefits.

name: Royce Sarmiento
review: I applied for this credit card when I was a freshman in college and was buying a fridge at Sears. I received a big discount by signing up and using the card for my purchase. That was 6 years ago and I have still been a proud cardholder. I usually pay my card balance on time. I also shop at Sears a lot for my parents who love their products. Because I shop there so much, I get a discounts and coupons every month. I am also glad there is no annual fee with this credit card that you usually find out after you sign up for credit cards. Overall, I am pretty happy with this card and would recommend it.

name: Jameson Smith
review: The best thing about the Citi Simplicity card is that it is 0% for eighteen months.  When I applied for this card this was the only reason I had as my intention for applying for one.  It really paid off because I was able to move my other credit card balances over to this and work on paying it down to nothing.  This card and company are great at not applying outrageous fees which lends to the game the Simplicity card because that's what it is, its Simple, and awesome!  If the subject of credit cards come up with friends this is the card I recommend first and several of my friends have loved theirs too.

name: Rachel Duncan
review: I used Citibank a while back before my family and I relocated. I enjoyed having them as my bank with a checking account. The customer service was always quick to help me with my problems and even let it slide once in a while if I overdrew my account. That was a big deal for me because I had an issue with a previous bank I had used. During the time my checking account was open my debit card was stolen. They worked fast to help me clear up any charges I had not made, turn off my card and send me a new one in the mail. I felt safe with Citibank.

name: sam grand
review: I have been banking at Citibank for a few years. For me it has been a huge mixed bag. Some of the branches I've been to have been completely unprofessional. The employees seemed to barely know what they were doing, service was slow, and just a bad experience overall. I was going to close my account, but then I found another branch that has been excellent. I don't know what difference driving one town over makes, but really the difference was night and day. The employees here were very helpful and solved all of the problems I was having with the account. Originally I had the wrong account type set up, was charged the wrong fees, and the first branches I went to could do nothing about this. The third one I finally found took care of all of it. I'm not really sure whether to recommend them or not, but make sure you check out your local branch first.

name: Sarah Bartolone
review: In order to pay for college I had to take out loans to supplement some of the other grants and scholarships. I chose to do this through Citibank because they had the lowest interest rates and the most straight forward application process. I took out the loans 5 years ago and now it is time to start paying them back. The repayment plan is reasonable, they are not charging more than I can afford (and being straight out of college, that's not a lot). The web site is easy to use and I can set up my payments there so that I don't forget about them. They were also nice enough to give me a 2 month forbearance when I wasn't able to make the first payment due to other financial burdens. Overall I have had a good experience with Citibank and would recommend them to someone that is looking to take out student loans.

name: Marie
review: This was one of my first bank accounts, and it wasn't the best experience. I can probably take some of the blame for that, but they were also not particularly clear with their fee disclosures. I signed up for a college account, and was initially told that I had overdraft protection. The way they explained this made it sound like a credit line, and that I would not be charged a fee for every overdraft. Well, of course, I was. Multiple calls to customer service resulted in absolutely no sympathy or reduced fees, so I was stuck with a fairly hefty bill for a few small purchases. Like I said, at least 80% my fault, but I would have liked a little more flexibility and sympathy from their customer service. Oh well, expensive lesson learned.That said, I suppose their online banking was OK, and they certainly have a lot of locations. I have been much happier with the customer service, explanations, and general experience at Bank of America.

name: John Rea
review: I just recently switched to Citibank after having some problems with Bank of America, and I couldn't be happier. The biggest draw for me was the ability to remotely deposit checks by just snapping a picture. I've never had a bank that allowed it, and I don't think I could ever live without it again. I called them up after doing my first remote deposit, and they couldn't have been nicer. I also decided to try out their credit card, and I was shocked at how high the limit was. I did not expect much, but now it's the card I always keep for emergencies. Citibank is an amazing bank that doesn't seem to get a lot of press, but deserves all of the praise it gets. I don't think I will ever leave this bank.

name: Patrick
review: Citibank has great customer service, the few times I have had a problem it only took one call to resolve the problem. The customer service representatives are always very courteous and helpful. The last time I had a problem it was fixed within 2 minutes of getting a representative on the phone. They offer toll free numbers for any country they have a branches located in. While on a trip my wallet and bank cards were stolen. I contacted customer service and they arranged for my cards to be sent to the nearest Citibank branch to pick them up. The representative gave me the local branches number and the manager arranged to have funds wire transferred to me so I could catch a ferry to get my new cards. There service is way beyond what I could have expected or hoped for.

name: Penny Barillas
review: I got this credit card when I first became employed as a mechanic almost ten years ago. I was offered a percentage off my purchase at the time and realized it would be really helpful for me to have in the future. Even during the period in which I wasn't a mechanic, I found the Sears Credit Card to prove beneficial. I'm a mechanic again and the savings are unmatched. I get lots of coupons and discounts as an extra bonus. The interest rates are extremely fair and I'm treated exceptionally well, possibly because I've been a client for so long.  This isn't a credit card for just tools! I've used it for back to school shopping, household appliances, and anything else you can find in a department store.

name: John Tanne
review: This was one of the credit cards I got after I got married. I started off at a medium-high credit limit but as I made my payments on time, my limit increased a lot.I like this card because it has many perks that come along with it. For example, they gave me 100 dollars cash back after 500 in purchases within the first 3 months of account opening. I earn 5 percent cash back on airline and car rental purchases. I like this benefit a lot because I travel around the country. They also gave me a full one percent cash back eligible purchases and cash advance. I think the interest fee is fair. They also offer $0 Liability on unauthorized purchases.So, I now use this as my everyday credit card. I think that this is a great card. I cant live without it.

name: Patty Macho
review: I've had this credit card since 2005 if I remember correctly. I've had nothing but good experiences with it, although I have been lucky enough to avoid any issues like losing it or having unauthorized charges put on it, so I can't speak to those experiences personally. It had a 0% rate when I opened it, and often has 0% balance transfer options running. The normal % rate is alright, I believe mine is in the mid teens at the moment, it's not the card with the lowest rate I have but it's also not the highest rate. It has a rewards program, though I don't know too much about it as I don't use the card regularly. I keep and use it for emergencies, and I've never had any issues. I'd recommend it so long as you tend to be someone who pays off your balance every month unless you end up with a lower rate than I have.

name: Jonah Quizon
review: I have had a great experience using this card. The company is very thorough about fraud detection; there have been times when my card has been used in distant locations and they picked up on it immediately. When this would happen, they canceled my service and immediately sent a new card. The only thing I would recommend would some sort of notification when something like this happens. It is inconvenient to expect to be able to use the card and then have it declined without knowing why. Aside from that, there have never been any convenience issues and customer service is always very helpful.

name: Kayla Chase
review: So, I really like my Citibank Platinum Select card.  I've had it for about 4 years.  They always have really good deals, with cash advance checks; that's how I just bought my last car!  I got the card because I transferred the balance from by Bank of America Credit card, and they had this great 0% APR for like a year and a half.  There's no annual fee, which is awesome, and that was another selling point for this card for me.  I also get cash back, which I always directly apply to my balance, which I’m sure annoys them.  I wish I could get another color card, mine is this ugly green.

name: Norberto Furler
review: So far, I've had a great experience with this credit card. My family and I have been a member since 2004 and we've never had any sort of issues with Citi and using this card. One particular instance that stood out was when the card was stolen. Customer service was knowledgeable and helpful and were quick to find a solution for us. The reward rates are excellent on this card as I am always travelling and the 5% reward has made my business trips much easier to cope with. These rewards tend to add up pretty quickly, allowing me to enjoy some of the finer things in life. Using this card has been hassle free for the most part and I have been a loyal customer. I would absolutely recommend this card as Citi has a great reputation for service and offers a great credit card for typical everyday use.

name: Ena Edie
review: I love this card. I've been using it for over three years, and it never ceases to please me. The rates are some of the best that I've seen, and I never have to worry about the fees, which I find are very reasonable. The rewards are perfect for me, especially the ones regarding back-to-school-shopping, which is some of my heaviest spending year-round. When I travel, this card really comes in handy because of the boosted 5% reward rate. I find that after a flight, I have enough rewards already for a small treat, which is a nice convenience. The late fee is very agreeable; I don't think $35 (which is the maximum) is anything obscene. All in all, I would recommend this card to anyone who needs a decent credit card for all-around use.

name: Nick Prindle
review: With my previous credit card about to slap me with another outrageous annual fee, I immediately went hunting for my first no-fee credit card. Simply hoping to save that one chunk of change every year, I wasn’t fully prepared for some of the awesome rewards that I would enjoy with the Citi Dividend Platinum Select Visa Card. Around the same time that I was card-hunting, I was also looking to buy an iPad for personal use. I purchased the iPad immediately upon receiving my Citi Dividend card, and with that one purchase the $500 requirement was met, and I was immediately eligible to receive the $100 cash back bonus. Not only that, but by visiting the Apple store through Citi’s Bonus Cash Center, I earned back an additional 2% on the transaction – not insignificant for such a pricy item. Since then, the rewards checks have been rolling in. With rewards redeemable in $50 increments, I’ve been surprised at how frequently I’ve been eligible for another check. With a decent credit limit, I’ve been able to earn back quite a bit of cash per month at 1%, and benefitted even more from rotating 3-month promotions offering 5% back on products and services I often planned on buying anyway. Although Citibank’s online interface isn’t quite as useful for monitoring expenses as others (they do not, for example, post the details of pending charges as my previous bank did), the trade-off has been well worth it to avoid the hassle of an annual fee, not to mention the fantastic cash rewards I’ve earned upon my initial purchase and every few months since.

name: Drew Short
review: I got the Best Buy Credit Card while I was a freshman in college. I had virtually no credit and was approved with a $700 credit limit. The interest free financing promotions that this card offers has been exceptionally helpful during my time in college, especially when my laptop died in the middle of a semester and I need a new computer quickly. If you're going to pay off your card monthly you would be better served by a Reward Zone Mastercard that Best Buy also offers due to the greater reward points earned. However if you are like me and cannot afford to put down the money for a new computer right away, this card is amazing. The only warning I have about it is that you need to make sure that you can pay the minimum balance every month. If you miss it or are late they will back charge all of the interest you would've earned and add it to your account. So if you're not careful it can become very expensive, very quickly.

name: Danyell Triplett
review: I've been using my citibank card for over 4 years now.  I use it for all my purchases so that I can rack up the reward points and redeem them for gift certificates.  It's kind of random which purchases get a higher rewards rate that others.  I wish they would make that part more clear.  Also their customer service department needs some improvement.  I dread having to call them because usually the person I speak with doesn't seem to have any idea what he/she is doing.  Its like they're always some new person who is in training or something. Overall tho, this is a great card.  They even approved me when my credit was less that prefect which was really nice.  It helps to build your credit when you have a card to make on-time payments with.  I recommend citicard.

name: Genevieve Heaps
review: I love my L.L. Bean card!  It is the main credit card that I use on a daily basis.  Barclays, the bank that manages the card, has awesome customer service if you ever need to call them.  I've only had to call a couple times for routine things.  The reward coupons are really nice too as I'm a frequent L L Bean shopper.  I was even approved for the card with my less than perfect credit.  There isn't much to dislike about this card.  You should get one!

name: Tom Feldtmose
review: I have had a very positive experience with Citibank. They were quick to approve me for a credit card, and I have never had any problems with it. They increased my credit limit within a reasonable time after I requested an increase. The rewards program is great, and I am able to get gift cards or cash back based on purchases I am already making. The automatic bill-pay is an extremely useful feature and it ensures that I do not miss a payment. The customer service is great - you can chat online or call in, and they were very easy to deal with when I had to inform them about traveling or report a lost card.

name: Merri Berntson
review: this is my favourite card as they treat me for what I am - a very credit savvy person who can get credit anywhere as I have never missed a payment and always pay my balance in full every month.  So they know I can go to another company at any time.  If a question or mistake arises, they take care of it and treat me with respect.  I do not like paying fees or charges, if you look around you do not have to, especially in this economy - they understand that.  Take charge of your finances and they will respond in kind. I have had my card over 20 years and do not plan to change to another.

name: Nilsa Gabri
review: I have had this card for about little over a year. This is my first credit card I have ever owned since I am a student and trying to build some credit. I like the fact that there is no annual fee that is charged. So that is a big plus. So far I am glad I have chose this card I haven't had any late issues or anything. I have also reccomended this card to other family and friends and even fellow classmates who also never had a credit card and this was there first one. They all so far like this card. All the rates and  fees are accecptable especially if your a student and is trying to save money this really helps a lot!

name: Michael Johnson
review: I haven't had this card long, but so far I love it. They gave me a smoking hot interest rate which in this day and age is uncommon. That could be due to my credit rating though. So I am not sure if that's common or not. I took advantage of the no interest for twelve months because it helps me in times of emergency.
