I don't use my card for everday purchases because I am afraid of debt buildup. This card is exactly what the average consumer needs. Highly recommended to all. The customer service department is remarkable and helped me quickly and happily.

name: Zach Sandager
review: My Citi Forward card is probably my favorite credit card to use. I've had it for a few years now. They gave me a good limit, have a great interest rate (0% introductory APR), and have a wonderful rewards program. I've gotten a few hundred dollars worth of gift cards in the first year. If your not into gift cards, the rewards catalog is extremely diverse; great for getting gifts during the holidays as well. Online services are wonderful, very intuitive, and very well laid out.This card offers a little bit for everyone; I would recommend it to anyone who is looking to get a rewards card.

name: Will
review: I've had a credit card with Citibank for quite a few years now ever since I was offered one. I heard many warnings about Citibank but I decided to give it a try anyways and I'm glad I did. In terms of customer service, Citibank was super helpful. I remember one time, I had accidentally missed a payment. I got a call the day of and was informed I could pay right then and it would be on time. Another time, after my card got stolen, Citibank notified me of unusual charges and called me to verify. After telling them it was not me, they declined the charges and told me I would not be responsible for those charges. I also received a new card in the mail that same week. Overall, my experience has been awesome and would recommend Citibank to anyone.

name: Geoff Peterson
review: The Citi Forward card, being a student credit card, was my very first experience with a credit card. At first, I was a little nervous, being a student using this card, due to my unfamiliarity with the credit system. However, after doing a little research I found that this card was for me. Because I pay on time every month, they actually award you extra Thank You points for doing so. Also, they give you extra points if you buy certain items, like things in Amazon and groceries. If you are in need of raising your credit as a student and willing to be responsible with this card, you can both get cool rewards and raise your rating with credit companies for further down in the road of life. They will accept you pretty easily and you did not need an income when I got mine. They also have some great sign on features. There may be better cards out there reward wise, but you cannot go wrong with this if you are a studentj.k.

name: Debera Swicegood
review: I've had great experiences with this card.  This is the very first card that I ever got, as a college student, and I've had it for the past seven years with no issues.  They are very good about raising my credit limit from time to time, as I've been careful about paying my balance every month.  I've had two other cards over the years, but this card has always been my primary card, mostly because I really like getting 1% cash back on everything and because of the universality of Visa.  They also have really nice promotions offering 5% back on certain purchases during each quarter of the year - for example, right now, flights and rental cars get 5% cash back instead of just 1%, though I have to remember to sign up.  Also, when my wallet was lost/stolen, they were very quick to cancel my old card and sent me out a new one immediately.

name: Megan Little
review: Hi, I have just recently (about three months ago) become a member of Citi. I love the card so far and the benefits that come along with the card. The fact that you have 0% interest for twelve months is really a bonus to me when or if I have a time where I need to use this card in an emergency. There is also another great feature that allows me to transfer my balances from other high interest credit cards to this one for a much lower rate. From that benefit, I will also be able to save money from transfering my balances. I also just used my thank you points for the first time since I received the card and I could not believe how many rewards I was able to buy with my point balance. I was able to purchase gas cards and gift certificates to go out to dinner. I would highly recommend this card to anyone who is looking to have a card from an honest company that does not have any hidden fees associated with it.

name: Matt Brown
review: I've had a HSBC Reward Zone credit card for quite some time now and love it. I use it to pay most of my bills and pay it off each month. The interest rate isn't too outrageous and the reward points are definitely worth it. I've used it for large purchases and have my account setup to alert me when a purchase over $200.00 has been made. I love to play video games and the Reward Zone card has a feature which gives me extra rewards for buying video games with the card at Best Buy. I recommend this credit card to all of my friends and family who want a "reward" credit card.

name: Miles Preston
review: I got a Citi Forward card because I wanted a card with a credit limit higher than $500 so I could build more credit (something that can be tough for a 20-year-old). I applied, got accepted with a very generous credit limit with many perks. The 0% APR period was nice, as well as all of the identify protection features. The stand out for me, however, is the customer service you receive. I once had a payment that didn't go through because of my internet connection, but I though it had. So my payment, much to my surprise, was late, and I had a late fee to pay and my intro APR was gone. After contacting customer support and explaining the situation to them they were more than willing to waive the late fee and the APR changes. Great card with great benefits and customer service.

name: WalletHub
review: You’re right; having more available credit will expedite credit building efforts, and it can be difficult for someone with little credit and relatively low income to garner approval for a card with a high limit.  That’s one reason why secured credit cards are popular.  The deposit you place in opening one serves as your credit limit, which means approval is virtually guaranteed and you can increase your available credit by simply adding to your deposit over time.

name: Amanda Wallace
review: I applied for the Citi Forward Card for students a few months ago and have been using it fairly often for the last 2 months. I was actually stunned I got approved for it since my credit isn’t great but I have been making progress on it. This is the third card I own and I have to say I like this card much better than my Capital One Card and a little more than my Chase Card. I like that there is not an annual fee and the rewards points are pretty nice. I signed up for paperless billing and received 1000 points just for doing so. I also like the 100 point bonus you get just for paying your bill on time. So far the rewards points are definitely better than Capital One and just slightly better than Chase. Citi’s customer service is also great. I had a problem with my card a few weeks ago and when I called customer service they were able to get the problem resolved right away and they even gave me 1000 rewards points just because I was experiencing trouble. The only thing negative I can say about this card is I would have liked a higher credit line but I was told I can have it raised in the future, so I guess we’ll see.

name: Anna Jacobson
review: I am a college student and I have been using the Citi Dividend Platinum Select Card for College Students. Citibank has been my bank for many years, and they made it easy for me to apply for and use this credit card. Although I originally just planned to use the card for emergencies, I have begun using the card more often for everyday purchases and to pay my bills, in order to take advantage of their CashBack offers. Through responsible credit management, I have managed to increase my credit limit over the past year or so. Citi has excellent customer service, and I have always found their online statements to convenient and easy to understand. This is a great credit card and I have recommended it to several of my friends already. I would have no qualms about recommending this card to anyone who asked.

name: Charlena Schwieterman
review: This card really helped me through my college years, especially with unsuspecting expenses and buying required books for class before financial aid was disbursed. Grad school can be expensive and when you’re in school full time and interning, it is hard to work full time, so the credit card helped during weeks where I made less money and with the interest rate being so low after the introductory period paying the minimum or paying it all back monthly wasn’t a problem. It was also great not needing a cosigner because it allowed me to build my own credit and not having to worry anyone else about making payments. I highly recommend this card for undergraduate or graduate students.

name: Aquillia Alowonle
review: I really like citi bank, because they have great customer service. I have had my citi thank you card for about seven years and it really is great. Not only did I used the credit card for purchases, but I also have been to use the card to pay off my student loan. They offer great deals on balance transfers and I am able to put my loan on the card for one year without interest and that has been great for me. I am really happy with my citi bank card and I would recommend it to anyone because it really is nice.

name: Chantal Tabaka
review: I’ve had my Citi diamond preferred card for almost two years now and I’ve never been happier.  I was given eighteen months interest free and after that I received a very low interest rate. I’ve used it to purchase everything form plane tickets to diapers and have never had an issue. With the extra cash program I’ve been receiving all sorts of discounts on name brand items and gift cards. Plus I’ve got 24-hour concierge service..  All I have to do is give them the information and they can make dinner reservations and reserve a hotel room if I so request it.

name: Michael Johnson
review: My favorite thing about this card is the 18 month 0%APR on balance transfers. This made my life so much easier when trying to consolidate my debts. With no annual fee I don't feel like I am getting ripped off like some credit cards. The rewards are wonderful and I take advantage of the presale concert tickets all the times. I have dealt with customer service on a few occasions and they are always helpful and attentive. Willing to do whatever they have to do to fix the problem that we are dealing with. They talk up there 0%liabilty on purchases I didn't make, this seems like a positive thing, but I have never personally had to use this.

name: Georgiann Ohler
review: The Citi Diividend Platinum Select Card has been invaluable to our family over the last couple of years. I helped my son look for a card he could use to get his credit history started and we came across this card. After really looking it over we immiediately knew this was the right card for him. He is a college student going to school out of state so we wanted to get him a credit card he could use in emergencies or for necessary things (like school supplies, food, gas etc.). This card is just great. It has NO annual fee and the introductory rate was 0%. It offers a cash back bonus, too, just like other major credit cards (which helps get him acquainted with how to make a card work for him, financially speaking). Best of all, no cosigner necessary on this card! (meaning mom and dad don't have to put our credit scores on the line). All in all, this is a great choice for college students.

name: Jackeline Cannavo
review: I have been a long time customer of Sears and have had their store card for almost 20 years now. A sales person talked me into applying for their Sears Master Card one day (about a year ago) in order to help qualify for a discount on a large appliance purchase I made. I have a variety of other cards but this was my first Master Card. I initially didn't use it much and so really knew little about it. I finally started to take advantage of my account last year when I decided to use it to make all my Christmas gift purchases (and realized that the benefits are pretty great). I get all kinds of coupons, discounts, and special savings every month which I love (and really comes in handy being that I'm a frequent shopper). Through this account I also get free unlimited access to my credit score. I can log on to my Sears Master Card account online and then hop over and double check my credit score to make sure I'm on track and that everything is okay. The interest rate isn't particularly great so I pay off my monthly balances immediately if I can (though the rate is still comparable with most other cards). There are no annual fees with this card to worry about either snd I appreciate that with the Master Card logo I can use this card just about anywhere.

name: WalletHub
review: Interestingly, one can only use this card at merchants owned by Sears, which includes Lands’ End, The Great Indoors, and their online equivalents.

name: Deidre Rene
review: I recently got this card, and I absolutely love it! The rewards program wherein you earn "Thank You" points for every dollar you spend makes me feel really good about using this card for everyday purchases as well as much larger ones. My credit is decent, but not the best, so I was really thrilled that Citi was willing to take a chance on me. They made good on their balance transfer offer, and it was extremely helpful for me, especially with the low APR to start. One complaint is that I had difficulty tracking the progress of my balance transfer. For awhile, this made me think it wasn't going to be approved. They also offer an option to link another Citi card to your account and still haven't been able to do that successfully. Other than that, I'm very happy with this card.

name: Lucie Mccaw
review: I love the rewards offered by the Citi Thank You Card.  The points can be redeemed for relevant merchandise or gift cards.  The points seem to add up very quickly, and it is always easy to log into the account and see where you stand points wise.  In addition you can earn extra points through other websites and use them with your card rewards.  Citi has great customer service, and if a problem arises with the card they seem very willing and capable of helping you out, and answering any questions.

name: Audrie Swartzendrube
review: I love my Home Depot credit card. It is an absolute essential for all home-owners and offers great interest-free purchasing power on items $299 and up if paid in six months, and interest-free purchases of heating and air conditioning systems if paid in a year. That being said, unless you are able to pay off all other purchases quickly, the interest rate is high, typical for store credit cards, and I find it much more favorable to use a rewards card instead for most smaller purchases. I do receive special purchase offers and discounts as a benefit of using my Home Depot card, which I do appreciate. I just make certain to not carry any balance from month to month.  Home Depot has been very good about increasing our credit line, enough so that we could tackle any home improvement project we desire.

name: alexander zhu
review: I've had my Citibank account since forever (about 15 years now). While they were mostly okay when I was in the US, once I had to go abroad for my Ph.D., they made it increasingly uncomfortable to manage my checking account. The online solution they provide is far from being encompassingâ¦ There are lots of things you need to call in for, and not all the departments work 24/7, which makes it pretty hard for when your time is 7 hours ahead of the US (you have to call at 3am to catch the specific person who dealt with you the last time, if you donât want to tell your story all over againâ¦)

name: stephen samuels
review: Have had a credit card with them for years.  They were one of my first cards and very willing to work with me.  Over the years I have never had a serious issue with them, and any issues that do come up they handle well and are courteous. Any fraud on the account is handled in a timely and fair manner.  The rewards through their cards are also very good.  When traveling their cards are accepted everywhere so there is never an issue with them.  While many credit card companies have a lot of unfair practices, I have found Citi to be upfront and helpful.

name: Mika Oh
review: The Citi Forward card was my very first. The approval process was painless; I did an online application last summer, and was approved within minutes. Citi gave me a temporary shopping pass that I could use for online purchases immediately, until my new card arrived. There was a small problem with my initial receipt of the card; the application recommended putting down my permanent address (my parents' house) as well as my mailing address. The application stated that my card would be sent to my mailing address. However, my card was sent instead to my permanent address while my parents were away for several months. I was working full-time in my college town, and wasn't able to get home right away to pick it up. Because of this, I couldn't activate my card immediately, and wasn't able to get my online account set up to pay my bill. By the time I got my card, I had missed the first payment date by a few days, which locked me out of the web system. I called Citi and explained the situation. The customer service rep was incredibly helpful, and allowed me to pay by checking account over the phone. No late fees or APR penalties were applied!Customer service aside, the card itself is a great starter card. The 0% intro rate is a great deal, especially if you're new to managing credit. The web interface is easy to navigate, and interfaces with the ThankYou reward system. You get a nice amount of ThankYou points for signing up, and there is a wide selection of items and gift cards they can be used towards. I got a nice wireless mouse and keyboard set out of my points earlier this year, free shipping, and it arrived pretty quickly! I haven't needed to transfer a balance yet, but I know they do also offer a 0% APR transfer rate. In summation, a solid beginner's card (especially for student!), nice online system, and favorable customer service. Just be aware of what addresses you list on the application!

name: Dennise Kulka
review: I originally had the MTV U credit card for students, but when CitiCards did away with it, they sent me this replacement card. My interest rate increased and my credit limit decreased. Customer service was unable to provide an explanation for these changes, but they were friendly about it. This credit card has no annual fee, offers balance transfers, and gives you reward points any time you use the card. I use my reward points for statement credits. Overall, I would say that this is an average credit card with an average company. I feel as if there are better options out there, but I have no issues keeping this card for emergencies.

name: AJ Curry
review: I think the Citi Simplicity Card is a really awesome credit card! The absolute best part of this card is that the introductory rate is 0% for eighteen months! It was a great way to start out using this card. I would definitely recommend this to people who need to pay some bigger balances or need to make a big purchase for that reason alone. Another benefit is that there is no annual fee! The only downsides to the card are that there is no cash back or rewards programs, and there is a 3% transfer fee. But even so, I think that helps the card live up to its name of “simplicity.” Citi Simplicity Card is fantastic!

name: Samantha Jamal
review: I really love my Citi Forward card. I applied for it a year ago, and the application process was a breeze. However, it did take about a week for them to process my application and notify me of their decision, unlike other credit card companies that tell you if you’re qualified instantly after you submit your application. It was worth the wait, though, because I was approved and was given a decent credit limit. I love accumulating the thank you points during the month and really enjoyed receiving the bonus points for switching to paperless statements. What I love the most about Citi cards is the virtual credit card generator. I can shop online with my mind at ease, knowing that I can set a limit to each temporary credit card number. I am a very paranoid person and I am terrified of identity thieves, and I love that I don’t have to give out my real credit card number online with the virtual credit card generator.

name: Anthony Glyadchenko
review: I've had this credit card recently and it's a really nice card for the college student. The APR is rather low for someone with low credit and the ThankYou rewards are a great perk. There's no annual fee, so that's one less thing for me to worry about. If you have any problems paying it off, they can lower your minimum payments if it's during a time when you are having financial difficulties. I would recommend this card to any college student especially if you have expenses like textbooks and other big expenses that would be a bit difficult for a college student to pull off.

name: Nadia Hickerson
review: I've had a Best Buy Card for several years.  I was initally given a very large credit line.  I've used it to buy really big purchases at their store.  I like that they have good "no financing plans" and I've taken advantage of paying the purchases off before the special financing programs end.  Customer service has always been great.  I can't say that I've really had any complaints except for one.  Several years back, during the recession, I made one big payment and paid off my card.  Shortly afterwards, My credit line was decreased to only $400.  I have no idea if this was because of the recession or because of my credit.  I had never paid my card late or had any problems with it, so I was shocked that they had done that.

name: Lenora Dever
review: I have had this credit card for several months. Since acquiring it, my interest rate has increased with no explanation and my credit limit has been lowered. I did not have a change in my employment status, no new loans, or anything else of that matter. The rewards are competitive with other companies. I normally cash in my points for statement credits. Customer service is normally friendly, but not very helpful. There has been a few times where it took multiple phone calls to find a customer service representative that was willing to answer questions or take the time to help. I would give this credit card an “average” rating.

name: Rj Wong
review: This Citibank Platinum Select was one of the first credit cards I owned as a college student. I was intrigued by this card at first because it gave me a balance limit that was 5-6x higher then my other card. There was also a very low interest rate, 12 months 0% APR. What got me however was the 5% extra cash rewards program from Citibank. The program itself is much better in theory than in actual execution. While getting 5% may seem very great, the program limits you to only buying stuff from their website. The website however doesn't actually let you use all of your extra cash but instead offers discounts using your extra cash. Besides that, I have had no complaints about the card. The balance limit is high enough where I never have to worry about going over. I would recommend this card to fellow college students looking for a good credit builder card with an incentive.

name: Tom Feldtmose
review: My experiences with this card have been nothing but positive. I do a lot of traveling, and I generally call ahead to let the credit card company know that my card will be used abroad. The one time I forgot, they called to inform me that my card was being used far from my billing address and to check if it was fraudulent activity. I feel safe using this card, and I think that Citi has taken necessary steps to ensure my privacy and security. The Rewards program is also a nice touch, and I get nice gift card every few months for purchases I would have made anyways.

name: David Weitzen
review: I have been using the Shell Credit Card for about 4 years now. All of the customer service experiences I have gone through have been great. Lost my card once and was able to get all the charges cancelled and a new card re-shipped to me in just under a week! Not only that this card is great because of the Shell Gas return rate when using it to purchase Shell Gas. My whole family uses it for their gas and are constantly re-rewarded with small amounts back for using their system. All together I have had a great experience using this card as well as my entire family. We have been going strong for awhile now with these guys and have no intention of discontinuing it!

name: Ryan Muir
review: I just recently got this credit card, and so far I am very pleased. The feature that drew me to Citibank was the fact that there is no interest for the first 15 months. That will really come in handy for me as I am training for a new job but will not start for another few months. Not having to pay interest for that time period will really benefit me. I actually lost my card in the first few days that I had it, and when I called customer service they were very helpful. They helped me cancel my card in case it was to be used by someone else, and promptly issued me a new one. I received it within 3 days. By far the quickest I have received a replacement card. They were very polite and courteous when speaking to me. So far, my relationship with my Citibank card has been worthwhile. I am very happy with my decision to use them.

name: Wing Lee
review: My Citi Diamond preferred card has done all I want it to do and more. With a 0% rate for the first year and a half, I can make all the purchases I want without worrying about fees and whatnot. Of course, I am conscientious with my purchases, and never go over my limits. The rewards are amazing, and the customer service (security, mistakes they make and correct, and so on) is amazing. I have never been wrongly charged. The balance transfers are nice, because it can be used to transfer money to other accounts at a rather low fee. There is no reason not to get another card, due to its amazing benefits, rewards, and Citi’s customer service.

name: Randy Holbein
review: I've had this credit card for about one year now, and I have had a great experience this far. I had a capital one card before this, and the customer service with them was not good. I would call, and be put on hold for a long time and I eventually got really fed up with them. I've spoken to Citi's customer service quite a few times, and they are extremely friendly and it was easy to speak with them. Citi's online payment method is easy to navigate and easy to use.  This is a great first card to use for college students because there is no annual fee associated with some other cards. I love using this card.

name: Liane Manderscheid
review: I have had the Shell Credit Card for almost a 5 years now and have always had success with the company. We had to make one charge back due to a company not shipping a product and the credit card company was willing to do-so with no problem or hassle. We use this card mainly for gas purchases which provides a nice little incentive. It allows for us to save a nice bit of money on gas purchases, which really helps on long car-trips and general fills. The one time we forgot to pay the bill  (left the envelop on the table), they were willing to waive the late fee with no complaints. I don't think this is "the best" for regular purchases, but for gas purchases? Get it and use it!

name: Keith Crossland
review: I love the citi forward card. I've used it for about a year now, I have an adequate credit limit, and I've never had any problems with the card or Citi. The interest rate is fairly low, but I have solid credit so that may be a factor. My favorite thing about the card and Citi in general is the online interface. I prefer to deal with my finances on the internet and Citi offers a very good website for that. It only took me about 3 months of solid use to earn enough points for a 50 dollar amazon gift card, too. Overall, I've enjoyed my experience with this card.

name: AJ Curry
review: Citibank is a really great bank! I have never had any negative situations with Citibank or their services. Anytime I’ve had a question or a problem, their customer service has been very helpful and helped me solve my problem in no time! My favorite thing about Citibank is that they have a really easy to use and helpful app for smart phones! I can go on and check my account and transfer funds whenever I want! I use it all the time! They send me emails every month about my checking which is helpful and convenient. They also allow for controls over accounts for parents, for example, my parents control the transfer of money from my savings account to my checking account to make sure I don’t spend all my money! While I don’t always like that feature, it’s a really cool thing that Citibank offers!

name: Chelsey Frain
review: I am a student and I have been banking with them for a year now. This is simply the best, student-friendly bank I have ever dealt with. It cost me zero to enroll with the program, I also got FREE CHECKS for LIFE as a student only of course. (I guess that's their transition to adulthood)  I was greeted by someone every time as soon as I walked through the door. And normally my transaction take only about 5-10 minutes because there are hardly ever any lines! I've also noticed that transactions to be processed go through the system quite quickly so I can easily keep track of my credits and withdrawals. Honestly I really do LOVE Citi Bank, I just wish there was a local branch closer to my home!

name: Samantha Jamal
review: I have both a savings account as well as a credit card with Citibank. I like to have savings accounts in multiple banks because it gives me peace of mind. So far, I feel that Citibank’s customer service is exceptional. I am very pleased with their friendly service, and how fast and easy it was to set up a savings account with them. I applied for a savings account in person at my local branch and the employees were very friendly and explained the whole process and perks in great detail. I really love their credit card as well, especially their virtual credit card feature. Most other credit cards do not have this feature, and I really like how I can make a temporary credit card number with a monetary limit for online purchases. This way, my real credit card stays safe from online thieves. Overall, I give this bank 5 stars for wonderful quality.

name: Ravyn
review: I've had both a checking and savings account with Citibank for about a year, and so far I don't have any major complaints. The minimum required balance for accounts is annoying, but a lot of banks are doing that now and Citibank's minimum is not as high as some of the other big banks. (Basic checking is only $1,500.) Plus, they allow you to combine all your Citi accounts in order to meet it. Customer service over the phone isn't exceptional, but it's not terrible. The only really frustrating aspect of the phone service is that sometimes they need to ask you a series of multiple-choice identity-confirmation questions, but they draw these questions from info they receive about you from OTHER sources, not info you provide to them when you sign up. So I have actually failed these questions on several occasions (because whatever their sources are do NOT always provide accurate multiple-choice options), and when that happens they cannot help you over the phone. That said, I experienced an incident of identity theft on my debit card several months ago, and when I called them Citibank immediately credited me the amount taken, sent me a new card via overnight shipping for free, and took very quick action to resolve the issue. I really appreciated that.

name: Julia Cantuaria
review: I've been banking for six years now. I had their basic checking account and recently switched to a student checking account. However, when I graduate college in a year, I will most likely discontinue my service. My experience with Citibank checking has been disappointing. I cannot get over the fact that they changed the policy regarding the basic checking account fees -- it used to be no minimum balance, so long as you use your the account for three transactions each month. Citibank changed it, without personally contacting their customers, so that you need either to have a minimum balance, or to pay a number of bills with the account. At the time, I could accomplish neither, and got a nasty monthly fee. After this, I opened a student account, but it was a real hassle closing my basic checking. They said they would close it within a couple of days, in case any transactions were still being handled, but it was never closed and I had to call again. During this process they also pitched a savings account, which apparently had no fees. However, I checked on the website, and the fee is waived only if you have a minimum of $5,000. I'm a college student with very little money so, of course, I had to also close that one (because I opened it on the phone with a representative, who assured me there weren't hidden fees).I'm mostly disappointed at their lack of accounts for those who do not have very much money. Most of their options involve a minimum balance of $5,000. I will be looking into smaller banks after I graduate school.I will say one thing: their customer service is responsive and quick. The representatives genuinely try to help, and quite often they succeed. I was able to open my student account over the phone, and that was a very positive experience. That said, I don't think I should have to communicate as often I as have with Citibank just for a no-frills checking account.In short, it hasn't been the worst experience (thanks to the customer service), but I've been disappointed a number of times. I mean, what kind of bank doesn't contact customers before changing the fine print?

name: Billy Wong
review: An established and long standing bank, this institution seems to have grown stagnant and not very welcoming of newer customers despite their importance to continued prosperity and growth. I was treated quite rudely when I inquired about starting a new account here, as they seem to value affluence and existing wealth rather highly in their potential customers and do not take kindly to the less fortunate trying to better themselves. Their starting balance requirements are designed to keep undesirables out, and their staff seems well trained to shoo them along. A bank to avoid unless you are looking to feel superior and part of an elitist club, but beware if they do not view you as a passable member.

name: Filipe Lebre
review: I really like this card, they offer many benefits and they have offered to increase my credit line a few times over the years. I have been using this card now since 2005, and it has not given me any issues. I use online statement and like the convenience of that feature. I also like how customer service is always quick to respond and you are not waiting online for a long time for someone to come on and help you. This is a great card and I would recommend it to my friends and family. While the credit limit may start out small, with a good payment history they will usually increase your limit quite fast. The credit card also gives you up to 1% cash back across all purchases.

name: Bethany
review: I've had a Citibank credit card since 2009. Right away, they gave me a great credit limit, even though I had a student account, rather than just a regular account. I really love Citi's points and rewards system. They have something called the "Your Wish Fulfilled" reward, which is really great. They allow you to ask for the reward you want to "buy" with your points, and will negotiate with you until you're satisfied with it. Citi also has great customer service, and a quick response time on emails. There's nothing I don't love about Citibank's credit cards. It's all that I've ever needed and wanted in a credit card. Right down to the fashionable card designs!

name: Katie Pitts
review: My Citi Diamond Preferred card is one of my favorite balance transfer cards that I have. They always have the best balance transfer offers, which it seems they have new offers every month. It seems lately if you open a new card with them they are for 18 months no interest, but when I opened my card last year it was 21 months no interest. Of all the cards with balance transfer offers, it was the best one available. I now receive about 2 balance transfer offers a month, and they are generally no interest for about 13-14 months. I like the Extra Cash from Citi concept as a rewards program, too. The daily deals for that are actually really good deals from what I've seen. Overall, a good card, especially if you need to transfer some balances to take advantage of the low interest rate!

name: Katrina Erck
review: This was the first credit card I ever got, and one of the best things was the crazy low rate the Citibank was able to give me on the card. Not a bad way to say, "Welcome to the world of credit! Enjoy yourself!"The ThankYou rewards associated with the card have been up and down, and I think finally the have the program down to a science. My favorite reward that you can get is a statement credit for $50 or $100! Nice! I know some people would prefer the cash, but I would prefer to just not have to pay that portion of the bill!Customer service for the card is okay, and most of the time the representatives I speak with are decent, but they're really not too eager to help you with your problems. Why should they? It's the bank's money, not yours.Needless to say, this card is okay, and it's been moved to my "backup" credit card, in case something happened to one of my regulars. Not a bad card, but not the best there is.

name: Katrina Erck
review: I absolutely love this credit card! One of the main reasons I opened it was that I got a promotion for 30,000 AA miles after I spent $750 in purchases on the card. Considering my husband and I were in the process of redoing our closet, this was not going to be a problem at all.I love the tie-in also to American Airlines, as they are my favorite airline to fly, so what better way to treat yourself than with some airlines miles for buying that pair of shoes you really want? I'm getting close to being able to buy my husband and myself a ticket to somewhere in the USA. It's nice to get rewarded for buying stuff!

name: Nhan Le
review: I've had the Citi "thank you" card for about eight years now and it has been really great. The reward points have a variety of different system that allows you to get more points with different purchases. Primarily I use this card for gas purchases because it gives the most points and it is very easy to track your points because on every statement, they tell you the aggregate points accumulated since you've started and how many points you earned during the month. One of the things that is hard to do is access the customer support to change your online account so if you ever forget your name and password then, you're pretty much out of luck on resetting your account.

name: Chris Fogarty
review: I have been using this card throughout my undergraduate career and it has been fantastic. I highly recommend this card for any students thinking about a credit card to improve their credit score, here is why. You earn tons of points for spending on food & entertainment which is basically all you spend your money on in college, that and books. Their ThankYou program is easy to deal with and very hasslefree. Their introductory rates are fantastic but after that it gets iffy but is still worth it for their ThankYou program. This is a great card to start building your credit with and the rewards you can get within the first year of using it are quite nice.

name: Yasmin Hardy
review: I originally had the MTVU Citicard but recently was switched to Citi Forward. So far, I’ve had no problems. I activated it about a month ago and find that it is relatively the same as the MTVU. As the card is used, it functions under a reward system where in qualified categories the more money spent while using the card gathers more points. For example, if I used my card for to pay for groceries or gas, the card matches each dollar with a single point, but if the card is used to pay for entertainment and/or restaurants then it rewards the carrier with five points. You begin your card with 0% APR(Annual Percentage Rate) for the first twelve months and then from 12% to 22% range is decided for the new APR.  For someone just beginning to raise their credit, this card is useful but also be careful because like all credit cards you to keep your payments consistent and balance low. All in all, it is good credit card.

name: Kandis Stodghill
review: I have had this card for a few years now, and I have mostly had good experiences using it.  I started using it in college as a way to build up credit.  I have mostly used it for buying gas and groceries, and the occasional major purchase that I had the money to pay it off right away.  It was also handy for emergencies.  The credit limit starts off pretty low, but that was not a factor for me; as a poor college student, I did not spend all that much each month anyways.  The cash back reward is not much, but it is nice to have, as I can get 1-5% back on things that I was going to buy anyways.  I almost always pay my balance off in full every month, though I just missed the payment date just once, which caused my interest rate to increase for a couple months.  My fault, though.  It did get stolen once, but customer service was very helpful in getting the fraudulent charges revoked.  Overall, this card would seem to be as good as any other card, and I would have no problem recommending it.

name: Reita Mackinder
review: I have had this card for 7 years now-- I didn't have great credit at the end of college, so this was the best card then.  It works great, they have changed their percentages of cash back (and the categories for extra rewards), but they have always had great deals.  The website is easy to navigate and auto-pay your bill.  I have also increased my credit limit a lot over the years, which has helped my credit score.  There is no annual fee, and you can redeem your rewards any time you have at least $50.  The late fees are a little high, but as long as you pay on time there's no problem.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: I have had this card for a long time.  I initially got it because I was offered a big discount for that days transaction and I was making a big purchase.  If you are making one I recommend getting this card.  They also send you offers and coupons for being a card member.  There is no annual fee, the APR is pretty standard and there isn't any reason you shouldn't use it.  If you apply for the VISA or Mastercard version you can use them anywhere. If you get the Sears card without those logos you can use it at Kmart and Sears.   I've had good experiences with customer service, problems resolved quickly in a friendly way.

name: Erin Bjornsson
review: I have had this card for nearly 4 years now, when I started going to University. There is so many awesome perks, the best being triple points for food and entertainment, and pretty much everything falls under that when you are in college. The ThankYou program is super easy to redeem things (I usually do cash or statement credit) and the online banking system is great.  I signed up when the interested rate dropped every time you paid off the card in full up to a certain amount, which was awesome since I started around 17% and am now down to 12%, much better than my other cards.

name: Erna Norquist
review: I've been using this card for 6 years now and it's the best credit card I have.  The card was given to me while I was in college with absolutely no credit yet built and it was fantastic then as a first credit card.  However, now that I’ve been out of college for a few years, it remains my everyday purchase card because the “Thank You” reward program is so great.  Citi’s online services and paperless statements are fantastic as well.  Furthermore, I’ve had nothing but good luck every time that I’ve dealt with the Citi customer service people as well.  Overall, it’s a great card that I would recommend to any student that is trying to build their credit.

name: Rachel R
review: My Citi Platinum Preferred card is one of my favorite balance transfer cards that I have. They always have the best balance transfer offers, which it seems they have new offers every month. It seems lately if you open a new card with them they are for 18 months no interest, but when I opened my card last year it was 21 months no interest. Of all the cards with balance transfer offers, it was the best one available. I now receive about 2 balance transfer offers a month, and they are generally no interest for about 13-14 months. I like the “Extra Cash from Citi” concept as a rewards program, too. The daily deals for that are actually really good deals from what I’ve seen. Overall, a good card, especially if you need to transfer some balances to take advantage of the low interest rate!

name: Genna Timmers
review: I’ve had this credit card for going on 5 years now and my experiences have been great. I got this credit card after having several problems with Capitol One and not wanting to deal with their terrible customer service anymore. I’ve spoken to Citi’s customer service a couple of times over the years, and it is always easy and efficient to have a problem resolved. Once, about 3 years ago, I was contacted by a representative who wanted to notify me of suspicious activity on my account. A small charge had been made and they contacted me immediately to confirm that the activity was not authorized. The representative reassured me that I would not be responsible for the charge and within just a few days I had a brand new card in the mail.  I love the rewards program and even though I’m not a big spender, I’ve cashed in my points several times for movies and airline tickets.

name: Carrol Besley
review: I have had Citi Forward Card for Students for about two months now. I was surprised when Citi sent me the card because I was already using their MTV U card. So far, I've had no problems with this particular Citi card. Users can accumulate points for either paying with the card, or fulfilling certain tasks. The points can then be redeemed for various prizes that can be seen on the website. Citi also provides the option of online payment, which is great because Citi's payment portal is easy to navigate and payment can be made promptly. Additionally, Citi can email you when the statement is ready for reach cycle. That's a relief because the emails make it easy to remember when to pay. Thus, college students can begin to build their credit history safely. All in all, Citi Forward Card for College Students is convenient and valuable for busy college students.

name: Dion Bottolene
review: I have had this card for a couple of years now. There really isn't much to say about it. It functions as a credit card should and I haven't had any problems. I pay it off each month so I don't have much experience with interest or any problems. I had a fraudulent charge a year or so ago and it was a bit of a pain to get through and get the problem resolved, but eventually it was. I think that this is pretty common throughout all cards these days. Call centers are outsourced and customer service is low. As far as raising rates or other scam stuff, Citi has been good about not doing that to me. I like the card and will continue to keep it. The online payment system is easy to use as well.

name: Cerpin Taxt
review: This is a fantastic credit card! In the past, I've had troubled with previous credit card companies making the use of their credit card a big hassle but that's not the case for this Citi Simplicity card. Having 0% on purchases for 18 months is a huge bonus for those just starting out with his card. Also, there is no annual fee so that's also another great perk of this card. Additionally, Citi's great customer service made an already great card become one of the best choices for a credit card out there.Unfortunately, there are no rewards program for this card which is a bit disappointing. However, I recommend this card to all my friends and family when they are on the hunt for a new credit card.

name: Treasa Omahony
review: Because we always enjoy staying at Hilton properties when on a trip, this was the perfect card for our family. The thing that really sealed the deal with this card was the initial rewards bonus of 40,000 Hilton HHonors points. That was a hard one to resist. We were delighted to get the initial offer and suggested that a few of our immediate family also sign up for the offer. The first trip we took after having these was a family summer vacation and we of course stayed at the Hilton and cashed on on our rewards. Great card and great rewards. Beyond the initial rewards, the benefits keep on coming with more points for every dollar spent.I strongly recommend this card.

name: Janice Medland
review: I really enjoy having this card.  It has no annual fee to worry about, which was great.  I was given a generous credit limit and interest rate, even though when I first applied, I really had no credit.  It's a Visa, so it's accepted just about everywhere.  When I traveled abroad, it was cheaper to pay for things on my Citi card than my debit card.  Before I went abroad (I do so pretty regularly), I always called them first and asked them not to flag anything from country x, and they never did, which was nice.  I've had it happen before with others and it can be a real hassle.  Every time I spoke with someone from customer services, they were always very helpful and friendly.  I really have no complaints about this card and would recommend it to those who qualify.

name: WalletHub
review: Since you go abroad so often, you may want to consider opening a no foreign transaction fee credit card.  The Citi Platinum Select Visa Credit Card for College Students charges a 3% fee for any purchase that is processed outside of the United States, and that can get expensive fast.  Neither Discover nor Capital One charges foreign fees on any of their cards, and most major issuers offer at least a few cards without them.

name: Jordan Selin
review: I have had the home depot credit card for several years now and have always had nothing but the best service with this card.  I have used this card to make purchases from everything as small as light bulbs to buying siding for my house.  They often offer promotions and great discounts for using your home depot card.  When I first opened the card I recieved a year with no interest and used it to carpet my entire home and was able to pay it over time with no interest.  I like the fact that you will often recieve coupons in the mail to use with you card to make no interest purchases.  I also love the ease of making a payment I can just stop by any home depot and make a payment in just a few minutes.  The customer service has always been great as well very attentive and always very helpful.  I have only had two situations in which my account had an issue and both times I was charged interest during a time when I should not have been charged.  On both occasions I called the 800 number and was able to speak to a person and have the problem cleared up quickly and with minimum hassle.  Great company and great card.

name: Jordan Selin
review: I have had the home depot credit card for several years now and have always had nothing but the best service with this card.  I have used this card to make purchases from everything as small as light bulbs to buying siding for my house.  They often offer promotions and great discounts for using your home depot card.  When I first opened the card I recieved a year with no interest and used it to carpet my entire home and was able to pay it over time with no interest.  I like the fact that you will often recieve coupons in the mail to use with you card to make no interest purchases.  I also love the ease of making a payment I can just stop by any home depot and make a payment in just a few minutes.  The customer service has always been great as well very attentive and always very helpful.  I have only had two situations in which my account had an issue and both times I was charged interest during a time when I should not have been charged.  On both occasions I called the 800 number and was able to speak to a person and have the problem cleared up quickly and with minimum hassle.  Great company and great card.

name: Jackie
review: Citi Bank sounded like a great bank to do business with. I decided to open a checking account with them because I was already in possession of a credit card with their bank. The application process took longer than it does at most banks and they asked for a lot more details about me, both personal and financial, than what I recall other banks asking. The customer service representative that I was dealing with was very hard to understand and acted as if I was bothering her when I asked her questions about the account that I was opening. Shortly after opening the account, I was hit with a fee. I called them and inquired about this fee. They said that their terms recently changed and I was required to have a minimum balance and direct deposit to avoid the fees. I told them that I was not aware of these changes and they said it was too bad. I closed my account with them.

name: Katrina Erck
review: I had a checking and savings account with Citibank for about 4 years, and the products and services they provide don't strike me as being anything that another big bank couldn't offer.Their customer service is average, and the customer service reps don't really go "above and beyond" to help me with issues, which I would expect as a high net worth client with a bank. To be honest, I would expect that with any bank. I had to constantly probe representatives for options to my problems, rather than have them proactively offer them to me.Furthermore, it's fairly obvious that sales is a high priority for the bank versus service, as 90% of the time when I called, I was offered the opportunity to apply for a line of credit for overdraft protection. No thanks, Citibank.Rising fees and lack of quality service eventually led me to close my account in 2011.

name: Alex Weis
review: I’ve been a customer of Citibank in New York City for numerous years and I am not that happy with their customer service as a checking account client. At one point last year, they decided to start charging me $15 per month for the privilege of having a checking account with them – something I am unhappy about. After going into the branch and failing to get my complaint resolved, I was forced to call the 1-800 number several times until I was finally refunded the fees and I received further clarification as to how to avoid the monthly fee going forward. I am likely to switch to Chase in the future.

name: hari sharma
review: I have had student loan with this bank for 2 years with 6% interest rate. They are very helpful. There had been times when I couldn't pay my dues on time but this bank helped me in resolving that issue and I was able get back on track with my payments. Their customer service is superior to any other bank I've been with. I have called them a few times and the representative was always friendly with me. If I ever need any kind of loan I will always go to them. One thing that I really like about them is they do not to cold call you for credit cards etc. A+

name: julie
review: I use a Citibank credit card. I have been a Citibank customer for over 10 years. They are extremely helpful when I call. I recently had a problem with a fraudulent charge on my account. They immediately looked into it. I was given a full refund for the fraudulent charges. I like the fact that I am able to get to a live person on the phone fairly quickly. They also have extended my credit line when I really needed  it. This company has been around for a very long time, and I will continue to do business with them in the future. If you want a company that handles customers requests in a timely manner, then Citibank is the bank for you.  I think they are the best bank around!

name: Anita Herschberger
review: I have mixed feelings about this card. When I first got it back in college, my limit was only $750, but it has steadily risen and is now over $11,000. Never have I asked for any of these limit increases and often didn't even know it had happened. In addition, the interest rate has gotten outrageous. When I first got the card, it was about 16%. It is now just under 20%. Worst of all, there is now no opportunity to get a lower interest rate. They used to offer a chance to lower the rate if you made your payments on time, but they won't even work with you now. I think as a loyal card holder who has NEVER in eight years missed a payment or paid even a day late and almost always pays more than the minimum, I should be rewarded in some way.

name: Lando Llar
review: Ive been a Citicard holder forsometime now and I have to say its  a really good card. With a low APR and no annual fee this card is the way to go if you want to save money. Oh did I'm mention that you also get thatk you rewards for everyday purchases using your citicard. That's right you get rewards. I like using my rewards on giftcard and plain and simple gifts. Also they offer protection against unauthorized charges. Plus free card replacement. I know this because I called for them to send me a new card and they didn't even charge me a penny. Plus it came fast. isn't that great!

name: Karren Jennie
review: This Citi Diamond Preferred Credit Card is amazing. It has done always what I needed at the time. Once when I had a problem they were very kind and gave me the best support I could imagine. That is the only time I have ever had a problem and had to contact them for support.Also it does not  have a annual fee. If  ever my friends need to get a credit card I will definitely tell them to get this credit card.It works amazingly well and I am so very happy with it. It has way surpassed my expectations.

name: Stuart Mcglohon
review: I have had this credit card for around 7 months now. I have not had any issues with customer service. They are always friendly and helpful when I call. I had another type of credit card, but Citi did away with it and converted my card over to this one. I did not get the introductory bonus points or 0% APR for balance transfers because of the conversion. My interest rate jumped up quite a bit when the conversion took place. Overall, the card seems like a great card for a starter credit card but it is not a card that I would recommend to someone who has already established his or her credit.

name: Courtney Cunningham
review: I have had this credit card for five years. It has been amazing having this card. The store offers same as cash financing which is really nice for the bigger purchases. I have used the 18 months same as cash financing several times and paid it off in time, every time. The card has high interest but with that option, it is not a big deal. Also, in the five years that I have used this card and used the financing offers they provide I have not been charged any additional or hidden fees. I check my account regularly and know exactly what I owe and what I have paid. They also seem very willing to increase your credit limit. I know, that is not always the best thing but it is really nice to be able to buy what I want/need when I want/need it (I know that is the "root" of our debt problems, but its still nice.).  I would defiantly recommend this card to anyone thinking about getting it.

name: Al Playle
review: I only had a few negative experiences with this credit card. The one main thing is that I was late by two days with my payment and they up my interest rate by a significant amount. It was the first time I was late and they weren't understanding about the situation. However, it did go back down to the original amount after several months. I do like that customer service is very prompt and sincere in response. Whenever I had a problem they respond within 24 hours and I like that a lot. Plus they offer rewards and that's cool. I haven't used any of mine yet but I plan on doing so in the future.

name: Rosa Mcglumphy
review: The Citi Diamond Preferred card is my go-to credit card. The interest rate isn’t the best, but when I really appreciated the 18 months with no interest, and from time to time the card offers me a no interest balance transfer. The balance transfers can also be used to deposit money straight into a bank account if you need a little cash. This means you can get money straight in the bank without having to pay the higher cash advance rates (you don’t get the cash immediately, however). It is easy to schedule online payments on their website. If you don’t have the credit to get a better interest rate, this is a great card to use in the meantime.

name: Barb
review: I love my Citibank-backed Home Depot credit card. It is an absolute essential for all home-owners and offers great interest-free purchasing power on items $299 and up if paid in six months and interest-free purchases of heating and air conditioning systems if paid in a year. We used our card to purchase several new appliances for our home and the interest-free deal was perfect for us and gave us plenty of time to get them paid off before the interest kicked in.That being said, unless you are able to pay off all other purchases quickly, the interest rate is high, typical for store credit cards, and I find it much more favorable to use a rewards card instead for most purchases. I do receive special purchase offers and discounts as a benefit of using my Home Depot card, which I do appreciate. I just make certain to not carry any balance from month to month.  Home Depot has been very good about increasing our credit line, enough so that we could tackle any home improvement project we desire.

name: Joshua Miller
review: I only recently started using Citi Bank but do not regret my choice.  I chose them because I was looking for a good student credit card, and their rewards card did not disappoint.  The application process was easy and I was approved right away and talked with a customer service professional who was very helpful.  I have only been with this bank for a few months now but have yet to have any problems and their website is very user friendly.  I would highly recommend this bank to almost anyone, especially fellow college students looking for a good credit card to put their foot in the door in the world of credit.

name: Jessie Madieu
review: I had never banked with Citibank until I got married. My husband was a loyal customer for many years so he recommended we seek their help for our mortgage loan. They were fairly helpful with the application process but my one complaint is that the paperwork seemed a little rushed through. As a result (in my opinion), some errors had to be corrected after the fact. They weren't major errors (very minor) so I wasn't too dissatisfied. Other than that incident, we've been pretty happy with our loan. I've only needed to call them a couple of times for further assistance (over the last few years) and each time I received satisfactory customer service. I will say though, unless you have multiple products with this bank (like savings, CD, loan, etc) their checking account fees can be really high! Thankfully, because of my husband's relationship with them (and our loan) we have been able to pretty much avoid these fees. I recommend going in and speaking to a representative to find the best option for you as opposed to just going online (because they can usually recommend ways to avoid high fees if you plan on keeping a lower balance).

name: Chris Jackson
review: Citibank is a great bank with fantastic customer service. I have used Citibank for over 2 years now and am very pleased with their checking accounts. I have never had any major problems, and only 1 to 2 minor problems, which were easily resolved. The 24 hour call service is a great feature, its nice to know that whenever you need your bank there is always someone there ready to help you with anything at any time. They also have a great thank you and rewards program, they have a point system that lets you earn points for the purchases you make and then redeem them for anything from electronics to free travel and flight options. Overall, I great bank that I am very pleased with so far.

name: Patrick
review: I have been a CITI Bank customer for more then five years. The bank has always given me great service. Any time I have had any problems they have corrected them fast and efficiently. Their 24 hour telephone banking is great as I travel for work; it does not matter which time zone I am in I can always reach my bank. I recently lost my Bank Card and they quickly sent a new card to the nearest CITI bank location near my hotel it was just another example of their great customer service and why I have banked with them for so long. I would recommend CITI bank for all your banking needs

name: Kassidy Swinney
review: I love Citibank... My student account comes with no fees.  Students, such as myself, with no credit history are easily approved for this card, a great advantage to students just starting out. Each student with an account is also a Thank You point member. An added bonus!The activation process is a breeze. It is simple via application through phone or internet. They fix problems quickly. The web site is very good as well.The account summary screen shows you instantly all your Citibank and connected accounts subscribed to.  The functioning is really easy and banking online beats any other bank! I've never been with a better bank. .

name: Dan Bowne
review: I have banked with Citibank for the last 6 years now.  I have never had an issue with this organization at all.  They have always been courteous anytime I called into CitiPhone or gone into my local branch.  They have been quick to resolve any issues that have arisen with my account, of which there have only been a few, and always made sure I was satisfied with the end results.  Their checking account also has a great rewards program which I have utilized and cashed in on for pre-paid gift cards, nothing like getting money for free from your bank!  I would recommend banking with Citibank to anyone that wanted to check them out as they are a premiere bank within the US that has a good long-standing history with customers.

name: Cindy Crumley
review: I had absolutely no problems with this card, at least at first. The only issues I ever ran into were if I paid my bill late, which was my own fault. Then, however, I ended up canceling after about the first year because the interest rate went up to 20%, which was ridiculous. Also, their customer service is awful. The hold times were outrageous. Not to sound like a bad person, as I understand that everyone needs jobs, but if you’re hiring someone to do customer service on the phone, their English should at least be understandable. This was a few years ago, so perhaps their company has changed, but my experiences were not great to say the least.

name: Tyler Alecia
review: I received a Best Buy Credit Card when I was 20 years old and I've continued to use it and I'm currently 22 years old. I was approved for, I believe, $900 initially, with hardly any credit. What really got me in was the deals Best Buy offered; interest free for XX months, depending on amount of purchase, as well as RewardZone. I maxed my card out the first day I had it with a TV and a home theater system. I received a good amount of gift certificate value back for that purchase. My maximum allowed to pay off the card was 36 months and was nearly paid off by 24 months. I recently called for a credit line increase, and was increased another $500, and of course came close to maxing that out as well.This card really has its benefits if you buy big. However, I don't see why more people apply for this when all you do is swipe the card, take home your big purchase, and pay it off over the course of say, 18/24/36 months with NO interest. It's a great idea for the holidays or even birthdays (family in particular). However, if you don't make an expensive purchase, the benefits may not come into play.If you're a geek and like to shop at Best Buy, I'd highly recommend this card. Even if you're not a geek and you want some new electronics or whatever, it's a great card due to the fact you can go interest free with a big enough purchase.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Tyler, I would always be suspicious of any program that offers no interest financing.  The companies have to make money from the card somehow; you might want to make sure there won't be any additional financing fees or other charges later on.

name: Michelle Marpole
review: Overall, I would say I have had a great experience with the Citi Platinum Select Master Card. I have had the card for almost ten years now, and I have never really had any problems. The interest rate is quite high if you are late on a payment, but they are willing to work with you to lower it back down. They are also pretty flexible about working with you on payment plans if you can't afford the minimum payment. Their customer service department is very friendly and helpful. I do wish they would offer rewards like some of my other credit companies though. The balance transfer option is nice though, and I have taken advantage of it. I would definitely recommend this credit card to anyone looking for one.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Michelle, there definitely are a lot of other cards out there that offer very solid rewards programs.  You might give them a look and see where you can get approved.

name: Kelley Keller
review: I’ve had the Citi “thank you” credit card for years and am somewhat happy with it.  I don’t like credit cards because they can get abused easily however I like to use mine to earn rewards.  I use it for all of my purchases and then I just pay it off at the end of every billing cycle so I’m not charged any interest.  My credit is pristine however I can’t get Citi to lower my ridiculously high interest rate of 16.71%.  There is no way that I would ever allow myself to get into a financial situation that I would have to pay something as high as that.

name: Lorraine Page
review: I started using Citi because they had the lowest interest rate available.  What was a bonus on top of that was the Thank You points that I earned for making everyday purchases.  Before I joined with Citi ThankYou Premier Credit Card, I was looking a Capital One, but I just felt like Citi might be the better choice.For me, I think it was the better choice.  I have gotten cash back that I have been able to use on expenses with my car.  And the best part when I joined was I had not interest for the first 6 months.  Occasionally, I will look to see if there is a card out with a lower interest rate and for years, I have not been able to find one.  The only thing that I have been able to see to meet or exceed my interest rate with Citi is a line of credit.

name: Tejas Desai
review: I originally owned the Citi MTVU card and was sent this Citi Forward Card for College Students in the mail with no strings attached. Being a college student, this card is very helpful to me due to the fact that there are no annual fees that come along with it. That means that I can use this card the bare minimum (mostly for books and other school expenses), and still build my credit for the future without having to worry about being charged any fees. Lastly, Citi will give you 100 ThankYou Points for each billing period that is paid on time. In conclusion, this card is a good choice for college students who are looking for a credit card they can use without having to pay the fees for more expensive cards.

name: Janita Sullivant
review: I think this is a really good credit card, it really is as simple as they make it sound. The zero percent for eighteen months is great! I was able to transfer balances from my other cards in order to consolidate my credit card debt. I have been paying it down well now that I have the zero percent. The transfer rate was not bad, and it has been saving me money. It doesn't have too many other great features, no rewards or cash back. But to me the zero percent interest is worth it and it definitely lives up to its name in simplicity...which sometimes it is nice to have something simple to be able to understand as you use. I would definitely recommend it to someone looking to pay down balances or needing to make a big purchase so they can utilize the 0% interest feature.

name: Rico Seremet
review: All and all I have to say that I’m quite please with my experience so far dealing with Citi bank. I have had bad experiences with some other companies in the past. Sure that probably had a lot to do with my lack of maturity and not knowing any restraint but the customer service that citi bank provides their customers doesn’t even compare to the other companies. Always when I have called with an issue I was given great assistance.  I try not to use my card that often but I love the cash back program. It’s not always a lot but that $10 to $20 is always useful! So I would definitely recommend this card to some of my dearest and best family and friends I’ve found it to be a fantastic fit for me!

name: Gloria B
review: I have had several accounts with Citi over the years, including a student loan and a credit card. The best part about Citi is the application process - I did everything online for both of my last accounts through Citi and it made it so much easier. I liked the instant confirmation for my applications, and how quick I got a response on both my credit card and my student loan. I only ever had one issue with my student loan, and after about twenty minutes on the phone with a representative, I had everything straightened out. Although I usually prefer to deal with smaller local banks, Citibank served me rather well for what I needed.

name: Jeni Morrow
review: I opened a Citibank checking account because I needed an account to use to have automatic deposit for my unemployment checks. The reason I chose Citibank is because they had an online application that was easy to understand and also they had a checking account option that allowed me to open an account without an initial deposit so that my weekly check could be the first money that I deposited. The application process went extremely smoothly and I wish more banks would take note of Citibank's application process. The automatic deposit process for my unemployment checks went through without a single hitch, it was a relief due to the financial position I was in, I really needed to make sure the money was available and they didn't let me down.       Once my unemployment ran out I didn't use the account much due to the fact I didn't have much income. However, I was doing small jobs on an internet site that enabled me to deposit the money I made directly into my bank account. So I decided to use this same Citibank account, what a mistake. I didn't have any problems the first few months. I stopped using checks for this account during this time because I never knew exactly when the money I earned would be deposited. So I would use my debit card so I would not make a mistake and cause any overdrafts. One day I decided to use my Citibank debit card and it was rejected even though I knew there were funds in the account. I went online to see what the problem was and couldn't sign on to my account after trying several times. The next day I still was unable to sign on so I called customer service to see what was going on and they fixed whatever the problem was but explained nothing and gave me no info on my account. I finally signed on and seen my account had been closed due to an overdraft fee that had never been paid off. I tried to find out what this fee was for, because like I said I rarely used this account and never used checks during this time. I can not find the reason for the fee so I called and was hung up on twice. The thing that upset me the most was I had just talked to customer service and they never said anything about my account being closed and then when I call right back to ask about it they hang up like they didn't want to deal with me. I decided just to pay the fee and find another bank, but with the economy the way it is I do not want anyone else to have to go through this. If you are a person like me who does not use an account a lot and therefore you don't check it often then I don't believe this is the bank for you.

name: Traci
review: Citibank has been wonderful to myself and my family who also banks there with a mortgage. Though I find their interest rate to be a little bit higher than my other bank, they did come though when I needed them during my refinancing. The whole process was simple and because my information was already on file, they did everything over the phone. The only thing I had to do was go in and sign the papers after work and make sure everything was correct. A real time saver! The service I've found to be super friendly and helpful, and I feel like most of the employees are close acquaintances of mine. They smile and laugh often and like to talk. The application process is relatively simple and I've, so far, never had a problem with them. While I recommend looking around for lower interest rates, I do recommend choosing them for other services because of their optimistic, cheerful attitude and their great way of explaining things in details.

name: Shana
review: I enjoy having my credit card through Citibank.  They offer a wide array of credit cards available for different types of consumers.  Although, I do not have a credit card hooked to a rewards program, I have considered switching to one with Citibank.  I have always received great customer service whenever I needed more information about my billing statement.  The only complaint I have that others may disagree with is they keep raising my credit limit.  I like having low limits on my credit cards but others could see this as a positive attribute.  Overall, my experience with Citibank credit cards have been good.

name: Chelee McKenna
review: I have the Thank You Rewards Card from Citibank and I love it! We got 25,000 bonus points after we spent $2,000 in the first three months which is good for a $250 gift certificate. It has been really easy to use the card and it seems really easy to redeem the rewards points. You get one point for every dollar you spend and it seems to add up pretty quickly. Also, the rewards are what I like to call ‘even money’,  a $100 gift card is 10,000 points. The rewards offered are also really great. They have everything from gas cards to restaurant gift cards, to a cash option! We are actually having a hard time deciding what to get! The customer service is also great to deal with.
